comment.text:
We took our daughter here for her 16 bday lunch and were pleasantly surprised .
We had an amazing server Carla who was attentive personable and very knowledgeable about the food.
Everything was fresh and made to order . We had a variety of dishes . They were all very tasty and no attention to detail was spared.
We had the pizza Neapolitan-a , arancini , calamari ,
Cheese platter . Steak , chicken , bolognese .
Also a lovely dessert , which staff sang her
Happy birthday
Only took a couple of pics because we were in the moment
It was a little tight but taking into consideration that it's the style of the whole establishment. It's like a food market with various restaurants within it.
A lot of tourists in the area so also take that into consideration .
There are huge windows throughout your dining experience and you have lovely views of the financial district .

service was great,
right in the middle of the market so a bit noisy
food was mid. soggy pizza and bland pasta.
price did not match quality. kind of disappointed.

"During our recent visit with a party of 10, including two well-behaved children, we were disappointed by the rude behavior exhibited by the manager. Towards the end of our dinner, the children momentarily got up from their seats and the manager approached our table in an incredibly disrespectful manner. Rather than addressing the situation with tact and courtesy, the manager rudely demanded that the children "come down" with no regard for their behavior or the overall positive dining experience we had been having.

This incident left a sour taste in our mouths and greatly diminished our enjoyment of the evening. As customers, we believe it is essential to feel valued and respected, but unfortunately, the manager failed to deliver on those expectations.

We hope that this review serves as constructive feedback for the restaurant and that the management takes the necessary steps to address the behavior of their staff. Until improvements are made, we cannot recommend to others who are seeking a pleasant dining experience, especially for families with children."

This place was inside of the busy market at eataly. It was noisy and felt like they were trying to serve people in the middle of a grocery store. The food was ...... below average. This is my second time back here and I will not be returning. The calimari was decent. The clam pasta lacked any flavor or sauce and was just pasta with clams still in their shells. The service was good but unfortunately the main dishes, that we barely touched, and paid $150 for left us feeling gyped.

Vino E Grano is located inside of the Eatly Complex which is located in Building 4 of the New World Trade Center.  Eatly had a number of dining areas and options.  Vino E Grano has a casual atmosphere and a wide selection of Italian dishes; pastas, pizza, meat plates.  Everything was very well prepared.  The pizza was a thick crust style and very tasty.  With beer and wine, it is a bit of an expensive lunch but overall recommended.

Wow who knew... we sure did not lol! Not being native to NYC this was an awesome venue one of many in the store!! After walking around there were several options a to pick from. Our waitress was knowledgeable and awesome this will be a spot to chill around the "oculus".  Did not go big just soup and a salad and wine

Undercooked rice and pasta. We are huge risotto fans, tried risotto all over the place, only discovered Vino e Grano's rice is undercooked, and so was our pasta.
NOt returning.

Pretty good place to enjoy salumi and cheese over wine. It's cheaper than other restaurants in Eataly but happy hour only applies to high top tables and the bar from 5-7pm. Even happy hour food is really expensive and small portioned.. cured meats and cheese were amazing but we were pretty disappointed with pasta. Not sure how they can charge almost $25-30 for a pasta dish that's cooked like for kids with just barely some sauce and pasta.. it's a good place to catch up with friends as it's hustling bustling but definitely touristy. Hostess and waitors were awesome though.
We enjoyed a very nice meal here. The food was fresh and delicious. The ambiance was fresh and exciting and the service was good. We left full and happy.

Best place in the area. The food is delicious and the service is outstanding. I took the family for a weekend dinner and was served by Sergio. He made our meal pleasurable. There are plenty of options to dine, but the server took the time to explain and suggest paring options.
Will definitely come back for more.

First off, let me start by saying that I love Eataly and I go there all the time for all kinds of purposes. This is my third visit to Vino e Grano and my least favorite experience. We were seated in the main dining area and it was a semi-busy night. I have previously tried their pizza and pasta and been satisfied with both food, wine and customer service. This time however we wanted to try out the main courses so we ordered the short ribs and the hangar steak. I found it outrageous that these meals cost ~$35 and were the most bland dishes I've had. The hangar steak came with some cooked farro, corn and squash that had NO flavor what so ever and looked liked something that could be served in a school cafeteria. Not even the added truffle had any flavor (!) I ordered my steak medium but received medium rare and again it was missing any type of seasoning. The short ribs tasted very average and wasn't served hot. We were served the wrong dish twice so overall it seemed like the staff was unorganized although it wasn't that busy. The waiter did not check in to see if everything was ok, if we needed anything else nor did he refill our water at any point. Even when collecting our plates we were not asked how it was. To me, this is the minimum you'd expect from the service staff at restaurant like this.

I'm deeply disappointed with this visit so my recommendation would be to stick with the pizza and pastas if you do decide to go and hope that the level of service will be better.

I'm disappointed to see a three star review( linguini vongole is suppose to be in the shell lady) This restaurant is located in Eataly. Therefor you will be eating inside of a market similar to the Arthur Ave but classier. This restaurant really relates to the Italian communal way of eating. You could possible be seated at a private table or end up sharing a high top with locals like yourself. I enjoyed the carpaccio appetizer along side meats and cheese. I ended it off with bolognese and norm. Everything was delicious. If you are looking for a private, intimate, setting this isn't the place for you. But if you want to enjoy the Italian communal experience come on in.

Went here yesterday evening for my sister in laws birthday and was very happy to be seated immediately. We made reservations, but modified them several times and the restaurant still made sure to accommodate our party of 8. We had a great time tasting some wine that our waiter who is on his path to become a master sommerlier recommended. We ordered the gran misto platter which had five meats and five cheeses to share as a group and loved the variety of the platter and also the presentation. We then each ordered an entree ranging from the hanger steak to variety of pastas. Amongst our group, the standout entrees were the papperdelle (amazing housemade egg pasta with a sausage cream sauce) and the octopus pasta (so tender and expertly seasoned). I ordered the brasato (short rib) that came with polenta and must say it was my least favorite dish among all of our orders. I found the portion size confusing with very little plenty and a gigantic piece of short rib that was a bit dry for my liking. I would certainly order one of the pasta dishes if I return as I think that is where Eataly out performs every other restaurant in the vicinity. Small con: Our waiter was very attentive in regards to our wine consumption, but there were many moments when we had empty water glasses at the table.
Not amazing service but nice place inside of eataly . Pizza is more like focaccia & the grilled octopus is the star

I visited the Eataly in Rome last year and the visit to this location was comparable. Although the space was smaller, the food was fresh and there was a great selection of wine. The waiters were very prompt with the service and cordial with their patrons.

On our NY trip, our daughter turned 16 and we stopped for lunch at Eataly (we love the one back home in century city). We were seated immediately and had a lovely waitress (Michele). My son ordered an "on the side" pasta dish and while we received our meals, his didn't arrive. After we let our waitress know, it quickly came out. After a few minutes, Madeline, the manager came over, apologized, comped our sons meal and refilled my husband and mine's glasses of Rose. Nice touch and very professional! In addition, they brought over a Tiramisu with a candle for my daughters b day. 5 stars! Btw, the food was delish!

Super overpriced like the rest of Eataly.  Appetizers are average, pastas are good, Secondi's are below average.   (Manzo (hanger steak) is a measly portion slathered with balsamic and soggy endives).  

Tourists can fill the space and drive revenue, but Eataly is getting stale.

Come here from long walkin, tired ...hungry....ordered pizza and pasta. Even we were very hungry, that pizza was awful...strange dough, little toppings.
We've Been in Moscow'a Eataly, it was disgusting, we think that in NY in World Trade Center area, it should be better, but...no.
And cappuccino is also not tasty, bitter.

This place is definitely not the price they charge. Ordered hanger steak - medium well ordered, but was burnt and tasteless when delivered. Chicken Milano - 2 thinly (and I mean the most thinly sliced) chicken fingers with arugula on the side. This was an $85 meal

This place is so good. It is such a good atmosphere.  The gluten free pasta is amazing!! I loved every minute of it. Even my family who is not celiac loved the gluten free pasta and thought it was amazing. Loved every minute of our time there. Would highly recommend it.

Definitely agree with the raving reviews about the tofu! I got the tofu pho and honestly the tofu was even more flavorful than the soup (I do think they made a mistake though, and gave me vegetable broth instead of beef broth like I asked because I tried my sister's beef pho and her broth was a lot more flavorful). They are also very generous with the serving sizes, so it's pretty good value for NYC (about $15 per meal). The tofu pieces were about as big as the palm of my hand, and there were ~6 of them!

The place is tiny--there's only about 8 seats so it's a good spot to get takeout or a quick lunch, but if you have more people with you then it's probably a good idea to look elsewhere.

I swear every time my friend and I come from the gym to here, we always come get the vegan broth tofu/mushroom pho and I always end up getting the thai tea and she gets a fruity drink(passionfruit), we fell in love with this spot bc it's so close to our gym to be honest, and the tofu here is seasoned so well it's unforgettable. I think about the season tofu in my sleep lol, seriously. Every time i'm close by I try to come this spot bc it's just so freaking good. The staff are nice inside, they might even remember my face for the times i've been coming here, if not it's cool. The spot is small not much seating area only inside you can sit. but yes lord bless my soul this tofu is bomb and that's all I have to say, mic drop.

Not many viet places down in fidi.
This is probably one of the best ones in the neighborhood.
It's a small joint with very limited seating.
Only about 10 seats along the wall counters.
They have your typical pho and summer rolls which is what I get.
I love the soup can never get enough.
You can get a pho and app combo for $22
You may see a long line at lunch time during the weekdays.
Although to be clear as this ranks for viet food in general is mediocre if that. I'm just craving pho.

The space is fairly small with limited spaces to sit so if it's busy, it'll be hard to eat there. And it is packed seating so you'll be very close to someone else eating. They have combo deals which are worth it which includes the appetizer, entree, and soda. The pho itself was very underwhelming...broth was not good and even with condiments, it didn't help. I think the summer rolls were packed with too much noodle and lettuce and the peanut sauce too sweet. It wasn't fresh either. There weren't many Vietnamese options in the area but would not recommend.
Good Bahn Mi. We had the classic and the bread was toasted perfectly. Nice crispy carrot topping. All good.
Love the classic sandwich!! Was craving for it and didn't disappoint. Will order again!

I love Banmi sandwiches from this restaurant.  I've never had any issues from this restaurant before, till tonight. I bit into some sharp bone pieces, which stabbed my gum pretty badly.
    I understand that it's a pork chop sandwich but people don't expect to get actual bone pieces in the sandwich, which can be pretty dangerous.  Please be more cautious when you prep the meat with bones in it.

I finally stopped here to try their tofu bahn mi and I am sad it took me so long to try Vietspot.  This was the best tofu bahn mi I have eaten.  The tofu had a marinade on it and was very soft and enjoyable.  The only thing i didn't like on the sandwich was a matter of personal taste.  I don't like carrots in general, but can deal with them if they are finely chopped or julienned.  These carrots were julienned, but on the thick side.  I also had the lemon limeaid and really liked it.  You can order it sweetened or unsweetened.

My favorite dish is the pork chop rice bowl platter. It's the only thing I get.
I've never tried anything else.

It's a very tiny space. There is some seating, but it's uncomfortable. It's better to order to go. They have a surprisingly extensive menu, including pho, bahn mi, vermicelli, salads, and so on. Let me tell you, Vietnamese-style pork chops are absolutely delicious.  The rice bowl includes rice, tomato, lettuce, pickled carrots, radish, cucumber, cilantro, jalapeno, and fish sauce. The fish sauce is served on the side.

Overall, 4 stars. I'll just keep ordering the pork chops on rice.

Vietspot is a small restaurant that serves traditional Vietnamese cuisine. The beef pho is a standout dish, with well-cooked beef and flavorful broth. However, the restaurant's limited seating area makes it difficult to dine with a group of friends, and it's best to order takeout instead. Vietspot may be a better option for a quick and satisfying lunch rather than a sit-down dinner. Overall, if you're in the area and looking for a delicious meal on the go, Vietspot is worth considering.

Ordered pork chop rice dish and Thai iced tea. Both were really good. Pork chop was very tender. They also cut the meat into strips so it was much easier to eat! Kid wants to come back tomorrow to try the pho.

The perfect lunch spot in FiDi if you are craving banh mis like I do!

The store was rather small but even still, packed with people that it doesn't feel like a hole in the wall as it sure was a popular hole! I had to wait some time during prime lunch hour before I got my banh mi. But they were really fast and efficient.

The Grilled Chicken Banh Mi ($10.75) was huge! I can't get over how banh mis have spiked to double its price from years ago, but at least the ones here are big enough to feel worth it. The ingredients were super fresh, from the cucumber to the carrots. The warm dark chicken was also pretty tender and juxtaposed the crunchy baguette well.

I can't say for their pho, but Vietspot's banh mis are definitely a solid lunch option!

3.5 stars. Solid lunch spot if you have a craving for Vietnamese food and work around the area. I wouldn't make any special trips to come here but if you happen to be close by and have a hankering for a banh mi, this is a good option out of the very few Vietnamese places in Financial District. The restaurant has a few seats (more like a lunch counter) but is small and narrow so better as a takeout spot.

I have to unfortunately give a full star but it unfortunately deserves half. Im always looking for some good pho in each city I go to.
This day was rainy, perfect for pho. I researched something close to where I was and this place popped up. So, give it a try.
I walk into this little hole in the wall, which usually I prefer to big restaurants. Unfortunately when I walked in I didn't smell the real pho scents. So I already was hesitant. Ordered beef pho and summer rolls with Thai tea. At least they had a combo meal. Also was ordered a beef pho with spring rolls and Thai tea.
The lady behind the counter wasn't friendly at all but I normally don't bother with that. The food tells me all.
The food looked appetizing but I took a bite and this cannot be pho. I think it might be a Chinese version of pho but definitely not Vietnamese. No pho spices inside. I couldn't taste any of it. Then I think they didn't pre soak their noodles because they were so tough. Spring rolls didn't have the same wrapper so it was thick with no flavor. Summer rolls were the only thing that was decent. Thai tea I felt was extremely sweet. Eh you win some you lose some. I was happy to have some heat in my stomach on a chilly wet day!

Wow what a great find. Vietspot has super reasonable prices and decent quality pho. The broth was flavorful, and the noodles were decent. It's the perfect meal if it's cold outside. The only thing is I wish there was a little more sliced beef, but at this price point you can't complain. I don't think there are very many options for pho in Fidi and while there are definitely better places in New York, this is a great option if you need something quick in the area for cheap.

Very popular spot in Fidi for lunch. Pretty big portions for the price. Lots of pieces of pork and also pickled vegetables and salad. Make sure you check your receipt because the cashier put down grilled chicken when I thought I said pork chop rice. Luckily she corrected it. Seems like they make things relatively fresh, otherwise it wouldn't take 20 mins to cook. Maybe order ahead if you have a meeting after lunch.

The food is worth the wait. Tiny spot to eat at, but they have sriracha and chili sauce ready and prepared. Mos def going back. Try the lychee drink. Perfect way to top off all the spiciness i added to my food

A great hole in the wall spot for delicious pho. This is my go-to spot whenever I'm in the financial district. I used to come here all the time with my friends after going to the gym in the area. I got the vegan tofu pho, which is the BEST vegan pho I've ever had. The tofu is soft and sweet and with the saltiness of the soup it's perfect. Reasonable prices and nice staff as well. This place doesn't get the attention it deserves.

This slightly hole-in-the-wall place is a go-to spot for quick and easy pho or banh mi or any typical Viet restaurant dish that's quick and easy. It is located in FiDi, close enough to several companies, the WTC and Fulton Center so it is definitely a convenient takeout lunch spot. Their menu is simple and also offers several combination choices including a pho+appetizer+drink or a sandwich+appetizer+drink and other combos too.

The prices are what you would expect from a place surrounded by large corporate entities where people pay high prices for lunch. It isn't the cheapest option but it also isn't a ripoff. I enjoyed the banh mi combo with an appetizer and drink. The sandwich had lots of ingredients, the bread was toasty and the appetizer was a full portion as well. I've had the beef pho here as well and it was pretty basic and simple but when you don't have time to fully enjoy a meal, you'd probably be ok with it as well. They provide everything that you would need to enjoy your meal including any applicable sauces. Their dining area is small for those that would wanna sit and eat but I've mostly seen a majority of the people come and go.

In summary, this is a decent Viet spot for classic, convenient and simple Viet food to take out but it is not the best pho option out there at all. Convenience is key with this place and the prices reflect that convenience but the city is huge and there are hundreds of pho places out there to explore aside from this one.

I had the chicken pho which was hearty and delicious although the chicken didn't really look like chicken. It had more of a beef flavor even though I know it wasn't beef compared to the pictures. There was plenty of meat and the noodles were fresh. Like all the places around my apartment I always pre-order for pick up so I have no wait.
Good banh mi. Only downside is they get very busy at lunchtime. If you don't order ahead you can end up waiting quite a while.
I have had Best Bahn Mi (traditional) from a lot of different vendors but this one is clearly the winner!!

Stale egg rolls.
Sauces were not authentic.
Shrimp was low quality.
Burnt coffee.
Thai tea was bad.
All around do not recommend

To start....vietspot committed the CARDINAL sin of bubble tea. I never thought I would see the day where this happened...but: they gave a regular straw with the tea...if this was regular tea, ok fine. But how do they expect one to suck the bubbles up? Unfortunately I was home before I noticed and couldn't ask for a correct straw but I was surprised to see no other reviews mentioned this?

Also ordered the pho combo B which came with air fried crispy rolls and the rare/cooked beef in a spicy broth. The options are great and I thought it would be a great deal for the amount of food you would be getting, however, this is the definition of quantity not quality.

The spring rolls looked like they were filled from the outside, but instead were just thick dough with maybe one or two carrot strips. Unfortunately, tasteless.

I was excited to try the pho which others rave about. It was spicy as requested and there was a lot of beef added. However the broth just tasted like pure chili oil. There was no depth of flavor as I've had in other pho spots in the city.

First bowl of pho in NYC in about 20 years.my impression is that NYC is nowhere near California in quality of Pho. Non Vietnamese staff. Not a deal breaker but it's a series of things including overly salty lacking beef flavor broth, summer rolls full of iceberg lettuce, premade and wrapped in Saran. The pho broth was served lukewarm.
Great sandwich, filled with porky goodness.  Good portions and very tasty banh mi.  Hits the spot when needing a quick and easy on the go lunch.   Convenient location in FiDi.
VietSpot has become the Friday night go to for my wife and I. Just reliable good food. Hits the Spot, shall we say?

Decent spot for takeout quality Vietnamese. Not the best I've had, but certainly not the worst.

I have tried a couple of their menu items, but the go to is their Summer Rolls which are huge for $7.00. Definitely enough to fill you up if you add shrimp or pork. I have also had the Tofu Bowl w/ Vermicelli (and added Shrimp), and the Vermicelli w/ Pork. The Tofu Bowl was just okay... I prefer the thinner, lighter fried tofu (or tofu skin) to these thick slabs of it, but not terrible. The Vermicelli w/ Pork was much better and you get a ton of pork for the price. They also never skimp on noodles.

Certainly an okay option for a quick bite.

I LOVE Banh Mi. This is a little place. But they make KILLER Banh Mi. Both he Classic and the Chicken were perfect. Plenty of toppings...which many places get wrong. Bread was perfect...and delicious filling.

Found this spot after coming from an appt. Nice and small, they asked for my vaccination card as I was doing indoor dining. I ordered the beef pho with raw beef (you can get cooked). The broth was flavored well and had a lot of depth to eat. The noodles were perfectly cooked and all the veggies were fresh and firm. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was that I felt that the broth could of been hotter. Overall,  great flavor and I'll definitely go back again.

This was an awesome practically hidden spot along Nassau! I picked up some food to-go after a gym trip and on my way to a working lunch - I was absolutely starving and needed a big bowl of noodle soup!

The interior is very unassuming, but the smell is absolutely incredible as soon as you walk in. The counters were full of customers during a weekday in the mostly dead financial district, which is always a good sign.

The beef pho I ordered was delicious, and the Thai tea was sweet and flavorful. The veggies and spices in the pho were very fresh, and I drank every last drop of the yummy broth. Will definitely head back again.

I visited because I was Craving some pho. I ordered pork chop pho with vegan broth. I think the food was pretty good. I don't think they use MSG in their food Because it was not salty at all.

The vegan broth tasted authentic but at the same time, it was not really flavorful or seasoned. Some MSG or salt would have helped. The portion was also a bit small compared to what I usually get at my go-to pho place. It was double the price of my usual PHO place, But half the size. It was also not as good as my usual pho place. I don't think I'll be visiting again.

TL;DR - okay pho for being one of the few pho places in the area, but wouldn't visit again, pho is mediocre

I'll give it 3.5 stars for trying. Had the classic banh mi today, wasn't impressed. The pickle carrots didn't have a lot of flavor. They only give you pickle carrots not a mix of pickle daikon and carrots like other places which is what I prefer. The amount of Mayo they put on mine was overwhelming. Everything was covered in Mayo. I wanted to get a photo of it but my hands were also covered in Mayo. Overall just bland. I've had better Vietnamese food in SGV!

Whenever I pass this place, it smells great. I've tried the Vietnamese iced coffee and it helps you wake up. It has the right amount of sugar to milk ratio. I tried the grilled pork chop banh mi, it's a good portion. I wish the sandwich had an fried egg option and they provided hot sauce. I think hot sauce would have given it that extra kick it needs. Overall great place, will visit again.

Walking home from the gym, I seriously couldn't resist the smell! They have amazing lunch combo options. I opted for the Pho + App + soda for $21.

I loved that they had a fish ball option for the pho, I've never had that but typically love them in hot pots! So I definitely didn't pass that option up, for broth I went for the spicy beef which honestly was the perfect amount of flavor and spice, noodle definitely the vermicelli . The main reason they scored me was they offer summer rolls on the menu which are my absolute favorite! Something about the texture of the paper and shrimp is always a go for me. YUM!

Already excited due to the menu and smells once I received my food I was very impressed with the amount! The Summer Rolls were huge! They definitely didn't gyp you on the shrimp either, so many! The pho was perfect so many balls!! I was very impressed. Lol As. I mentioned I was excited about the balls. Haha On the side they also gave two sauces and jalapeños which complimented the pho delightfully.

Anyways if your looking for a quick bite or delivery, this place is an amazing option that I would DEFINITELY RECOMMEND TO A FRIEND.

Living in fidi, there aren't a lot of Vietnamese spots in the area-- but if you're ever craving it, Vietspot will .. hit the spot! Their broth is a little too peppery, and the noodles are a bit thicker than I'd like, but still a good bowl of pho at a good price point !

I came here with my friends the other day after the gym, and it was delicious. I got the grilled chicken pho and my friends go tofu & grilled chicken rice bowl, and tofu pho. I ended up only taking a photo of my friends food because my pho was so good i immediately devoured it haha. the service is super friendly. small shop but it was just us three eating in there. their thai iced tea is *chefs kiss*. one of the best thai iced tea's i've had in a while. this location was easy to find and they have a variety of other delicious vietnamese dishes in here! i highly recommend everyone to check this spot out and support this local business. super close to the Fulton Center train station. delicious authentic vietnamese food. The staffs were friendly and followed covid guidelines and protocols.

Not a bad spot for pho and banh mi! I believe it's the only viet spot in fidi that offers pho and banh mi.

I ordered their beef pho and classic banh mi to go. I'll say that the pho has some good flavor but definitely taste the salt and pepper used. They give you a good amount of noodles and alright amount of beef shank.

As for the classic banh mi, again not bad. A bit bigger banh mi than most that I've had. It's more bread but tastes good.

My only issue is that the was no prices shown on their menu and it came out a bit more expensive than I personal like. But then again I live in Chinatown so there more options. This is the only spot I know of in fidi so I guess price matches its location and lack of competition.

Still overall good viet spot for pho and banh mi and would recommend!

Maybe we came on an off day or we didn't order the right item but thought my shrimp pho was very very average? Came here in the late afternoon on a Friday wanting to try the beef pho however was informed by the cashier that they already ran out.

The shrimp pho was very light. There was not much flavor to the soup besides the spice and salt. Portion was ok for the price. Thought the whole thing was just meh  

Definitely want to come back and try their beef pho.

Small place with a few seats only

I used to order from them for fish ball soup. They provided a large container before, but today when I ordered the fish ball soup, they gave me a container much smaller, and the price was increased.

Very disappointing; never going there again.

The service was terrible despite there being very few customers here. Food takes so long, and a person who ordered after me fully got their meal before me, finished eating it, and left and i'm still waiting for my food (one entree). Disappointed :(

This is the best pho I've had in nyc so far Or maybe ever. Hole in the wall , but worth it! Very tasty and full of flavor and a great price. Will be back to try other items. (Was too tasty i forgot to take a photo)

Descent pho spot. It's close to my office and the service is pretty fast and good.

I ordered combo d which is their soup and sandwich combo. I got the half chicken sandwich with shrimp pho and a drink.

Everything was okay, but it's a nice consistent spot. Soup was a little bland so I had to add a lot of lime, hoisin and chili paste. Not the best pho or bahn mi I've had but not the worst either.

My friend and I stopped by on a Saturday morning  to grab a quick Banh mih. When we arrived there was no one else in the restaurant which is good because it is very small and I'm sure  it would be difficult to a social distance. The cashier was friendly and took our order quickly.

We ordered a pork chop Banh mih. The pork seemed like it was cooked fresh and tasted very delicious. The veggies that came with it were good but pretty average. The bread though was very plain and disappointing. It seemed like they just took it out of a bag and slapped some toppings on it. It would have been better if the bread tasted fresher and was toasted or something along those lines.

Not sure if we just ordered an average dish and need to order another one in order to appreciate the restaurant more like other yelpers. Since it's so close to me I might consider giving it another chance.

I found the Vietspot from passing by many times while going to Blink FiDi. The smell of their Pho soups is pretty obvious when you walk by this hole-in-wall restaurant. I only tried their beef pho twice afterwork. The portions are big and filling for their price. BTW, I noticed an $1 increase recently for all their menu items. Overall, I really enjoyed their pho and I don't have to commute to Chinatown when a random Viet food craving strikes.

NOTE: This place is pretty small. There are about 10-12 stool seating.

Unfortunately, this didn't hit the spot for me.  I was starving and really craving a banh mi.  I am not a banh mi expert, but I have eaten enough of these sandwiches to know what I like.  The Classic at Vietspot bore little resemblance to my favorites.  Instead of crackly, baguette-like bread, this sandwich came on a giant, torpedo shaped bread.  I have never had a banh mi with ground pork, and after trying to eat this one - and spilling it all over my pants in the park - I know why.  The pate was barely funky and had an unappealing skin of gelled fat.  The pickled carrots were good, and the fresh cilantro lent an herby burst of flavor, but neither could ultimately redeem this sandwich.
Unassuming little spot with tasty soup and sandwiches. A little pricey, but nice size portions and food tastes freshly made. Definitely going back on a payday or when I want to treat myself.
I really liked the pho broth that was all I ate and I considered the broth flavorful and wonderful. The servings were big

Just want to leave this has feedback: a lot of people are complaining that the soup is too peppery. That is because the cooks use big pinches of roughly grinded black peppercorns instead of powder. It was a nice surprise to bite into them as I finished the soup

Really good lunch spot for bahn mi and pho. If you can't decide whether you want a sandwich or noodles, they have a combo so that you can get both! Prices are very reasonable for the area and service is always quick and friendly. The pho is certainly not the best you can get in the city but is good enough to satisfy a lunch craving. My favorite is the pork chop pho.
Love this place always very welcoming, and the lavender coffee is great. You can always expect to have a great conversation with the customers.

Amazing! I saw the staff (I believe they are the owners?) interacting with customers in such a soulful way. The entire cafe is space themed so very interesting. The way it is tucked into the subway station makes it so unique. I already grabbed iced coffee elsewhere, but would have happily gotten it here if I had known. I got the rhubarb scone ($4 + tax). It was great and I had such a good time here.

Been coming here for a bit because of its proximity to my workplace. I love their espresso, I'm a fan of nutty espressos and I feel like that's not commonly found. Also been a fan of their toasts, it's always delicious, tastes fresh, and made with well curated quality flavors! Customer service is always great too, even when the owners are slammed with orders, they make it a point to greet you and are warm each time. So happy to have a spot I love for my work mornings~

Such a fancy little coffee shop to be hidden away in a subway station.  Taking an office break to have your coffee and snack here, not to-go, is totally worth it since the presentation is a real treat.  Plus it all tastes great.

Iced Latte: I felt like I was running an experiment with Mr. Wizard.  The espresso came in a little glass bottle with a little cork.  The sweetened milk and ice in a huge beaker.  And some mineral water in a double paned glass on the side.  It's DIY in the sense that you pour in the espresso and mix it all together.  Not heavily involved, but the ritual of it all feels cool.  Plus tastes very refreshing.

Burrata Grape Toast: Who needs Avocado Toast or Almond Butter Toast when you can have a massive amount of mushy burrata cheese on toast?  The generous amount of cheese alone would be enough for me, but the other stuff actually made for a great pairing.  There was some kale pesto which had a nice herbal contrast and thankfully tasted more like pesto than like kale.  The grapes were unlike any grapes I've ever had.  They were sliced thin and tasted quick pickled so their inherent sweetness was mellowed with a delicious vinegary tone.  Such a great combination of flavors.

A true hidden gem that blew my expectations out of the water! In typical weekday morning fashion I was looking for a place that had both craft coffee and something to nibble on like avocado toast. My first attempt at finding this place on a map was unsuccessful because I hadn't realized it is actually underground in the Fulton Street station! There are a few pathways to finding it, mainly by accessing the John Street subway entrance, or by going through the revolving doors of the building on William Street, then heading downstairs. A kind security guard helped us navigate when we entered the building and before we knew it we found ourselves in the subway station! Very unexpected and almost secretive, like the coffee version of a speakeasy--they truly did take us on a voyage :')

Their menu is pretty compact but I like how they offer a range of menu items like classic espresso and pourover drinks, fresh-made food, pastries, and of course signature espresso drinks (my personal fav).

The space inside is quite cramped with one table and a few bar stools; it could seat maybe 8 people total but I think that's apt considering I'm sure most of their clientele are busy commuters. That said, on a Friday mid-morning it wasn't too busy.

The employees taking and making our orders were so friendly and struck up conversation with us. Our barista kindly explained to me their signature drinks: Their lavender latte uses a housemade lavender syrup; the Space Oatly is a hazelnut and oat milk coffee; and the cafe miel is a light roast latte with honey. These types of unique concoctions are right up my alley!

I opted for the lavender latte which was excellent. It had an incredible layer of crema and the lavender flavor was so good (I've been scarred in the past by coffeeshops that pump half a cup of Torani syrup in one drink). It was maybe a tad too sweet but I certainly need some sweetness so I would request it half sweet next time. My boyfriend who had a regular latte also enjoyed!

Our group also got all three toasts to share: the Classic Avocado with a drizzle of olive oil; the Mango Avocado with what I believe is szechaun-style chili oil (I felt the numbing!!); and the Burrata Grape. All three were fantastic. My favorite was the Burrata Grape, which was equally creamy, garlicky, savory, with a tad of sweetness from the marinated grapes--scrumptious! I can't wait to go back and have this again.

I was also pleasantly surprised by the relative affordability. The coffees were only around $5-6 and the toasts $7-8 each. The portions of the toasts are quite huge as well. Effectively one whole toast had me really full, so I think sharing one would be sufficient for a light breakfast.

Do not sleep on Voyager Coffee just because it's a bit tucked away--it is worth the trek! Delicious food and coffee in a humble environment but with high-quality products.

The storefront may seem a little random but the baristas know what they're doing. The best coffee I've tried in NYC so far!

It's been awhile since I felt that an overpriced coffee in NY was worth the money.

This place is such a hidden gem; it's underground and so it might be hard to find, but once you find it you'll never forget where it is.

The people who run this place are so friendly and nice. The owner(?) who made my coffee asked me about my preferences and he made a special drink for me with honey, and I absolutely loved it! He really knows what to pair with the type of coffee they have and was so good at explaining as well.

I came here to do some work cuz I saw that they offered free wifi, which worked extremely well, and I loved hearing other customers coming in and conversing with the staff here; seems like they are really good at building and maintaining relationships with the people who know this hidden gem!

Loved the aesthetics and everything, just wish there was a bathroom nearby (will have to go out and go to a nearby store or restaurant).

Will definitely tell my friends about this place and come back to try their other drinks (:

hidden gem coffee shop in the subway station that's served delicious, warm, hearty lattes. We opted for the almond milk latte and coconut milk latte, both served with a side of sparkling water. The coffee itself is definitely better than your standard latte and it was overall a really nice and friendly atmosphere!

Located underground in the subway station - this coffee shop is an absolute hidden gem! Cute, small shop with seating, outlets, and wifi. The owners were very friendly and lovely to chat with as well. I got the iced lavender latte and matcha latte which was perfect for me. Not too sweet and well blended (not powdery). I have also tried their regular latte (iced and hot) and enjoyed those. I will be back!
Great spot tucked away in the subway entrance. Had iced coffee and iced oat latte. Quick and delicious

This was Voyager Espresso, in the tunnel to the ACE train in Fidi. I decided to treat myself to a cafe  au lait and ham and cheese croissant after working out and it was delicious. The honey in the latte was impeccable and the croissant, toasted, was Chefs Kiss

Wow I LOVE this place! Who would've expected such a cool coffee shop in the subway station? Came here to do some work Thursday morning at 8:30 and there're already 6 customers enjoying their coffee. They have a corner area with a table and seats, and several high top seats. I ordered the specialty space oatly with hazelnut syrup and oat milk and it was delicious! Also got a feta spinach tomato croissant pastry that was tasty. Super affordable too for a $6 latte and $4 pastry. I love how everything came on a tray and they were thoughtful enough to provide sparkling water! I tried the cheddar chive biscuit another day for $3.5 but didn't love it as much as it was a bit dry. My favorite thing about this place though is how welcoming and personable the owners are. You could clearly tell that the owners knew all their regular customers and kept up to date on their lives. Will definitely return!

Just it's a treat like going to a luxury spa in a coffee house ! The lavender coffee is a must and the bureaus grape toast!
So good I just can't put in words .
Lovely cafe, friendly service and great tasting coffee. I haven't tried any food items yet, but the menu looks inviting so I'll give it a shot soon. Will definitely return!

Amazing underground coffee experience. Love their unique coffee flavors and food selection. The vibe is also great, especially when you decide to dine in. The staff is super friendly and down to earth, check them out!

While it may go unnoticed due to location it so makes up for! I passed a few times headed to the 2/3 line and noticed Voyager was always busy. Popped in for a great cold brew and have been loyal since! Their pastries are also super fresh and yummy! The same two people are always there (assume they are the owners) and are soo incredibly lovely. I think I went twice before they had my order memorized. All around a great spot I really recommend!
Located just down the subway steps. Immaculate vibes and really great coffee. 5 stars.

Voyager Espresso is an exceptional place to enjoy espresso, pour-over, lattes, and tea. From the moment I stepped inside, I was enveloped in warmth, comfort, and the pleasant aroma of freshly brewed coffee. The baristas were immersed and knowledgeable, ensuring my drinks and experience were perfect.

The espresso itself was outstanding - smooth, rich, and flavorfully robust. Every sip reminded me why I love coffee and why I will keep returning to Voyager. The ambiance of the place, combined with the exceptional service, made for an extraordinary adventure. I'm grateful for the opportunity to enjoy such a wonderful time with William and co-rock star. Thank you!
Great coffee. Made a good cortado. Very friendly. Need to go downstairs like you're going to subway
This place rocks! Coffee is superb.. Much better than Starbucks. You must try the mango avocado toast!! Photo here....

Was pleasantly surprised. Saw there were a few bad reviews but they were from ages ago and likely different owners. Would have given it a 4.5 be abuse the baristas were so nice, but I went with a 4. Oat milk latte was nicely prepared and I got a waffle. Only thing that would have made the waffle better was getting it freshly made, but that's kind of next level and this is really a grab and go place. Entrance is a bit hard to find, you enter the building and go to the subway entrance then go downstairs.

This place is back in business! Will was my barista this morning. I ordered Lavender Latte because I never saw it anywhere else near by me.

He told me where my coffee beans came from but I forgot. The latte tastes rlly good. I am drinking it currently

Tucked underground, down the Williams St. entrance to the 2/3 train, this place serves the best coffee in New York City. And I mean that -- unlike the bespoke Brooklyn roasters that open only at odd hours, this place serves up drool-worthy Geisha, Pink bourbon and single origin coffees right along your commute! Far out!

Voyager is my go-to place for coffee. It's like coming home to folks that are always happy to see you, go out of their way to make you feel comfortable, make your experience the best, and most importantly, live for coffee. It's never a miss, never dull, and always fun!

just discovered this gem and i'm overjoyed! i live in fidi and all the coffee spots around here are mid and i was literally about to give up when i stumbled across voyager. the matcha latte here is amazing especially with the lavender syrup. the staff are all so kind. i was having a shitty day yesterday and the energy of this place brought a smile to my face. safe to say i will be back!

Best coffee I ever had ! Thank you.
It was smooth without texture. It had an awesome after taste !

I was able to sample their coffee at a farmers market in Asbury Park, NJ. The first thing I noticed were all the Fellow products they use! We got an almond milk latte and a cold brew with oat milk. The cold brew was a little weak, but the latte was strong and just enough sweet. Service was also friendly, from what it seems like was a family. Even the kid had a good handling on the pour overs!

Best coffee ever! I work in the neighborhood, and this is definitely the best coffee shop around. They serve your coffee on a cute little tray with a glass is sparkling water. The owners are super friendly, and I love that I'm supporting a small business run by incredibly hard-working and kind people. I'm always welcomed with a smile. Their avocado toast is delicious too, and honestly the coffee is really good. Even my almond milk latte is thick with thick foam on top. Yum!

Voyager Espresso is the epitome of a hidden gem. This intimate cafe is located underground, beneath an office building in the financial district, and, most importantly, serves killer coffee. I had a single-origin Ethiopian light roast pour over, and the round, bright flavor profile was exactly what I needed on a chilly afternoon.

What made the experience truly special was the friendliness of the baristas. They were eager to share some coffee made from new Columbian beans they had roasted a day prior, and we had a great time discussing the flavor profile. Needless to say, I will definitely be back for another afternoon pick-me-up!

Voyager's customer service combined with expert coffee knowledge and technique sets the bar extremely high, and I'd say it's one of maybe two coffee shops in NYC that provide both at this level. Will treats you like a regular from day-one and serves up a delightful single-origin pour over with the attention to detail and respect that a meticulously sourced and roasted coffee deserves.

Such a cool spot! Just a quick stop-off in the subway entrance at William Street. Super friendly staff who took such care for a single, house-blend coffee! Delicious and smooth blend as well! I also LOVE the theme, original and super fun! Definitely put this place on your destination list when you're in the FiDi!

10/10 this place is an experience. The staff is so nice and it's a shame that it's hidden away! The grape burrata toast was such a great mid day brunch treat and the coffee is definitely not something you'd get at Starbucks!

This is literally a hidden gem; it look me 4 trips around the block to find it! I found this spot on Ritual and loved it so much I came back. If you're looking for an Instagram worthy latte, this is your spot! The milk is in an adorable beaker and the coffee is in a tiny bottle. (Go with the oat milk)
You know a spot is legit when they give you sparkling water to wash down your coffee!
The guys behind the bar are also super friendly!

They roast their own coffee beans. One location. Unassuming.  Thought it would be on street level, but had to ask the security guard who directed me to go down a set of stairs and turn left. It's actually located underground along a path to the subway. Opened now for 3 years, it's popular amongst Yelpers.  Locals' favorites: Sliced Egg Toast and Avocado Toast ($6/$9.50 for 1 or 2 slices). The slice is thick. I got the Yoghurt-Granola- Mixed Berries for my post workout treat. They have 3 choices for brewed coffee: French Press (dark roast), Colombian (medium roast), and I forget the name of the light roast. He let me try all 3 in separate glass cups. He was patient. Then I inquired about their expressions--also 3 to choose from: 1. Guatemalan, 2. Columbian, and 3. French.  I am sipping the Guatemalan americano and it has chocolate undertones. Yummy!  

I did try the samples they had out this morning by the register: 1. Peanut Butter Arugula Toast and 2. Sliced Egg Toast. Enjoyed them both.m, but the Egg one was my fav between the two.

Good stream of people coming through mid-morning. There is a hideout small lounge area good for 6 people. I saw an outlet there as well. Free WiFi.

They do not rush. They bring the food to you.

I'm in my happy place right now. Voyager coffee allows you to complete escape from the hustle and bustle of the financial district... in the least expected place of all. At the Fulton St subway station!

It's basically a sauna in NYC right now (mid August) so I opted for an iced coffee. The barista even gave me a free coffee tasting so I could choose! I tried the Barundi, Colombian, and the dark roast. They were all sooo good but I personally liked Colombian the best.

I'm a big fan of the presentation here. The metal straw, mini water cup, coffee beaker, the tray... I love it all. They even make their own almond, macadamia nut, and date milk. Soooo good. Definitely try this.

Overall, amazing coffee, service, interior, and presentation. Can't wait to be back many many more times :)
What a nice experience. This place is just the hole in the wall I love to seek out when visiting NYC. My Americano was great. Can't wait to go back again.

Dropped by Voyager Espresso when I had some time to kill and got to try some pretty good coffee~ First off, there is a lot of intrigue about this place because it is a bit difficult to find -- you have to go through a door off of the lobby of a building and this place is basically nestled within part of the subway! Super cool to be honest, but a bit confusing if you don't know where to go. The presentation of drinks in Erlenmeyer flasks is another interesting part of the experience at Voyager and it certainly adds to the appeal of the place. The coffee I had was good, well balanced and too tart. Service was super warm and friendly so I'd definitely drop by again if I was in the area!

Although this place was a little tricky to locate ( take the staircase on your right just as you enter the building) it was worth it. I've seen pictures of their drinks but I cared more about the taste. The aesthetics of it is just a plus. The baristas were super friendly, and when it seemed like my iced latte seemed to take some work to make I asked if he would prefer making it in a to go cup to make his life easier. He was very friendly about it and told me not to worry at all. Once given my iced latte to stay he explained how to put it together because some customers do get confused.

Now onto my latte, it was awesome. Just the right amount of espresso flavor.

Was in the area and had some time to kill. It would be a little difficult to find, but the street sign pointing to the basement was helpful. I ordered an iced chai latte and avocado toast, they were both delicious. Avocado toast came with a very generous slice of sourdough cut into 2 pieces, slathered with their avo spread. I'm usually not one to buy avocado toast, but it was reasonable priced ($7) and delicious! Staff was very friendly, would definitely recommend if you're in the area.

You would never know this was here unless it was through friends, family, coworkers, or just passing by. It is definitely a hidden gem.

Location/Enviroment
When you get off the subway 2,3,A,C it is in the direction toward John Street at the very end. It can be hard to find if you are not going out in that direction. The place is small and it is not a place to really dine in with a group. It's more for a quick bite or a to go order for lunch. There is very little seating but you can sit there and eat if you prefer too.

Food:
The food is definitely delicious. It is all homemade and made to order. You watch them make it and it is simple stuff. I usually get the tuna sandwich because it is just a great amount of tuna and the bread is nicely toasted. It is great they do an open face sandwich because it keeps the bread getting soggy. You can put the bread together if you wanted, it is a personal preference. If you ever just want to try their food they do have samples out every day. There coffee is a pretty reasonable price for where they are located.

Overall
They are one of my favorite locations to go to at the moment. They are generous since they do help those in need. They also are inviting since they tend to remember you after your first encounter with them. They do give special offers which is great from my budget and they are pretty quick.

The bat cave of high end coffee. Voyager embraces the darkness of its location with an equally dark interior, on which the coffee and food really pop. There's a lot of thought and cool factor here, and while I wouldn't choose Voyager for a cozy study spot, I would absolutely come back for the coffee and Nutella toast.

Coffee - excellent. My cappuccino was perfectly smooth and flavorful. They take coffee seriously and will tell you about the origin and flavor profile if you are curious.

Food - both the Nutella toast and avocado toast are great choices for a quite breakfast or a snack. The bread is fantastic.

Ambiance - dark and cool. This is one of those spots that makes you appreciate the diversity of food and drink in New York.

Hidden away below 110 William street. Right by the entrance to the subway underground. Small place. I only got the ice latte experience with oat milk. Super fun. It comes in a flask like it's part of a chemistry experiment. Little bottle of espresso to add to the milk of your choice, and a shot of sparkling water. Very fun, tasty, and def recommended.

Without yelp I wouldn't have been able to find this hidden gem! Absolutely amazing customer service and delicious coffee!

This place is kind of hidden underground in a subway station so just follow the directions on their website! I ended up getting the iced latte in an Erlenmeyer flask and honestly it was one of the best lattes I've ever had! I also loved that they served every coffee with some sparkling water on the side. The owner was also extremely kind and gave us samples of some baked goods they had on sale. Amazing coffee and great service! Will definitely be back next time I visit New York!

If you can't find it: it's on subway level below ground, you can enter through business center lobby.

Wonderful Italian style cappuccino, tuna salad was made right in front of me and was on point. Very friendly staff, overall a great experience to start your day.

Excellent coffee and presentation, the owner is very helpful with suggesting different roasts.

The food here is good value too, I'd recommend a full sandwich or a salad/sandwich combo.

As previous reviewers have mentioned, this location is sort of a hidden gem find as it is nestled in the hallway of one of the entrances of the Fulton station. I ordered a chai latte from this cafe and really enjoyed it! It was super creamy and flavorful. 5 stars are given especially because of the service. The barista who made my latte was incredibly nice. They ran out of 2% milk so he offered to make it with oat milk and sprinkled cinnamon on top.

A true hidden gem, Voyager Espresso is one of those coffee shops where they love what they do and it really shows. From my second visit, they made me feel like a regular who had been visiting for years. This is how everyone needs to start their mornings!

They offer a great variety of milk alternatives, including their amazing homemade macadamia almond milk. A note, the drink presentation is beautiful when you dine in, so try that at lease once.

The food is phenomenal- It seems silly to rave about such things as avacodo toast and egg sandwhiches, but they are some of the best I've had. They are prepared to order and the servings are huge.

This place really takes care in what they do- in a busy spot like theirs, they could easily just get by without all this care and effort. This is one of those places where the drinks and food are really amazing, but the people are truly priceless.

I just got a new job in the city hall area and I was looking for a new coffee shop to prepare for my day. I found voyager coffee online and decided to check it out. The location, tucked away in a subway station, was a little tricky to find but felt extremely cozy once I settled in.
I ordered a coffee to go and an espresso to stay. They offered both light and medium roast and I opted for the light. Their customer service in explaining the difference was awesome.
Their espresso has complex flavor notes that show their attention to detail as they must have dialed in recently. They also offered sparkling water to accompany the drink which was appreciated greatly. I will be returning here soon.

There are a lot of options for coffee in the Fidi area, but the Voyager Espresso is hands down my favorite place. A word of warning, I only like to drink black filter coffee-- so I can really only speak to that (I added in milk once and it was sour, so-- not my thing). Location-wise, the Voyager is the most convenient place (inside my building and inside the subway station). Taste-wise, oh baby that coffee is strong and my colleagues have since gotten used to this, but their coffee also has a REALLY STRONG aroma.

I know that if I am lacking energy and need fuel, this is where I will go.

You can never say enough about customer service.   It's the little things that make a difference in your experience.

Was in the area eating brunch and we wanted to get some coffee afterward.  We found this place on yelp.  Had good reviews so wanted give them a try.  

As we entered we noticed the sign for buy one get one free coffee drinks, we were already sold.  We ordered the mochaccino hot and ice latte.  Both drinks pretty good, not the best we've ever had, but solid nonetheless.  They serve their dine in drinks with a side of sparkling water, which is always a nice touch in my opinion.  As we were ordering our drinks we also noticed that they had free food samples at the counter including pieces of avocado toast.  What other coffee/café gives out free samples of avocado toast and buy one get one free?  Plus they posted their Wi-Fi password so you can easily login without having to bother the Barista.

Because of their customer service, I will definitely come back. Sally their buy one get one free deal ends in January, but I'll try to head back before then.

Best coffee in the city! The mocha was perfect because it's not overly sweet and is delicious. The drip coffee was fantastic because it was flavorful and actually hot! I hate when places add cold cream or milk and compromise the temperature. Super kind and friendly staff. Highly recommended!

Food (4/5): Got the pork and chives dumplings as well as Basil Chicken dumplings. While not spectacular, the dumplings were tasty and well cooked. I preferred the boiled dumplings over fried.

Service (2/5): This was the biggest con, it took a long time to get our small order. We waited upwards of 20 minutes.

Venue (3/5): It has a decent amount of seating area, but note that the place can be very busy and loud.

I felt compelled to come back to Yelp to warn everyone what has happened to this Vanessa's locations.
I've been going to Vanessa's since 2005 and I started visiting this outpost in 2019 while working in fidi. Solid lunch special deal and everything was made to order.
Before today I hadn't been here since end of 2021.

OH MY GOD. They were just closed last week for a redesign and something went HORRIBLY wrong.

1) they got rid of the lunch special and have a much smaller menu
2) NOTHING IS FRESHLY MADE. MY DUMPLING WERE STRAIGHT UP TAKEN OUT OF A HEAT BOX???
3) THEY WERE GUMMY. THE DOUGH looked smooth like for a ravioli and GUMMY. STUCK TO EACH OTHER GUMMY. I'm pretty sure I just ate raw dough for $10

Do NOT come to this location until they bring back... fresh boiled and fried dumplings. An absolute insult to the OG Vanessa's.

Recently I ordered the Noodles Soup Special with Pork, seaweed salad and ginger tea from the Ritual app ($11.88 plus tax).  When I arrived to pick up my order, my order was made on the spot so it stays fresh.  The noodles were buried and there was a lot of broth.  This spot is reliable in terms of food quality especially their dumplings.  I have yet to try their pancakes.  The ginger honey tea hits the spot especially after devouring the soup and seaweed salad.
What happened to the menu? This was our go to place for noodle soup and sesame pancake sandwiches. Those items are gone and they now have dumplings and cold noodle appetizers.
These dumplings are not what Vanessas dumplings used to be! Reheated, gummy and expensive dumplings... i miss the original ones

This location has really gone downhill.  I used to work in FiDi and ordered food from here regularly before 2022. I went in the other day expecting the same delicious dumplings I had always ordered.... WRONG.  First, no one seems to be working at this location.  I was helped by one of the people working at Artichoke pizza.  He took my order and couldn't care less.  The dumplings didn't look fresh.  I assumed they were boiled versus the steamed I asked for because they looked pale and gummy. I asked for them "spicy" which in the past was tossed with chili oil, garlic, cilantro, and scallions.  This time they just handed me a small chili oil and sent me on my way.  I paid an extra $1.50 for essentially nothing.  There was absolutely no love put into the food or the preparation.  Customer service is non-existent I will never come back to this location.  It was a huge disappointment.

This particular location is the one I go to most often as it's right across the street from work. The man who takes orders is always a delight. He's quick, attentive, and helps with cooking when it begins to get busy. He's always trying to get orders out as soon as he can because around 1-1:30 it gets pretty busy and they make the food to order. I love that although it's inside of City Acres, they have a full menu. I have never tried anything I didn't like from them. They also sell frozen dumplings to make at home!

Very disappointed. The quality food and taste went down and the price is ridiculous. $5 for dumplings when it use to be 2.5 or less for the same box of dumplings. The dumplings use to have thin skin and very crispy and now it's just the opposite. The beef cilantro and carrots pancake I used to love getting but now they skimp on the meat. It's now literally eating bread with two tiny slices of meat. Not worth going there anymore and it's now 4.50! Used to be $3 for the beef pancake!

Never been lucky with this place. It's near my work place so often drop by for lunch. I have finally concluded after many attempts that it's of low quality, less quantity and over priced for what is served.
I ordered veg dumplings in a soup and seaweed salad. This was my worst nightmare packed in form of lunch. Veg dumplings had shiitake mushrooms which I can't stand and seaweed salad was layered with sugar or honey (really don't know where they got that sweet flavor from).
I wish they would specify the ingredients for people to make better choices.
Earlier on I  have tried their chicken basil dumplings- the dumpling skin was too thick n chewy.
Sesame pancakes are too oily.
Miso soup is extra salty with a few shredded pieces of floating tofu  and maybe three strands of seaweed.
If I go there again during lunch time (due to convenience) joke is on me not them.

This has got to be the WORST soup I have ever tasted! I thought I ordered vegetable wonton soup but turns out I got veggie wontons boiled in dirty toilet water. I'm surprised I even had the stomach to taste this soup after the way it looked and smelled. And how does any restaurant mess up wonton soup?!?! I will never come back to this place again! Stay far far away!!!!!! You guys should give me a refund!

Why did anyone not tell me that there is a Vanessa's Dumplings in Fidi?  It is located inside the City Acres Market on Pearl Street but the address is 70 Pine Street.  I want to thank Mealpal for helping me discover this because I went to pick up my mealpal pizza at the City Acres Market and this was next to Artichoke's Pizza.  For $9.99, you can get an order of dumplings, a soup and a side!  I got Hot & Sour Soup, Chicken Dumplings (Fried) and a side of spicy marinated cucumbers.  Lots of mushrooms and flavor in the hot & sour soup.  Maybe I should have gotten boiled dumplings to save calories but I would workout an hour for these dumplings!  The cucumbers are a nice accompaniment to the hot soup and dumplings.  The vinegar on the side is a must!

Unfortunately we hit this spot instead of the banging pizza joint next to it our first night in the city. We got 4 types of dumplings and they were all equally foul. Honestly I've had better frozen microwaveable ones from the grocery store. They were soggy and wound up uneaten they were so bad.

I'm a big fan of Vanessa's Dumpling House and have been trying various locations across the city (most notably the 14th street location and Williamsburg). My favorite dishes include the boiled chive and pork dumplings or the sesame pancake.

The reason I love Vanessa's is for that classic dumpling house feel, yummy food, slightly divey, quick service and cheap prices.

While the location in City Acres is convenient for those working downtown and still has that fast service and yummy food, it doesn't have the old-school New York City dumpling house vibe.

Of course the prices have increased quite a bit as well, while they are still cheap I have to say I was a bit disappointed about how expensive it got for the same exact food. Maybe I miss the 14th street location, but I would certainly prefer to dine at a different Vanessa's location in the future.

So amazing! This spot is inside City Acres Market so if you're looking for dumplings, make sure you walk inside the market to the back area. There, you'll clearly see a big red sign for Vanessa's Dumpling.

I love the lunch special here where I get veggie dumplings, miso soup, and a side of spicy cucumbers. For the special, you can get either dumplings of pancakes, and choose between two soups, and choose a side dish. I've yet to try the pancakes because I love the dumplings here!

Although the dumpling skin is a bit on the thicker side, they do not skimp on the filling and the ratio is just so good. Whenever I go in for lunch, they usually have around 2-3 people on line and the wait for the food is less than 10 minutes.

I love coming here for a filling lunch, checking out the market while I'm here, and sitting at one of the tables at the market to enjoy my meal.

This is a limited review as I was in and out, and ordered through meal pal for lunch. It came with miso soup and chicken dumplings.

I really wasn't too impressed with either item. The soup was as basic a miso soup Can get. Nice flavor so checks the box. The dumplings were a little disappointing. They had a purple hue to them, which I thought was odd but kinda cool. The filler was tasty enough. The thickness was a bit much hence I wasn't raving or really enjoying them that much. It was a totally average meal, and I guess I had heard such rave reviews from coworkers I expected a bit more.

Will I eat there again? Sure. Will I be overly excited(as lunch time tends to make me)? No.

My daughter and I heard several reviews of Vanessa's Dumpling House and, being lovers of dumplings, wanted to try it out.  We first made a haul to the 14th street location to find out they were closed for renovations.  We then went to the Pine Street location.  The dumplings were just ok and the chicken soup we ordered didn't have much flavor.  It was nice to try but I don't know that I would reach out to eat it again.  I've had better.

Waited 25-minutes while order after order went out to customers; my wonton soup sat on top behind the register. I asked multiple times about my order and got no response and later "it's not ready". After the rush came through the door and another customer ordered and immediately got their meal I asked for a refund.

I can not recommend this place.

Vanessa's dumplings are great. But not at this location.
It's hidden in a market and I guess they don't have much business because the dumplings are just sitting there lukewarm and stale. At the vanessa in the east village they're cranking them out so fast they're always pillowy soft and warm. Avoid this location. Save your cash.
Was literally served RAW pork dumplings - I only realized after I had already eaten 4 .. so pray for me. AVOID THIS PLACE

This place is delicious. My tummy and mouth are so happy from all the delicious dumplings and other delicious Chinese entrees. Authentic, great spices and seasonings.  Every time I'm in town for work and walk past it I have to go in and get my dumplings. Can't go wrong
The owner is very polite and nice. Great customer service and clean restaurant. I have dined in and ordered to go. Both are fun. But, I especially enjoy ordering take out to enjoy those delicious dumplings whenever I crave.

Mmm. Day dreaming about this place today brings me some happiness. I used to live above battery park and meet up with my ex girlfriend after soul cycle, as an excuse to grab on some of Vanessa's delicious dumplings. The pork+chives then the shrimp+chicken are my favorite. I found myself in fidi a week ago after a game of basketball and had to stop through to refresh my taste buds. Damn was it worth it, left with both.  On a rainy day like today feeling like grabbing some of that miso too

Always reliable! I've ordered delivery tons of times and never disappointed. Flavorful vegetable dumplings, noodle soup, and it leaves you feeling satisfied. The spices are just right and the sauces they provide are signature to Vanessa's. This is a unique gem - been to their Brooklyn location and now fidi.
They use different skin for their dumplings here. Don't come for dinner, might be better for rush hour lunch

This is the only place in Financial District to get dumplings. Also, it is very expensive. You won't be full on just one order. It is almost $1 per dumpling and each order is 6.    it's not the best but satisfied your dumpling craving.

Really wanted some dumplings for lunch today and this spot came up in my google search. It's inside of City Acres Market in FiDi. I had the pork sesame pancake sandwich and pork dumpling soup. I walked there in the cold several blocks.  I probably won't do that again. Yeah not ever. At least I grabbed a cupcake while there that was yummy.  I really wanted to like this newly discovered eatery. I suppose the food wasn't bad just not what I was hoping for.   #underwhelmed

Every time I come to pick up dinner, most items on the menu are not available and they just offer leftovers that have been sitting next to the buffet food section... Duck pancake, which is my favorite item on the menu, is rarely available even for lunch... and when it is, most of the times they put in it mostly duck leftovers like skin and fat with no meat, not cool. Not coming back anymore.

This is probably the best dumpling spot in the tribeca/city hall area, i've been trying to find authentic dumplings at a good price and this is the place! I went here with couple of friends and we ordered dumplings, soups, and pancakes, they were all rich in flavor and made me crave for more right when we left. everything was at an affordable and good price. definitely recommend going here if you are craving dumplings! best dumplings in the city for sure!
Fresh and delicious handmade dumpling, especially the pan fried pork dumplings and the beef sesame pancake sandwiches.

Ordered veggie dumplings in hot oil to go on rainy gross evening. They were backed up and ended up waiting over 20 minutes. Should have left and cancelled order but by then was very committed to dumpling. Got home and couldn't wait to devour them. The first two were perfect, the next one was shrimp. Not what I ordered and as vegetarian, the worst kind of surprise. Of course I had take a huge bit. Ending up feeling gross and gaggy all evening. Couldn't get the taste/smell out of my head. Threw of the rest. So paid $9 for 2 dumplings and went to bed starving. Yeah, not ordering from here again. Never had issues with their other locations but there is always something off with their stuff at this place.
Bessssstttt dumplings in the game!! Not a fan of their stuffed pancakes cause they were very oily but dumplings are the best.
Food was awesome and each dish had it's own flavor, my good place for Chinese take-out .Will definitely come back again !!

The Spicy sauce is the best in town and I always take the cucumber and kimchi salad. The price is definitely acceptable considering you are in downtown Manhattan(of course) Just grabbing one order and eating by the window seeing plp walking by is a highlight of my lunch break.

I usually get the beef noodle soup, but today I got the chicken sandwich through meal pal. It was a good portion and was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend this place for seamless if you work nearby.

Yay

Solid food for high price point.

This food was pretty good, but not the price point. Though it is in Tribeca, so it makes sense for the pricing. The banh mi had flavorful pork inside, but the sauce was the authentic sauce. They had cilantro mayo instead, which changed the taste of a traditional one. The noodle bowl was also very flavorful and the taste was close to the traditional, but the price was too high compared to other restaurants in Manhattan with this dish.

Service was fast and waiter was nice with replacing water.

There was a lunch crowd, so it was loud and lively.

Cute neighborhood spot with a friendly waitstaff. It's just unfortunate that the food is mediocre. I ordered their signature beef pho in which the noodles and the beef were both overcooked. We also had some flavorless summer rolls and a side of fries that were about as average as fries can get. Prices are also what you'd expect for Tribeca - i.e., more expensive than anywhere else.

average food, expensive prices, friendly service

I got the grilled chicken rice noodle bowl, hand cut french fries, and the vietnamese iced coffee as takeout. The food was not the best. The chicken was good, but everything else was average. The fries were soggy but that could be cause i got take out and the way it was package.

The prices here are crazy - over $10 for spring/summer rolls...that's too much. But, it's tribeca and everything else in this area is insane.

the service was friendly. i guess this could be a good sit in lunch spot, but seriously, you could get much better vietnamese food at a much better price somewhere else.

I get it. It's par for the area but still prices seem high for the quality of Vietnamese food you get which isn't great.
Guess it's sort of a good bet if you don't feel up to going to Baxter Street in Chinatown and getting better tasting Vietnamese and more bang for your buck.
Review is for food only.
Place might be ok if you are into knocking off some drinks and having a bite as the Vietnamese Restaurants on Baxter dont have a bar scene going on.

Had dinner here with a few friends after drinks nearby.
Service was quick and helpful, food was decent, we all had different things, rice, noodles etc.
Cozy Vietnamese restaurant in Tribeca. There are a lot of food options here and service is fast. Food is ok but nothing extraordinary. Good spot for lunch in the neighborhood.

Value: 2
Taste: 2
Service: 3
Venue: 4

The only reason anyone would come here is because there is no other pho / Vietnamese restaurant in the area. The place is decently large so it's good for a group (such as lunch with coworkers) otherwise there is no reason to come here. Chinatown is around 20 more mins of walking from here.

The pho were disappointingly lackluster, either too salty or just too bland. Although the coconut noodle soup was slightly better than the others. I would give a 2 for their pho and 3 for the coconut noodle soup.

Disclaimer - This review is for pre-covid.

Came here for lunch. The restaurant is very nice, service is good and the food isn't bad. Only slight draw back is the price. It is on the high side for lunch and of your typical Viet dishes. If you do come in the pork chop bowl is good. The pork had traditional flavor of the fish marinate and the good grill taste.

I ordered from Caviar and the drink arrived like this. I called the restaurant and spoke with Ruby and she said that I need to go though Caviar and refused to resend a new iced coffee. This isn't how you pack iced coffee. I waited way too long for this order to arrive to be told to file a complaint with caviar (no ones answering their phones ) who will then communicate to the restaurant to send a new iced coffee.

Also the vegetable pho doesn't come with noodles. I was told you need to "add noodles." Is this place even a Vietnamese restaurant?

This is a great spot in TriBeCa for some delicious Vietnamese food. I've come here multiple times but this time around on a chilly autumn afternoon, I decided to go with the Dumpling and Roast Pork Soup. I thought it was pretty decent, wasn't the best bowl of soup in all of Manhattan, however. The dumplings were a little overcooked, but I enjoyed the pork and the broth of the soup. Service was also quite slow when I was here that day which I was disappointed in.

My coworkers and I came in for lunch and we were seated on a Friday afternoon right away without a reservation.

I got the classic beef pho with bean sprouts and it was very good. It was a cold day and the soup was perfect. The broth was flavorful and the beef perfectly thin and tasty. The food all came out very quickly.

Great lunch spot if you're looking for Vietnamese food!
