Great "healthy" Vietnamese option in Tribeca.  Not really comparable to Vietnamese food in China Town as far as Pho variety, etc.  BUT!!!! Cleaner ingredients than what you would get in China Town restaurants.  (This place uses organic vegetables, etc.)
I have coworkers who prefer clean eating and I have friends who are vegetarian.

(I've lived in Flushing and also frequent Manhattan ChinaTown and have been to Vietnam.. that being said, understand this is not where you would go for nitty gritty authentic Viet food. Closest option is the hole in the wall spot on Nassau Street that was called Nikki's for years but has since changed names twice.)

I usually get soup or noodle bowl for lunch.  Most of my coworkers go for the Pho for lunch.  I've mostly dined-in.  I've also been a couple times for dinner with a couple vegetarian friends.

I work walking distance from here in Tribeca and this Asian lunch option is must appreciated!
Prices aren't good enough to eat here more than once a week for lunch, but better than a lot of Asian Tribeca spots.

They do get very busy for lunch, so not a good idea for a tight lunch break.

$16 for vegetable soup with no noodles and $11 for simple summer roll. The place is way overpriced. The vegetable soup is flavorful but too salty, making me thirsty the entire afternoon. Summer roll is good!

I stopped in for a quick lunch. I ordered the house sandwich and a hot tea. The bartender recognized I had a cold and added some fresh ginger to my teapot. Too kind!! The sandwich was served with a baguette that was fresh, moist, warm and fantastic! The veggies were colorful and crisp, the pork was tender and the oils were tasty. The sandwich was served with a side of shrimp chips which didn't have much flavor. The service was fast, the establishment clean and the staff was very polite.

TLDR: friendly staff but slow service; appetizers were great but pho was very average

Came here on a Friday night around 8:30pm. The restaurant was pretty empty, with maybe two or three other parties, so we were seated immediately.

There were quite a few appetizers that sounded really good. Since we were unable to choose just one, we decided to order both the chili calamari and ha noi "pillow" dumplings. For my main course, I went with the pho bo hanoi soup.

The appetizer portions were pretty generous and the food was served hot. The chili calamari was both sweet and spicy (a unique twist on the typical calamari served as an appetizer) with mixed vegetables. The ha noi "pillow" dumplings were crispy and served with shredded carrots, mint, lettuce, and tangy chili sauce.

When our main courses came out, I was already pretty full. The pho was also pretty large and the waiter brought hoisin and sriracha sauce for us to add. Although I was pleasantly surprised by the appetizers, the pho was pretty bland and a bit disappointing. While adding the hoisin sauce helped, it lacked the full beef broth flavor of other pho I've had in the city.

Despite the fact that the place was pretty empty, it took a while to flag down the waiter to pay. Overall, would pass on VCafe if you're craving pho, but it is perhaps worth a try for its appetizers and other entrees.

Not a bad spot but definitely doesn't come close to the Viet restaurants in Chinatown in both price and taste. Considering it's one of the few Viet restaurants in the area, it's not bad. Popular spot for lunch and plenty of seating. We ordered the pho beef noodle and bahn mi. They mixed up our pork bahn mi and gave us vegetarian instead. We decided to just try the vegetarian. It's good with nicely toasted baguette and fresh ingredients. But I still prefer pork (would have been nice if we actually got it)! The noodle soup was just okay...the broth isn't too flavorful and there was a lot of cloves used in the broth. Overall, it's a quick substitute but I still prefer my down and dirty Chinatown spots.

It's Vietnamese food in Tribeca, there are no surprises here.

I ordered the roast pork and dumpling soup. The soup is $10, which is steep, but it's a massive portion with tons of noodles, probably lunch for a person with a normal appetite. I had just wanted a regular sized soup, which isn't offered on the menu. The roast pork is cooked well, and the dumplings are good, although they taste like they're filled with chicken? I dumped a lot of hot sauce in the entire thing to make it taste like anything other than unseasoned clear broth.

The sauteed jumbo shrimp small entree is indeed small ($17). While it comes with rice I wouldn't really call this an entree. The shrimp are cooked well.

Their website menu is completely out of date. Neither the seafood soup or the shrimp crepes are offered anymore. Definitely check out Seamless for the most updated items.

Great authentic view food. I got the charred beef with fried rice.
Good stuff.
It's worth a try if your in the area

I ordered their pho hanoi beef soup to-go delivery  not good or what I expected. First of all the noodles where mixed together with broth. True authentic Vietnamese restaurant that takes pride in what they do they would do things right. Because i have ordered to go from a lot different Vietnamese restaurant they ALWAYS put noodles separate from broth so that noodles don't arrive soggy. This was first indicator that something was wrong. Broth was not flavorful neither.

Their grilled beef over brown rice dish also not flavorful. The beef was tough and not marinated , lacked flavor. I will not be ordering delivery from this place nor will I dine in

Good place to go to grab lunch or takeout. I love coming here when the weather is chilly for a nice bowl of pho. Pricey but hey, this is TriBeCa and the hot broth does the trick. I always go for the beef pho with lots of broth flavor and rice noodles. Other dishes are also great: sausage fried rice and other rice or noodle bowls. I love their spring rolls! They have a spring roll noodle bowl and it is amazing. Ordering the spring roll separately as an app is too expensive in my opinion!

The food is fairly good. Prices are high- no lunch specials. And today I am writing about how they packed my leftovers. I didn't finish my lunch and asked for it packed.  No problem. I take my packed good and 4 blocks later it's leaking through the paper bag and plastic bag. Turns out they packed my leftovers in too small of a container it was literally busting out of the tiny pint container. I had over half my noodle soup left from lunch, and they felt the best course was to essential give me dry noodle leftovers. There is no soup in my soup noodles anymore. Why does one get a  noodles with soup is not for the broth?

Did not like the service .
The food was not good . We might have ordered wrong . But the food was barely decent.
Just an excellent banh mi. Really big and fairly priced. There's not much to say other than they nail a classic spicy banh mi.

VCafe might be the next casualty in the restaurant and retail landscape of the neighborhood, along the lines of the demise of Harrison, Ivy Bistro and Trattoria Cinque, to name a few.  However, one can only hope that business is brisk enough to cover the cost of the grand space that VCafe occupies on Greenwich Street.

The space is lofty, and the menu is extensive.  And the place is never crowded ... or even fully occupied.  The crispy spring rolls, stuffed with mung beans and tofu among other ingredients, is a great way to kick off your meal.   And the chili tofu is sure to please on a cold, wintry evening.  The salads and sides, including the hand-cut fries, are average at best.

VCafe is a worthy occupant that one hopes continues to exist.  If you are in the neighborhood, give them a try--highly recommended for a casual, reasonably-priced meal.
Some of the best mien ga in the city. Consistently on point, solid delivery time, and always nice and accomodating, I'm very happy to have VCafe nearby for great Vietnamese food.

Love VCafe!  Love, love so many of their appetizers, hard to choose. The chili calamari, pillow dumplings, and vegetarian "crab cakes" are my favorites. For the main, I always order the coconut noodle soup with shrimp. The taste is simply refreshing, large, fresh shrimp, delicious!

This is my favorite lunch spot! I usually get delivery to my office. Beef fried rice is nothing like you've ever had before. If you're looking for something cool and refreshing, I recommend the grilled chicken noodle bowl. Their hot sauce is literally the BEST hot sauce I've ever had. Think... Sriracha with crack LOL

I think price is reasonable and portion is more than enough!

Pork Sandwich was tasty and very well sized. The lettuce wrapped shrimp summer rolls had good flavor but were very difficult to eat after the initial bite (cucumber strip just doesn't hold everything together as well as rice paper would).
I'd come back for the sandwich but skip the lettuce wraps next time.

It's been a while since I've been so underwhelmed & aggravated that a spot warranted a 1 star review. My $9 shrimp lettuce roll dish took over 25 minutes to arrive. Probably because the waiter was bullshitting with the other waiters and manager at the pass rather than bringing the food to the table. Have you ever seen three waiters and the manager all standing around on their phones in the middle of lunch service before? Well, that's what goes on here.

I won't rage too much against the ridiculous prices because it's to be expected in Tribeca. But these humongous shrimp lettuce wraps came out and I was seriously puzzled on how to attack them. They are enormous, but structurally flawed. Only one flimsy lettuce leaf encased an egg-roll sized portion of noodle, carrot and shrimp filling inside. This leaf is wrapped around the mass of filling fruit-roll-up-style; meaning the ends are left open for everything to fall out. And only another flimsy piece of cucumber is wrapped around the middle to keep it all together, secured by a toothpick. Don't take out this toothpick or your food will fall apart in a mess. It's too big to dip into the accompanying sauce so that needs to be scooped out with your chopsticks and sort of smeared onto this faulty lettuce-roll-up. When I say "shrimp" I do mean singular shrimp. This HUGE roll consisted of exactly ONE shrimp sliced into paper thin portions to stick out on both ends. The middle was only noodle and veggies.

When it was past the 35 minute mark and my pho still hadn't arrived, I looked up to see my waiter suddenly realize I was the ONLY ONE left in the restaurant (because the rest of the lunch crowd had finished and left) and he signaled for them to START MAKING THE SOUP. He came around to clear the table next to me, and that's the only time I had a chance to tell to bring my check. I was done.

I've had bad service in my restaurant history, but the clear disinterest by the entire waitstaff and management here is staggeringly off-putting. To be fair, I paid for my drink, shrimp roll, and even that wayward soup that they insisted on bringing out in a To Go bag with my check. I could have raised a fuss about it and made them take it off my bill, but I had enough and was ready to get out of there.

There are LOTS of restaurants on this block. SKIP VCafe and head to Chinatown if you really want to get your Vietnamese fix. Better food, service and prices will be found elsewhere.

Eating my Shrimp Salad was the most interesting experience. It started out terribly bland; with every forkful I was pondering why in the world I'd paid $20 (added bokchoy and tofu) for this very small and tasteless meal. But then about 1/3 through the flavor suddenly ramped up and I literally gaped down into my bowl for a good thirty seconds trying to figure out what had changed. Whatever secret ingredient it contained wasn't making itself known to me, so I started eating again with renewed vigor. And then about 2/3 through IT GOT EVEN BETTER. It was like a flavor packet had exploded in my mouth! The remaining mixture of various veggies and tofu looked humble indeed, but it did not taste that way at all, and I finished the rest of the bowl in utter amazement and vowed to come back.

Ok but seriously - the shrimp salad looks very, very ordinary when you first get it, actually like something you could toss together yourself with a couple of carrots and whatnot, but the incredible combination of sauces helps make it really delicious. It's also deceptively small! By the end I was immensely full, but something else I loved about this salad was, as obvious as it sounds, how healthy and natural it was, so I didn't feel weighted down at all despite all the food. That sentence probably has entirely too many clauses. A star off only because it's exorbitantly expensive compared to other Viet places, even though I know it's reasonable in Tribeca terms, but will definitely be back in the future, even if just to eat the shrimp salad again.

I soooo wanted to like this place; the neighborhood needs more Thai, Vietnamese, etc. But I didn't like it. The waiter hurriedly took our order and of course got it wrong. (Summer rolls.  Spring rolls. Whatever.) We finally got our crispy vegetarian spring rolls and they weren't good.  How do you mess up fried spring rolls? Well, let's start with a lackluster dipping sauce, which is what makes a spring roll. And the veggies were bland.

Now onto the entrees. The coconut soup? Come on fellow Yelpers! If you like this version, you need to get out more. It was flavorless. The shrimp noodle bowl was boring. The shrimp lacked any flavor and was over grilled. The rest was just plain noodles and some raw veggies.

Let's review what we have so far: bland food. Shall we move on to service? (See above about spring roll.). Water glasses went empty, server was rarely seen and our dishes were never cleared.

Other than all that, it was great.

Very disappointed with the dinner I had here. Service was friendly but harried and distracted. Got my appetizer wrong first time around. Took a while to correct it. Finally got the veggie summer rolls and blah. Bland and dry and crumbly. My main course was the coconut noodle soup with chicken. Yuck. Broth was thin and had an odd tanginess to it. Chicken was nondescript. The noodles stuck together in a huge clump. It was not good. My woman had a similarly disappointing experience with her food.

So I didn't like it here very much. But to be honest, I'm not upset with the restaurant. It's you Yelpers who disappoint me. WTF is with all the great reviews?  You people need to get out more. Or stop eating at PF Chang's or wherever the hell it is you ate in your little town before you moved to the big city. You mislead me and it pisses me off. You all owe me a beer. Now.

Came here for a business meeting at the end of the lunch rush. The service was quick and friendly. I had the Vietnamese steak frites. The beef was tender. It is kind of a stir fry style versus traditional steak frites but the sauce is flavorful and the fries are nice. I'd like to go back and try more dishes.

The VCafe is one of my favourite restaurants in NYC. The food is delicious, the atmosphere is lovely (not noisy like so many N.Y. restaurants!), and the staff are friendly. My favourite appetiser is the vegetarian crab cakes - yum! But we also like their spring rolls and dumplings. My favourite main dish is the spicy coconut soup with shrimp. It's absolutely fresh and delicious with a good portion of shrimp. My niece loves to come here and always orders the grilled chicken noodle bowl, which comes with a nice portion of julienned carrots and cucumbers and sprouts in addition to the chicken and noodles. Next time you're hankering for Asian food, put V Cafe at the top of your list.
Omg the duck. I just came for dinner rather than take out. Amazing drinks, staff and duck!

A restaurant I would never have heard of if it wasn't for Seamless Web.  What is special about them?  They are the only place in my delivery area that will bring me pho.  I am so thankful that I can have pho brought to my door whenever the whim strikes me.  Their pho is not especially great, but I find that to be pretty consistent around Manhattan.  True pho heads go to Eden Center down in Virginia, but that can be a bit much for a weeknight meal on a cold night.  But as far as New York standards go, I find the pho at Viet Cafe to be decent.  I enjoyed the broth, and found the beef to be plentiful.  I additionally added shrimp which were larger and more numerous than I was expecting.  For the delivery, they even gave me a small cup of Sriracha -- very nice.  Great takeout, but pricier than the Chinatown equivalent by about double.  Take heed.

3.5 stars

there is just nothing better than getting fast delivery of pretty decent food via Seamless Web.  So, continuing our trend of trying new places out in the Downtown area, we decided to try Viet Cafe.  I opted for the curry shrimp.  I swear I could smell that curry before it arrived at our door.  So flavorful and served with just the right amount of rice.  Pretty quality food and the price is definitely reasonable.  I plan to make this a regular delivery spot.  Hidden gem.  Recommend!

DON'T GO HERE IF YOU HAVE SERIOUS ALLERGIES AND/OR HAVE RELIGIOUS OR OTHER SERIOUS DIETARY MORALS OR PREFERENCES.

We both order the seared lemongrass tofu entree from the vegetarian section of the menu and clearly state that we are VEGAN and cannot have any dairy (lactose intolerant) and eggs.  The waiter writes it all over the ticket and assures us that he understands.  When I eat some of the tofu, I can tell that something is off and first think it's cheese.  I ask the waiter and he says it's butter.  I say WTF?  He says he told the kitchen and wrote it on the ticket but they must have made a mistake.  The chef comes out and says she tried her best but it was the line cooks. Again, wtf?  People with serious allergies could die.  

I ask to speak to a manager or the owner, but they say none are here.

When I get the bill, only the tofu has been taken off.  I say, you must do something better than this. The chef comes out again and this time says we are not a vegan restaurant and that she "tried her best" and that she asked for our forgiveness earlier.  Not even going to try to explain here what is wrong here, but after landing in the hospital after restaurants "did their best" by putting nuts in my food after being warned I have a serious allergy, I am so done with this attitude.  We left our number on the check for the owner to call, but refused to pay any of the bill.  This will make the owner take this problem seriously and train the staff better so that other patrons will not suffer from physical and/or emotional trauma.  We also explained that the amount of money we could sue them for their errors was far greater than the discount we were expecting.
Have been having work lunches here for years. Always fresh veggies in the soups, sandwiches and apps. Very quick service and deelish.

The food is excellent & the service is outstanding. Love the chili calamari & Hanoi pillow dumplings. Noodle bowls & soups are delicious.  Shrimp, chicken, duck & beef entres all good.It is a great place to chill out have a conversation.

All of the many places I tried in New York, Viet Café is probably one of my favorites.  Because I had just gotten an internship offer that day, I decided to celebrate with a more expensive lunch, at my desk as usual, of course.  So I ordered off of Seamless Web, and made specific note that I will be picking up and to call me when the food was ready.

Perhaps, that is the only part I was dissatisfied with.  After an hour (I was busy anyway, so I actually somewhat forgot about the order), I had not yet received a call, so finally decided to call them.  Turns out that my order had been ready half an hour ago; they simply neglected to call me.

I ordered the steamed shrimp crepe (with mint, pickled carrots, sliced cucumbers, and lime-garlic sauce).  It was delectable--a perfect way to celebrate.  When I first ordered, I thought the shrimp and veggies would actually be wrapped inside, somewhat like an egg roll, but it turns out that the dish was actually in a bowl with the rice crepe on one side and the veggies and shrimp on the other.  But that made the dish taste even better, as I could choose the poportions of carbs and sides that I wanted to stuff in my mouth with each bite.  

I found the carrots to be perfectly seasoned with just the right about of lime, and the sliced cucumbers were fresh and crispy.  There was some kind of chewy texture to the noodles: they were layered and cut up in little squares, so each bite was fun.  So it was a mix between the chewiness of pasta and the Asian-ness of rice noodles.  Add to that the right amount of sourness and a tinge of garlic.  I loved it.  Even if they didn't call me, I still give it a five.

Perhaps I was just really hungry or in need of a real restaurant rather than homecooking or delivery, but Viet Cafe impressed me to the point where I really need to go back again. The service was outstanding with patient and quick wait staff who managed to hustle without the rude bustle.

The semi-trendy decor might suggest high prices, but it was consistent with most other Viet places which was a surprise given its location.  I wouldn't however, expect super cheap prices like in most Chinatowns, but still cheaper than the severely overpriced options nearby.   Above all, the food was stellar and easily the best part of the evening.  

The appetizers (spring rolls, rice crepes) were incredible and the Bun Bo Hue was extra fresh that night.  Definitely recommended for the Viet cuisine seekers and a true Tribeca delight.

Went for lunch during work with a large group.  Food was very good, we all got one of the many noodle bowls to choose from and everyone really enjoyed it.  I had the dumpling and pork soup noodle bowl and it was great.  I don't know vietnamese food well enough to know how authentic this is, but regardless it is a great place for noodles.

Staff were polite enough but pretty absent during our lunch, could be a bit more attentive.  We sat in the back room which is really nice with a large skylight and old exposed walls.  Really gave an authentic feel, though they should get rid of the make shift office they have right in the middle of the room, kills the look a bit.  

While there are some kinks here and there the food is great and we will definitely be back.

Stopped by for dinner one Thursday, while we were in the area. Nice atmosphere and it seemed quite hopping, usually a good sign. I also liked the open kitchen you can peek into as you're walking to the bathrooms in the back.

The food, however, was a bit of a miss. I ordered the shrimp noodle bowl, and found it meh. I guess I wasn't expecting it to be served cold, so it came as a surprise (perhaps it should be stated it's a cold dish on the menu). The shrimp was decently cooked and flavored, though. On the other hand, the lemongrass curry we ordered was quite tasty and a good portion size. I ended up gravitating towards that more than my noodle bowl.

We also ordered the grapefruit cocktail that was an abomination. We really should've sent it back, but our waiter was nowhere to be found. Not the type of service I'd expect in the TriBeCa area and for the prices being paid. It wasn't busy enough to warrant scanty service.

Will I be returning? That's a tough call. With so many other choices in the area, I'll have to think twice about that.

I was in the mood for Vietnamese one day at work and Viet Cafe was the only option available at the time through seamless.  I ordered their Beef Pho and shrimp summer rolls.  The Pho really hit the spot and tasted how you would expect it to.  I wasn't blown away by it, but it was good.  I expected the summer rolls to be the same as the traditional shrimp spring rolls, but these turned out to be even better!  The summer rolls are wrapped in lettuce and cucumber and they are amazing.  Since then, I've been back to order several times, branching out to their chicken noodle dish, of which I've also become a fan.

The only reason I'm docking off a star is because their prices are pretty steep for Vietnamese staple dishes.  Two shrimp summer rolls are $9, the Pho is $13, and the chicken noodle bowl is $11.  Pho is usually $6 from what I'm used to, but if you're really craving Vietnamese like I was, you'll spend the extra dollars.

This was JUST what we needed. After an awesome tour of the Woolworth building we were walking up Greenwich looking for somewhere to eat. VCafe stuck out for us as something potentially light and fresh and tasty, and it did not disappoint.

We both had Vietnamese iced coffees, which were perfect for this gorgeous spring day, like the best caffeinated chocolate milk.

Then I had the noodle bowl with spring rolls--SO GOOD, fresh and clean flavors, just the right amount of funk, I gobbled up every last bite. My boyfriend had the grilled pork noodle bowl which was a yummy combo of sweetly seasoned pork, yummy noodles, and fresh veggies, along with that delightful fishy sauce. He ate every bite, too.

We agreed, couldn't have been happier with our choice of places to eat.

This is a great place for casual lunches with office friends. The lunch prices are super reasonable. I usually order the grilled chicken rice bowl, which comes with daikon carrots, cucumbers, cilantro, mint, and fish sauce on the side. The portions are generous, and you will leave full, even without an appetizer or dessert.

They have a full bar, but I've never had any alcohol here so I can't really speak to it. Service is good though I frequently have to flag someone for a refill on my drinks/water. The food, however, is good enough to sway this review to 4 stars.

Stopped in for lunch.      Spring rolls were amazing!    We had a shrimp curry coconut soup and a beef pho soup.  

Excellent!

Mediocre service and less than mediocre food. Tiny shrimps sliced in half to appear more. Twice as expensive as normal Viet food. Ok fine location is more expensive. But boy the food was just lame. And for the mediocre service they tack on 20% not 18%. We had 9 ppl. For my dish it had choice of rice or noodle they didn't ask and assumed o want noodle. Nice decor though.
Sadly, there is no longer a Vietnamese food cart at this location. By the looks of the spot and the date on the last review, I'd guess to say it has been a little while since it was last present.

This place is a lil trailer with 3 people inside. 1 taking orders, 2 making the sandwiches.  Each sandwich is $6, and it does take anywhere from 15-30 minutes to get ur sandwich, but there is always a line and its definitely worth it.  The Baguette is flakey and soft, and the fillings are just great.  Too be fair, i've never had viet sandys before, but this place is def good food regardless.

$6 FOR A BANH MI?
                       YES, IT'S TRUE.

Actually, the tuna one costs $7. Ranking as #2 in highest pricing right below Ma Peche (many of you know I boycotted DC). Always on my A-Game w/ food, I have yet another FTR under my belt for my loyal Yelp fans! No frills, unfinished walls, bare bones fixtures, faux grape vines. They don't even have a name for the place yet. The banh mi explosion has officially arrived in FiDi, with the previous failed attempt of a Banh Mi cart, the recent addition of Baoguette on 9 Maiden Ln and now this place. Albeit the amazing bread which is a perfect balance of chewy/crunchy (guessing they also buy theirs from Paris Bakery), amongst its other downfalls, the pate was not evident on my palate. There was also skimpage on the cilantro. 15 minute wait times are a Debbie Downer.  My coworker said they speak Fujianese there as that is his dialect. The lady at the counter has this smirk on her face as if she is looking through you, saying 'Sucker, I'm laughing all the way to the bank!'. Hey as a consolation, at least you can grab a free can of soda on your way out and they don't charge tax. I'll stick w/ Saigon on Mott, TYVM. Killer margins are nice, but serving a a higher quality, faster product is nicer.

Note to self: premature ejaculation will get you nowheres fast, mang.

Ordered:
-#1 Chicken Banh Mi ($6) - diced chunks of mysteriously marinated chicken, a notch too salty, I had 1/2
-#7 Pork Roll and Pate ($6) - sweet finely diced red pieces of pork, too bad it tasted so ambiguous I couldn't discern between minced pork or minced rat, missing cilantro altogether on this one, I had 1/2

Total came out to $6/pp after everything

Food: i50.tinypic.com/29zs8q8.…
Actual Menu (1of2): i47.tinypic.com/2ur1i1e.…
Actual Menu (2of2): i48.tinypic.com/1zo7x8i.…
Takeout Menu: i48.tinypic.com/110am8m.…

I've had good Vietnamese sandwiches before. Very good. Granted, it was in San Francisco. A new place in downtown Manhattan was worth a try.
These had nothing to do with good Vietnamese sandwiches. These just weren't good sandwiches of any kind.

Horrible, cheap and very dry baguette. Meats indistinguishable from each other. Instead of delicious tender marinated carrots, the hallmark of Vietnamese sandwiches, these carrots were barely marinated, overly sweet and tough, large-chunked. Pork roll and pate sandwich had no pate whatsoever. No credit cards. Delivery took way, way too long - and it seems they didn't leave until we called again to ask about our order. They apologizing for being "too busy".

I don't think they deserve to be that busy. Don't spoil your impression here of what good Vietnamese sandwiches should really taste like.

Delicious popcorn chicken, I always get the salt & pepper. This item is a must try! Would need to try the garlic flavor next time! The 6 piece takoyaki was so delicious. Fresh and hot! Very affordable!

Cash has a few cent discount
Card accepted
Casual indoor seating

I would give it 3 stars for the boba and 5 stars for service. I ordered just a simple black tea with boba. The tea was good but the boba was a little mushy/soggy.

The service was great. I have to give props to the lady behind the counter that had to deal with my "high maintenance" group haha.

Taro milk tea (with boba, half sugar) was delicious. I'd like to try with less sugar since I prefer my drinks less sweet but this was very good. I really like that all of their milk teas are non-dairy.

I mean just look at the photo, there isnt even one scoop of salmon in this.

The portion is absolutely appalling, will not be coming here again.
The drink was a bit thicker than I'm used to but it was still delicious. It wasn't overly sweet like some teas. This wasn't the best Thai iced tea I've had but it certainly wasn't the worst.

If you're Dr. Watson, it's the ELEMENTARY-VI

But there is nothing average with the fruity drinks at VIVI!

WHAT!

This is a really lovely Vivi with super-friendly girls. They were willing to make any of the fruit teas with black tea for me which most bubble tea shops will not. I was super happy that they did that and I thoroughly enjoyed my fruit tea with black tea and Aloe.

They play Blackpink and BTS (well, 1 out of 2 isn't bad, Blackpink in your areaaaaah!) and they have cute customers and they seem to really like me, and the feeling is mutual!

Nice decor and definitely a five-star location of this chain which is usually far from five stars. Will definitely be back here and can't wait!

I don't care what anyone thinks
I f***ing love these Vivi drinks
To prove it, I'll get nude
Once my tea has been brewed
Cuz I know that is one of your kinks ;)
Prompt and courteous service - not fancy but nor is it pretending to be. Taro milk tea hits the spot,
I got a poke bowl, and the rice was extremely sour. I did not like and to throw away half of it away.

Please be careful of this place and the prices!!!
They charge you for something that is not on their menu... example Ramen 8.50
To add extra items it's stated clearly on the menu +$1 eel +$1 shrimp tempura so I asked for the ramen and the two extra items which will total up to $10.50 so tax is 8.875% ok so my meal would be about $11/12 bucks in change
When I asked about a custom item charge of $3.12 on my receipt. I was blasted Rudely y by the female worker and a male worker I'm not one for arguing I will ask questions especially when I'm paying my money so end of short I requested a refund.... And left please always ask questions bf you become victim of unseen charges and unexplained cost!! By the way their Ramen is fake....

I really love the bubble tea here! I worked nearby last summer and saw a sign out front for the lunch special so I came in and thought I'd try it out. It came with popcorn chicken (sprinkled with chili powder), rice, salad, and a bubble tea.

I went with milk tea (my fav!) and it was superb: the boba was soft and chewy and the tea itself was sweet and refreshing! The food itself was okay. The popcorn chicken was crunchy and spicy but a bit on the dry side, I feel like it could've used a sauce or something but it was still overall really good. The only thing I really didn't enjoy was the egg that came with the rice, it had a weird texture/flavor so I just tossed it to the side.

In all, I think I'd definitely come back. It's a nice place to grab bubble tea in the Chinatown/Tribeca area.

Right after finishing my lunch that I brought from home to eat at work today, I still felt hungry; but not super hungry. I thought maybe a snack would satisfy my stomach. So I decided to order delivery here on Grubhub.

I decided to get the garlic popcorn chicken and a medium Vivi milk tea with pudding. Delivery came super quick than estimated! ETA was between 25-35mins but it came within 10-15mins. Plus this location is pretty close to here I work lol. When I picked up my order, the popcorn chicken was still piping hot as my drink was perfectly made!

Definitely would order from here again when I ceave Vivi's during work! lol

I got this for my lunch today through meal pal and I was blown away. The meat was delicious and cooked very well. The broth and noodles were fine and the portion was great. I'll definitely be back. Thank you!!!

Working in that nearby area for so long, I was always hopeful that one day there would be a dedicated bubble tea establishment opened around there.

I was incredibly happy to find that this place opened from my colleague!

Early morning, around 11 am, we decided we would check the place out together. When we arrived, we were taken aback by how clean and tidy the place looked. After approaching the register, the cashier notified us of a promotion they were having where people could get a free drink upgrade if they check-into the place in social media (Yelp included).

I ordered my bubble tea, and probably received it about 10 minutes afterwards (which really surprised me given the very low number of people in the place when I ordered).

The bubble tea tasted really good! The machine they used to shake it did an amazing job of helping evenly distribute the coldness in the drink.

Later in the afternoon, we returned! This time, we wanted to try out their food menu. I ordered the pork dumplings. The texture of the pork dumplings was very 'gummy'. Also to note, the soy sauce did not stick well to the dumpling. The dumping innards tasted alright.

I would go back, but really only to have bubble tea.

Bubble tea is fine. Stick with the bubble tea. I was a sucker and ordered sushi and most soup.

The sushi was actually pretty good, but they serve it in a tiny little take out container, so there's no room for me to put the ginger and wasabi on the way I do. They do add those delicious little black seeds to the rolls that I love... that was good. But man, STAY AWAY FROM THE MISO SOUP! Tasted like hot water with mushroom... I could see the miso in there, but could hardly taste it. Also, it's served in a plastic take-out soup container. No big deal unless you know about the way plastic leaches into food when that food is hot (like miso soup).

Was walking around and came across a couple of Vivi's so my crew and I decided to try it out. Nearly everyone got a tea and thought it was okay. I got to the try the almond milk tea regular sweet. Also, got to try their spicy popcorn chicken, it has a good kick more so than your average spicy popcorn chicken. It's like at the flaming hot cheetos level.

It was kind of nice to try because we were seeing it everywhere as we walked around like tourist. Would I go back to again, I would say not by choice only because there is a lot of other things I would like to eat but still an okay place to grab a snack.

My hubby and I are fans of Vivi bubble tea and decided to drop in this location to get a beverage. Turns out this Vivi location sells everything! Popcorn chicken, Taiwanese sausage, pokebowls, sushi rolls, ramen, french fries. Just mind boggling. Hilarious but very convenient if you want some food with your drink. Ordered the peach pulp jade and peach oolong, two of our favorite drinks. Made fast and prompt. Love the customization of ice and sugar. $3.75 for this size is great when compared to other bubble tea joints. Also got my favorite item on the menu, popcorn chicken. So good. Freshly made, tender chicken, great flavor. Can't go wrong with this as a snack. I liked that they had a few tables there so we could enjoy our quick snack while our baby napped. Cute and convenient location.
.Excellent Lychee boba tea! Fast delivery too. I love this place. Also, I like that you can order without tons of sugar or ice added

I have been drinking milk tea from different places and I would say that the quality of the bubble Milk Tea isn't as good anymore. It was pricy too for milk tea.
Bubble Milk tea
$3.25. Then they charge .25cent. Then tax.
Which equal to $3.81!
(I felt that I could just go to a Chinese bakery or other drink place for a cheaper price)

I quickly ducked into this place to grab a Poke bowl and some bubble tea for the wife- she loves these two items more than she loves me sometimes lol.

The bubble tea is pretty standard and good. Unless it's super amazing, i generally give a 3/5 for your run of the mill bubble tea spot (your CoCos and what not).

The poke bowl was good, the fruit was fresh and ripe.  The fish itself was good but like my bubble tea rating scale, if it's not amazing, it's not getting more than a 3.  The other components of the Hawaiian poke bowl consisted of Kani salad, seaweed salad, etc.  It was good and i'd go back.  I've had better and worse at other spots so if there were a 3.5, thats what id give it.

Went for my first time today early in the morning when they opened at 9:30 AM. We had just finished our last final of the semester and unfortunately were meet by some poor customer service.

1. We walked in and it was a minute or two before 9:30. We saw an employee at the counter and the door was unlocked. We walked up to the counter and he let us know that they were not open yet, so we went back outside. It was completely our mistake for walking in too early, but it would have been nice for the employee to say something like "5 more minutes" or "feel free to have a seat, I'll be with you shortly". Instead we just stood outside and stared at him, waiting for a signal to let us know that he was ready. He did not wave to us so we just walked back inside after a minute and started to order. It was pretty bizarre.

2. They have a decent food menu for a boba shop. We went to order some popcorn chicken and he said, "We don't have any chicken." He didn't explain why, and there were no signs stating food was not served in the morning, so that was a bit confusing and a bummer since we were hungry.

3. There was a sign that said 30% off for students. My friend went before me and showed him her school ID for a discount and cashier entered it for her. Then, the cashier was switched out for another employee and I also let her know I was a student. She attempted to put in the discount code. There is a small screen that would show the total and I could see her multiple attempts to put in a discount. The total was over 50% off of my drink price and I told her I think that was a mistake, so she attempted to fix it again to take the correct amount off. After talking to the other employee and failing to get 30% off of my total, she then said "I'm sorry, we don't have a student discount". Mind you my friend just got her discount and there is a sign explaining that they do. Or the other employee could have easily typed it in for her.

BUT on the plus side, you can customize the sweetness level of your drink which is always a plus and the boba was fresh and well-cooked. The drinks were well-prepared and service was quick. They also have a few tables and outlets if you would like to study here. There are so many delicious boba places in the city, so customer service really comes into play when I'm deciding where I want to go, and unfortunately this day left a bad taste in my mouth.

Ordered delivery via Seamless, and the food came quite quickly - which is always a welcome! This place may be known for superb bubble tea, but the food was so incredibly lackluster, yawn-worthy, and uninspiring. I got seafood ramen and could don't have been more disappointed. 1) The egg was so hard-boiled it was grey, 2) the greens and carrots were a poor choice since both hold up really well to hot broth, so neither wilted/cooked and elevated the dish or melded into the ramen experience. The seafood: how do you cut up some imitation crab meat and throw into a bowl with some boiled shrimp. Do something, anything, to make this meal less sad and pathetic. Did I mention that I had to navigate my way though this dull ramen soup with just a plastic fork, since that's what I was provided rather than a spoon and chopsticks? Never getting food there again. Maybe just their bubble tea for me.
This bubble tea shop offers great pokebowls,Taiwanese sausages and popcorn chicken! Especially the lady there was super nice and sweet with great attitude！

I am so happy to see such a nice bubble tea place opened near my office. They provide many choices of cold or hot drinks and also nice food. It's a must-go place in this area! I cannot wait to go back again~

External Rude Staff. Got my order wrong and refused to correct it or apologize. Blamed the mistake on me and gave severe hostile attitude. Gross product. Will never go back. Ugh. There were a bunch of employees behind the small bar and they just stood around gossiping with eachother most of the time.
Walked out. No acknowledgement of customers. No customer service, cashiers were calling wrong customers, etc. Just a terrible experience not fit for New York.

terrible customer service. Rude and unhelpful. We got the wrong order and called to tell them hoping they would politely fix their mistake she demanded that she was right and would not fix her mistake. Even politeness would made a huge difference. Can't speak for all Vivi Bubble Teas but this one is a pass.

SOFT OPENING! buy one get one free for the five best sellers. This place doesn't have free boba which almost every location does... but because it's in a nice area they don't have a minimum for card . The chicken took a while to make but it was delicious! Would come back if I'm around

ViVi's is the standard bubble tea place in NYC, I think. It seems to be ubiquitous and has a good assortment of drinks. I think their drinks are all pretty standard in terms of consistency and decent balance of tea/sweetness. They have a good menu of nomming foods, so I tried the fries out of curiosity. It took a while for them to get the fries to me, and they were kind of bland. I've had good fries from another ViVi chain before, so I was kind of disappointed how plain they were. They were oversalted, and they didn't have much flavor. A little sad that there wasn't more to it! I kept thinking that I should have just gotten the crispy chicken because that's what Taiwanese PMT places are known for. Sads!

Yum!!! got the signature bowl - Federal Express. Edamame, cucumber, shrimp, avocado, mango, kani salad on sticky rice. $10.95!! Then I got green tea yakult w herb jelly (their drinks are obviously great as well). so delicious you gotta try it

I love Vivi Bubble tea, so I was happy to find that there was a location down here near chambers street. There is a good amount of seating and although the staff can be slow with food orders, they get the drinks just right.

I do however propose the team gets a bit more organized or an addition of one more staff as during lunch hours and other rush hours, they tend to scramble and have trouble keeping up. They are friendly otherwise and I just make sure I have enough extra time to wait when I order the basil popcorn chicken (my favorite snack!).

I love the bubble teas from here. It's right around the corner from my apartment so a frequent stop on my walk to work. You can choose the sweetness and flavors you want in your tea. The popcorn chicken is also AMAZING. It has quickly become a weekly meal for me.

Happened upon this cute little spot after a meeting across the street, the interior is positively adorable and so are the couple that we're working this morning (he walked in with some boxes and snapped a Polaroid of her, it was just too cute).

The drinks are priced about the same as everywhere else, and as usual I ordered Taro bubble tea (my go to when trying a new spot).

The bubble tea itself was smooth, a little on the sweet side but I liked it nonetheless. The tapioca was nice and fresh, not overly squishy and properly cooked through, the tea looked a bit over-brewed (it came out the dispenser looking pretty brown) but tasted good regardless.

The shop interior is very clean and the service was prompt. All in all a great spot, only reason it's not a full 5 stars is because I have actually had better, this place came very close though.

It is a cute place, but their bubble tea sucks! SUCKS. I ordered the taro bubble Tea and it was horrible. Tasted nothing like it . Probably other things in the menu might be good but their bubble tea sucks very bad.

Vivi is one of my favorites. Great bubble tea, fast service. Definitely a regular place I like to visit. Unfortunately, it has a layout issue. No one knows who's already ordered and who's waiting to order. Every time you walk in, it's a cluster of people standing and you have to figure out the end of the line.

I had the bubble tea and it was really good. I didn't like the popcorn chicken, much too salty and did not taste like chicken. The french were good but once again too salty. Nice place in general, defintely will go back for the teas and another snack on their menu.

I was seriously craving a poke bowl and came across this location. Now, most Vivi's sell food from a limited menu, but this is one had a larger menu. I saw that they had a lunch special for their "Hawaiian poke bowl". It came with a free iced tea (black or green). The amount of food was decent, although, I wish there was a tad more tuna and less rice. The flavor combo was decent, but the kani salad needed some kind (any kind) of seasoning. Food came out fairly quick. Would I buy poke bowls from Vivi' s again? Maybe, if they got their portions correct. I really wish that they sold chicken rice bowls instead (using the same popcorn chicken meat). The popcorn chicken is delicious and I would love it in a rice bowl, accompanied with a small serving of some kind of salad/or veggies and some sauce. And for those reviewers complaining about this location's pricing, it really isn't. Their pricing is on par with most places around city hall. People, rent is high, so give them a break.
I've been here several times for the bubble milk tea. The first time was good, but I lost excitement after a while. I found the yogurt-filled boba balls to be too sweet.

This is my second time here. The food is cheap but not that good. The service is very slow and the employees are un attentive. I ordered ahead of time because I knew that I had a short break I watched them work on over 5 people orders before they even started mine. Terrible service !!

Great snacks and great drinks. A great place for a small bite. The reason why I put 4 stars instead of 5 is because every time I come here the wait for my stuff is usually kind of longer than expected even when it's not busy. But other than that it is a great place!
Only had one visit but, would go again! Good prices, good bubble tea in in a clean, lively pink and white store front!
It's a great addition to the neighborhood. I'm extremely happy about my experience there. Greeted by super nice server and love the bubble tea there. Delicious fried chicken too!
Honestly this makes me want to come back and get more. The bubbles taste fresh, and given that the the tea contains a lactose free base, I can throw away my worries about being lactose intolerant.

I visited Vivi Bubble Tea for the first time on Friday with a friend.  I had some ramen and passionfruit bubble tea.  Both were great!  The service  was good and the employees were very friendly and the place itself was clean and very cutely decorated.  I can't wait to go back for more!
Great ambiance. Friendly service. Many different tasty bubble tea options. The chicken was delicious and different from anything I have tried before!
this place is new, pretty good and affordable drinks. The scene isn't bad since they hire a lot of cute chicks to make drinks and serve the food. I would come back
Very friendly employees and not a long wait for the drinks and food! definitely coming back with the summer coming up!

A hidden gem in FiDi.  I agree with the poster about their coconut iced coffee.  It is truly delicious! I havent found anything better in this area.  Now on to the food, also very good if you are the vegetarian/organic food type (I am). Everything is prepared fresh and you can taste the quality of the ingredients.  I dont know what I would do without Vivo...FiDi is truly lacking in healthy food options and this place is my lifesaver.

I started buying my morning coffee here a few weeks ago after deciding to take a break from Starbucks.  Even though their coffee is good, after an encounter at Vivo Food this morning, I am heading back to Starbucks!  

Ordering a cup of coffee should not cause a major disruption.  But, the employees here made it an issue today.  I was surprised at their confusion since I have been ordering the same thing every day for the past few weeks . . . even the owner/manager now  recognizes me and knows exactly what I want.  But my complaint is not that the employees did not remember.  My complaint is that they seem to turn their ears off and apparently lack interest.  This is a bad combination when dealing with the public.

Today, the owner/manager was not at the front counter when I placed my order and when the confusion started.  I did however, ask to speak to him after returning a few minutes later, with hot coffee dripping all over my hands because their coffee cup cover broke and fell off of the cup while I was walking back to my office, because his employees were also confused by that.  Sigh . . ..

Starbucks here I come!

Went there for the first time today.  They screwed up my bagel order and the bagel itself was the worst bagel I've ever had.  It tastes like it was either undercooked or made out of bean sprouts.  

They get two stars instead of one because they didn't put meat on it and their coffee is pretty good.

There is a Dunkin' Donuts really close to Vivo and I'd recommend you get your morning bagel there instead.

Good option when you're looking for a healthy lunch in the fidi.  Everything is organic and fresh.  Salads made to order (they grill your chicken right there so it goes hot onto your salad), omelets/egg whites made to order, pre-made sandwiches/wraps ($6-8 usually), other snacks (hard boiled eggs, yogurt parfaits).  But, what I come here for most often is the iced coffee.  They make a toasted coconut coffee one which is TDF.

This place has really gone down hill in the past 6 months, to the point where I will NEVER go there again.

1.  I don't think a single cashier there can mix an espresso drink to save their life.  My mochas have become so bitter they're not drinkable because all of the syrup is stuck to the bottom of the cup.

2.  They've let go half of their staff, including the great guys who would make breakfast in the morning.  Their breakfast croissants are over the top greasy, I cannot believe they're as healthy as the store claims.

Overall, whenever I order I am highly skeptical that they'll get it right.  I'd rather go somewhere I can rely on, even if there's less of a selection.  It's not like this place is cheaper than Starbucks anyway.

The last time I  went to Vivo I was disappointed to discover that they no longer offer their lovely made-to-order omelettes. I'd probably go back for lunch but I'm pretty disappointed in the reduced brekky menu.

Stuck downtown right near the Staten Island ferry station for a few months working on an off-site project and I have to say I was getting really grossed out by the lunch options.  After one too many experiences with subpar lunchmeat (in a related story, I am on a self-imposed turkey strike for a few weeks after one particularly harrowing turn at Subway), I was very happy to discover Vivo foods today.  The shop is in the subterranean plaza underneath an office building at Water and Broad streets and appears to be nothing more than your standard NYC salad/sandwich place from the outside.  However, once you get inside you immediately realize that everything in there is fresh and healthy- even the chips are the good, organic kind with no transfats (microchips, I guess you could call them).  I got a chicken sandwich with basil mayo which was delicious and made with high-quality ingredients including actually whole wheat bread (as opposed to the dyed-brown Wonder bread that one usually encounters at a deli).  A completely non-disgusting (and actually very satisfying) lunch.  I highly recommend.

Great coffee and only $1.25 for a large!!!!  Well, while there special last.  Also went back for lunch and had a great sandwich.  Really fresh and made with naturally raised chicken.  But best of all I wasn't hungry an hour later which is what happens when I have a sandwich from Pret.

A lovely atmosphere and thoughtful staff. We specifically needed some chicken parm and most restaurants were closed for Labor Day. Although not on the menu, the man in charge said the chef would make it for us. It's "the best" he assured us. The meal was good, with the chicken tender and sauce flavorful. A bit too much cheese, and quite pricey for only chicken parm and broccoli. No side of pasta or anything else for $38.50. The tricolor salad was excellent, and I dove into it and forgot a picture. It, too, was pricey: $23.50. I'd like to try other spots in the area to comparison shop. $100 for lunch of a salad and two chicken Parms is very high, even for NYC standards. We may return next year when we need the chicken parm to mark a family event; at those prices I don't see making this spot one I would frequent often.
Obviously, a favorite for lazy UESiders not willing to go beyond their neighborhood but horribly overpriced for mediocre food w reasonably good service. Hundreds of far better Italian places in NYC.

Service was super nice and quick.
The coffee I ordered was amazing!
Highly recommend

Not good.
Not awful but def not good.
Seems stuck in a rut ... blah. Blah. Blah

Not going back.

Except for the canned fruit juices that were not authentic, the meal we ordered, salmon and their chicken special, was very good. The only downside to having a meal here is that they are very expensive, and lunch can run over $100+ for 2.  Overall experience was pretty good for the area!

Decent food but grossly overpriced. The outdoor cabin was nice as we came with two dogs both of whom were accommodated. Rrgatoni alla nonna was good but the other pastas were average. Live nearby but not likely to go again. Plenty of other choices.

Overpriced for the quality.  Had the tomato and dry ricotta appetizer which was nice but $18 was over priced for sliced tomatoes. The Branzino was fine but nothing special. The wine list is really ridiculously priced.  Way overpriced. Shame because the place is lovely and the tables spread out so you can enjoy the conversation with your guests. But you pay a lot for that pleasure.
Came for restaurant week. Incredible food. Beautiful outdoor seating. A can't miss! The eggplant in the rigatoni norma was top of the line.

Food was excellent: I had the mushroom risotto and my friend had the special pasta which was fettuccine with sun-dried tomatoes. Wine selections by the glass were good. The only thing that could have been better was the attentiveness of the head waiter. We were sitting in the cabana outside and he was standing facing the street with his back to us so it took some time to get his attention without out yelling.
Will definitely be back.

I was always intrigued by this place because of the decor on their outdoor dining area. It reminds me of Munchkin land in the Wizard of Oz because of their flower set up- It's really capturing! In efforts to kill time my son, his father and I decided to have lunch here. We had their fried calamari as an appetizer- it was hella tasty!! I had the risotto with grilled chicken and my son had their chocolate chip pancakes. His dad went with their banana pancakes. I really enjoyed the risotto but wasn't too crazy about the grilled chicken. My son and his father loved their pancakes, I happen to try the chocolate chip and could not help stealing more bites haha- such a glutton of me! The pancakes are pretty big in size despite there only being two, it comes with strawberries and blueberries on the side. I also liked to shout out the staff as they were so nice and attentive as well. I can definitely see myself coming back here.

Would give this 0 stars if I could- the food was overpriced yet undercooked. I ordered chicken and am still trying to figure out what part of the chicken it was. And the "baked" vegetables were raw? So strange. The ambiance and service were decent, but the food and price really make me question if this was an actual restaurant.

If I could give this zero stars I would, but I can't so I give it one.

I guess the one star could be for the great, extra foamy cappuccino and the great skill of the construction worker that we were in close proximity to. More on that later.

On the website, a brunch menu is advertised, which is why we chose to come here. We were expecting some form of brunch. We had an 11am reservation, which is early but we had commitments in the afternoon and figured we could deal with a completely empty restaurant. We needed to sit in their outdoor cabin because we brought our dog.

We arrive and the outdoor cabin is nice, but we're handed a lunch menu and a wine list, and when we asked about the brunch menu, the server named a few breakfast dishes off the top of his head that he said we could order if we wanted. The rest of the menu was pasta, salads, and heavy entrees that didn't exactly fit in the brunch vibe.

Probably the greatest part of this experience was the fact that this restaurant decided to carry out a construction project on the outdoor cabin at 11am on a Sunday. And the construction was happening quite literally inches away from our table. The drilling and hammering while they installed doors on the cabin made it difficult to hear any of our own conversations, and while I appreciate the servers apologizing for the noise, what manager/owner in their right mind would allow this to happen while customers are dining??? Debris could have hit us, gotten in our food, or disturbed our dog (luckily she's very well behaved and wasn't too phased by it, but many dogs would not have been so calm). It wasn't even like it was cold or bad weather where the doors needed to be put on that moment to make the cabin more comfortable. It was completely unnecessary to be happening during business hours. On a Sunday at brunch time when the weather is gorgeous you have to at least anticipate that customers will want to sit outside!

Even with all of the absurd construction aside, it was some of the worst service I've ever experienced. Two of us arrived after the rest of our party and weren't given water or attended to for a solid 15 minutes after sitting. We ordered coffees because wine didn't really seem like a vibe and we would've preferred some brunch cocktails, but we were all fine with coffee. The server never once checked on us or asked if we wanted refills or anything, and instead of clearing our empty cups when our food arrived to provide more space, he left them stacked on the edge of our table.

I ordered gnocchi alla sorrentina which was fine, nothing crazy good or crazy bad, but my boyfriend decided to risk it all and order the off-menu blueberry pancakes. Arguably some of the worst pancakes we've ever tasted. They were bland, overcooked, and overall just super disappointing. We kind of expected it but it was still a let down. Don't advertise a brunch menu if you don't serve it and don't know how to!!!!!

Again our server never came over to check on us and I have worked at restaurants so I understand being busy, but he probably had 3 tables including us and just never came over to check on us. Which is even more disappointing considering there was drilling happening right over my shoulder throughout the entire meal.

I guess I blame the management here because to allow this all to happen is not right and quite frankly just absurd. I appreciate that the servers tried to insist on seating us inside, but since we had a dog with us we couldn't. And there were other tables who wanted to sit outside because of the nice weather. They could have at least sat us farther away from the construction if they knew it was going to happen!

Save yourself the money and go literally anywhere else. There are plenty of overpriced Italian restaurants in the upper east side that at least have good food and better service. This owner/manager has absolutely no place in the restaurant business and I'm surprised it's even still open. Even taking out the construction, the meal was mediocre at best and the service was just awful. I've dined at a lot of restaurants and worked at a fast paced bar in Times Square and am just appalled at how this place was run.

DO NOT EAT HERE.

Came in without a reservation. Even though they were busy, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Sat us immediately for a great dinner. Then after diner, the waiter saved us a spot at the speakeasy bar that they've opened, where we had even more great drinks. Wonderful experience all around.
Mediocre service. Friend and I got food poisoning immediately afterwards. Not worth the risk.

Overpriced basic Italian fare with subpar service and a slow kitchen. Appetizer (an arugula salad with artichokes) took over 30 mins to arrive. Portion size was small for a $23 salad. Entrees took an hour.

Wait staff never checked on us after we  received our food. Water glasses were never refilled.

We ate dinner at 4:30pm and the restaurant was maybe at 10% capacity.

All said, a $182 total tab for three fish entrees and an appetizer (no drinks). If the service and pacing was top notch, I wouldn't have minded the pricing.

I've been a long time client of Vicolina, it's predecessor Vico and it's sister restaurant on Lex and 70th. The food has always been consistent and I've hosted large dinner parties at the elevated back table and numerous other gatherings here over the years. I work and live nearby and it's a convenient location for me.

What a disappointment it was to be treated like second class citizens tonight. I've vowed never to return and to spread the word. What happened? We had a 7 pm reservation and specifically asked for a table under the tent outside where the tables are farther apart, and were told this request would be honored. We arrived and were shown to a table right by the front door where the wait staff and customers pass very closely. We told the hostess that we had requested a table under the tent and pointed to an empty table for 2 there. She insisted that that was not possible. As we were discussing this with her, another older distinguished-looking Caucasian couple came in saying they had a 7:15 pm reservation. A different hostess came and seated that couple at the very table we were asking to be seated at, which was the last table under the tent.

We immediately asked why the other couple were being seated at the table we wanted when we had an earlier reservation and had requested that location. The hostess said well the other couple requested that table -- whereupon we said we ALSO had requested it and had the earlier reservation (7:00 vs 7:15 pm).

I don't know why this happened but could it be that we were two younger Asian customers and the other couple was an older Caucasian couple? It certainly felt that way. There were other small clues. The maitre de ignored us for several minutes when we first arrived, choosing to help other customers. The entire episode left me feeling disgusted. People of color reading this will appreciate how subtle discrimination can be. It can be very difficult to put on finger on exactly what racism looks like, but all I can say is that this is it.

Needless to say, we will not be back. People of color (Asians, African Americans, Latinos) beware: you may
not feel welcomed here.

From the moment I was greeted by the lovely beautiful hostess (new to NY from Slovenia/Dubai) to my entire service this was an outstanding meal.   A friend recommended this restaurant and they were able to accommodate a party of one (not everywhere in NYC will).  I had a table at the very end of the tables to be socially distanced outside.  I felt safe and comfortable with the staff wearing masks.  

The menu is very well rounded and their daily specials were tantalizing.  In fact I had a difficult time deciding what to order.  I had the buffalo mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes and then enjoyed the daily pasta special.  The pasta special was sun dried tomato pasta with a medley of seafood (salmon, clams, calamari) in a light sauce.  It was generously portioned and out of this world delicious.  Elijah (sp?) was my waiter.  He made my experience as a single dinner enjoyable.  Food and service were top notch and I will be here on my next visit!  Thank you Vicolina for a wonderful experience.
Great good and atmosphere .   Nice outdoor seating, very clean , service is amazing .

Vicolina has to be one of the most well done outdoor seating areas in all in NYC. As I was walking by and I saw the magical outdoor seating I just knew that I had to pop in!! As I walked inside I was greeted with warm smiles and delightful smells!! I decided to order the black ink pasta and oh man...it didn't take long for the waiter to come and clear my plate. It was delicious! Then I enjoyed delicious macaroons. My waiter was so sweet that he wanted the macaroons to be on the house. I will never ever forget that trip to Vicolina!!

Get ready for slow, rude service and a financial fleecing that is insulting. Be sure to google the bottle of wine they try to serve you. I wish I had.
I ordered the only chardonnay on the menu and it didn't have a name.
It was a $68 bottle of chardonnay but was served a $10 bottle of swill. When I told them that was insulting they offered a $20 credit. Although maybe well intentioned, I won't be going back. Plenty of other restaurant options who respect their customers and are rewarded with life long clients.

They have nice outdoor dining with flowers and curtains as well as the acryl barrier. Good quality bread. With their recommendation, I had Vongole dinner. It was decent with al dante linguine. It tasted as if they made Aglio e Olio and added the clam meat and little bit of clam juice. Thus, I barely tasted the rich clam flavor - I asked for extra clam juice to figure out and it tasted like a soup with olive oil with garlic and salt. Clams were a bit small and not super fresh compared to other traditional italian places. It is why I removed one star. I usually eat all the clam meat but I had to leave them after biting on few old ones with sand in them. Better served than Fettuccine.

I had the pasta with whole crab. To die for!!!!!

Outdoor seating is the best of the best on Madison Ave. YOU MUST TRY.

I'm a big chicken fan so it was right to the pollo balasamico.  Amazing. My second visit for lunch was take out calamari fritti. Only 38.50.   Last trip with a nice group of foodies was flatbread galaro....sausage flatbread, beer flatbread and sweet sausage.  Each 18 beans and we'll worth it.  Spent about 500 dollars in last month and the cook will come outside and smoke with you.  Check it out

Absolutely amazing food and service! Everything from the appetizers to the main courses to the sides to the desserts. All made exquisitely! Highly recommend you do not skip dessert! Black cherry gelato and creme brulee are a must!

Must visit restaurant!! From the service to appetizers, dinner and dessert... there is not one thing that was not amazing. The food was very authentic and cooked to perfection... a taste of Italy in the heart of Manhattan!

We were also perfectly seated six feet apart which made the night even more relaxing. I highly recommend this restaurant as it is also in a great location. 10/10!

Will definitely visit again! :)

Decent food, terribly rude service. Our waiter would approach and just stand silently at our table. Proceeded to cut us off as we began our order, pressuring us to order our entrees with our appetizers. Understand it's a Saturday night and the kitchen is busy, but there are much better ways to communicate that to your customers. It's a one-and-done spot for me, and it's entirely because of the service.

This is the most beautiful covid setting in Carnegie Hill. They've built and entire house on Madison Ave, with chandeliers and carpeting. And the place is always packed. It's a scene. And like most restaurants where people go to be seen, it is overpriced. But unlike the overpriced scenes farther south on Madison in the 70s, the food here is just not worth it. There is much better Italian in the neighborhood.

First time downtown in a while due to the covid and wanted to try something new and this place did not disappoint, from the appetizer to the gelato dessert, everything was amazing! There's so much on the menu so I'm definitely coming back. Authentic Italian at its finest!

For the price, the food should have been better. The linguini was just eating straight garlic. The carbonara was just ok. The dirty martinis were pretty bleh. There were aspects that were ok but nothing to write home about. Our waiter was very nice but again, for a bill close to $800 for 6 people, not worth it.

Very mediocre, tasteless food. Dessert tasted of refrigerator. I left part of each course untouched. The price came to $500 without tip or tax for three people.
Service was very good.
Tables not distanced six feet apart in the shed.

We went with 2 other couples. It was awful--the service was terrible, the food was mediocre and the bill was too high. It took forever for the server to take our order and once taken, it took forever for the food to arrive. We all ordered pasta except for one of us who ordered a veal chop for 70 bucks. We had a bottle of $85 white wine that was okay, a couple of cocktails, and a couple of desserts. The bill was $381 with a $76 undeserved tip included. We went with 2 other couples. It was awful--the service was terrible, the food was mediocre and the bill was too high. It took forever for the server to take our order and once taken, it took forever for the food to arrive. We all ordered pasta except for one of us who ordered a veal chop for 70 bucks. We had a bottle of $85 white wine that was okay, a couple of cocktails, and a couple of desserts. The bill was $381 with a $76 undeserved tip included.

We met some dear friends at Vicolina yesterday. Atmosphere and service was excellent. Maybe 5 stars. The food looks good, but isn't really great. It is a lovely environment. I had the halibut that came with a huge helping of spinach. I'm sure the fish had been frozen. With tip the bill was over $500 for four people. The least expensive bottle of wine was $75.
I'm sorry but if felt noticeably overpriced. PS I live in NYC for more than 25 yrs.
Great dinner spot. Enjoyed the outdoor seating. Fresh halibut was amazing. Great dessert selection

Nice dining room but bad vibes when after placing our order from the menu the maitre de came back to tell us that the shrimp, clams and pasta dish we ordered was priced wrong and was $48.  My plate only had one shrimp and five very small clams.  Wine was way overpriced.

Ordered two dishes: risoto and fettuccine carbonara

The first smelled as strong as a fish market on a warm day, had tasteless broccoli and shrimp, and rice soaked in "moist sauce" (the cherry tomatoes were good, though!)
Cost over $40 (and price was not specified on the menu, as a day's special)

The second had good bacon over okay pasta (mostly dry), standing on a puddle of oil at the bottom of the dish
Cost over $30

VERY disappointing experience, but service was good and the outside cabin decoration is gorgeous... so go there for the water, I guess?
A must try!! If you are in the mood for fine authentic Italian course this is the place you want to be. Amazing atmosphere ,great service and delicious desserts. All the best to you guys!!!

I booked a reservation here over a week ago requesting specifically to sit outside because
my parents were joining and they were not comfortable sitting inside. When we showed up today they no longer had space for us and said the only option was to sit inside. We said we were not comfortable with that and they could have cared less. Extremely disappointed in the customer service when we had requested this table a week in advance.

For the first time since the pandemic started - I actually enjoyed dining out. This place is doing it right. The wait- staff was incredible and the food was excellent. The heat-lamps and decor were top notch. Aside from the masks, you couldn't tell at all that there is a pandemic happening at this place.

Seriously, this restaurant is excellent.

I've been here a few times but don't plan to return after our NYE experience. When we sat down for our dinner, we only learned then the menu was a pre-fix $175 per head menu. This evening was just a huge money-grab for Vicolina. The amount of courses and food they brought was enough for 3 dinners. It was embarrassing. People were leaving the restaurant double handed with paper bags of leftover food. On top of this, they kept us at the only table with no heater for 45 min in freezing cold temperatures when the workers came to bring a heater, they were insulting us in Spanish - unfortunately they didn't know it was my date's native language. No one at the restaurant even bothered to apologize. This evening cost $500 and I've never felt more bamboozled by a restaurant in my life - the food was good, but not THAT good.
Thank you so much for the donate meals to the mount Sinai staff!!! The chicken parm was phenomenal!
Beautiful spot! Wonderful service! Here for lunch and the salads offered were amazing! Very nice menu and will be sure to come back!

I went to Vicolina for dinner a couple of weeks ago. I was promised a " great table" twice while making the reservation. When I arrived, not only was there no " great table" for us, seemed like there was no table at all. Luckily we bumped in to one of the owners who rectified the situation. We had a great dinner, the food was excellent. I would definitely go back. A word to Sophia ( who I spoke to twice when making the reservation) it's incredibly poor form to promise and not deliver, and a very bad business model.  If we had not been lucky enough to be intercepted by the owner on his way out, we would have been seated by the garbage can on Madison Avenue and I would not have been happy . Be careful about what you promise customers, and more importantly be honest.

We've never written a restaurant review before, but we felt compelled to write about Vicolina after our meal there tonight. We've eaten at most of the other Italian restaurants in the neighborhood, many of which are very good, but this was the most fully satisfying and delightful dinner we've had this summer. The outdoor shed, breezy on a hot summer night, is unusually lovely, with plantings and music, and the waiters -- every one of whom was masked (unlike at some other places) -- were efficient, courteous, and charming. Our salads were delicate and beautifully prepared, and the pasta was deeply flavorful without being heavy. Prices are slightly on the high side, but pretty much in line with the others in this area, and let's face it: rare a meal like this, with everything just right (did we mention the scrumptious bread?), is worth every penny.

It took a full 15 min before we received menus. Waiters would rudely interrupt conversations. The food was mediocre, but would in no way merit the price tag. Not a great dinning experience. Would not go back or recommend.
Vicolina is amazing! Great ambiance; adorable outdoor seating with adequate social distancing on a quaint block on Madison Ave. These meatballs are a great appetizer. Dip bread in the leftover sauce.

The food here was delicious, however I was not impressed with the service my sister and I received. We found a small chunk of glass or hard plastic in the appetizer, and upon informing our waiter he said he would let the chefs know, as they might have broken a glass near the food. Although I would have preferred a more apologetic response, we decided to move on since the food was delicious and mistakes do happen. After finishing our meal, the server did not check on us for about 15-20 minutes. Upon going inside (we were seated in the outdoor structure), I found out our waiter had left for the night, as his shift was complete and someone else would be out to deliver our check. Such a delay was odd since they didn't appear to be very busy. Plus, I was surprised the waiter left without telling us, especially since we didn't have a great experience with the appetizer. They brought our check and a free desert to apologize for the delay, which was kind, but while we were waiting a rat ran under our table and around our feet. The structure was more of an enclosed outdoor dining room rather than seating out in the free air, so we reported it to the server. He said they can't control it and that the rats come because there is a nearby construction site. While no single event was a huge deal, they all added up to a poor experience, and I wish the staff had taken greater responsibility, been more apologetic, or compensated one of the items (especially the appetizer with the piece of glass/plastic).

My wife and I ate at the old Vico at least once a week and were very sad to see it go.  We had our first meal at Vicolina on February 5th with friends and I'm glad to report it kept everything we loved about our old favorite spot and upgraded in many ways.  The food is still delicious but the new place has an energy and liveliness to it the original never had.   We are so glad to have it back in the neighborhood!

My husband and I went to Vicolina for Valentine's Day and ate outdoors. We were not aware that there was a special price fixe menu on this day, which was our first disappointment.
