As we did not want a 4 course meal, we were told we could order a la carte, which was a fine solution. (Several other guests also were surprised by this and complained) We each ordered a pasta and an entree from the selection, and both our meals were actually very good. However, our shock came when we received the bill. My pasta was $69 and my entree (Sole) was $74. We ended up paying over $140 for 2 items, when the price fixe would have been $150. This was never communicated, and quite frankly outrageous to pay compared to their every day menu prices. It was clear that we were just being up charged because it was Valentines Day. On top of that, there was a 5% COVID surcharge. While the food was good it certainly wasn't worth these prices, and we will not be returning. I understand restaurants are struggling at this time and we want to support the neighborhood, but this was clearly just taking advantage of customers, very disappointing.

I had lunch there with my 5 year old son, ordered him half size pasta with butter. His pasta came soaking in butter. We also ordered home fries, thick cubes we raw inside. We asked for a scoop of ice cream on cone, they were out of cone. Ok no worries bring it in cup, it came totally different flavor than what we asked. Server can easily come over rand day we are out of that flavor. Instead she said they replace it with this.
I asked for check, they charged half size of kids pasta $20 / by the way full size is priced as $21 on their menu.
I asked server to talk to her manager she said they can't do anything because that's what it says in their system. I told her that makes no sense. Told her to see a manager, she came back with reducing it to $16 and said that's all they can do. It was so weird, I felt like I am negotiating for the food that was bad, salty and HALF size!
Overall very salty, expensive, and out of touch place.
So disappointing, we were very excited to try this place and have a good meal. There are plenty of Italian places in the neighborhood, so I would never go back there again.

We stopped for lunch and were so impressed my friend went back the next day for breakfast AND lunch.  We ordered the Burrata salad and Cornish game hens then topped it off with pistachio gelato.  AMAZING!  He ordered the pasta and clams the next day and was equally impressed.  On top of the amazing food the service is wonderful, very attentive.  I highly recommend Vicolina.

Super nice folks running the place and at the grill. Solid food. Neighborhood bodega/deli with even larger selection of non-vegan and vegan food than usual. Good smoothies. Good breakfast sandwiches. Good halal food. Some toiletries and other classic behind-the-counter stuff. Prices are reasonable - just ask if you wanna be sure!

Well Over a year and they still won't change the menu board prices.  Until people start demanding to pay ONLY the posted prices, they will continue to not update the sign. Actual prices are 15-20% higher but advertise lower.  What a Shame!  They can't be trusted.

I have run past this place quite a few times, and kept telling myself that one day I'd finally patronize it, because on the Upper West Side, we aren't lucky enough to have anything like this and there's no damned way I'm going to go through life without stepping into a vegan deli (it's not entirely vegan; it seems like the menu is half and half, and I've heard the grills are separate for vegan and non-vegan) and then stepping back in another time and another until I've tried every item on the menu at least, oh, I dunno, half a dozen times.

I finally stopped in this morning, a Saturday, after my run, and ordered the vegan bacon, egg, cheese, and sausage (I'm not quite sure of the order of those items) on a roll (there's also an option to get it as a hero!), and it comes with hash browns, which thrilled me to the gills.  As I waited for it, I chatted with the lovely young gentleman at the register, who was super-nice and friendly, and glanced at the other fella who was tending to my food on the grill.  I got a frisson of a *rush* when he sliced the sandwich in half with a big knife, because I knew that that would give the thing that delicious cross-section view that the kidz seem to be into these days, which  makes food look even more scrumptious and appealing.

I took my bounty to a little park at 90th and Second, found a bench, and was already giving Pavlov's dog a run for its money.  Then, after my first bite -- drum roll  -- I'm pleased to report that what I ordered BLEW AWAY MY EXPECTATIONS!  I even exclaimed aloud to myself about how good it was and may have (okay, so  I did) even cursed a little bit about how, uh, flim-flammin' delicious it was.

I am thrilled to have finally tried this place and plan to make it a part of my routine.  I'm hooked.

I was bemoaning my inability to eat the iconic chopped cheese sammich with my intense food allergies... and my friend recommended I try the vegan chopped cheese.

This is one of the best bodega experiences I've had in my 8+ years in the city. The staff was so kind and perky to everyone who walked in. It was clear this store is beloved by the owners, staff, and locals. Unassumingly, this bodega offers what you would typically find BUT ALSO a wide variety of vegan, dairy free, vegetarian, and gluten free options.

I have no other way to describe my experience than to say it was prepared with love, which I understand how odd that sounds... the cook adjusted the sandwich to accommodate my food allergies with gluten free bread. He softly wrapped and then padded the sandwich with fries. He delicately sliced holes into the top of the plastic lid so the moisture would escape without rendering the contents inside as a soggy mess. The person at the register (possibly the owner) was so delighted by my happiness to finally eat a chopped cheese that he thanked me for my joy with a banana... again this interaction was done with the kind of love one might expect between friends.

This store is great and I hope my review inspires more people to try it out. Yes, it is a bodega so don't expect a fancy restaurant. But for being a bodega, it is a treasure to enjoy.
Pretty good food. Didn't take too long. We were the only ones there so it was quiet and tidy. Could get easily crowded.
This is your typical go to bodega in the city! I got #13 (the dead end) which has chicken cutlet, lettuce, tomato, bacon, Mayo. It was $8.32. Will come again when I need a quick bite!

An amazing concept. It looks a lot like a typical convenience store and deli but  it isn't. Vegan Deli has something for non meat eaters too. Lot of stuff in fact. The prices are good too.

I like the vegan Egg & Beyond Meat. It's about $8 for a pretty good sized sandwich. This is vegan egg substitute and Beyond soy link sausage on toast. It comes with a hash brown. This tastes just like something for breakfast at some fast food place. So many other good choices. There's also premade drinks and salads.

Good stuff is what you can find. It has lots of meat substitutes and they taste like the real stuff. The people at the counter are mostly friendly and helpful in explaining the menu and things.

This weekend was my first visit to this new deli but I'm sure I'll return. Vegan Deli is my kind of deli. It's close to my apartment and opens at 6am. The bagels are great. The place is new. They have two grills in order to keep foods for vegan and carnivore lovers separate.

Everything is fresh daily and the employees are nice. One employee handles the food and the other mans the cash register. It's take out only.

I'm recommending for meals on the run. They are open 6am to Midnight Seven days a week! The cashier said they are new to the neighborhood. I said I would add them to Yelp because I'm a fan!

Pretty nice deli that recently opened up in the area.

Variety of hot and cold sandwich options. Salads, wraps, breakfast. Smoothies,  juices, and protein shakes. Plenty of snacks, refrigerated drinks, and some household items. Neat and clean place.

They also offer vegan options which are prepared on a separate grill.

Tasty cup of hot coffee for $1 a cup.

Come visit this clean, fancy and delicious vegan Deli store! I love eating here most of the time.

Thanks for the best services!!!

Best regards.

What a cool idea - a New York City style bodega with bacon egg and cheese, egg on a roll, blts, etc., but all completely vegan! The deli does have two separate grills for vegan and non-vegan food. The food was pretty good, for a deli. It wasn't really like a restaurant style, but it was priced really cheap and the service was fast and convenient. I would come here again if I lived closer.

The vegan crunch wrap is awesome, so tasty. And you get a generous portion of fries. I came when this place first opened and was really confused by the name (Vegan Deli and more), and now the new sign just says "Vegan Deli" but also "2 separate grills". I see non-vegans ordering off the regular menu all the time, so I guess they are not deterred by the sign that makes it seem like it's an all-vegan place. Somehow it all just works. Really grateful to be able to get veganized deli classics on the UES!

A vegan and regular deli in one with 2 separate grills- one for vegan items only and one for non vegan items. The staff is friendly. Food is made quick. Most importantly it is delicious. I have ordered the V1 (vegan blt) and V8 (beyond sausage sandwich) which are both my all time favorites. They are very fresh and satisfying without making you feel guilty of eating typical fast food sandwiches as all the ingredients are fresh and 100% vegan. I also appreciate that they offer delivery on the delivery apps and are open 6am-midnight daily for all your vegan (or non vegan) munchies.

I found this deli on TikTok. The food is so good and fresh! The service is outstanding. I got a vegan chopped cheese with French fries and it was great. I stopped eating beef as a child so I never got to enjoy the hood staple :chopped cheese sandwich until now! I will definitely be returning !
I had a vegan crunch wrap. So filling!!! They have an entirely vegan menu. A good way to enjoy classic deli bites without the greasy feeling afterwards.
Great vegan sausage egg and cheese. The staff was extremely friendly. Would definitely come here again!
Strongly recommend! Great vegan food! I love the vegan sausage, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich. Comes with a hash brown on the side.

IMMACULATE!  This place may be the cleanest eatery in the city-- other than my kitchen.

Being a clean-freak, I am thrilled to be able to report that Vegan Deli would pass my mother's (operating room nurse) cleanliness inspection.

The guys are of great disposition, too, and really want you to be a satisfied customer.

Kudos, yo.
The shop was clean, had friendly workers, lots of vegan options, and was affordable for the city. Great place to grab a sandwich to go if you're vegan.
Not only is the food delicious, the bodega itself is so transparent with ingredients. 10/10!
It's so NY Deli with delivery I would recommend it for anyone that missed. Running into a deli yo get a hood sammich or egg n cheese on a roll but all vegan n quite pleasant.

Wonderful neighborhood deli :) Been coming here for the last month amazing food and amazing smoothies .
Perfect Delli

Total gem for vegan breakfast sandwiches. Both the vegan sausage egg and cheese and vegan bacon egg and cheese were delicious. The roll is light and slightly flaky. All of the components were nicely cooked and as a wonderful bonus they come with a hash brown which reminds me of McDonald's hash browns but without the nasty hidden meat. I ordered an off menu sandwich for my daughter and they couldn't have been more accommodating or nicer!
You MUST try the food here! Hands down the best vegan place in Manhattan. So flavorful and very affordable compared to others in the area. Great service and Amazing food. 10/10 recommend.

So thankful I discovered this place when I'm looking for vegan desserts I turn here.

Always enjoy my orders.

Highly recommend the carrot cake and oatmeal raisin cookies. Delish!

I'm not sure what all the rave reviews are about, but as a visiting vegan from the west coast I was instantly struck by how shabbily and carelessly this restaurant was put together and how underwhelming the fare we were served was.

From the dirty, dead plant on our table, the dilapidated floor mats, the 90% empty and remnant-encrusted container of Sriracha next to the dead plant and nothing else warm, inviting or appearing to have cost anything on display, this comes off as a not-squeaky-clean place that isn't doing very well.

And "great service"?? What service? A kid who looks like the owners' son was waiting----not very attentively----at the counter. There isn't any table service, although they will bring you what you ordered when its ready.

The kid simply doesn't have what it takes to be the one-and-only connection with the public here. He's a little shy, doesn't do well when somebody wants to wander slightly off menu, and speaks in a muffled unclear tone when he needs more information from the customer.

The "mom" or "dad" or whoever that was back in the kitchen never directly interacted.

I wanted to try the lentil soup, and it was the only thing I ate that had any seasoning to speak of in it. And although it was pretty good soup, the seasoning that starred in the recipe was salt.

I had the 2 tostadas, which had almost no flavor at all, had skimpy portions of all of the ingredients and which I could make a hundred times better at home with almost no effort. It's a TOSTADA! There's a reason that Mexican chefs make a large BOWL out of the foundational tortilla. I want lots and lots and lots of stuff in/on it, not a couple of slivers of lettuce, a tiny scoop of beans, etc. etc. There wasn't close to enough salsa for my tastes when the dish came (I had asked the kid for extra when I ordered it but to no avail) and when I got up from my table, walked the length of the restaurant and asked for more, I was handed a tiny little portion. HEY, I'm from California, we eat so much salsa, they could serve it to me from a horse trough with a shovel and that would be fine with me.

My friend had the 3 soft tacos, and she thought they were reasonably tasty. When she wanted to add an extra protein to them (and pay for it at the cash register of course), the kid got confused and had a hard time with it.

A couple of vegan oatmeal raisin cookies on the way out were thin and small, seemed LOADED with sugar and had hardly any raisins in them, and the ones that were detectable, were fragments rather than whole, juicy raisins. Why not serve big, delicious cookies with lots of stuff in them?? This whole cookie display reminded me of the ones you see at a Subway next to the tree of Doritos.

C'mon people, vegan fare can be amazing, scrumptious, inventive, bursting with flavors, imaginative and POPULAR but if you won't fix your space up, hire a charismatic staff and get your customers excited by serving, pampering and accommodating them, then you'll.................end up with *this.*

This restaurant has a great selection of traditional American, Middle-Eastern, and bodega-style options, all of which are made on site. I even saw them bringing out a fresh tray of chocolate chip cookies. If you order through their website (which you can see in the photos of the front of the store) vegangrillnyc.com it's a little cheaper than if you order through Seamless or Uber Eats. It is such a luxury to have a completely plant-based restaurant in this part of town. I especially like the "steak & cheese" and "beef gyro" which are entirely plant-based.

I was in town to see my favorite band and took the opportunity to check out some good vegetarian and vegan food while I was there. I visited Vegan Grill on my last day right before my flight and it was sooooo good. I got the Chopped Burger Cheese Melt and it was sooooo good. I got fries with it and they were very generous. The man working the counter was very friendly, probably the nicest person I came across in NYC. He even gave me a free cookie!

I was very impressed with the food and service! I got a just egg omelette with veggies and it was massive / very satisfying. I asked for hot sauce just as a cherry on top. The bacon was more like bacon chips, which I didn't expect but didn't hate. I may have to come back on my short NY trip!

Vegan Grill is a chain restaurant. At first I was excited about it's opening. The place is new and clean but I found it to be very pricey. Their other locations appear to have very good reviews. I'm sorry but I had to pass on this place for my first visit. Online I didn't see anything on the menu that interested me.

When you see the full menu at the business it is a very extensive. Plus they have outdoor seating. When I did return for a second look, the employee on duty was very nice and helpful. He said when I'm ready they would accommodate the portion size and take into consideration my allergies.

I wish them Good Luck at this new location. I can't wait until all the Yelpers in my neighborhood write reviews. In my case I need to share a meal with someone! Three tacos for $16 is too much for me. $3 for coffee....

The setup for this restaurant is your basic low budget walk-in with cheap tables and a tile floor. But the food is fantastic. I ordered the vegan hamburger, and not only was the sandwich huge--and delicious--the fries were amazing. Same for everything else. The jackfruit bowl was incredible. I don't know how they did it, but the jackfruit tasted just like spicy shredded chicken. If you're hungry, vegan or not, I highly recommend this place.

Hands down the best vegan food I had during my time in the City! This food was so good we had to confirm with the waiter that it was actually vegan! Highly recommend the breakfast burrito and chicken sandwich (pictured).

They just opened and having some grand opening week offers every day. Everything on their  is plant based So I decided to give it a try.
I got their power green Cesar salad with extra Buffalo wing sauce protein.

The food was great and the staff members were very kind. They explained what they recommend and what the deals are etc.

I took one star off because the kale in the salad had way too many stems. Wish they were a bit more attentive in NOT putting the stems in like Just Salad.

Amazing selection of Vegan options!!! The perfect meal after hitting up a few different thrift shops in the area. Food came quick and the service was good. Foods a little more pricy but understandable. My friends meal had the cheese paper wrapper inside, but once we noticed we informed the server and he offered to remake it. A little concerning, but not a big issue! The offer to remake it was enough and I would definitely go back  for another meal!

Vegan grill is a fantastic spot! The corn ribs were super flavorful and the chopped cheese was so good, we ordered a 2nd to go! The service is excellent and staff was so kind. The restaurant itself is bright and cheery with fun vibes!

I'm am amazed by all the vegan options here from latin fare to American to middle eastern...all the flavors are fabulous! Give this place a try!

Thank you for your attentive service & delicious recommendation of the Jerk Jackfruit. This was the best jackfruit I've ever had. Tasted fresh & cooked to perfection. Also had gluten free chocolate cookie. Ate it before taking a photo. Please check this place out if you're in the area.

Ordered the Nacho cheeseburger with impossible meat on a brioche bun for pickup. It was slightly pricey at $14, but Omg was it worth it!! Highly recommend! Seriously the best burger I ever had. It was cooked perfectly and the cheese was flavorful as was the homemade guacamole. The brioche bum was also slightly toasted on the top which gave it a nice crisp. Can't wait to come back and try their other items!!

The food was absolutely amazing!! Everything was so flavorful and seasoned to perfection. I ordered the beyond burger and I added peppers and jalapeños to the burger with the special sauce and it was 10 out of 10. The fries were also delicious. If you are unsure about this place, I would definitely give them a try. Also, I ordered through Uber eats so I don't know how the customer service or the atmosphere of the restaurant is.
The food is fresh and well prepared.  We had the jackfruit and mushroom tacos, (the jackfruit were better.), and the ribs of corn. Super yummy.

LITERALLY THE BEST VEGAN SPOT ON THE UPPER EAST SIDE ! Hidden Gem ! Food is delicious and Omar who works in the front is attentive courtesy and friendly. The space is modern, cozy and  clean !! It's my go to spot!!! Not pictured here are the impossible Burgers which are 10/10!! And let's not forget dessert the chocolate chip cookies are Fantastic !!! Highly recommend!!!

Gotten takeout twice now. First time, I got the crunch wrap, which was delicious. And also huge. They forgot my cookie though. Second time, I got chicken tenders and fries. The vegan tenders did not taste good. Maybe there was something weird in the oil? Maybe I just don't like beyond tenders? Either way, it was super over priced for chicken tenders and fries.

Would def go back for the Crunchwrap though! And I need to try the pasta.

And the guy who works there (maybe even owns the place) is really nice! Super excited to get a vegan spot in the neighborhood.

As I have previously written in my reviews of vegan grill, I enjoyed the food greatly. The atmosphere is still a bit much, as the staff usually had friends or family inside the restaurant, which is incredibly small. The service is still fine, though it does get annoying to have anywhere from 4 to 10 people crammed into a small room (there is some outdoor seating.) I would still recommend trying vegan grill for the food, but don't expect a generally amazing experience at this location.
Got a wrap today it was wet in the inside no mayo not worth the 16 dollars I paid and the cauliflower wings were terrible and too salty , never again
Amazing service, amazing variety, amazing burgers. A vegan's food sanctuary.  I love their crispy chicken sandwich, and fries.
Yippee ! Another great lunch spot and it's affordable. . Great food . Nice employees . Zero New York attitude. Highly recommend.

honestly really good food. service is great. they make your food fast, the environment is cute. good vegan food. I live near and will definitely keep coming back. I've had this place three times and appreciate that it's open late nights.
Got the ultimate nacho platter, really good. Healthy food and tasty too. You get choice of vegan protein, beyond or impossible. Both good. Great service staff.
Crunch wrap sandwich with spinach tortilla and beyond meat was delicious. Much needed vegan spot on the Upper East Side.
Great food! Love that there's good vegan options in town. I no longer eat meat so this is good

20 dollar falafel?? Do these falafel balls come out as golden poop?  Is this a magic falafel? Can this falafel give me relationship advice ? HARD PASS, NEW YORK IS OFFICIALLY "GENTRIFRIED" I'm writing a movie with that name, stay tuned.
VERY good and fresh.  Ordered a bowl farro, broccoli, sweet potatoes, black beans and marinated tofu. Delicious .  Will be coming back and trying different combinations and other menu items!

I have never had better vegan food in my life. What they are able to do with the classics but veganized is amazing. Perfect for a dairy free girl like me. And I love the boy who works there too! So kind.

I asked a nearby shop worker if she had tried the Vegan place and she said Yes !!  You should go !  So I went in and I ordered one of their Bowls with tofu, greens , 3 veggies and tahini sauce. The veggies were phenomenal ; super flavorful !  They had fun music playing and the whole experience was A +++. I will be bringing my out of town friends to this great local vegan Spot. Great Find !!!  Highly recommend.  Thanks Darwin for the Music Tip too !

New restaurant! Bright happy clean. Self service or take out. They do bring food to you on ceramic plate if you eat in. kosher  and vegan. Delicious French fries. Paper straws.

An entree is about $11+. You can add combo $5. My food add up to be $18, $19 plus tax. Tips are optional but they have a machine that asks for tips ( this isn't a good idea for small business owners because it's already expensive food for a small meal. It deters some customers because they feel not good shopping here). I did tip however. Mine all in were $24.50 for a burger w. Fries and drink.

This would be more of a solid 4 stars if not for the TINY portion sizes. I am a 105 lb female and I was hungry after eating the french toast. Please don't make me pay for a full meal that has (not kidding) ONE hash brown, three bite-size bacon... chips, and three unsubstantial HALF pieces of toast. Someone please get the memo. I am a long-time vegan, so I've been around the vegan block. This is not a vegan problem, it's a portion problem.
Really good option for plant based food.  Great breakfast burrito and the house made hot sauce is outstanding.  Super service.

The food is always excellent and consistent. the breakfast sandwich is always great. Recently had the chick'n sandwich and quinoa bowl. All excellent. The staff are very nice. I regularly go with a non-vegan and it is one of his favorite places. The place is extremely clean as well. I highly recommend Vegan Grill!

I tried their Green Power smoothie with almond milk! It was simply creamy green- banana-y goodness! It was absolutely delicious and the perfect healthy jumpstart to my day. Their staff is welcoming and the bright airy modern design really compliments their vegan menu! Congrats on opening :) !

I've been trying to find a viet place that has really good bun -- and I finally found it! I got the roast pork bun and it had the perfect ratio of noodles, veggies, and meat. sometimes restaurants add extra things to their fish sauce, but their sauce was perfectly simple.
this place is currently take out only, but their service is still so great! they're currently giving 10% off for pick up orders & 10% off for lunch.
would def go again.

A+ summer rolls!! Made fresh, yummy sauce
10% discount when you pick up
Placed order at the counter and it was ready in minutes!!

I've been here twice and both times got the bahn mi sandwich with chicken cutlet. It has the perfect amount of spice and the bread is soft yet has a nice bite to it.

I've tried their taro bao which was good but nothing special. Same for their dumplings. I would like to try their pho but for now the bahn mi is what I recommend.

They have been closed since Covid so they only offer take out for now. I've never seen the inside.

This was a college staple for me while I was living in Manhattan. Unfortunately they only accept takeout orders, so I can't comment on the ambiance. What I can say is that the food is phenomenal despite being packaged in to-go containers. Restaurant taste in the comfort of your own home.

What you need to try is their Banh Mi. They have a long list of options (proteins) for the sandwich from fish to traditional cold cuts to pork belly. Get the pork belly. Seriously, I get it every time. It's so good that I make the trek from Yonkers to the UES just to get it. That's how much I love Vietnaam!

Ordered take out, note they Only do take out or delivery! No more dining in. Hubby went to pick up the food to get the additional 15% off (only available if pickup). Thankfully we are close by!

We ordered
- basil eggplant, wonderful dish and cooked so tender!
- red curry with beef, highly recommend!
- lemongrass pork chops, everyone raves about this dish, portion is huge!
- Vietnam chicken, great curry flavor

Overall, highly recommend for an easy and delicious meal, we still have leftovers, portions are huge!

I was able to try this place finally after a lot of recommendations as the best pho spot in Manhattan.

Unfortunately, it wasnt the best I've ever had. It was still good but because they don't deliver to my apartment or let you dine in, its not the easiest to pick up.

You do get a discount for pick up so keep that in mind. I still liked all the soup pho though
Please bring back inside seatings . That's all I'm saying. Take out is great but not really works for noodle soups. I just want to eat pho right away.

Take out only! They will give you 15% off if you pick it up! We got the 30F sandwich, spring rolls and moon dumplings and all were delicious! I liked how I could mix and match the flavors of dumplings. The shrimp garlic one was my fav. Everything was ready at the time we requested and packaged nicely! Very reasonably priced too. I will definitely order again!

I'd like to contact them directly, but they don't seem to have direct contact on this page (besides their phone number).

Anyway, I went with my friends and we got bobas and iced coffees. Mine seemed fine, but then I got to the bottom where there was something that looked like a hair or small rope-- very disgusting!!

And moreover, they had some sign at their establishment a our charging an extra 25-75 cents for hot sauce, which is ridiculous. I don't even like hot sauce, but this clearly shows bad business practice. Why wouldn't they just raise their entree prices by 20 cents each to recover the cost of free hot sauce? Very odd...

Suffice it to say, I never wanna go here again. I prefer my iced coffee without unwanted junk.

They are take out only. Don't make the mistake we did and walk all the way there, only to have to wait to take your food to go! Order ahead.

Personally I dislike getting pho to go, so it feels difficult to judge their pho for what it really is.

The eye round steak that came with our pho was great. I wasn't very impressed by the pho broth though tbh. I've had better pho broth with deeper flavor. It felt like if I hadn't used sauces, lime, etc I would have been bored by it.

We got a banh mi in addition to the pho. I would come back for the banh mi. It was served on a softer bread than the traditional crusty baguette, which I personally liked. I'm a texture lover, but the baguettes they typically use for banh mi often scrape the roof of my mouth. That was not the case with the banh mi we got here.

The pork was well seasoned and cooked, as well as plentiful. I only wish there had been more carrots, cucumbers, cilantro, etc. with the abundance of grilled pork.

Vietnaam is a gem in the neighborhood and serves great food at reasonable prices and huge portions (you can easily split it into two meals)- what is not to love?  My cousin got the shrimp fried rice and I got the noodles (I forgot which type) but both of them were fantastic.  I would 100% venture there again whether it's for takeout or dine-in.

Great food at a great price -- there was even a 15% discount for all pickup orders, and they do free delivery within some number of miles with minimum $25 order, so very convenient in UES. They don't have any dine-in currently, so only take out orders.

We ordered the chicken pho bok choy, and the regular pho, both were tasty and the nicely packaged (chicken packaged separately). Good portion size and super cheap price ($15, $14, respectively). Staff was friendly and order was ready by the time I got there, looks like they usually quote about 15 minutes.

Try: Crispy Tofu Skin Roll and Lollipop Sugar Cane Shrimp!

Why: Solid Vietnamese spot on the UES. I enjoyed the Crispy Tofu Skin Roll and Lollipop Sugar Cane Shrimp as they are both unique and not many restaurants in NYC offer these on the menu. Also tried the Classic Banh Mi, which was good and packed with meat and veggies. The bread was ok, wasn't super fresh. Also tried the Moon Dumplings, which were good. And of course, I washed everything down with some Iced Vietnamese Coffee.

Notes: Ordered delivery and they were fast. They have an extensive list of menu items so I look forward to trying some other dishes like Bo Kho and Canh Chua!

I wish this place will close down already. Only because no dine in (take out only) and prime real estate for a great corner restaurant.

Also no seamless or grub hub. If you want delivery you need to call or use their website (bad!!!)

I know it must be hard to manage an establishment where you probably make more money from takeout vs dining in.   I see many customers disappointed that there is no dine in. Please vietnaam!!!! Fix this

They now charge you for everything. .50 cents for extra hot sauce. Also food is below average. Was better years ago but went down hill. My rant is the quality of this place just went down!!!!

Vietnaam is my go-to takeout spot for banh mi sandwiches. Prices are very reasonable and service is quick + friendly. I recommend placing your order over the phone. Sriracha is an extra charge but all together it's still fairly priced.

Excellent! I ordered the Beef Ball Pho and the Chicken Thigh Sandwich - both were great portion sizes, at great prices, with the 10% off discount that is valid Monday-Friday 12pm-5pm (a generous window of time) and an additional 15% off for picking up, valid all day every day. The order was ready before the 15 minutes, with an easy handoff.
The pho was on par with ones I've had at other places, but what I really, really enjoyed was the tenderness and flavor of the chicken in the sandwich; absolutely delicious, paired with the mayo, seasoned carrots and cucumbers, on the not-hard French bread. Delicious food, good prices (the two, with tax, came out to be $23.27), good portions=will definitely be coming back.

What was once a terrific neighborhood restaurant now looks like an eyesore and blight in the spot its still in.

I don't get it. The owners of this place shut it down in 2020 due to the pandemic for delivery and take out only. Now here we are two years later and it's still the same and hasn't resumed normal dine in and outside seating. Even though every other restaurant and bar are back to normal operations for the past year. It's like they don't want to hire back their staff or something.

Oh, and the place looks horrible. Like an episode of Hoarders. There are boxes and assorted supplies and trash piled high in the windows. Why are they doing this? I would not trust eating from here at this point.

Hopefully, one day they will come back and be the great place they once were. The food and staff here  were so good. I miss eating here.

Super flavorful broth, which was the best part. Ordered the Chicken Pho, the chicken was a little tough, rubbery to eat. Too much garnish; although fresh, it was overpowering in every bite. Huge portion. Not the best Pho around, but it will suffice if you are in the mood for warm, comforting noodles and broth.

Beef cube over rice all day for me!!!!!!! I love it so much LOL.

Beef is very flavorful and the portions is decent.

Pho is a must try. The soup is BOMB.COM

Review for takeout!

Vietnaam is currently available for only takeout, but I really loved everything we ordered. We got two beef phos, roast pork vermicelli, and the lemongrass pork banh mi. Despite having left the takeout on the counter for around 15 min, we still managed to have piping hot pho. Everything was extremely well flavored. Only negative is that the soup is on the smaller side vs portion of noodles!

My husband and I discovered this gem right before Covid which was always packed to eat inside, but was a great spot.

Post Covid they still aren't open for indoor or outdoor dining, just takeout. The food is just as good! I've had the ginger shrimp which were very good but my and my husband's hands down favorite is the long hot pepper beef. The seasoning is spot on and it comes with good quality beef and fresh vegetables and your choice of white rice, brown rice, or sticky rice.
Recent takeout meal was tasty and enjoyable. Delivery was efficient. Ingredients seemed fresh and nicely prepared.

I only wish I could take out more from here. I don't think they ever reopened for indoor seating post Covid. It's fine. I like it in my home better. Everything is delicious. Roll the dice and eat well.

We regularly get takeout from here on the weekends, and it's always good. Don't underestimate the simple vegetarian dishes - they're tasty and perfectly prepared. Skip the teas, though - they're very sweet and not as good as tea from a bubble tea shop.

We have only tried the bahn mi here and it is on point, some of the best we've had and we have tried all popular spots in Philadelphia. The grilled lemon grass pork and classic bahn mi will not disappoint.

Got their food for lunch today. An amazing deal. There's a lunch discount and they deliver for free if you spend more than $30. Compared to a delivery service, it's so much higher value. Love their pho. Also love their Nem spring rolls, which are super crispy and were still quite hot when they arrived. Not crazy about their classic banh mi. It's large, but I wish it had less bread, fewer carrots, and more pate.

Amazing food, quick delivery times, reasonable prices, and consistent! I've ordered here several times and the food is always fresh and flavorful! I've been happy with every dish I've gotten! The delivery times are super quick also! Highly recommend!
(Pictured below: Red Curry with chicken and Long Hot Pepper Beef)
Big portions. The special was a bit spicy but good. The pork belly bun was delicious!
Had the chicken fried rice, great taste And so worth the price. Put in tofu as well, great combo and full of flavor

So good, extremely quick. No indoor/outdoor dining, only takeout. The pho is delicious and comes with a delicious homemade chili sauce. For appetizers, the moon dumplings and the coconut curry sticky rice are a must have.
The best Vietnamese spot in town, I've been ordering here for almost a decade and never had a bad dish. The staff is super friendly and happy to make customized orders
Pleasurable Vietnamese food with pho dishes that does enough to get the job but more importantly has awesome pork buns worth trying. $15 a dish. 3.75/5 stars as a dinner spot.
Great food, loved the 15% off discount for picking it up myself, and would highly recommend. Introduced my friends and now they're obsessed. Bravo, Vietnaam.

My favorite restaurant to date in Yorkville! They don't have seatings anyone and is only pick up. Kind of wasted space and I hope they open the sit down soon.

I get the long hot pepper veggies and noodle soup
Has been our go to place for pho noodles.  Super tasty and very tender beef meatballs.  19B is out order every time.  You can't go wrong with it.
They charge $8 fuel charge for a 5 block delivery. Complete rip-off. Delivery was on a bicycle adding insult to injury

Have ordered through Postmates twice now (9 days apart, lol) and have been very happy both times! First time tried the Pho Ga & Shrimp. Second time tried the Shrimp Pho Vermicelli, which basically prompted me to write this review because it was (actually) spicy and so good! The broths have been great, not too salty and full of flavor! I really like their spicy hoisin sauce, which I didn't know was a thing but maybe that's because I am new to Vietnamese food. I like that they offer a side of bean sprouts. My only critique would be that it would be nice to have the option of adding more cilantro and the option of adding extra shrimp because I am a shrimp fiend. Excited to try the rest of the menu and will dine there in person if/when available! My new favorite place.

While i would've loved to give a better review, I can't say the quality is good as ONLY a takeout restaurant. By the time the food came, it was sitting in packaging for 45 minutes and the crispy spring rolls were soggy. Lots of items should be eaten fresh right away but you can't do this as they've been closed for dining 2 years.

This is the only restaurant I know that after 2 years, won't allow indoor dining. It's specifically very odd as i know the food would taste better if it wasn't sitting in packaging for so long.

I recently had the grilled pork with vermicelli and cha gio (spring rolls) here. Both of them were fresh and delicious and I was definitely satisfied. It is rare to find such authentic Vietnamese food in this area. Their prices are a little higher than the Vietnamese restaurants you find in Chinatown, but that is to be expected for this neighborhood. They are still very reasonable at about $15 to $20 for an entree, and with large portions too.

This place appears to have been here for quite some time. With this quality of food, I expect them to be around much longer.
My girl friend and I grabbed some food here last minute. All I will say is OMG. The food is to die for. So amazing!!

The online menu makes ordering very easy for either pick-up or deliveries. They list items using numbers.
Everything was delicious with ample serving sizes. We especially have liked: #26 Bun Xao (noodles - pick your meat topping);  #42 Roast Shoulder filet (pork); #54 Bo Luc Lac (steak); and #75 Vietnamese Seafood Bouillabaisse.  The Vietnamese coffee is superb - count it as a desert!

Very good pho, with really good broth. Not a fancy place, so if you're going on a date, maybe not. But if you just want to have really good food in a simple environment with nice staff, then definitely go for it!

My friend used to live in Vietnam and said these are the closest pho to the pho she used to eat in Vietnam that she could find.

I usually always complain that pho don't have enough broth but these did have enough (tasty) broth + enough meat!

Definitely recommend for the taste!

This is not a sit down restaurant currently so takeout was what I went ahead and did . On the recommendation one of the workers I got the # 38 with brown rice . The food was almost perfect . At around 18 bucks , the 38 consisted of lemon grass chicken with veggies. The juicy lemon grass chicken was excellently cooked with a slight crisp on the outside and soft and tender on the inside and was a thick cut of meat which was a very pleasant surprise  . It's garnish and sauces also complimented it very well . The veggies( carrots, cucumber and tomatoes) also tasted good except I could've used less tomatoes and more of the others . In fact, I could've done without the tomatoes . They had no business being in this meal except to add color for the visuals . Had the amount of Proper veggies match the amount of chicken It would've been a perfect eating experience . The food took less  than ten minutes to be ready which was also a big plus .I definitely look forward to trying other things on their very extensive menu and will recommend .
Wonderful Vietnamese food. Especially love the shrimp lollipops, spare ribs and Duck Pho soup.

This restaurant has delicious and very reasonably priced Vietnamese and southeast Asian cuisine. At the moment (June 2022) it seems to be takeout only, but if that's what you're looking for, it's a great spot. Their vermicelli dishes and curry are great. The pho looks good too but I haven't personally tried it yet.

Every time I see Vietnaam I pronounce it in my head (and out loud) like "Viet-NAAAM."

Came here on a Saturday night around 7:30 pm with a group of friends, and we fortunately got a seat within 5 minutes of waiting (best to make reservation! The restaurant was packed at that time). Between 4 people, we ordered a smorgasbord of foods to share.

Vegetarian papaya salad - Papaya here is most reminiscent of a cucumber or an unripe mango (Aka not sweet). It came with greens, tomatoes, crushed peanuts, and crispy taro (the better version of crispy wontons).

Grilled chicken summer rolls - Unfried summer rolls will always be better than fried spring rolls. It came with lettuce, bean sprouts, vermicelli, and grilled chicken (you can substitute proteins). I loved dipping it with the spicy and peanut-y nuoc-cham sauce.

Spicy pho (raw beef eye round and brisket) - By far my favorite dish of the night. Each one of us ordered pho or stir-fried noodles, and I tried them all, but I still thought mine was the best. I've never had spicy pho before, and this one was perfect for a cold evening. I also loved how the beef was pink when it first arrived at our table but gradually turned brown as it simmered in the soup. Even though pho broth has high sodium and bloats my face, I still drank my entire bowl.

Basil eggplant - Randomly ordered another vegetarian dish, but the eggplant was tender and went well with basil leaves.

Service was great even though the restaurant was packed. Our waters were regularly topped up and our waiter was very accommodating when we asked for the check ASAP (had to catch a movie nearby). Would definitely visit here again next time I'm in UES!

Consistently good food, and very good service. Always fast and efficient, even with take out. If I ask them for something on the side, or extra fork/spoon, they always accommodate - no questions asked! Very efficient and professional staff. This is my go-to place when I'm craving Vietnamese food!

Something different from the usual spots in the area, Vietnaam provides a large menu of Vietnamese cuisine in a large setting. Given the amount of space they have outside and the large awning covering the sun, decided to get a table outdoors for two people (and a dog).

To start off, shared the Vegetable Summer Rolls ($8) - two tightly wrapped veggie rolls with two sauces to the side. Mostly raw sprouts and herbs that was made way better with the accompanying peanut sauces. For the main entree, decided on the Pork Belly Banh Mi ($13) - a hearty sandwich with layers of pickled veggies, mayo, and tender pork. Looked like it would be dry, but the juice from the meat comes through as well as the mayo. Flavor has a good amount of spice from the jalapeno without being overwhelming.

Service is prompt and they filled our water periodically. Like how the full menu is available as soon as they open, so will come back in the morning again.

Love their food but they have not been open to sit down in too long a time.
It is only take out or delivery.
One of my most favorite restaurants in the city.
Meat was good but the bread was a sub roll you would buy at the market. Very disappointed

A very pleasant breakfast spot at the Pendry Hotel located at the Manhattan West/Hudson yards.  

Had coffee/Breakfast sandwich/Mixed berries.  All excellent.  The service is very good and the place is beautiful.  The place opens from 7 am that it is a good place for an early start!

I decided to order from here because the options were really irresistible, I even convinced my boyfriend that this would be a good option and he was satisfied that we chose this place.

I got 1 three course vegan meal with the sweet potato noodles and oh my goodness it was delish now the only thing that I didn't like that much was the corn it was a little hard for my liking but everything else was great my photo gives it no justice. I did order avocado and it was put on the wrong plate but that's ok I sorted that out. If you move the plate around you get a different taste every it and it's quite nice. I enjoyed getting to the mushrooms oh my  the kale had a nice crunch to it and the kimchi was a first time thing for me and I am so glad I've had it. It's spicy and crunchy ohh I may be getting some more of this soon! If you're by here visit it's worth it!

My boyfriend had 1 three course vegan meal with a house mixed salad that was fresh with crispy Brussel sprouts, coconut curry lentils didnt have an over powering taste however it was tasty, the sweet potatoes were chunky.

I would suggest labeling the sauces we didn't know which was which and couldn't tell by smell.

Super cute place right in the Hudson Yards area.  We went for a couple drinks and a snack.  I love the vibe and the location.  The service was great and efficient.  Our guacamole was delicious and fresh and served with thin blue tortilla chips.

Dinner 10/3
Staff was pleasant enough; we were seated quickly.  Our waiter arrived very quickly.
There are no blinds of any kind on the west-facing glass wall.  The sun was setting when we arrived and it was blinding until the sun fell below the Jersey 'skyline'.  The gimmick is an Airstream trailer inside.  That combined with the rows of high-top counters, paper napkins, and fake flowers, this place is a glorified taco truck under a tent.

The menu is very limited: few appetizers, a few tacos, and a dessert.
Our waiter had some trouble explaining the Chihuahua cheese app (It's basically mozzarella sticks, BTW) and wasn't sure that he could exclude guac from my tacos (he did).  My friend ordered a Negroni and the waiter had to confirm that the bar would make it during dinner. (They did.). You can order chips & guac but they don't have chips & salsa. (?!?!)

The food and drinks arrived very quickly. Empty plates and cups are removed very quickly.

The Verano Margarita is not very good.  They are bitter and sour and inconsistent; two drinks were both bad and tasted nothing alike.  Avoid them.  My friends Negroni was very good.

The chihuahua cheese sticks were bland and a bit rubbery, though the dipping sauces were very good.

The tacos were pretty tasty, though I couldn't really taste much difference between the pork (Carnitas), chicken (al Pastor), or beef (Suadero).  Everything was fresh.  Meat was tender and pretty juicy.  Nothing we got had any heat (spice); no sauces/salsa is served with the tacos and there are no condiments on the table.

Staff/Service: 7/10
Food: 5/10
Drinks: 2/10
Ambiance: 4/10
Price/Value: 4/10
Overall, we were disappointed/would not recommend.  4/10

The crispy cheese sticks were good but the ceviche was awful. The seafood tasted frozen and old. We also got the spicy margarita and the verano margarita which were served in plastic cups with a straw - they were fine but fairly underwhelming and slightly below average.

Over all, I'm not sure what this place is trying to be. The prices are expensive for what you get yet the quality is poor. I miss jibs, which used to be here. Do not recommend.
Food was great and came out very quickly. Wish menu was larger.  Servers friendly and attentive.

I was very excited to visit Hudson Yards and get a good margarita and some tacos at Verano, but I was very disappointed. We were seated at the back next to the kitchen entrance, so we had to move because it felt very disruptive. After being seated, it took a while to get service. We had to alert a server to wait on us and service felt unfriendly and rushed. The $16 margaritas were watered down with a lot of ice cubes and did not taste good. The chips were store bought (from the bag) and the guacamole was unseasoned and not tasty. The tacos were not so bad, but the tortillas were cold and hard. Lastly, when we asked for the check, it was presented on a small handheld tablet that a person held to my face for about three seconds, so I did not see the details of my tab. It was not until after I had paid that I realized that I paid the tip twice because based on the high total, the service charge had to have already been included in the total and I had added the tip again to the total I saw on the bill. Would definitely not visit again.

My first impression of Very Fresh Noodles was when I had my first Chelsea Market visit last summer. I would pass by people eating outside and smell that spicy cumin flavor. Fortunately, I had the opportunity to visit the market this month and try the noodles for myself.

Although the line to order can be long, it moved fast and the wait time for my noodles was only a few minutes so they told me to not go anywhere. I'm a huge noodle soup person so I decided to get the Tingly and Spicy Cumin Beef Soup. I expected the chewy noodles to not make me full, but this dish was comfortably filling. I appreciated the different cuts of beef and fresh vegetables. The broth was not too oily nor spicy, which made it very easy to eat.

I would love to try some of the other menu items next time.

A little overrated.
I went, stood in line (long line, must be awesome), and ordered Lychee Lemonade w Badil Seeds and Very Spicy Pork Dan Dan Mian when able. Customer service was pretty great.

I do appreciate that the noodles are made from scratch and pretty delish. I enjoyed watching them be made from the line.
The wait time after ordering is pretty short.

The Lychee Lemonade w Badil Seeds was ok. Kinda bland. It's definitely not worth 5 bucks.

Very Spicy Pork Dan Dan Mian was dumb hot. I love spicy. I'm the spicy girl, but nah.
Great portion size of food I could barely eat.
I ate enough to stay alive and trashed the rest.
For $17, I would have loved to have been able to enjoy 75% or more of my food.

There's a possibility I ordered the wrong thing. It appeared most folks ordered the beef soup.

I don't know.
No more.

As a devoted fan of noodles, the diverse options available at Very Fresh Noodles made it a must-visit. Despite a lengthy wait of around 45 minutes, the anticipation was well worth it. The menu offers two enticing vegan options, and we opted for the very spicy vegan dan dan mian. The noodles were fresh and perfectly QQ! I loved watching the noodle-pulling process while waiting in line!

The attention to detail in crafting vegan dishes, such as the very spicy vegan dan dan mian, with a mock "duck" option, showcased the restaurant's commitment to catering to diverse dietary preferences. Alongside the delectable noodles, Very Fresh Noodles offers an array of beverages, including milk teas and several vegan beverages. We did not get to try it this time around, but 100% would visit again.

The overall atmosphere and the dedication to fresh, high-quality ingredients make it a spot I would undoubtedly recommend and eagerly revisit whenever the opportunity arises.

OMG, their hand pulled noodles are great.
Make an order for any of their hand pulled noodles and you won't be disappointed. Try getting the bar seat in front of the window they prepare the food and you get a little show of how they hand pulled their noodles, great little place for dinner and a show lol.

Their Spicy Beef Noodle Soup maybe be tad spicier than people may be used to so if your not into spice stick with the mild one.

Their Fried Chicken Wings..... I don't think I ever had one so huge and sooooo soooo crispy. Usually good fried chicken wings to be crispy they deep fry it twice. These feel like it went four times....so crunchy.

Very Fresh Noodles in Chelsea Market, New York, offers a hip atmosphere with bar-like seating inside the market. Despite it being a Monday at 6:30 PM, close to closing time, the store was pretty busy. The chef's meticulous noodle-pulling skills were on full display. I ordered the dry cumin lamb noodles, and let me tell you, they were fantastic. The dish had a perfect balance of spiciness and cumin flavor, and the noodles' texture was on point. Definitely planning on coming back for more next time.

FOOD - definitely lives up to the hype

la mei taiwanese beef noodle soup - so good. the noodles carried, perfect texture thickness and hardness. chewy in a good way :). the soup flavor was also solid although it was kinda mala (but only enough that it made ur mouth tingly, and not thst it overpowered the dish) and not exactly the classic taiwanese beef noodle soup, but still great.

PRICE - so expensive (like $27ish?) especially the portion size was like a snack size

SERVICE - comes out p fast

AMBAINCE - inside chelsea market so not much seating. super long line but worth it imo

Came around 5pm after work to try this place out that's been on my bookmarked list for ages. It's the first corner stall you see in Chelsea Market as soon as you walk in brightly lit with their neon sign. Thankfully, there were only a few people in the queue when I got there and I was able to grab a seat at the counter to enjoy my noods that I received within a few min after ordering.

Vegan Very Spicy Dan Dan 10/10! The peanut and chili oil mixed is hands down one of the most delicious things I've ever tasted. The consistency is quite thick and grabs on to the noodles so well so each bite is as good as the previous. I like how the sauce is on the bottom so you pretty much can customize how much flavor you want as you attack the bowl. Very al dente noodles + very generous amounts of scallions and peanuts they give you = love. The added sweet pickles also serve as a nice contrast and palate cleanser. Definitely lives up to its high ratings!

Came here expecting a lot but was underwhelmed. I'm going to attribute my less than ideal experience to me ordering the vegan dish. I'm sure the meat options are great judging by the line. Let's get into it.

Food- I ordered the noodles with vegan duck. The broth was plain and despite it being spicy didn't do much for the dish. The noodles were a little gummy and I've been to quite a few hand pulled noodle places and never encountered this texture. Nothing really blended together 2/5

Drink- I got the lychee lemonade with basil seeds which was decent but not great. 3/5

Service- probably the best part of my experience here the staff was very kind and quick to give me recommendations. Turn around was fast as well and despite there being a large line when I first arrived I didn't wait more than 15 minutes from first getting in line to recieving food.

I wouldn't come back personally but I can appreciate good service and the possibility that this spot isn't best for non meat eaters like myself.

Very popular and busy with limited seating. While there is always a line, it does move pretty quickly.

We ordered the tingly & spicy cumin lamb (dry) and the very spicy pork Dan Dan mian. The cumin lamb was a classic and did not disappoint. The noodles were chewy and so flavorful. Each noodle had the perfect amount of sauce with each bite. The Dan Dan mian was very mala and spicy, which I love. The noodles also grabbed the sauce really well, making each bite so flavorful. Definitely a place I look forward to eating at again!

Super good noodles. Relatively fast, but it's pretty popular. Good thing I went during an off hour late lunch. Had the soup version of the Tingly/Spicy cumin lamb in a previous visit. It was really warming and nice. Decided to try the dry version, still super good. Noodle texture is just right, not overly soft or loose... it's got a good bounce and bite. That sichuan peppercorn was doing its magic thing. Will return when back in Chelsea

If you like hand pulled noodles - go here. The broth too was TASTY and reminds me of being back in China.

There's very little counter space - so get here right when they open at 11. Otherwise, there are a few spots you can take the food and sit at.

The menu hasn't changed much - so just know what you're going to order ahead of time - saves some stress when you're waiting in line / the menus are scanned.

I'll be dreaming about these noodles for a long time - $18ish for a bowl isn't terrible, but it's not an overwhelming amount (so you won't have a lot of leftovers haha)

Awesome hand pulled noodles in the Chelsea Market! There was a decent sized line when I went, but I got my food in about 15 minutes. The broth was well balanced and slightly spicy, the beef was tender and the noodles were perfectly chewy and absorbed the flavor of the soup well. The fresh herbs on top really sealed the deal!

If you're looking for a hidden gem, this definitely isn't it!

We arrived at 2p on a Friday afternoon, and we weren't sure if we would be able to find Very Fresh Noodles within the Chelsea Market....but it was easy to spot because they have the biggest line. When we queued up, there were about 30-40 people in line ahead of us.

The line moves relatively quickly, but we still waited about an hour. There aren't too many choices - a couple of different dry noodle choices with meat, a couple of dry noodle choices without meat and a soup noodle option. I went with the beef noodle soup - mild! - because the dishes looked very spicy. I'm glad I went with mild because while I like spicy, I still wanted to taste the food, and the mild option still had a fair amount of kick. It was a tasty dish that hit the spot for a late afternoon lunch.

I got a boba which was a welcoming counter-balance to the spice, but it was just okay as far as milk teas go as the milk tea is already pre-mixed.

There is limited seating at the bar next to the cash register and outside. I saw people getting tables while other members of their party were still in line; I get it but also, the line is so long that you'll just be hogging up a table for a long time.

You can see them making their very fresh noodles right in front of you! This place absolutely lives up to the hype and had be wanting more despite it being such a generous portion. The place is in the Chelsea Market food hall but still gave a good ambiance with great and quick service. The soup of the noodles was very delicious and perfect for the new cold weather.
The 45 minute wait was definitely worth it! Although EXTREMELY oily, the taste was impeccable! I took the noodles home and drained the oil and they were perfect. The next time I will try it in broth.

Very cool ambiance with their neon signs. You can see and hear them slapping and stretching the noodles while you wait for your order. Service was fast and friendly. I ordered the dry cumin lamb noodles. These noodles were very chewy and long. Probably the best biang biang noodle texture that I've had in NY. The sauce on the noodles smelled very flavorful, but I wish they would let the customers add their own vinegar because I had to throw away all of my meat because it was just so sour. It really threw the dish off balance. I was able to eat all the noodles, thankfully, because the vinegar doesn't penetrate the noodles. I would get the noodles again if they can fix their sauce balance, or whatever their meat marinade is.

Fast, great ambiance and the food is absolutely terrific. Enjoyed it so much. Too bad the place has only 1 far bathroom but it's the Chelsea Market's fault, not theirs.
Loved every minute.

Delicious food. Enjoyed every second.
Highly recommend.
Would be nice to have a few more places to sit but it's really a non-issue.

Very Fresh Noodles serves up some of the best noodle soups in the city. I got the tingly & spicy cumin lamb and the chicken wings. Both were impeccable.

Just bear in mind that the lines are typically long. And being in Chelsea Market, seating is limited.

I've tried both the dry tingly and spicy cumin lamb and the mild la mei Taiwanese beef noodle soup. I preferred the beef noodle soup in part because the cumin lamb was too mind-numbingly spicy for me. However, both were still very good. The lamb wasn't too gamy and the cumin was delicious. For the beef noodle soup, mild was the perfect amount of spice for me. The beef was tender. Cilantro adds a bit of freshness to both dishes.

The noodles have a great texture and chewiness and you can see them making it fresh. The only qualm I have is that the thickness isn't consistent throughout. Sometimes there'll be a part of the noodle that just breaks off because it's a thinner area, but I guess that's how you know it's handmade. Portion sizes are enough, maybe even more than enough. Prices aren't bad considering the area.

The lines do get long during dinnertime even on a weekday. Weekday lunch has a shorter line. Weekends are crazy. They don't have tons of seating at their bar area, but there's plenty of outdoor seating available.

I always say this is my favorite place for hand-pulled noodles in New York City and always rave to anyone who's visiting to make a stop here. I found this place while I was visiting New York back in 2017 and it was instantly put at the top of my list for the best hand-pulled noodles. I was pretty impressed over the years that I visited that the quality and flavor hadn't changed a single bit. However, coming back in 2023, I noticed that they started including thinly sliced beef to make up for the lack of beef chunks that they serve per portion. It's a small change and doesn't really matter to me because the noodles are my favorite part. They also have amazing dry noodles and we tried the Cumin Lamb one and it was packed with so much szechuan flavor. Service is quick and predictable but it might be hard to grab seating in the immediate area since it's very limited!

Our order at Very Fresh Noodle was a hit. The Dry Hand-Pulled Noodles with Spicy Cumin Lamb were a flavor-packed delight. The noodles were perfectly cooked, and the dish had just the right amount of spice. Plus, the casual atmosphere at Chelsea Market made the experience even more enjoyable. A must-try for noodle lovers!

On a visit to Chelsea Market, we stumbled upon a sign that said very fresh noodles. Simple, effective marketing that is no frills, and just pure honesty. I like that.

Holy smokes. Upon eating their food I realized that I had stumbled upon literally the best noodle spot I have ever had in my LIFE. It's a tiny little shop with not too many staff members, but with the small crew these folks are cheffing up the best spicy noodles I have ever had.

We ordered their cumin lamb noodles and beef noodle soup. The cumin lamb noodles: fresh chewy noodles that were not scarce smothered in spicy, herby, saucy goodness. Tender slices of lamb, all topped off with onion and cilantro. The noodle soup: noodles swimming in flavourful, rich broth and tender pieces of beef; again topped with the essential veggies. I don't trust anyone who doesn't like cilantro, onion, or garlic.

Once you order and receive your food from the very friendly staff in like a few minutes, you're able to enjoy your bowls of deliciousness either on the stools right in front, or you can head out to enjoy your tender ingredients outside, where you can relax and take in the sights and sounds of this wonderful city.

If you happen to be in the state of New York, run to Chelsea Market and visit Very Fresh Noodles. They deserve your last paycheck. Oh how I miss New York.

Back in 2018, I was on a vacation to NYC. Very Fresh Noodles was the first place I've ever had hand-pulled noodles and I absolutely fell in love with the dish. When I went back home to CA. I was on a journey to find something like that but nothing had come close to Very Fresh Noodles. I had waited for so long to come back and 5 years later, I'm finally back! The first stop back in NYC had to be the Chelsea market. It didn't matter that there was a long line, I just had to have it. I waited about 20 minutes before my turn to order. This is what I got!

Cumin Lamb Noodles Dry
- The hand-pulled noodles were no doubt the star of the dish. It was chewy but easy to eat. It had such a nice springy and silky to chew on. The sauce was flagrant, a strong cumin aroma complimented the nuttiness of the chili oil. It was tangy and not too spicy, but a really well-balanced flavor. The flavor profile is pretty friendly to most people. The vegetable allows a break from the main flavor. The thin-sliced lamb was tender, elevated the dish even higher. I ordered dry because the rich sauce flavor coats the noodles better than the soup. It makes every bite that much more enjoyable.

All and all, the food was delicious and the staff were cool. It didn't matter how long I had to wait. It was worth it.

We visited Chelsea Market and were overwhelmed by the sheer excess of different foods to try. Having seen a decent sized line for Very Fresh Noodles, we decided to give them a shot. Overall, noodles were tasty, but the main downside was that they were all excessively oily. They offer dry style and soup style noodles, with the majority of the selections being on the spicy side.
Other than that, service was good, the line moved quick and the portions were a decent size.

I was recommended this by one of my friends and I honestly forgot about it until I walked past and was like, wait! The food comes out fast and you get a free show. They give plenty of meat and flavors were all good. I just wish it was a tad less salty.

I am not usually a soup fan, but a friend ordered this for us to share and I will say I am impressed. Almost makes me want to try more soup style dishes!

This place is located inside Chelsea market. We came on a Saturday which was BUSY but overall with waiting in line and receiving  food, it really didn't take that long!

If you are like me and like spicy, this perfect. It was hot but in a flavorful way! Super flavorful as well!

Just finished having lunch here and wow the wait is worth it!

I got the tingly & spicy cumin lamb dry and it was so savory! The spice kick is subtle and mild. I can't express how much I enjoyed this plate, the veggies, seasoning, and noodles were even better than I expected. The line was a bit intimidating and long, but once you order the food is literally ready in minutes. I had the lychee and lemongrass margarita, which is frozen, I really enjoyed it and it was so refreshing on such a warm day. The basil seeds were a hit and miss, I personally liked them, but my significant other hated them!

BEST noodles I have ever had. I'm from the Bay Area in CA and so we're known for our Asian spots, but this place was incredible.

The noodles were so chewy and had the perfect bite to them. Flavors were great and loved the tons of cilantro. Beware of the spicy vegan dry noodles because they really are spicy so make sure you can tolerate it!

However if you can tolerate spice, the vegan Dan Dan noodles are a must and a more mellow version is the vegan chili glass noodles!!!

These noodles are a must every time I am in the area! They have two different vegan options for the noodles. The spicy vegan noodles are not very spicy but you can also ask for them to not be spicy if you are sensitive to spice. The Dan Dan noodles are spicy but delicious!
Overall you can't go wrong with either choice and probably want to go back just to be able to try both of the options!
It is best to go during the work week as it is not very busy but on the weekends and holidays the line can be very long.
There is not much seating inside but there are tables outside of you could always walk over to the little island to enjoy your food.

The noodles! It's a must try! I love beef soups and this was delicious! The vegan Dry noodles were perfect if you didn't feel like a soup, I wish we had grabbed the other vegan option just to try. We arrived literally minutes before the crowd around 4:40ish and we were able to snag two counter seats. I would highly recommend this place but given that it's in a market, be flexible and ready to wait, it'll be well worth it!

My entire family loves Very Fresh Noodles. I'll be bold and say that this is the best food in Chelsea Market (sorry Los Tacos No. 1!), and you should absolutely stop by.

My order: Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup on Spicy. The noodles are so chewy and flavorful, and the soup is deliciously spicy -- and hurts so good !!! My family is partial to the Dan Dan Noodles, which I've also tried (they're amazing) but the Beef Noodle Soup's spicy soup is really what takes the cake for me. Something about sipping ridiculously spicy noodle soup on a hot day or a cold day does it for me....

Line and wait absolutely worth it here. A must-try. If you're a tourist, trust me when I say that this will turn you onto NY food forever !!! seriously so amazing

This place was right inside the Chelsea Market and as expected, it took a bit of time before you are able to order and get your food. On top of that, the seating is very limited so prepared to look for a free table elsewhere. Other than that, the signage was actually very cute and there was an bar space with a view to the kitchen where you can see them slapping the noodles on the counter!! The noodles were very nicely made and had a great texture. The soup was a bit salty so expect to dilute it down with water if you prefer less salt. The disappointment was the cucumber. This is because the cucumbers were not crunchy such as ones made with Persian cucumbers. Without the crunchiness, the dish loses an important aspect of smashed cucumbers.
One thing that they did well was that they wrap the food very well with 2 layers to prevent your soup from spilling so this would be a good one to deliver with no fears of spilling! It's worth a try but it wouldn't be a usual spot for me since it's inside the Chelsea market.

Hand pulled noodles?! Count me in lol. We visited while taking a stroll on The High Line, as it was conveniently located in Chelsea Market. There's a whooole lot of food and restaurants here, and Very Fresh Noodles was one of the spots we decided to try out!

The line seemed intimidatingly long, but definitely don't be discouraged from queuing. The food here is so good, and they had so much variety on their menu too!

My BF and I shared one plate of the dry tingly and spicy cumin lamb. The noodles were delicious; they were bouncy and chewy and indeed tasted "very fresh" lol. The sauce packed a whole lot of flavor; it was a mix of cumin, sichuan peppercorn, and chili oil. There were also some bits of celery and mixed greens bunched in with the dish.

When ordering biang biang noodles, I always look for a strong tingly and numbing flavor. It was a little more mild than I usually like, but was still delicious overall.

Service was quick, there isn't a whole lot of seating if you're expecting to sit inside. Since it's only bar seating people come and go fairly quickly so finding a table isn't too big of an issue!

I ordered the spicy vegan dry noodles, which came on a giant paper plate. Very filling, very delicious.

Since the inside of Chelsea Market, and specifically this area is very loud and busy, we enjoyed the food at a table outside.

Rating 4 stars because the line was insanely long (you will need to be patient) and as soon as I got up to the front to order, the lady taking orders spent 10 minutes organizing chopsticks and napkins. I was unable to order until she returned, so I waited about over half an hour total. I did not have to wait too long for the food to come out, though.

The noodles were great and really flavorful, so I am glad I was able to experience it. I am not sure I would return to order again unless the line was shorter and I knew I could place the order quickly.

This place and Xians famous foods just know how to do hand pulled noodles in a way that's so good and authentic. Although this place has different hand, pulled noodles styles than Xians. It's in a stall at Chelsea market so don't expect anything fancy very limited seating and no real ambience from that perspective, but the food makes up for it. You get in line order and the food comes really quick.

They have tons of vegetarian and vegan options which are super helpful and I would say that the vegan options, rival the meat options in terms of how flavorful and amazing they are. Get cucumber salad because it's a great little fresh bite and we got vegan dan dan noodles which are extra spicy they warned us. These were definitely spicy, but in the best way possible and again very authentic spicy flavor. Yeah, you can't go wrong here get meat or vegetarian, and you will be bought away by the texture of these noodles and the flavor and heat that again it's not overwhelming it just adds another amazing flavor component.

Great spicy noodle!! It was spicy but the pickles were sweet so I could manage it.
Spicy oil on the bottom so don't mix it if you want to have less spicy. And eat pickles when you feel too spicy !

Whenever I visit Chelsea market, the noodle "aroma"would be calling my name. I had the beef noodles when the shop was the size of my cubicle. It was good...and beef was tender. Today, I'm vegetarian and the shop has tripled the size! So I was excited to try it again:

- I got Vegan, dry noodles with mushroom and "duck"

5 for the noodle texture and taste. 3 for the sauce and imitation duck. Mushroom was probably hydrated shiitake and it was just ok. 5 for speed. It was tangy and salty. Not spicy though.

I'm glad I tried it. And that would be the last.

It's not my favorite noodle place to be honest. The noodle never feel cooked. Maybe it's just not the right food for me. Super spicy noodle doesn't taste spicy at all. Note I'm used to spicy food. So I couldn't like their spicy noodle at all. Usually the waiting line is super long. You'll have to wait like 20 mins during weekends. Not a lot of seating area is available. So sometimes I saw people stand and eating. I'm not a big fan of this place.

Lamp noodle taste too greasy that I'm about to puke. I wouldn't come back again.

Hands down my favorite taiwanese beef noodle soup in nyc. Sitting at the bar table, I could watch their chef pulling and smacking the noodle right in front of me. Magical moment.

＊Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup (mild)
The wide noodle was chewy and soaked up the rich beef broth. They provided two spice levels and I chose the mild one.  The braised beef chunks were tender and served in a filling amount. I personally prefer sliced beef shanks tho.

Long queue but speedy service. Their noodle soup satisfied my cravings to its fullest and I can't wait to go back for another bowl.

Worth Returning ? Yes

Gotta try very fresh noodles if you're in Chelsea Market. The line was long but worth the wait. Love that the noodles were made right there and texture of the noodles was perfect. The broth was a good amount of spice as well.

To be honest, had no idea about this spot as I was browsing through Chelsea Market food options so when I saw this spot, I felt some kind of energy here and had a big curiosity towards it. Then when I read about it and looked up food options for this place, I was sold. I ended deciding to order a little before it closed so things were closing up and they ran out of the normal flat noodles they usually serve their entrees with. And thankfully, the worker was nice to communicate that and their service was just very welcoming and cool with when they finished their orders.

I ordered the La Mei Taiwanese Beef Noodle Soup (mild) and a Lychee Lemonade. It was between that or the Tingly & Spicy Cumin Lamb noodle soup. And my friend's idea was to bring our food we ordered from the Chelsea Market and eat this at Little Island was a vibe!! The mix of cold weather and soup was the perfect combo. Made my tummy very happy and satisfied!

Will definitely visit here again next time I visit!

Came here with my girlfriends during lunch hour. really really busy, waited maybe 30 minutes for our order to be taken, but we didn't mind much since we were able to walk around while the others waited in line.

Food was good, and we luckily found a counter seat. Shared the beef soup-- a bit more sour than I expected, but noodles were sooo good!
One of the best Sichuan food I've had in New York. The very spicy Dan Dan noodle is to die for. The hand pulled noodles have a really good texture that takes things up a notch.

Taste :

So good (one of my top5 noodles in NY so far)

Location :

Relatively easy to find

Service :

Friendly staff

Price :

A bit expensive but reasonable

Ambiance :

very slightly uncomfortable bar chair

Etc. :
If you don't like coriander, ask them for it ;)

At this point, who has not seen a review about this place located in such a bustling market??

We came back two days in a row for noodles here and loved each and every dish we ordered. The meats are tender, broth is very flavorful, and the noodle texture is perfectly cooked!
