The first time we ordered a Cumin Lamb Noodle Soup and the cashier recommended we split the order so we had two bowls of a good amount of cumin lamb soup we could share between the two of us and it was super convenient.

Be prepared to wait in a line though since this place is very popular!

Welcome to Very Fresh Noodles, a bustling spot inside Chelsea Market. This casual joint is conveniently located near the entrance, making it an ideal stop for a fast quick service/bite. The works were nice and helpful.

Let's dig into the Tingly & Spicy Cumin Lamb Dry. The chewy and flavorful lamb had us drooling for more, but our taste buds were left longing for the promised tingle. It was oddly filling and I would be ordering again, earning a solid 9/10.

Quench your thirst with the Lychee Lemongrass Slush. This refreshing margarita had a delightful twist with basil seeds, though they were a bit stubborn, frozen in lumps like we were able to spread it on a chia pet(remember those?). Was the absence of alcohol intentional or did the drink play tricks on our taste buds with the sweetness? You be the judge. We give it a 7.5/10(minus .5 extra if it was stronger).

Now, the Red Bean Soy Milk. While it has the potential to be an outstanding soymilk drink, we couldn't help but compare it to the flavors of the motherland. It fell a bit short, earning a modest 6/10.

At Very Fresh Noodles, you'll find tasty offerings with a few quirks. Stop by for a casual and satisfying meal, but be prepared for a taste adventure that might have you longing for a bit more.

When my husband and I see long lines, we're always curious.

LOCATION: Inside Chelsea Market on the main floor. There is very limited seating - they only offer bar seating (like 8 seats). You can't miss it because there's a huge sign that says "Very Fresh Noodles."

FOOD: We ordered the beef noodle soup. The noodles are hand-pulled right in front of you. I actually liked the broth more than I like the noodles themselves. Some of the noodles stuck together. I asked for it spicy and it was just right to enjoy it but not crazy like the Dan Dan noodles. Szechuan flavors and spices typically leaves your mouth feeling tingly but this one wasn't that extreme. The beef itself was good, too. They give you a descent amount beef. My husband and I shared one bowl because it's super filling. Their lychee chia seed drink was refreshing! Although they give you a really skinny cocktail drink straw, where all the chia seeds get stuck in, a wider straw would do a better job.

SERVICE: We waited 45 min + 20 min for the food. It's worth the wait to try it but I wouldn't wait in line again for them. I didn't love it that much (my fav hand-pulled noodles are in Hawaii). The gentleman taking your order is friendly, they ask you to not leave while you wait for your order. They said it would take 3-5 min to be ready, but that wasn't the case lol I also didn't believe them because there were so many people waiting for their order.

Would I come back? Nah, I'm alright. Would I recommend? Yeah, I mean it doesn't hurt to try it if you never have!

Multiple friends told me that this is the only place they'll eat at in the Chelsea Market, and the line for this place showed that this place was indeed quite popular. There's limited high top seating so you're better off having someone snag a picnic table outside (the heaters weren't on when we went but it's somewhat enclosed) while another person waits in line to order. They do serve alcohol. The tofu pudding drink is a popular option, and they also have an horchata boba which is vegan. You order at the counter and pay, and then are given a number; once they call you, you pick up your order on the left hand side of the cash register. If you order it for here, they put in on a paper plate while if you order to-go, you'll get a little container.

I got the spicy cumin lamb dry (you can also get it in soup). The cashier told us that the spice level is equivalent to Sriracha. One of my friends opted to get it extra spicy, but noted that it's not that much spicier. I liked the texture of the noodles a lot. The portion size was pretty generous and you can watch them hand pull the noodles if you're so inclined.

FOOD - 4/5
The beef noodle soup was so good, but the spicy and tingly noodles were okay, had a good spice level though. The meat was very tender and had lots of flavor from the spices. Noodles were great too, firm and clearly freshly made since we saw them making it in front of us!

SERVICE - 4/5
The line was maybe medium-sized during peak lunchtime, but the time from ordering to getting your food was not bad at all.

AMBIANCE - 3/5
The decor was detailed and artsy/hipster (good for ig pics), but unfortunately not as much indoor/neaby seating  except for a couple counter spots. Since it was inside the market, it was loud and busy so just good for a quick meal  but wouldn't really come here to stay/catch up with someone.

Woah. Magical. I waited for the first pies of the day and it was heavenly. First slices of pepperoni and white.
The White was amazingly soft and creamy. It was slurpingly moist and buttery. Creamy fresh taste, y'all make any of the cheese in house?
My super hot pepperonis slice was meltingly hot, dripping with pepperoni juice and homemade tomato sauce. Lots of sauce, lots of cheese. Ample pepperonis! The pizza maker looks like he's there all day into the night.
Amazing crust. Authentic nyc pizza slice to the max!

I ordered a pizza with a couple of toppings to be delivered. The pizza arrived almost 1 hour after the time the delivery was promised. When the pizza finally arrived, it was was cold, soggy and disproportionally cut. Some slices were huge and some were tiny. The bottom of the pizza box was so wet that the pizza almost fell through the box when the delivery person handed it to me. I believe this was due to steam buildup within the box when the hot pizza was put into it. The box was not vented as some pizzerias do.

We heated the pizza in the oven which didn't help. It remained soggy. The sauce was bland and thin. The cheese was tasteless. The toppings were plentiful, but didn't make what was otherwise a bland and soggy pizza, any more enjoyable.

The pizzas were tasty , warm, and had that NY oil on them. I truly recommend trying this place.

The garlic knot stood out the most! I ordered three but one really did the job for me. They garlic knots had an abundant amount of garlic and oil. The knots tasted so so good with the warm marinara sauce.

I would go back just for a garlic knot!

Yelp has done it again. Here on Yelp you will find the most accurate and authentic recommendations, reactions and food reviews! Pizza is definitely top notch. The texture and balance of cheese and sauce was on point. What makes this spot so impressive is their ability service the amount of people in short period of time and your pizza is still fresh and hot! Great attitude and customer service the cashier and grill/oven master. We decided to eat in and enjoy the scenery on west 36th St n 9th Ave.. Never a dull moment city life.. I stamp this message!
Really enjoyed these slices! Perfectly hot, saucy and cheesy. The garlic knots were good too!
We dropped by for slices and weren't disappointed. Service was fast and the slices were cheap and tasty, what more could we want!

The margarita slice was loaded with excellent fresh toppings. However, too much of a good thing and the crust couldn't hold up. It didn't look good while we were attempting to eat it, but it tasted great. The lemon ice was just want we needed on a hot/muggy day. In and out fast, good service with a smile. Thank you.

Spontaneously stopped by the nearest pizza shop on my walk back to the hotel. I did not read any yelp reviews and went in blindly because I was so hungry and was pleasantly surprised by everything!

I ordered the standard pepperoni pizza with their housemate lemonade. The pizza was fantastic! The crust made this pizza amazing. It was so crispy yet thin. The one thing was the grease. I had to pat my pizza down with napkins soak up the excessive pool of oil. Other than that, I would love to come back and try the other flavors.

I was in NYC and as usual evrytime I'm in the city I like to try a new pizza spot and I came across Vito's. I loved how quick the service was. But even better how amazing the pizza was. I had gotten a plain and grandma slice. The plain slice was perfect from the tin crunchy crust the to sweet sauce. The grandma pie was also amazing from the sauce to the thick and airy dough.

I just happened to come across Vito's while walking back to my room one afternoon when I decided to drop on in. I love the simple, old-school vibe of the place!

When I stopped by, Vito's was at full capacity, so I decided to take a few slices to go. It all smelled so good when I walked in, I couldn't resist.

I grabbed 2 pepperoni slices and a cheese slice and it was so, so good! I also decided to try a garlic knot for the heck of it, and I was blown away with how good it was! It was so moist and full of flavor! I only wish I had gotten more!

Next time I'm in NYC, I'm definitely stopping by Vito's for some more tasty slices and those incredible garlic knots!

4 solid stars.
Came back got the grandma slice and it was BANGIN' !! Sauce had an amazing taste! Cherry ice was decent

This was my first time at Vito's and I hope it won't be my last. This place has such NY pizzeria vibes that it's undeniable. The store isn't huge but there is outdoor seating and most people come in and take out, so it seems like it's not hard to find a spot to eat. My friend and I ordered a half margarita, half pepperoni pie and it took about 15 minutes to come out. The margarita side was absolutely delicious. The pepperoni side was great too but I preferred the margarita. The person who took our order was super friendly and the staff seemed very willing to make a half-half topping pie. The total was about $37 for the pie and seven dollars for two cokes and the glass bottles. Definitely worth hitting up this spot.

Oh man! We were craving pizza while out exploring the city. After doing some browsing on google maps, we decided to make our way over to Vitos. Quick and easy meal and the pizza was so good. We shared a slice of pepperoni pizza and Margherita pizza. The slice of pepperoni pizza made the entire meal. Every pice of pepperoni was crispy and full of flavor (grease) LOL. I thought the price was fair for 2 slices and a drink. If you're feeding 4 or more people, I recommending getting an entire pie. Definitely a slice of pizza I'll remember.

No public restroom. Limited seating inside along the windows.

I finally had a slice at Vito's and it's my new go-to for pizza when I'm in the area. For the past year I've been passing by this place and the smell has been so enticing. I stopped by the other day for a plain slice and I was so pleased! Service was standard, quick, professional.

The pizza was crispy and pillowy, the sauce is perfect amount of tangy and subtly sweet and salty. The cheese pull was amazing! As a native New Yorker, pizza like this is surprisingly rare nowadays. I haven't had good pizza like this in a while. I will definitely try their desserts and other slices like margherita and pepperoni.

This pizza is like a calling.  It calls me a block over from work and I cannot ignore it.  
 The crispy crunchy crust!
The sweet n savory sauce!
The cheesy cheesy cheese!

I thoroughly enjoyed this visit and I'll stop in again without a doubt.

Their Grandma is more of a thick and crunchy Sicilian that needs some sliced of roasted garlic and their marg slice could use some salt & fresh basil, but their regular slice is delightful.  All three were pleasant,  the crunch on the corner Sicilian grandma whatever was phenomenal.

Like I said, I'll be back soon.

Great pies. Recommended by my Bronx friends. Cool Hole in the wall with no boujee bs. Service is quick. Fresh hot pies. Busy with locals coming for a slice or two and a drink. The also have cheesecakes

YALLLLLL. This place is the epitome of a "new york slice."

The ambiance is wonderful, there's a small amount of seating but it works, and the prices are super reasonable for a drive-by slive.

And guess what - they have slices of gluten free pizza too!!! (Key word is "slices" as usually when you are gluten free, for some reason you have to get a whole pizza lol my gluten free pals know what I mean. But you can get just a SLICE like everyone else!) Truly can't wait to return whenever I visit NYC.

Not much for ambiance, but the pizza itself is really amazing.  Excellent hearty crunch to the Sicilian with a nice bite on the sauce.  Plenty of flavor from the dough.  Highly recommend.  Vastly superior to another nearby place which also had 4.5 stars on Yelp.

My friend that lives in New York loves their Italian ice here. Perfect while traveling and getting all of your steps in especially on a hot day. It's so refreshing, we got mango, and tried raspberry, and lemonade. I got small scoops and he got a pint. I also ordered a slice of margherita pizza and it was so good and fresh. It has a small store front with some indoor and outdoor seating and perfect for people watching. They got a busy flow of people. I saw lots of people buying cheesecake too. They also sell a ton of drinks. Service is quick and fast and it's definitely a busy spot. I really enjoyed my pizza slice and the Italian ice. I ordered two in one sitting! I actually liked their pizza compared to the other New York pizza shops. The workers are efficient and super friendly when taking orders. You can order for both dine in and take out.

Small establishment with just enough to seat 12 people on 4 different sections and the staff are quite friendly.

They have some of the best pizza I've eaten, but I can be picky, I thoroughly enjoyed the Sicilian Pepperoni which is more of a deep dish or pan style crust, and has the marinara on top like a Detroit style pizza.

The thinner pizzas have lovey crispy crust and my little dude who's eaten pizza all over the country rates this as a 10/10, for flavor, temperature, and crispy crust. I concur.
$5 for a pepperoni slice, $3.75 for cheese and $3.75 for a small lemon ice.  Manhattan prices but a safe choice for NYC pizza.

A very good slice for this part of the city.

I got the Sicilian and the pep. The Sicilian was nice and crispy, and most importantly fully reheated (I'm looking at you, Prince St for your inconsistent temperatures). The pepperoni was very well-executed as well- thin and crispy, and they don't skimp on the pep.

Overall, it was a good experience, but I didn't find this place to be super memorable. I'll probably stop by again though, because it's likely the best slice in this area for when I'm too lazy to make my way further down south.

huge slices ready to go and new pizzas constantly coming out hot + BYO with plenty of toppings available (including my favorites: ricotta + roasted mushrooms.) classic and charming interior + decent seating inside + large fridge of drinks and desserts. Slices are huge and delicious. friendly and efficient service both times I've been (out of many to come lol.) love that they offer grandma-style slices (+ GF for you folks out there.) coming back to try that Belgian dark chocolate mousse!

NYC style for sure, crispy crunchy bottom with a nice chew, and good flavor and salt on the cheese.  Slightly sweet sauce with an excellent light crust.  Might make me consider other pizza spots besides NY Suprema my all time favorite.
Awesome NY pizza! The white pizza was my favorite although I enjoyed the pepperoni as well. Long line was worth it and the line actually moved really fast.

Vito's is phenomenal. I'm mean really phenomenal. I was stoned, stumbling and getting my steps in, In Hell's Kitchen. OMG. This pizza is really delicious. 5 stars from me with pizza means it's The Real Deal. Thanks Ma'm

even as the world crumbles into banality, good New York City pizza remains beyond reproach. Vito's Slices and Ices served up a good to very good plain slice. a thin-style slice with the right balance of crust crispness and softness, melty layer of mozzarella atop some sauce. classic New York slice--crust, cheese, and sauce flavors that fit together nicely. worth a stop by if you need a quick bite in the Hell's Kitchen area. nice clean modern pizzeria with some seating. staff are nice. sadly, the post-pandemic (inflationpalooza) has ended the Pizza Principle (aka the costs of a subway ride and slice shall be equal) now a slice of good pizza costs more than a subway ride...eh, walking is good for you!

Needed a slice and got the grandma. It did not disappoint that is for sure. There was garlic on the grandma and the sauce had a nice garlicky flavor. The crust was fantastic. I didn't expect a 5 star slice but that's what I got! The crust on the round slice is thicker but it still looked good.  Definitely worth a visit for the grandma slice. Love it.

Great spot for a quick new york slice!

We got two slices of pepperoni and it was great! The pizza had lots of flavor and there was a good amount of pepperoni. Also, the crust was soft and delicious! Not a lot of seating but great service and authentic vibe.

Would definitely stop in here again when in the area!

Enjoyed a really good slice of pepperoni pizza from Vito's last night. The crust was crunchy on the outside, but soft on the inside, and the flavor of the sauce was delicious. Employees helped me and other customers with good speed.

Note: while dining in at Vito's is an option, there are only a few tables inside, so you might have to take your order to-go.

Vito's became one of our to-go places to grab pizza because they offer gluten free pizza by the slice! This is such a rarity because most places make you buy the entire pizza if you need to go gluten free.
The GF pizza is Grandma Style, which means it is on a thick focaccia instead of the traditional pizza crust.
The toppings are abundant and one slice is enough for a full meal.
The service is a bit inconsistent, sometimes we had great kind people and sometimes the service was not great and a borderline rude.
Overall it is worth the trip for great pizza!

I've been twice now and have enjoyed it both times. First time I got a cheese slice and a pepperoni slice that were fresh out of the oven and it was really good. Easily the best pepperoni I've had in the city so far, but I do wish the crust was just slightly crispier. The second time I got a Sicilian pepperoni slice and a garlic knot and both were good, but I'd stick with the cheese and pepperoni honestly.

A lot of people from the offices around here come for lunch so the workers might come off as cold, but really they're just trying to keep the line moving (which they do). Even when I'm with 5+ coworkers we are in and out within 10-15 minutes!

I was super excited to try this place. A bit disappointed. The pizza did not have tremendous flavor. The sauce was a little too sweet. And there is nothing special about the crust. I guess you can't win them all the time. but on the flipside, I asked for a delivery at 8:25 PM and it came 25 minutes early. So maybe it was because by the time I got to the pizza, it was cold...

Vito's was easily the best mushroom slice I have ever had. Juicy, meaty and rich.

Margherita was the juiciest Slice I can remember with garlic and bursting flavors.

Not your typical thin slice NY slice but a little different and I look forward to the next visit. Super highly recommend.

A bit crowded and small and the lady behind the register was super cool in recommending them to me

This is a place I've been looking for awhile. As a New Yorker I love authentic New York slices but those days seem to be long gone. Pizza slices have changed call it covid whatever you want but that old school New York slice isn't around how it used to be on every corner of a neighborhood.

This brought me back to that taste and vibe so i loved the slices I had. The Garlic Knots are not knots they are mini bread loafs definitely worth trying out.

The service is like a New York pizzaria get your slice pick it up and eat. The place is very busy but I understand why after having it.

My friend and I accidentally discovered VITO's SLICES and ICES because we were as staying at a nearby hotel and kept walking by it everyday.  We always saw large crowds of people here and we knew we needed to try it!

Unfortunately what I did not know was that VITO's is not necessarily a NY Style pizza but rather a Sicilian style pizza. The pizza had a thick / spongy crust definitely was distinguishable fro mother types of pizza such as thin-crust Neapolitan, Roman, Chicago and NY style pizza.  I ordered the mushroom slice with extra olives and also got some sparking water.  For about $5 a slice, it wasn't bad.  

It was a bit salty for my liking and somewhat oily, it was decent.  I would say I have a preference for NY Style pizza but I'm glad I came here to try it!

1st time as an adult in the New York área and of course pizza had to be on the Menu. This was a random find that Apple helped me find but it was worth it. I love the pepperonis that curl up. The pizza was a good size, we ordered 2 pepperoni and a white pizza. They were a bit on the greasy side but after a few dabs with a couple napkins it took care of that issue. Those 3 pizza with 3 drinks total was $25 which I thought was fair for the city.  It's small inside with very limited seating and no public restrooms but I think this is a New York City thing because no establishment had restrooms for the public.

Classic NY slices. Thin, crisp, delicious sauce and cheese - really good! The ices were really good too - fresh fruit flavors, not the old school artificial stuff (which I also like).  Friendly fast service, steady stream of customers keeps the pizza fresh.

The best dining recommendations come from employees who work nearby, and that's how we ended up on the corner at Vito's for a slice on our recent stay in Manhattan. The quality of New York pizza is legendary. The fact that we went back for more from Vito's speaks to how tasty their pizza is: thick, fresh, with generous toppings and the perfect marinara sauce. We had the Margherita, the sausage, and the cheese. Slices are under $5, and you can also order a whole pie. They keep a variety of freshly made pies by the slice displayed in the front case, since there's usually a line of folks waiting to purchase The Italian ices are made in-house and are fresh and delicious as well. They also have some pre-made desserts available by the slice, including cheesecake and Key Lime pie.

There's a small dining area in the front window and at the side of the counter, but it's mostly grab and go.

When it comes to an authentic New York slice, this is your place. It's not the other super famous places, but it lives up to the hype of "the New York slice". I came in at a 6Pm on a Sunday and was glad to see a crowd and slices being served.

I ordered 3 slices, of which one was an experiment slice and the other 2 were classic tried and tested slices. The first slice was the pepperoni, amazing cheese flavor, nice and warm, and spicy pepperoni (found that it's rare to get spicy pepperoni)

The second slice was a margarita and let me tell you, this slice was heaven. Perfect cheese to tomato sauce ratio, crispy crust, doesn't fold and flop, stays absolutely straight, and a flavorful basil. I could ask nothing more for a slice like this and it is to die for. Prices are around 5$ for a slice.

The last slice was a sausage and onion, although yummy, the onion doesn't add much depth of flavor and the sausage is very standard. It's basically just an over glorified cheese pizza. Wouldn't recommend, but at the same time it's not horrible.

If you are in this area you must eat here, 10/10.
Pizza was very good. No flip, crispy, sauce is really good. Def a must go to pizza shop.
Terrific large slices.  As good as it gets.  And air conditioned on this hot, very humid day.  I'll be back.

We stayed nearby at the Crown Plaza Midtown and our bartender recommended this place as his go to pizza joint. We grabbed  few slices togo.

They were decently priced and pretty fresh. The bartender did not disappoint us at all. I have had other pizza joints and there was always a long wait. This place is kind of a hidden jem and I would definitely recommend trying it if your in town.

Real deal New York pizza n Italian icy I had two cherry n coconut n then mango n coconut.must try. Clean n family friendly business been here for years but, my first time here, I'll be back when I come back to city
Vegan pizza!!! So delicious and exciting to have this option! We tried the vegan (only one option but delicious), the pepperoni, and the margarita. They were all excellent. Hidden gem.
Very yummy pizza by the slice near our hotel. Lots of options and good desserts. I would definitely come back here again.

Yes, we had a dinner reservation in a little over an hour but when the pizza craving hits who am I to deny it?

The line can be prohibitive and was on a later visit when we were crunched for time but if you are willing to wait, many pizza varieties await you. I was actually pleasantly surprised to see VEGAN pizza which I ordered because I'll gladly take any opportunity to reduce my diary intake. They also offer gluten free pizza if the signage is accurate.

I had never had vegan pizza before and while it wasn't quite the same as the real thing, it was pretty decent. The crust held up against  the sauce and cheese and there was no detectable sog.

GF ordered the grandma slice which was DELICIOUS. She actually returned the following day and we sampled the margherita which was also enjoyable.
Thank you Vito for providing excellent pizza!  I always stop by when I visit Manhattan!
Pizza was pretty good but not the best I ever had. I loved the greasy feel of the pizza and the fresh basil on my margarita pizza that I added pepperoni slices to

Must Dos when visiting New York City!
Vito's offers whole and by the slice pizza.
Delicious fresh toppings and you know it's a good pizza when you enjoy the crust as much as the pizza!
We enjoyed the Italian Ice - the small was the size of a bathroom cup but it was a good sampling of the Pineapple!

Great for groups after work happy hour. I recommend the buckets o beer. Good sharables include the flatbread pizzas and chicken quesadilla.

Service was fast, friendly, and accommodating. Very glad to have worked with them and will be back

Food is just ok. They did a bad job of accurately describing what each meal was or how drinks would taste (basically, bad recommendations), so that soured the experience. They were also missing a bunch of items from the menu, so half the things we tied to order weren't available. However, they said this was because they were in the process of switching menus.

I didn't end up eating my burger given everything (waited described it was an aoili sauce, but I was given a ketchup or mustard based sauce instead), but I'm sure something else would have been better. I don't think they really noticed though. But overall, eh. The atmosphere is inside was nice though!

Reserved a weekday early evening, asked for an 'outside' table, and got it. Weather was a bit cooler , so they turned on the heat lamp for us.  

(It did rain a bit near the end, which caused others standing around to run inside, and some crowded next to our table, but that's just normal rudeness, and not on Versa).  

Staff was great, had wine and cocktail - Manhattan was nice.
Calamari was breaded and fried nicely. Ravioli was good, salmon was amazing and a really big portion. Waiter said the green curry is not spicy, but it was - but I am ok with  that. If you are NOT ok with spice, don't order it.  

Cheesecake was great, blackberry compote was a nice balance.

They did try and get more drinks from us,  and seemed a bit bummed when we did not - maybe another day. Would look to do the bar, the inside table area was VERY loud (think cafeteria loud) I would not be able to tolerate that.

I'd say this is a casual but elevated sports bar.  Comfy booths, decent amount of tv's, plenty of seating. Service was kind, attentive, and very quick. The Caesar salad was good, I added chicken, and my friend really enjoyed the French onion soup and risotto. We had no issues getting a reservation either. Some of the cocktails sounded great but neither of us were in the mood to drink. This is a nice spot, nothing super special about the experience but no complaints either.
This place has pretty decent bar food and is good for happy hour with its spacious outdoor area. Highly recommend the beef slider. Calamari, pretzel, flatbread, and fries are good, too.

Absolutely 5 stars!! The staff were not only quick and attentive, but the food was incredibly delicious (the mozzarella sticks were hands down the best I've ever had - they were just amazing!). The venue was well-organized, with fantastic music and breathtaking views. I'm definitely coming back and planning another event there!

Zac Baccaro, the events manager, was incredibly helpful and kind. I believe the on-site manager was Stephy (apologies if I've misspelled the name), but he was also an excellent host!

Lastly, huge kudos to Jillian at the host station , who, despite an injured foot, made sure we smoothly reached our designated space without any trouble.

I'm only assessing the special Rangers event

ENTRANCE - this restaurant and rooftop bar is in the renaissance hotel. You have to take the elevator up to the 5th floor

EVENT - this is a usual Dolan party for those familiar

AMBIANCE - for others the rooftop area is fairly large with an outdoor section and a covered section (in case it rains I suspect)

The feel is very modern with a long bar for ordering and many tables.

PEAK AT REAL MENU - not a lot of options at a glance and prices are up there

SERVICE - for the event the bar tenders taking drink orders were efficient and fast.

Overall I'd give it OK but I'd need to come again for a restaurant outing

During my recent visit to Versa Rooftop Lounge, I was treated to an enchanting rooftop experience filled with delightful sips and delectable bites. With its chic ambiance, breathtaking views, and a menu designed to please, Versa Lounge is a rooftop haven for relaxation and indulgence. Let me share the highlights of my visit, featuring a refreshing glass of Prosecco and a scrumptious Chicken Caesar Salad.

Upon arriving at Versa Lounge, I was immediately impressed by its stylish decor and vibrant atmosphere. The rooftop setting provided stunning panoramic views of the cityscape, creating a perfect backdrop for a memorable dining experience. The lounge area was tastefully designed, featuring comfortable seating arrangements that allowed guests to unwind and soak in the surroundings.

To start my visit, I ordered a glass of Prosecco, and it was the perfect choice to elevate my rooftop experience. The sparkling wine arrived chilled, with delicate bubbles dancing in the glass. Each sip was a delightful fusion of crispness and fruity notes, providing a refreshing and celebratory feel. The Prosecco complemented the lively ambiance and set the tone for an enjoyable evening.

Moving on to the Chicken Caesar Salad, it was a mouthwatering delight. The salad featured fresh, crisp romaine lettuce generously coated in a creamy Caesar dressing that had just the right balance of tanginess and richness. The tender grilled chicken breast added a satisfying protein component, while the homemade croutons provided a delightful crunch. The dish was garnished with shaved Parmesan cheese, further enhancing the flavor profile. It was a well-executed rendition of a classic salad that left me fully satisfied.

The service at Versa Lounge was attentive and friendly, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. The staff members were knowledgeable about the menu, offering recommendations and accommodating any dietary preferences or allergies. Their attentiveness added an extra touch of hospitality to the overall visit.

As for the pricing, Versa Lounge aligns with its upscale rooftop atmosphere. While it may be slightly higher than average, the quality of the Prosecco, the taste and presentation of the Chicken Caesar Salad, and the overall ambiance make it worthwhile for those seeking a sophisticated rooftop lounge experience.

Versa Rooftop Lounge provides an idyllic escape from the bustling city below. With its chic setting, breathtaking views, and impeccable service, it is an ideal spot to relax and indulge. Whether you're sipping on a cocktail  or savoring a delicious entree, Versa Lounge delivers a memorable rooftop experience that will leave you wanting to return for more.

Boo took me here last night to celebrate my birthday. The rooftop views are nice. There was a DJ who was playing fire music. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks. The refresher cocktail was amazing and the perfect balance. My date had a long island iced tea. The bartender was really friendly and accommodating. Food was surprisingly very good. I am muslim and don't eat pork so they were generous enough to remake the burrata bruschetta without the prosciutto.

We also asked them to make vegetarian nachos, which they gladly improvised. The truffle fries were good, but could use a little bit more Parmesan cheese. Both the fish entrées were amazing. The puree On the Branzino was paired really well and the crispy brussels sprouts were delicious. My date ordered soy glazed salmon which was also delicious. Service was top-notch, they even came out with a little surprise birthday lava cake. Highly recommend this place.

I met up with a friend for happy hour during the a nice weather day, and planned so we can stop by here for the rooftop, however was disappointed to learn it was closed due to a private event on a Thursday. The drinks were really good and strong, however definitely on the pricey side. We ended up staying at the bar indoors. Bartenders were friendly. We didn't get the food but the flatbread pizzas looked good. They also have beer towers which is fun a nice touch if you come with a few folks.

Went here for brunch one Sunday. It was about 3 other groups there. I think because it was to rain that it was no crowded, not sure. Food was was just ok. Nothing to be crazy over. Service was fast and waiter was friendly (I guess because it was not crowded). The manager did come over to ensure that we were ok. I do like when that is done. Came back on a Saturday, and it was also not crowded (basically empty). I do believe they have a good after work crowd during the week. I'll have to go back during the week to see.

My friend and I met here due to its convenient location to Penn Station. We really enjoyed it!

I had heard they had a nice rooftop bar area, which is where we ate and drank. You get nice views and it's enclosed and heated in winter.

I had a mezcal orange rosemary cocktail I really enjoyed and my friend enjoyed hers too.

We split the hummus tray, prosciutto flatbread and Brussel sprouts. All were very good! The service was also very attentive.

This place is a great place that is close to penn station or msg. The rooftop is not too high up but still offers nice views. I have been here a couple of times and the food is always great. All our appetizers and meals were delicious. I will say on the weekend they will sometimes have a DJ and if you are looking for a casual dinner it might be a little loud. I recommend this place for after work drinks and food during the week or a place to go before a show at MSG.

Great drinks, great food. Ambiance and service were also very good. The dining area is set up in a way that you can have the experience of sitting outside without having to actually be outside regardless of the weather. Multiple bars as well

Food was mediocre at best - service was absolutely horrible

The food menu isn't huge and is definitely overpriced for what they offer. We got nachos, brussel sprouts and calamari. The brussel sprouts were pretty good, but the rest were very average. Our server was dropping things left and right - she spilled my drink, dropped my knife ON ME, etc. They kept forgetting items that we had ordered and at one point she stood 4 feet from our table arguing with another server about whether or not the calamari that didn't come yet was on our table already or not. She also charged for a beer that was never delivered. Would not recommend and will not be coming back.

Such a cute indoor/outdoor rooftop space for a night out with friends or even a date night. Their menu is pretty extensive so there's a lot to choose from. I've been here twice so far and both times did not disappoint.

Highly recommend the nachos, the guacamole and chips (guac is so fresh!), and the calamari. The drinks are fairly priced for a place in the city and if you get a good bartender then you'll end up feeling nice after two rounds. If you're a fan of mezcal and tequila then I recommend "the smoke show" and the "pick your poison."

Versa is one of those spots where you can ingest the beautiful atmosphere and feel satisfied/full.
Unfortunately, dining out doesn't just rely on ambience exclusively though it does play a huge role.

My first time experiencing Versa was very satisfactory. On a Monday night, my colleague and I were lucky to snag a table because many people want to be there. It was only Monday yet a table outdoors was in demand.
Their ambience merits 5 stars and beyond. An open air 5th floor rooftop, Versa  is the perfect backdrop for dining with friends, a date, family gathering, grabbing a drink with colleagues and/or fill in the blank.

The food was average at best.
We shared the Ricotta Ravioli and the BBQ Chicken flatbread.
I'd say the Raviolis was the better selection of the two  It included 6 large ravioli with a chunky tomato sauce topped with dollops of ricotta.

The flatbread was meh. It was BBQ chicken (which didn't even taste like BBQ) with cheese and sprinkled pomegranate seeds. It didnt quite resemble the BBQ flatbread according to the description on the menu. The menu stated caramelized onions and mushrooms which I didnt detect. The crust tasted odd and the overall flavors were bland. It was shareable for two since it included 6 slices.

Service was attentive, staff was friendly, food average (at least our selections. You may  be better off with a burger).
But it was the atmosphere that won me over. So much so that I would definitely return again.

I finally got back to VERSA again this time for dinner. It was still fairly new that first time, and now it is obvious the restaurant runs like a well oiled machine. Our dinners were an assortment of apps and menu items, and the overall experience was quite good, but I think there's still some room for even more improvement. We did not order any type of alcoholic beverages with our dinner. We instead asked for, and received, iced tea. This is not on the menu as a non-alcoholic option, and it should be.

Our selections were okay. The queso appetizer was good, however the jalapeno slices in it were canned and flavorless, and the chips were slightly greasy. Our dinner selections came out reasonably quickly. I enjoyed my grilled shrimp Cobb salad, and the Norwegian salmon was cooked to perfection. I'm sure the waiter was trying to be helpful, but I don't really need instructions on how to eat the ingredients of a Cobb salad.

The bathrooms continue to need to be maintained a little more frequently.

VERSA is trying to be many things to many types of customers, with its lounge/bar area, its restaurant area, its terrace dining area, and the faux sports bar area. It's just weird trying to watch the staff homogenize all of these, but it does make for some really interesting people watching.

Went here for restaurant week and was satisfied with the deal, food, and atmosphere. Along with some other reviews I saw, each course did take a while to come out. Tbh if it weren't for the restaurant week deal I probably would have given it 3 stars just because the actual price of the food wasn't on par with the taste. For example I got the margharita flatbread as my app and it normally costs $18. Def not worth 18. Maybe 12. Staff was pretty attentive with filling drinks and taking plates, but again food took a while between each course to come out. Atmosphere is cool and quite spacious! Apparently they have a retractable roof, but it was closed on my visit

0 stars if I could! THEY ADD FAKE TIP AMOUNTS to your bill!

I came here for a team dinner as some of my colleagues flew into town for a tradeshow.

The waitress keeps on forgetting one of our drinks and while we played it off, it still happened 3x that night.

Food was pretty good and portions were very reasonable.

However, 0 stars as we split the check where I paid $200 even and even indicated that in my receipt (see photos). Tips were added as a group to another card as this was a company meal and items couldn't be expensed!

Even though I told them as such, my total bill charged came to $342.95. The waitress decided she deserved a $142.95 tip!

After many many weeks of trying to get my money back, they basically ignored me and felt like they did nothing wrong.

PLEASE check your receipts as this is the restaurant that add their own tips!

Found and selected this place on a whim due to it's proximity to Penn station. Contrary to expectations, VERSA was very nicely priced and had great food!

Very friendly staff - We had not made a reservation, but we were kindly offered the bar and were sat right away. The bartender was amazing, personable, and attentive. Had conversations with us and chatted about why we were in midtown, any fun plans, etc.

Would recommend!

I was meeting some friends afterwork & they made a reservation for Versa. I'm very familiar with the area however, I never been to the venue. The venue is located on the 5th floor

When I arrived my friends were sitting outside on the rooftop. The rooftop was spacious & had a nice vibe. They play a great mix of music.  

We ordered some appetizers for the table queso & guacamole. The queso was better than the guacamole. I ordered the spicy pearl.  If you like a little spice in your drink,  this is it.

For dinner i ordered the grilled Norwegian salmon it was excellent. I had a slice of my friends BBQ chicken flatbread, delicious. I was told the Mahi tacos were also good.

Overall it was a great experience. I will definitely return.

Came here for Restaurant Week with some friends. The food was pretty good but the service was not the best. Although our waitress was very nice, she got our drink orders wrong and brought us another table's drink. The food was also was very slow to come out and we found ourselves waiting quite long in between each dish.

Drink: Dirty Blue. It tasted like blueberry, very fruity. It wasn't very strong and I could barely tell there was alcohol in it. I personally very much enjoyed it but I'm not a big drinker. (5/5)

Appetizer: Meatballs. The meats balls were good, not dry. The tomato sauce and ricotta were the perfect compliment. Good appetizer but nothing special. (4/5)

Entree: Grilled Branzino. This was the highlight of the meal. The fish was grilled just right where the skin was slightly crispy but the fish was tender. The butternut purée, swiss chard and brussel sprouts were also so delicious. (5/5)

Dessert: Brioche Bread Pudding. Disappointing that the meal ended on a low note but the caramel on the plate was burnt and the bread pudding was just subpar. The ice cream was good but it was just vanilla ice cream (2/5)

Fantastic rooftop dining! Way better than Tavern on Green. Branzino came with awesome tomato sauce and Montauk tuna was super fresh. Cheesecake was also great! If you're staying at Marriott don't bother looking for another place. If you're not give it a try.

Came for a work lunch with two others and had the Grilled Chicken, Avocado Wrap w/fries.  All around good wrap and the chicken was cooked perfectly.  Service was a bit slow as they just opened.  I'd like to go back for after work to try drinks and other menu items.

Pretty solid place to grab some grub. We came here for a friend's birthday and were seated right away. The drinks were really food but pricey. My Dirty Blue cocktail was $16. I got the avocado wrap and substituted bacon for extra cheese and it was so good. One of my friends didn't like her food though so I ended taking her leftovers home and it was still pretty good. She enjoyed her champagne though.

For some reason though, one of the staff members was weird. He kept staring at us and standing while we were trying to take photos. No excuse me, no pardon me, nothing. Just stands there and waits for one of us to excuse me..

Besides that, our server was so sweet. She's a little tattooed, blonde, and the most lively and attentive staff member. I smacked her in the face by accident at point while stretching (sorry girl!) so we definitely left her a good tip, haha.
I'd come back here, it's definitely a good spot if you're near 34th St.

TLDR: The location is beautiful!

Great views in Midtown and the cocktails are delicious. The flatbreads are huge portions and really cheesy.

Nice breeze and shade.  We were not rushed and had plenty of time to catch up.  Food was good too -  margarita pizza and QuinoaVeggie burgers were good. Their chips and guacamole were some of the best I have had .  For the most part, our waiter had other priorities. However, the manager helped us out.
Amazing space for private events. The watermelon salad and chicken wings are the best. The service is so welcoming. JC was our bartender and was super fun and made delicious cocktails.

Heard about this restaurant through a friend. The drinks were very good and the food was great too! The service was great as well- our server was super attentive and kept checking in on our party. I really appreciate great service nowadays so I will definitely be back!

Fun date night spot! We came on a Tuesday evening after a work event, choosing the location because of its proximity to Penn Station. Turned out to be a great dinner experience with a DJ and folks enjoying themselves in the dance floor!

The food is great: we split the chicken milanese and. Cobb salad with shrimp. Both dishes were tasty, filled with crunchy fresh veggies, which were perfect for a warm summer evening. Sipping cocktails on their outdoor patio offered great views too!

I ordered a vodka martini with olives just slightly dirty when I got it after waiting for a while it did not have any olives. The glass was also dirty so I had floating something's in the glass. While the food was being brought to other tables we noticed that each meal looked subpar. We left without finishing our drinks or eating.

We had high hopes for Versa...

I had been here once on a date and came again to enjoy the rooftop. This restaurant is located on the fifth floor of the Madison Hotel. Even if you are not a guest, you can tap the floor directly on the elevator pinpad in the lobby and go straight up.

When I arrived, the hostess originally told me the wait for two people would be about an hour. I put my name down for the waitlist and was waiting for the elevator to head back to the lobby. The hostess ran back over to me to let me know that a table just opened up. I appreciated her making the extra effort to allow me to sit earlier than expected.

Most of the restaurant is indoors but it has high ceilings and an airy vibe so you almost feel like you are sitting outside. They also have an outdoor patio. The view is not the best as you can't see much over the building wall, but you still gotta love a rooftop and it catches a nice breeze.

To drink, I had The Refresher. It lived up to its name and I loved the fresh mint. My friend was torn between ordering the Pinot Grigio or the Chablis wine. The waiter was kind enough to let her sample both. The first time I came here, I also tried the Smoke Show. Once again, as the name suggests, the mezcal had an extra strong smokiness to it, but it was a great drink for sipping slowly.

For food, we shared the chips and guacamole. It was a large portion size and I loved the pop of sweetness from the added pomegranate seeds. I've also had their cacio pepe pasta and enjoyed it.

Overall, this was a great place to pass an hour or two on a humid eighty degree day.

Nice place to host large gatherings and for views! I came on a Friday night for a friend's birthday and it was super lively with multiple parties in the bar area mingling around.

I got the Versa Burger and The Patio for a drink. The Burger was solid; the bun was a little dry but the rest of it was pretty good; they also give a very generous portion of fries that kind of tasted like McDonald's fries. (not a bad thing) The Patio was tasty but also quite strong; I could noticeably feel it after downing it.

Since we came at night during December, the outdoor area wasn't the most ideal to hang around, but I can tell this would be a great rooftop to hang out during the summer. Definitely recommend this place if you're looking to hang out/eat with a large group of people!

A comfortable and modern restaurant with comfortable seating both indoors and outdoors. It's a great place to meet up with friends for drinks or a sit down meal as the food was great, the service was fast, and it offered plenty of seating and room to relax. Definitely check this out if you want to get off the city streets for an hour or two to unwind.

Ehhh this place was okay. Only reason I give it 4 stars was because the hospitality was great and we had an awesome server (forgot her name and im upset because she def deserves a shoutout). I got the chicken sandwich. My friends liked it. I liked the flavor but the chicken's breading was just not crispy enough for me. Too much to ask if my fried chicken not be soggy? We also got calamari and flatbread for apps. Not so tasty. Didn't have much seasoning. The place is cute though. Drinks were good.

This is a nice place for happy hour after work!
It's located on the 5th floor of the hotel and has a very spacious open layout. You can choose to sit at the bar one side, tables in the middle, or on the sofas on the other side of the room. The rooftop balcony is also spacious and has a clear view of the empire state building. We tried the flatbread, hummus, guac, and fries, which weren't outstanding but still good. I also had the captain blue (a sweet and sour drink) and aperol spritz (very refreshing!). The service was slow, but eventually we got what we ordered.

Had my birthday dinner here on Friday night.  What a treat!  Absolutely loved everything from start to finish.

The open space restaurant is beautiful and the rooftop was amazing.  Loved the views.  The weather was just right for the most perfect dining experience.

We started with drinks.  I started with the garden margarita which consisted of Casamigos Blanco and lime.  It was topped with Cucumber and raw jalapeno which added a nice spicy kick.  I moved onto the "summer thyme" which consisted of Bombay gin, tonic, raspberries and a thyme infused simple syrup.  Was absolutely delicious.  The Rosé was on point.  I've never seen Hampton Water offered on a wine menu.  Pleasant surprise!

The food.  Oh the food!  So full of yum!  The table had guacamole and chips.  The guac had pomegranate!  Very tasty and not something I'm used to seeing in guacamole.  Definitely gave it an extra kick of sweet bursting flavor.  For my main, I had the lamb burger, cooked to perfection, which was topped with feta and tzatziki.  It came with a very generous portion of fries which were fried to crispy perfection.  My company had the chicken pailliard which they say was very delicious.  I don't recall the other dishes.  I was too into mine.  I just remember the glaring reviews.  

Finally, I was treated to a nice chocolate molten lava cake served with a scoop of vanilla.  Warm and delicious.  Super moist.  Molten Lava on point!

Our server, Zack, was very friendly, attentive and service was super quick.

I already have plans to come back as soon as possible before it gets too cold to enjoy that gorgeous rooftop view.  Even if it gets too cold, I look forward to dining in.  

A+ - HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
Food was good, atmosphere was good and service was good. The DJ was great. It was raining so we sat inside but it was exactly what we were looking for.

5th floor of the renaissance hotel. Well laid out with plenty of seating (at bar, tables etc). Large outdoor space as well.  Large menu with plenty of choices, good drink selection.  We loved the giant pretzel. Service was quick. We enjoyed our time.  

Only downside is they were playing the live games on the bar TVs but showing reruns of older NBA games on the big TV screens in the main dining.

Otherwise would highly recommend!

Service was bad. They did not check on our table once. When somebody spilled water we had to call the waiter over to help. The food was decent, but definitely nothing special. The place itself was nice, but definitely did not match the food being served there.

A wonderful space with ab excellent team and costumer service!!!
I definitely recommend that place...

My favorite thing about this restaurant/hotel/bar is that they offer good champagne. The wine list is severly lacking but maybe they make up for it in the cocktails?

The food is basic:
-Margherita pizza tasted like it was from the frozen aisle
-Kale & Arugula salad was overly dressed and had to be returned
-Grilled chicken wrap was bland but I take the blame for that because I asked for no bacon and it definitely needed the crunch & saltiness
-Chicken quesadilla was good, hubby thoroughly enjoyed it (he ordered three during the duration of our stay at the Renaissance)

Service was good- friendly & attentive

Versa is a great restaurant!  This restaurant is for any one looking for a nice night, no matter the occasion.  Located on the 5th floor of the Renaissance New York Hotel. Which makes it a perfect place for literally every occasion.  

Place was super clean staff very pleasant.

Tip: Versa has 3 dining options: Canopy, Patio, Indoor
I love the Canopy and Patio area where you can sit at a table or lounge chair.

Don't worry about bad weather retractable roof.
The food was subpar but the views and ambience made up for it! You can still get a glimpse of the rooftop view without sitting outside. Also has a convenient location to penn which is a plus!

Okay the bar vibe is great here. I really liked all the cocktails and the service around 5-7 each night we stayed here. The espresso cocktail, the patio cocktail, both great! What I didn't love was breakfast. The breakfast burrito was good, but the home fries were sad and not hot or fresh tasting. I was happy with the burrito though :) but I'd definitely recommend coming here for drinks. Lots of Harry Styles concert goers were in for his 15 day tour here.

After my 5.5 hour flight into NYC, I decided to grab some dinner at Versa since the reviews looked decent plus they had a rooftop bar. The outside rooftop was super cute but jammed pack with no seating on a Wednesday night @ 6pm.

When I asked if they had a open table for 2, the hostess looked at me & asked if I had a reservation, which I didn't. I asked if she had a waiting list & she looked at me funny & said no if there's no open tables then we're full.... I was very confused by this & asked if they only require reservations & she looked at me strange & said of no..

We finally found a seat at the bar where our bartender was super nice. He was attentive & even handcrafted a speciality cocktail created just for me. This made the experience so much better.

I got the BLT wrap which was good but nothing over the top. Atmosphere was the best part!

Giving three stars mainly for the food. We had a group of 8 go in on a Sunday when there were barely any people in there. Initial greetings were fine as well as ordering. The food itself was really good and would recommend the sriracha chicken sandwich. The service was hit and miss, as I said before the restaurant was pretty empty, they missed a couple of drinks off our order and then once they were brought, no one was ever came back to check if we wanted any other drinks, we had to flag down a busboy to ask for some extra condiments. So this place was really nice but the service was not fantastic. Food was great though

Tried this for a date night around 10pm rez on a Wednesday.
PROs
-First of all, great wait staff. SHOUT OUT to our waitress Caroline!! Lovely, so nice, helpful, she gave us a full tour of the place even at the end of her shift! This woman deserves something good from you Versa!
- chicken sandwich was yummy!
- decent prices for a roof top in NYC

CONS
- bathrooms were  besides needing a serious Reno, there was piss everywhere, smelled horrible. Flies. No soap in the dispensers. No one had checked on that place all day.
- unprofessional security staff, rushing and bossing around waiters to hurry up. One seemed audibly annoyed when I walked in for my 10pm reservation. I understand it must have been a long shift but keep your opinions to yourself.
- it was a lovely night but unfortunately the outdoor seating area was already closed by 10pm. Bummer.
- you know when your fries from McDonald's get cold and they are dry and stale and hard? that's how Versa's fries were. It's fries, come on! gotta be fresh and good!
- the rooftop is only on the 5th floor so views are fine

Summary: try another place.

It was not a great experience from the moment I arrived. I was looking for a cute roof top to enjoy lunch with my friend and daughter on a lovely Monday afternoon. I called prior to ensure that no reservations were required. When I arrived I was not greeted by the hostess right away. Once I said  good afternoon the hostess acknowledged me and asked if I had a reservation. I told her no but I called prior to ensure none were needed. Her response was ok and she proceeded to walk us to a table. The table she took us to did not have any backrest  to them. They were more like bar stools. So I asked the waitress if it was possible to move to a table that had backrest since I was with a child . Granted she's not a baby but I wanted to be comfortable. She did move us but seemed annoyed. I was determined to not let this spoil my beautiful afternoon. I ordered the cheese dip and a flatbread pizza. I love food so when the cheese dip arrived room temp I was very disappointed. I've had many cheese dips in my life and never once was my cheese dip room temperature . I was expecting it to be warm or even hot. Maybe it's just how it's served here. So I continued to eat my flat bread pizza. It was nothing special. Not even good. It's not hard to have a decent pizza on the menu . So I ordered the fried calamari since I was hungry in hopes that it would at least be good. It was ok but the breading kept coming off. At least the flavor was good and I was able to eat it. The setting was cute and trendy but the food was a deal breaker for me. This place is more just for drinks and photos. If you come  here don't waste your time with the food. Hopefully you can catch friendlier staff. As we were leaving no one even said thank you or good bye. It was extremely awkward.

Vanilla Gorilla Cafe shares a sidewalk courtyard with the Doubletree Hilton. There are quite a number of outdoor benches available for public use. This is a perfect spot to kill time until the fabric stores in the garment district open.

Wanting to escape the throng of people walking down 8th St, and needing to stop somewhere to rest our feet and grab a bite to eat, my wife spotted this Vanilla Gorilla Cafe location on a corner, right next to a Hilton Doubletree Hotel. She was drawn by the cute gorilla mascot logo, and I'm glad she choose this location. Walking in at around 12:30 in the afternoon, the interior was completely devoid of any other patrons. There are several tables available inside to sit at. And due to the lack of any other customers, we had our choice of seating in the small, yet very clean and inviting interior.

Service here is very friendly, and they certainly did not have any shortage of staff working behind the counter. Jhanela rang us up and prepared our food and drinks. We genuinely appreciated her kindness and patient demeanor, which was quite the stark contrast to the typical New Yorker gruffness we've gotten accustomed to experiencing in NYC.

We ordered some coffee, a Nutella cookie, and a toasted Poseidon Tuna Sandwich. I felt the tuna sandwich to be pretty average and not really worth the $10.95 price tag. But the Nutella cookie was 100% the highlight of our lunch! It was served warm, and was filled with gooey, delicious Nutella on the inside. It was pretty sizeable too, and I was able to share half of it with my wife. At $3.50/cookie, it was not only more delicious, but definitely a better value than Levain Bakery's famous chocolate chip cookie at $5 a piece.

Vanilla Gorilla was a really nice, quiet break from the fast-paced environment outside. And perfectly located for some people watching outside. Definitely a welcomed, albeit brief respite for our lunch.

- large iced oat latte (no soy)
- comfortable seating on the sofa
- fast wifi
- almond croissant was good

Overall, good coffee shop in the area. Lots of space to sit, comfortable, and super funny cashier (he was wearing a comedy cellar shirt).

Will come again to try more and review their food.
Food was supposed to croissant but was smashedbtortilla w salsa. Coffee was supposed to be mocha but I got watery lukewarm hot chocolate. Brutal

Was walking around the city in hopes of getting to Time Square and came into this cafe from the pics I saw outside and boy am I glad I did.  Had the smoked salmon sandwich and it was DELICIOUS. The bread with light and crispy and warm. The sandwich was the best  Salmon sandwich I have ever tasted. Be sure to stop here and give this place a try. The coffee was also really good.
Cute cafe with very friendly and patient staff who answered our many questions. A delicious cappuccino and black coffee. The breakfast pastrino was good but a little greasy.

A decent place for a carryout breakfast is on 8th Ave near PABT and next to Angelina Bakery.

The "Pastrino" is the special must-get here, food-wise. it's a wrap made from croissant dough. It's tasty and a bit flaky but has more dough than a regular croissant and flatten down.

And the fillings are quality, I had Tomato Mozzarella Pastrino a hot and buttery flat Croissant wrapped around melted Mozzarella, sundried tomatoes, basil & pesto.

YUMMY

P.S. the coffee is good too, lol
What a quiet place, stopped in around 3pm and the place wasn't too busy.  Got a pumpkin spice latte and wasn't disappointed.  I need to go for lunch one day and grab a sandwich, it all looks good!

Honestly, usually I'm writing long reviews but just go there ASAP
I love loved it !!!!

I had been to one of the other Vanilla Gorillas before. I was walking along 8th Avenue and decided to stop in and get the smoked salmon sandwich, which I really liked in the past. The space is small, a square with limited seating but clean and the staff is efficient. i waited on line and i ordered the smoked salmon sandwich and a bottle of water. I waited for a table to become available [some work people were working at table seating four people and with their laptops and knapsacks, there was little room at this space} They eventually finished their work and I was able to sit down. The sandwich came on a small aluminum tray lined with a blue and white paper and the sandwich was wrapped, cut in half at an angle and three pickles were off to the side. The smoked salmon came on a warm ciabatta roll [you also had your choice of a brioche] with cream cheese, red onion and cucumber slices. It was a great sandwich and was very filling. I would recommend stopping in for a quick and filling lunch. There are many other sandwich options to choose from and I would return.

Service is great and staff is great here however when it comes to the prices they seem a BIIIIT pricey - especially since a Medium iced coffee looks smaller than a tall at Starbucks and costs $4.50. Had like half the cup full of ice and only got a splash of oat milk. Quite disappointing
Lots of options! Most friendly barista I've ever encounter. I got the iced hazelnut and honey latte and it was delicious
Such kind staff and their vegan pizza sandwich is amazing! Very clean and calm shop! Highly recommend!

Placed an order for pickup while I was in NYC.  Staff was great, very friendly, great customer service.  They were able to prepare an order for 12 people in a timely manner and labeled every item for us.  Food ordered were delicious.  No complaints and will definitely recommend
Coffee isn't up to par. Much better options nearby. The only thing going for it is the location.

Great customer service. Had a breakfast pastrino & cold brew. Took my name & maybe forgot about me!?! Either way, I wasn't pressed for time & they called me up, apologized & offered a free pastry or coffee refill. Pastrino was excellent with the right amount of heat. Cold brew was avg but refreshing
Ordered iced cold brew coffee and zucchini bread. They have a good selection of coffee.  Staff is friendly and helpful.
Nice little shop next to my hotel.  Food was great and the service was even better.  Get the Nutella cookie warmed up!

I always get the same things here. these are the must-try items.
SECRET MENU ITEM: pan fried mai fun topped with saucy egg white, veggie lamb, shiitake mushroom, and cilantro
Wheat gluten - curry, soy sauce, sweet and sour, bbq
Veggie salted fish fried rice

Came here on a Friday afternoon, and it was completely empty, just my vibe. The waiter saw me enter, and gave me menu. She left and came back after 5 mins, and I asked for a few recommendations. She was kind and great, and accommodated my friends and I, and our taste palettes.

We got one boiled spinach dumplings and one boiled seseme dumplings, and they came out hot and steamy within 5 mins. My friends and I tried one of each, and for vegetarian dim sum, this was very impressive. For vegetarians its hard to come by a place like this, but man aren't we glad this exist. Obviously not good as compared to normal dim sum, but accounting for accommodations, and the peace of mind to not ask about if anything had meat, this was great. The spinach dumplings were solid (3 for 6 dollars), and the seseme dumplings (3 for 6 dollars) felt very much like a boiled soft ball with a thick peanut butter inside. It was sweet, but any more than one would be too much in my opinion.  They also provide tea instead of water, which is always a green flag when it comes to asian eats in ctown.

Great vegetarian option, no line, fast, efficient, and helpful service when asking questions. Would come back with vegetarian friends to try more of the menu. Keep in mind it is cash only, but it is also slightly more expensive then your typical dim sum place in ctown (still nothing too crazy).

Service is awful. My friends and I had the worst customer service experience.

No hype

I came here on a Sunday night and the whole street was blocked off with tables. It was such a mood! I sat outside to enjoy dim sum in fresh air. Buuut kind-of regretted it since  the garbage smell traveled my way multiple times. Good ol Chinatown juices..

By the way this place is CASH ONLY!

I ordered a nice mix of plates from dumplings, to buns to sticky rice and soup. The yam ginger soup broth was too sweet for my taste, but I fished out the pieces of sweet potatoes. I liked the Sticky rice in lotus leaf and Cabbage buns a lot. The only thing with the sticky rice, there was one bite that tasted off so not sure they were fresh. Lo mai gai is my fav dish ever so I wasn't pressed about it. The Spinach dumplings were weird..they were filled with white stuff which I didn't know what it was. They also seemed overcooked since they were falling apart as I held them with chop sticks. I was expecting clear dough full of spinach on the inside so pretty disappointed with those.

Service was quick but my server didn't speak English as I had questions about ingredients. So one of the employees tried to explain in Spanish which I sort of understood. Then 5 people came outside and we did some pointing at the menu. Still don't know what's inside of the dumplings lol.

I'd say this place is pricey! Each plate was $6-7 for a tiny portion. I've had tastier vegetarian dim sum so I don't think I'll be back.

A lovely stop for some quick vegan dim sum! It gives off such a homey vibe - I just wanted to stay here forever :)

I ordered fried turnip cakes, mock shrimp dumplings, and deep friend banana dessert! Dessert comes first, obviously - I didn't know what to expect, but the soft and sweet banana completed the crispy fried parts soooo well. I almost burned my mouth because I ate it so quickly after it was brought out!

The turnip cakes and dumplings were a little bland so I had to add soy sauce and chili oil. I feel like the texture and flavor of both were a bit monotonous by itself, but perhaps you can adjust it to your taste.

Overall, I enjoyed the ambiance and the kind waitress / front desk lady! Please note that this place is cash only - there is an ATM within the restaurant but it charges a $4 fee (for me at least).

Nice to know that this place is still going strong. During my first solo trip to The City my friends took me to Vegetarian Dim Sum House (one of them was vegan) to soak up the copious amounts of alcohol we had consumed.
We ordered:
Rice rolls with mock shrimp
Spinach dumplings
Mock pork buns
Sesame paste buns
Fried banana rolls
And my personal favorite, one of the fried noodle dishes featuring extra crispy noods, mushrooms, snow peas, a mock meat and a tasty sauce.

Aside from the noodles, I wasn't keen on any dish trying to capture the flavor / texture of meat. My philosophy is to allow the vegetables to shine and be themselves. I think vegetarians / vegans and omnivores alike can find tasty dishes to enjoy, so don't be shy to step out of your comfort zone.

Otherwise, expect standard Manhattan prices and no discernible parking. Get yourself a Metro card and explore, eat, and live!

A true hole in a wall, the vegetarian dumpling house provides a plant based twist on traditional Chinese dishes. Some of the things we had were the "shrimp" dumplings, the corn congee, and the "pork" buns. The prices were extremely affordable and you can truly have a full meal while staying within a budget. The restaurant is quite cozy, with the space being quiet and easy to enjoy the meal with your party. Overall, I will definitely come back to the heart of chinatown for an amazing meal

I've grew up eating vegetarian dishes At Vegetarian Dim sum house because my Grandma is vegetarian and this would be her to go spot all the time. The dishes are always as delicious and flavorful! Bring cash with you because they do not accept credit cards, however there is an ATM machine right outside the door. The service is great, they go over the menu with you and recommend some of their best sellers. It's a very cozy friendly atmosphere.

This is definitely more of a "hole in the wall" type of restaurant. It is cash only so come prepared. The prices are fair and service was average. The food itself was just fine, but keep in mind I only ordered 3 plates. I got the treasure ball assorted flavor, deep fried vegetarian crescents and fried noodles with mixed vegetables (not pictured).

*watermelon juice was made fresh
*treasure balls were different in my opinion. it felt like a mashed taro root fried ball. a great basis to add soy sauce/chili oil
*deep fried vegetarian crescents were a fried dumpling. the texture inside had a nice crunchy from the veggies and a chewier filling as well that I couldn't identify. it was different than your typical dumpling
*fried noodles with mixed vegetables (not pictured) was just fine. this is a dish I order at most Chinese restaurants, it's nostalgic to me and I base my reviews usually off of this dish. The sauce was less salty than I would have liked, but still a solid dish for the value

overall, I think this restaurant might be on the "blander" side but that might be because they go lighter on the sodium imo. I don't think this is a bad option in the area and I would come again with friends to try more dishes

I love this place more and more. Every time we go, we order new things, and each dish is exquisite. New favorites: the sticky rice in lotus leaf (I never had lotus leaf before; it has a beautiful toasty tea aroma), the half moon pockets (succulent steamed dough bursting with fresh crunchy veggies and cilantro), and the deliciously savory "treasure balls with assorted flavor."
We're so obsessed with the dim sum that we haven't had much of the regular menu yet - but we will come back!

It pains me to write this review, because after 12 years of loyalty, I am officially breaking up with Vegetarian Dim Sum House. They are the oldest plant based restaurant in NYC's Chinatown, and for over a decade, the go-to group dinner spot for my friends and I. Sadly, our recent meal will be my last here.

The restaurant is dimly lit, with a sparse, charmingly mismatched interior that has not been updated since the 80's. The menu is extensive, offering somewhere near a hundred different entirely vegan dim sum options. Name a mock meat, they've got it-pork, chicken, shrimp, even shark fin. Beer is not on the menu, but they keep the Tsingtao flowing if you ask nicely.

On a Monday night, my group of 7 friends were the only patrons here. We ordered ~$200 of dim sum, which ended up being enough to feed 12 people. No matter, this is the fun of dim sum. Order and try a ton of different things, and even if you end up with a few lemons, there will still be plenty of dishes you like.

We ordered all our usual go-to's. Pork Buns, Treasure Balls, Shrimp Dumplings, Rice Flour Rolls, and a dozen other wild cards. Sadly, the food quality has majorly declined since my last visit. We needed to add ample soy sauce and chili paste to everything, to make it taste like anything except glutinous soy flour, bland mock meat, and oil. Everything was incredibly one-note, void of flavor and complexity.

While Vegetarian Dim Sum House will always have a special place in my heart, I can no longer recommend them.
I went with a friend for dinner during a weekday, and we tried a handful of the mock meat options. The textures were all interesting, but the flavors were mostly pretty average.
So yummy! Love that all the food is vegan ! We shared a large wonton soup, pork buns, honey pork, fried spring rolls, and a mango milkshake

Dim Sum is a weekend staple for me growing up and I love it. My girlfriend is vegan and never had dim sum before. I really wanted to share my love of dim sum with her and this place allowed me to do that. Fantastic food and I just really really love that I could share this with her.

vegetarians come here u won't regret !!!

honestly fake chicken nuggets were 800/10
they tasted so good and the texture was nice!
fake pork buns as well were very yummy. the entire menu is indeed vegetarian and honestly that is a rare find. mock seafood mock chicken mock pork mock beef... literally insane

also in a pretty tourist area but the road is pretty, good vibes.

Affordably priced vegetarian and vegan dim sum! The food was great, although the mock meat is very obviously not meat (if you're looking for mock meat that resembles real meat, this is not the place). It's very clear that there are vegetables and no meat here. The prices are affordable, and my friend and I even had leftovers after. It's more of a hole-in-the-wall place, so don't expect any fancy decor or stellar service (if you need something, like a hot tea refill, you need to ask). Ironically, it wasn't my vegan friend who took me here, so I definitely need to show my vegan friends this spot!

Delicious Chinese food, all vegan.
The dim sum menu is a bit confusing as it has some items that are not dim sum.

We had the mock shrimp dim sum, rice with "fish" and broccoli and the pecking noodle soup.

I reallyyyy wanted to like this place because its vegetarian dim sum! The perfect place for all vegans and vegetarians to enjoy but the quality of the food really disappointed me. I thought the issue would be how the mock meat wouldn't be able to compare but that part was more or less okay. The issue was the actual dumplings and rice roll. They were overcooked and slimy and tasted like bad water. All the already vegetarian items sucked.

I tried the mushroom rice rolls and there was barely any filling. The mock pork buns had an odd texture. The fried dough was tough and probably stale. The cold sesame noodles were especially bad as it was just peanut butter and nothing else (you could see the clumps). The sticky rice was my favorite thing but I wished it had mock sausage in it like the real thing.

The place is cash only but they have an ATM inside ($4 convenience fee). The food itself wasn't exactly cheap, around the same or higher price as regular dim sum. I feel like if you have diet restrictions, you're better off going to a quality place and sticking to whatever the options are there. The bathroom was really dirty and cluttered with cleaning supplies and boxes. The service was good.

Delicious. Scrumptious. Fresh. Filling. Tasty. Hits the spot.

What else can I say? Your tastebuds will thank you for eating here. Bonus is that the street seems to be blocked from traffic so we had a peaceful and quiet dining experience. I highly recommend this place. I'll be back!

This was a wonderful experience for me. I ate Chinese food the first 20 years of my life but I can no longer eat soy or gluten and it's been impossible to find Chinese food that I can be sure I wouldnt have a reaction to.... until today!!! Our waitress was sooooo special and made sure I knew exactly what dishes I could and couldn't have and reminded me as she brought each out. They were able to do dishes with garlic sauce and totally avoid soy sauce, oyster sauce, etc. Many of them naturally didn't have gluten. I'd say all of the mushroom ones were awesome that we tried. My favorite was the rice noodle mushroom curry!! The curry was delicate and delicious. And loved the Hot chili oil on the side. No stomach or headaches, only wonderful flavors and great service. Excited to go back with my celiac dad.

The dimsum here was good, but not great. I like the fact there are vegetarian options for dimsum regardless (though I claim not to be a vegetarian). Also, I love it wasn't crazy busy here on a Sunday like other dimsum spots. Came on a Sunday and was seated immediately outdoors, though indoor is also an option.

We ordered a few usual dimsum favorites, and it was an overload of carbs; vegetarian mock shrimp dumplings, mock roast pork buns, mini sticky rice in lotus leaves, fried wonton, mashed taro treasure boxes, steamed turnip cakes, and rice rolls with chinese kale. On the table, they supply soy sauce and chili oil. The selection isn't bad, but it's more limited next to a full regular dim sum. I liked the food overall, but I still found a lot of it on the blander side. I had to use a lot of soy sauce and chili oil to compensate, but even that wasn't enough.
