The service was faster but it was very crowded so good luck finding a table to dine. The prices were reasonable; infact cheap! I even got frozen dumplings since their taste was amazing. The pancake sandwich was huge and filling. Definitely going there again to taste other dumplings.

Highly recommend this place!

I have a loved Vanessa's for years and last time I went, it felt more doughy and less flavorful . Still good,
But perhaps there are better options to try next time .
Hot chili sauce is a bit extra bit but a must have ! Don't forget I, I always have to back through the line again.

You'll want to make a stop at Vanessa's Dumpling House if you're near one of their five Manhattan, Brooklyn, or Queens locations!

The backstory behind this family-owned business is actually very interesting. The owner, Vanessa, used recipes passed down through her family to make dumplings for friends and family back home in Beijing, China to celebrate the Lunar New Year. And eventually turned it into the successful small business it now is today!

As we now celebrate the Year of the Rabbit, here are a few foods and drinks I'd recommend off the menu:
-Assorted Boiled Dumplings
-Red Bean bun
-Boba

While not my favorites in the city, they're definitely up there! I love the variety of flavors of the dumplings, the doughiness of the bun, and the milk tea was tasty too.

Definitely worth checking out!

Good, cheap, and quick spot to grab dumplings. I've been here a handful of times and I'm glad they opened up some other locations. In Chinatown there's a ton of alternative places to go and get dumplings but I feel like this place is a classic. The location itself is small and the seating area is also on the smaller sides, but it's a no frills type of place with solid food.

I came here with a guest after we had wonton noodle soup at another restaurant in Chinatown and we ordered 2 dumplings. We got the spicy beef fried dumplings and the pan fried pork and chive dumplings. After eating this we were pretty stuffed, but if both of us were totally hungry and didn't eat prior I don't think this would have been enough food as in we may have ordered one (or two) more. But what we ordered worked out well and we left very happy. Will definitely be going back when I'm in town.
Decent dumplings that had nice crispy edges. The best part was the spicy oil which have it a pretty good flavor.

The communication was terrible. I stood at the counter for a few minutes waiting for someone to address me. Each person saw me and decided to ignore me. I finaly said to the older woman  that I wanted to order. Shen then pointed to someone else who then directed me to the register...Side eye...

I ordered the veggie dumplings and the vegan spicy beef. Initially, I was pleased that spicy beef dumplings were accomapniked by some type of sauce, but upon further inpection, it was just chili oil and that it was made them "spicy"---the actual filling wasn't spicy at all, so I'm sure you could order without the oil to nix the spice.

Furthermore about the quality of the dumplings. I ordered them fried, and they were not crispy at all. They were quite soggy as if they had been sitting for a while. In fact, they weren't even hot, so that's how you know they weren't fresh.

I'm sure they would've tasted better hot and fresh, but they were lackluster in the flavor department. They had some vinegary soy sauce on the table, but it was very thin and didn't hold up well to the greasy dumplings.

Anyways, they were quite busy, so I'm sure their other dumplings are tasty, and it was economical, but I'll just stick to going to trader joe's and pan-frying my own.

If I could give it 0 stars I would. Seems like they work on a lottery system here for receiving your order. Just stand back and watch everyone who came after you get there order, eat and leave long before you get yours.
I typically never leave reviews but this one had to be written.
Tasty and well priced! I would go here again just for the dumplings. Both the steamed and pan fried are delicious.

Great dumplings at a great price in classic Chinatown ambiance. I got their fried pork and chive - the dumpling skin wasn't too thick and the filling was good. I'm excited to go again and try their other dumplings.

This is what dreams are made of.
After a long day of walking around and relaxing in the sun my friend and I figured to listen to our internal clocks and get something to eat. We had two requirements: 1. Tasty 2. Won't break the bank
Vanessa's Dumpling House provide those two services and more!
The food was prepared quickly despite the pre closing crowd and was just as delicious as it looked (we both got the spicy house made sauce).
My friend is returning later this week to buy a bag of 25 frozen dumplings to always keep on hand.
I hope to return to Vanessa's Dumpling House whenever I come back to NYC and am in need of a quick meal.

Got the spinach and mushroom wontons which were big, filled with spinach and skin was thin. They were tasty and flavored just barely any mushrooms only spinach. I also liked the sesame pancake with veggies. The pancake was fluffy, fresh and had lots of sesame seeds. This location is cash only; for payment with credit card only $15 above

Really solid and no complaints.  Been wanting to check it out for awhile.  Spicy beef soup (lots of braised beef and excellent five spice flavor) is great and love the handmade noodles in there.  Nice broth.  Not too thick, oily, or salty.  Boiled chive/pork dumplings also great.  Cash only and price is fine.  Paid $14 total.  It was pretty busy even around 2 on a Thurs afternoon last week.  Looking forward already to the next time.

I've never had a bad dumpling at Vanessa's. Their filling to wrap ratio is great and even with their price increase, you get a big bang for your buck. If I'm in the area with the fam, we'll order a couple of different types and just chow in the car. My tiny tot absolutely loves dumplings, probably more than me, which I could not believe was humanly possible. One thing about this place, however, is that they're always packed to the seams and it gets kind of crazy with people hovering near the plexiglass, despite having JUST ordered while there are five people that ordered before them. As hectic as it looks, however, the staff is quite organized with their service. I ordered one time in person but I'll never order on site again. I'll always order through the Yelp app for convenience and have never had an issue with my order.

GRUB RUNDOWN:
Dumplings - We love all things dumpling here. They've never been a miss. My faves include the basil & chicken dumpling, shrimp dumpling, shrimp & chicken wonton, and spicy beef dumpling. Other than that, the guys might also get the pork & chive dumplings as well. We usually order a lot because some of us like the spicy sauce and some do not, including my tiny tot (we're building up her tolerance, tho). In any case, you can always order the spicy sauce on the side. I would also insist on asking for more dipping sauce. Even when we've ordered enough for a small army, they've given us too few dipping sauces so make sure to get extra.

Dan Dan Mein - I have only ever ordered the dan dan noodz with spicy beef sauce and they are really good. The noodles are served with julienned carrots and cukes on top, along with the sauce of your choosing. They're definitely shareable. I love getting a bunch of different things so that we can eat family-style and try a little bit of everything.

Soups - I've ordered wonton soups before and since it's a drive to get home, I'll ask for the wontons to be packed separate from the broth so that they don't get too soggy and break apart. Once home, adding a little broth to them will loosen them from each other, as they tend to stick together. The dumplings are always good but In my opinion, the broth leaves something to be desired; it is a bit bland. I usually order this for my little and she likes it, so it's no biggie for me. I have also ordered the white meat chicken noodle soup for her before and that had way more flavor but prefers the wonton soup, so she wins.

Sesame Pancake - My guys like these sandos. My son always gets the Peking duck with extra meat and hubby will get the beef or chicken versions. I've had the duck sando before but it's a little bit too greasy for me and I find there's not enough meat filling and I can't resolve the need to order extra meat just to make it better, so I've never ordered it again for myself.

To reiterate, I prefer ordering from the Yelp app. It's easy and efficient, and even if you have tons of requests, they follow everything. They will mark all the dumpling packs for you if you request, and separate your dumplings from the broth if you order soups. I've ordered from the UWS location as well and both are the same, save for a bit of a price difference which is weird; some items cost more at either location, I'm assuming based upon the demand in that area. Regardless, when ordering via the app, nothing beats that feeling of walking into an incredibly bustling restaurant, slithering your way up to the front, giving your name and having your food handed to you while others salivate in disbelief.

Pork and chives dumpling with a side of kimchi.

The dumplings were really good and I had it with spicy sauce on the side which was a better touch than the teriyaki if you like spice. I could of done without the kimchi. It wasn't the best but the dumplings were delicious.

Try it with the spicy sauce.

Not bad for Chinese food at an American mall. The Dan Dan noodles hit the spot.

We also had the beef noodles which were hand drawn. My 6 year old who is particular with food ate the noodles so that's how I know it's good.

It's near the Lady M and Van Lewan as a bonus. There's ample seating nearby and it's not too crowded

Pro tip: don't order on GrubHub. This restaurant's food is marked up 20% on that platfom as compared to the counter

Vanessa's Dumplings is my all time FAVORITE place for dumplings and an affordable meal in New York. I love everything on the menu...scallion pancake sandwiches, seaweed salad, and of course their dumplings. It's my favorite place to go when I'm in NY.
One of the best bang for your buck food spots. Gyoza, dumpling, noodles, and sandwich delivered for a cheap price.

Wanted to come here to try the dumplings and sesame pancakes that have been hyped up. I think the sesame pancakes deserve all the hype--fluffy and crispy with a delicious filling. The dumplings are decent as well. I got the pan-fried dumplings, and they had the perfect crisp. The filling wasn't my favorite though, I feel there are better fillings in Chinatown. The chili oil and cilantro sauce was to die for though!

We tried the veggie sesame sandwich! It was really good. I wish we woulda tried the dumplings, but we were doing a tour and stuck to one item so we could try others.   Everything is homemade. The sandwich was made to order!  It was also very fair priced.  This sandwich (we split it in half and it was still a good size) and two bubble teas were less than $12.

I first ever visited Vanessa's Dumpling by union square back when they had recession specials. I was there religiously Their dumplings were literally top tier and the chicken teriyaki is to DIE FOR. I had them recently and I'm glad they still are!

The service is normally pretty great and everything is made to order.

This location was smaller from what was the Union Square location, however you can still sit down and eat. It's a very casual atmosphere, so you don't have to worry about a dress code

I'm honestly tasting the dumplings in my mouth right now.

#thankyouthursday

The food was fireeeeeeeeee, I would go back to NYC just to get more dumplings. I ordered to go since it was pretty packed inside but the fragrance filled the whole restaurant I was dying to eat.

The service was great I asked different questions before ordering my food. They were very helpful it was so hard Deciding what I wanted since everything sound so good.

I wish I would have taken a picture of my food to show how good it looked and the tasted matched 1000%.

My room was probably a 12 minute walk away but when I arrived my food still tasted super fresh and delicious.

I'm disgusted with this place. Aside from the 6'4 POS lunch line beggar  being allowed to stand there harassing EVERY S INGLE COSTUMER for money the food quality in my opinion is just poopy. My dumplings were dry, mostly burnt and tasted stale, like they have been sitting there for hours warming,  and they weren't even warm! Years ago this place was great, ALWAYS fresh dumplings and 8 were less then $3. Now they charge me $8 for 8 dumplings and I'm pretty sure I only got 7. Maybe they are collecting dumplings for the beggar they allow to hang out harassing customers for money. The scallion veggie sandwich was good ONLY because it was fresh, they JUST finished making the sesame bread. BUT it's now 1/2 the size is used to be and the price is $1.75 more. Never will I go there  again.

I am a fan! It was pretty good food and fairly reasonable priced. We did wait in line for a while and it is hard to hear them when ordering, but other than that, it was good.

I got the sesame pancake sandwich, vegetable dumpling, and dan dan mien. Everything was so good. I think I would skip on the sesame pancake sandwich next time because it is literally a sesame pancake (thick one) cut in half to use instead of bread. It's not bad, but not what I was expecting.

Been coming to Vanessa's for years because is definitely is one of if not the best dumplings in the city. I usually stick with the pork. Anything with the chili sauce is a winning choice. Place says it is cash only but I've seen them accept credit cards. They also have an ATM in the restaurant.

There is a good amount of room to sit in there and eat but you can also easily order to go, they are pretty quick to prepare the dumplings.

Came in on a Sunday afternoon - there are no open seats. I'd recommend takeout!

We got the pork and cabbage boiled dumplings with the spicy sauce (chili oil), which cost an additional 50 cents. They had good filling and were 8 for $6. We also got the sour and spicy cucumber which was good. It was kind of sweet too.

We also got the sesame beef pancake - was good as well and would recommend adding some sauce to it. Overall, we spent $17.50 for 3 items. I'd return!

If you're near Chinatown, I'd recommend Vanessa's for a quick bite. Great price, but I was told they only take cash. There is an ATM inside. You can also order ahead for pickup through various food delivery platforms. I got the chive & pork dumplings & they were pretty good (wish I had added chili sauce). Sriracha and soy sauce on the tables inside.

Cheap, delicious, and fast no frills Chinese place.

Oddly enough what I recommend most at this place isn't the dumplings, but their Dan Dan noodles!

Dumplings were flavorful but on the doughier and chewier side, if that's the type of dumpling you enjoy (I like a slightly less doughy dumpling)

Sesame pancake with Peking duck: delicious and very hearty and filling. Crunchy Peking duck with succulent duck and cucumbers.

Dan Dan noodles: bouncy light saucy flavorful! The minced meat adds extra depth to the dish. Make sure to stir!

We come here often, when we are in town.  Personal top picks are usually the spicy wontons, scallions pancake stuffed or plain and Bao.   Try a few of their items, take it to go (and go sit on a nearby staircase or head towards the park nearby Forsyth.  

The cashier is always pleasant and kind when ordering and oh so patient.

Where they lack the luster is with the pick up staff.  I usually like my food spicy and will ask for spicy sauce of some kind on the side, the pick up staff working the counter will almost always look at us like we're asking for gold diamonds encrusted with fairy dust, speak to each other, laugh and then ignore us.  I wish it wasn't this way and it is a small part of the experience, but it's happened literally every time we have been there so seems worth noting.  I wouldn't let that hiccup stop you from enjoying their quality dumplings tho, enjoy!

I've been going to Vanessa's since it was just called the Dumpling House. Probably over 20 plus years. Never a disappointment! Fresh made daily,  a nice assortment of dishes. Easy n quick to grab a snack!

It's a small cozy place with great food. We had chicken and pork deep fried dumplings and loved the chicken basils.

We also had wonton noodles soup and it was great. They accept MasterCard and Visa with $15 min and have soft drinks.

There are 3 large tables that people share. We waited for 10 min for the fried dumplings but other than that they're pretty fast
Dumpling skin is too thick for my liking. The taste is not what it used to be.  Maybe I'll try again in the future.
I had the veggie pan fried dumplings and the peanut sesame noodles with spicy vegan sauce. Not that great honestly--I was underwhelmed.

I just went there and 3 of the ladies that were there just saw and kept on talking. I decided not to give them business and left. They need to acknowledge customers because they will leave just like me. Disgusting!!!
We ordered the Pork and Chives Dumplings, and it was cheap and delicious. Our order was ready before we finished paying. The decor of the restaurant was beautiful.

All I can say is wow. I mean, I definitely had high expectations for this place, but it really did surpass them. My husband and I stopped by here on a really cold windy night to warm up with some dumplings. We were doing our own little food tour, so we knew we could order a lot, but honestly after what we had, we wish we had just gotten our entire dinner here.

We got the spicy wontons (an order each or chicken/shrimp and vegetable) . THEY WERE SO DIVINE! Every single bite offered flavor, freshness, and the perfect amount of spicy kick. Easily one of my favorite foods I've tried in New York. You can't go wrong here!

The chili wontons were out of this world. I would get this every day for every meal if possible.  The pork and chive fried dumplings were very good too. The chili oil makes it all 10x better.  The boiled cabbage and pork dumplings were okay but needed some oil to dip to make it better.  Would definitely recommend this place

The dumplings here are tasty, but we were very disappointed by the noodles. We ordered the Dan Dan noodles, though I believe they gave us the black bean instead by mistake. They were not very flavorful, and the noodle texture was a bit over cooked. My parents definitely make better at home :) The dumplings are yummy but not any better than other options in the area. I'd skip this one since there are so many yummy options in Chinatown!

I can see the appeal of Vanessa's Dumpling House if you were looking for super cheap eats. Among the best tasting dumplings to be offered though- this is probably not it.

I ordered the cabbage and pork dumplings ($5.50). The order took close to 25 minutes to come out, which was significantly longer than I was expecting. Then the dough wrapper was super thick compared to the filling. The filling was okay but not as flavorful and rich as I expected.

I think for the value it was good, but definitely far from the best dumplings I've had

Definitely don't skip this place on your hunt for a great chinese takeout spot!

I ordered 6 chive & pork dumplings for $7.25, the peking duck sesame pancake for $7.75, and the noodle with meat and bean sauce for $7.25.

The dumplings were amazing and just the taste of home I was looking for. I really felt that the peking duck sesame pancake was great as well. It had a good amount of duck, and the sesame pancake was still crispy even though I ordered takeout. The dumplings and pancake were enough to fill me up, which is amazing for ~$15. I ordered the noodle with meat and bean sauce, which is called zha jiang mian in chinese on their menu, but it wasn't really zha jiang sauce. I'd skip this next time.

Great dumplings and sesame pancake here for a great price. I'll definitely be back for those two!

Vanessa's has incredible dumplings for sure, and it's also very affordable!! The chicken dumplings I got were so so good. I honestly just wish I could have more. I got 9 dumplings for around $9. You can also purchase bags of their frozen dumplings to make in your own time too!! The inly thing really is that the place is small so you might not get a seat, but the food quality is amazing!! Definitely recommend!!

Super tiny spot enough for a few tables, cash only. Always packed and for a good reason! The food there is very reasonably priced. I always get the dumplings and the Peking Duck Pancake Sandwich was great as well. You can definitely walk out full for under $10.

Located on the lower level at Essex Market, Veselka Essex serves most of the essentials you know from Veselka in the East Village.
I had the Essex Duo, which gives you a choice of any 4 pierogi boiled or fried, plus a pint of any soup. I chose 4 boiled arugula & goat cheese pierogi which came with onions on top and sour cream and apple sauce on the side. The soup I chose was traditional borscht (hot, contains meat, veggie option available cold). Everything was very good.
Service was fast and friendly.
The only downside I saw was that the food is served in plastic to-go containers even for consumption at their tables.

As a person of Ukrainian descent, I have been a loyal patron of Veselka in NYC for years. Their Piroshkis and mashed potatoes have consistently provided me with a warm sense of comfort and a taste of home. Thus, when I decided to have a delivery breakfast from Veselka, I was excited to try their Blini.

**Note: this image is not indicative of how I received the Blini. However, I was able to massage it into an edible confection after making my own Rasberry Compote and dusting it with powdered sugar.**

The Blini was well-prepared, with a nice texture and a perfect balance between fluffy and slightly crispy. However, my experience was marred by several shortcomings. The raspberry compote that came with the Blini had spilled during delivery, leaving my order in a messy state. I understand that accidents happen, but more careful packaging could have easily avoided this.

Additionally, the syrup provided was a branded product, which, in my opinion, was mainly overpriced with branded packaging. The watery and weak syrup failed to impress. I would have preferred a more authentic, homemade syrup to accompany my Blini.

The final disappointment came in the form of the farmer's cheese. While I appreciate that it's not everyone's cup of tea, I found it to be too sour for my liking. This resulted in an overall less-than-ideal breakfast experience.

Despite these issues, I still recommend Veselka for their other menu items, especially their Piroshkis and mashed potatoes, which have never disappointed me. However, I would advise skipping the sweets, or at least the Blini, until they refine the accompaniments.

In conclusion, Veselka remains a solid choice for comforting Ukrainian cuisine, but there is room for improvement when it comes to its breakfast sweets.

The chicken soup is so hot- it is so perfect for wintry cold days!
The ingredients are fresh, absolutely 5 stars!

We just went into Essex Street market for a quick bite. Veselka was almost completely empty on a Sunday afternoon. We wanted something small so we split four cheese pierogies. The pierogi has great flavor and were perfectly fried. The price is what I would expect to pay ($8 for 4 pierogi.)

I would like to try the other Veselka location in the future, but our pierogi experience at this location was enjoyable!

This was my first time trying the infamous Veselka Ukrainian pierogis at the Essex Market. I ordered the classic 8 boiled pierogis and chose 2 cheese, 2 meat, 2 potato and 2 sauerkraut / mushroom fillings. My favorite pierogi was the meat one, it was so flavorful and the pierogi its self was very soft. On the side was sour cream and some apple sauce for dipping. The pierogis were very oily but otherwise really good and flavorful.

The food is pretty authentic. My brother in law lived in Romania for several years and spoke to the menu hitting classics. The borscht was my favorite. 5 stars - So delicious. Pieroli we're good as well. I like the goat cheese arugula better than the classic. Lost a star on the chicken dish we had with egg noodles. Food came quickly and the attendant was helpful in suggesting dishes. Lots of good places to sit within the Essex market!
Love their borscht. Delicious complex flavor. However charging $3.50 for a can of ginger ale is a buzzkill.
My girlfriend and I are trying veselka Essex for the first time today!!!! I'm having the beef goulash and she's having the chicken Paprikash !!! Both meals are delicious

I've never been to the original Veselka, but love pierogies and couldn't pass these up while checking out the new food hall. I got a variety of most of the flavors and liked them all, but the classic potato was the best. Something about eating in the food hall seemed like the wrong place to be eating them though and I'd rather go to the original location next time.

Great dumplings and soup, fast service.

Inside of a Essex Market, so expect cafeteria-style seating.

I'd definitely eat here again
Delicious Pierogis fresh from the kitchen in the lower east side. A must try place if you're visiting New York!

We tried the chicken paprikash and the veal goulash, each served with egg noodles.  We felt the sauce was too bland and thin for both dishes, ie they didn't coat the noodles very well.  The pierogis were slightly more successful.

Randomly walked by and decided to try the tacos. These are very good. We ordered Al pastor and quesotaco beef Biria tacos and they were very good. The Al pastor were better than the birria.

We received free salsa and chips on the side which were fresh. If you are in the area give this spot a try.

I'm from California and all birria spots at home don't fuck around when it comes to birria. This spot honestly was the best birria I ever had and I don't think I'll be able to eat the from the spots at home ever again.

The best birria I've ever had, HANDS down, and super affordable! It's hard to miss the adorable food truck in the wall facade, and the cozy seating area out front. Every time I go here I try something new, the beef tacos and quesadilla are my favorites. Each bite is savory, your taste buds dance, juice drips down to your wrists, but you don't care. You just reach for a third taco. Big shoutout to the staff for always being amazing and bringing the fire, see y'all again soon!

This place has a vegan birria taco option!!! It is a jackfruit taco which I added some oxacan cheese to (vegetarian instead of vegan). This is by far my favorite place in nyc already and I cannot wait to go back. I've already recommended the vegan birria to a few friends and they all have also really loved it

Omg' bomb ass tacos! They were filled to the brim with goodness, and they were crispy!!  Win! Win!!! The consome was a great dipping sauce that made the tacos sooo much more flavorful. They gave us free chips, and guacamole was $3 extra. The guacamole was good!! It had a hint of sweetness which was nice. All in all, definitely 5 stars. I will return cuz these were sooooo good!!

Check pics below.

Vegan drunk food heaven!

We got the guac and vegan birria tacos and both were so good!! This guac was extremely tasty and the chips were fresh, crunchy and perfectly salty. If you're vegan you have to try this spot.

My friend got the chimichanga and was in heaven so that's probably a great option if you eat meat.

The place is a little window outside on the street and I wasn't expecting much from here because the price seemed pretty reasonable. I ordered for pickup and the tacos were neatly arranged and packaged safely when I opened the box. A lot of meat was inside each taco and I wasn't able to finish all the chips they gave me. I would go back here if I was in the area and wanted something both filling and reasonably priced.

A new birria taco spot located in the bustling Lower East Side neighborhood. It's a "to-go" spot with a dope design. The staff are very friendly and they are reasonably priced, especially for the amount of food you get. I ordered the beef birria nachos ($13) and I devoured it. So delicious! They were gracious enough to throw in a birria taco for free to try since it's what they're known for. Easily the best birria taco in the Lower East Side that I've tried so far. Wow! They are so worthy of a visit over and over again.

The food here was delicious! I had the vegan birria tacos and the nachos. Both were bursting with flavor - spiciness and tanginess from the tacos, and freshness and richness from the nachos. This was a fantastic meal. There's only limited outdoor seating, so takeout might be the best option.

The vegan jackfruit birria tacos were so rich in flavor, my friend and I had to double check to make sure they were actually vegan (yes, they are!). I wish I could learn how to make these myself. Getting these to-go would be the best option, but they do have a couple tables set up outside of their stand to sit and eat if you desire. The staff was nice and quick to get the orders out.
Little to pricey. For what you get ..  nothing special.  I won't be back here.  Thanks though
Incredible flavor and some of the best birria tacos I have had in New York City. I love the chicken tacos.

This place was a gem! I was looking for a quick bite and this was right arlund the corner. I opted for their $20 Delux Barria meal which was worth it. The salsa was amazing. The guacamole could use more spicy and lime. The tacos were delicious. I'd recommend you eat them asap because one got soggy when I ordered it to go. The chicken was well seasoned and juicy. I wasn't sure, but I dipped it in the sauce they provided (or soup like item in White Styrofoam container)- mind blown. I do wish it was a bit more spicier!

oh my god. it's amazing.

the food is phenomenal; i had three pork birria tocos and i finished them so quickly they were the best thing i've had today!

the service was super quick and they were really nice with all of the members in my party

definitely will be coming back :))
Pretty good food. I like that they offer a meal option which makes you feel like you get a bit more bang for your buck. I've only ordered from them once but I plan on coming back again.
Best tacos I've had !!!!!! Definitely going back for more !!!!!! Crunchy flavorful worth the price
Amazing tacos and good service. Very much enjoyed myself when i came here with my girlfriend.

We stumbled on Viva Birria while looking for a place to eat and it was the perfect dinner on a warm evening. We had the beef tacos and the al pastor tacos which were both delicious! They came with a side of slaw as well. The portions are a little small but not outside of the norm for NYC to me. And they have some tables set up outside which was really great. Would definitely come back.

Really cute on the go place! The woman working there was super friendly. When I opened my box I was pretty disappointed they were super small. They were pretty good tasting but not the best tacos I've ever had. You're better off going to a taco truck in the east village where the portions are bigger and cheaper.
Great tacos- perfect for on the go or just a quick bite out front. The 3 taco special is a great deal as well.

This is my new favorite taco spot in NYC they have the most delicious Birria made to order tacos, I've ever had. All the food is fresh and super savory. I really like their concept and service too. Its chilled cool ambience. 5 stars well deserved.

Best bahn mi I've ever had! It was perfection. The oxtail pho broth was so good and the noodles were very tender. The potstickers were crispy and would recommend. This is such a good hole in the wall take out place. Phenomenal, would def suggest coming here!

No frills authentic Vietnamese spot. I've dined in solo multiple times now when I've found myself in the neighborhood needing a quick bite. Service is always polite and quick (never rushed).

Bahn mi's here are super solid. Great bread, good ratio of fillings and bursting with flavor. Today i got the summer rolls which I'd give a 8/10. Flavors were on point but the mint and lettuce were a little more wilted than I'd hope for - still had a crisp to them thankfully. The rice paper had a perfect texture just needed to be rolled a bit tighter. Make sure you use all the sauces and ask for something a little spicier if that's your jam.

Excited to try the pho here once it cools down.

Visited on my NYC trip and suddenly craved a banh mi. After days of searching prior to my trip, I finally found a place I could trust due to the positive reviews. Got a banh mi & beef vermacelli noodles to share with my boyfriend. The vermacelli was not spectacular but the banh mi made up for it 100%. It's the first time I have tasted banh mi like this, almost tasted like a beef tartare.. but it was delicious.

The store itself sorta sucked because it was TINY and I had to squeeze past the staff and people eating inside to order my food but all was worth it. Would most likely come back just for a quick bite next time.
Amazing - tasty and not too salty. 10/10 also quick pickup. Super friendly and nice. Halfway through eating and wanted to write a review bc damn

I've been on the hunt for a good banh mi in NYC for a while, and this one is definitely at the top of my list. I got the classic banh mi and the beef pho. The banh mi bread had a nicely crispy exterior and super soft interior. The filling was delicious (though I wish it had more slices of meat), but it was still really flavorful. The pho was decent. Not necessarily my favorite as it was less aromatic than I usually liked it, but still very good.

Everything was excellent considering the price. The prices were extremely reasonable, and the service was nice and fast. Will definitely be back to try their other dishes.

First Impressions- it was a super hot summer night and after drinks and exploring my friend and I were hungry. Luckily, we still had about 45 mins before the restaurant closed so we popped in, found an open table (it was full even with 45 mins til close and people waiting to pick up their to go order) and placed our order asap

The Noms - I'm super picky with Vietnamese food (having grown up in a family where both parents love to cook and having Little Saigon nearby with all the best Viet foods close at hand). We both ordered Bun thit nuong cha gio and set to work eating... service was scant, but once the food was set down on the table the only focus was eating. The vermicelli noodles were were perfectly cooked, the thit was tender and flavorful. The nuoc mam that came with it was sooo good... I practically drenched my cha gio in it and asked for more!

I'm conclusion- this is one of the few Vietnamese spots I like in NYC... most of the time I would say save your money and go to Cali for good Viet food. This is definitely one of go to spots now

The Beef Stew Egg Noodles was FANTASTIC!!! Highly Recommend and the service was wonderful. We were well taking care of. I also enjoyed the delicious Summer Rolls with soy protein (veggie chicken) So Good! We will definitely be back. I had so much of the beef stew leftover that I took it home to my husband and he loved it!! The best Vietnamese food I have ever had.
A good hole-in-the-wall. Friends love their banh mi sandwiches, I'm a big fan of their dumplings. Don't go for ambiance, go for good cheap Vietnamese eats.

Came here around 9pm on a weekday. Easily found a table, service was quick, and the Banh-Mi was the perfect sandwich. My only regret is that I didn't get to try anything else on the menu, but I will be back!

Little hole in the wall spot with banging food. The spring rolls are perfectly crunchy and delicious. The banh mi is easily the best I have had in the city. I have only had the classic but it is lovely. Medium spicy has a punch but not too much of one. I added the egg and it was a very nice component.

Place is very small but there are a few tables for sitting down. Probably more of a take out or delivery place, but having the food extra fresh when you eat in is nice.

They take cards but not AMEX.
food is of amazing quality for the price. service was extremely fast and server was very generous/helpful. The best vietnamese cuisine in the city

If you're looking for value and remarkably flavorful vegan pho, V-Nam Cafe is it!

The cafe itself is an extremely unassuming spot, tucked away under some scaffolding on 1st. The interior is somewhat small and narrow, but cozy: the lighting is a bit dim, and there's a collection of plants by the windows. Service was friendly and fast--our potstickers were out within 10 minutes.

These crunchy potstickers were DELICIOUS. Perfectly fried to a crispy, golden brown, and slightly fragrant from the shrimp, they paired so well with the fresh carrot and radish garnish! One of our party said these were some of the best potstickers they've ever had. $6 well spent.

At first, I was skeptical of the pho with vegan broth. I've had some truly miserable, watery vegetarian hotpots and ramens at other restaurants. But this? This sets a new bar for vegan excellence. Full of citrus brightness, deep sweetness, and tofu with just the right amount of bite! I added generous helpings of sriracha and hoisin, which may have helped, but that broth--along with generous heaps of bean sprouts, jalapeño, lime, and basil--really gives me hope that quality vegan pho will become more of a thing.

Hard to beat the $11 price. Super happy with this spot!

Ordered delivery, and it's definitely going on the rotation. The pho was still hot, packaged great! The summer rolls were delicious, and could have been a great lil meal on its own. Perfect for a little cozy night in, and an awesome price.
Love this little hole-in-the-wall. Fantastic complex casual flavors and quick service. Reasonable prices. Try the pho. Try the coffee. Don't tell too many people.

This place felt like a warm hug! It's a small, no-frills spot and delivers exactly what you hope for from a vietnamese spot. I got the beef pho and it was super tasty and it's a portion big enough for 2 meals; really nothing else left to say. The people tthat work here are super nice and prices are affordable. Very glad that I came here and highly recommend to everyone.

4.5 stars
Loved the sunfish banh mi even though I only managed to get a few bites. L ate the rest, he usually doesn't care for fish so I didn't think he would eat the entire thing after I left it in bowl. He didn't even know which protein it was, only that it was delicious! Bread was crispy on the outside, soft inside, fish wasn't soggy even after a hr commute. Now I need to get another one and next time I won't share it!
Beef stew and egg noodles were reheated for dinner the next day. I'm not a fan of egg noodles so that was just okay for me. The soup is really flavorful but a bit too salty. I separated it into two portions for myself. There's no way I can have that much sodium. The beef was lean and tender. No tendon. It was good... nothing special but great on a cold day.
I'd def come back for more banh mis and try their pho. Priced reasonably especially for the area.

Came here with a larger group last night and despite the small space, the staff was so incredibly accommodating of us. Everything here was fantastic from the service to the flavorful pho and banh mi to the Vietnamese coffee. Definitely recommend this spot !

I can't say enough good things about this place. The soy protein is some of the best fake meat I've had, and I've had a lot. The pho was super flavorful and filling. Incredible prices for the quality. A little cramped, but worth it. Nice server and fast service. Next time I'll try the bahn mi since other reviews rave about it.

Came here to eat with a friend recently and it seemed like a good restaurant. Prices were really good for the food that we ordered. My sandwich took a while to come  out, but when it did come it was lukewarm, which was a bit off-putting. My friend order soup and you didn't even see any steam coming from the bowl. The waitress never came to ask how the food was because she decided to go on break as it began to get busy (I didn't understand that).

Also, they don't give you shrimp chips on the side (I guess times are hard). This isn't an elegant restaurant by any standards, but you will get filled up on the food here, in my honest opinion. It doesn't break the bank and you can go elsewhere for dessert afterwards.

If you order food to go, DEFINITELY heat it up when you get home.

Lastly, why are dogs being allowed in the restaurant when you clearly have a sign saying "NO DOGS ALLOWED"?!? That's disgusting.

The food is delicious, the portions generous but not overso, and price incredible. Skip Lucien and go here instead :)

Recommend: the Vietnamese Beef Stew or the Ginger Chicken Clay Pot...but you must try the spring rolls first.
Can't beat the quality and price. Staff is very friendly and can accommodate all specific food needs.

So much yes.  Arguably best banh mi in the city.  I get the classic, but there are tons of hungry NYU kids and busied doordash delivery folks who make it clear you can't go wrong with your menu choice.  

Ambiance?  Zero.  Service?  Lovely.  Price?  Stahp!  Give it a whirl and thank me later.

The most reliable pho you will find at this price point. You can have a filling soup here for less than $15. The broth is delicious before adding any of the extras. The beef tastes fresh, and the added works are always fresh. The limes aren't the best sometimes, but you can always ask for another, no problem. It's a small space, but well worth taking a seat to enjoy good pho on a cold day. Will always come here if I'm in the area, winter or summer.

Ordered several times in person and through DoorDash!

+ crispy spring rolls and their peanut sauce is to die for
+ as for delivery, they always followed order notes
+ their classic Banh Mi is my go-to, always delish
+ friendly staff
+ reasonable prices especially for the city
Good food, reasonable prices.  Spicy here actually means spicy.
Great food at affordable prices. My go to place when I feel something coming on like a cold or just want delirious soups and sandwiches
Good banh mi sandwich for lunch. Service was also good. Also ordered ordered a Beef Pho another day for delivery, which was also very good.
What a hidden gem! This might be my favorite Bahn Mi in the city. I would like to come back to try more menu items. You cannot beat these prices!
My favorite place for pho. It's not expensive and it's delicious.  I highly recommend. No complaints.
Fantastic food very consistent very nice people that work in the restaurant  my go-to spot for sure

If you're looking for a world-class Banh Mi, this is the place. The bread had a delicate balance of crispy and soft and the meat was tender and flavorful. It's also really big! Especially for 8.50, this sandwich is more than worth it.

Also tried the Clay Pot Ginger Chickenand it was lovely. Tender meat and large portion.

EDIT: I've been back here so many times in the past month and this place doesn't disappoint. Great food, great service, great prices.
Liked the sandwich and the salad but the curry chicken rice noodle soup was the BOOM!!!

This has to be one of my favorite places in the whole city. So good. Every time. The banh mis are incredible. I've had the tofu one and the soy protein one, both amazing, juicy, spicy, and so big! The prices are cheap, especially for what you're getting. The ambience is relaxing, real, and appetizing. And the Vietnamese Iced coffee is a great treat (you can get it hot too!) I've never been disappointed here and recommend it to everyone. Can't wait for my next time out at V-Nam Cafe!

After a busy Sunday shopping saga, I landed at V-Nam Cafe, my first time at this cafe the waitress was nice and kind with a deep knowledge of the menu, she recommended spring roll for appetizers and beef pho for main dish. The spring roll are crispy hot and delicious, the beef pho ! Oh boy !  So tender and full of flavor the portion was generous!
I had a great time, and recommend this cafe for anyone who is religious about the oriental flavor

The Bahn-Mi I had here will forever live in my heart. If you're looking for an incredible, quality hole-in-the-wall place, with kind people and a pleasant atmosphere, look no further. And seriously, order the Bahn Mi, classic.

I always passed by this place and saw a lot of people going in and out, it caught my attention. Very cozy and authentic. Staff was so sweet. The house salad is extremely good. This place was 10/10 and definitely recommend if you're looking for an authentic Vietnamese restaurant.

Ordered chicken pho delivered. Broth was way too salty. I had to add water. Chicken meat was dark meat which I don't like as much as white meat in my pho. Not much bean sprouts and flavor seemed muted.

Very affordable and reasonably priced. Service was okay but the staff was definitely friendly! I ordered the classic Beef pho and a friend ordered the Beef stew with egg noodles. Also ordered shrimp fresh rolls. I will definitely come back!

Was searching on Yelp for something to eat late last night after a long day with a hangover and I'm happy with finding V-Nam Cafe. They were one of the only Vietnamese restaurants open that deliver and I ended up having a nice average meal!

Ordered the vermicelli beef noodles and delivery came fast. Also got a side of beef soup that was delivered and only had chicken in it. I think I would've liked the Vermicelli Beef Noodle better if it was delivered correctly-- asked for it "Very Spicy" which means they add thai Chile, sriracha & jalapeños but they forgot it :( so it has no spice at all. Womp womp.

All in all the beef was cooked well and the noodles were tender. Wish they had more mint as it only came with 1 leaf. Left me craving for more flavor!!
One of the best spots to grab food in the city, try the beef stew it's phenomenal and so is the coffee
Understated but SUPER yummy! Got the bahn mi and it was absolutely delish! Fully recommend!
I had the Beef Stew with rice and salad.  Everything was delicious! Salad was fresh and crispy. Beef stew was nice and tender.
Tofu bánh mi was "the best sandwich I've ever had in my life," said my 12-year-old. Cute guy at the register kindly hurried when I said we were short on time.

DISCLAIMER: All these reviews are just personal notes to myself in the future.

We did a pickup order. So I got the Pho and Kayla got the chicken vermicelli, which she RAVED about on and on. And tbh it slapped. My Pho was pretty great too- the broth was rich and savory, and the meat was great. They also properly separated the broth/greens/noodles, and it was hot when I picked it up.

This is a restaurant that would be best for pickup/carryout. Inside the restaurant could use a bit of love.
I love their banh mi! I had this spot recommended by a former employee and it has yet to disappoint.

Cheap prices and good reviews reeled me and my friend in, but I think I'll just stick to my usual Banh Mi shop in Chinatown after all.

It's a small store with a decent amount of chairs and tables, dark lighting, and no bathroom. Me and my friend shared a Banh Mi Ga (chicken) to stay. Good thing was it was a very filling size but in regards to the taste, it was way below mediocre. The chicken, which was thigh meat, tasted rather bland and since that's the main protein/what most of the sandwich is, felt very disappointing. Maybe because I did order it as non-spicy, at some point as I was eating, I was considering to squirt some sriracha on my sandwich to give it some more flavor. The other only redeeming point was the sandwich came hot so you know it's freshly made.

Regardless, if you are to come to this place for a cheap meal to share, I wouldn't suggest getting the Banh Mi Ga at least.

Delivery review:

Really yummy pho here with vegan friendly options! Flavorful vegetable broth and they have either tofu or soy protein (faux chicken) which is delicious! Always glad to have a veggie pho option. When you order delivery they package all the components separately !

I also really enjoyed the summer rolls and subbed out shrimp for soy protein. Generous portion and very tasty ! Actually really loving this fake chicken. Not dry and good texture.

I would order from here again. Fast and timely delivery
The best! The classic, the summer roll, the fish curry, the pho. Great service. I want to go back right now.

The first thing that came to mind when I took my first bite was that it was SO F***ING GOOD!!! (Excuse my language) I had gotten the Banh Mi Sandwich and the Spring Rolls, and they were so tasty. And the service was nice, quick and CLEAN. Definitely going back!
Came out of my yelp retirement just to tell y'all how delicious the bahn mi here is. Most delicious bahn mi I've ever had, hands down. And it's ridiculously cheap too. Extremely impressed

This place is good. Has everything you want for a good price and is fast. Staff is nice. Food is fine (what you would expect from a diner). the breakfast options, wraps, and smoothies are good. I go here pretty often for carryout breakfast and lunch.

The guy who posted about orange juice in the smoothie has probably never had a smoothie before, it's very common and they also state that they use it in their menu. I've also had that smoothie before and it's a fine, typical smoothie.

- I regularly come here to get a large no.1 smoothie (berries, soy milk, honey, ice), sometimes while walking my dog, they'll have my smoothie ready for me without me even ordering first
- staff is always very nice and courteous
- competitive pricing for the area
- quick service
- recommend: smoothies and breakfast sammies

I would never know how the food was because my order never arrived. They accepted and confirmed my order but never reached out if the delivery was possible. The delivery person got there and they were closed! I hope they are able to process that delivery person's tip on a cold night at least.
Who tf puts orange juice in a BANANA and STRAWBERRY smoothie...it literally only taste like orange juice so there was barely any strawberry or banana in it and it cost 8.50...SMD

My daughter brought home an order of Penne al la Vodka.
To my surprise it was probably the most delicious meal I've had in a long time.
The flavors were so beautiful and incredible that it left you hanging for more and more.
Which tells me I have to make a few more trips
Kudos to the Chef
Angel Gonzalez
The penne alla vodka hit the nail on the head so tasty very flavorful definitely will come back for pancakes :)

Gets pretty busy in a Friday night. The back room is beautiful with the sky light and murals on the ceiling. It's loud with all the chatter but really feels authentic. The portion sizes are small but that keeps the prices low.

I was disappointed by the rigatoni because there was almost no mushroom nor sausage which was the main draw of the dish.... There was like a few loose bits of ground meat and maybe two mushroom slices in the whole dish.

Delicious food but insanely loud restaurant and very very very slow service.  Server's rear was ALWAYS in our food- a bit completely repulsive. They really should think about this when arranging tables.

Lasagna- flavorful but top over browned/over reheated with cheese remelted on top.

Pasta - delicious, appreciate it coming out hot/fresh, al dente. Never received the other items we asked for.

Really old-school, mom/pop type of Italian joint in east village. It does taste like home-cooking in the comfort food type of way. Flatbread/pizza and pastas were done well, prices reasonable but it's that homey food/vibe that really makes the place stand-out.

Food: 7/10
Value: 8/10
Service: 6/10
Vibe: 7/10

Appetizers were amazing & cacio e Pepe was pretty good.  The carbonara only had a bacon flavor, nothing too special- would try other pastas. The back room is loud but so beautiful with the sky light!!

Easily a neighborhood favorite! I was so sad when I found out their old location closed but so glad when they got this location! The space is beautiful - especially the back patio which includes a huge glass-domed ceiling and huge framed mirrors lining the wall.

The staff are still quality people and embody hospitality in their service.

The dishes are still delicious and the portions are perfectly sized. I honestly can't even recommend one dish over the other because you can't really lose out with what you choose. However, I will say I'm a fan of their bruschette.

Make sure you bring cash as it's cash only.
Glad their back and can't wait to visit more!

Came here for my husband's birthday. It was an early dinner so we were the first at the restaurant and they let us pick where we wanted to sit. We opted in for the garden and it was very romantic and cute! I ordered the painkiller which was delicious! we asked our server tips on wine and he was very knowledgeable. We ordered the rice balls to start which was good. We ordered carbonara and the pasta specials, the lobster ravioli. The pasta were kinda small portions so we ordered the gnocchi pesto after the first two pastas. The pastas were all pretty good though! After dinner, I ordered the espresso martini which was great. Would come back again for another date night.
I love this place. Food is always good. Gio is a fun guy. It's always a good atmosphere. I bring my relatives when they visit the city.

I went for the first time and had a Spritz and a supplì with tomato and mozzarella which was pretty good. The ambience was good and the owners Giovanni and Marco very friendly.  Grazie. I will be back for more food.

This was a nice spot to meet up for dinner, but the food wasn't that great. We tried the steak from their specials menu and the baked rigatoni. We had a party of 10+ people and were able to make a weekend dinner reservation less than a week before.

Great Italian food, impeccable service.
Must try : Cappuccino Martini, absolutely phenomenal !

SO glad this spot got to re-open! It had always been on my list, but after the fire I realized I never had the chance. It was definitely worth the wait for re-opening. From the service, to the food, to the ambience, it was a great experience. The restaurant has some different vibes to it - a dimmer, more date-like front area with the bar and some tables indoor and outdoor, and then a beautiful garden in the back with a skylight, open windows and paintings. We opted to sit in the garden given its unique-ness.

Service was very prompt and the prices were beyond reasonable. I went with the house red, but they had a variety of choices of wine and some delicious sounding cocktails (I will be back earlier in the day for the cappuccino martini). For food, they had a regular menu and a handful of specials. We got a bruschetta special that cane with fresh mozz, mushrooms and truffle oil. It was very truffley and delicious! Plenty for 2-4 people to share. For our entrees, we shared the cacio e pepe and the baked rigatoni special. Both were very big portions and delicious and cheesy. We were too full for dessert, but I can imagine it's as good! Our server also sent us to the bar after we finished for complimentary amaretto shots, which was honestly so sweet especially for a city like NYC.

Everything was so great and I can't wait to be back. I hope more people discover that it's re-opened!!

i went here for a date and had an amazing time! the ambiance is very lively - which I like but understand it's not for everyone. The restaurant itself is very charming and quaint. The service was good, the food came out literally instantly. I got the spaghetti cacio e pepe and my date had the gnocchi pesto, we both liked mine more. Both pastas tasted very fresh and home made. We ended with the chocolate lava cake and it was great, it was very rich and perfect for sharing. To drink we had aperol spritz and painkiller, both were normal good. I would recommend!

This is a very cute spot that I got lucky to stumble upon. We sat in the back room which had the cutest vibe with candle lighting, perfect for a date night dinner. We started off with wine and complimentary bread, then made our way to the pastas where they had classic dishes which were perfectly Al dente. Given the reasonable prices and the yummy food, I will definitely be back!
Such a great neighborhood spot. Authentic authentic authentic Italian food, no frills, just good quality. Cacio Pepe is amazing. And the value is great for NY. Love this place and their whole team!

Just leaving NYC this morning after my first visit and decided this little local Italian bar my best friend and I accidentally stumbled into was the absolute highlight of our week. We only got the rice balls appetizer which was fantastic, but this atmosphere created some vivid core memories for me. The bartender was an interesting wonderful character shouting and singing joyfully in Italian. The tv behind the bar was playing an old seventies Italian movie, and everyone in the bar was happy and singing along with the bartenders. 10/10 recommend. I cannot wait to come back and bring my husband.
Authentic Italian food! I'm super picky because I am first generation Italian and I was impressed. Great service, value, and ambiance.
Delish brood and good value. Great service   Cool little place and we happened to hit live music Wednesdays.
Food, vibes, and Giovanni, all 10/10. Highly reco the carbonara, burrata, and the suppli.
The spaghetti carbonara here is very nicely doneZ I like the rice balls too. Definitely a good place to keep in a rotation. Relaxed
Great pasta and apps in a cozy indoor eating environment in the east village. Perfect for large groups before going out for the night
First time visiting the new place - much roomier, same great food. The pizza pasta was amazing and the rice ball selection is a great new addition.

slow service, awful food , the decor is cool if you like sitting on a block of wood and too dark to read the menu. they didn't ask us how our food was at all even though none of it was eaten. I told them it was gross and they didn't even offer to take it off the menu, on top of giving them self 50$ for a tip  I wouldn't have even given 5$....

Very poor service not once was I asked how my meal was (when it wasn't very good to beginning with) never asked if I needed more water , drinks , utensils etc plus on-top of that they felt they needed to add a 20% tip themselves due to my party being large (5 people) lol good thing they did because I wouldn't have given this place a tip or another chance
Food sucks, hair in it. Menus were awful, water glasses were dirty. Service sucked. Added too high of a tip as gratuity.

The cocktails were terrible, the bread was old and cold, food good at best. Service tried but understaffed. And they cleared plates without checking. I don't appreciate that when people are still eating.

Via Della Pace serves super delicious food. It has a lot of seating (an upstairs section and more tables in the basement), so we were able to be seated immediately.

We tried the lobster ravioli ("Ravioli di Aragosta alla Vodka") and beef lasagna, and both came out quickly and were delicious! The lobster ravioli dish had little pieces of lobster in the super tasty pink vodka sauce, and the caviar on the side created a nice contrast to the rich sauce. The ravioli were great and cooked perfectly. The lasagna was also delicious and had the perfect ratios of noodle, delicious sauce, meat, and cheese.

The only drawbacks were the fact that it is a cash-only business and that the portions were pretty small (six ravioli and maybe a 4x4 or 5x5 inch portion of lasagna). I was not hungry after but was also not full after my meal, and I had also eaten chocolate chip cookies that I was baking right before coming. Perhaps the dishes are designed with the expectation that people get an appetizer and an entreé, but we did not have time to order two courses. They could also be designed with health and portion-consciousness in mind, but I don't think anyone would protest having more of their delicious food! Still, the food was great, so I would definitely try out the lunch special if I'm in the area!

My friend and I arrived at 7 PM on a Thursday night and the first floor was full. The waitress told us we could either continue waiting for the first floor or we could be seated right away in the basement. We decided on the latter. The basement was a bit humid and desolate but at least it was quieter than the upstairs. It was also not as set up as the upstairs which had mood lighting and candles vs the downstairs which looked like some tables and candles were thrown haphazardly around.

Our waitress came over right away with the menus and told us their policy of having to order all of our food at once but never explaining why. We decided on a bottle of white, bruschette trio, soup of the day, rigatoni alla carbonara, gnocchi of the day and homemade tiramisu.

BRUSCHETTE TRIO: We chose the pugliese (goat cheese and roasted peppers), emiliana (prosciutto and parmigiana) and ligure (shrimp). There was one of each that was served to us. The bread that the bruschetta was served on was not too memorable, kind of dry and not crispy enough; however, the toppings were the saving grace of the dish. The goat cheese one was probably my favorite - the peppers and goat cheese really meshed well together. The prosciutto was pretty good as well. And as for the shrimp, the shrimp was well done and cooked however there was way too much mustard slathered on the bread and just overpowered the taste.

SOUP OF THE DAY: The soup that we were served was a mushroom and truffle oil soup. It was a disappointment. It tasted like they threw some mushrooms into a vitamix and then dumped some truffle oil and served it. There was absolutely no flavor apart from the mushroom and oil itself.

RIGATONI ALLA CARBONARA: Pretty good carbonara over al dente pasta. Not much to complain about there.

GNOCCHI OF THE DAY: The gnocchi we were served with had some tomatoes and shrimp. The flavor of the sauce was delicious, I'm just personally not a big fan of gnocchi and this one did not stand out too much for me - a bit too doughy.

HOMEMADE TIRAMISU: So delicious however was a bit too heavy on the coffee for my taste. But I loved how large the portion was as well as the plating.

Though the experience and food at Via Della Pace was a pretty average one (save for the tiramisu which was wonderful), the service and people working the restaurant were great and helped to add to the night.

This place is fantastic! It reopened after the terrible fire in a new spot. It is absolutely gorgeous with a skylight in the back that makes it feel
like you are outside.  Not only is the space lovely, but the food is delicious Roman style pastas. The prices are really reasonable for NYC.  But the best part of the place is the lovely service.  All the staff is warm and friendly. It feels like a trip to Italy!
Everything was delicious and service was great! This is the best meal we've had while visiting NY the past week.
Just like the old place. Great food. Nice job Giovanni. Awesome, crazy skylight in the back.

Best carbonara in Manahttan. Was so happy to see that they were able to push through and reopen after a multitude of obstacles. Can't recommend this restaurant enough for a great meal and a great experience. Grazie Mille!

Cute little spot near at Marks.

They're apparently rated as one of the best pasta places and is even known to people in Italy!

Prices are good, most dishes of pasta are 12-15 range. The only catch is that it's cash only so make sure to get some cash beforehand.

I got the rigatoni carbonara and my friend for the spaghetti. The rigatoni texture was amazing, perfectly al dente and had so much chew. I love a good noodle so this definitely hit the spot. The cured meat in it was also well seasoned.

I was definitely happy and full after this meal- as someone who is always looking for a solid Italian spot in the city, grab some cash and come here- you won't be disappointed.

My go to spot. Authentic, warm, incredible food and incredible staff. The owner Giovanni is a gem of a person, and will gladly keep giving him my money indefinitely. The best Carbonara in the city, and the rice balls are SO good. Also try the bruschetta.
unfortunately I got food poisoning from the rigatoni  the pasta was  good but not worth throwing up for

Came here last night with a big group and everything was fantastic. Had the carbonara and it was delicious. We recommend the cappuccino martini too  we all had a great time thank you so much! The place was full of Italian customers which is always a good sign. Great atmosphere post marathon!

It's hard to judge a place on just two dishes, but I'm going to do my best to be fair.

For delivery we ordered the Ligure Bruschetta and two Fettuccine Momma-Nonna Munda's.

The Ligure Bruschetta is just what it says it is: grilled shrimp, arugula, avocado, and mustard. If you're a person sticking to a diet or trying to eat healthy, where you know exactly what you're getting, this is for you. It's a fine choice, not my favorite but all the ingredients are good, and the mustard is not overpowering. The presentation in my photo isn't so great but it was delivered, so keep that in mind.

The pasta is good enough to travel for. Good enough for earn 4 stars on its own. I have no photo, all I can say is: homemade pasta with sausage short rib sauce. Oh hell yes. This is good, this is amazing, this makes me happy. It's filling and arm, the short rib cooked to perfect tenderness, the flavors all working together. And it reheats well, best leftovers ever, if you have any!

This restaurant has a quaint and cozy feel to it. The $16 lunch special comes with an appetizer (soup, salad, or bruschetta romana), pasta dish, and coffee.

The bruschetta romana had 2 slices of bread with diced tomatoes. This simple dish was surprisingly delicious and big enough to share with another person.

Out of the pasta options, I picked the rigatoni pesto which was hearty and tasty.  I wished the dish had some vegetables or meat to give it some variety instead of just sauce and pasta.

My friend ordered the lasagna which was one of the best lasagnas I've had! Sadly, it is not included in the lunch special and will cost you $14.50. I definitely recommend ordering this!!

The latte was simple yet was an nice addition to the complete the meal.

This is an affordable must try if you are in the area! Perfect for a lunch date or for catching up with friends.

It's a relatively small space. The bar in front was manned by Giovanni, the owner and gregarious person. A football match featuring Lazio and some unknown was on.  The bar was occupied by guys having some beers and not enjoying the game. I make this surmise based on the number of times they waived their arms and shouted Vaffanculo!  I figured this was not the time to announce I am a Napoli fan. We were seated in a dining are past the bar. It was homey and comfortable, with nice decor. We , a party of six, started off with meatballs, olives, and rice  balls, and then ordered 5 different pastas. Each was delicious! Fresh ingredients , nicely prepared, with an appetizing presentation.  My bet is whatever you select, on the menu, you will be very pleased. Our server was friendly, personable, courteous, and attentive.  It was a memorable family meal and social occasion.  On the way out I showed Giovanni a video I took of the Lazio match we saw last year, in Rome. He got a big smile and we chatted about the Serie A table. Next trip to athelete City will definitely include a meal, here.

Great hole in the wall (ok it's slightly larger than a hole in the wall, but very cozy) with AMAZING food. I'd have to agree with other reviewers that this is one of the most authentic Italian places west of Italy (actual Italy, not Little Italy).

Every single thing we had here was a hit! The burrata e crudo (burrata with prosciutto) was so fresh - so incredibly fresh! The Umbra bruschetta was heavenly!!!! If you get one thing, it should be this. It's got goat cheese, crispy panchetta and asparagus and I can't stress enough how freakin' delicious it was. I could eat that all night long.

Fettuccine with meat sauce was amazing. Chocolate tortina for dessert. What an amazing meal from start to finish! Great wine. Good service. The place is packed and buzzing - good vibes and energy. Best Italian place in NYC hands down.

Came here for dinner this week.  It's kind of a hidden, unassuming Italian place stuck behind the long lines of San Marzano and some of the other options on 2nd avenue.  Due to the ridiculously long lines at San Marzano (on a weekday!), we ended up here.

The place itself is quite nice.  Dimly lit to make it feel a bit romantic per se.  Table setting is a bit tight, but that's to be expected I guess.

At first, we were told there was a private event so we had 45 minutes to eat.  Hated that we were rushed to eat, but thought it wouldn't really take us that long to get our food.  We ordered the gnocchi and the fettuccine with pesto.  The food itself wasn't bad.  Ended up being around $35, though I didn't realize it was cash only.  That's a bummer (for a place like this).  Might be up to something....

If I didn't feel rushed eating here, I probably would have taken photos, so they lose a star because of it.

Visited Via Della Pace for the second time today.

The Lasagna Della Pace is my absolute favorite.

It was paired with wine the first time I tried it. It was amazing.

This time I had it while sober to confirm it is just as good as I remembered. It did not disappoint.

The restaurant is a lot more packed for dinner than for a late afternoon lunch. They do offer a $16 lunch special that includes a pasta, drink, and appetizer.

Had the most delicious dinner last night. We begin with two orders of bruschetta and glasses of red and white wine, continuing with  cacio e Pepe, lasagne, pollo Milanese e bisteca con arugula. Desert tira mi su, panacotta affogatto and a simple enormous dish of vanilla ice cream.  We are so happy that Via Della Pace has returned as truly Italian as ever!!!!!

This new location of Villa Della Pace has a very good vibe to it and the food has been consistently delicious and healthy. The service is diligent and the skylight in the main room is aesthetically pleasant. I recommend the anti-pastas, and the spaghetti carbonara. There's a great variety of excellent wines to choose from.

This place is amazing! I got the Gnocchi! It was my first time having that and it was amazing! We got the chocolate fondue for two and didn't finish, could easily be for 3/4 people depending on how full you are from the bread and meal!

Stumbled in here at 7pm impromptu on a Thursday evening looking for a good Italian meal and we were blown away! Quaint place with real deal Italian food. Even the server and patrons around us were Italian!
The meatball appetizer was tender, bruschetta was delicious as was the lobster ravioli with caviar and the spaghetti. The price for two appetizers, sparkling water, wine and two entrees was $60! What a great deal! They even have an ATM inside which was very convenient. Highly recommend.

The line at San Marzano was too long, so we found the closest Italian restaurant nearby - fortunately saw Via Della Place across the street. It was quiet on a Tuesday night at 7pm - greeted by friendly, Italian speaking servers but a very empty restaurant. We were nervous, but it was too cold out to venture elsewhere.

It's a pretty restaurants - great date spot. It's dimly lit and there are wood accents that adds to the ambiance. We sat in a corner seat with a candle-lit table. We started off with bruschetta. You can order them by the piece or order 3 for $10.50, so that's what we did. 2 truffle oil and one plain. Bread was only OK, but the toppings were delicious. The bread that came with the table was the same bread that was prepared with the bruschetta. It was a little tougher than I'd like, tough to cut with a knife. The crust wasn't as strong as I'd like.

For our main entrees, we ordered the gnocchi with tomato sauce. They gave us a nice heaping of parmesan, which always adds to the dish. The gnocchi was good but it wasn't the best I've ever had.

All around, Via Della is a fine place to eat - it's romantic inside and the food is decent. You can't really go wrong with it, but it won't blow you away. There's a lot of Italian options in the city so if you're looking to get a quality meal, I'd venture elsewhere. If you're hungry and just want to eat decent Italian, come here.

I visited this place with some friends on Saturday night for a dinner. It`s a nice Italian restaurant in East Village. The place was very crowded but we had really luck and got a seat outside.
It is an Italian restaurant but you will not find any pizza on the menu but a lot of other delicious meals.
The staff was very friendly and we got our food also very fast.

On recommendation I ordered a "Lasagna Via della PAce". It was served in a nice stone pan and it was really so delicious. I got a good portion for a reasonable price.

This was not my last visit at this place and a good recommendation if you are around East Village.

One of my favorite dinner spots in the Village. The place and food have so much character. Besides getting an amazing meal, you'll get some prime people watching in.

The upstairs is packed with candlelit tables (with a piece of paper precariously wrapped around the open flame), a bar full of regulars, and effectively a shrine on the front wall to the owners' favorite soccer team. A black and White Italian movie plays behind the bar. The energy is high and once and awhile a round of "happy birthday" comes on, with the owner leading the song on a bullhorn.

First fresh bread appears, toasted on a panini press in the back, with nice grill lines. If you're doing the night right, you'll have a class of wine or prosecco. Ah... And then the pasta. This pasta redefined my understanding of what pasta could and should be. Even a simple spaghetti and red sauce comes packed with rich fresh tomato flavor every bite. The carbonara is covered in a sauce that is somehow creamy but light at the same time, with some fatty pork belly accenting the flavor. Every last drop of sauce must be finished with the remaining bread.

Dessert is also a must. Especially the Panna Cotta covered with strawberry marmalade. Each bite is a delight. But it doesn't end there. Finish your meal with a sweet but strong serving of limoncello. A perfect way to end the meal and leave you with a nice buzz for the trip home.

Via della pace is an experience of food and life as it should be - full of fun, flavor, and friends.

Absolutely WONDERFUL. Molto buono. A favorite authentic Italian spot of mine in the city. Cash only!!! so know that beforehand. I want to be here for dinner every week. Charcuterie - amazing. Bruschetta- amazing All pasta - amazing. Wine - incredibleeeeee

This is one of the best Italian restaurants BY FAR in the east village. I pretty much tell everyone I know about VDP and it has proved to hold up to its great reputation.

One of the key markers of a good Italian restaurant is lentil soup. If you can't make lentil soup, then you can't even call yourself an Italian restaurant! Needless to say, they have a fantastic lentil soup that makes me feel so cozy. It's thick and comes with a large helping of bread on the side!

Another marker of a great Italian restaurant is that Italians actually go there. I have never seen so many Italians in one place in the east village, but every day I walk into VDP there are tons of fellow Italians speaking Italian and watching soccer. PS this is a great location to watch your favorite Italian soccer teams!

This is a cash only restaurant so make sure to bring your hard earned cash! Especially if you are going for a special, because things can get pretty pricey really quickly lol.

If you have the luxury of getting to spend your lunch hours in the east village I'd highly recommend going here for the lunch special. It even comes with a great coffee! It's honestly such a good deal at lunch time!!! I wish I still lived right next door. Keep it up, VDP!

- the sandwiches aren't large but they're filling
- went in and requested their "2 most popular sandwiches." walked around the block with my pupper (10 min or less) and the guy behind the counter handed me the Scrofa (Porchetta, broccoli rabe and smoked mozzarella) and Na Fetta De Culo (Parma prosciutto, Buffalo mozzarella and tomatoes)
- both were good but offered different vibes
- the scrofa ($10): heartier, you could actually taste that the moz was smoked and there was a bite of ...almost sour? to the broccoli rabe
- the na fetta de culo ($11): I was partial to this one, enjoyed the saltiness of the prosciutto against the fresh tomatoes
- both served on a crispy exterior, domed chewy roll; it's actually quite tall, was a bit hard to get it all in for a bite but nevertheless very tasty

Authentic Italian sandwiches for the win! Love this little hole in the wall hybrid Italian grocery and sandwich store. All of the ingredients in the paninis (porchetta, prosciutto, sun dried tomatoes, mozzerela) were so fresh and flavorful. Bread was soft with a slight crunch on the outside. There is no real space to eat inside the shop so you should plan on taking out.

VIa Della Scrofa as road is a small Italian cafe  serving up a menu of savory eats and coffee drinks as well as Italian grocery items. the cafe is located on a quiet street, so it's a nice spot to grab a coffee and eats and stroll around the East Village or elsewhere. the interior is clean, well organized, and welcoming--has that local store charm as well as ton of high quality food items. no seats, grab n go only.

the sandwiches menu contains a number of Italian savory bites. last time, i tried the "Porco Deddena"--porchetta (roasted pork), sun dried tomatoes, and smoked mozzarella on a small soft chewy baked roll. the sandwich is served warm. the porchetta / pork is amazing--fatty, flavorful, and savory. the sun-dried tomatoes has that intense tart sweet flavor that cuts through the sandwich. the smoked mozzarella has that subtle scent and taste of fiery smokiness and an earthy meatiness to it. the roll is has that soft chew carb-y grain that folds the pork, sun dried tomatoes and mozzarella together. this is a small sandwich that is worth every calorie because it uses such high quality ingredients and really shows off that simple can rival complex any day of the week for a meal.  Porco Deddena, $9.99 + tax + tip

staff is chilled out and friendly.

drops mic cuz sandos are real heros
i out
zzz
Amazing bread and hot porchetta, very simple sandwich if you're looking for a heftier bite around EV
One of best lobster ravioli I've ever had. They stayed open til the hours listed. Manhattan was great, minus a cherry. Such a charming nyc small restaurant.
My favorite espresso of ever before theater. Small and worth it, perfection in a cup. Want to try more.
