Amazing authentic products directly from Italy! Great prices and fresh ingredients. Highly recommend stopping by for a filling sandwich (we got the Na Fetta De Culo) or picking up some genuine Italian groceries!

Absolutely enjoyed eating here! I didn't take a picture but we also have truffle fries and calamari rings and everything was DELICIOUS! The service was wonderful, atmosphere was great! Make sure you stop by and enjoy their food! Tip: make reservations they are a small location and it does it full!

I meant to say 10/10 lol.
Loved my brunch here and would totally come back
Highly recommend

Came here for our team dinner and tried some popular appetizers, drinks and pastas. Service and ambiance were greats The rating is solely based on the taste of food in NY standards as nothing really stood out to me.
The calamari was not crispy enough and lacking a bit of flavor. The fried burrata tasted like cheese stick but wasn't extraordinary.
I got the first pasta on the menu: spicy rigatoni alla vodka. It was a bit too spicy for my liking but this dish was probably a 4/5 flavor wise. My teammate got the short rid pappardelle. The short rib was good but the sauce was a bit too sour for my liking.
Overall this place has ok ambiance for a large party gathering but would not come here solely for the food.

I went with a group of four and we were able to be seated at 8 pm on a Friday with no reservation. The food was very solid and service was good too. I wouldn't say it was the best Italian but much better than other places I have had in the city. They are also gluten free accommodating which is great. The overall ambiance / vibe of the restaurant is very unique. The music inside is pretty loud and almost looks like a club. Overall good food, interesting vibe.
Decent food, but nothing too outstanding tho. Too many great Italian restaurants in NYC to recommend an okay place. Pretty spacious, not too expensive.

This is a lovely Italian restaurant. They have a mix of high and low top seating. Decor was very modern. It's a great pick for vegetarians and vegans. They have an entire plant-based menu with lots of tempting options.

On the house, they served us caprese skewers with mozzarella, tomato, and drizzles of balsamic vinegar and olive oil. They tasted very fresh.

We shared the crispy cauliflower appetizer. The cauliflower were batter fried. They were nice and crunchy, but still felt light. They were topped with a small amount of sauce, but I would've liked a bit more of it to balance out the texture.

For my main, I had the vegan meatball marinara. For all of their pastas, you are able to choose the noodle style you want. I opted for rigatoni. The dish was very tasty. The meatballs had great texture and flavor. The sauce was nice and hearty.

My friend got the chicken parmesan and enjoyed it.

To drink, I had the viva mojito which was sweet and fruity with a good amount of fresh mint.

The portion sizes for all of the food were huge. We were very full and had plenty for leftovers.

Service was fantastic. Our waiter was kind and attentive. Absolutely recommend this place.
You cant beat 25 bucks for a huge pitcher of sangria on sunday. Give these guys a try. Didnt get anything besides a ceaser salad and the sangria so not aure about the menu but its still a great deal

What a beautiful new restaurant! I came by here for their bottomless brunch which is $20 additional to food price.

I ordered the salmon Benedict, which was good with lots of salmon but the portion even now looks pretty stingy. The potatoes that it came with were delicious and the hollandaise was perfection.

I ordered the red sangria and it was sweet but tasted like it had absolutely no alcohol in it.

I probably wouldn't come back here and especially not for brunch. The Benedict was good but it was not worth it for the bottomless brunch. The servers were friendly but a bit slow with refills even though the restaurant was mostly empty.

I came here for happy hour with some friends. Their happy hour ends at 8 pm which is why we came! Their happy hour deal is buy one get one free.

My friends and I all got a glass of sangria. I got the red sangria and my friends got the white. I thought the glass was a great size and it was super flavorful and just the right amount of sweetness. A glass of sangria is $12.

Came here on Wednesday to celebrate my birthday and I enjoyed every dish. Had a pulsd for a 3 course dinner with my friend and I. The waiter was just darling. The decor is cute and posh. The food is wonderful from the grilled octopus, to the seafood pasta, to the vegan carrot cake; scrumptious.

Everything was fresh and didn't taste frozen at all.  I like that it's Vegan and gluten friendly; although I eat anything. The carrot cake was moist and the icing not too sweet, very soft and fluffy.  I would Def.  Go back to sample other dishes as the menu changes from time to time. I was looking forward to the squid ink pasta but the one I had did not disappoint. Let's not forget the many photos ops for the gram.

Good for large group seating ahead of a night out. Staff are attentive and with the exception of a fairly lengthy delay bringing drinks, food came relatively quickly and experience was good. Had the pesto pizza which I would rate a 4/10 for flavor and texture - wouldnt recommend this dish.

I love this place, the food the drinks the service.  Management is top tier. The owners are consistently making sure each of their guest are enjoying every part of their experience. I'm from out of town but I make it a point to visit. The atmosphere is perfect. This restaurant definitely continues to get better each time I visit. Love it here

Visiting from out of town with a large party. Used Open Table last minute to book which was nice. I ordered the beef short rib pappardelle and didn't taste as good as I anticipated. They also told us they would comp our meals since two of us ordered the same dish.  Saw later that they still charged one of the two plates.

4/16/23 UPDATE
The manager, Justin called me to apologize for our experience and offered to comp us for the other beef dish + the extra tip we accidentally left. Note that if you are a big group the tip will automatically be added. He was super apologetic about the whole thing and really appreciated that he actually contacted me. For that reason I'm changing my star review from 1 to 3 stars. Thanks again Justin for making this right for me as a first time customer.

I love visiting New York City for business, I get to try out these new restaurants and this 2.5-month-old establishment did not disappoint.  The service was attentive and the wait staff knew what to recommend.  They have room for a casual sidewalk seated dinner.

We ordered the Calamari Fritti as an appetizer, this was delicious. They used baby calamari which was tender and lightly breaded. Perfect level of salt and were tasty plain or with the accompanying marinara sauce.  This is some of the best-fried calamari anywhere.

Their pasta is really the star of the show, they make all of their pasta in-house and the chef cooks it to perfection.  We ordered the Limone e Gamberi with perfectly grilled shrimp and the linguine was light, dense, and perfectly cooked. I know, being light and dense is like an oxymoron but they amazingly pull this off. The other dish was the (vegan) Sausage and Peppers and they paired this with pappardelle pasta that is very difficult to achieve an al dente but they did!

Their actual menu is a subset of the full menu featured on their website, but it's excellent as they focus on what's fresh and available.  Desserts are brought in from Philadelphia so we didn't order any and were quite full, but if they ever get a pastry chef, we would try them for sure. This is a must-visit if you want Italian food that isn't too pricey while they have the current chef!

Juan P  was the best waiter, this resturaunt is beautiful and has a great brunch, if you haven't checked it out then you have to!! I would love to be taken here on a date honestly!! I went with my friend and we had a great time
I got the bottomless Bellinis and blueberry pancakes!

ordered a brussel sprout salad and it was just uncooked brussel sprouts with cheese. tried to send it back (i only took a couple bites) and they did not comp it :/ i dont think customer satisfaction is a priority here

tried my friends pasta and it was pretty mid. not worth the price. cute restaurant decorations but you can do better!!

Had lunch at Viva Cucina yesterday and although our experience wasn't great initially, the manager truly made up for it in every way.

So in short I think they forgot to put our order in. We waited and waited (40 minutes or so) and then the manager (?) came out to ask us how our meal was...and it was only then we realized what had happened.

He immediately went in to rectify the situation. We ended up waiting another 20 minutes I think but the restaurant comped our entire meal on their own volition and insisted on giving us dessert on the house.

The vegan carrot cake is spectacular by the way...definitely a must order.

Overall the experience ended up being pleasant and we'll definitely give them another chance.

Overall a good experience. The food was good and we enjoyed mostly everything we got. It was nice because they had some vegan dishes for anyone vegetarian dining and we could add vegetables to pasta dishes (which my parents loved). Service could've definitely been a bit better in some ways. One of the pizzas we got was not one we had ordered- it still tasted great and so we didn't say anything and let it be. But it wasn't what we had ordered. There were 3 different servers coming up and so if we wanted to order something, it was a bit chaotic getting someone's attention. We had ordered a round of drinks that we never received. We were celebrating my husbands birthday and they said they'd bring dessert out at the end, but it was brought while we were still eating lol. We enjoyed our experience there and the food was good, so would consider going back.

Great experience at this new Italian restaurant in in East Village.  The mushroom pizza was fantastic with its thick and crispy crust. The bucatini, cooked to perfection and complemented by a delicious white wine sauce.  The attentive staff added a personal touch, making this restaurant a must-visit for authentic Italian cuisine.

Stopped here for an event last night (grand opening party) and it was an amazing time. I was able to sample different dishes on the menu and I couldn't find any I didn't like. The risotto and salmon were my absolute favorite. The fried burrata is a MUST. Super awesome ambiance and location. Perfect for date nights or parties.

So I have mixed feelings about this place. We had a little misunderstanding about the pulsd deal, which to be honest kind of left a bad taste in my mouth about this place. We were a big group, a group of ten coming for brunch with a reservation. Prior to purchasing the pulsd deal, the fine print clearly reads that only two vouchers can be used per table and a reservation is required.
However, apparently after purchasing the pulsd deal the fine print changes. Which in my head is super shady....why is the fine print different prior to purchase compared to purchase.....that's false advertising. After purchasing the fine print says that you have to call for a reservation and tell them it a pulsd deal. We did not do that, which to be fair was my fault I didn't read the fine print twice (we use pulsd deals all the time and have NEVER had a requirement like this before) and the waiter was incredibly rude to us. We were ignored for the next 20-30 minutes, even though we had clearly voiced that we didn't need to use the pulsd deal we would be more than happy to just order and enjoy brunch. Finally someone took our order 45 minutes after sitting down. The waiters changed and the female waiter that we had was really great!!! I wish I could remember her name to give her a shout out. She was lovely.

I ordered the lobster ravioli which was delicious. The people that ordered the regular brunch food it was pretty average, but the pasta was an absolute delight. The waitress was excellent at keeping the drinks flowing and the white sangria in particular was delicious. It it was for our initial rude waiter and the not understanding manager with these crazy changes in rules with the fine print I would have given this place at least four stars, and would have liked to return, but due to the first experience of 45 minutes of being there, I'm glad we went but I will be branching elsewhere :)

Sports bar meets red sauce Italian. The rigatoni vodka and red sauce was sweet (gross). Chicken parm drowning in sauce and cheese. Awful. Pizza tasted like dough was frozen from a supermarket.

Don't waste your money.

Seriously great brunch! Good place for groups and for those bottomless mimosas. Staff was super friendly and kept us boozed up well and were even nice when our 90 minutes was up. The food itself was really delicious as well. Salmon eggs Benedict was so delicious m! Perfect hollandaise sauce and nice quality salmon and of course perfect poached eggs. The lobster ravioli also ended up being quite a treat. Delicious sauce and the raviolis were packed with lots of delicious lobster bits. Entirely a great experience and a recommendation for brunch!

Everything about our experience here was great - the food, the drinks, the service, the price... This restaurant has a beautiful ambiance. The portion size is great. The staff is all so sweet and helpful. The owner even came over to check on us. Definitely recommend trying this place!

Espresso martini & red sangria - perfect the martini has a gorgeous aroma and perfect balance... same for the sangria!  The blackberries & touch of strawberry add soo much elegance to this drink .  Happy hour is inside or outside, so don't walk, run here. Shout out to the bartender Helena who is a gem!!

Overall bad dining experience. The cocktail menu has potential but they don't have their liquor license and proceeded to serve us cocktails without telling us they're using weird versions of liquor that somehow are a loophole around it. We found out after we tried to order different drinks from off the cocktail menu that they don't actually have liquor so they can't make most drinks. The waiter tried hard to sell us drinks and convince us they were good but nobody believed him. The food was soulless and unappetizing. My friends got the spicy vodka rigatoni and both agreed the sauce likely came from a jar. The pizza is a travesty. My friend compared it to a ballpark personal pizza.

The ambiance is weird. It's really bright and somewhat uncomfortable inside. We all feel like we spent way more than we should've and there was something shady about the restaurant.

We went for brunch with a group of 10, one dish was immediately served and everyone else received their food an hour later. Multiple tables that were seated after us had their food served before ours.

The menu was really misleading - avocado (pictured) and salmon Benedicts we're supposed to be served on brioche but it was just a single slice of toast. The "frittata" (pictured) was actually a chili with raw eggs floating around inside.

The stars reflect the bottomless brunch deal being only $15 - you can choose between sangria, mimosas and bellinis and everyone really enjoyed that. Also our waiter was good and kept everyone's drinks filled and comped the 4 frittatas our group ordered.

Overall - the food that came out properly was decent but half the group needs an additional food stop afterwards. It went without saying that we will not come back here again.
Love the  recipes they got a  very conducive environment  and nice food I wish I will come back again

Viva Cucina was amazing & great for a date night. They have a ton of vegan and vegetarian options which was good for my girlfriend because its hard to find places that offer vegan food! The cocktail menu was unique with a variety of fun and interesting offerings. Don't remember the name of what I had but it was some kind of rum drink which was amazing. Almost all their pasta was homemade and tasted delicious. I got the bolognese, and we shared some fried burrata as an appetizer. Although we didn't try the pizzas they had a ton of different options to choose from. The highlight of the night was definitely the vegan chocolate cake which had a mint leaf on top to make it look kind of like a plant. Also delicious. Probably the best vegan chocolate cake I've ever had. Will definitely be back!
Sat us by the door so it was freezing every time someone walked in or left  but the food was great!! Service a little slow but very fun/cool vibes! Salmon was amazing!!!

This review is for just one drink at the bar on a Saturday afternoon. I was initially enticed to come in by a refreshing pitcher of red sangria on a table outside.  I didn't eat food but they had promotion $20 for I think 90 mins of drinks including sangria or mimosas with purchase of food item. The service at the bar was excellent.  They quickly took my sangria drink order ($12) and gave me ice cold water which was needed on a hot sunny day. My problem was the sangria by the glass which is I'm guessing what they give for the brunch promotion. I saw them prepare it at the bar. There was 10% red sangria followed by 70% of an orange juice mix topped off with 20% club soda. The color of the drink was so light it looked barely rose tinged. I basically paid $15+ with tax and tip for a glass of orange soda.  I left the drink almost full on the bar as it was too sweet to drink. Two different bartenders asked me how my drink was and i said too sweet. I said to one of the bartenders look at the differece between the red pitcher of sangria and my drink. He claimed bc it was a pitcher. He also offered to cut the sweetness by topping off the drink with more club soda. I didn't want to further dilute a barely alcholic drink that i couldnt tolerate. Definitely disappointed and will not be returning.

As someone who spends a fair amount of time going to Off-Broadway theaters on lower 2nd Ave., I was pleasantly surprised to find Viva Cucina, a new addition to the scene. The buratta , the shrimp fettuccine and the pizza were well prepared and reasonably priced. The atmosphere was upbeat and pleasant, service was excellent, and it was a memorable pre-theater dinner. A wonderful addition to a very busy neighborhood. I'll be back!
Amazing food server was great (Johanna) I will recommend 100% they have pasta of the day and catch of the day also happy hour as well !!! Will be back again real authentic Italian food
Ate here again and the food got even better. Real authentic Italian establishment with great service. Inexpensive lunch special, I will be eating here a couple of times a week..

Went to their grand opening party and it was a blast! The decor is so cute (love me a neon sign ) and the food was phenomenal. I especially liked their pizzas. I can't wait to come back for a proper dinner reservation and try more of the menu and drinks.

I found this restaurant through Open Table and Yelp reviews.  It was very tough to find a reservation during the middle of the holiday season.  That should have been a sign that they had availability.  I met a friend and when I walked in I was the only person in the restaurant.  It smelled musty, someone was sweeping the floor, and the staff of 4 were all huddled talking by the mini bar.  The server was very nice and lovely.  I ordered a glass of wine while I looked through my phone to find another place with a nicer ambience nearby.  When my friend arrived he had the same thought about the musty feel of the place.  We said let's give it a try.  He then proceeded to order a Tito's martini.  The server quickly responded we don't have Tito's.  "What kind of vodka do you have". He brings over a menu with three drinks, Manhattan, French Martini, and a Spritz.  So we ask again can you make a vodka martini.  The server has a long chat with the bartender at which point we decided to leave.  How is making a vodka martini a big deal in this day and age.  I have no idea how the food was but if you are looking for a cozy place that knows how to make a martini don't come here.

The food was excellent, and service was fantastic. They were attentive without being overbearing and were there when you needed them. The food was great, the a la vodka was particularly amazing. The seafood pasta was fresh and my favorite was the mussels dish - lots of mussels! Absolutely no complaints, I highly recommend everyone check it out.

Newest spot on the Avenue is excellent. We split the Arugula salad, the kale salad, mushroom risotto (yum!) to start. All were delicious. For dinner we thoroughly enjoyed the Bronzino and the pasta with clams, which was easy to modify to our sauce preference. This place is a gem and I hope it becomes a neighborhood staple.

As a regular, I am thrilled by the new holiday drink addition for Sangria. A hug in a glass. I've found service to be friendly and helpful. They do go out of their to take care of our order (timeliness and attentiveness). I don't have an issue addressing what I want and working with them. On a busy nights, the atmosphere feels super cozy and delightful.

We had the best girls night out! Fan favorites were several including drinks but top two include the fried calamari and spicy rigatoni a la vodka. All sea food and pasta dishes tasted so fresh and delicious. We already made plans to come back for brunch this weekend!

Great new Italian place with a pescatarian focused menu plus plenty of vegan options. The fried burrata is amazing and so is the garlic bread. Also got the shrimp scampi and the ricotta pizza which were great! Will definitely be coming back soon.

I just happened to be looking for a restaurant on foot and I stumbled across this restaurant! Upon entering, there was immediate seating and immediate service!  My waiter was phenomenal! Her name was Alex and she was super friendly and even offered humor with her service  The food was delicious.. I had fried Calamari and it came out super hot and fresh! I also had A Cesar salad to start with and that too was delicious! And lastly, my Shrimp Pasta with olive oil was Divine For a new restaurant, I was impressed and glad I gave it a try!  No pix to share because I was too greedy diving in

The food was DELICIOUS! I recommend the vodka pizza, linguine with clams. The meal had DELICIOUS TOASTED GARLIC BREAD with it! Genuinely chefs kiss, I cleaned off every plate. Not to mention the waiters were SO NICE! They continuously checked in on us and greeted us with genuine smiles. And the restaurant is gorgeous!! THIS IS AN AMAZING PLACE 10/10 RECOMMEND!

I came here for dinner on a Saturday night. The indoor decor is upscale and inviting with beautiful exposed brick.

To start, I enjoyed the sweet potatoes. They were tender but had satisfyingly charred edges. The feta fonduta paired well and had a nice, creamy texture. I also loved the arancini. It was savory and rich with sharp fontina cheese.

For my main, I got the spaghetti. It's a classic dish and the flavor was subtle, but I enjoyed it with some extra parmesan and chili flakes. It was a good portion size and very filling.

For drinks, I had the goddess spritz and amalfi spritz. Both were citrusy and not overly sweet, which was great. I didn't taste much of the elderflower in the goddess spritz.

I was a little disappointed with the service. They tried to collect my cocktail glass after both drinks when I still had several sips left. It felt a bit like they were trying to rush us out.

Still, it was a good meal so I'd recommend it for the food.

Came for a work dinner and it was a good pick. Italian is usually a safe bet. Pizzas were delicious. Loved my espresso martini and my staff was kind. Water glasses were kept full. Special requests were fulfilled. Apparently the meatballs are very authentic! Melon and prosciutto combo is always a delight.

Romantic ambiance, dim lighting.

My favorite place in the LES for some quality Italian food. This place never disappoints, and it truly is one of the best places to go to.
For apps, I would def recommend the 50/50 focaccia, it's one of the best ones I've ever had.
The pizza was really good, but also would recommend the ravioli

Came here with a party of 3 on a Saturday night and were seated immediately. Right off the bat, we loved the ambiance! Here's what we got:
Arancini - super flavorful and yummy, would recommend!

Crispy Sweet Onions - this was just ok, found them to be really greasy but my friend who loves onions loved them!

Broccolini - this was my favorite dish! Super lemony but also spicy and had the perfect bite! Sometimes broccolini gets over cooked but this was just perfect!

Cacio E Pepe - super well made! perfect balance of creamy cheese and pepper. Would 100% come back just for this!

Cannelloni - for the main we shared the cannelloni which was forgettable. It was not super flavorful and was kind of watery and mushy - would not get again

Overall, we enjoyed most of our dinner and would love to come back and try more pastas!
We like eating here. The the restaurant has nice decor but still comfortable. We loved the fried onions, it's a must try. We each had a different pasta and pizza. Really good.

Came here with some friends to dine in and it was a great spot to have some Italian food. There weren't too many options for vegetarians so I probably wouldn't come back but it's definitely worth checking out once for the vibe of the place. I ordered the ravioli and it was pretty good, but the portions are smaller and it is a bit pricey. I also tried the focaccia bread which was amazing here.

Elegant dining experience with a wonderful atmosphere.

The food is very authentic, every pasta I've tried is intricately made with perfectly balanced flavors. The pizzas, as well, are delicious with fresh ingredients. Definitely try the tiramisu!

The staff are incredibly professional, and we did not have to wait too long for our food.

I am very impressed with the options and food quality at Vic's!
The menu features a ton of delicious and creative modern Italian dishes, and you'll want to try a bit of everything-I highly recommend ordering a few dishes and sharing amongst the table.
To drink, I had the Goddess Spritz, which was pretty good and floral.

To eat, 3 of us split:
-Crispy Sweet Onions (an unexpected menu item for an Italian restaurant, but they were delicious-and that dipping sauce?! Bomb).
-Roasted Carrots: so beyond tasty and flavorful-this will make you want to eat your veggies.
-50/50 Focaccia: whoever came up with this idea (giving you both toppings in one order so you can try it all) was a genius. My favorite side was the roasted garlic).
-Arriabata Pizza: a solid pizza, wonderful crust and loved the olives and chilis combo.
-Cannelloni: AMAZING. Plenty of sauce included, Vic's does this dish very well.

I also appreciate how a large majority of the menu is vegetarian-friendly. The service and atmosphere was good as well. I would absolutely come back!

Sat at the bar. Service was just OK. Calamari was bland. The pizza was decent; was expecting sausage , though according to the bartender it was minced up and integrated into tbe sauce...

I couldn't taste it though.

Came here with 5 other friends on a weeknight night with a reservation and the place was definitely super crowded already for dinner time. Some of the food and appetizers we got are shown below. Definitely want to say our server was awesome and super attentive and friendly. Gave us a few recommendations and we definitely had great service throughout the whole meal. Make sure to make a reservation before coming here since it's a pretty popular place so dinner one always fills up quick. The atmosphere is super casual and one thing to note it is pretty dark in there which may be good or bad depending on how you look at it.

Awesome food and service! I loved my pizza bianca with guanciale. It's a thin crust and the perfect portion for one hungry person or good to share with a few more bites. My friend got the tomato pizza, little gem salad and arancini and enjoyed it all.

Service was very friendly and accommodating. Staff made great recommendations for food and wine pairing.

Wheelchair accessible outdoor dining and indoor entry. I didn't go inside so can't comment on restroom.

The outdoor dining options consist of tables on the sidewalk and a fully enclosed hut. I personally wouldn't feel safe in the hut, but staff were very understanding when I called and were more than happy to reserve a sidewalk table for us.

Solid brunch spot in this neighborhood, especially if you don't want to wait in line for Lafayette's! The inviting rustic-modern decor sets the perfect mood for a laid back brunch. The squash blossom pizza is a standout, a delicious blend of crispy squash blossoms and creamy ricotta on a perfectly thin and crispy crust. Equally delicious is the cacio e pepe spaghetti, which I find to be one of those simple dishes that is deceptively difficult to execute well. Vic's makes a fantastic rendition that offers a great juxtaposition of creamy textures with peppery flavors. For those looking for more breakfast-type food, they also serve classic egg and sweet dishes. Service is friendly and unpretentious. Drinks are great too.

Great date spot. Nice lighting and noise level for a Friday evening. Service was polite and accommodating; however, the waiter did seem annoyed that we did not order drinks (we were grabbing afterwards).

Would highly recommend the Long Island fluke and the mushroom pizza. Both well done and balanced dishes. The mafaldine was good but I would personally skip it on my next visit. Too much onion and not enough clams and literal pasta noodles

Came here for brunch with a big group of friends. Got there around 11AM and was super empty but got packed shortly after.

We pretty much ordered one of each of the main brunch items but I got the ricotta pancake and my partner got the bacon, egg and cheese roll. The pancake had a good flavor but its a single pancake and very thin so not very filling. The pancake also stuck to the bottom of the hot plate it came on so I found myself scraping most of it off the plate. Interesting concept to a pancake but not my favorite. The sammy was good! Egg was perfectly cooked and meaty portion.

Everyone else seemed to at least somewhat enjoy their food! Waiter was very nice. Cool relaxed vibes. I would return but not for brunch.

Went for drinks.  Family and friends got pasta.   Good bourbon list.  Had Pappy....Espresso and Sambuca.   Their pasta smelled amazing.  Not sure if they make it fresh but it looked amazing.  Great outdoor seating.  Great waiter.
Tried their Arancini, Gnocchi and Maritozzi. Nothing impressive. Arancini and Gnocchi were ok. The bun of Maritozzi was too dry and the cream was mediocre.

Just came to Vic's for my third time now, so it's time to leave a review! I really wish I could leave more stars but had to knock stars for the lack of vegan-friendliness.

There's plenty of seating inside and outside. It's definitely a cute atmosphere and I highly recommend asking for the round table if catching up with friends! The vibe is cute but casual so you can dress up nice or wear jeans.

As a vegan, I usually look for restaurants that clearly label vegan options so removing 1 star for the forced labor. Labeling saves time for everyone - vegans, friends dining with vegans, and restaurant staff fielding these requests. Not to mention substitutions go wrong almost half the time so there's less food waste when an item is naturally vegan.

Vic's makes us (and their staff) work to understand our options so vegans, you'll need to research Yelp, email, or call to be 100% certain. Luckily, I already knew they have options since I'd been here twice before. They told me they could do a pasta dish with olive oil (yikes) and pizza sans cheese. Pretty sure the last time I was here they were able to make me a pasta with a bunch of veggies in it and red sauce but that wasn't on the table this time. This is a bummer because that actually filled me up.

I ordered a pizza without the cheese and after eating the entire pizza I was still hungry (minus 1 star). This happened to me the time before as well. I tried to substitute veggies for cheese but they said they weren't able to so I had to settle on basil. I also ate a bowl of olives. It was all delicious but the pizza was super unbalanced and overly spicy without something to sub for the cheese. And I love spicy!

Much to my surprise, I was charged full-price for this spicy situation, so removing a star for that. Meanwhile my friends were swimming in decadence and so full they were practically unbuttoning their pants at the end. I hope they start offering a vegan cheese to make the dishes more filling/balanced and to be more accommodating to people with lactose intolerance and vegans. Slap this change on your menu and your SEO will shoot through the roof - we cannot easily find vegan options without these keywords living on your menus, which translate to review mentions.

Vic's I hope you see this as constructive, actionable feedback! You're definitely a trusty spot but it's a bummer that all three times I've visited in left hungry while my friends need to be rolled out the restaurant. And don't worry, experiences like this never impact my tip. Your staff was lovely, got our order correct, and did their best with the tools they were given.

Came here for a friend's birthday and I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good (4/5) but the service was outstanding (5/5). For a group of 20, our drinks were never empty and we were always attended to. Though the food was served family style, our plates were changed in between courses.

Starters:
Arancini -- 3/5, crispy, but very salty. The peppers on top were also really spicy.
50/50 foccacia -- 4/5, I wish there was more sauce on the tomato side.
Pork meatballs -- 5/5 delicate and flavorful
Misticanza -- 5/5 this was superb. I loved the mustard vinaigrette dressing on this salad.
Broccoli di cicco -- 4/5, I love broccolini

Mains:
Cannelloni -- 5/5, this stuffed pasta was delicious! It was a little hard to share though
Ramp pizza -- 1/5, I did not like this at all. There were lemon slices on top that were way too acidic compared to the rest of the pizza that was slightly bitter tasting

Dessert:
Tiramisu -- 5/5, sooo good. Thick and not too soggy
Rainbow cookies -- 3/5, I'm not a fan of rainbow cookies in general

Drinks: We tried a bunch and all of them were good. The spirtz and mixed drinks were a little on the sweeter side though.

Torn between a 4 and a 5, but will round up. Immediately upon entering the vibes and ambiance are great and there is plenty of space (not on top of other tables like many restaurants in nyc). Food was good to great with my favorite being the roasted garlic focaccia and the cacio y pepe. Desserts were unmemorable, same with arancini and pizza. Prices are reasonable for the area, a big plus. I definitely recommend this spot for a group dinner in NYC that will please most people.

I had dinner here last week, my first visit since a magical lunch two years before COVID.

I love everything about this restaurant. It's vibrant and you can eavesdrop if you want but you can still hear your dinner companion. It's classy but laidback with a cheery vibe.  And the food is terrific and inexpensive for the neighborhood.

Servers are competent and friendly.

The whipped ricotta appetizer is heaven. I dont eat a lot of bread but this was what I call "worth it" bread. Ultra crispy crust with soft, chewy interior (but lots of holes so airy). Heaven.  I was eating light, so had the brussels (huge portion), and then a nice Grillo (I think, the white most like a Sauvignon, post-martini).

I saw a few pizzas go by: thin crust, Neopolitan-style.

They have Dorothy Parker gin, which I like (and about which I was happy because that was it, other than Tanqueray, yuck, or Bombay, even worse). Tanqueray 10 is not much more money by the bottle and so much better. I don't know why all bars don't stock it. So much better than Hendricks, or at least, I prefer that style of gin.

My friend had the hangar steak with a charred bok choi or something like it.

The crispy potatoes are to die for. He ordered them and I had a few bites.

Just great food in a lively, upbeat setting. Perfect for dinner before the Public /Joe's Pub.
Never disappointed when I have dinner at Vic's. Their staff and managers are so thoughtful And their customer service is 10 stars  (if only that was possible to give on Yelp).

Came here on a Saturday afternoon for a post workout pick me up.  To my surprise there was no line at noon and I was able to get seated immediately.

Heirloom citrus salad:
(Champagne orange vinaigrette, pistachio, tarragon)
This is a super refreshing, fruity, tangy, nutty salad. There was a mix of oranges, blood orange, grapefruit and pomelo so you get a nice mix of a little bitter and sweet. Everything was just so well balanced with this dish. I finished every last bite of it. Definitely would get this again and again.

Pappardelle:
(Pork sugo, parmigiano, parsley)
Fresh made pasta cooked to perfection. The pork was juicy and tender with a nice little heat from the chili flakes. I was between this and the cavatelli. I'm definitely coming back to Vic's to try their other items!
Came here as a party of 4, tried lots of pastas + apps family style w/ a few other entrees, very cute vibes. Would return. Fun cocktails too.

Cute ambiance, great service, but meh food. Portions are quite small too for the price. But I must say that the pasta noodles were very well-cooked.

Crispy sweet onions (5/5). Of what we ordered, the only thing worth getting again. Crispy onions, slightly cheesy, and a great cheesy dipping sauce. Loved the herbs on it too. This appetizer was the highlight of the meal.

Cacio e pepe spaghetti (3/5). Buttery and creamy but lacked flavor. The noodles were cooked really well though.

Lumache (4/5). I liked the sausage and the texture of the pasta. Not that memorable though.

Pork shoulder steak (4/5). Not a bad steak, but only 6 pieces! Had good flavor and not too tough. But not a standout.

Clam pasta (3.5/5): Well-cooked pasta and an interesting shape. Not that memorable either.

Honestly- pretty disappointed in this place. All the reviews were amazing so we were excited to try it but I'm not sure I'm on board. The best thing about it was the vibes, great for date night, cute and cozy. Starting with the calamari it was incredibly dry and chewy. Something else I noticed- which may be the reason I didnt enjoy the food. Almost every single dish had scallions, chives or onions. And not a garnish, a very over powering flavor. The squash flower pizza (the best thing all night) had large scallion chunks in ever bite, it didn't necessarily go with the pizza to me. Same with the Campanella pasta. Veryvery over powering onion flavor. And looking back at the menu , most of your options include heavy cheese and heavy onion. Just not my favorite combination so I didn't enjoy the food and left feeling very .. oniony.. like i needed mouth wash.  But hey if you like that try it, the place is cute and service was good!
I highly recommend the sweet cut onions!! The 50/50 bread was also yummy (the garlic bread side was VERY garlic-y!) We got a table pretty quickly too!

Let me start off by saying as soon as you walk into Vic's it reminds you of home. It has a very homely feel that makes you feel instantly feel comfortable. I would definitely bring my kids and family here. The wait staff is very accommodating and very friendly. I should have taken a picture of the drinks , my friends enjoyed their lemon drops , I wanted to be different and get a cranberry Negroni and it was terrible lol but I powered through and finished it , I then took the waitresses recommended and didn't like it that was supposed to be sweet but didn't like that either. Should have stuck through the tried and true lemon drop. Now onto the food, we got the garlic bread which was sooo sooo good , like we could not stop eating it. The calamari was a bit tough for me so a lot to chew and cut through. The pastas were soo good, I will say the cheese and garlic did sit on my stomach a bit also my friend had the same concern, maybe if the garlic bread didn't have the big chunks of garlic on it we would have been fine.

I also got the grape sorbet which was really good and tried dessert won't for the first time and hated every bit of it but I'm going to learn to appreciate all wines eventually. It had now become my personal mission.

Overall I do recommend for a casual family dinner or a quick bite.

Had drinks at their bar and order the blooming onion appetizer. I was pleasantly surprised by the blooming onion - hahah. It was really good.

Nice spot for drinks and for a big group or just a little date night.

We sat outside on a beautiful late November night and enjoyed delicious food and great service.

We started with the burrata - and absolute must try! The olives were seasoned really well. Then we had the prosciutto (nothing extraordinary), and the crispy sweet onions which were good, but very greasy and too large of a portion for just the 2 of us - definitely better for a larger group.

We shared the roasted chicken and the Brussels sprouts and loved both agreeing that we'd order both of those again - with the burrata of course.

We loved the burrata dish so much, we ordered it again to finish out our meal!

I eat out every weekend in NYC, and this was the most memorable restaurant experience I've had in a long time. The food was incredible from the jump - the 50/50 focaccia with roasted tomato and garlic, give me a cut of that every Sunday night for the rest of my life please - and the pizzas were hot, fresh and piquant.
Not to mention the servers were incredibly kind and friendly - leaving the restaurant, every single one smiled and said goodbye to my partner and I. Made us feel like VIPs :)

Had the chicken and the pappardelle. Both were unbelievably good. The chicken was cooked to perfection. Portions on both were substantial for the price. The service was unreal fast -- we were amazed at how fast our dishes were brought out. Great noise levels, ambience, decor, everything was just fantastic.
3.5 An ok/good Italian place but nothing super outstanding. The spaghetti was good. The apps were mediocre - wouldn't recommend the garlic bread. The grilled broccoli was the best. Very busy place

Amazing place, only downside is portion size.
The location is great.
Ambiance is on point.
The service is amazing.
Prices are very reasonable for what you're getting.
And the food! The burrata was simply amazing, it comes with a a sweetened grape sauce (you will need to order bread with it though).
Also got pasta and pizza, the caico de pepe was amazing, downside is the lieu in size is very very small.

Nice place with good atmosphere. Friday night was busy mainly young crowd.
The food is good and tasty but limited menu. I had the skirt steak was very good. The drinks are good as well with a large variety of options. Our waiter was attentive and recommended solid dishes. Pricing is reasonable for NYC

Vic's is a good spot for some pasta and cocktails if you're in the neighborhood or looking for a place that will leave you with no complaints. The arancini and Cacio e pepe spaghetti were both decently flavored with reasonable portions for the price. We also got the brussel sprouts which weren't my favorite, they were a little hard in the center making it difficult to eat. The winners for me were the cocktails and the service. I got the Siesta which was really yummy with just the right amount of everything. The service throughout our meal also was very attentive. I'd come back for the drinks!

A great option for reasonable prices, good drinks, and universally pleasing food. They typically  have availability, so one of my go to places for last minute reservations. Also have a seasonal menu, so fun to enjoy dependable and new dishes!

I came here for a work dinner (party of 6) last night and honestly, the entire experience from start to finish was great!

When we checked in, they seated us in the smack middle towards the front of the restaurant. There was a lot of foot traffic so we requested a seat in the back and they accommodated us really quickly - super appreciative of that! We got sat in the back room right by the kitchen which was brighter and we had the section all to ourselves the entire night.

The food here was FIRE. Defo recommend the crispy artichoke, asparagus pizza (drooling rn) and pork shoulder. Our server Peru was amazing and super friendly even when we were getting loud and rambunctious - he matched our energy and didn't make us feel like a nuisance. Overall great experience but knocking one star off because it's pretty pricey for what it's worth imo!
Amazing linguine diavalo, lobster was perfectly poached and the sauce was spicy but not overpowering. Get the Foccacia to start

10/10 going for 6 generations amazing !!!!!
Everything is always delish
Always a fav

So. Good. Don't expect huge portions, but definitely expect delicious food. I was afraid that this restaurant was hyped and that the food would be your typical, New York City good not great Italian food, but it was truly something special.

Would give this 4.5 stars if I could given the prices and portion sizes, but three of us shared the pizza, eggplant parm and cacio e Pepe and we were pretty full after.

The pros: delicious, authentic flavors, speedy service, good water refilling (important!), and portions that while not huge, felt good enough

The cons: prices are a bit high (though fair given the area), menu and wine list are small so if you don't like what's there, you're out of luck

Will definitely be returning!

HOLY CATFISH YELPMAN!

I really enjoyed my time here. And the owner is a friend of a friend and fabulous eye candy that tides me over until my food arrives. The food took awhile ... a long while. But it was worth the wait. I've been craving collard greens for a long long long time. So I was super pumped to consume my feast of catfish and greens. The catfish was so good. So good. Why was that like the best catfish ever? Perfectly seasoned. Tender and juicy on the inside, crisp and bangin' on the outside.

The service was slow in general. Besides the delicious food taking a long time to arrive at our table with no one in the restaurant but me and my 3 future roommates. The waitress took awhile to place our order. Never offered to refill my glass and we went without silverware until our food arrived. She took days with the bill and years with the change. Thursday girl's pretty and all but she's sort of not efficient. Don't go starving.

Will return for brunch cause what I really wanted was catfish and grits ... mmmm.

If this review were solely based on atmosphere then Vanel on First would easily score a 4-5. It's a nice setting and I went with two friends and enjoyed the atmosphere. Unfortunately we didn't go to just hangout and we needed food too. My two friends have said that they thought the food was ok, personally I thought mine was ok too - though my fried chicken was on the dry side and there wasn't much chicken to speak of.

I had a bigger issue with the portions/pricing. There wasn't much food and while the charges were not exorbitant, I should leave any eatery feeling full after two appetizers (which we split evenly) and my own dinner - especially after dropping 30 bucks in the process.

The best soul food in the village. This is what they say. And I quite liked the food actually, the chicken was delicious and the sides too. The crowd was a bit too loud and the service is slow. I liked the pictures on the wall. It is worth a try if you live in the area. Reservations are recommended if you are more than 2 people, as there is not that much space

This place was insanely good. Our server recommended we try four plates, and I'm so glad he did. My favorite was the burger. I'll probably dream about that burger for the next week. The oysters rockafeller were also incredible.

Came here for a Saturday night dinner. Got a couple of apps the marinated olives and the chips with a crème fresh dip both were good. For the mains got the steak frites and the Virginias Burger. The burger was great cooked medium rare and had a delicious onion jam spread on the bun that had been lightly toasted. The steak frites was very average the steak was cooked medium rare and was very juicy but did not have much flavor it tasted overly peppered. They do have desserts but I did not order any.

This spot is on the radar of most burger lovers in nyc. I have to say their burger does live up to they hype. It's a large fat single patty burger but still manages to stay juicy and moist. I really liked the sharper cheese they use and he caramelized onions were quite tasty. The fries don't come with the burger but we ordered for the table and they were really tasty. We also had the crab cake appetizer and Brussels sprouts both of which were quite nice. Cocktails are expensive but well made and worth the $.

The only negative (which is a pretty big one) is that the waitstaff were honestly downright unfriendly. When we would order something they usually just stared back with no acknowledgment lol, kinda odd. Still I'm a food first reviewer and the food was on point.

We decided to go to brunch here because the place is around the corner from us. When our order was being taken, I requested to have regular hollandaise on my eggs Benedict because I can't eat dill bc I'm about to get a colonoscopy and my doctor told me not to eat any fresh herbs. They told me they cannot make regular hollandaise because everything is pre-batched and "hollandaise takes a long time to make". To make Hollandaise is a very quick process. When we requested Mezcal instead of Tequila for our spicy margaritas, they said they can't change it because it was pre-batched. If you are spending $26 on eggs Benedict (of which I only got 1 egg on top of 1 crab cake no sides other than wilted spinach underneath, like no potatoes etc) and $18 on a margarita, you should be able to customize based on your needs (I have an intolerance to tequila ). Then we proceeded to wait quite a while for our food, and I asked the bartender about it. He said sorry we have a 12 top. And then I responded will we get our next round of drinks comped, and he said he will ask the manager. He never got back to me and when I was about to sign the bill, I asked did you ever ask the manager, and he said that the manager said no. So there was no follow up from his end in terms of relaying this info to us. Then I asked to speak to the manager and the manager said we don't give free drinks. And I said it's not about free drinks, its about making a concession for bad service. And I told him good luck when your place closes down after a year for your short sighted ness. There are too many good restaurants in the city to go somewhere again where you are treated like this. Also on top of it, the bartender was nice but had no social skills. He asked why I can't eat dill and I said because I'm getting a colonoscopy and can't eat fresh herbs and he said "Nice!". Part of being a bartender is making good drinks AND having social skills. I obviously won't be coming back here again. I suggest you don't either.

New York has some amazing burger options, this is definitely one of my top burgers in New York, there were four of us and everyone ordered the burger, everyone was in heaven. I added the bacon, the bun was perfect held together, the cheese just melted perfectly, and the flavors, you can feel the love in this burger. The staff was amazing, and friendly, a great nice cozy restaurant with outside seating as well. I seriously dream about this burger.

Amazing. First visit, we got the olives/sourdough, onion dip with potato chips,  clams casino, crab cake, burger, and banana pudding. The burger is excellent, with incredibly perfect onions, although I felt like I didn't actually need the bacon, and maybe it could have benefited from some kind of slight sweetener, but I still really loved it. The clams and crab cake were perfect, and both had a slight kick to them, which I appreciated. The onion dip was maybe my wife's favorite dish of the night, and I loved it too, even if it's not usually my thing. We both said we'd pass on the banana pudding next time around.

Bartender clay Virginias

Had a FAB dinner @virginias it re-opened after a quick hiatus and it has come back to seriously serve

What to Get:
- The Virginias Burger is absolute must. I prefer a more simple style burger without the egg and bacon but I would be tempted to try the bacon next time I'm there
- Butter Lettuce Salad.  This salad is light, refreshing and has awesome radish flavors that compliment the tahini dressing
- Oysters and anything on the raw bar

Sit at the bar to hang out with the bartender, Clay and grab your friends for a group dinner with a @resy

Small bistro that is famous for it's burger, but that also has other options and a solid cocktail menu

I came here for brunch with my GF, and we were struck by how loud it was inside!! Only ~1/2 of the tables were full, and we still could hardly hear each other (or the waiter). They do have some tables outside however, so this might be the way to go

My GF and I both ordered a burger, and we also had to order a side of fries because they do not come with the burger. The only thing that comes with the burger are a few tiny pickle slices.

We also did not have to specify how we wanted our burgers cooked, as they already have a pre-determined temperature that they serve their burgers at. When our burgers came out they were less cooked then we would normally get them, but we trusted that the chefs knew what they were doing here.

Our food was all brought out to us very quickly, and the service here was very solid overall

This all being said...The burgers were amazing. Nothing more to be said on this...

The fries were also very tasty as well

Virginia's recently re-opened in a new location in the East Village, and it's as good as ever.

Still one of the best burgers in the city and the steak frites was excellent.

Service is pleasant and pro.

Highly recommend.

It was a great list to East Village when this neighborhood bistro closed in 2021; luckily it has found a new space and reopened in the former home of Root and Bone, a Southern style restaurant that still has a location in Florida. A blessing to this new space is additional seatings and a steakhouse menu with steak frites, clams casino, and of course a burger. Another surprise is the kitchen is headed by chef Justin Lee, who closed Fat Choy a vegan fast casual joint last year. Perhaps he could incorporate his smashes cucumbers into the burger or make a cacio e pepe rice roll? ;)

Went here with a group of people I unfortunately call my friends. The place is small with a short bar and and a dining area.  Well decorated warm atmosphere.  We ordered cocktails, which were excellent. I ordered the burger which was unbelievable. Probably a 9.5 out of 10. Buttery, juicy, perfectly cooked, with amazing caramelized onion flavor. I put it in the top three I've ever had (along with Au Cheval and Emmy Squared/Emily). Truly unreal flavor. Hopefully the word doesn't get out because this place could blow up. The fries on the side were unreal also.  I tried my friend Alex's steak which was one of the better steaks I've ever had. My friends Alex and George are pretty average but the food here was not! Service was great. Prices were fair. A great spot.

Love this neighborhood spot.. East Village neighborhood. Amazing food but the connections and service are beyond. When you are local or want to come by for a good time and good food stop by and say hi to Ben!!

Awesome dinner spot serving American dishes! All the dishes were so flavorful. A bit overpriced for the portion sizes but everything tasted so good. Great spot for date night or with a group of friends!

Hands down this is the best burger in town. I highly recommend not making any modifications to the burger, it's really delicious as is. Their passion fruit margarita by far was my favorite cocktail drink. The fries are a little pricey for the amount you get, but they were super crispy and worth it. The banana pudding is sooo much better than magnolias so definitely make room for dessert. The service was great, it's a super busy spot so definitely recommend making a reservation. It's a perfect spot for a cute date.

Visiting from San Diego and sort of stumbled on this place. It was pretty crowded and we had no reservation. Seated us, party of two, right away. Very friendly and attentive staff. A bit noisy inside. We asked if we could finish our drinks outside after dinner and they were very accommodating. Even comping us a free dessert for freeing up an inside table. Food was delicious.
Banana pudding and molten chocolate cake are the best I've ever had. Burger (wife loved), fries, bread, Brussels, crab cake (wife, duh) all excellent.

Virginia's NYC has an excellent pairing of elevated food with mature drinks. While the mixologist is working on a specially crafted cocktail for you, you will likely be enjoying a bite of something that is exquisite.

I went with a group of friends for a reunion dinner and their service was fantastic. I highly recommend getting any of the following:

Dinner Table Recommendations:
Roasted Carrot Salad
French Onion & Creme Fraiche Dip
The Wild Mushroom Risotto (it is wild)
Faroe Island Salmon
Steak Frites
THAT BURGER THOUGH (Virginia's Burger)
Brussels Sprouts
Shrimp Cocktail (that Calabrian Chili-Lime Aioli is ridiculously delicious)

Dessert Recommendations:
Banana Pudding (save room for this, I'm not even a desserts person and implore you get this)
Chocolate Lava Cake

For drinks, the menu is constantly evolving but for while we were there, I enjoyed the Debbie Gibson, the Cucumber Melon Gimlet and tried a drink that was the mixologist's own creation. I can not wait to go back and try the seafood.

Vegetarian options: My understanding is that Virginia's NYC offers something for everyone, with 4 tasty vegetarian options on their menu.

Wheelchair accessibility: While the space is intimate, the staff are more than accommodating of wheelchair users.
Dietary restrictions accommodated
Vegetarian, Vegan, Gluten free, Dairy free

Recommendation for vegetarians
Highly recommend

Vegetarian offerings
Vegetarian menu or section

So excited to see Virginia's back in business! This is an amazing neighborhood spot with a burger that can hang with the greats, without the insane price tag. They are back with new appetizers and cocktails, and the vibes continue to be on point (always have a great playlist going). Highly recommend the carrot salad and hamachi to start, and you can't come and not get the burger and fries. The service here can't be beat - we've come to celebrate on many occasions (engagement, birthdays, anniversaries, NYE), and we were so grateful to be greeted by name with champagne when we came back last night! Reed and the team take great care of their regulars. Congrats on the reopening! Can't wait to come back again soon.

I recommend this place for dinner, the ambience is really nice. Service was also friendly and helpful. Their drinks are REALLY good!! I didn't try their meats/fish, but all their vegeterian stuff was really good - cannot recommend enough their carrots plate and their green salads - we had to order them twice in the same night!!

Wow.  Can't say enough about this gem of a restaurant.  My wife and I commented this morning that it is rare -- and has been a long time -- since we could say that EVERY dish we tried (and we ordered most of the menu items with the couple we went with) were PHENOMENAL.  Exquisite tastes (the burger, carrots, salmon, gem salad etc are 5 stars), the ambiance is chill and fun, the owner Reed makes his rounds and regales the crowds, and the service is prompt and friendly.  Try this spot.

the hostess moved the seats at the bar so we could sit and bartender was lovely. the drinks were amazing- we got the espresso martini and the spicy marg. we ordered fries to share and they were amazing, shoestring with mayo aoli
We had a fantastic dinner here. The burger was cooked perfectly. Fries and roasted carrots were delicious. We ended it with some of the best banana pudding I've ever had. Highly recommend!!!

One of the most inventive dining experiences in New York! Amazing menu (I'm still thinking about that waygu bite) and fun atmosphere. Awesome team behind it. Great for a fun date night or with a group of friends.

I used to eat at the other Valbella establishment near Park Ave and the 50s. I love this new location, ambience is similar and good vibes. Staff is always attentive and giving amazing service. The menu is to die for! Really love the calamari and lobster. Sushi isn't bad here either, I've tried two signature rolls before. I have lambchops from time to time. Delicious. Martinis and wine selections are good. The rooftop calls for fantastic views and air, and bustling with finance people usually due to being in the heart of Bryant Park. It's definitely one of my favorites in the area. I recommend for fine dining in the area, but definitely on the pricey side for most!

Prices are thru the roof food was good not something worth traffic and parking and toll price place was empty on a Friday evening which was nice but says alot.

Service was friendly but nothing to match the prices.  

I recommend this for a nice business meeting date but not sure I would go back unless I'm in the area.

Wowsers....this place is fancy! Wonderful location near Bryant Park with an indoor and outdoor seating area. This place is ultra high end all the way from the decor, clientele and menu/drink cost. Lamb chops were great, fries were done well, sushi was okay, calamari pretty good and egg yolk ravioli very tasty. The old fashion with tequila cocktail was fantastic but $25.

Service here was fantastic. Very attentive, maybe a little pushy on the ordering.

Definitely a place to check out if you want to impress someone.

Came here for a team dinner. There was about 10 of us at one large table. The waiters were excellent, super helpful and kind. We had a 4 course meal with wine pairing in a way. we started off the first course with two types of salad, which were delicious along with a rosé and a white wine.then we got two glasses of red, which were also very good, we got two different pastas and eggplant one and a Bolognese. I really loved the eggplant pasta and for my entrée I got the steak medallions with peppercorn sauce and mashed potatoes. It was me nothing spectacular, pretty basic and the crème brûlée for dessert. Other colleagues got the chocolate soufflé, which was a bit too chocolatey for me and had a side of ice cream, my friend had the chicken entrée and that was also not that spectacular.

A superb dining experience! The service was attentive and thoughtful. The extensive wine list will ensure even the even the pickiest wine enthusiasts will find the perfect wine to pair with dinner. The food is excellent. The truffle Alfredo pasta was our tables favorite pasta dish; creamy truffley goodness. The mozzarella chicken was good too but the pork chop had our table raving. The pork was so tender you could cut it with your fork! A beautiful restaurant in the heart of Manhattan with amazing food, a must try!

Service was outstanding. Everyone was very welcoming and super attentive to our needs.  Food was fantastic but the star of the show had to be the napoleon desert. One of the best I have ever had - and that's not to put it lightly.
The only negative was the location. It is certainly not easy to find though once we found it I realized I had walked past it twice.

Valbella is a charming and elegant but friendly and familiar place.  Our food was unique in flavor and presentation.  Service was attentive and the food came out  spaced out perfectly.  Bring a lover or business partner as the food and atmosphere offers opportunity for both.
Amazing restaurant with a fantastic location next to Bryant park. We sat on the rooftop outside which was great. The food and service were both phenomenal. I would highly recommend.

Very upscale restaurant. The ambiance is very chic and romantic. Our server was very attentive. We had the burrata salad and the fish. The perfect way to start date night before a concert in NYC. I can not wait to come back.

We came back to this gem with kids for my husbands's birthday dinner, an early evening dinner to try their regular menu. Last time we only ordered sushi and it was amazing!
The service was right on, attentive but not overbearing and our waiter had great suggestions.
We started with fried calamari which was light and tasty with a wonderful marinara sauce on the side. We also had tuna tartar from the specials which was a great. We did have a huge dish of sushi specials since we couldn't skip that. It was beautiful , so fresh also very tasty!!
For main course I really enjoyed double veal chops, grilled to perfection with vegetables on the side (baked potato, carrots and cauliflowers),  my husband did order steak and it was perfect. Kids had lamb chops from the regular menu and mushroom Ravioli  from the specials. Both amazing!!
Desserts were also well executed with Napoleon  cake being the stand out, topped with fresh almonds and amazing vanilla cream. Kids had an amazing time helping the chef prepare my husband's birthday surprise!!
I would absolutely be coming back again soon and probably bring friends to enjoy drinks on their beautiful deck!
The staff was very professional and helpful. The food was very good. Friendly cool place. The atmosphere was great location was perfect distance from grand central as well as Penn station.

Sushi was phenomenal, great ambience. I'm not sure if there was a language barrier, but I got tonic instead of soda 3x. Hopefully they fix that issue because that was really annoying and ruined my experience
Great location and service, especially for a client lunch. On the pricier side bit of wanting a wow from your guests, this a must dine.

One and done!  
So loud we had to lean in and yell to hear each other. The waiter could not have been ruder had he tried: when my friend ordered from the sushi menu he said the item didn't exist so she would have to order something more expensive.
Speaking of prices, one friend at dinner is a wine distributor and got sticker shock at the 300-500% markup. Only two wines in the wine book were under $200 a bottle!  Food prices were just as insane.
The food was good but there are lots of better Italian restaurants in Manhattan. Go to the other ones!!!

Had lunch there today. Service was impeccable. I had the Caesar salad and the pork chop with hot cherry peppers. The salad was good, but the pork chop was by far the best I've ever had. Perfectly cooked--fantastic sear on the outside. The hot cherry peppers & potatoes were a great complement to the chop. I would definitely eat there again!

I am giving this a 3 because it was a mixed experience. I LOVED the setting (lively rooftop patio) and the service (many servers who were genuinely attentive) but I thought it was overpriced and I especially hated all the cigar and cigarette smoke from the customers who were dining on the patio. I haven't been to a restaurant in 20 years that had such a strong smell of smoke in the air while I ate.

Food and service were top notch. We ordered a bunch of specials and everything was delicious; they also portion out and serve you things you want to share which is always appreciated.

However, was not impressed with the vibe:
- we were seated on the 2nd floor which looks to be for big groups only. There were ONLY groups of 6-8, did not see a single small table besides mine. We were squeezed into a table amidst the rotation. Super awkward
- I had specified this was a business meeting but they set us up at this weirdly intimate table... ???
- the floor was absolutely chaos. Waiters EVERYWHERE, no room between tables, just super frenzied atmosphere. While I appreciate the service people were hovering way too much around all the diners. Definitely not a calm or fun experience
- very strange host set up ... first you have to check in on the 1st floor (unfriendly hostesses) ride up the elevator which opens up to a very crowded bar area; everyone is knocking into each other. And the 2nd host stand is there so you check in again. Hosts were also knocking into people given the cramped set up.
- besides the outdoor patio, I don't know why the interior is getting such positive reviews. Nothing special about the decor nor the view (the restaurant is NOT on Bryant park despite the address.... Just saying for all the tourists) There is a cool wine bottle room though... I'm not sure what's on the 3rd floor, maybe that's better decorated?

I would come back for some after work drinks on the patio OR for a large business dinner given the convenient location and set up. Corporate card will be used for sure as the wine bottles are  pricey (200$ min). Otherwise not a place I would revisit, plenty of way cooler restaurants in NYC at this price point

Absolutely wonderful upscale restaurant! Their service is spot on....we felt like we were the only ones in the room. They have one the best wine selections I have ever seen! Our dinner was delicious, and so beautiful. If you are looking for a romantic place to take your loved one, this is it! Impressive!

This is still one of our go-to spots in the city when we're looking for dinner in the area.

Old review still applies. I just wanted to add this for the new items we tried this visit.

Sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich. 5/5 flavor and texture. Portion wise, it's typical. So price for portion is a bit pricier, but then again it's a bunch of vegan replacements, which tend to be pricey, so I feel like overall can't knock it for that.

Also tried the jerk chicken platter. 1/5 whatever the dominant flavor was, it wasn't enjoyable. Couldn't quite pin it. The pickled onion helped because it overrode the flavor. At the end I ate the salad and 1/4 to 1/3 of the jerk chicken.. the rest got tossed bc we weren't able to finish.  Also, it's pretty spicy on its own (which I appreciate) so consider before adding harissa sauce to it.

Food is expensive but the food is flavorless. There are better vegan spots, you can skip this one.

Place is so small, you will need to eat outside. Only good thing is you can order without talking to someone.

I heard of Vegan on The Fly through several YouTube videos when searching for vegan and vegetarian food options in NYC ahead of our trip. They showed the Seitan platter, and it looked so mouthwatering good that I added VTF to the "must visit" list.

We made our way over on a rainy Saturday while sightseeing in the area and ended up trying the seitan gyro sandwich without tomatoes and a side of fries. The seitan seasoning paired with the sauce was a perfect combination. Naturally, I made a mess eating, but I think that's a positive sign of a good meal. Next time I'm in town, I'm coming back for that seitan platter!!

The location itself is small with limited seating. The one thing I would ask visitors to keep in mind is that there isn't a bathroom here for guests. So, if you're looking to wash up before or after your meal like we were, you're outta luck. You'll have to pack some wipes with you for your day out. But don't let the lack of facilities keep you from eating here! Make this a "must-visit" while in NYC!

As a vegetarian I really appreciate being able to choose anything from an entirely vegan menu. The space inside for seating is small but cozy. Service was really kind and quick. I got the vegan drumsticks with bbq sauce. Honestly delicious. Would definitely come back and try more things off the menu too!

Wow!!! I didn't think in my 10 years of being vegan that I would get a local vegan "chicken and rice" spot, especially one that is better than the original. This is my go-to lunch / dinner spot, especially delivery. I love that they make their own seitan and have so many delicious high-protein options. I love getting their breakfast sandwich in the morning and their jerk chicken platter (it's super spicy so I ask for less spicy!) in the evening. Don't forget to treat yourself to their strawberry milkshake!

okay, so i found this place through a sponsored ad on instagram and I've been here twice! I ordered the classic gyro that comes with white sauce, lettuce and tomatoes... I added banana peppers, feta & pickles! Y'all when i say this food is good! I mean this food is Gooooooood! i must admit i was a bit salty with the costs of extra toppings but, when i say you get what you paid for!!! I meannnn you get what you paid for and the FOOD IS GOOD!

I met one of the owners "Yaz" today, we had a convo and he was absolutely lovely, very genuine and down to earth! And he even gave me a double fudge brownie treat on the house!

If you are Vegan or into trying plant based food! This is a HIGH RECOMMENDATION! The food is well crafted, seasoned and thoroughly flavored... if you are a meat eater I would say give it a shot, you will truly enjoy! Plus idk if any other "vegan" or "plant based" gyro spot in NYC. This spot is a gem! And I'm glad i saw their ad on instagram! I'll definitely be back again... and again... and AGAIN! :)

oh and my fault for the pics! i was hungry and excited to dig in! I totally forgot to take a BEFORE picture lol but, best believe the food is GOOD! :)

I absolutely love being able to walk into a restaurant and know that I can order anything off the menu without worrying about dietary restrictions. I tried my first chopped cheese which was amazing, the rice platter would give your local Halal cart a run for their money, and mac and cheese will always be my weakness. I think vegans and non vegans would enjoy this spot! Quick service but seating is a little limited.

Pretty good Nashville chicken.

About 6 seats inside + outdoor seating. Good vibe.

$16 sandwich... it is NYC.

2023/08/26 - Saturday afternoon lunch. Loved it! Jerk Chicken Mac was the highlight, so filling and flavorful. I've never had real jerk chicken, but the taste of this made me wonder what I've been missing. The chicken sandwich was good too. Since we had a gluten-free person with us, we appreciated the Loaded Fries and Rice Platter, both with Falafel. However, it would've been nice if gluten-free items were labeled on the menu itself. Sadly, ice cream was out so we couldn't try a sundae.

Staff was friendly and helpful. Seating is available inside in the back, or outside in a covered area.

Vegan chicken & rice!!! Finally. Their platters look similar to the Halal Guys platters, but all vegan, complete with the white sauce! While I've never had the non-vegan version before, I will go out on a limb and say it is similar at least based on how it looks like. I got the "chicken" version well-flavored faux chicken, delicious rice, lettuce, tomato and creamy white sauce. I would liked a bit more veggieI added jalapeños which was a great touch! It was ~$15 which you may think is pricey but overall as a vegan substitute + convenient location in midtown NYC with a store front, I think it is a fair price for an entree in NYC. Portion size was good. Food was served quickly.

I also got their Vinkies (vegan twinkies)! I I believe they buy this from a bakery and just sell it there. It was yummy! Have not had twinkies in forever. It's what you imagine- vanilla spongey cake with cream filling, nice & moist, not overly sweet.

As for other items on the menu, you can get the platters with seitan or falafel. You can also get Mac & cheese bowls, salads, and burgers. I think the other items are easier to find at other vegan places, while a chicken & rice platter I have not seen yet.

The restaurant itself is pretty small- narrow hallway with cashier to order from. You order at the front and pick up your food when they call you.  Limited seats in the back- maybe sits 8-10 at most? Went on a Saturday afternoon and found a seat. The decor is cute and "instagrammable". Staff were really friendly.

Overall, really enjoyed the food here! I would come back!
Had the impossible chopped cheese and it was really really good. Would definitely come again when I am in the city and try the rest of the menu.

My new favorite vegan spot in the city. The food is so addicting and tasty. They have tons of choices from loader fries to platters. The spot is fairly small with limited sittings but outdoor area is available. Usually stop by for a takeout. Order ahead if you can because they can get pretty busy.

I'm not vegan but if I had a spot like Vegan on the Fly near me, I would absolutely give it a try bc the food here was DELICIOUS and I would have definitely not known it was vegan at all.

The spot itself is very small - a narrow hallway with a cutout to order halfway through and a space to sit and eat at the vey back. Staff was very friendly and answered questions re: what was best to order with ease. Prices are also reasonable and portions are pretty generous.

I decided to grab a Bowl which consisted of vegan mac & cheese topped with chopped beyond chicken tenders and drizzled with buffalo sauce and vegan ranch. When I tell you it was amazing, I mean it. The cheese sauce was so creamy and delicious. Chicken was crispy and hot. Combined, it was the perfect combination of textures and flavors. Side of loaded fries were topped with a mix of ketchup and vegan mayo plus caramelized red onions. VERY good as well. The fries were hot, crispy and tossed in a great seasoning. The toppings were also plentiful and added the perfect compliment. Partner got the seitan gyro and loved every bite - get an extra side of the white sauce - you can thank me later!

At West 44Th Street, New York City -- The most delicious Middle Eastern food I ever had. Absolutely mind-blowing Today I got the chicken  (shawarma) in a salad. Comes with pickled onions, dolmas, olives, tomatoes and a fantastic white sauce. I added pickles and 1/2 a pita, which they cut into strips and laid it on top of the salad. Great idea! Yes, they have the super fluffy pitas the normal person can't buy. 10/10 rating in my book.

I liked this food soooooo much. It's really tasty vegan halal, my boyfriend and I scarfed it down. Everything was packaged really well.

The seitan flavor in the gyro comes through a decent bit, which I liked a lot, and the white sauce tastes a lot like mayonnaise I would say. The impossible "meat" in the platter had a more subtle umami flavor, but I loved the texture.

I think it's a wee bit overpriced but that's my only main complaint.

As for ambiance - it's called "On the Fly" for a reason. It's advertised as expected! The interior is more like what you'd find at a dollar pizza place, like Joe's Pizza. There is one nice wall with greenery and neon lights, but the rest of it is drab. I would recommend taking your order to-go and eat at Bryant Park.

Service gives you an option between self-serve orders and in-person. Food came really fast!
