Overall a 4.5!! Food is solid, service is solid, but I knocked a bit off for a) pricing and b) interior. Even for an "on the fly" place I wasn't digging the environment inside, which is where we waited for our food. But I would still highly recommend this place!

Insanely good plant based burgers, gyros, Mac n cheese, milkshakes and more right in the Midtown! My non-veggie friends couldn't believe how delish the gyro and chicken sandwiches are. Milkshakes are made with soy milk. Love the counter style - just order, pick up and take home or eat in their little area in the back or outdoor seating also available. Please support your local small businesses!

The best way to describe this place is vegan halal cart with cozy sit down seating. Flavors are savory and delicious! I ordered the vegan chicken platter which came with turmeric rice, white garlic parsley sauce, lettuce and olives. It was a nice-sized lunch portion. I also got a side of drumsticks, which came served on sugarcane skewers and were very saucy. Loved both items and will be coming back to try others.

Prices feel a bit premium about $20 for a lunch entree, but was happy to see a vegan restaurant getting so much foot traffic--this place gets a lot of action on weekdays from neighboring businesses and I'm happy to come back and support.

There is ample seating outdoors and in the back, can hold about 6-10 people in each area. Makes for a great grab and go vegan joint!

What a phenomenal gem in the area! My wife and I were accidentally stranded in NYC for a day thanks to Delta cancelling our connecting flight.
But this friendly and delicious restaurant helped make up for our miserable experience because the food was that exceptional.
We ordered the Impossible kefta loaded fries and Impossible chopped cheez. Both were flavor bombs and we wish this dish is what people would think of what they think vegan food...not the sad salads of the general perception. Also met one of the owners and his passion for his food is clearly evident. So glad we were able to have this experience and it always feels nice to support a small local business :)

Ordered at 8:12p, got our food 15mins later. We sat in their outdoor seating while we waited for our food. Once we went in to grab our food we were told we couldn't sit there anymore because they were closing the area. This is 35mins before closing. Multiple customers standing around shocked that they had overpriced food in hand and were essentially told too bad, nowhere to sit. The other customers were eating standing saying their food wasn't that good and were furious they continued to lock up the seating.

$120 in food and we had to walk to find somewhere to eat. It was cold and soggy by the time we found somewhere. The owner laughed when she told me they like to close 10mins early while I pointed out it was 35mins early.

Wouldn't return on the customer service alone. Too many great establishments to give this place our business. Unfortunate it's a No Go for us.

Reviewed by @dwilliamson on Instagram.
(Find vegan food reviews on my profile!)

Vegan On the Fly is a quick service Halal-inspired plant-based restaurant in the heart of Times Square in Manhattan.

Some of you may have seen reviews for this family-owned business offering amazing vegan food options like gyros, chopped cheese AND soft serve ice cream but did you know they have a SECRET?

Currency Exchange:
Inside a small room next to the kitchen is a #currencyexchange window! Inside for select hours only you'll find Driss Alami, who offers the BEST RATES for travelers in Manhattan.
(Based on daily exchange rates)
$ HOURS:
Mon - Thu: 10 AM-4 PM
Fri: 10 AM-Noon & 3-4 PM
Sat: 11 AM-3 PM
Sun: Closed

Now for the food:
We ordered a platter and wings to share while we waited for the gentleman to exchange the money. They bring the food to you if seated but we were close by waiting for that ¥!
RESTAURANT HOURS:
Sun 11 AM-7 PM
Mon - Sat 11 AM-9 PM

VEGAN RATING:
Impossible Kefta Platter
"Dinner-sized portion that's easy to share, but WOW it is so good! I've cooked impossible vegan meat before but nothing like this!"

Vegan Wings
"Loved the bbq sauce, although the buffalo sauce is also a hit! A little small but affordable protein-rich dish."

NON-VEGAN RATING:
Impossible Kefta Platter
"I give it 8/10 because it was full of flavor & tender. Every bite was pleasurable to eat."

Vegan Wings
"Texture was a little chewy but the sauce was bangin' so I give it a 7/10. Would order again!"

SAVE this for next time your planning to travel  or SHARE with a friend traveling soon!

I can finally have white sauce!!! I've gotten falafel from plenty of trucks so nothing new there, but grateful for the sauces and other options like impossible and seitan. You can order at the kiosk or in person and there is indoor and outdoor seating. Food comes out pretty quick. Great casual location for midtown lunch during the week! I've only ever had the salads but can recommend the seitan and the jerk chicken. Don't skip the juices either!

The McChicken dupe was a 5/5! Superrrr good, just a little oily. It tasted almost exactly the same as a McChicken.

The jerk Chicken was a 1/5. Wayyy to much spice to mask the taste of it. I ordered a jerk chicken gyro--took 2 bites and it was trashed. Worst sauce Ive had in a while.

Also ordered the reg chicken salad with hot sauce. The lettuce is reg. Ol romaine lettuce. The hot sauce was also super overbearing and took over the taste of the white sauce--which is super subtle.

Overall if I ever came back here it would be for a McChick'n

The strawberry lemonade was mid. 2.5/5.

They were kind enough to replace the jerk chicken gyro for something else-- great customer service.

100/10 would recommend this place to everyone even if you are not a vegan or vegetarian. My boyfriend and I love this place, we saw it on TikTok and decided to try it. It was amazing, food was great & delicious. Service was fast and amazing, and staff was so nice and welcoming. My boyfriend is a Vegetarian/Vegan and I am a newly vegetarian but I love vegan food as well. We cannot wait to return and try other items on the menu. We have tried the Gyro with vegan chicken, vegan chicken over rice, and loaded fries with onions (it was so good we only got a picture of one of the foods) my boyfriend also got a strawberry shortcake  milkshake and I had a vanilla with chocolate drizzle milkshake. Overall Excellent restaurant, food, service and more. If I can give more than 5 stars I would.

Ps. I am a picky eater and don't eat everything so my reviews be honest and real

The gyro is delicious, but overpriced--you don't really feel like you're getting $14 worth of food, which is what their cheapest gyro costs, plus tax.

The toppings on the loaded fries were great, but the fries I received were completely stale--no give to them whatsoever. You couldn't even poke them with a fork. They weren't even crunchy in a fun way--they were just stale and gross.

The lemonade is fantastic, and was the only fairly priced thing on the menu, as far as taste and what you receive.

The dining experience is a complete afterthought--this is essentially a takeout place, because they wouldn't let us eat inside, and the outdoor dining shack is dingy.

This place could be so good if the prices were a little better and the quality were stronger across the menu. I'm used to falafel places having incredible fries--these were like if I baked the cheapest frozen shoestring fries I could find, then left them on my kitchen counter for 24 hours. I hope they up the quality one day.

Oh this place is yummy. They have an easy self service ordering kiosk that makes things simple. A nice indoor or outdoor eating space (nothing fancy) but quaint and palatable. The taste of my falafel platter will definitely make me a repeat customer. Kind staff too. Limited desserts and my drink was just okay. They have an impossible option I'm interested in trying too. I recommend this vegan spot :) it's not too far from time square.

This spot is LIKE NO OTHER! First of all, they pioneered the all vegan gyro spot concept and took it OVER THE MOON! The options are overwhelming, you'll want one of everything. It's perfectly balanced between comforting and protein rich. I love that you can customize everything. Adding different meat types, cheeses, veggies, sauces! And there's various options that really differ in flavor in texture so it all adds something different but these magicians really know how to create the perfect combo of things. Everything tastes so RICH and full of flavor. And I love that I can easily ask any question about flavor palates and combo recs and they've got the specific answer I needed. Everyone is so dope too and the vibe is too notch. You feel like you're just going to ya cousins house to eat that good good!

They've got sandwiches, loaded fries, platters, wraps, empanadas which vary daily, fresh house made juices and desserts and amazing sides. I love the Mac and cheese. I think their Mac and cheese tastes like my favorite childhood Mac and cheese IYKYK!

My key takeaways:
Fast! Came out in less than 10 minutes.
Full of flavor! Strong and rich!
Various customizable options for every thing!
Options for every flavor palate and texture
Various sauces! I love sauces.
Packed in / they do not skimp on anything nor do they overdo it. Perfect portion sizes.
The bread is super fluffy.
No nuts! (I have a nut allergy and it's nice to try everything
It's perfectly heavy without being greasy or overfilling.
It's still healthy and protein and veggie rich.
Not overly processed - comforting and healthy.
Their marinades are authentic and one of a kind!

Overall, don't miss out on coming here whether you live here or are just visiting, this is a MUST TRY spot. Whether you're vegan or not!

Things you need to know:
They have a seating spot in the back and outside in the front
No bathroom
Very fast and easily eatable on the go
Vibes and music on point
Nut free!
Lots of gluten

Umm yeah this needs to become a chain ASAP!!
Was my first & definitely not my last visit. I've eaten many vegan dishes/foods to compare with what I had(a gyro wrap)and hands down the founder/cooks definitely know what they are doing! The flavors were seriously off the chain, it was truly hard to accept what I was eating wasn't meat. Even customer service was top tier. As if eating vegan dishes isn't enough, they serve healthy beverages.
The only con I could think of was how small the space was..There are 4-5 bar stool seats, plus a small couch chair. They also have seating outside. My tips for visiting come with extra $$ because you're going to want seconds like me!
Call ahead to see if there are seats available.
Try everything! Because I'm a photographer & slightly obsessed with capturing beautiful people, places & things, I asked these beauties for an impromptu mini shoot. Last tip, take some selfies with your girl gang in the back! Lastly, not sure if this man was the manger or owner, but I thought it was lovely that he asked the customers myself included, if we were pleased/good with our food. Now it don't get any better!! Run don't walk to Vegan on the Fly!!

Cozy little place, the staff is so welcoming and nice but lets get into the food!

First of all, the variety of the menu is amazing!! Definitely something for everyone. I chose the gyro and just looking at it, I knew I was going to be in love!!
Just the right amount of everything but I ordered extra white sauce because that's how I roll.

Needless to say, I scarfed it down in less than 2 mins then was angry at myself because I didn't get two! So of course, every time I'm in the area (or not tbh), I'll have to stop by.

It's so good, by the end of the year, I would have tried the whole menu!!
The food was amazing and everyone was so nice and helpful. The shop was small but super cute!

Such a flavorful gyro!! I could not have asked for a softer bread, crispier pickled onions, or tangier seitan. The portion size was humongous too, so it's worth the price. Just a work of art, from the food to the decor. The employees also made my day with their upbeat attitude and cheerful vibes!

Will definitely come here again to indulge :)

This is purely for the amazing food. I couldn't stop eating it. The place is pretty tiny, only a few stools to sit n eat and a little photo corner. This is definitely something you eat on the fly or take with you. The portions are great and the service was fast. I had the BBQ Drumsticks and a BBQ Mac bowl. Both were finger licking good lol.

Delicious vegan food! Another great addition to the food scene. I like their take in halal food.

What we got.

- the platter with vegan chicken, full of flavor. Right balance of sauce and rice,

- Moroccan meatball tagline special, great option if you don't want sauce. The meatballs have a lot of flavor.

- one star reduction for the packaging and forks, although compostable. its very flimsy, cheap and easily spills and gets knocked over. The fork was falling apart not too soon after use

We found this place literally on the fly for lunch. They were setting up the parade route and we walked down the road and saw it. The gyro was amazing. It's the first time I've had one since I went vegan five years ago and I loved it. Saucy, packed with tomatoes, accompanied with crispy fries. This place knocked it out of the park. If you like solid food that will keep you satisfied; this is a great place to eat
The burger & fries were delicious! The service was amazing & friendly. Outdoor seating too

I went vegan 6 years ago and haven't had chicken over rice since. Came to VOTF since I was visiting from out of town to see if they could recreate the experience AND I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED.

The white sauce was 10/10
The spices 10/10
Could not even tell the difference that the entire entrée was plant-based.

Highly recommend for vegans AND non vegans

Omg loved the gyro style platter. Can't wait to try other options when I return.

Maybe the gyro itself with all the fixings?! We will see.

If you've ever wanted vegan versions of foods like chopped cheese, gyros, or street meat, Vegan on the Fly is your place. There are four main proteins - original (seitan), vegan chicken, falafel, and Impossible kefta - which you can get in a gyro, salad, platter, or loaded fries, and the menu also has some other options for sandwiches, burgers, and sides. They had vegan desserts by the register, but I didn't have a chance to investigate those (this time).

After hearing that they make the seitan in-house, I decided to go with that on a platter. The platter comes with basmati rice, salad, grape leaves, and white sauce, and it's reminiscent of the street meat platters from the carts lining the nearby avenues. I was impressed from the first bite, and the seitan is an amazing vegan version of street meat. I would 100% recommend this dish to anyone looking to try NYC street meat without the meat.

While I loved what I got, it was a little pricey. The platter I got was $16 (without adding extra sauces or anything else), and that was the lowest priced platter they had. The ingredients are high quality, and everything was delicious, so I'm not saying it's not worth it, but it's a bit out of my price range to make it an everyday type of thing. I definitely want to come back and get the seitan platter (or try something else) in the future though!

My friend recently recommended this place and I'm so glad I tried it! I've ordered a couple times since then because the food is just SO good and I want to try everything. The burger is amazing, the milkshakes are incredibly thick and creamy (even delivered!) and the mac and cheese tastes just like I remember it from before I went vegan. I've only ordered delivery, so I can't say much about the actual restaurant space but definitely have to add that the staff is always super friendly and accommodating! If you want to order something specific and don't see it on the menu, just give them a call and they'll do their best to accommodate you and make it work. Really great spot!

Vegan on The Fly is amazing! Visiting New York, I've passed countless street food vendors, bodegas etc that offered burgers, hotdogs, gyros, etc... None of them happened to be plant based. Vegan on The Fly provides those options. VOTF has all the options that bodegas and street vendors offer and more.

Prior to being vegan, I've always said when I visit NYC, I'll be going for a chopped cheese and I was able to do that here. The chopped cheese was amazing; had it been served at a bodega nobody would tell the difference. I also got a side of fries and a ginger pineapple drink. The fries was nice and greasy with plenty of salt similar to McDonalds and the drink was very refreshing with a nice amount of ginger in it for this cold day.

I wish I had photos of the food but I mopped it all prior to realizing I should leave a review.

5 Stars, the food is amazing, service was awesome (had a great convo with one of the employees), and there's a nice picturesque area for the social media pics.

This place is a gift from above.
There are not a lot of vegan restaurants in the Times Square area, so VOTF was smart and making that decision to open up here. Their menu features veganized Halal cart classics (platters, gyros, salads), and other comfort, food classics like mac & cheese, bowls and sandwiches: so many options to choose from!
There are no wrong choices on the menu, but my personal favorite that I cannot rave enough about is the Jerk Chckn Platter: vegan jerk, chicken, over rice, with a side salad, grape leaf, and your voice of toppings. I just love how many flavors and ingredients go into one bowl, it feels like a complete meal! Also... Can we just talk about how amazing the rice is?! I have been looking for a good yellow rice for years and VOTF has perfected it-chef's kiss! They also make a really good vegan macaroni and cheese and I love how they have tons of catering options.
Last, but not least, the service is amazing. They were very patient as I asked many questions and made special requests for my order. I also had the pleasure of meeting the owner, and you can tell he really cares about his customers and what he does.
For a quick vegan carryout meal, this place has my heart (and my wallet)!

I had a chopped cheese and dark chocolate salted caramel cupcake and it was amazing!!!! It was truly delicious. Everyone was super nice and helpful with the suggestions on what to try. I was even gifted ice cream to try and it's been one of the best vegan ice creams I've had.

I love this food. Everything is vegan . My husband and I came here to celebrate our 9th wedding anniversary . This food is delicious, seasoned , flavorful and good size portions.  My husband and I ordered a lot of food . Gyros which are not easy to find vegan , the vegan chicken sandwich , fries vegan chopped cheese with vegan bacon and vegan chicken platter and kefta platter to go. Everything is delicious.  I highly recommend giving this place a try. Seating is limited however there is more seating outside or you can always take the food to go and enjoy it at home or a nearby park .  And the strawberry lemonade was refreshing and went well with the food and the staff was hard working and kind the food came out quickly as well and the food looks delicious and tasted delicious. Highly recommend.
Customer service was quick and fantastic. Food looked amazing and fast. A great experience and good stop for vegan food.
The food is excellent. Seating is limited, though. Good value for downtown NYC. Would come again.

They nailed NYCChopped Cheese Sandwich food veganised. I had a chopped cheese and empanada, my friend had a seitan gyro, and we both got lemonades.

Everything was how you would hope-- empanada crispy, chopped cheese sloppy and delicious, gyro filling, and lemonade refreshing.

The seating was limited and nothing fancy. The service was friendly and very quick.

I'm adding this place to my regulars and my list of where to take friends when they visit NYC.

Easy walk-up counter with space to sit outside as well as inside. It's good vegan junk food/comfort food. I tried the chicken gyro and the drumsticks, which were both very tasty. My companion had the pepperoni empanada and he liked it.
Super fast and easy.

I picked up dinner here on a weekend. Someone in a previous review described the food as comparable to a vegan halal cart, and I think that's a great description. I really liked the offerings and the food came out very quickly. It is a bit pricy, but the portions are big.

The space itself is very small. There is some room to sit in the back, but not a lot. There is some outdoor seating too.

I wasn't sure what to expect when we came here for a quick bite, but this place was DELICIOUS. My fiancé got the gyro with seitan, and I got the Impossible Kofta platter. Even though we're both vegan, I don't always like to eat meat substitutes since they can be too salty, but Vegan on the Fly's meat substitutes were seasoned perfectly! I thought that I'd be overstuffed from the platter since it looked intimidating, but the serving size was just right. I couldn't get enough of the kofta and I also loved the seitan that my fiancé got. Well done vegan food.
A few  weeks ago I tried their drumsticks with ranch dressing. Omg. It was delicious. Next I'll try something else. They have an extensive menu and even if your not vegan you would love this place!

First time in the restaurant. I have been in the vegan movement for almost five years and I know what meat taste like. I found this restaurant and after reading the menu I decided to order a vegan chicken gyro.
My gyro had good portions of vegetables and sauce. Excellent flavor.
I know that I will be back to the place because I really enjoy the food.
The restaurant has great service and the crew was very kind and very welcoming.
They have good manners and I really enjoy the atmosphere in the restaurant.
Too bad that they don't have more restaurants in other counties.
Food and drinks were delicious and I loved the location. Steak Frites is what I ordered and I loved it.

Made reservations at 12:30, and was seated promptly. The decor is quite Art Deco, makes you feel posh and ready for a drink! Their cocktail menu is elaborate, way more than their menu - not necessarily a bad thing since you can easily decide what you want. For three people, we got:

Cauliflower gratin - looks like mac and cheese but slightly healthier. This was super creamy and delicious. I wish there was a tiny bit more cauliflower to finish the sauce.
Flatbread was crisp and flavorful, prob not my favorite but a good shareable plate.
Gem cut lettuce was surprisingly very refreshing and packed with cheese.
Grilled chicken sandwich was hearty and the accompanying sauce makes it stand out.

We were super full at the end. Not sure how I would go back to work, I would just take a nap.

Came here for an after show drink.  
The ambiance is very nice and the staff was very pleasant.

The place specializes in gin. They have a huge selection of gins I haven't seen before.  The bartender was very nice and was able to create special drinks for us.

The food was also very good, aside from a few minor issues.  I ordered steak, which was undercooked and under seasoned.

We also had the short rib pasta.  This was delicious.
The grilled octopus was also a star.
Brussels sprouts were under seasoned.

Overall a nice place to come on a date.

Every time I come here, I forget to take photos of the food! A great sign to me. The atmosphere is electric here from the food, service, and decor. It's like a dark, seductive cave - perfect for dates or get-togethers with the girls!

As for the food and the drinks, they are fantastic. I've had the Organic Half Chicken, Spinach & Artichoke Dip, Truffle Fries, and Brussel Sprouts. If you are the type to do family style, the different sides and starters are enough for a full meal. They are medium-sized dishes. My friends and I love to do family-size sharing here alongside the drinks.

Plus, the service is great! They are highly attentive here and give great suggestions of drinks and food.

Cute spot for a jazz brunch! Honestly one of the best grilled chicken sandwiches I've ever had!!! It was delicious. The speciality cocktails were great as well. A spacious restaurant, however this ended up with us being seated very far away from the Jazz band and so we didn't really get to enjoy the music too much.

Just love this place!!!

it was absolutely perfect from the exterior. The Beautiful entrance, the art deco interior, and even the fabulous ladies room... I could not have thought of a better place to have an impromptu lunch.

My Kale  and radicchio salad with salmon was cooked perfectly
and dressed perfectly as well.

My husband also really liked his salmon entrée.

The service was Flawless!  Ohh we had a great lunch in Thanks to others reviews.

I would definitely go back again.

Cool spot to visit for a few drinks while out and about in the city. Really dig the ambiance and the way have the place decorated. Definitely gives you an proper introduction to New York. Can't provide any feedback on the food since our visit was for last minute drinks while exploring the city. As for service, every employee from security, wait staff and our bartender were super hospitable. Our bartender, Anthony, was attentive and helpful when asking him for recommendations.

1 star knock off due to how busy/packed it is at the bar.

Came to Valerie for the oyster and cocktail happy hour and was very satisfied with the drinks and food! There was another event happening in the front when I went (looked like a company happy hour event?) so it was a little loud, which is why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars.

I tried the petal pusher (hh cocktail) and then for dinner we ordered burrata and brussel sprouts for the table and I ordered the salmon. They cooked the salmon perfectly which I appreciated and I'd definitely order the brussel sprouts again. The petal pusher had a very strong floral taste which I expected and was served in a cute smaller glass - it was stronger than I expected but watered down with the large ice over the course of dinner. Service was very nice and friendly and did a good job of taking care of us and letting us know when hh was about to end in case we wanted to order anything else.

All in all, great food and drink, just a bit loud.

Came for a quick Sunday brunch with 2 friends. It's a fairly large restaurant and that particular Sunday wasn't too packed. It's super cute inside and has a lot of different spaces for seating. I had the Korean chicken and waffles and the cornbread waffle was delicious but the amount of sauce on the chicken made the waffle super soggy before I could even get to enjoy it. When ordering, I asked the waiter if I could get the sauce on the side and he said I could not. But I'm not sure why I couldn't and honestly I probably would've enjoyed it better had I been able to do that. My friend had an omelet which she enjoyed and my other friend felt that her salad with chicken was bland. I was really hoping to like it better but was slightly disappointed.

Such a fun place to have a drink and a nosh if you are in the theater district. Love their exceptional variety of gin based cocktails. Also loved the beautiful decor. So many great snacks and little bites to enjoy. Service was attentive and they worked within our time frame to get in and out before our show without issue. Would definitely return to Valerie if we were in the theater district, or just for a beautiful bar with lots of variety to share a drink with friends.
This bar is absolutely beautiful! The decor is very cute. Honestly this is a gin lovers dream. The bartenders are attentive and the food is delicious!

8/31/23
8:30pm
Part of 2

Dinner after exploring Manhattan, we found this beautiful restaurant.
Very dim, huge bar, friendly staff.

Salmon w/quinoa: 10/10 tons of flavor in the quinoa.  May look simple but it's delicious.

1/2 Roast Chicken: 10/10 seared mushroom & caramelized onions. Rosemary potatoes.  Highly recommend this beautiful dish

Cheesecake:  7/10 Presentation is very pretty. Flavor was good.

Cool spot close to Grand Central! Stopped by on a Saturday for brunch with friends. The outside was decorated with flowers and the inside gave a speakeasy type vibe. This would be a good place for a date as they have a bar, booths, etc.

I ordered the Egg & Lump Crab Salad as it sounded interesting and came with a side salad. I was surprised at how something so simple tasted so good! It was light, refreshing, yet surprisingly filling. I didn't try any of their specialty cocktails but I was intrigued by the descriptions. I will probably try one next time!

Lovely place not far from the Hyatt Centric on 45th. Enter into a coffered ceiling, dim golden light, with a to-the-ceiling bar filled with varietals of gin. The menu was extensive for cocktails, and bartenders truly craftsmen with the recipes! I had salmon on greens, carrots and a glass of Pinot Grigio .. a bit pricey for veggies, but you're in NYC...

Went here with my girlfriends and absolutely loved the vibes
They had a negronis week - I tried the butterscotch symphony and loved it.
They have a variety of cocktails to choose from! . The waitress recommended couple of drinks but really dint hit the taste and she was very accomodating and changed the drinks for us. Loved the service here ! go

We just tried the appetizers here and food was nice.I liked the hummus platter, though fries were soggy and lacked any taste.
But would definitely recommend this place for drinks and the vibe !
Been here a few times for drinks and food. Everything was really good. Loved the espresso martini. This restaurant is a crowd pleaser, plenty of options no matter what you're in the mood for.

Valerie was an adorable spot for a nice trendy brunch. My friends and I loved the outside and the intimate inside vibe--its perfect for a cute casual date or get-together with friends. The waiter recommended the Korean fried chicken, and it did not disappoint. The chicken was seasoned beautifully and had the perfect crunch. The waffle was a nice savory and mellow contrast to the sweet and flavor-packed chicken. The biscuits were also wonderful, along with the berry compote it came with. I loved every part of this meal, and it was very affordable considering the large portion sizes.

This is my 3rd visit in the past 3 months. I have sat both upstairs and down.  Drinks at bar,  appetizers only night and dinner.
All have been good, not great, but a good choice and a nice variety menu

The main dishes were perfect, I had the pistachio crusted halibut.
Only critique is the appetizers could use more finessing or flavor for the price being charged. Ordered the burrata, but there was barely any with some bread and veggies. The avocado hummus needs some work. Either way, I'd skip over to dinner if I were to visit again. Staff is amazing.

This was a really fun spot to hit up while staying in NYC. We went during their happy hour, which I certainly recommend!

I tried the charcuterie board on their HH menu as well as one of the HH drinks. I would rate the food and drinks a 3 star, but the ambiance and decor of the place is just so cool. Service was a bit slow, but we weren't in a rush so it was all good.

Have brunch here, the food was great. The steak is kind of tough but very flavorful. The short ribs and grits was good as well.

The service is great. They were attentive. The place is very pretty and there live jazz band on Sunday so a perfect time to go for brunch. It's surprisingly not that pack.

My friend did mention her drink is just okay.

Great food!! My only caveat is it's LOUD... I felt like I was in a phone booth with 3 other people and they all had their own conversation. Holy cow!! It was insanely loud. It has a speakeasy feel but surly the cocktails were not as good as the food!! We got the fish, charcuterie and spinach artichoke dip.
Very standard for a gastropub/American food but they were all executed very nicely. It was not cheap. 3 cocktails plus food= 200$. It's a sign of the times. Definitely worth a try. Bon appetit!!

Valerie is a hidden gem! It's location is great for a pre- or post-Broadway show, and I'd highly recommend making a reservation. The food is outstanding - great fresh oysters, phenomenal salads and fish entrées, and ridiculous desserts you don't want to miss (but really need to share). The servers were really good, attentive and engaged, with awesome recommendations. The gin cocktail menu is something else entirely - such a great selection and worth arriving early to enjoy a pre-dinner drink or two. Fun atmosphere.
Didn't try the food here. Group came to hang out and drink. Servers were very attentive and polite. Drinks although not the best they did the trick. Presentation was nice though.

TLDR: good food, good vibes, loud bar, wish they'd mark allergens on the menu.

The vibes at Valerie are truly immaculate. The art deco theme is carried throughout the bar so that it's just enough to set the tone but doesn't come off gaudy or like a comedic bit. If you come here for nothing else, it's a great place for pictures.

But you should come here for other things. The service we received was top notch--our waiter was friendly and attentive, and offered to replace my food when there was a misunderstanding (more on that below). Every person we interacted with was lovely.

The food and drinks were also delicious. They have a varied range of cocktails in a thematically-appropriate booklet, as well as a decent number of mocktails. I got the salmon and my friends both got the papardelle, and they adored their dish. I did not fully read the menu and found a grain on my plate, which I could not eat because I'm gluten sensitive (again, they offered to replace but because it was my own mistake I just didn't eat that part of the dish).

I knocked one star off for not marking the menu with allergens and for the noise level. The bar area is quite loud. The seating area in the back is a little quieter, so you can at least hear each other, but you still have to speak up to be heard.

I decided to dine at Valerie for a last-minute birthday dinner with a couple of friends. Having made the decision to dine there the right after leaving a Late Show with Stephen Colbert taping, we did not make reservations, and we were STARVING! Upon arrival, we were disappointed to see that the place was PACKED, and of course, they didn't have any available tables. However, as my friend walked away to the restroom before we left to check out another restaurant, one of the hostesses was kind enough to let us have a table by the bar! Amazing!

I am so glad we were able to stay. Despite the unexpected noise level and crowdedness (people standing all around us, since we were by the bar), we were able to enjoy our delicious dinner and craft cocktails!

I have nothing new to say that others have not already said, but want to emphasize that they care about their craft and use fresh high-quality ingredients for both food and beverages. I definitely plan to visit again next time I am in New York!

Beautiful venue with great food. Service was really spot on and the food came out at a perfect pace. The NEW YORK SOPPRESSATA - cured italian pork, creamy burrata, basil, tomato flatbread to start was great but the creamy burrata placed on top seemed out of place. Too big and cold to make a compliment to the very tasty flatbread. The BABY GEM CAESAR - parmesan crisp, focaccia crouton, sunflower seeds, lemon caesar dressing was very good. Though the sunflower seeds offered an interesting texture for a common dish I think I could have done without them. My main course of the HIDDEN FJORD SALMON - celeriac puree, swiss chard, ras el hanout couscous, chive butter, purple cauliflower gremolata was very tasty but sampling the NEW YORK STRIP STEAK FRITES - 12oz grass-fed brandt steak, hand-cut french fries, peppercorn compound butter, green garlic chimichurri that was also at the table made me wish I made that choice.

Overall, a great experience with only a few oddities on the menu selections that keep it from going all the way to five stars.

My boyfriend had a wonderful birthday dinner at Valerie! The service was awesome and our waitress was very attentive. The drinks we ordered were delicious and strong-pretty too! We both had medium rare steak and they were both cooked to perfection!!! Super tender and flavorful and I loved using the chimichurri sauce. My salad was also amazing. My boyfriends fries were so so good too. At the end they gave us a delectable chocolate fruit tart and we couldn't get enough. Valerie is a gorgeous restaurant-the ambience reminds me of Great Gatsby. I highly recommend this place if you are in Manhattan!

We had brunch here last year on November 26, during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend. It was a fabulous experience. The ambiance was relaxed but upscale, the service impecable, and the food divine.

We were on vacation in NYC (and not driving) so we tried several of their gin infused tea libations ($16)  and they were all creative and delicious. The Chai, Green Tea, and Tea with the Queen all tied for first place!

We started with the Chef's Sourdough ($9) toast for the table. The burrata was velvety and the prosciotto lean and the heirloom tomato confit, balsamic glaze and micro basil complemented them very well. I had the Valerie Omelet ($23) with ham, onions, and fontina, and it was cooked perfectly fluffly and the ingredients were all fresh and high quality. My wife had the Crab Cake Benedict ($26) and the breading was flaky and delicate and the crab was succulant and delectable. We were stuffed, but I regret not trying their Banofee Pie French Toast. It looked incredible.

Overall, a top notch place in a city with hefty competition, so I don't say it lightly. Whether you're in a NY for a weekend, a longer vacation, or a lifetime, make Valerie's a priority. It's worth it!

Came on Saturday evening to meet up with a friend

the servers and staff here are beyond generous and welcoming. immediately upon entering was seated and served. we both ordered  the gnocci given prices here are sliiightly high but this dish did not disappoint. everything tasted so fresh and cooked from scratch. the gnocci was chewy and thick. the sauce was a white puree not too salty but full of rich flavor including pesto and white sauce. the garnish was blossom greens super fresh. what especially made this dish was the truffle oil - strong yet delicious hit of truffle. definitely want to come back and have a drink at the bar otherwise great spot!

So I wandered into this place without a reservation this past Sunday. WOW!!! Loveddddd it. Live Jazz? Check! Brunch ? Check! Delish cocktails? Check! Beautiful bar and ambience? Check!!! Looking forward to returning. I had the Nutella French Toast. YUMMMMMMMM!!!

I love the vibe here. The atmosphere and ambiance is everything--very cool and modern, but with a slight "prohibition-style" twist. The cocktails are wicked good--and strong. When it came to ordering food, I wanted everything on the menu but settled for the fluke hamachi, hot spinach & artichoke dip, homemade truffle gnocchi pasta, and the NY strip steak with chimichurri sauce and truffle fries. I ate all of it--everything--not a single bite left. Absolutely delicious. The servers were also great--very knowledgeable with respect to the menu and made great cocktail recommendations. Checked in on us often to make sure we were having an enjoyable experience and kept our drinks full. What more can you ask for?

Gorgeous interior... we started at the bar for happy hour and enjoyed oysters and wonderfully crafted cocktails.
Had reservations and sat in back. Really a beautiful place.
I had the traditional paper plane drink and it was made perfect.
We really loved the shrimp bao buns. The tuna tartar was also excellent. They were stand out, buns were like pillows. The charcuterie board and oysters were both a deal for happy hour.

Came here around 2 PM on a Saturday for brunch. The inside is spacious and the bar is beautiful. Staff was so attentive and so kind. We started with complimentary biscuits, and each ordered Caesar salads - one with salmon one with no protein. The salmon was 10/10 the salad was good too but not a standout. The hashbrowns were unique and everyone enjoyed them. This is a nice spot in an area of midtown where there aren't many good places to eat, I'd definitely drop by again.

Cute venue for happy hour or gathering, beautiful interior design, the place is pretty spacious, love the bar area and the stairs to the 2nd floor. We came for a team happy hour and stayed at the bar area for a while before being seated. The drinks are pricey but tastes ok, the food was decent. Overall good vibe and very picturesque

Food:
- Truffle Fries: Great for sharing! Generous portion. The sauce on the side (not the ketchup) is so good. Fries are crispy!!
- New York Soppressata: Very Filling. Love the fresh Burrata in the middle. Taste like a good pizza but on a thinner and crispier dough
- Half Chicken: Chicken was very tender and juicy. Lots of fava beans on the bottom.

Service: servers were great!

Interior: the bar is gorgeous and overall it's very romantic, I think once its 8pm or 9pm the lights dim.

Overall: they have so many cocktails, so I definitely think if you are interested in drinks come here. Great for a night out with the girls or a date night!

Love this bar! It is a classic spot in midtown to go to after a show a radio city or after work if you work near Rock Center. If it is a Friday or a Saturday (especially) I would recommend making a reservation. The drinks are great and the service is good. I usually get a whiskey based drink here and have never been disappointed.
Came to the bar and it's everything New York City is. Friendly bartenders and good drinks. The ambiance is the winner.
Excellent vibe and delicious cocktails. Very attentive bartenders. Will definitely visit when in the area.

Dined here for a table of four. We each ordered a cocktail. I personally ordered the cocktail remedy and two people ordered 10,000 words which means it's the bartender's choice.

As appetizers, we ordered the burrata & stone fruit, tuna tartare and grilled octopus. We found the tuna tartare really good and you could never go wrong with burrata.

As entrees, I ordered handmade truffle gnocchi. It was delicious. I was sad I was too full to finish it. Two people ordered the lobster special. And lastly one person ordered the seared black cod. Everybody loved what they ate.

The service here is wonderful and the vibes are on point.
Love this place for the drinks and ambiance. I'll certainly be back  however incredibly bustling and social it is, I love how it still offers a more intimate setting in the back dining area.

They have a nice decor inside and I was able to be seated right away midafternoon without a reservation, but it was still surprisingly busy at that time. They have a very extensive drink menu, so I went with a server recommendation.  I just got a salad and drink and they were both good and the service was quick.

I've been to Valerie twice now and both times the service, ambiance, and drinks were top notch. The bar area is BEAUTIFUL with tall ceilings that showcase their alcohol selection, and the dining areas feel like a modern take on old New York.

Right near the heart of midtown, Valerie features great prices, and select happy hour drinks are only $11 from 4pm-7pm Monday - Friday. The only downside of Valerie is that they charge a credit card processing feee so bring cash if you can!

My friends and I have unanimously decided to add this to our happy hour rotation! I'd recommend making a reservation as we were taken straight back to our table and we noticed others being told there was a wait.

I was in the area and looked for a nice spot for Happy Hour after work and Valerie came up.  The photos in Yelp were more than enough to make me want to check this place out.  The interior is absolutely beautiful!  Walking into this bar is like stepping back in time to a different era of New York City's history when buildings used combinations of metal, wood and marble work to create amazing exteriors and interiors.   There are definite strong Art Deco influences in this bar and it is really a feast for the eyes.

I was able to squeeze in at an area towards the back of the bar.  There is plenty of room on the first floor including a back room seating area and smaller section that can be reserved for parties (there were two going on the day I visited).

Valerie specializes in drinks that have Gin in them along with a wide array of flavored syrups and fresh herbs.  I only had one drink that evening, the "Faint Expression" which is a rum blend, clementine, lime, vanilla rose black tea,
cedar berry tincture, rose water aroma.  The one word I will use to describe this drink is that it is "floral".  I don't mean that in a bad way.  It is definitely distinct and unique while also refreshing in its own way.  I'm usually more of a Whiskey type person myself, so this is not my usual type of drink but I definitely enjoyed it.

Service was fantastic.  Despite having two parties I was squeezed in without any issues and the bartender mixed my drink super fast.  She was courteous and patient as I looked through the extensive drink menu.

If you want a very cool spot for after work drinks in a beautiful space in Midtown this is a fantastic choice.

I came to Valerie for dinner and drinks last Thursday with a friend. Valerie is an upscale cocktail bar, with high ceilings and beautiful decor. It's conveniently located in Midtown, but not right in the middle of Times Square, which makes it easier to access.

At 6:30pm when we arrived, the bar was packed for happy hour, which they have on weekdays from 4-7pm. They have a couple of cocktail options for $11+, as well as $9+ wines (including prosecco) and $7+ beer. Their regular menu prices are much higher at $18+ for cocktails, so I can see why it gets busy especially during happy hour.

We had dinner reservations at 8:30pm, which was late, but this was the only time available when we booked.
For dinner, we were lead up to the 2nd floor, which had a cozy and intimate feel.
We ordered the Brussel Sprouts ($14+) and Crab Cake ($26+) to share, both of which were delicious. The Brussel Sprouts were the perfect crispness, with a bit of sweet and spicy. I would love to order it again.
Because we ended up drinking more than eating, our bar tab came out to be higher than our meal.

One thing to note is that they charge a 3.95% credit card fee--they indicate the price for cash and credit on your bill.

The food and especially drinks are on the pricier side, but if you're looking for a nice evening out in Midtown, this is a great option.

Decided to stop here for a drink while waiting for a table at Mitr Thai.

Ambiance - 3/5 - Cute interior but extremely packed. There was no seating, only standing room. It was extremely hard to get a drink at the bar because of the swarm of people. Lack of organization.

Drinks - 3/5 - Drinks were decent. I got a few tequila drinks that were smokey and flavorful. Some were on the sweeter end. It was nothing spectacular but also not bad.

Service - 4/5 - Good service. Bartender was solo so it was a little tough to track him down to get a drink. I wish there was more organization or even a lesser amount of people allowed to walk-in.

Overall, glad I came but probably will not be coming back here.

I visited Valerie on a Monday evening with two friends visiting from out of town. We chose Valerie due to its vicinity to both Grand Central and Times Square (which is where they were staying during their time in NYC). I'll start by saying the bar is very attractive and the cocktail list is extensive. We grabbed drinks at the bar before dinner and all were carefully crafted and tasty.

For dinner, we split the burrata, grilled octopus, and baby gem Caesar salad, which were all good. For mains, 2 of us got the burger, which was substantial and delicious. Overall, a very positive dining experience.

Beautiful rustic venue. Defiantly great for a couple. We went there with a group of 45 ladies, each of us order different items. The food was top-notch incredible. The food, however, took an hour to get to our table, which was excessive.

Our waiter started out, really great very informative. He was a new guy that overwhelmed did not come to the table. We had to ask for our food several times, and he spit on us the entire time. He was our waiter when he talked.

Came here for happy hour on a Thursday - definitely an energetic vibe! A go-to for post-work drinks in midtown. It was a bit loud even at the back at a table but did enjoy the energy, and the service was pretty quick even though it was crowded.

We had a couple cocktails and the $1 happy hour oysters (!!). The drinks were good but not mind blowing, but at $11 they're still a great happy hour deal. The oysters were good but all the same type and they didn't tell us which type - would have loved a mix and some more info. But overall enjoyed it a lot!

Had a really good expereince here this past Friday.  Great place to go if you are a gin fan.  They have over 70 brands of gin. Ordered their Vesper martin which was excellent.  They give a traditional martinin glass ( see picture) so it is very small, but they give you a refill bottle on ice.
Truly enjoyed it.

Next I ordered their tart gin and tonic .  It was ok ( I have to remember I don't like yuzu)  so no fault of theirs.   Ordered the 1 dollar happy hour oysters ( order minimum of 6 oysters) .  They were fresh and delicious.  My last drink was the Sazerac off the happy hour menu.  One of the best I have had.

Bartender was professsional and attentive even though it was very busy.    Would come back here again in a heart beat!

ordered this for a work event. We had the roast, bbq chicken, broccoli, collard greens, Mac and cheese, and banan pudding.

it was delivered to us promptly. the ordering process was very simple and straightforward.

they do not have many vegetarian options. the food was good but did not feel like genuine southern BBQ food.

Mixed reactions on this restaurant.
The flavors of the pork were great.
The chilis and nachos were great.
The servers were super nice.
My problem with the pork was it wasn't prep well meaning large chunks of fat mixed in the pork. A couple more minutes chopping would have served the meal well. Being one block off time square shows as they cater to large crowds but loose that little extra in prep time. Sides were very good except the cornbread tasted two days old.

We decided to change it up and grab some BBQ in NYC for once! Virgil's was very welcoming and warm inside. Took us a while to get our order taken and our food came out before our drinks even came out.
I ordered a watermelon margarita, wayyyy too strong for my liking.
Now onto the food. I got the Memphis Style Pork Spare Rib 1/4 rack. It was very dry! You had to practically yank it off the bone. The coleslaw tasted like pure vinegar. I have to say the cornbread was SO good!! Wow we couldn't get enough of it. Wouldn't come here again due to the amount of other restaurants i want to try, but i would recommend for BBQ lovers.

The question I ask myself is why? Why did I think this place was going to be good? I spend so much and was disappointed. There is no greater heartache than being catfished by food. But here we are.

The food came out too fast! We placed our order and it came out in 5mins. The Mac and cheese should be called noodle and fake tasteless cheese. The chicken= fricken. The drinks? Mehhh. The only thing that was decent was the ribs and that didn't come out hot. It tasted better the next day when I put them in the oven.

Listen tourist and folks wanting ribs learn from my failures and DON'T go there. Try Bark a Dominican/Texas influence spot. But don't do this to yourself. The one star is for the great company I had; my friend.

I really love this place. It's the first restaurant I ever had in New York almost 20 years ago and the food is still amazing. I haven't been in so long I needed to try everything again. My wife and I ordered "the Pig Out" and it was a ton of food. We got it with the cheddar cheese grits and the baked beans. Everything was crazy good, and I was using a ton of the spicy bbq sauce.
The wait staff was really cool and kept coming by to refill drinks. The whole place just feels super cool homey, almost exactly the same as 20 years ago.

I'm not a huge BBQ person, but I still enjoyed this meal! The BBQ was very tender and flavorful, and the fried chicken was juicy. I had the pork belly sandwich, and it was amazing. The sauce on the pork belly was fruity and slightly spicy, which balanced the fattiness of the pork belly really well. The sourdough was crunchy and a great touch. The sides also didn't disappoint!

The restaurant decor is fun too! It really feels like you are in a different place. The waitress was nice and had great energy too. We received the wrong change when paying, but she fixed it right away.

If you're looking for a late night happy hour that's still going on after you get out of work...none of that 4-6 pm nonsense. Then Virgil's is the place!

Food/Drinks: 4/5
Their happy hour is from Noon - 6 PM and 9 PM to close, Mon-Fri, at the bar!

The Kicked up lemonade and frozen marg are both delicious! You can add different flavoring to the lemonade as well for an extra kick! These drinks pack a punch and definitely are not watered down! :)

I've only had appetizers here and they haven't disappointed me - the Cajun fries and Korean barbecue ribs are also part of the happy hour and were delicious!

Service: 2/5
This is the only down side...Service here, particularly at the bar its a struggle. Now I get that the bar is a different vibe and I'm a pretty patient person. But at some moments it felt like we were just straight up being ignored with only 5 or so other people at the bar. We put in our order and it came out half incorrect. Then we had the flag down process to get someone's attention for everything we needed.

Vibe: 3/5
The vibe is what you'd expect from a Times Square joint! TV's everywhere, loud, and nothing too crazy. There is definitely a southern cowboy feel to the place. This place is always packed which says something!

I'm a SIMP for a good, cheap, late happy hour so despite the mid-service I'd come back here! You can't have your cake and eat it too sometimes lol

Sorry to say the food was blah. Of course like some other chain barbecue restaurants such as dinosaur barbecue, the food is all premade. However, dinosaur Bar-B-Que tastes better.

Service was average at the tables, the bartender was very nice however. We stopped in for a quick dinner before theater. Totally not impressed with the food. The flat bread under the pulled pork was standing mushy. The pulled pork on top and in fact, all the other meat, the ribs, the brisket, are so covered in barbecue sauce, that you have no idea what the meat taste like.

The five dollar frozen margaritas during happy hour, however, will kick your ass. At first I thought they were weak, about 3/4 of the way down I realized I was wrong. So if you wanna come in, try happy hour, but go eat somewhere else.
Everything was pretty good! Decent prices. Not like back yard bbq, but pretty good for commercial

A nice place in here. It has that country feel with lots of dark wood surrounding you. I sat in a booth on the second floor with a view of the street, this place is very noisy, but better upstairs.  

My hostess and server were friendly. My server didn't give the most attention to me though. I got the bbq platter picking two meats and two sides. I could have got one single lettuce salad instead of two sides but I did the coleslaw and brussel sprouts. The coleslaw was a little sour (not fresh?) but very sweet. The Brussels sprouts were five star, having a nice crunch and flavor to them. The brisket was a large porting and delicious. The dry rub ribs were meaty and tasty. I also like their hot bbq sauce they have at the table. Coffee was good too! Highly recomend

BBQ happy hour food menu is just the best deal in the area.
The drinks are great Very friendly service!

A lot of seating - happy hour is offer at the bar area.

This was my first visit to Virgil's BBQ. It was a Tuesday at 1pm. As you can imagine, it wasn't too busy at that time as opposed to my first attempt when I bailed out of even trying to get in. I took a seat at the bar and ordered a carolina pulled pork sandwich with fries. I enjoyed my meal while watching FS1 and ESPN and listening to country tunes. It was a great meal. I thought it was a small portion at first but the food is heavy being BBQ afterall. I explored my condiment choices with Jalapeno Habanero sauce and Hot BBQ sauce and of course ketchup.

I went to Virgil's for my boyfriend birthday and the food & service was amazing. The hostess was friendly and made me want to come back for happy hour. The waitress was quick and gave great recommendations. We ordered, "The pig out" a meal for two people and we left full and had a lot of food to take home. I will be back for happy hour.

If you're not a complete snob for some very specific style of BBQ, Virgil's is located in an unlikely spot to find southern delights. The only reason it isn't in my lunch rotation is that it's hard/impossible to pare down the combos and you can't order by weight, so trying to hit 2000 calories or so results in a bunch of duplicate sides or stuff you don't want.

The place wasn't too busy and I was seated right away. I was surprised because this is in Time Square on a weekend. I ordered a sweet tea, dry rub ribs, mac and cheese, and greens. I didn't care for the greens. Too much vinegar in them for me. The mac and cheese was tasty. The ribs were good and the sauce options helped. The food came our very quick! The service was friendly and they offered suggestions.  This is a casual spot and also had a bar.  Great for families and the prices were fair.
We visited this place for the first time. Sat outside. The food was delicious and served on time. I loved the burger. The kids ordered ribs and enjoyed it, too.

Great food, close to times square.

I spilled sauce on my shirt and they gave me a new one and covered dry cleaning. Great service!

This was recommended to me by a friend that used to live in the city. The bbq was good and fairly authentic to southern bbq. I'm originally from TN but moved north a few years ago. Virgil's has a good atmosphere for southern/country music and the food was good. I'd definitely go back.

We were in NYC for the weekend and after checking in into our room we decided to go for a walk to time square to grab something to eat.

We ended up choosing Virgil as I was feeling like having a beer. We sat at a bar. Grabbed some beer and ordered some wings. The wings were massive but super flavorful. My sister ordered a side of mac and cheese but didn't care for it. We both ordered Apple cider beer to go with it.

It was decorated like a typical bbq restaurant, service was great and super attentive.  The bar was full of a mixture of locals and tourists.  Also was super affordable for being in time square.

Come on! You're going to a Times Square BBQ place, you know what you're getting yourself in for. The food is generally acceptable - tasty if expensive for what you get. The service is great, as I'd expect from a Times Square place. The real reason to go here, in my opinion, is their late-night happy hour menu. If you're looking for a cheap drink or snack after your show, Monday through Thursday they have a special post 9PM menu.

This review is based on my first and last delivery order. The good: Meat was delicious and tender. Full of flavor and only reason for 3 stars. The (very small amount of) BBQ sauce provided was tangy and yummy! The Bad: I have never paid so much for such a small amount of food. My partner and I were both still hungry after eating. Even the side dish containers were only 1/2 full, all of which were lacking in texture and flavor. The Ugly: there was so much grease and/ or sauce leaking through the containers it also leaked through the bag and all over the kitchen counters. The delivery man warned me it was about to break through the bottom as he was passing off. Will I order again? No. Much better BBQ spots in NYC boroughs.

Catered in from the Times square location. It pays to pay the money for the catering option as oppossed to individual meals. We ordered the meals before for our team and found them to be small portions. Catering provided plenty of food.
Food was excellent, brisket, pulled pork, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, biskets, corn bread and apple pie. Whole team really enjoyed the food. Customer service setting up the order the day before was ecellent. Added utensils , plates, etc. Food got delivered about a half hour earlier than the window we were given which left us scrambling a bit but better early than late I supposse. Catering not cheap but worth it
Great food and service!!! Ask for Armando, he knows his stuff. Definitely can't wait to go back

We were staying at the Biltmore across the street. This place is a stable and has lot of history so we had to try. The service was amazing, food was great, and the price was surprisingly reasonable! The restaurant also has a great ambiance!

As a group of 5 it's not easy to find a spot that can seat all of us and have food for a picky child. We were lucky to land here at Virgil's. The prices we good for the area, and the food was great! They didn't have a problem seating us right away on a busy holiday and it's was Saturday during the summer in NYC.

Spacious area with lots of seating great for groups. Lots of options for food, and even the vegetarians. They have non meat options but for this trip we went to all out on the BBQ.

The BBQ spare rib combo was really good smoked perfectly on a dry rub seasoning. The Mac and cheese with the potato salad to me was a great combo with the cornbread was perfect. I would recommend getting the platters or combos since they come with 2 sides you get the best bang for the buck.

My mom got the steak which was very good very tender and juicy. My daughter got the pulled pork sandwich which reminded me of us back down at South Carolina where it was all BBQ so it really gave you that smoked southern taste. The kids of course had their usual chicken and hamburger and fries and for the picky eater the fries were gone! So the fries were a hit and so was the meals for them.

We also had some great deserts, chocolate cake, banana pudding, apple pie, and key lime pie all were delicious sorry no photo on those it was gone before I had the chance :)

I would recommend any tourist or NYC native like myself come to visit this place. I had no idea it was tied to Carmines Restaurant which is also located in NYC which I also recommend if your wanting Italian style food to feed the family.

Meh I had high hopes and was really looking forward to dinner here. These hopes were quickly dashed. I had heard good things about Virgil's but left really disappointed.

All the soda delivered to the table was flat with no carbonation. So bad I asked to switch out for a sweet tea. The sweet tea was good.
The margaritas were pretty good, we had the watermelon and the passion fruit.

The appetizers should have been good but fell short
The bbq boneless wings were good. Lightly sauced and crispy.
The nachos were terrible. Ask for a spoon to eat them since there is enough sauce to drink on the bowl and everything last the very top is a soggy mess.
The hush puppies were bland heavy and not crispy

The brisket burger was a sloppy mess and not very flavorful. The best part of the sandwich was the brisket

The combo with brisket and pulled pork was ok. The pork was decent but a bit dry. The brisket on this combo was terrible. Fatty and rubbery and a bad piece of meat. The mashed potato was not that good and came out cold.

The brisket melt was decent but not great
The grits were very watery and could not be eaten with a fork.

Overall I feel like the cuts of meat were hit or miss the sides as well.

Service was ok. I feel our main server was a little
Missing but the other servers were good with drinks and the meals

Great option for BBQ in Times Square. I've been twice and never had too long of a wait (granted it was only a party of 3 and then a party of 2 so take that with a grain of salt) I wouldn't imagine going anywhere with a large party without a reservation if I could anyway.
Got the PigOut platter with all the meats to be the most indecisive. The ribs were great and tender, default dry rub but you can add sauce with their squeeze bottles at every table like I did. The chicken was the next best, but also maybe just a vehicle for the sauce. The brisket was a bit chewy still but had good flavor. The pulled pork was relatively forgettable.
The sides were a bit small but it does encourage you to focus on the meat instead of filling up on carbs.
Probably not the best BBQ in NYC but a solid choice for Times Square and pretty good for a pre-Broadway meal (but keep in mind to hide your leftovers if you have any before you go to the theater)

This restaurant is just pandering to the southern states.  The name is a misnomer; there is nothing fresh or "real" about this place.  Someone from NYC thought it would be a good idea to try to steal Granny's recipes and charge New York prices.  It just was not worth it.  Everything was cooked with a ton of sugar, including the greens.  

The only reason it got two stars is because it is a great space to take a large group of people, like it's sister restaurant Carmines, it would be ok for a field trip.  But honestly Carmines is a NYC tradition and I only tried Virgils because I thought it had the off chance of being good.

This place was good, not great.

The ribs that I ordered were good. They were large spare ribs and were seasoned deliciously.

I was a little bit underwhelmed with the sides. The collard greens and beans were alright.

My friend ordered a few different meats and they were not impressed.

The service was really bad. Employees were complaining about other employees quitting and they didn't have the best attitude.

This is a good bbq spot, but there are a TON of great places to eat in the area!
Best all around barbecue but hard to get in. All regions all prepared. You don't know cue like they do!

3.5 is fair and accurate.  The first thing we were asked is if we had a reservation. No.... we did not.....

We were told we could sit at the uncomfortable bar area with stools that don't have back support.  Clearly there were plenty of empty tables and we only needed a table for two.  We asked again and stated that if anything became available to let us know as the bar area was too uncomfortable and no where to hang up jackets.  We were immediately seated at a corner table for two.   Stop the nonsense and just seat people that want tables or give an ETA of when one will become available.  

Downstairs bathroom was absolutely filthy and right next to the kitchen.  

I asked for a drink, they didn't have what I wanted.   I asked for a salad off their menu and was told they did not have 3 of the 6 salads listed.  

We ultimately figure out other options to order and thankfully the food was decent, server was attentive, she was tipped fairly and we packed up leftovers as their portions are generous.

I came here with a large group after an All White Party nearby. We took over the majority of the 2nd floor. The restaurant was extremely welcoming and accommodating, considering we only gave them less than a half hours notice that we were on our way. The place was quite spacious, yet homey and comfortable.

I knew that I wanted to try the Memphis Style Pork Spare Ribs, but had a tough time choosing my 2 sides. Since I wanted something different than the regular fries and Mac & cheese, I decided to go with Potato Salad, as well as Cheddar Cheese Grits. This meal also came with cornbread shaped as a small muffin.

The ribs were really tasty and well seasoned with bold flavor. The meat was also tender, slightly crispy, was even tastier with a little bit of tangy BBQ sauce. I also enjoyed the Cornbread, which was made with fresh corn, cheddar cheese, and scallions. The potato salad consisted of red potatoes, eggs, celery, pimentos, along with mayonnaise. I liked the creaminess and richness of it, but wasn't the biggest fan of the sharp mustard taste. As for the grits, this side included white corn grits, with cheddar and Parmesan cheeses. I can safely say that in general, I don't like grits. The texture and consistency was almost porridge-like. At least there was a decent flavor of the cheeses. However, I definitely preferred the Mac & cheese, made with sharp cheddar. This was nice and cheesy, with perfectly cooked pasta. I also got to try the French fries, which were crunchy, full of actual potato yumminess.

Service was solid. The waiters did a wonderful job making sure we received the right order and taking care of us throughout our time there. I would be open to returning  to get the Catfish Po Boy with Trainwreck Fries and Crispy Hush Puppies.

Horrible. We had a family gathering, called and reserved weeks in advance for 22 people. Visited the morning of the event, and re-confirmed, hostess reassured we'll be fine. Arrived 10 minutes early before remaining family arrived and was told we would have to wait a few, that ended up being 45 minutes. Upstairs bathroom not available due to a private event, interesting as we requested the same and thought we would be accommodated. We were spread out through their bottom floor, close to the kitchen and main pathway to only available bathroom.

Food was bland and the service left a lot to be desired.

Please stay away, Dallas BBQ nearby is 1000% better.

3 of us shared The Pig Out and oh man was it good! Brisket and Chicken were our favorite but all of it was tender and well seasoned. Sides were delicious and couldn't leave without a southern classic-Apple Pie. Had excellent service despite it being quite busy.

One of the best bbq I have had in a long time. It was so good that I had to go back and have it again for the second time. They also have the best bbq hot sauce. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I had the chicken sandwich the first time and the chicken plate second round and they both was very flavorful and yummy. Definitely you must try if you are in nyc. Also the brisket out of this world.

Just absolutely great service, food and drinks!! I recommend going there and catching a Broadway show. Henderson was great, he gave me great recommendations on food. I had a classic pulled pork sandwich and Darius poured me an amaretto sour, my favorite. Great atmosphere! A lot of great people at the bar one patron even shared some of his wings with me:)

Would be 4 stars but took them 30mins to take my order during an empty lunch sesh. The Memphis ribs were VERY good and so were the sides. I got beans and potato salad. They give literal dish towels as napkins which actually work well getting all the sauce off your fingies.

I really enjoy the food here - it is a hidden gem in nyc. Really great bbq that is always tasty. The brisket is great and just the right amount of thickness and bbq sauce. They do have free refills on drinks which is unique for nyc and much appreciated. My only complaint is that I made a reservation 3 weeks in advance, and they were still taking people before us that walked in off the street, which was frustrating. We had a 6 pm reservation for 3 people and were seated at 6:20 and did not order until 6:45. So I would not recommend this if you have to make a Broadway show like we did.

To refer to our meal which we barely touched as a disgusting and repulsive would be a compliment and I am not prepared to do that.
We ordered the pig out platter for two which included Memphis style spare ribs, brisket, bbq chicken and pulled pork plus two sides.

Within a few minutes, our food arrived and taking one look at how it had it been slapped in "mushy pile" on the plate, my first thought was that "pig out" was correct as it looked suitable for pigs not humans! It smelled awful but we tried. I bit into a rib and wanted to throw up, the brisket smelled awful and the bbq chicken day old and sour. Inedible as were the two sides.

We summoned our server over and asked for the check. He asked if we wanted to take the food home and we said no as it was awful and NOT edible. His response to that was "GOTCHA" and he made no effort to appease or help us.  I took great pleasure in putting ZERO at the tip!

I guess as New Yorkers who live near there, we mostly felt sorry for the naive and uninformed tourist who will undoubtedly go there and truly believe they are supposed to like this dreadful fare.

Meh standard Times Square tourist trap. Restaurant was super packed but luckily we had reservations. Staff was lovely. Food was okay. Not the best but not the worst. Def better bbq in the city. Restaurant was super crowded and load

My daughter and I ate here last night.  Great food and service (thanks Armando!) We had the fried pickles, mac and cheese and the Pig Out platter.  The menu says that the Pig Out feeds 3 but it actually will feed more.  We packed up the leftovers and there are at least 2 lbs. of leftover ribs, brisket, bbq chicken, pulled pork, etc.  Was delicious! Can't wait to eat more later!

This pace is a gem in times square. Great food good prices and portions are big. So you eat a lot of food for the money. This is a great place to eat have some beers and have a good time. Ask for Ellie she was awesome.

I've walked by this place maaaaaaaaany times n' never thought of going in. I guess because my friends and I have been going to Dallas BBQ's since forever and if it ain't broke, no need to fix it. But I was out with some fam and my cousin recommended we go to Virgil's. I'll be honest... The reviews here had me kinda nervous. But fortunately, our experience was great.

We ordered The Pig Out Platter. I think the menu said it was enough for two people. LOL, there were three of us and between us three, we couldn't finish it and took home a sizeable doggie bag. I loved the brisket. The ribs and chicken were good. The pulled pork was meh. Only thing I'd change about The Pig Out Platter is I'd swap cucumbers for sweet pickles...which is what I thought they were before my greedy behind eagerly bit into it. Potato salad and cornbread were good! I had a Pina Colada and that was... *phew* Very good!!!

The staff was cool. No complaints. Lookin' forward to goin' back and trying some of their other fare.

First time at Virgil's and it was great! With no reservation we were seated within 4 minutes. Our server came over quickly to say hi and start us of with some drinks. We ordered our meal, which was out and served in about 11 minutes! Fast! Mind you, the place was crowded. Great service. And the food...... DAMN GOOD! We will be back real soon to tryout all the great bbq on the menu.
This place has gone down hill in the past several years. The food is okay, but there is so much better BBQ in the city. I would recommend their wings here. Overall friendly service.

Place is across from Millennium hotel Broadway Times Square.  Food was delicious.  Not to be outdone by the BBQ, the roasted Brussels Sprouts is just as amazing and can hold its own.  Definitely making this is a must stop for food whenever I'm in town.

A bit disappointing this morning!  I asked to substitute grits for breakfast potatoes. Bartender check with manager and it was a NO!  She did apologize and I appreciated her trying!  Eggs were cooked right and brisket was good, not great.  My standard for brisket is no need to cut with a knife and no need for sauce.  Unfortunately, sauce was already on the brisket, my fault for not requesting no sauce I guess! Not their best effort today!

Virgil's food and hospitality are fantastic! We had melt-in-your-mouth smoked brisket sandwiches, mine sans the bun, and lip-smacking lemon drop martinis made with a welcoming smile by Chris the bartender.  Kind people like Chris give the NY restaurant business a good name. Loved Virgil's!

Considering you're near time square, the prices and service were pretty good. The food could be better but overall it's a decent place to stop by for a quick lunch.

The staff are very friendly and try their best to accommodate you.  The Fried Chicken sandwich was okay, I wouldn't order it again though.

I forgot to take pics of our food and drinks. Came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. We had a blast, although this place is in Times Square and I usually avoid Times Square at all cost , we lucky ended at Virgil's. There were a few hiccups, but the manager( cute Black guy, was wearing an olive colored shirt on Friday night) was awesome. The waitress was also really nice and super attentive.

So we had hush puppies, margaritas, fries with all kinds of toppings on it, popcorn, cornbread, chips, and pecan pie... it doesn't seem like much of a dinner, this was just the appetizers, but it quickly filled us up- we didn't need entrees after that. So the hush puppies were ok, not Long John Silvers good, but the maple butter that came with it, more than made up for it. The popcorn had the perfect pinch of Cajun seasoning, the fries had jalapeños, cheese, bacon(we took that out), and ranch( I'm shock that adults still eat ranch dressing) the cornbread had little pieces of corn and either scallions or jalapeños in them, but it wasn't spicy, it was pretty damn good, the sea salt chips were alright, the winners of the night were the margaritas and that damn pecan pie. Virgil's is  about fun times, strong drinks, and good comfort food.I can't wait to go back.

Needed a quick, nice dinner before theater, and Via Brasil excelled. All of our food was tasty, well-prepared, with a lot of authentic Brazilian touches, spices, combinations.  There are several caipirinhas on the drink menu, but the baseline one was excellent. Service was attentive and professional, and they definitely worked to get us out in time to get to our show.

Would not only go back, would make an effort to visit any time we are town.

We got tickets to a Broadway show so we needed a dinner place nearby. We don't have Brazilian food too ofter, so we thought why not? We made a resso for a Wednesday at 6:15. It was pretty empty. From the outside looking in, it does look like a tourist trap, especially because of its proximity to Times Square. But they had good reviews, and the menu looked good and was reasonably priced, especially for that area. We ordered:

-Assorted Brazilian Hors d'ouevres - this was an assortment of 6 different empanadas/croquettes with various meat/cheese/rice filling. Some were good but there were a few I didn't like. I don't even know what was what because nothing was explained to us. But its a fun dish to share between two people if you want to try a little bit of all the flavors. This was served with a side of some chili/tomato oil, which was really good but if you can't take spice, this dip isn't for you
