-Feijoada Complete (black bean stew with fresh and dried beef, salted and fresh pork, bacon, sausage and ribs, served with collard greens, rice, sliced orange and farofa) - we shared this and it's definitely enough for two people. I didn't care for the beef, but love the pork because it was tender, and the sausage as well. The collard greens were a nice garlicky tradition. I've never had feijoada before but having stew with orange was new to me but it was actually kind of refreshing and cut some of the richness of the stew. I didn't care for the farofa (toasted cassava flour). It reminded me of eating nutritional yeast. We wanted a bit more carbs to go with the rest of the stew and the cheese bread would have been great to soak up all the sauce but unfortunately, this was sold out. How can you sell out of cheese bread before a dinner rush! We ended up getting fried bananas, which I do not recommend. We thought it would be like fried plantains but it was literally battered and fried halves of bananas, kind of like the banana tempura you would get at a sushi restaurant.

I don't know if I liked this place enough to come back for a second visit, but it was a great first experience.

Had lunch at  Via Brasil in Manhattan today after a wonderful workshop Star Mothers & Earth Ancestors: A Channeling Event for Starseeds with Marissa & JJ Brighton. The restaurant was beautifully rustic inside with a piano for live music & tasteful pictures throughout. We had the special which was oxtails & polenta & the rio grande churrascos mixed meat grill. The Pao de Queijo A Brazilian delight "cheese bread" was delicious & the Mariscos Ao Molho de Vinho which is Sauteed mussels w/ garlic, white wine and tomato sauce. The waiters were all great & very attentive. Love this little piece of Brazil on west 46th street.

Came here for lunch before a broadway show and I got the gaucho churrascos cooked medium. It was a little closer to medium well when it came out but it tasted pretty good. The salt ratios I found were also a little odd. The black beans were too salty and the fries didn't taste salted at all. My uncle got the bacalhou cozido and it was definitely very garlicky and tasted just a tad over cooked. Overall it wasn't bad but I wouldn't rush to come back.

A hidden Jewel in the heart of NYC , they have authentic Brazilian beer and a great menu , Wellington our waiter was absolutely the best , very attentive and helpful .

The atmosphere of the place is nice and cozy . We had the Bacalhau a Gomes de Sa , and it was amazing !! That's coming from a native Brazilian .

I took home the Bife a portuguesa and even tho I asked for well done it was a bit tooo well done , kind of burned on the edges  so that was a little disappointing.

Over all it was a great experience and I want to go back and try the other dishes on the menu to see if they are as authentic as the ones I tried .

P.S: The Caipirinhas where PERFECT !!!!!

Located in the heart of Little Brazil, I dined here with a friend for dinner. The interior is lovely, vibrant, colorful with a welcoming atmosphere. There were white table cloths and pretty pink flowers on the table, giving the place an elegant touch.

Of course we had to get the cheese bread, which was excellent. Sticky, strong cheesy flavor, still warm, and perfect little tasty morsels!

For my entree, I ordered the Grande sampler meat platter, which included strip steak, Brazilian sausage, pork chop, as well as chicken. This was served with rice and beans, along with yucca flour and pico de gallo. I think my favorite was the steak, which was nice and tender, as well as packed with flavor. The Brazilian sausage was wonderfully juicy, succulent, and had just the right chewy consistency. The pork chop was also tasty, and was very well seasoned. The chicken was probably my least favorite, because I'm not normally impressed by it. This chicken was decent and was pleasantly soft, but a little on the bland side.

The rice was perfectly cooked and usually I'm not really a fan of beans, but paired with the rice, it was pretty good. I also enjoyed the yucca flour mix, which had a sandy consistency, along with raisins and veggies. This was a nice blend, especially eaten together with the pico de gallo and meats. The pico de gallo added a lovely fresh, slightly crunchy element to the meal.

For dessert, my friend and I shared the Doce de Leite com Queijo, which was Dulce de Leche with Brazilian white cheese. This was a very simple, yet delicious preparation of pure, sweet, rich, milky, deeply caramely, and irresistibly smooth Dulce de leche. The white cheese was mild and dipped with Dulce de Leche made for mouthwatering bites.

Service was wonderful throughout. Our waiter  was friendly and attentive. Also, the prices are pretty reasonable, especially considering the midtown area and proximity to Times Square. I would be open to returning and would like one of the seafood dishes, such as the Fresh Pollock and Shrimp.

Service wasn't the best. The restaurant wasn't full when we were there but maybe they were short staffed because our waiter didn't even remember to check on us or get us water. But he did remember to try and push all the expensive dishes on us. The food wasn't bad but it took a long time to arrive. Would not recommend the salad, it didnt taste good or fresh

What a delicious meal we had!
Super friendly n courteous service, which is always appreciated.

We started w Salgadilhos ( sampler of fried aps) $12 for 6pcs. My favorite is the beef pastel ( like empanadas but much better!)
The caipirinhas drink was soo good. Perfectly limed n cachaça.

Vatapa is perfectly seasoned w nice shrimp n cod.
I hope this restaurant survives the pandemic. Next time I want to try the paellas.
The bacalhau was well balanced, sometimes it can be very salty. Comes w rice. I ordered side of black beans, so good it's a must w rice.
For desert we had the brigadeiros, chocolate truffles. Yum yum.

The manager helped us take pictures by the gorgeous white piano.

I grew up in Brasil n this restaurant brings me back to my childhood. Specially the entrance's black n white wave tile, which reminds of  the sidewalk in Rio's copacabana beach.

This restaurant was located beside my hotel and was the first meal I had in the city. The place was spacious, and nicely decorated. I loved  the artwork, one piece in particular and would love to know who the artist is. For my meal, I ordered the salmon and vegetables. The salmon was flavorful and had a beautiful sear on it, and had a delicious sauce that accompanied it. The vegetables were tasty and not overcooked. And the cappuccino I ordered was the perfect ending to my meal. Great ambience and service. Thoroughly enjoyed this place.

Wonderful dinner with family!  We came upon Via Brasil during our trip to NYC. A lovely restaurant with white linen table cloths and tasty food and drinks. Gets crowded after 6pm so you may want to call ahead for a table!

Today me and my family went for a late lunch and we order grilled chicken with rice and beans, beef strogonoff (to die for) !!!

Server was pleasant and we a great experience!

I'm Brazilian myself but living in Washington DC for 20yrs I can guarantee the taste and quality does match with top restaurants in São Paulo.

I usually don't right reviews but this one was worth to come here and give my opinion so, whoever wants to taste an amazing Brazilian food that's a place to be
I've come here for a solo lunch twice now when in the city for work and it's amazing! The Service and the food are top tier! I will deff continue doing back

Do NOT go to the vegas location. Owner Anna is an absolute monster and runs it into the ground. No one has good things to say about her. I have her old regulars (that she continues to 86 for simply asking what happened to a couple of employees), telling me how awful she is and asking how she is even an owner if she only cares about money and not staff or guests at all. Plus, the restaurant in Vegas is disgusting. Don't go unless you like food poisoning from mold. Hope NY is doing better.

I've been coming here since I was 8 years old. As a Brazilian, there's such a welcoming feeling and my American friends and family have felt this warmth as well. The live music is great, the staff is always friendly, the food is superb. Just overall such a great place. I highly recommend this place, and not such a far walk from Penn station :) was there for the first time in 2 years and it did not disappoint. The passion fruit cocktail is so good and you can't ever go wrong with a picanha. If you've never had Brazilian food, I recommend the Brazilian sampler, gives a taste of several little savory treats and perfect to share between two people.

Went here over the weekend to celebrate my birthday with a long time friend. The service was very courteous despite our reservation being close to their closing time. The food was ok to me. I don't think I really had time to dig into the flavor of the dish I had and mainly focused on the drinks. I would definitely come back to give it another try and really absorb the experience. Decorum was beautiful and had a vintage appeal to it. Right in the heart of Times Square... is where you can find it all..

A late lunch, the place was empty so the service should have been quick but it took a few minutes to grab a waiter.  But when he showed up, he took our order and the food turn around was pretty fast.  

Started off with a soup, which was good.  The calamari was delish, a must have. There was some pork, rice and veggies.  A nice healthy feast for a pricey tag.

Food: 2/5
Ordered grilled skirt steak with rice and chicken milanese with mashed potatoes. Both dishes were just mediocre. The grilled skirt steak was just ok and the portion was a bit skimpy. The chicken milanese was deep fried and dry. Sort of reminded me of chicken cutlets. Nothing to brag about. The food wasn't spectacular and I left feeling like I overpaid.

Service: 4/5
We sat at the bar. The bartender was very nice but she had a very heavy accent. I had a difficult time communicating with her.

Ambiance: 2.5/5
Nothing special about this place. Sort of felt like an Italian restaurant.

Two entrees, two martinis plus tax and tip = $100. I don't think it was worth it. The food just wasn't memorable. Probably won't visit again.

I was so excited to take my father here, that excitement quickly turned into embarrassment. Food was cold, and grizzled. Have not had much luck with Brazilian food in Manhattan. Is it safe to say Little Brazil is no more?

If you want Brazilian food this is the place.  It a small place but always crowded so rsvp.  The food is always good.  We usually get Brazilian sampler as appetizer and grilled skirt steak which comes with rice and beans, it use to be unlimited rice and beans but now they charge $7 each.  Omg that was one of the reasons going here. Oh well.  I still will go but limit myself to the rice and beans.  And they have small, spicy chilis when you ask that goes well with everything.  The paella is what I usually would order which is fantastic but this time I got the beef stroganoff.  I liked it but I think I would of liked it better if it came over egg noodles rather than rice.  And of course don't forget to get a few caipirinhas.

My daughter and I went to eat last night. It was our 2nd time. This time was a little disappointing experience. The food was amazing as always. We got the cheese bread, the bean soup, the picanha entree and the camarao paulista. Of course caipirinha for a drink. My surprise was that the server included 20% tip in our check without saying any word. I had to ask him if it was ($144.81 plus $29.19 tip, total $174.00, which I paid $100 in cash and the rest with my credit card) He said it was a service fee (20%). I felt terrible because they said they do sometimes. Maybe based on your ethnicity? I don't mind the gratuity to be included, but of course they have to tell you. Anyway I'll be back because of the food, but I hope you tell your servers TO ALWAYS advised the customers that the 20% tip is already included. It's up to the customers if they want to leave an extra tip based on the service experience

Over priced bad Brasilian food.  The food had no flavor.  Brasilian's love herbs and taste. We ordered the PAO DE QUEIJO and was wondering where the cheese was and there was no green sauce on the side. The chicken croquettes(Coxinh) and empanadas (PASTEL DE CARNE) were totally tasteless. We ordered the PICANHA FATIADA COM ALHO the meat was so fatty. However, the worst was the passion fruit Caipirinha. They completely forgot to add cachaça. We paid liquor prices for fruit water drinks. It really only tasted like whipped water. The serves was however was good.

Dined here recently and it is as delicious as I remember.   Fantastic steak and fries, salad and passionfruit juice.  Don't forget to finish with their perfect caramel flan and coffee!  Friendly staff.

Have been here numerous times on friday nights after work. My coworker loves their signature brazilian drink Caparinha and I always stick to the classic Margarita. My reason for 4 stars is the last couple times my margarita was a little weak.
Last Friday we were here we ordered a sampler appetizer plate which was a lot smaller than I thought it would be but it was delicious.
One of the guys ordered the Calamari which was cooked to perfection.
Will definitely be back here for many more Friday after work adventures.
The bartender Andrea knows us by now and is always so friendly and quick to serve.

We love the warm atmosphere, classy decor ( white tablecloths etc) and delicious food. I especially recommend the shrimp in an acorn squash. We usually go for pre/ theater  dinner and this time we brought out of town guests.

The food was ok. Nun bad to say, this that I ordered the steak tasted burnt. Like right before it was burnt really bad they took it off the stove an put it on a plate. Noddles/pasta was bland as well. The only thing I liked was the drinks & Brazilian chocolates

Me and My Girlfriend came here for Dinner and from the minute we came in we were treated with such Professionalism and Great Attitude and the Waitress was Great and Friendly and the Food Was Amazing, we will be back, Thank you.

This was some of the best food I've had in New York while living here for 2 years. We ordered the mussels, picanha, and feijoada. The mussels were so delicious - I wanted to drink the broth. The picanha was perfectly seasoned and absolutely delicious. The feijoada was made with black beans but still really yummy. I also had a couple espresso martinis with baileys and they were the perfect way to finish my meal. I will definitely be back!
Good food good company makes it perfect plus servers were courteous and attentive.  Let's go.....
Has great service and lunch specials! The inside is really eclectic and classy, it's a nice spot. I like the croquettes!

Found this place thanks to fellow Yelpers and loved it! We dined at 7pm on a rainy Tuesday night. The umbrella bags in the front were a plus right off the bat since it was pouring! Super friendly staff; manager greeted us at the door. Small bar with three or four kegs on tap to your left as you walk in. Dress was business casual. HUGE portions and well worth the money! Most entrees in the $20-$30 range, typical for midtown!

Our waiter was able to help with the menu giving us suggestions of customers favorites! We ordered the signature Brazilian cocktail ($12), which was a light rum, lime, and a couple other ingredients! Very delicious and light! We ordered the carne verde soup ($6) to split. He generously brought it out in two separate bowls along with some fresh bread! For dinner I ordered the steak with the fried egg on top ($23; can't remember the official name). Cooked perfectly medium, just how i like it. My friend got a white fish with shrimp ($28; see pic). Both dishes were super flavorful! A hearty serving of rice and beans were given as well for us to share. Dessert was the caramel flan ($7); more dense than other flans I've had but delicious nonetheless!

Overall amazing experience! Highly recommended to anyone in the midtown area! I'm sure you'll need a reservation if you go over the weekend!!

Good food and huge portions. We started with Pao de queijo and I must say, it was a little disappointing. Kinda dry, tasted like they just threw them in an oven and heated them up before bringing them out. I got the Bobo de Camarao and it was great. Shrimps were massive and they were cooked perfectly and the sauce was awesome. My wife got Frango com quiabo and she liked it. The sauce was very good also. Our waiters were very friendly, made sure we were enjoying our meal.

Take a break from the bustling congestion of Times Square and step into some live music and comfort Brasilian food at Via Brasil. Make sure you've got some time, because they provide that sit down, relax, atmosphere. You won't want to rush here.

I came for a friend's birthday celebration and called in advance to see what vegetarian options they had. I was informed there were no actual vegetarian entrees, but side orders of rice and beans. But not to fear, I was certain they could concoct something once I arrived and they sure delivered!

They have moqueca, a traditional brasilian stew from Bahia which is a medley of garlic, tomatoes, cilantro, coconut milk, and dende oil. I ordered it and asked for just vegetables in place of the fish and meat options it came with on the menu.The waiter said he'll ask the chef what he can do and to my pleasant surprise I had a lovely vegetarian moqueca fixed with tomatoes and greens that was delicious with my rice and beans.

We also shared a pitcher of sangria which was rich just like I like it. No weak sangria here.

We started with cheese bread and mussels to start and both were excellent. The authenticity of the food was as real as it gets. For entrees we had the authentic Brazilian for two and shrimp in a pineapple sauce that was served in the pineapple. Again incredibly tasty and being located right next to our hotel was even better. Highly recommend this place.

This restaurant features tasteful old world decor. Even when crowded it's easy to carry on a conversation. Adequate small wine list. Great menu. Extremely reasonable prices. Music has boss nova flair. Not loud
Hidden gem in Times Square

Late dinner after a long day.  We ordered Picadinho de Carna, Tutu a Mineira, and salada via Brasil.  The salad was fresh and perfectly topped with the provided balsamic vinegar, olive oil, and the lemon wedge drizzled over top.  The black beans and rice served with the picadinho were seasoned perfectly and the fried bananas were a treat.  With the Tutu de Meneira, the meats were prepared perfectly and gave us the taste of Brasil that we were hoping for.  The black bean purée accompanying them met a quick demise.  A very satisfying meal following a busy day.  A definite plus.

Went here for the first time. Blown away by the food.  The assorted appetizer plate was excellent (wish they had a dipping sauce other than the flaming hot one they had though).  We had the shrimp stroganoff and it was one of the most amazing dishes I've ever had in New York.  Wait staff and management were also amazingly friendly.  This will be a standard stop now on our annual NYC trip!!!

I've loved dining here many times over the past 20 years. The menu is extensive, loads of Brazilian traditional dishes. On this visit I took 3 friends there, all new to Via Brasil, and they were rhapsodizing as we left--every dish a triumph and how could they charge such reasonable prices too? Be sure to try a caipirinha, expertly mixed at the bar, and if you come on Friday or Saturday you can enjoy live music starting at 630...but it isn't so loud that your group won't be able to hear each other. My personal favorite dish is the stroganoff de camarao (shrimp stroganoff) which I think may be their finest dish. My friends would disagree, as their pork loin, tilapia, and osso buco were all tremendous.

I have been coming to Via Brazil for 4 years and it is ALWAYS MY absolute favorite go to place for dinner right before I go to the theater.  The food is absolutely delicious, prices are reasonable, they give you plenty of choices on the menu that accommodates anyone's dietary needs, the service is great and the atmosphere is pleasant.
Please make sure to try the cheese bread (it is not the same as American cheese bread),  yuca, and definitely make sure  to have a caipirinha.
I highly recommend. Two thumbs up!

It was a Friday evening in the city. Rain coming down. We were all famished from walkIng to all the sights around Time's Square. One place booked, another had a long wait, yet another closed for a private party. Via Brasil welcomed us like an old friend. The 5 of us were promptly greeted and seated. Several Brazilian gentlemen circulated through filling glasses, taking orders, bringing bread and ensuring every detail was attended to! The presentation and professionalism was impressive. For an app we munched on the fresh, lightly battered calamari that was accompanied with some poppin side sauce that had just the right amount of kick! We ordered our various menu items. For me, the showstopper was my Brazilian braised beef with mashed potatoes. The absolute tenderness was unbelievable!!! Cut through it with a fork kind of tender. Another dish was served in a pineapple. Yet another was served in an acorn squash. Layers and layers of flavors! Oh how I want to go back! Near the square, but want an off the beaten path...head down 46th to this little gem! Bon appetite!

Had dinner here last night and not only was all our food delicious they went above and beyond with the service.

My husband, sister in law and I came in with our cranky 20 month old and when they noticed I was hesitant by the door a gentleman came up offering him a little toy car which help us make it to our seat peacefully. At the next meltdown he came over with a balloon. They truly went the extra mile to make us comfortable and turned what could have been an unpleasant dinner with a cranky toddler into a fun experience. At dessert time he even got to taste his first brigadeiro.

I used to come here with my parents as a kid over 20 years ago. Coming back as an adult with my family was a real treat. We will continue to return whenever we are in NYC. Muito obrigada pelo carinho!!!

I was greeted by a friendly and smiling host and owner. We were seated immediately and our server was kind enough to make recommendations. The chicken risotto ($16.95) was ah-mazing and very filling. I was so impressed. Wow! The chocolate mousse was great too and reasonably priced at $6.50. Beautiful space, loved the white piano. It's definitely worth a trip!

Note: Very quaint bathroom stalls

Came here for dinner on a weeknight when the place across the street was booked out. Wish I could rate it higher but the food was just really subpar for the prices ($20-30 per dish). We were really excited for Brazilian food, especially since our parents love trying new food. The grilled meats were bland and I don't remember anything I ate except for the flounder, which was delicious. Drinks were very sweet.

Decor and waiters were lovely though. They just need to work on their recipes and make the food more flavorful. It was packed when we left though... maybe it was just our table that was unimpressed? :/
Always consistent food! Love this place. Best Brazilian food in NYC. Shrimp stew ( moquecas) is incredible!

Nice place for a few caipirinha and Brazilian food.
One of the best in NYC.
Great service, congratulations.

Randomly stopped here tonight and was so glad I did. Had dinner outside (covid restrictions) they had a a few tables outside. My boyfriend ordered the PICANHA FATIADA COM ALHO and I got BIFE A MILANESA. They were both amazingggg. Perfect size serving and so delicious. So glad we decided to go there. Inexpensive, quick, delicious, what more could you ask for.

Let me tell you, Via Brasil Restaurant was simply cool. Sooooo good and well priced. I will definitely tell all my friends to try their Fried Yucca, it was simply just outstanding. Bonus that their service is so outstanding, they are so quick and helpful. Could not recommend more highly.

My friend and I stopped by this place today after walking by someone devouring his pao de queijo here yesterday. The cravings started to kick in and it's been awhile since I had it.

We walked in and was greeted warmly by the hostess. This seems like a popular spot among tourists yet still less crowded than your typical Times Square restaurant. We placed an order for 2 pao de queijos (1 order comes in 5 pieces) and 1 order of the fetuccine via brasil to share. The pao de queijos were served warm yet as soon as I took my first bite, I can tell it's not freshly baked. I used to eat these things on a regular basis cos my mom and my aunt used to bake these at home. It still tasted good and the texture was up to par. It's just some pieces were overbaked and some were not. But it still somehow satisfied my cravings after eating the ones baked at the right temp.

The pasta is not comparable to your usual italian pasta but it definitely tasted like a brazilian pasta. The light sauce and flavor reminded me of a hint of moqueca taste to it. My friend enjoyed it since it wasn't too overwhelming and it was light on our stomachs. Plus, we felt less guilty since we headed here right after zumba class .

Overall, the service was excellent. I was just a bit bummed about the pao de queijo so it's 4/5 stars for me. It was also clean and the laidback ambiance made it more relaxing. P.S. seems like they have live music here as well - saw the drums set-up in the middle section of the restaurant. Will give it another go for the caipirinhas or just have a guarana and watch a band live next time.

I stopped in here as I was passing by for a late night snack. The restaurant is cute and has nice live music. The service was also pretty good. I ordered the picanha steak mid-rare and they bring out two cuts on the skewer which is pretty cool but one of them was mid-well and the other super well done and too tough and chewy to eat. It came with rice and beans, pico de gallo and yucca flour. Im pretty picky with my steaks especially since the best picanha steak Ive had and continue to have comes from a food court restaurant in a shopping mall but it is always cooked to perfection there.. if fast food can do it then restaurants should be able to get the temps right as well.

Love this place!!!!

I have been going to this place for a few years and I always have a great time, especially at the bar. Via Brasil is great for grabbing a drink alone at the bar, having a date, or meeting friends for dinner and/or drinks. The staff are really attentive and friendly to their customers. During my last visit, the female bartender (I think her name was Elana), who was a blast, "let me" name a drink after myself - a caipirinha + gin. Be aware that the caipirinhas are pretty strong, which is a good thing . . . especially after navigating through Times Square.

During my latest visit, I tried the Moqueca with shrimp and it was absolutely AMAZING with the wonderful mix of flavors and ample serving of shrimp. If I had more room in my stomach, I would have ordered another one. The portions at Via Brasil are very generous for the price point, especially for the tourist trap area of Times Square . . .  a place where almost everything is overpriced and overrated. I guarantee that you will not leave hungry.

Be aware, the spicy peppers are REALLY spicy and you will feel them the next day.

Also, Via Brasil is one of the few places in NYC that will do separate checks without copping an attitude.

AFFORDABILITY: Entrees are on the expensive side (high teens but mostly higher) but are extremely filling!

VENUE: The restaurant itself is really nice, spacious New York eatery! Great environment to bring friends for a fancy time or family for a great family-meal in the city.

From my experience and observations, the restaurant seemed LGBTQ+ and POC friendly. Did not take note if there were gender neutral bathrooms.

GENERAL: My friends and I had no plans for dinner after 9pm on a Sunday night and were just walking around Midtown and we stumbled across this restaurant. We were super indecisive, but I am so glad we decided to stop at Via Brasil! The service was fast and the menu was super expansive. Beyond the large regular menu, there were several specials, which was super great.

THE FOOD: I ordered Chicken Milanesa off the specials menu which was a breaded chicken dish with mashed potatoes. I honestly did not expect the serving to be so large - it was a great portion size. The potatoes were creamy and silky smooth and I absolutely loved them. The chicken was tender and cut easily, but has a great flavor to it. It was expertly breaded and overall delicious dish.

My friends ordered beef dishes and loved them as well. I think the next time I go I would definitely order Fried Yucca!

ACCOMODATIONS: Has some vegetarian options and appetizers, but a strong majority of the cuisines include meat.

OVERALL: Although slightly on the more expensive side, the food was filling and absolutely delicious. Definitely recommend if you want authentic Brazilian food! It's a great time with family or friends and short walk from the Theater District and Times Square.

I got lunch there yesterday from their salad/hot food bar and ate it there.  The selection of food was just "fair" & the taste was also just "fair" (and they really should put up a sign indicating that every single type of potato they have [several different kinds] has a TON of spices on it [and since potatoes weigh a lot and it was impossible to eat them with that overwhelming amount of spices, I wasted a lot of money]).  The cost was the usual (pricey) for Midtown and environs....the woman at the counter was o.k., but the man was very pleasant and he didn't quibble about giving me some (tap) water.  In fact; he gave me a *regular-size* cup, which is more than almost any other such place has been willing to do.

There's a decent amount of seating at the back, but - and I don't know if this is typical - every single person sitting there (and eventually it was rather full [I was there at the height of lunch "rush hour"]) was talking at the top of their lungs & non-stop.  It was like a *shouting match* in there (!).  I was (attempting to) read a magazine while eating my lunch, but it was almost hopeless and I scarfed down my (boring) food.

(Update on 11/11/11):  I noticed when passing by there today that they only have a "B" rating from the Health Department.

awful awful awful..... the pizza is awful, no sauce, super doughy, small slices, and expensive for what you get.  Their buffet always looks like it has been sitting out for hours, and the service is slooooooow.

if the place i was going to wasnt closed i could have lived a happier life

HORRIBLE service, HORRIBLE food, and HORRIBLE coffee!!!

My normal coffee guy was on vacation recently, so I swung by Verona because it's right across the street from my office. I ordered a large coffee light and sweet with a plain bagel. The guy who made my coffe dumped about 2 inches of sugar in the bottom of my cup, then the coffee, and finally the milk...put the lid on and handed it to me without stirring it! The bagel was hard as a rock and stale.

YUCK, YUCK, YUCK!!!

Well I needed some protein and carbs before hitting it for the night. The last meal I had was a Starbucks Croissant with an iced coffee.  I was only able to stuff 1/2 the sandwich down my gullet....nothing terribly exciting, but the bag of chips were great.   The hot self service chow looked a tad scary.  Better choices elsewhere.

DISGUSTING!

Every time I ordered from there it was a problem.  My typical order was two eggs scrambled and toast.  The first time there were egg shells in the eggs.  The second time I tried, there was a hair in my plate.  

Don't even ask me why I went back for a third time.  I was in a rush during a busy day at work and needed something to hold me over until lunch.  Well, I ordered a bagel with bacon and cheese (11am-ish) and I swear the guy use OLD bacon on my sandwich.  He had to because I did not see him put any bacon on the griddle and I am too short to see over the high counter to see the lower counter in which they use to prepare the food.

The bacon had to have been from the same batch as the one they used for breakfast.  Mind you it had to have been sitting there for a minimum of 3 hours!!  The bacon was burnt, dried, and tasted of old reused oil!  Being that this was the third time, shame on me!

NEVER EVER AGAIN!

This spot is a half block from one of our offices in NYC so I have been in dozens of times.  Very nice salad bar, kind of cramped low rent seating area so most everybody is ordering to go.  Decent coffee, sandwiches.  Good selection of cold drinks.

I've been on a scooped-out bagel kick for the past couple of days and already the guy behind the deli counter says, "Hi!  So, the usual?"  Don't even bother with the woman that works behind the counter because she's kinda slow in more ways than one.  Prices are decent.  I've never sat in the back but have seen people lunching there quite often.

$4.00 for an small, old, barely-warmed, dried out slice at 2:30 in the afternoon after the lunch rush?  Are they crazy?  That's what I get for trying something "new".  As I told the guy after getting my change, I never have to go there again.

i work across the street from here so every now and then i stop in for a bagel or a sandwich.

the staff is SUPER NICE. the older hispanic guy with the mustache is the best, i really need to ask him his name. he always remembers my bagel order even if i haven't been back in months. and this one time, i came in for lunch and i pointed at a pile of pre-made wrap sandwiches, and he told me, "oh, that one's been sitting there for awhile" and he made me a fresh one! and it turned out to be one of the best sandwiches i ever had--fresh avocado and greens with hot melted cheese.

really good value compared to the other chain delis in the neighborhood. toasted bagels with cream cheese are still only $1.50

I wish I could give it less than one star. I wandered into this place for lunch. Worst mistake. This place is so gross. The food made me so sick only and hour after eating it that I had to leave work and go home asap! I don't know how the city hasn't shut it down. STAY AWAY!

I was able to go to school across the street from this place for about a week and I ate breakfest here every day.  After the 3rd day she remembered me and knew exactly what i wanted.  Locks and bagels.  The best that i have ever had!!!! Makes me wish i lived in NY

This place deserves ZERO stars. This place absolutely disgusting. Im surprised the city hasn't shut them down already. I use to go here to get juice or a bagel before I saw a roach chillen with the bagels like the roach lived there a couple of months ago. I walked passed the other day and they have a grade pending so I assume the city are starting to crack down on them. But never again. The pizza sucks. Ive never ate at the buffet but after that roach incident I'm glad I never did.
This place sucks. I only ever go because of its convenience. The place and their "mongolian buffet" need a serious upgrade. They have a $5 credit minimum but nothing in the place is worth $5.
Nastiest sandwhich meat ever, guy did not wear gloves when making the sandwhich and a conplete waste of 15$ for two sandwhiches.

The service here is good and they've got a large selection but this could be one of the worst and most expensive delis I've come across in Manhattan. I've had food on more than one occasion that was not fresh, the coffee is bad - it's the kind of place you go if nowhere else is open. If you're not in a rush it's certainly worth walking a few blocks to go someplace better.
Ordered a tunafish sandwich on pita bread and a bottle of vitamin water. It was $9. Ripoff!!!!

Great pizza! Love the crust! The only unfortunate part was they didn't have Parmesan topping or crush pepper. Who does that?

Inside you will can order pizza, smoothies, Philly cheese steaks and more. They also have a meal deal that includes 1 slice of pizza, 1 side, 1 drink.

Plenty of seating as well.

I visited this place back on December 1st, 2017.

I was tired from a long day and decided to stop in for a couple of slices. I looked up at the menu board and saw the different prices for each type of slice...

Neo Cheese : $ 4.19
Neo AnyTopping: $4.89
Pan: $5.59

Decided to go with the Neo Cheese x2, which should come to $8.38 plus tax. I go up to the register, pay for the food, but find it odd that I paid a total of $12.17...

I take a look at my receipt, and it shows that I paid for two pieces of PAN pizza, not Neo Cheese. I think, "That's fine, the cashier obviously made a mistake. Look... there is the manager, I'll just go ask to get this corrected, it was an honest mistake after all."

I speak to the manager, tell him what happened, and he says to me,

"That's the right correct price, the Neo is the same price as the pan." I was surprised, but since he's the manager, I must have read the board wrong. So, I say, "Okay" and walk over to the board again to double check...

The board reaffirms what I thought to be true...
Neo Cheese : $ 4.19
Neo AnyTopping: $4.89
Pan: $5.59

I prompt the guy behind the counter to ask how much for 1 slice of Neo Cheese, but before he can answer, the manager appears next to me again... I say to the guy, "I thought you said Neo was the same price as Pan?" He says, "It is. I just forgot to change the board this morning...."

Does this guy think I was born yesterday!?
I say, "well who's fault is that, why should I have to pay the difference if you """forgot""" to change the board."

He continues to make excuses, "It's not my fault!," he says. Then, immediately after, says, "I forgot to change the board this morning." Keep in mind, this isn't just some random employee, THIS IS THE MANAGER!!! I go from very calm and reasonable, to having to raise my voice at this guy to admit he's in the wrong.

The guy was basically labeling me an idiot and trying to steal my money. I originally asked for him to just give the difference in cost back so I could go sit down and eat my pizza, no big deal. But since the guy thought he could yell at me that it wasn't his fault, and that, that was the price. I had to demand my money back.

I got it back. I've never had a worse customer service experience in my entire life. Doubt I ever will.

By the way... if you look at a picture of the menu board, posted on google reviews (no one has posted a recent one here), from late December 2017 (after I went), the prices haven't changed....I'm sure they're still the same to this day.
Manager needs to be fired.
Great pizza. Big slices with good flavor. Nice variety of items to choose from. Clean and they have extra seating downstairs.

Garbage. Went for lunch on a weekday. Did not listen to my to-go order, completely ignored my preferences. Honestly, I wouldn't complain if it was a special request that I made, but the cashier asked me what cheese I wanted on my Philly Cheese-steak. I said Pepper Jack. She then proceeded to put it in and I watched as the line cook made the sandwich with american cheese.

DON'T ASK IF IT DOESN'T MATTER!

Very expensive for the quality. Awful service. You are in the food service industry, you need to be personable when you work with people.... get it together.

Bright, flashy, tourist magnet that draws the eyes and ears from far away. It will captivate your attention long enough that you won't see the Pizza shops nearby that sell $1.00 slices of the same thing. I suppose my pizza slices at Villa were "premium" because they were the thicker crust than usual, but they were plain, and yet when I got to the register and found out they were $7.50 each, I just took a deep breath and said "When in New York, pay as the New Yorkers do". But I suppose a New Yorker is either smarter than a tourist and wouldnt end up there, or they just have more money than brains.
The place is 2 floors. You can go downstairs and eat cafeteria style. Its a huge space. I can only imagine what the rent is, so this is most likely why the food is so overpriced.
Dont get suckered in. Beware of places that try to put food in your hands and have no visible signs with prices. Theyre exploiting your hunger and weariness from walking.

Ridiculously overpriced. $10.50 for a Stromboli and a bottle of sparkling water. My mother in law paid $14 for a slice of olive pizza, a side of vegetables, and a bottle of soda. My husband paid $20 for Philly cheese steak, fried pickles, and a soda. I understand it's Manhattan and higher prices are to be expected but at least price it accordingly. The cheese steak came without cheese. The fried pickles were so overcooked that there was no pickle left in the breading. My Stromboli was was completely dried out. Not worth it. Get a dirty water dog instead.

We loved this place! Went back multiple times for lunch on different days as it had plenty of different options. We thought the prices were reasonable as the portion size was huge!! One meal a day was plenty to stay full so worth the money! A very "New York" kind of place so we thoroughly enjoyed it!
Not bad cafeteria-type place.  The staff is friendly and the pizza is fresh, though overpriced.  Then again, you're in touristy Times Square, so whaddya expect?!

Ridiculously priced, so-so service, so-so food and according to my wife and daughter, do not use the ladies room. I know that just about everything costs more in NYC and the attitude will be there,  but we were very disappointed with the quality of the food, especially the pizza!!

Very Bad. ... There was a particular server who serves Pasta misbehaved with us Un provoked..... even when we complained to the management they could not do anything to this guy and he had to deal with him. The food is really bad the fettuchini and alfredo had water in it.....but the servers insulting you unprovoked was intolerable....The ambience too was not agreeable. Please eat Street Food there where the vendors are more courteous than here.

Went here to try out their pizza and realized that it was really good.  Unfortunately, it is on 42nd Street and the price of a slice reflects that. But, it was pretty darn good and the service was good as well.  The manager was very accommodating.  Just wish a plain slice was just a wee bit cheaper and then I could responsibly convince myself to go here for lunch weekly.

Delicious food and incredibly kind service.
I was having a bad day and desperately needed food. I can be fussy when I'm gingery but they were very patient and lovely to talk to.
Highly recommended!

Located in the lower dining concourse of Grand Central Terminal, Veselka's newest outpost offers a range of their most well-known vegetarian and meat-based foods such as varenyky (pierogi), soups, entrées and desserts. The service is fast and friendly as usual. Like most food booths at Grand Central, Veselka doesn't offer seating/tables. Instead you take the food to go and take it to a table of your choice in the middle of the food concourse.
Drinks include soft drinks, Ukranian beer, and wine.
The only thing I wish they did, similar to the Essex and 2nd Ave location, is offer a combo plate (e.g. soup, potato pancake and small goulash).

I needed to grab a quick bite before going to work and I remembered that they opened a new location of Veselka in GCS. I saw they had a Chicken Schnitzel sandwich on the menu and it was just what I was craving. I asked for no tomato on the sandwich. Also grabbed a Diet Coke from the cooler to drink. The menu is a streamlined version of what they offer at the full service restaurant but they offer their famous pierogi, borscht and blintzes. It is a little expensive but the quality of the food makes it worth the price. My sandwich came out relatively fast and I was happy to see it came with a side of coleslaw which was delicious and cut the richness of the sandwich. The chicken was hot and perfectly cooked. My only problem was there was a little too much of the sauce on my sandwich which made my roll a bit soggy. But otherwise, it was a really yummy sandwich and I would definitely order it again if I was at one of their restaurants.

Great place for a quick slice in the middle of the city.

Stopped by for lunch on a weekday. It's a small shop and only one guy was working there. He was friendly and helpful. I got a square slice of cheese and a square slice of pepperoni.

The pepperoni was probably my favorite pepperoni slice I've had in New York. The crust was crispy but fluffy and the pepperonis were thick and flavorful, but not too overpowering. The pizza also had a good balance of cheese and sauce.

All in all, would definitely return for another quick lunch slice.

Village Square has verrrrry quickly become one of my favorite slices in the city.  What's not to like, right?  Sicilian style with that thick crust, loaded with sweet tomato sauce, just the right amount of mozz and allllllll the pepperoni could dream of.  The balance is near perfect with that thick dough and those pepperoni cups.  Gosh, I love a spicy pepperoni cup.

This new location is perfect for those who can't get down to the village but craving a delicious slice.  I walked in a few weeks after they opened and was greeted by the friendliest guy behind the counter.  We chatted for a few about those pepperoni cups while he heated up a couple slices for me.

The place isn't too big but there's a counter along the one side if you want to stay in and have your slice, no stools tho.  And be warned -- both sides of the place are lined with mirrors. Makes the space feel bigger than it really is and super bright but if you don't like seeing yourself eat then you may want to take your slice to go. :-P  Either way -- it's going to be the best $$ you spend all week.
I love Village square pizza. Never been disappointed with any toppings I got on my pizza. Will always visit!
Best in NYC. Went all over on my trip to try different pizza's this easily beats prince street and was the best square I had by far here. Workers are super friendly and nice as well.
Stopped in for some drinks to take to our hotel room. Noticed the cakes in the display. Decided to get the tiramisu and lemon coconut cake. One of the best decisions of this trip! Delicious!

All the bad reviews on this place are spot on. They're nasty crooks ripping people off. The gypsy woman at the counter sold me stale pastries. When I went back to tell her they were stale she just kept repeating with her nasty expression "I got them fresh today." She seemed mentally challenged so I won't make personal comments. They were so stale you could see the white hard crust forming in the middle and she just kept popping off repeating her lies. Any self respecting establishment doesn't sell stale garbage and doesn't argue with customers who then tell them their items aren't fresh. Too bad she's too daft to understand this. Steer clear of this dump.

This morning around 730am I tried to make a order cuz I was at work and the lady answer the phone I was telling her my order and before I got to finish my sentence she cut me off said she don't deliver and hung up in my face. I see she is having a bad day but that has nothing to do with the customers that you work for. Your pose to be kind and respectful not disrespectful. As of today I don't want nothing from that store as long as she is working there. I don't need that bad juju around my food or me she has on a long black wig like hair and bad attitude for no reason. It's crazy cuz I been there be for never had that problem with her. Seems like she don't want to work. Trust me her mood for today made me very upsetting.

Disappointing.

Wanted some authentic NY style pizza, but sadly, Villa Pizza fell short.  Very uninspiring.  We only stopped because we were starving on our trek from Penn Station to the U.S.S. Intrepid.

Prices are outrageous also -- a slice of mushroom and a bottle of water set me back over 10 bucks.
Nastiest pizza I've ever had in my life. Stopped for a quick bite and immediately regret it. Waste of money. Don't bother. Pricey and nasty.

I've tasted better pizza, I only came in to grab a quick bite and I wasn't thrilled on this pizza. It was heavy on the dough. I wonder put this in the family of New York Pizza. Don't come for me just my own opinion. Given that it's in Times Square expect long lines. They do have a solid system that makes traffic move fairly quickly which is something I appreciated.

Was waiting to watch a movie at AMC across the street and needed a quick bite. Ordered two regular slices and a pepperoni roll, me and my girlfriend ended up getting sick from the food here. Highly suggest other pizza spots around the area.

Terrible
Utterly terrible
The worst Italian food I have ever had, absolutely avoid.

0 stars if I could.

Disgusting garbage pizza. Didn't even finish. Throwing it in the trash. The most lousy pizza I have ever had. Frozen pizza tastes better.

People who founded this brand are a disgrace to all pizza.

Overpriced to the max!!

Villa Pizza has been around since 1964. This location was inside another food hall. Got excited to eat some pizza. Too bad the quality of the pizza was not that good. Tasted like cardboard. And they had tons of pizza out for a while. Not very crowded either. The pizza is overpriced too. So not worth it. The Mac and cheese tasted gross. Chunky and artificially-like. Sad to see this was considered a favorite side dish. Overall, I wouldn't recommend eating here.

AS ALWAYS, NOM FOR LIFE!
Everything look sooooo good! Made with love! My daughter loved their pasta. I had sausage in dough, pizza still waiting for us in the box, but looks soooo good. Thank you!

This will be a quick review. I missed my 4PM bus, and had a 90 minute wait. I wanted to charge my phone, but hunger set in. As I approached the counter, the older gentleman with an attitude says "what do you need" I asked him to hold on so I could decide, a minute later he says "slice four dollars"Why can't he just let me decide in peace!?

Onto the pizza, it was horrible and equivalent to cafeteria in grade school pizza, but here it will set you back $4 bucks. The ambiance, is bunch of people who didn't even purchase anything; they were charging their phones, using the Internet cafe, or people getting drunk. Yea, a group of five people across from me were downing a fifth of vodka without much discretion at 4 in the afternoon!

In sum, if you're hungry, just wait, and stay the hell away from here.

This is the worst spot in Times Square. The "manager" has no manners but couldn't expect less from somebody who has this place looking like sh!t. The grills were disgusting, food all over the counter, no masks when handling food, the bathrooms were disgusting, etc, etc. Never coming again.

You get all hyped about eating NYC pizza and then you eat here and bursts your bubble!

It was pretty late 2:am to be exact and I understand they are probably not cooking fresh out of the oven pizzas but I think the promptness of service can be better specially when your group of 5 is the only one in line.

I had a Stromboli which I totally love from other places. This one was good but no yummy tomato sauce over it, I had to ask the guy for sauce and he gave it to me on the side. My friends had chicken parmigiana and spaghetti with vegetables, though it was cooked it lacked flavor. For the 5 of us we spent $60.. The other 3 had a slice of pizza! Yes very expensive.

They have sitting in the lower level and their restrooms are actually pretty clean. If you plan to come back then the $2 off on your receipt will come in handy on your next visit.

if its late and your worn out, This place will fit the need. A little on the expensive side for just bottle water and a couple slices of pizza. It sad that this was my first NY Pizza, will try higher Yelp rates restaurants for pizza today. But it did the trick.

I may be a tad late to check in, but here goes a review.

I learn back in May of NYC being one of three stops for Nena's first American tour.  Date?  October 4th.  So I get tickets, buy the train fare, all in advance.  Only thing to do is plan dinner that evening.  I wanted something I couldn't get in Aberdeen MD (which is just about anything; Aberdeen is in the middle of freakin Nowhere lol) once I got into town.  So where did I wind up?

Being late for the theater, I decided to stop here along the way.  (This, I could've gotten in White Marsh lol)  Picked up two slices and a side of pasta.  I still arrived at the theater in plenty of time.

What struck me as interesting was the fact that this location had a basement/separate dining room from the upper level, which was basically the kitchen.  It was laid out well, everything visible and there was no rush (apart from wanting to make the PlayStation Theater by 7 lol), and it all seemed to flow well.    And on the way in I spotted someone across the street who I swear looked like Debbie Harry and Chris Stein.  So that's an added bonus, I suppose :D

Worst food and service ever. There were barely a customer here when I walked in. No one behind the stand knows how to take an order or even check out. And the food? I stopped eating after the first few bites because I could taste this cheesesteak was grilled on a grill that has so much grease on them and it looked like a trash.

Legit the worst place in NYC probably in the whole states. They couldn't take my order since they didn't know how to do a sandwich that was on the menu. I went for a wrap and another sandwich and oh boy was that a mistake. The cold wrap tasted like it was going bad and I can't even describe what the sub tasted like.. I ate it with some hotsauce since I was hungry as hell. Rest of the night I tried keeping it in my stomach and not puke it out.
Avoid at any cost!

Honestly, I didn't think this place was all THAT bad that it has received so many harsh reviews.  But there were a few things that my beau and I pointed out while we were eating a vegetable slice of pizza, a hot dog (which I succombed to), and a pasta salad:

1) NO ONE WORE HAIR NETS!!!  Ughhh!! That's a violation for SURE!

2) Everything was handed with BARE hands at this place.  I pray they washed their hands :x

3) Only one co-ed bathroom on the first floor (additional seating downstairs) and it was an absolute disgrace!  It made peeing on a hydrant look like sh!tting on a golden throne

The food was standard and I think that's important if you're on the go.  Not exactly a place I'd take that "almost steady" bf/gf, you know?
Service was bad, took forever to get their foods done. Next thing you know, they charge you gold for a bottle of water

Wanted to grab some quick food before a bus at Port Authority. Service was fast, friendly enough staff. The food wasn't amazing in general, specifically the pizza was really not great. I got the tomato and ricotta pizza and the ricotta was essentially melted string cheese. Low quality, sitting out forever. They did heat it up a little, but it didn't solve much. The seating is spacious but pretty unkempt, and employees were sitting around whom obviously should gave been cleaning booths and tables for other guests. Typical *ambiguous origin stickiness* on the booth seats.

The reason for the three stars is because I caught the mac and cheese straight out of the oven and it was quite good. I will say that unless you gave the fortune to make it right when the food is out, expect it to be cold and hard--the reheating isn't substantial.

Huge pizza shop on the corner with main floor and downstairs seating. The food is already made. Just grab a tray, order, pay, then sit or take-out. There's plastic plates and forks when you dine in. Nothing fancy......

If the guy who made my plate was new, I'll give him the benefit of the doubt but regardless, he was annoying. There's a sign that says $13.99 for a meat, choice of pasta, and salad. I asked for a chicken parmesan meal and he gives me a piece of chicken with sauce in a bowl. I said "Do I get pasta with this?" He says: "Oh, you want a meal? O.K. You get one meat and two sides." I tell him no I want the meal on the sign; One meat, pasta, and salad. He says: "Ohhhhhh! You want salad?" then proceeds to make the plate I asked for.

Really?

Anyway, the meal was $15 with tax and was not worth it. The chicken parm wasn't awful but it was cold and I didn't enjoy it. Wrapped the rest to go and ended up throwing it out. More than likely I won't return.

I bought a $7 cup of orange juice that was supposedly fresh squeezed, but had that metallic taste of concentrate and a weird faint aftertaste of pineapple. I have a great suspicion that they are definately not freshly squeezing oranges back there and using cheap orange concentrate rehydrated with water.

Extremely expensive for cheap food. $48 for 2 mash potatoes, 3 small chicken wings, 1 chicken thigh and 2 orange juice cups. So not worth it, I could have eaten lobsters with this price. I will never tell anyone to go here. It is way better to walk for a short distance and eat outside.

I am a NYC local, this place is horrible. Spent $20 on the "triple play" . Quarter chicken, vegetable rice and roasted potatoes. Got here at 6pm and I was able to taste that the food was nuked in the microwave this morning. Long story short, this place was built to take tourists' money. If you are from NYC looking for cheap eats definitely not worth coming here. If you are a tourist, you will not find authentic NYC food at this establishment. I don't enjoy giving poor ratings, or writing bad reviews but this place does not deserve anything more than 1 star.
Way way overpriced. Leave the station and go around the corner for local good pizza. Taste is bland! Also rude staff. Avoid!

I know it's the New York fast food style to cook pizza and make sandwiches in the morning and put them under a heat lamp all day then put them in an over for a few minutes to serve and tourist like me eat it up. But this place is just horrible even for those low standard.

We traveled by train to Penn Station and we were starving by the time we checked into our hotel. So of course we wanted some authentic New York pizza. After they cook us some pizza Sabarro style we looked for a place to sit. It was full but fortunately they have a basement. So we slide down this old slippery stairway and find rows of collapsible tables crammed together with about 30 chairs. There was only one other family eating there but the chairs and tables were so tight together we felt cramped. Thank goodness there weren't more people down there too. I guess I shouldn't complain too much about this. I know every inch of real estate is valuable in the city and we were lucky they had a place for us to sit at all.

Even though we were starved the eating was a chore. The bread was like eating construction paper. The sauce was not to be found and the cheese was absolutely flavorless. The pepperoni gave you heartburn as it touched your throat. They had old bottles of hot sause that looked like they survived the last world war and were nearly empty so I gathered a few and doused my pizza as best I could to get it down.

Our loss, but there are so many other places to eat around this place for anyone else to suffer the fate we did. Save yourself and skip this one.
Definitely not worth the money. $15 for a very small Stromboli, a small side of vegetables, and a drink that gets no refills. Never, ever again.

Holy crap $5.22 for one slice of supreme pizza! I should have just gone to Two Boots if I wanted to pay that much for one slice of pizza. It tasted decent but seriously if your gonna charge me hat much at least use fresh mushrooms instead of the canned kind.

Pros:

(+) Friendly staff
(+) Quick service
(+) Plenty of seating
(+) Computers available with Internet access
(+) Sells ice cream & shakes
(+) Sells beer
Cons:

(-) Baked ziti was cold in the middle as if it were once frozen

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For a food chain this place is decent. For the friendly customer service alone I would give this place a solid 5. As for the food, I'd give it a 3 and the reason being was because my baked ziti was cold in the middle as if it were once frozen. The baked ziti was hot and mushy on the outside - but cold in the middle and I specifically was craving pasta. I got the combo which comes with a slice of pizza, pasta and a drink. The pizza was good. But I still give this place a pretty high score of a 4 only because the customer service was great and it overweighed my experience with the food.

Coming here was a mistake. My husband and I have been walking around New York City all day long and we wanted to try "NY pizza". We decided to choose a place closer to our hotel and came across this one. We were already hungry and lost hope in finding a pizza joint that was open and looks newly cooked. First off all, a manager and employee argued right in front of us, a tourist! He was the type of manager that would just give direction instead of hoping on and helping us, instead he scolded his employee who was making pizza to help the line. Secondly, $28 freakin dollars for two commercialized slices of pizza, 5 pcs of cold wings and two drinks. Bad first experience of New York pizza.

Pro tip: If you're around that area. Google "Yotel Hotel" and head towards that direction and it should be a good 5-7minute walk from Villa Pizza and you will come across a 99cent pizza place, try that place out for me. Unfortunately we weren't able to do that but reviews are way better than Villa and even if the pizza is not that great atleast you're spending less than $28!!

Definitely not your typical New York style pizza.
Felt like I got an attitude from one of the workers, but it's all good!
It's definitely pricey just for a pizza & drink. Then again everything around the city is expensive, but I'm sure anyone could find a good tasting $2 slice of pizza.
There was one good thing there that a friend of mine got, it was expensive, but it tasted good. I can't remember the name of it as of right now.

Stopped in here for a quick bite.

Got a slice of pizza, drink and 2 Garlic sticks.

Sat downstairs. It was clean. 2 bathrooms to boot!

Pizza was all dough :(

The Garlic Sticks were tasty!

My husband and I are from Chicago visiting NYC for New Year's Eve and unfortunately we lost our new iPhone X late night nye. We last remembered it at Villa fik so we called several times on New Year's Day but they said it was never found. We decided to call one more time at the airport going home and Waheed was attentive enough to call his manager at home to further investigate. He called us back as we were boarding the plane to let us know that an iPhone X has been found and that they'll let us know when the manager comes in to the restaurant. The Manager ended up calling us and we were able to verify that the phone was in fact ours and they got our address and shipped it to our home with a tracking number included. My husband and I were thrilled and blessed for Waheed and Alaa. We insisted on sending a check or a gift at the least to show our gratitude but he refused and would not accept anything. The least I can do for these gentlemen is to leave an amazing review for the restaurant and acknowledge WAHEED and ALAA for their amazing act of kindness and honesty.

Besides these two amazing staff, I would also like to comment that they had amazing pizza and calzone! We have a few in chicago but definitely enjoyed it better here!

Look, it's a huge pizza place in Times Square. Is it gonna be the best pizza in the city? Of course not. But it's perfectly fine.

It's mainly geared towards tourists. It's huge with LOTS of seating inside, with additional seating downstairs. I've been here before and it can get pretty crowded but there always seems to be seating available, and it was not very busy for a Sunday afternoon today.

They've got a number of pizza options, beer, pasta, and sandwiches. The employees are all helpful and friendly. Service is fast. I had a slice of pepperoni for a little over $5. The pizza itself was fine. It did its job. I would definitely go here again if I'm in the area and in a rush, though there are cheaper and better pizza options elsewhere.

Stale, cold disappointing pizza I had. I was starving and I needed something quick and I always remember coming here as a child with my mom to stuff my little face off and I loved it. Now well I know better and  I'm highly disappointed. Either management changed or they don't care about there establishment anymore bc they are at the heart of port authority and no one knows better.

The most disgusting place I have ever dined at! The food is pig slop at best. The service is worse than that.

We stopped here on New Year's Day because every other restaurant nearby was packed full of people. We wanted a quiet place with tasty food to sit and relax and enjoy! We had philly cheese steak sandwiches that were made with liquid cheddar cheese! Ewwww. My daughter had a slice of cheese pizza that was burned black on the bottom and tasted like paper. Please do NOT go here when there are so many more quality establishments in the area.
It's just fast food. I didn't have the pizza but I did have a wrap. It wasn't made fresh. It came from a refrigerator and was very bland.

We were looking for a quick bite to eat before the megabus ride back home. We stopped here, and I had the mac & cheese. I was waiting in line for the megabus when I started not feeling that great. I got food poisoning. I had to deal with being sick (don't want to be too TMI) for the 8 hour long bus ride. Thank god it was a midnight bus and everyone was sleeping. Please do not eat here! I have never been in so much pain in my life.

They only got this one star, because of the Pie Day Pizza Rate.
We just had the most awful experience at this location. With today being "Pie Day", they advertised via email "a whole cheese Neapolitan Pie for only $3.14". Myself and 2 co-workers headed to the restaurant, with coupons in hand, only to be met by "the Manager" who refused to take our coupons because our email addresses were not on the coupon. I offered to write it in, which he refused. He wanted "the original email". After standing quietly awaiting someone from our office to email us the coupon, he came over saying: "I spoke to my boss, and he said to take the coupon". See our argument was, among the information regarding the offer, there was NO MENTION, that we were to present the original offer with email address, we had the coupons. Nevertheless, it was accepted.
We proceeded to await our pizzas, the cook/server said in a VERY UNPLEASANT manner, "you have to wait". I said okay, and stepped aside to wait, he continued to fuss with me. I had to say to him, that I paid for the order, he did not have to be rude. He gave one of my colleagues, hers in the large pizza box, I asked him to cut mine and place it in a smaller box so I can carry it. The pizza maker, said to him in Spanish - to not give us the smaller carry boxes. He however continued to box them, we politely said "thank you", but before I left I said to both men, "make sure when you want to bad mouth your customers, be certain that they do not understand the language which you speak".
It became obvious to us, that they were not prepared for as many customers to respond to the offer, which is okay.  Some businesses still do not understand the effect of promotion via the World Wide Web. But know if your business is serving customers, it is imperative for your employees to be courteous.
My suggestion - choose another pizza location. You're in NYC, there are tons of them.

The location here in port authority is is extremely over priced! It's insane almost $4 a 20oz bottle of soda, $6 for a side of fries, $6 for a slice of pizza! The food was not that great at all! The server where rude, and the place felt like a sweat shop it was so hot in there! I will not be going back anytime soon!

The food is good but it's hard to know what is the ""All you can eat breakfast" I took the line asked what I was sawing but they charged me more than the "all you can eat" and it's not clear if I can take the line again, a little confusing for tourists.

I stopped in here to get out of the rain for a few minutes and to use the bathroom. The place was clean and the bathroom smelled strongly of perfume scented cleaner. There were only a few people in here despite the fact that it's right in the middle of Times Square. Almost like an upscale bodega. Downstairs there was a ton of seating. I'd stop by here again if I was waiting for someone or for a potty break. I doubt I'd eat here though. Limited and expensive options.

Blah - what was I think? Watched cashier (handling money) take a customer's pizza from plate to to-go box ... with us money fingers! Yuck!! Go find another place - you don't deserve this - even for convenience.

Went here today for dinner. I ordered my food, and after i paid for it i turned to go to a seat and this panhandler guy is right in my face coming toward me as i am moving to the side because he is nearly right over my food, which is rude for a stranger to do. I nearly dropped my food. He followed me to my table still begging and right near me only like one or two inches away as i placed my food on the table. I then said "i don't have cash, i use my card to order, sorry. Then he (the panhandler) said i don't want cash. I am trying to get food. Then, i said, "please, let me finish eating." Then the panhandler said with an attitude "oh! I gotta wait for you to finish eating?!" Then he said "well, i'ma wait right here!" And he then sat nearby. Still sounding like he had an attitude and he seemed to me a bit harassing. And there is no security there it seems, none that i saw. And the staff there seems to allow panhandling and begging in the restaurant all around the customers, near the lines, near the cash register payment area and near eating tables. Because of my experience today, i will make a concious effort when i can, to not go to this restaurant at this location anymore. Staff should not allow that in their restaurant. Panhandlers following people around inside and begging in their face. Come on! Watching payment transactions. Panhandlers and beggars should be asked not to do that inside a restaurant or place of business. I give money to panhandlers and beggars often but outdoors, and when i'm not busy. And definitely not while i'm being basically harassed while trying to grab a bite to eat at a restaurant that i assumed would be peaceful and safe to eat at. I will not go here much, if at all anymore. Horrible horrible experience.

First off , the service was left to be desired . The women are yelling at you to step down while your trying to decide what you want to eat , what ever . They all have attitudes , who's fault is it that you work here ?. When I get the OVER priced & UNDERwhelming chicken , that was supposed to be buffalo wings , it was fried Tyson frozen chicken wings with hot sauce on them (nothing like what was depicted) the tea was unsweetened (yet was told it was sweet . You have to wait to be called with no waiting area ? It's a no for me a second time . No thanks
Bad food, cold in the middle, and overpriced. The slice was better than the pepperoni roll. Just don't.

This is one of my few 2 star reviews and I gave it that because of all the places in Times Square, this is one restaurant that NO ONE should ever get trapped into going, even if you are a tourist and I want you to never come back to infest the streets with your flashy cameras and obnoxious fanny packs. I cannot do the disservice of tricking you to eat at this place.

I was going to a dance studio for some Argentine Tango and had about an hour or so to kill so I walked around Times Square and found this place which looked pretty clean and legit. I walked inside and it felt like a Sbarro, but nicer with a smoothie bar. Okay, all good so far, so where the heck do they get the one star?

You're here for food and prices. If you're a New Yorker, pizzas and all things Italian are held sacred and kept at a higher standard than anything else. If your pizza tastes like cardboard, it had better be dirt cheap. If it is mistaken as manna from heaven, we don't mind flapping out our wallets to do it. But if you cross that rather generous threshold of Cost and Taste, there is no room for forgiveness, and this place does that.

That being said, I didn't order a pizza (uhh... what the hell was that ^ rant for then?). Well, it's because this is a PIZZA store and that sacred bond is upheld for everything that they sell, including the chicken ranch stromboli that I ordered. It cost over $8 for the tiniest wrap thing that I had ever seen. It was dripping in oil and looked like there was nothing stuffing it. What made it worse was that when I was about to order, there was a group of Japanese people giving back their plates of pizza because their order was to-go. The server took the pizzas off those plates and put my stromboli on one of them. Now, normally it's not a huge deal and I prefer that they not waste things, but I count it as a check against them rather than for them because everything here just felt slimy.

The stromboli, as I suspected, was dry inside and the cheese was hard from having sat outside all day. The oil covering the thing was like a layer of sunscreen - thick, congealed, and sticky. I was not a huge fan of this meal. If it was at the very least large, then I could somewhat forgive them for getting my money's worth, but it was the size of a puny hot pocket. What made the meal worse was the Hawaiian Punch bottle that I bought with it - $2.99??? Are you freaking serious?

I agree with the other reviews here, avoid it at all costs, it's not worth your money or time.

It's only saving grace is the large open space in the basement that you can chill in with a group of friends, but I wouldn't want to buy food from here again.

I eat here everyday, so I'm being a hypocrite complaining about it.
The pizza here will kill you.  Only tourists who don't know any better, and the homeless eat here.  I usually just buy soda in here.  The staff is pretty rude unless you are a regular.  
If you plan on sitting in here and eating, be warned you will not eat in peace.  This is where the homeless people hang,, they ALWAYS come in here for money, and if you don't give them any , they WILL bitch you out.

People need to write reviews based on a restaurants location and their expectations walking inside.

This place is nearly right next to Port Authority and a stone's throw from the middle of Times Square. It sells pizza by the slice and other things which are ordered at a counter as you carry a tray, so it's not classy. It is supposed to be quick and easy... also it is not billed as an authentic Italian restaurant by any stretch of the imagination. It also has a/c on hot days and heat on cold days... in this neighborhood, that can mean a contingency of homeless individuals trying to escape the elements. Taking all of that into consideration, this place meets my expectations.

We were actually greeted by an employee who directed us to the end of the line. Those working behind the counter were patient and quick. We snagged a table and sat down to eat our super quick lunch before making it to our show down the block. Was the pizza great? No. Did I expect it to be based on everything written above? Absolutely not. Was the pizza good enough for a fast meal in a pinch? Yes. (Oooh, and the garlic knots were yummy!)

For what it is and where it is, this place is just fine. Just don't go expecting a 4-star treatment or quality food. The place is kept fairly clean and everything is adequate.

It doesn't take a rocket scientist to know that this pizza is way overpriced.  We're talking theme-park, museum-cafe, movie-theater, American-food-in-Japan style overpriced.  I know it's Times Square, but come on!

The pizza is fine.  It tasted fine, but $3.57 for a slice?  Not OK.  Weirdly enough, their Greek salad is really good.  I got the meal deal and it ended up being upwards of $9.  For that much I should have people wiping my mouth (censored) for me!

Do yourself a favor and buy a street falafel.  They're $5 in Times Square but it's better than a crappy slice of pizza.

-Mediocre food
If you want to call it even that.

I definitely wouldn't have the chicken salad again. "Grilled chicken" was some funky :x looking meat.

The only reason I wouldn't give it a 1 instead of a 2 cause I do think the pizza is at least ok.

-Overpriced

$2.29 16.9 oz btl of water. Peh!!

Salad was about $10 :X
Could easily get a better regular salad at the Pax Wholesome down the block(between 7th and 8th ave) or any number of any of other restaurants. I even think a Burger King(there's one the block over bet 8th and 9th ave) that could make a better quality salad.

ARRRGH!!!

Mega mediocre. When I was a NYC newbie eons ago, I found myself at this joint every time I had been commuting from Jersey. Why me?! The thought of how I wasted so much money on this food ails me to this day.

The pasta is super meh, the pizza is... okay... but oddly super expensive. I understand if you're in a jam-packed rush, but there's so many other places nearby to get your pizza fill that won't leave you so dissatisfied.

It's loaded with tourists and crazy crowded during the day to boot. Barf.

Do yourself a big favor and skip this place.

The Nuer Tom Bai Horapa is absolutely delicious. The broth is very flavourful, filled with lemongrass and basil notes, and the beef is stewed to perfection, very tender where the beef fat melts when biting into it. My date was also impressed with the dish as she usually stay away from inconsistent textures, so two thumbs up for this.

The server was courteous and the ambience was intimate with jazz music over lunch service, definitely not too loud and conversations can still occur.

Definitely looking forward for my next visit.

the food here is so so good, we got the mom's pad thai and chef special of duck noodle soup. all the servers were so nice and welcoming, plus everything comes out so quickly. definitely a calm vibe for a late bite!

one of the best thai spots we've been to !!
friendly staff with cozy atmosphere here. The food is very tasty . Small portions to share but it's all good. We get to enjoy a lot of delicious foods. Recommend to try.

Boat noodle soup smacks!!

The Thai iced coffee is also good stuff.

Around 10 small tables for seating but worth it

Food was great. Ordered the pork belly, chicken curry, and braised beef - all were amazing.

Very attentive service as well; PK and TK were fantastic.

Great service - TK was the best!

Curry was the right level of spice and super flavorful. Definitely coming back.

Loved this restaurant mainly because of our amazing server. I didn't catch his name, but he was so friendly and enthusiastic and helpful. He even gave us complimentary Thai iced teas because he apologized that we had to wait longer for our appetizers! The wait wasn't even that bad in my opinion.

I came here for the first time in April 2022 and sat outdoors for lunch. This time, I came for dinner and sat indoors.
