Although it is tight for seating, we got a table against the wall which gave us more privacy since we didn't have a table on either side. It's dark and candlelit inside so it had a great ambiance. Our table was a bit wobbly though which made it tough to balance our food. The menus are also way too big compared to the table. We had to be careful with the open candle flame as we were looking at the menu.

My favorites were the crab curry (under seafood section) and the rice balls that came with it. There was also a made to order rice roll appetizer that was delicious. Make sure you eat that warm!

Yelpers helped me find this place--Thank You!

Took all my relatives and friends here for dinner on a Saturday evening of Labor Day Weekend before the Michael Jackson Broadway Show and impressed them all with the quality of the food, presentation, service, and atmosphere.

Prices here are reasonable--especially for Manhattan.

Major Tip--if you want to avoid the touristy mediocre restaurants in the Broadway District before a show--Come Here.  It's just a 15-20 minute walk into the Broadway Show Theater District.  (And everyone send me $5 for this valuable tip if I am right.)

The entire staff was wearing Thai outfits--we were told the owner brought them back from Thailand.

Hands down, my favorite Thai restaurant in the neighborhood (and HK is known for Thai food). There are so many items to choose from, so we try to get different dishes when we visit--the visual aids in the menu help to make the difficult decision.

Recently, we had the pak mor cashew as the appetizer - it was simple yet delicious. Sai oua, lemongrass pork sausage, leaving me wanting more. The three of us shared miang salmon - a dish where you use lettuce to wrap crispy salmon bits. We love how all the dishes were authentic and felt homey.

I can't wait until they get the liquor license. In the meantime, it might be a good idea to allow BYOB.

I came in with a group of 6 and had a reservation for 7PM on Wednesday. We got seated outside but it was oddly super close to the streets; homies felt like a car would crash into them LOL.

My friends and I ordered the Green coconut curry (4/5), Pad Thai (4/5), and Beef Noodle Soup (4/5). All were delish and very flavorful! Make sure to check in for free Thai iced tea! The service was alright but I do feel like since we sat outside, we didn't get as much attention.
Delicious food, great service and lovely ambiance. My husband and I really enjoyed our lunch here and will definitely come back again!

The Pad See Mao was a flavorful delight with its Drunken noodles, fresh Thai chili, and aromatic basil leaves. The Khao Soi Kai (Chicken) showcased Northern Thai cuisine perfectly, with its rich curry and tender braised chicken.

All the dishes were a true testament to the chef's skill and dedication to creating authentic and mouthwatering Thai cuisine.

The ambiance at Valla Table was warm and inviting, and the service was attentive and friendly. It's evident that the team at Valla Table takes great pride in their food and customer experience.

Valla Table was truly a magnificent experience of flavors, aromas, and service. TK, who managed a great team of dedicated servers and staff, made sure our experience was welcoming, comfortable, and memorable. The positive attitude was infectious, and the comfortable space was warm and inviting. The food was truly memorable as it brought me back to my trips to Bangkok, Thailand, but with a very personal touch. The flavors and aromas have the elegance of the making of a top restaurant but also the comfort of your neighborhood spot that you would want to go back to every night. Imagine having a Thai parent who went to culinary school and brought it to serve you. It is a great place to eat with a group, family style, or a romantic date night. You will not be disappointed coming here. Be adventures and take a chance with their recommendations. It is completely worth it.

This is definitely one of my favorite Thai restaurants!  Everything is so fresh, well seasoned, and generously portioned.  The Tom Ka here is my favorite anywhere!  Wait time for takeout is excellent and the people are lovely.
This unassuming entrance has the most delicious Thai food I've had in NYC. BEAUTIFUL servings, beautiful presentation and delicious food. Accompanied by excellent service .

This is probably my 4th or 5th time in person and I always find myself coming back! We got the Mom's Pad Thai with shrimp and the Crab Meat Fried Rice. Both were so delicious and complimentary. The pad Thai was sweet while the fried rice was more savory. We also got the Thai ice tea, which was a sweet compliment to the meal. Service was amazing as usual. Everyone is so kind here and offers great recommendations. The indoor space is cozy and very cute with lights, candles, and fresh flowers. The menu is extensive so there's something for everyone and you can't go wrong with whatever you order. We will be back again!

Food: 5/5 | Service: 4/5 | Experience: 3.5/5

My party of two sat in the outdoor covered area, which was not the most pleasant experience. There were a bunch of flies around the plant area that distracted me. Luckily there was not a party sitting there. And every time someone walked into the seating area, the back of my chair dipped in and I had to readjust. The outdoors area can definitely do with a better structure.

We ordered the Thai iced tea, ba mee haeng, and yum sam moo. Everything was really well presented. The Thai tea was a bit sweet, and I wish there was more of the spice flavor shining through, but overall it was good. The yum sam moo was a smaller dish than I anticipated, but tender and tasty. I enjoyed the ba mee haeng as the noodles with the sauce were perfectly sweet and savory and the fish balls and meet were tender. I liked that I could adjust the amount of sauce I could put in.

Overall, I recommend sitting indoors for a better experience.

I was attending a Circle Line boat ride and I wanted to find a Thai restaurant that was as far West as possible in Hells Kitchen and I found Valla Table on Yelp with tons of positive reviews.  I had the pleasure of trying the crab dumpling curry dish at Valla Table and it was an absolute culinary delight!

The combination of delicate crab dumplings and fragrant curry sauce created a harmonious fusion of flavors that left me thoroughly impressed. The dumplings were expertly crafted, with a delectable filling that showcased the freshness and sweetness of the crab. The curry sauce was delicious,
It had just the right amount of heat to add a delightful kick without overpowering the flavors. The dish was beautifully presented.

I highly recommend Valla Table.

Found Valla Table through search and I was intrigued by their ratings! I called the restaurant 15 minutes in advance, and they were able to accommodate my party of 6. This was on a Sunday evening for dinner!

The menus are HUGE and they have pictures for each item which I absolutely love! No one in my party has ever been here before so the pictures helped us with our selection.

The food came out quick! I ordered the Nuer Yang, Chicken Pad Thai, and Thai Tea. The Nuer Yang was AMAZING! The tamarind sauce that comes with the meal for dipping was so good! I even used it on my rice and Pad Thai. The Pad Thai was very flavorful, and the Thai Tea was delicious.

I would highly recommend you make a reservation or call ahead to see if they have availability before just walking in. Service, food, and presentation were excellent! Can't wait to come back and try some other items on the menu.

Amazing meal, great service !
The waiter is so friendly and warm and provided great recommendations! The food was delicious
Everything we ordered was good, including the pad Thai, tom yum soup and crab dumplings.

Food is great! Love the Pad Kee Mao
Thai ice tea is very nice too
The curry has a really strong coconut taste, so coconut lovers GO for it!

First time here, the service was fast and the food tasted authentic and tasty!

The pad kee mao was just the right amount of spicy.
The steak (nuer yang) came sizzling hot and done perfectly.
Food was amazing! Great service! And the wait-staff were amazing! Especially Ploi!! He was so friendly and went over the entire menu! Gave great recommendations!

This is a cute little thai restaurant by the hells kitchen
I was welcomed right away by ever smiling waiter and were promptly seated. They have a QR code scanner for the menu. Waiter was helpful in letting us know of the various options and since my friend has low tolerance for spice, they adjusted the dish accordingly!
I love spicy food and this place never failed to surprise me. But this time though I had ordered pad kee Mae spicy, it was quite bland. Once I let the waiter know, he promptly recooked the dish for me!
I love the crunchiness of the vegetables and the overall taste of the dish.
They allow patio seating as well. Loved the little details to the ambience added for patio
This place has few seating so might get crowded during peak hours around 8ish. Definitely recommend!

From the warm welcome by the hostess to the energy of fellow diners, we knew we were in for a special dining experience. The most delicious, creative Thai food we've had--and we eat a lot of Thai food. We followed suggestions from our fabulous waiter, who steered us to a delicious appetizer (Pak Mor, rice roll with cashew, sweet radish and coconut cream), a crispy salmon lettuce wrap dish (Miang Salmon) and duck breast with
bok choy and noodles (Ba Mee Ped). There are lots of Thai restaurants in the area, and we wanted to make sure we chose well. We did and would absolutely come back next time we're in town (this is not a touristy place), and we will recommend it to friends and family who live here!

Ordered three dishes: Moo Krob Prik Kluer, Kaeng Som Goong, and Classic Boat Noodle.

We love Thai food in NYC but we were a bit disappointed with the dishes we ordered. The noodle was a bit too salty and didn't enjoy the aftertaste it left. Pork belly was on the tougher rather than on the tender side. Maybe it's due to our lack of tastebuds to properly appreciate, but wasn't our favorite.

Will say that a lot of people seem to enjoy and the service was great!!!

Service was super friendly and the food was on point in terms of flavor, portions and quality of ingredients. A friend that lives in the neighborhood recommended this place and I will definitely return. Thank Daniel for the tip!

Our meal was excellent. Definitely worth the visit. Staff was great and very attentive! Small and intimate
space. Will be back next time I'm in town.
The ambiance of the restaurant is lovely. It feels cozy, and the service is great as well. All the dishes that we ordered were delicious as well.
The lunch deal can't be beat. Got a really filling order of pad Thai and iced tea for under $20. The staff is so nice here. I love visiting whenever I'm in the area.

Walked here after the gym. I like the vibe and the servers are really really nice. I just felt like the food was average. I ate it all but I wouldn't come again, or if I did I would order something else. I felt like the green curry had a lot of spice and but not the best flavor overall. They had a lot of other things on the menu that looked really good.

The Thai iced tea was so good !! Perfect amount of sweet

Tried coconut pork and cashew dumpling. It was amazing.
Followed by moms pad Thai - it was really good too

Service: We ordered some pretty spicy dishes and down our cups of water within a few minutes, but I never once had to fill up my own water because they were so good about refilling it for me. Greatly appreciated it!

Food:
1/10 Fried tofu was really good. It's a little difficult to eat the crumbles with the tofu because it's just hard to get it all on one spoonful, but the crumbles were really taste and the tofu had a great texture without feeling too fried.

10/10 Pad see ew we asked for spicy, and it was actually quite spicy. I really liked it! It wasn't drenched in flavor, but rather a nice balance of sweet and spicy.

7/10 Miang Salmon was definitely a very interesting dish and I'm really glad I got to try it. I loved the sauces they had and really enjoyed the different textures coming together. However, docking a few points off because having the rinds on the lime was a bit much for me, and I feel like I couldn't really taste much of the salmon in the bite.

The Thai food here is spicy!! Even when we asked for mild spice (baby spice level haha), it still had a kick to it. But I loved it! We got banana blossom as appetizer (which doesn't have banana), pad pak, and tom cloeng jay. The appetizer reminds me a bit of fried chicken, the tom cloeng jay was like a hot and sour soup, and the pad pak just delivers the way an authentic Thai food stall would for street food. I really appreciated that they kept my tom cloeng jay heated with a small burner bowl underneath but watch out for the heat conduction of the bowl/ladle.

The space is an intimate one. We made reservations for it easily the day prior for a Saturday lunch date. If you're looking to find reasonably priced quality Thai food near the Theatre district, this is a short 10 minute walk away! They come out with their food quickly too, which is always nice if you're in a time crunch. They also have plenty of vegetarian/vegan options for people with these dietary restrictions/preferences. :)
Easy to get into for a Thursday night. Highly recommend. The food was excellent and came out quickly. Very friendly service. We will be back.

I recently ate at Valla Table. While the restaurant was small in size, it more than made up for it with their incredible food. I ordered the beef noodle soup and was impressed with it's amazing flavor. The food was fresh and definitely had an authentic taste. It's often hit or miss in NYC, but the service was great and our waiter was super attentive to our table. We also ordered some kind of tofu appetizer that the person I was with raved about. If you're looking for good semi-upscale Thai cuisines in Hell's Kitchen, definitely add this to your list. The clean modern decor was also very inviting.

Whether food is good or not, when one of you gets your entree and then it takes 30 minutes (no exaggeration) for your companion to get his entree, which in this case was SOUP, and you have already asked three times and each time, the person you ask says they're checking on it and then never gives you an answer after that, well, the mood and the meal is ruined.

It's not like this is a huge restaurant. There's maybe 10 tables. It's not like they were packed. Only half of the tables were occupied when we arrived. It's not like they are new or inexperienced. They've been around for years. It's not like there was any justification for this. But more over, to not say anything, when it's clear that you are waiting for an answer as to where your SOUP entree is for your date and your meal is now cold, it's just ridiculous, especially since there were also three or four people working the floor of a 10 table restaurant.

In that SAME 30 minutes we waited for my husband to get his SOUP on Valentine's Day (when they were not busy), the woman at the two top next two us, who ordered a small appetizer, also sat there unattended for 30 minutes waiting for her four piece dumpling.

Did I mention they originally didn't want to seat my husband in the nearly empty restaurant because I was five feet outside locking up our scooters, a visual they could see from the large glass doors and picture glass window that faces right outside to where I was and at which they sat him?

The whole thing was inexcusable.

My husband says the food was decent. I honestly don't remember because by the time he got his, I was too annoyed to even enjoy the meal.

We almost went here about a year ago and walked out because the vibe seemed off. I guess I should have trusted my instincts.

Don't waste your time or money. Go anywhere else. Seriously. Ok
Recommend the Pak mor, boat noodles, moo krob prik!   Service was very attentive and food came out timely

My friend and I checked out the Restaurant Row of Manhattan and was craving Thai food, so we made reservations (to be safe - there were plenty of reservations around 7:30pm prime time) to dine here. It was a good call as there were only 2 tables left that were allocated to reservations only - otherwise you will probably be seated at the bar facing the wall instead of the table (which can be a bit tight as the restaurant layout is a small hallway). We tried the duck tamarind noodles and miang salmon, and both were $26, around NYC restaurant prices.

Duck tamarind noodles were good - the duck is quite juicy and the noodles were cooked well. It was a bit sweet but also flavorful at the same time. The miang salmon was excellent as well - they are seared and fried, bringing out the salmon flavor. You add it to the lettuce, with a bunch of ingredients like rice noodles, cashew, lime, ginger, red onions, and spicy chili lime sauce that brings out the flavors of the dish. I really enjoyed this dish a lot as it was seasoned well and also very refreshing - although spicy, the lime cools down the effect.

Service was good as water refills are consistent. Don't forget to check in on Yelp for a free Thai iced tea, and it seems like there are no restrictions as both my friend and I checked in and we each got a free Thai iced tea which was solid, albeit on the sweeter side a lot of ice (though I can't really complain as it's free).
Flavorful food and nice cozy environment for dates or catch up. Would be back. We didn't have to wait for table was srated right away and just a comfortable environment.

Amazing spot. Super cozy and nice interior with friendly service and staff. So many menu options and the food is very reasonably priced, high quality, and authentic. And easy to walk in without a reservation! At least on a Wednesday it was. Egg noodles were awesome and the beef was so tender. Awesome spot

Follow me on TikTok @rynelly for more NYC food recs!

Ambience is fantastic. Candle-lit, the restaurant treated us with a bottle vase with a red flower in it when seated. Servers are skilled and attentive.

We ordered Thai Ice Tea (rich!), Tom Yum Mor Fai (Tom Yum seafood) and green curry (subbed beef with shrimps). Tom Yum seafood was surprisingly thick and rich in flavor, and green curry was "fruity" in a good way.

We're def coming back.

Food, service, and ambiance was 5/5. Highly recommend this restaurant.

I ordered the Red Curry Chicken with White Rice, it was very good; taste, portion, and quality was great.

Price is reasonable, I would definitely be back!! One of the best Thai Restaurants in Hells Kitchen.

My girlfriend, and I so enjoyed the small but shareable appetizer selections of the fried pork jowl and crispy noodle shrimp! The Tamarind sauce with the pork jowl was stupendous. For entrées, the whole fried Bronzino, crispy pork belly with mixed greens, and the New York strip steak. All cooked to perfection and plenty to share, and all reasonably priced. But the exemplary portion of the meal was the incredibly friendly and efficient service. Although we were in and out in a little bit over an hour, we never felt rushed and the food always came in a timely and fresh  manner.

This was a little hallway-esque, small, hole in the wall-ish, vertical place with a big heart. My friends and I made a reservation for 6pm; it wasn't too busy when we got in, but it definitely filled up by the time we left at around 7pm.

The thing that is most noticeable about this place is the service. We were tended to so so extremely kindly, from being given water when waiting for our entire party to arrive, to being given both a physical menu along with the QR code on the table, to the constant water refills even when they left a bottle of water on the table. There was not a single point where I poured my own water because a server was always there to help me. The food came out insanely fast, both the appetizer we got and the mains. It was genuinely just plain impressive how quickly and sincerely they worked.

A small note is that their menu is super intimidating. The font is difficult to read and there are a lot of words. I opened the paper menu and my eyes could not zero in on anything that was on it. The QR code leads you to the electronic version of the paper menu, so it was still overwhelming, but I was able to zoom in on the text to make it easier to focus on each section.

Food wise, I thought it was standard. Nothing to call home about, but certainly nothing to complain about. The shrimps were fried with crunchy noodles and they were pretty much exactly how you'd think they tasted. I love when fried rice is served in a bowl, which this was, and the portion was big and filling. I thought there could have been slightly more seasoning on the rice just to add a bit more flavor, but at the end of the day it was totally fine.

At the very end, we were offered free thai iced teas to go in exchange for a review, but it was totally on the honor system. They didn't ask us to review right then and there. I was going to review anyway, and I love a thai iced tea (but not to worry, y'all know I keep it real). It was honestly just really kind of them to offer us a free drink. Even though they asked, we could have easily not written a review, so in my head I just see it as generous management, and I'm so grateful to have had such a great experience here overall! It's always a treat to be able to support businesses that care, and you can tell Valla Table does.

A must spot to dine in if you want delicious, fresh, and flavorful Thai food. Our table of 6 ordered a variety of dishes and they all came out quickly. Each dish was delicious, and the service was amazing. Can't wait to come back! Will certainly share with all our friends.

My partner and I live around the corner from Valla table and it's our go to whenever we have a craving for Thai. Whether it's a take out order or we go and sit the food is always great. The staff are extremely friendly and the food is great and quick. Highly recommend the mango sticky rice!!!

Really yummy Thai food in Hells Kitchen! My friend and I got the Pad Kee Mao and the Massaman Nong (curry chicken) - all of which were delicious. We also enjoyed the Thai iced tea; it was so refreshing on a hot day. The space is fairly cramped inside, but there seems to be a nice outdoor seating arrangement outside. All in all, a solid Thai place if you're in need of a Thai food fix!

The reviews are correct. This is a great place.
The Tom Yum had the perfect blend of salty, spicy and fragrance.
Friendly and welcoming staff.

Valla !!! So delicious we had the Thai fried rice and the ground chicken with the egg/rice. Great flavor and good portions. Try the Thai coffee and iced tea it's very refreshing m. Service was exceptional, we dined our side and enjoyed the Neighnorhood as well. Will be back sooner than later def worth the stop!

First time visiting tonight and definitely will be back! They were super friendly and accommodating, draft beer and wine is super reasonably priced, and great selection of bottles and cheeses! Sandwiches are super delicious as well.

Amazing service, great prices, delicious sandwiches, tons of selection for beer and cider!

This dismal place not only cannot communicate but is pointlessly rude to customers. Leave aside the fact that they take forever to make an overpriced sandwich. I wanted the toasted, melted cheese roast beef sandwich with onions and chipotle mayo. All I said was that the last time I got it the roast beef, rare to start with, was for some reason cooked until well-done, and I didn't want that. Instead of giving me the sandwich I asked for, they gave me a cold roast beef sandwich with nothing--not even lettuce and tomato--and charged an absurd $17 for it. And blamed me for not understanding their supposed communication. There is an air of condescension and indifference in their treatment of customers which is truly disgusting. Please let this place go out of business and get replaced by something decent.

The store has decent amount of wine selections. Sometimes I get a sandwich from there as a quick meal. Service is always friendly.
The location is convenient and nearby to my cousin's place. She likes this wine market as well.usually we spend 30 bucks for red wine. Good deal can be found during holiday seasons as well.

I had been searching one recent afternoon for a place to eat and nothing appealed to me. I past the Vinter Cafe and remembered, after looking over the sandwich menu, that I had had an excellent French Dip sandwich there awhile ago. I went in and was taken care of immediately. I ordered my sandwich and realized that there were a full selection of beers in refrigerated cases and you were able to customize a six pack if you so desired. There was also an case where you could purchase nuts, dried apricots, etc. packaged in small plastic containers. I was told to sit at a table and they would bring my sandwich to me. I also got a bottle of Poland Spring to go with my sandwich. The sandwich arrived on toasted Italian bread with melted mozzarella cheese and roast beet with a vat of au jus to dip. It was an excellent sandwich as I remembered it. The staff was accommodative and attentive and the price reasonable for inflation. I would recommend and return.

This is a really unique and cool beer, cheese, and wine market. I've known about this place for 7 years now but seldom get the chance to visit. Nonetheless, I love it here!

I love their vast assortment and selection of craft beer and cheese! Truly a gem in New York City. I just so happened to be in the area this past weekend and so I decided to pay them a visit.

Pre-covid times they were known to have a few indoor tables and seating available. Due to current restrictions, they didn't have any seating set up, however, they said that it would soon become available in the coming weeks!

I picked up some cool craft beer while here.. mind you, I'm not a beer drinker whatsoever, but when it comes to their selection, I just can't resist taking some to-go. I went with this brand that had an array of fun flavors- cans with 4.5% abv and a taller can with 8% abv, flavored with cherry and elderberry.. it was a delight!

I also went with a selection of 3 cheeses and 3 meats, which I took to go.

I'd definitely recommend checking them out if you're in the area and on your way home... or wait a bit until you can enjoy sitting inside once seating opens up again. A cool spot in Hell's Kitchen worth the trip!

Wonderful Place!!

Looking for pumpkin beer,  I found this fabulous place!  

Cozy Little place in the middle of Manhattan with incredible people! This place is going to make your night!

We were walking looking for a quiet place to drink a couple of beers. We stopped here, the best choice of the night ! ... We sat down and the amazing server came with a big smile. I asked for pumpkin beer and he show me 3 different kind!!! The best one is Southern Tier Pumpkin ! OMG!!! If you like pumpkin this is your beer! The taste of this beer is something else! Vanilla pumpkin flavor! its wonderful!! **Sweet taste !!! **

I love this season!! Pumpkin Everything ! LOL..

The place is extremely clean, the menu is not big but is very good. You can ask for a sample of 4 beer, but I didn't because pumpkin beer it not included in the sampler menu.

The service is excellent !!! Only two guys but they are always looking if you need something !

Bathroom is extremely clean!

I will definitely come Back !!!! I am enchanted with this place !!!

I called the restaurant to reports rats by there open eating area.  They hung up on me.  I then went to the restaurant, they would not give me the managers name and was told all reataurants have rats.  Don't eat here

What WHAT?!  SO glad to have given them a go for some breakfast and lunch om nom noms.  

Food arrived within 45-60 mins.  The soup (their quite delicious and homemade broccoli cheddar) was PIPING hot, even after a 10-block delivery in below freezing weather.  Plus it was packaged in such a way that not even one drop spilled in transit.

The 3-egg breakfast sandwich was tremendous, and made me the awe of the office to boot!  Thinly sliced and tender cured chorizo, scrambled hard eggs (with nice color and browning, just enough cheese.  Stellar!

The Chawiwi Panini - besides being the most fun sounding sandwich imaginable - literally made me pause and close my eyes.  Literal perfect balance of all ingredients.  

Both served on stellar bread, with beautifully seasoned and marinated olives on the side.  

Just awesome.  Can't give 5-stars until I venture up to explore the shop.  But that venture is on the list!
I'm not sure what about the alcohol,  but the sandwiches are fantastic. Everything is fresh. Large portions. Haven't gone wrong with anything I've tried here. Highly recommend.

I've passed this place at least a dozen times while in Hell's Kitchen and had always wanted to go in. Before seeing a movie the other weekend a friend placed me in charge of finding a happy hour. The bar I picked next door was packed to the gills and then we saw a street sign that said $5 beers/wine. Sold. The name of the place confused me. The sign on their shop says in big letters "Beer Cheese". So that's what I figured was the name of the place but it's really "Vintner Wine Market".

Small selection of house wines and beers on tap for $5 but they also have plenty of bottles for a $2 corking fee. Kind of average priced out. Nothing too out of the ordinary and a really decent selection of craft beers. The one thing I didn't like is that the people that work here really push for you to have table side service so that you have to eventually pay a higher tip plus tax. I kind of just wanted to grab a beer, pay for it and can totally bring it to the table myself yet they insist on serving you. But it was all good because my friends also wanted to eat.

The selection of meats and cheeses sold here are also pretty glorious. You can take meat and cheese cuts to go as well as bottles. To keep in mind the beer here is more accurately priced than a lot of delis I find in this neighborhood that will overcharge you for crap like 'Blue Moon'. Get out of here.

There is an actual dining in food menu with tons of salads, sandwiches, paninis, soups, fondue, and cheese plates, etc. The sandwiches come out ENORMOUS so my friend insisted I ate half of his. We had the signature Mozzarella sandwich with tomato, basil, greens, olive oil, and added on prosciutto. It was so fresh and the prosciutto was tastier than I've had at sit down restaurants. My friend's wife went with a fancy grilled cheese that was filled with brie, cheddar, manchego, basil, and tomato. She said it was too cheesy and I immediately phased into 'I have no idea who these people are' mode. Is there truly such a thing as too much cheese?! I tried a bite. It was beyond great. She ordered a salad to make up for it and was happy. I was drunk and started eating marinated olives. I hate olives typically but these were solid. The movie Solo was slightly better than I was honestly expecting (perhaps the beer helped) and I will totally be back to this place sometime soon since I have a friend that lives down the block.

A cute find in Hell's Kitchen before dinner reservations at an Italian restaurant a few doors down.

My friend and I each ordered the $5 house rose for happy hour and shared the fig goat cheese spread; one of the pita dips. If we had more time we would have tried the others. It was so good I went back and purchased a pound of it to take home. This place is reminds me of an upscale bodega. The staff are every welcoming and friendly. Ask as many questions and sample before purchasing.

Will return often knowing it's not far from my office and close to Port Authority.

Same great place, new location.

I really like how they've set this location up. I met some friends here and we sat right in front of the big window. It was awesome.

You can get any kind of beer here that you want (although with all the great choices it was disconcerting to see someone walk out with a 12 pack of Lite). You choose it, they'll bring it over with a glass. Easy, easy.

We ordered the cheddar and ale fondue and it was delicious. Such a great choice. Came with apples, bread and this wonderful salami to dip it in. I highly recommend this dish SO MUCH.

They also have cheese and bread and beer for sale so it's a one-stop-indulgence-shop. I'm all about that.

I've always loved this place and I know you will too. Really nice staff, too!
This place has carries every single beer you can think of. $5 wines by the glass (red, white, rosé, prosecco) and $18 HUGE cheese platter with condiments. What's not to love!

Decided to try and give this place another chance.  That was a mistake!  The same nasty employee, Manager, owner that I dealt with 7 years ago was working and by the way without a mask.  I immediately walked out and won't be back.  

Stay away from this place!

Such a unique spot! VWM probably has one of the best happy hours for beer/wine in HK. We ordered the fondue as well that was $25. This was the only thing I thought was a little steep but it was really flavorful and great size for two people.

Highly recommend if you need a low key spot with great service. Thank you Hector!

Slowest service in NYC, almost feel forgotten at times though. Good prices which makes leaving a negative review unfortunate.
Also purchase minimums should be posted on the door. The Asian waiter isn't the friendliest.
Went here with a friend , great cheese and wine place. Super cheap, highly recommend for a quiet place to hang out and enjoy good company
Great cheese plate to take to a friends. The best part about the place is the service. Unbelievably nice and easy to work with! Highly recommend!!

Racist. Staff only seats white people, bringing them menus, napkins and food. People of color have to order at the counter and do not get napkins unless they're asked for -- again at the counter. I sat myself and stood at the counter waiting to order, while I saw three different parties of white people never having to get up once. A couple of black women were asked to order at the counter. This is especially disappointing as the two men working the shop were Mexican. The food was alright.

I would advise anyone who cares about racial equality to boycott this store.

Ah, this place is very underrated. This review is for their beer and food, as they have many options at many price points available. Their sandwiches are a good size, but we opted for the cheddar ale fondue. It came with a large bowl of warm fondue, cubes of baguette, sliced green apple, and lots and lots of salami. It was $25 and enough to fill two very hungry people, so definitely a great deal! The employees were very kind and the food came out pretty fast. All in all a great low-key place that has a comfortable atmosphere and is not bustling or cramped.

Cheeses are amazing! Service is stellar! I came here for the first time today and just had the best manchego I've had so far. All three cheeses I got were under the recommendation of the owner/staff there and I absolutely loved it, will def come back even though I live at the other side of the town lol

Amazing place, excellent food, the place has a huge menu. I couldn't believe the menu when I saw it. If I was the owner of this place I would change the name so people can actually find it.

I love the outstanding service. Me and my boyfriend used to go there a lot before COVID to sit down. During COVID we would pick up food, and artesanal beers. We love their beer selection. Thanks for a great experience always and also for being open during the pandemic. Me and boyfriend will definitely come back!

What a find, thanks Yelp!!! My favorite night out is a glass of wine and a nice cheese plate and this place did not disappoint. Super chill, not crazy or noisy, friendly service. The cheese plate was super generous and delish, will def be back!

It really does not get any better than Vintner Wine Market (Beer & Cheese). Their prices are reasonable and the selection of beer from the refrigerators is unmatched (except maybe beer culture). Hector is the best server around and is always attentive when we go as a group to eat their delicious sandwiches, fondue and cheese plates - get the fig and goat cheese spread! In addition, they have an excellent selection on tap and very reasonable pricing.

Cozy cafe with fantastic fresh sandwiches, fondue, wine, and cheese. Especially loved the Classic Swiss fondue--best I've had in New York and highly affordable. I've also have had the Mozzarella sandwich, which tasted super fresh.

Would frequent here if I lived in Hell's Kitchen!

The meat and cheese here are to die for!! One bite and you're transported to Europe. Low key and unpretentious little shop. Great spot to catch up with a friend for lunch. Can't wait to try more of their sandwiches! They definitely don't skimp on meat. Plus the olives on the side are delicious.

It looks like a deli from the outside, but oh, how deceiving! This is THE best place with terrific service, fresh food and reasonable prices. How many places can you say that about in NYC? The beer selection is amazing. This is a family owned business. Give the Vintner a try - you'll become a regular.

NBThis place is perfect. Hector will take care of you and knows everything about beer! The food here is divine and seriously amazing. It's a cool place you can just order a nice sandwich or cheese plate, pick out a nice craft beer and just chill. Really sad I have to out of Hell's Kitchen, but will definitely come back. Literally come here once a week.

After trying to contact the owner, through email, leaving messages and social media,  I was told by others that he is busy and "not duty bound for any resolution that I am after". I supposed my messages were filtered through the staff and ultimately lost on the owner.

I'm am not after any "resolution". I am looking for a direct response from the owner over an ugly incident from a drunk patron that was made worse by an inept staff. Unfortunately it looks like what happened is not important enough for the owners to get involved, enough for any type of resposne, or perhaps complaints of this nature from my person aren't worthy. Either way, I'll make sure people are aware of this disgusting behavior and dismissive attitude of the staff and owners.

This quickly became my go to spot for all things wine and liquor when I moved to the neighborhood. After shopping at a few other local places I realized they have much better prices than other shops and a great variety.
Service has always been lovely and I always check out their selection of vintage bar ware and glasses when I stop in.
VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. If you cancel a cookie order, they wont give up on charging you for it. Just be very careful when ordering cookies.

I live in Jersey but stumbled upon this place yesterday when looking for a place to meet my friend while in Hell's Kitchen.

Perfect for drinks, cheese, wine, beer sampling. It is very causal, prices are fair, and the owner is super nice. A great place to sit and chat if you want that low key atmosphere. It's like that cafe that serves tea and coffee along with beer and wine.

I ordered the crab dip platter with pita which was delish!

The "Beer Cheese" part of this market is my favorite spot in all of Manhattan. I'm here at least once a week, because the atmosphere is the best. The cheese is the best. The happy hour wine is the best. And Hector, the best employee I've ever come in contact with in the restaurant industry, is the BEST. Whether you want a fondue dinner, a yummy sandwich at lunch, or a place to hang and drink, this is it.

Not being a fan of beer or wine, I never thought I would come here but I'm glad I did! Thankfully, they have a few ciders to choose from so there was something for me after all. I got a pineapple cider (don't recall the name) which was 12% alcohol but didn't taste like it at all (dangerous!). For food, I got the Turkey Italiano sandwich. It was HUGE so definitely a good value for your money; delicious too! The staff is very courteous and helpful so it's a good choice if you choose to dine in. I'd love to try more of the sandwiches or the fondue!

Solely here to talk about the amazing craft beer selection. Those prices, oh my, especially for this area, oh my. 9 dollar bottle of Goose Island Bourbon Barrel...what? Even with the 2 dollar charge I've heard if for drinking there, that is way less than most other places.

I won't speak of the food as I didn't have but those beer prices...uhhh....WHAT?

Also, for their wine/spirits store next door, nice selection of bourbon/whiskey. I also asked they guy if they had Amarula (a South African Butterscotch flavored cream liqueur (you know you want it from that description) and they noted they'd be getting more of it soon. I don't know of places that sell this stuff and i am quite happy this place does.

Nice people, excellent selection. 5 stars, auto.

A small , inconspicuous market in the heart of Hell's kitchen. This place welcomes you for a quick pint or even hours at a stretch. I was introduced to this gem a few months back by one of my friends and now I visit here regularly. Sit and work here you sip on a variety of beers. They have multiple fully stacked refrigerators with a wide variety of beers which you would usually not find in the city. They do add a charge if you sit there and drink, FYI. The sandwiches here are also good and the portions are fairly good as well. I have, on many occasions, gone here with a group and played board games (self-owned) for hours at length while drinking our beers and wine.

Running late for a gathering. Supposed to bring an appetizer and beer. There is a beer and cheese shop on 9th Avenue en route? Perfect! Except that it took them over 20 minutes to slice a half pound of three meats and ring me up. Then they didn't know how to ring me up properly. And the selection of meats, cheeses and beers was rather limited to boot. So I was much later.

If you're in my shoes, save yourself the time and aggravation and go to grocery store a couple blocks away. You'll probably have better selection and cheaper prices, too...

Excellent 12-7 happy hour with $3 wine/beer and friendly efficient service.

They also make beautiful panini! I have to confess that I wasn't  really hungry so I didn't order one, but here as a pic to make you want to come try their panini. I DEFINITELY will be back to EAT. If I had one criticism, it would be that I'd like them to offer a half size for, say 60% of the full panino price.

This is a very cute little beer shop where you can buy beer by the can or on tap for very reasonable prices. They also have food and cheese platters. Got the three cheese platter for only $20, which also comes with some jam, green apples, and fresh bread from Amy's Bread which is right across the street. This is a great place to simply sit with some friends (or by yourself, you do you) and enjoy a nice drink. Definitely recommend!

They have a sign outside for cold brew, don't make the mistake I did, $5.50 will get you room temperature brew with no ice!!! Never have I got a cold brew served without ice, it also tasted super old and bitter, I already paid when I realized there was no ice in my cup and they refused to rectify the situation just argue with me cold brew from the tap is never served with ice and I should buy ice at the deli on the corner... First and last time here

This place is a great idea but you can't run a business with bad customer service. Was searching for a beer I was looking for and their website said they had it. I called to confirm and the guy said he would hold 2 6-packs for me (after confirming they had it). Showed up later (when I said I would) and they didn't have it.

Holy COWWWW I am in love. I've only had one visit here but this place has already established a place in my heart. This is not really a place I would ever think about stepping into- only because it merely looks like a beer/liquor shop from the outside looking in. The menu is short but I've never had to make a more difficult decision before in my entire life. What I absolutely love is the simplicity of each menu option but the flavors are definitely not lacking. I opted for the prosciutto sandwich after much internal debate and I think this will be my choice of lunch for the next week or two... or three. The prosciutto isn't too salty and its savory flavor is balanced perfectly with the thin layer of fig jam and goat cheese. Heck, I eat found myself nibbling on the olives that it came with- anything to make this sandwich last a little bit longer.
Well, today is currently Monday and I'm counting down the minutes until it's appropriate for me to get lunch because you best believe that I will be running 1.5 avenues down just to get my hands on the prosciutto sandwich again.

I only have positive things to say! One of my go-to places in NYC. Here are my favorite highlights of Vintner Wine Market:

-- the $5 wine special for Happy Hour (12pm-7pm)
-- the cheese plate, delicious
-- build your own craft beer 6-pack
-- the welcoming and kind staff
-- the open-air eating environment

I'm giving this place 5 stars simply because the sandwiches are amazing. At first I felt the turn around time was slow but it was because everything was being prepared simultaneously by one person who was also handling the patrons in the market. He was nice and assured everything would be ready. I had ordered the special which was the salmon sandwich with alfalfa sprouts with a doll spread served on Sullivan Street Bread. I also ordered the Cuban sandwich which came in a gigantic roll. It was the best Cuban I have had compared to the neighboring places in Hells Kitchen. Everything was worth the wait and the taste was on point. I recommend you try the sandwiches. Once you enter the shop you will see the selection of cheeses and wine. They have a great selection of gifts for the chef at heart.
you are not going to find a better beer selection in NYC.  Next time we'll bring some friends and grab a sandwich or two.

We've been coming at least every other week and it always gets better. The food the drinks, are just perfect and most of all, the service is the best we've ever had thanks to Hector. He always welcomes us with a smile, recommends exactly what we are craving for and if that's not enough, he throws in something extra that we end up loving! This is a true gem in all of Manhattan!

This place has a cute little restaurant and an awesome wine market a few doors down. The staff was really nice and told us about the dishes on the menu named after some of their favorite customers. The paninis are unexpectedly awesome and the salads are big and delicious. It sounds like a typical sandwich and soup place, but this place has food with way more pizazz than Panera. Nice drink selection as well.

Manager or owner asked my friend to leave as she searched for her wallet because he wanted her to purchase before searching for wallet. That makes no sense. Threatened to call cops too. Smh. Very unfortunate because I'm sure this could've been handled differently, even asked me to move from the benches in front because they're "private property"..... there was nobody  waiting to sit ... they were wet and said if we didn't move that he'd call the police.

Amazing.  I'm not a big fan of cheese but I now have a new found respect thanks to Vinter.  

Vinter has two storefronts.  One is specifically for wine and the other sells meat, nuts, cheeses and beers.  Somewhat hidden behind the cheese counter are four small tables and a couple of seats at a bar like table against the perimeter of the wall where you can order off their menu.  I suggest heading to Vinter before 6:00 because this place can get crowded quickly and they can comfortably seat about 12 people.  

My friend and I started with the caprese salad-tomato, mozzarella and basil with a hint of olive oil.  We were also given a side of bread.  So delicious!  The mozzarella was so smooth and light and portions were bigger than expected!  We were pretty full from that.  The waiter recommended beer which my friend ordered and I ordered a glass of prosecco.  We also ordered the cheddar and ale fondue.  The waiter's timing was excellent and right when we finished the caprese he brought over the fondue.  Behind the counter you can see the waiter make the fondue in a small pot.  Pretty fantastic since there are only two people working there.  Fondue came with slices of apples, salami and bread.  I highly recommend splitting it if you have a party of at least 3 because there's so much food.  It's not extremely expensive but not cheap either.  

They also have delicious painis, salads and cheese plates.

They have fresh nuts and dried fruit which are sold by the pound.  They are pretty cheap and I happily walked out with a good portion of walnuts for three bucks.

This is my new favorite spot in town. The service is excellent, the cheese selection is on point -and that's coming from a French! Their beer selection is also incredible! I can't recommend this place enough. I can't wait to bring everyone I know here soon.

The spring rolls and Crab Rangoons are good. Service was quick and they were nice.

*Got free Thai Iced tea for the review
Possibly one of the best places you can have Khao Soi, it's full of flavor and just the right amount of spice. Also tried try their Thai iced coffee, it was as good as any you will find in the area.

Great atmosphere, they were playing some 90s jams. Server was very nice. Normal selections on the menu for a Thai place. Food is solid. Tastes great. Nothing mind blowing but an enjoyable meal. The ka pow appetizer was the highlight.

I did get a Thai iced coffee for free for a review

I wouldn't recommend - we've eaten here before - sadly the service has deteriorated and we won't be returning.  

Firstly - appetizers should never come before cocktails.  And when we were asked to order entrees even before we got cocktails ... we noted we prefer to have our drinks first.  

I suppose because we made this request - the entire staff ignored us the rest of our time there.   We couldn't even get someone to take our dinner order.  

So we decide to leave and OBVIOUSLY not leave a tip.  The host had the NERVE to chase us down outside the restaurant asking for a tip.  What a joke!!

With all the other options for Thai on 9th Ave - this kind of customer service won't fly for long.

The Thai food was very delicious and artfully presented.  We had the appetizer platter: spring roll, dumpling, crab ragoon, tofu, and one other item.
My beef Pad Tai was delicious tho noodle could have been less cooked. There was a chicken volcano dish that was also very good.
I am surprised there weren't any lunch specials.

- I had high hopes for this restaurant after seeing pictures of its amazing decor. And while the inside atmosphere is quite magical, it seems like that was the highlight. I ordered the pad Thai and while it was pretty good, there was a solid 15 minutes between everyone else at my table getting their food and when I got mine. I'm not sure if it was an issue with he server forgetting to put it in, or a kitchen backup, but that was the main memory I left with. Having said that, it's definitely worth checking out, I maybe just went on an off-night?

Decent Thai place in the center of the city. Very pleasing aesthetics.

Only tried their pad Thai & pad kee mao and they were both pretty good.

Wished the AC was cranked up a bit higher tho :,)

Not the best Thai food, definitely prefer Pure Thai on 9th. While the ambiance was good (good for young groups) - food was mid we ordered pads see ew and we thought it was rather dry and asked for a sauce to pair with it. Service was very quick we were in an out of the restaurant in 45 minutes.
Delicious food, friendly staff, loved the noodles. will come back for sure ! Got a table right away.

Wow!!!!  Fabulous vibe. Fabulous food. Highly reco. Best Thai. Eclectic atmosphere. Colorful, dark.

Food is fresh, flavorful and very reasonably priced, too.

This is my fav HK Thai place. Beware that there is usually a wait for walk ins during busier times. The inside is colorful and unique. Definitely one of the more interesting ambiance's around, in a good way. The food is always good here. I usually get the pad Thai, but haven't gone wrong between the noodle, rice, and curry dishes. Would recommend!

I got the Pad Kee Mao with shrimp, and it was super tasty! Spicy noodles, but not too spicy. The Thai basil on top added a really great flavor and crunch. It's always annoying when shrimp dishes come out with the tails still on because I hate having to take them off, but other than that, a great dish! They also brought out a side of rice to put in your noodles if you wanted.

The service was great. The food came out really quickly!

Very fun decorations and cool vibes. They played great music too. Low lighting with fun lights!

I've been so curious about this place and I'm glad I finally tried it. They have a very fun interior and is cozy. We got seats right away despite it being peak dinner time. We ordered some chicken wings which were crispy and well flavored. We also got the pad kee-mao with chicken which wasn't too spicy but still so delicious. Their happy menu wine was also a generous pour and we were so happy we caught the end of the happy hour.

This place has really quick service and good prices. The decor is slightly eclectic, but very pretty at the same time. Definitely good for some photo ops.

For entrées, we ordered the kee mao and pineapple fried rice. I really enjoyed the kee mao. I normally order this at almost every Thai restaurant as the first thing I taste there. It was a generous portion, and a good amount of shrimp. But I will say it is not as spicy as I was expecting. Although it was advertised as spicy.
Note: Ordering the spicy sauce on the side means ordering some salty concoction

Pineapple fried rice is very large serving. Yummy

Get the mule!

Decided to order from here a few weeks ago based on the good reviews since my go to was closed that day. Can't speak for the dine in experience, but the delivery was kinda abysmal. I ordered Siamese fried rice and pad see ew. Super basic stuff. The fried rice lacked flavor and was very underwhelming. The pad see ew was the sweetest I've ever had and that's not a good thing. They also used some really old Chinese broccoli in it. The food did not have a single ounce of authenticity. Pretty much like you gave someone that did not have any premise of Thai food a recipe and asked them make it. Also, they used the shallowest possible takeout container and the portion was tiny.

I seldom give a bad review, but I would not waste my money here when there are so many Thai options in the area that actually taste good.

Order: lemongrass pork chop ($22) and beef pad kee mao ($16)

Tldr: Depending on what you order, i think this has been a pretty reasonable lunch location. Worth coming for a date in the future -- solid price, decent dishes, pretty interior. Not quality enough to justify calling it a dinner location tho imo

Atmosphere: decorations are noteworthy! Probably one of the prettiest mid-tier (interior) restaurants ive been to

Service: they'll check up on you quite a bit (at least when the service is slow)

Lemongrass: the fish sauce is on the sweeter side, i prefer it slightly watered down so it isnt as potent

Pork chop itself was bland. Id pass on this given a second chance

Pad kee mao: it was reasonable. Medium spicy is on the slightly spicier side of medium compared to most places imo

The particularly notable aspect of this plate was its basil leafs. You could get the crispy texture which i've never otherwise noticed in other pad kee maos

The thai style fried rice is exceptional! We tried the pineapple one and the pinky one with Thai sausages and both were so delicious.

But I have to reduce a star because the music is so loud. It's like eating in a night club and we eventually had to move to the outdoor area in order to have a conversation. Oh wait, maybe it's a good place you can secretly have in mind to hangout with those chatterboxes whom unfortunately you can't avoid. Yeah, just eat and enjoy your fried rice, because I can't hear anything you say, sorry!

My friend and I stopped by around 5pm on a Saturday after seeing Moulin Rouge on Broadway. We were pleasantly surprised that the restaurant just opened for dinner and even had happy hour. We both ordered the happy hour margarita and some classic entrees, red curry with chicken and pad Kee mao with chicken. The servers were friendly and the food came out fast. The pad Kee mao was spicy and flavorful, just how I like it. I enjoyed my meal and wouldn't mind returning for more happy hour cocktails!

We had passed by this place a few times and finally got to try it out and we were delighted. I have to mention the decor and the ambience of this place. It's off the charts and so eccentric. We got there almost as soon as they opened and the place was already starting to fill up. We opted to have some appetizers and drinks. The fried tofu was insanely good and it came with a phenomenal peanut based sauce. Best tofu I've ever had. The chicken satay was also really good. The drinks were great. The service was amazing and prompt. We had an amazing experience.

Pineapple fried rice was fire! It was really moist and the pineapple was juicy. The pad see ew had good chewiness and the flavor was good but it wasn't my favorite that I've had. The green curry was also good but not my favorite.

The vibes here are unique and fun! I would come back to have a fun meal with friends.

Their bar is our group's favorite and is almost our default 'next place' after a fun brunch. We love their Happy Hour deals, one of the best in Manhattan in fact and the energy and vibe of the place is just happening. At night, it also transitions to like a club-feel.

The last time I was here was the Saturday before Halloween (post my birthday brunch with friends!) so people were in costume and it was even more fun! The lychee martinis were delicious as usual, thanks to Toby, who is like our resident best friend here. We come in and he already knows us and immediately makes our lychee martinis. He also makes the place super welcoming and really fun, love the Thai hospitality and touch all over the place. See you again soon, Viv and Toby! And thanks for the tequila shots last time for my birthday! Highly recommend this place! #ThankfulThursday

Such a great spot for dinner with friends! They have a really cute ambiance and vibe inside with the decor and music. Drinks for happy hour were so yummy and a great deal. All the food we got was delicious. Highly reco the chive pancakes and pad kee mao. Will definitely be returning.

The food at Viv was a little underwhelming. Of the dishes I tried, the pineapple fried rice was not bad. The restaurant is a good vibe for a family-style meal with friends. Cool interior too. Be sure to peep the light up dragon on the ceiling. Our waiter was also very nice!  
Taste: 3/5
Price: 4/5
Aesthetic: 4/5
Service: 5/5

We went to ViV for their happy hour which as of November 2022 is $8 a cocktail during their set happy hour (I believe it runs from 5pm to 7pm but don't quote me on that). $8 for the cocktails they were serving was more than fair. My boyfriend got a lychee martini and I got a mango martini. Both drinks were strong and not too sweet. We also ordered the fried spring rolls which were hot and delicious.

They play EDM/pop music which is great for pregame drinking. This might not be the family sit down restaurant others desire. This is a great place to meet up with friends or to have a 2nd or 3rd date. Service was decent, nothing to write home about but the servers were organized and timely.

I would return here regularly for their happy hour!

Stopped by for a late lunch and was greeted with a smile. The kitchen was about to close for transition yet they made sure our order was in and made fresh. Flavors were there, ingredients authentic and ambience memorable. Great place for lunch or dinner! Check them out. We will be back.

Love the ambiance here! They play great music here and it's super vibey.

It is on the louder end so If you want a peaceful spot, probably not the spot.

Food is amazing too!!

We decided to come here for a work lunch to celebrate my birthday and the overall experience did not disappoint. From the food to the service and the aesthetic of the place, we were all very satisfied as a party of 4. 1 had never tried Thai cuisine and she had great things to say! We had a small issue that we told our waiter not to worry about, just a note for the team, and the server went above and beyond to take care of it. The bartender that heard it was my birthday gave us some complimentary shots which was also a nice surprise! Will definitely come again and recommend to others. Thank you for a great time!
Fun casual Thai food. Meets expectations and I appreciated that all the dishes were not overly sweet!

So this is my first time going to this location.  I remember years ago there was a location on 34th Street next to EWC. So Viv was my thing whenever I had a wax appointment..
Get waxed Then Viv solo date. lol
That's my definition of self care.
Anyway, I took my mom here because she loves Thai, and we work on the UES and of course, we bypassed many Thai restaurants to get to this one.  

It did not disappoint my mother loved it. Also, we were going to see MJ, the musical and Viv, was just a short walking distance from the theater. I would recommend this spot for anyone in a Thai Food mood that's attending any of the Broadway shows.
The service was great.
The ambiance was so cute and cozy.
I loved it.

My food amazing.  My mom and I had the duck with fried rice it was soooo good
My sister got pad thai
i didn't really like it but she loved it
Decent food and great ambiance.  Service was nice and efficient. Got the Rama dish and enjoyed it.

Stumbled upon this place walking through Manhattan. Had great reviews so we stopped by and it did not disappoint.
Ordered sausage, papaya salad, steamed fish, drunken noodles with shrimp - it was a lot for 2 people but we loved everything. Don't try drunken noodles, sausage or The steamed fish if you cannot handle spice. We love spice and that's why we loved everything we ordered.. we will be back
Thai iced with Khao Soi were very good! Atmosphere was nice too. Great place. Promotion ongoing for a free glass of thai iced tea
I had the chicken pad Thai and is was really yummy. I love the decor, especially the dragon. Solid good service

Tables in the back are a little bigger and great for larger parties but the tables I'm the front are a mood. The ambiance at ViV is fun and lively.

Hot music, excellent foot, great cocktails. Definitely worth the trip back for a great meal with friends anytime you want Thai.

Really cute and colorful place with their decorations.

We got the calamari and pad see ew. The calamari was slightly fried which I liked, wasn't overly greasy or battered. Portion size was on the smaller side shared between 2 people. Pad see ew was pretty tasty.

We stopped in around 5:30 pm on a Sunday and we're seated immediately. The atmosphere inside is very cool - the lighting is a lot of fun. Everyone there was incredibly friendly. I think we were welcomed and thanked by everyone inside. The food came out very quick and was excellent! The prices are also incredibly reasonable for NYC.
Great food and service. The pad thai was yummy. The atmosphere is welcoming and the service was except excellent.

So this is a tough one. Went here to eat the night before NYC pride parade with 5 friends. They don't take reservations, even thought they have a Yelp! Waiting List they don't use it, and they wouldn't seat us until our whole party arrived. Fine. We finally get a table and sit down, order 3 appetizer all good. We all order entrees, I got the Cashew King with chicken it was actually pretty good. Well here's where it went south. My friend ordered the Avocado Massaman with chicken on the bone. She thought it had a funny taste, two other people at the table tried it and also thought it had a weird taste. About 5/10 minutes after eating the friend in question violently and u controllably vomited at the dinner table for a good 15 minutes. She couldn't even get up to go to the bathroom. She did not consume any alcohol so it definitley wasn't that, even at drink just ordered a Thai tea. Anyway, the staff didn't know what to do. They gave her a bottle of flat water as if that was going to solve everything. After we asked, they took our friends meal off the check and gave 15% off the check. Honestly, we probably shouldn't have had to pay at all. Over really terrible experience handled very amateur like. None of us will be going back.

Had a really great dinner here the other night while waiting for our Broadway show to start.  We were seated right away and everyone was so friendly. The food was delicious. I got the spicy noodle kee-mao and asked for it mild. Thankfully I did because it still had a little kick to it! We also got the chicken satay as an app and it was also delicious. The music was great and loud and the decor was so fun!  I wish I had more time/could have taken stuff home so I could have tried more.  If you're in the area waiting for a show (or even if you're not) I definitely recommend trying this place!

Really good meal!! The server was super nice and friendly, even gave me a birthday shot of one of their drinks :) I really enjoyed the red curry, and the pad see ew was also good (but have had better). overall I would come again! ambiance also really vibey

Decent Thai food but there's many better options in the area. They give free Thai iced tea for reviews on Yelp and Google...so do what you will with that information. I came with a group of 6 so was able to try quite a few things off the menu.

Phuket Shrimp - Skin on prawns stuffed with chicken. Tamarind dipping sauce had nice flavor but the actual chicken/shrimp was quite tough. 3 prawns per order so we had to order two.
Calamari - Would skip this one, tiny calamari rings with almost no seafood taste. Also had lettuce at the bottom of the serving dish so the portion was much smaller than it looked.
Crispy Duck Salad - Duck was good but once again very small portion. Came with big pieces of lettuce that looked like we had to cut ourselves? Dressing was tart and refreshing.
Red Curry, Pad Thai, Pad See Ew - We decided to go with the safe bet for entrees and ordered typical Thai dishes that would be hard to mess up. These were good but nothing spectacular, all leaning towards the sweet side flavor profile wise. Beef and chicken options were both tender and cooked well.

Overall glad I tried this place but wouldn't be my first choice in Hell's Kitchen.

I'm obsessed with the vibe of this restaurant! You can spot it from down the block- it is an absolute SCENE both inside and out! The exterior decor creates a magical canopy from the restaurant to the outdoor dining area that intrigues passersby to stop in for a glam dining experience.
Once you enter, you're greeted by a giant suspended dragon that lights up and somehow just works with the gaudy, over-the-top interior decoration. There are tables outside, inside by the bar, and towards the back of the restaurant as well, so they can seat a large amount of people. It is usually pretty crowded except for early dinner-time during the week.
The service staff are all super nice and the manager can often be seen serving LEWKS around the bar. Grab a lychee martini and some appetizers while you spill tea with your crew or if you've come for business, any of their entrees will be sure to satisfy you. 10/10 would recommend!
Cool place to go if you're with a group of friends. Their short rib is a must-try. The atmosphere is great and the inside was really unique. They have a good selection of sakes as well
the food and service were great! and they got the spice level right for me. the Thai iced tea is also very good

Looooved this place. My friend and I came here for dinner. We had walked by this place a couple of times and it always caught our eyes - lovely vibes, colorful decor, and people always seemed to be enjoying their meal. Our server was extremely sweet and attentive. The music in the front was a bit loud, but perfect in the back of the restaurant.

- We started off with the Kra-Pow Puff. Very soft, puffy, pastry with the most delicious filling. The sauce it came with it was exquisite and gave it a nice sweet taste.
- For my main course I got the Pad See-Eiw. It was lovely. The noodles were soft and flavorful and the chicken was great. Everything came together really nicely.
- My friend got the Sriracha Noodle. It was really great and really loved the plate itself. However, beware if you don't do well with spicy - it does have a kick!

Overall, this place was lovely. Great vibes, delicious food, and friendly service. Will definitely come back for more.
Loved the basil fried rice. Service was quick and not much to wait. Love the ambiance on Tuesday evening.

A wonderful modern Thai restaurant. We came for a dinner of 4 people and it was pretty busy on Friday night. The environment inside was club with elements of Thai culture. The paper dragon lining the ceiling was fun to look at. Food wise, the appetizers were tasty - definitely recommend the fried chicken puffs! The duck noodles were amazing along with the Panang curry. The one thing is that there wasn't enough white rice that came with the dishes, but we definitely had leftovers!

Their red curry was delicious! The pineapple fried rice was very well presented and tasted great as well! The table size was too small. Me and my wife were struggling to manage in the limited table space! The overall ambience was good.

Omg obsessed!!! Walked in for lunch after the gym and was treated with love HONEY. Sat in the front of the restaurant because the playlist was great! Had a lychee martini to start and ordered the spring rolls and the Kra-pow puff! Spring rolls were nicely sized flavorful with the sauce and not greasy 8/10! Now the puffs were recommended by the waiter now these were a twist on the empanada and oh my was this a hit! Tasted like a chicken cheese steak empanada with a touch of basil... yum 10/10! Now main entrees! We had the pineapple fried rice and the spicy noodle Kee Mao! Pineapple fried rice had a 10/10 presentation but the taste was 6.5/10 for me but I also don't eat pineapple like that and it's regular fried rice but I'm glad it had egg in it. The spicy noodle was spicy but really good flavor I like spicy but this is SPICY! So if you love spice try it if not stay away 8.5/10! Can't wait to come back for those Thai empanadas and try some more things from the menu... but for now IM STUFFED!

everything was great decore is stunning and flavorful with the food to match
the only downfall is the music . not sure if it was because of the day and time but there were a slow jams playlist that filled the room kind of killed the vibe for my partner and i

Came in and got a Fresh Mango tea with tea jelly and tapioca pearls. Didn't try the food.

Place has a couple of seats so you can sit and enjoy your drink and/or food.

Tapioca pearls were a little too soft and I feel like it was a little overpriced. But nevertheless very good.

We tried this place in Manhattan after desperately craving some boba. It was a small spot, with a good amount of seating and a lot of customers.

I tried the 3Q Milk Tea with 0% sweetness. It came with both pearls and egg pudding. I didn't expect there to be two toppings and without adding more sweetness, it was just about right!

I recommend stopping by here if you're near Tomes Square!

I'm speaking about the popcorn chicken especially but the one I got had basically no seasoning and was supposed to be salt and pepper. For $7.50 each the size has definitely decreased despite the changed to boxed packaging.

I guess this is a midtown location so it's pricier but I wish at least there was seasoning.

There's seats here though which is nice to just come by and have a pick me up.

Lots of different options to choose between. You can get either a milk tea or a slush or just regular tea. You also have the option to choose between your add-ins. I went with the strawberry Boba, which was absolutely delicious.

It's made really quick, and you just have to wait a minute or two for it to be made.

I got the Thai tea milk tea with boba. It was very good, although not exactly like the Thai tea I'd get from a restaurant.

Overall, ViVi has many options to choose from and seems like a good boba chain. The location in midtown Manhattan is clean and the staff is fast.

Do yourself a favor and go to another location  the portions here are smaller and the staff are rude. I've been to many vivi locations and this is by far the worst one. Any other location would give you DOUBLE the amount of popcorn chicken. When asked about the amount I was met by a rude staff and told no refunds as if they get this complaint alot

The best bubble tea in NYC

You can walk in and order the usual.

It tastes milky, refreshing, and not too sweet. The tapioca balls are a little soft, but still delicious.

Usually the wait is fine, today, it has taken more 30 minutes for one order of Takoyaki. THIRTY MINUTES.
And I'm the only customer. WTF?
When I questioned the time they said "Sorry". "Sorry" doesn't cut it

I only come here for popcorn chicken and it's always hitting the spot! I highly recommend you order it!

I've also had the rice balls before and they aren't bad but there is just too much rice and not enough of whatever protein you select. It has potential to be great but it's just good and ok.

My order is always the basil or salt/pepper popcorn chicken, taiwanese sausage and shrimp tempura rice ball.

I got bubble tea from here on the first real hot day of this summer, that too after an intense dance class, so I really needed it and it was so refreshing!!!

I got their special signature Coffee Jelly Bubble Milk Tea! I liked the flavor, not too strong of a coffee flavor but also not too mild. I got the small size with 50% sugar level and less ice. I didn't really see a point for the coffee jelly along with the tapioca, because the coffee jelly didn't really add anything, not even that much flavor.

Next time I want to try some of their other special signature drinks as well as the fruit teas. A girl in front of me got the Honeydew Milk Tea and that sounds so good, so want to try that next time!
Our go to place for boba in Hell's Kitchen, and the folks working here are always kind, efficient, and accurate with the orders.

A lot of my friends who went there said they didn't like the place, so when I spent a summer there I felt like I was scared to try it. Because a bad boba, always ruins my mood :p I lived in sf before so all the boba there was always insane so I didn't bother to try it. One day, I was craving boba so bad that I was willing to try whatever and was on a time crunch. So I went to Vivi and I was so pleasantly proven wrong. The boba was great, and I would go again!!! I am excited to try their other flavors :)

Came here because the hubby wanted some bubble tea.  The place ha da great menu selection and was very inviting when you come in.  The people were kind and patient. I love bubble tea a lot and had high expectations for this place. But, when we received our bubble tea it was not very flavorful as we had hoped.  Hopefully they can up their game for when we come back to the city.

Only redeeming factor of this location is the popcorn chicken (but even so other locations put more while this franchise just seems stingy) their bubble teas are pretty good but some of them are kind of mid too. There's this one employee that's always so rude to her customers (she wears her ponytail low) and makes fun of the customers in Chinese and rolls her eyes at customers. I've overheard her multiple times talking trash about customers. But the overall ambiance is good, small and cozy.

Fast and yummy! I used to avoid Vivi unless I was really desperate but now I go at least once a week for the Blue Galaxy, Strawberry Lemon Tea, Taro slush with red beans or a Mango green tea!

The one downside is that their red beans are really hit or miss. I've def gotten a bad batch more than once and complained to them about it.

The inviting scent of sweetness permeates the air, accompanied by the gentle melodies of soft music. The service is attentive and friendly, and the ambiance is cozy and welcoming. After placing your order, you receive a receipt with a number and patiently wait until it is called. As you enjoy your surroundings, your anticipation grows for the delightful treat that is about to come.

This location of Vivis holds many memories for me. I used to always grab a snack and drink here and knew that it would be great as with most Vivis locations. The one thing I enjoyed the most about this location was the vibe. Though you would have to wait out some people to be able to grab a spot to sit this was the perfect location to meet up with my friends and debrief on our day. The seating area was very comfy with the benches having a really nice cushion to them. I was saddened to see on my most recent trip that they have removed the seating area as I remembered it and it really took away from the comforting vibe of the store. Getting your food or drink always takes a bit of time even when they're not too busy but they usually are busy so be prepared to wait a little.

In terms of food, I really enjoy all of their teas and they have a pretty great selection. Their boba pearls are always super fresh and tasty as well. They also have a good selection of food like popcorn chicken, fries, and calamari.

Starting this off, the price is definitely a little too expensive but hey it's worth it for the popcorn chicken. The popcorn chicken was so good, the seaweed salad was delicious but they gave you a really small portion. The rice and egg was eh and the egg roll was pretty tasty. Id suggest just getting the popcorn chicken for $6 instead of the $13 bento box for sure. Also while the pepper and salt flavor was good I preferred my friends basil popcorn chicken! Pro tip: student id gets you a free upgrade from a medium to large drink
My daughter and I have been to Vivi twice so far and enjoyed it both times. The store has a cute vibe. The bubble tea is good and the staff is friendly.

ViVi Bubble Tea is a consistent solid choice for bubble teas & late night munchies. Other tea shops close earlier but this ViVi location stays open late & delivers consistently good drinks & food. I used to carry their rewards card with me & get stamped because I'd go there so often. I've tried lots of tea at ViVi - I prefer their standard "popular" bubble tea (black tea version). I also like the matcha green tea. The "QQ" I tried tonight came with tapioca & lychee jelly - it was very filling & almost too much.
The Kani salad is very affordable & goes well with the teas. I've tried a few other food items on the menu, but I always end up choosing the kani salad.
