As for fruit teas, there are other tea shops that do it better but they also charge more. I keep returning to ViVi simply because of its consistently good quality, decent prices, serves food too & convenient hours.
The service was really bad and the drinks were not impressive... We won't try the second time. It's a pity since we used to like ViVi a lot.
I think this is the best boba I've ever had and the onogiri is just chefs  kiss of you say other wise u have bad taste not an opion just a fact

Not great.

We got the lychee tea and for the price (came out to $7 for one bubble tea), the flavor was flat and didn't really taste like anything.

Wish I had more to say but there really isn't much else. There are other bubble tea places around the block and would recommend going to others

Glad they were open late . Prompt delivery as promised . Ordered from I'Milky and got delivered to wrong address and wouldn't remake my order ..
Ordered black tea with extra tapioca from ViVi ! They came to the rescue ! Can't go wrong with this place :) Happy Boba Drinker :D

I've been to a handful of smaller bubble tea chain stores throughout the city but I was surprised to realize I hadn't been to ViVi before! My girlfriend and I found our way here when she had a particular craving for their chicken of all things! To be fair we had just walked by a picture of it and it did look pretty appetizing.

We walked in around 6:15 on a Friday evening. This particular space wasn't that busy during this time and only had two other parties there. We walked up to the register and ordered their popcorn chicken. They had four different flavors to choose from and we ended up going with the salt and pepper choice.

Overall the chicken was really tasty! Piping hot  and plentiful, we were both able to enjoy a generous portion from the same bag. It comes with two tiny wooden tongs that you're able to pick chicken pieces with. Definitely a great snack to enjoy on the go, or right before having something sweet.

This location however was a little bit dirty. When we decided to sit in and enjoy what we ordered it looked as if they hadn't cleaned the tables in sometime. Seems like they have good options overall but I'd probably only get it to go if I ever visit this specific location again.

I'm happy they deliver! I love Vivi bubble tea in Hoboken and this one was great too!
I ordered the spicy popcorn chicken, basil popcorn chicken and a ginger milk tea with tapioca. Prices are fit. Delivery is quick. Order was correct. Everything arrived hot and drink was cold. Though no ice remained lol. My co-worker ordered the taro milk tea and salt and pepper popcorn chicken.
All of the chicken was delicious and cooked perfect. I didn't taste basil on the basil chicken but it was still good. The spicy popcorn chicken is my favorite. Just the right amount of spice. Crunchy. Tender meat. Definitely recommend! Good portion size too!
The ginger milk tea is made with dairy free milk which I love. I tasted a hint of ginger. It's not a very strong flavor. It was good! I love the tapioca too. Great drink! I usually get the matcha milk tea. Both are excellent!
My only complaint is that none of the chicken was labeled lol. So her and I had to guess which one was which. The only obvious one is the spicy chicken.

So if you drink a little too much Vivi
As in, if you drink as much as Me-me
You'll say within a minute
"Where's the bathroom", then be in it
As you desperately expel your pee-pee.

(and if so, you'll have to go to Sbux across the street)

Very friendly and very busy Vivi store right in the middle of Midtown Manhattan, where things are kind of crazy, but in a good way - unless you want the bathroom.

I came here on a very rainy day a few months ago, and was happy that even in a rude area of a rude-ish town, they were nice to me as I took refuge in here from the downpour. They don't have a bathroom but then neither does your mother. I would know.

And of course it's owned by Vivi-an Leigh, and Vivi-n Diesel. A popular chain in various spots of the USA, and this particular location is a stall in a mall, of sorts.

Their fruit tea options are actually not bad at all. I'm a fan and I appreciate that. I'm not a big fan of the milk tea but then I'm not a big fan of your mother with her clothes on. Besides, the locations that make Brown Sugar Milk Tea make it actually really goodlyishly.

And my fave drinks here include Grapefruit Black Tea and the Mixed Fruit Tea which actually doesn't have any tea in it, but is still yum.

Now let's finish with some rap:

If you are the lock, I have the KEY-VI
If you're Anthony Kaedis, I am the FLEA-VI
And unlike freedom, this isn't the FREE-VI
So try the mixed fruit drink here at VIVI

If you are Edam, I'll be the BRIE-VI
If you're the princess, I must be the PEA-VI
If you want sausage, you know I'll bring the D-VI
But if you want fruit tea, come and try VIVI

I ran here so fast, I blew out the KNEE-VI
It hurt so bad, like the EMERGENCY-VI
But I said no, don't call the EMT-VI
Cause first I want some yummy fruit tea from VIVI
Typical bubble tea shop. Had the same variety or drinks like their sister stores. Took a little bit of a wait to get our tea but that's because they only had 1 person Manning the shop.
They have a wide variety of drinks and food here. The people are nice and fast. Every time I go to New York I never leave without going in!

My favorite tea place in Hell's Kitchen in NY. They stayed open and hopefully will continue to stay open during this difficult time.
I typically try to call my order in advance to speed up the process.

You can't go wrong with viví!! I got taro milk bubble tea with bubbles and it was good! Location is not the best if you are driving. Staff is efficient and definitely one of the better bubble tea spots I've been too!

Interesting flavors of bubble tea. Definitely have your typical flavors but also have atypical ones too like taro with crème brûlée. This is what I tried and it was so out there but in a good way. On the top, it was layered with this creamy substance that had a bit of a salty taste to it. I got it with tapioca and I do recommend it. I want to try some of the other eccentric flavors that they have here.
If you are a student bring your student ID card and you get a discount.

I needed a tea fix and I was walking, hit up Yelp, and it sent me to ViVi! I am so happy that it did. The place has a vintagey feel with a pop of colorful Tokyo. I love the pink outside! As I walked in I was greeted by the friendly cashier and she quickly took my order. I just wanted a simple Matcha no Boba. Nothing too special.

The person making my drink was super friendly as well. I even double checked to make sure I didn't want any other add ons. I've been to my share of tea houses and boba shops, however I have never seen one with an actual robot drink shaker lol. He put my drink into the contraption and it was shaking like crazy. I thought it was pretty cool. The green tea was delicious! exactly what I wanted and fulfilled my craving. I will definitely be returning next time were in NYC.

Unlike my friends, I'm not the biggest fan of bubble tea (#BubbleTeaNotForMe). BUT THEN. I decided...why not give it another shot. I saw grapefruit pulp green tea on their TV menu, and I was like ok that with bubbles in a medium why not (with no sugar). And it was mind-blowingly good. Perfect balance of sweetness and bitter/sweetness from actual chunks of grapefruit. I realized I don't like bubble tea much because I don't like sugary drinks and regular milk teas without sugar are meh. Definitely my go to order from now on... and in a large.

Also, got their popcorn chicken as a snack. I ordered the basil flavor and second time I was mind-blowned that day. They fry the chicken to order so it might take a little time, but it's so worth the wait. Super crunchy and amazing flavor! You bet I'm gonna be trying all the other flavors as well in my next boba run.
I love viví it has really good boba and great service I go there a lot with my friends and it's a good place I recommend passionfruit tea for people who have never had boba before

Pretty solid boba place.

I honestly haven't been to any other ViVi tea so I can't compare this location to the others. However I have had a lot of boba (lmao) and I would say that this place was pretty standard.

I ordered the tiramisu milk tea to spice things up and was pleasantly surprised. The tea flavor was super tasty, and the pudding I got it with complimented the drink well. Didn't actually order boba so I can't comment on the quality, flavor, and texture of that.

Not much place to sit, but there are a few tables to lounge around in. The place also looks pretty standard, not much to rave about.

We also got some veggie dumplings that were super solid. Overall good experience here!

We often order their milk tea in this store, but today I am very disappointed. I ordered a total of 7 cups of bubble tea, 4 cups without pearls and only red beans, but got back 3 cups without pearls, and the red beans in 4 cups were sour, so we opened two cups and gave them all those that had been sour. I asked them to give them a full refund. A boy in their store didn't know whether he was the manager or the boss, his attitude was very bad, and he refused to give me a refund. Everyone commented, if he drank sour, he would give me a refund. No refund and bad attitude,

A small Vivi bubble tea shop right nesr Penn station snd the business of 9th Avenue. The store itself is really tiny and csn pribably only hold 8 people maximum since there is really little space between the entrance and the register. I ordered a classic Vivi bubble milk tea with 70% sugar and no ice. They take card here (no minimum or min number of drinks compared to some other stores).

For my drink -- it has some brown streaking when I got it. Not sure if this was from the bubbles or the sugar, but it didnt go away even after I shook around the drink before I put my straw in. Overall, the tea flavor is pretty good (you can tell its not powder) but it didnt have a lot of sugar even though I asked for 70%. The bubbles were really inconsistent. Some tasted hard, while others were chewy and soft. I cant tell if they were soaked in syrup or not, because it tastes a bit sweet when I chew on one, but tasteless on the inside.

Probably will not get bubbles next time, and stick with just aloe in my fruit teas (my usual drink)!

The drinks here were very good! Being that this was my first east coast boba experience, I'll say that they held their own.

I opted to try their Oreo Creme Brûlée milk tea, and I was not disappointed. It was actually real Creme brûlée as I watched them flame the top of my drink. It was also incredibly tasty.

Wifey ordered the strawberry fruit tea, which was a bit flowery but not over powering as some boba places can be too flowery with their fruit teas. They also did a great job portioning their tapioca.

I'm just not sure how I feel about a boba place that sells food as well lol. Great boba tho!

I wanted to try bubble tea for so long. I'm so glad I got the chance to do it in NYC.

ViVi Bubble Tea is a small grab-and-go bubble tea shop.

All of their flavors look so tasty and I want to try them all!

The boba is perfect texture and each blend is perfectly balanced. A delicious creamy sensation with a nice big straw.

Bubble tea at its finest.

[Intro Disclaimer: As a Toronto foodie, I ventured out to New York for the first time in my life with high expectations and a fully planned itinerary dedicated towards trying all the best foods in New York City!]

Because my boyfriend and I are ALWAYS down for bbt, we came to give this place a try seeing as it was the closest bbt store to our hotel.

I got the Peach pulp tea with tapioca and my boyfriend got the Thai milk tea with tapioca. The flavours of both were pretty good - mine was fruity and refreshing while his was milky and well-steeped. My only note of criticism is that even though we had both asked for 50% sugar level, they both still came back really sweet (too sweet!).

Given that further adjustments to the sugar levels are available, I could definitely see myself coming back and trying Vivi's again with 25% sugar!

Yummy, but pricey bubble tea. I'm from the San Francisco Bay Area and have tried at least over 25 boba places all around California. I give ViVi my stamp of approval for their fruit tea with herb jelly and boba. It's not too sweet, and I usually get a side of edamame to offset my sugar intake. I can definitely see myself as a regular here.

This bubble tea spot has so many options! I like that they use soy milk for their milk teas! I did have to wait a bit for my tea (there were only 2 people working and it seemed like they had a lot of delivery orders), but I didn't mind. They also have food options but I only tried the tea.

Wasn't expecting to see a vivi's bubble tea while walking in Hell's kitchen! I was about to pass by when the picture of fried porcorn chicken caught my eye! I ordered the lemon + pepper fried chicken, since that flavor was the most popular one. Man am I glad I got that! It was the perfect snack and was decently portioned. The shop itself is pretty small but being as it sold bubble tea where most of the customers take out, it wasn't much of an issue. I would recommend trying their snacks if you're not too hungry!
Ordered 3Q Milk tea and it wasn't the same as what I had in the past. The garlic popcorn chicken was extremely salty and didn't look fresh. Left disappointed.

Believe it or not, I came here not for the bubble tea, but for fried chicken. Crazy right?

I ordered the Popcorn Chicken here Salt and Pepper flavored. They took about 15 minutes to prepare and came out fresh out of the fryer. They were very good to my surprise and worth the wait.

The place itself is pretty small and seems like it's always packed with people. The staff behind the counter could be more careful with sanitation as they tend to use the same rag to wipe everything down including the syrup bottles and counter and it's clearly visible to the customers what they're doing to plain sight.

Brace yourselves and teleport to Japan within seconds. This place gives you some serious Japanese vibes. Loved the interiors and a really friendly staff. It was my first time trying bubble tea so I asked the server for suggestions, she suggested the honeydew bubble tea and I got that with an order of Spicy Popcorn Chicken.

Didn't have much expectations from the spicy popcorn chicken but surprisingly, IT WAS THE BOMB! Try it only if you can handle your spice. Perfectly crisp and tasty, a must try! The honeydew bubble tea had the right amount of sweetness which went so well with the popcorn chicken.

They posted that they open at 11 but when i got there at 11:05 they were still not open. They opened few minutes after. Waiting is ok if it wasn't freezing outside. I was the first one to order and expected to be out of there quick and I was wrong. I wanted to get tapioca but they said they weren't available for another 20 minutes. Really? You literally just opened how is it that you're out already. Tapioca is an important ingredient that make this drink bubble tea otherwise it is just tea. I might as well have waited for that tapioca because that's how long it took for them to get my drinks ready. I've been to their other locations all around the city and I've never experience this before.

I can say now that not all ViVi are created equal!  They are definitely my favorite bubble tea providers in the city, but I have been to some where I just feel something is missing. This location doesn't have that problem.  For me I always get one drink and that's the peach green tea.

One of the things I love about their bubble tea syrups, is that they usually have some sort of fruit chunks in them. It's actually my favorite part come to think of it.  So you can imagine my dismay when I go to some locations and there are none.  If I'm ever in midtown though, I'm going to come here for sure.  As you can see in my photo I will post, their are tons of pieces of fruit in their syrup. It's so tasty and peachy!

Price wise, the brand is kind of expensive for sure.  It cost me 5 bucks for one tea, but the flavor made it so worth it!  I highly recommend coming here for consistent delicious bubble tea!

A bit dirty inside, but the workers are really nice. The drinks are also well made. They made a mistake on my order but fixed the situation fast.

They were extremely kind and friendly here. Enough seating for 4 parties of 2.

Absolutely delicious! I had never heard of a Pastrino before and so glad I stopped in. They are delicious wraps filled with breakfast or lunch items. They are toasted or browned on the outside so the cheese melts and everything is just the perfect temperature.

The staff here is awesome!!! Highly recommend and you will thank me and you will be back.

Pros
Great menu
Excellent coffee selection
Good for breakfast or lunch
Clean space and friendly staff
Worth the stop!

Cons
Not a ton of tables so if you are looking to meet a large group night be tough but the Double Tree is attached. You can grab coffee and food and head into the lobby of the double tree for a meeting.

Cute location and very clean inside, but service was LACKING!
If you don't like yr job then get yr ass off the counter! No smile, no how can I help you and my choosing to wrap my umbrella up and carry it is no reason to stare from me to my umbrella and bck to me. I could forgive the dry banana nut bread, but her crappy attitude and customer service, No!
And the cigarette smoke coming in while we dine, guess who?
Mad no name tag, but this is the morning of the 14th!

A great place to pass some time and get some work done while waiting for my train! Free WiFi is fast, the food and coffee was delicious, but best of all, the music playlist on in the background was absolutely banging!

I would definately recommend!
Food: 5/5  |  Service: 5/5  |  Atmosphere: 5/5
The location itself is pretty fast but when it comes to drinks, it's not very accurate. Today for example, ordered an iced latte with oatmilk but saw them make it with regular milk
5/5 Vanilla Latte, would come again. Butchered my name, but it's oki. Nice vibes, fast service.

The missus and I traveled to the Big Apple to take in a play this Saturday. We emerged from Penn Station and decided to grab a bite before the show. A search of Yelp pointed us to Vanilla Gorilla Cafe. A short walk from the train station and we were there. Vanilla Gorilla Cafe was bright inside and I observed seating for about 12 people. The employee behind the counter welcomed us and took our order. I opted for the mocha choca caramel latte and my partner picked the pumpkin spice latte. We also ordered the reuben pastrino and breakfast pastrino. We sat at a high top while waiting for our order. The drinks came out first. The mocha choca caramel latte was rich and delicious. My partner was very pleased with her pumpkin spice latte. Our sandwiches were up a short time later. We traded halves and dug in. The breakfast pastrino had egg, bacon, tomato and aged cheddar. It was delicious and I enjoyed the subtle heat from the sauce. The reuben pastrino consisted of pastrami, sauerkraut, cheese, and thousand island dressing. The pastrami was tender and it was good with the other ingredients and the soft bread. Vanilla Gorilla Cafe job well done.

We needed a good spot for a quick bite before a play, and Vanilla Gorilla fit the bill. It was clean and there were plenty of tables for all of us. The sandwiches were excellent, service was great (attentive, prompt, and friendly), and the pickle slices were delicious! Would definitely return, and would recommend.

Im kinda sad as Im writing this review, that there are NO Vanilla Gorilla Cafes near the D.M.V.  I was determined to get Starbucks before heading to the museums. My friend who is from the Bronx, told me that this place tops, Starbucks in a heartbeat.  I go in, and the whole cafe is a vibe. The sweets displayed and from what I saw online made my jaw dropped. Too bad, I had ate, and wasnt that hungry for sweets. They also have delicious bites and offer breakfast  items too.  They are located a block away from the train station.  My drink was an iced vanilla latte, and im forever hooked. there coffee is 10x than SB. This will be my first pit stop when I arrive in NYC from now on. Service is great. Fast friendly service. Plenty of space to meet friends, or just to chill. Please expand to Maryland :)

Vanilla Gorilla is our weekend treat to ourselves.
We order from here all of the time and love it! Everything has been delicious. The coffee and iced teas are our favorite. I love that there are so many vegan options.

This place was a fantastic find to start the day. Ordered a vanilla latte that was perfect in size and flavor. I also ordered a breakfast pastrino that resembled a croissant burrito. It was as crispy as could be and with the egg and melted cheese, it was heavenly. The side of pickles was the perfect complement to the sandwich.

If you're in the area or not far, try this place. The staff were friendly and there was plenty of space to enjoy a cafecito and a pastry or sandwich.

I have come here so many times; this cafe has great coffee, food, and plenty of seating. The staff is always kind and patient despite the frequent crowds.

I love working from here as the their wifi is free and fast. It gets a bit noisy inside, but if you don't mind, it's a great spot to work from.

Their pastrino's are delicious and super filling! I love the breakfast pastrino. The smoked salmon sandwich is also delicious. Everything is always fresh. A gem!

Overall 3/5 stars!

I had the Iced Matcha Latte with Oatmilk and put a splash of honey in mine. I am a HUGE matcha girl, so I definitely enjoyed my drink, however the oatmilk this time around definitely overpowered the Matcha :( so I definitely wish it had more of a matcha taste to it, but it was still good!

The vibe in the Café was super duper cute & I loved the aesthetic, and the service was beyond great! Our cashier was super friendly, which is always appreciated!

I went here on my way to lunch with a friend and had the passionfruit iced tea it was so fresh and delicious. It had the perfect amount of sugar for me, not too sweet and you could taste the tea.  The space was open, sunny and filled with plants. The music was loud enough for a vibe but not too loud so you could get work done.

I stopped in on a Thursday morning at 10am and it was as if the employees were all still sleeping. Slow service, and it took over 15 minutes for my order for a breakfast sandwich to even make it to the kitchen to be made. When I asked them about it about how long it would take, they just said "it's coming." Peeking into the kitchen 5 mins later, no one had even started making it yet. Mind you, the place was NOT busy. I wont be wasting $15 here again.

My new favorite breakfast place!

The breakfast patrino coupled with an iced hazelnut & honey latte hits the sweet spot. The pastry is like a breakfast taco, but replace the taco with an Indian roti. The result is a delicious and crunchy (and not thick) breakfast meal. It's $12 for an almost foot long sized role, so pretty worth it imo.

Decent amount of seating inside, but it's pretty busy on weekends. Service was good.
Service was outstanding. The frozen coffee was perfect for the hot summer day! The cafe is cozy and inviting.

Pros
Clean
Comfortable seating
In house made pastries
Nice staff
Average price
Quiet

Cons
Blended frappe too icy

I was at the Vanilla Gorilla recently and had an excellent salmon sandwich. This time, I had had lunch at home and was out running errands and only decided on a cup of coffee. The small coffee was about $3.50 and the cup is really much smaller that the standard small paper cup of coffee. This was somewhat disappointing. I realize that the cost of everything has increased but sadly, the smaller size of their cup is really noticeable.
How did they make an almond milk latte taste that good!?!  Amazing. Had a hint of vanilla. Not sweet. Perfect foam. I added an extra shot but it was still smooth. They were so nice. Love it here.

Favorite quick cafe/breakfast spot in the area!! Their breakfast pastrino (imagine a breakfast burrito but replace the tortilla with a croissant inspired wrap) really hits the spot. Their pastrino isn't quite like a croissant but it's still super yummy. When I'm in the city, I come here almost every morning for breakfast since it's so good! Their coffee--specifically, their cold brew--is also pretty good and their sizes tend to be larger than other coffee shops.

Service is also great -- everything comes out pretty quickly and the staff are really nice. The space is also pretty big (definitely bigger than any of the nearby cafes) so it could be a good place to do work.

I was looking for a great cafe to do my work in and Vanilla Gorilla Cafe was perfect. They have a great coffee and tea selection, outlets and the noise levels are perfect if you want to hop on a meeting. The wifi was easy to connect to and the staff was personable

Very nice small place they where very pleasant. I will be back nice vibe neat double tree. Appreciate you acknowledge the military and give discount. Much appreciated from Female Army veteran thank you...

I had the tomato mozzarella pastrino and it deserves 10 stars! So good and made to order.  Went back the next day for an iced caramel latte and just as delicious. Service was prompt. Definitely making one more trip before I leave NYC.

A decent place for a carry out breakfast or lunch and coffee in Hell's Kitchen.

The "pastrino" is the thing here, food-wise. The gimmick is that it's a wrap made from croissant dough. It's tasty, and the fillings are quality, but croissants should be flaky. These are not. It feels like a huge waste of all that butter and calories just to end up with what's basically a tender-but-dense and fatty tortilla.

Pretty good cafe to do work! Free wifi and decent amount of tables (there is one medium sized table for like a party of ~4 so you can do work with your friends!). I sat on the couch area with my friend and it was really comfy and not as loud.

Food is a little pricey but it was yummy! Our drinks came out fast and I enjoyed my iced Americano.

Would bookmark this place for when I want to casually do some work!
The service here is good and the coffee is delicious, there's also a bathroom, comfy seating, and free wifi.

My neighborhood coffee spot is sexier than Starbucks.  The coffee is always on point, but it's the sandwiches that keep me coming back.  I love the salmon sandwich with a vanilla latte with oat milk.  The service is speedy and the ambiance is all about coffee culture, community and computers.  I love it here!

One of my go to places for Too Good To Go orders! Cafe wise, it has a nice vibe with a good amount of seats, some sofas, and free wifi. I usually get their pastries, which can be a little pricey but always taste delicious; I personally like the Chocolate Chip and Blueberry Muffins the most.

Service is always friendly and attentive. Would recommend coming here for a quick bite or a place to sit down for a bit.
Breakfast consisted of a decaf latte, juice and a chocolate chip muffin which was all very good. Employee was friendly, cafe and bathroom was clean. I would go back.
Clean, nice, good food, and good drinks. The service was fast and quality, kind employees. Nice place to sit and work, clean and quiet.

Great spot and good lattes. There is also space to work if you want to break up your work from home routine. They have a delicious variation on your traditional breakfast sandwich called the Pastrino; a creative use of flaky pastry in sandwich form. Check it out!

Love this place! Drinks and pastries were delicious.
Staff were super friendly. Can't wait to come back again to this place.

You have to try it!! Because they've recently come out with a new product! If you love savory breakfast, you must try this Pastrino, there are many different kinds of fillings and a large amount of filling. I've had it once and I can't stop myself to coming back for more! I love Chicken Club Pastrino, the crust is amazing when you bite into it! It's also lightly sweet! The chicken breasts are not too tough, they're filled with salsa, lettuce, tomato, bacon, cheese and pickles, and the cheese is shredded!

[Out-of-Towner Review]

Local versus big box, always...

Every year I stay at the hotel that is about fifty steps away. There is already a great little, local coffee shop on the same street, BUT VGC opens up earlier than that one. BOTH offer great coffee, so I hope this doesn't cannibalize patrons for either coffee shop.

This has obviously been up since 2019 when my last trip was here. I was happy to see it when I drove past it in my taxi to my hotel. I knew it was going to be on my list to visit at some point.

All the early things going on during a work trip, means I need caffeine early and quick. VGC does the trick. I ordered soy lattes with added shots both times, and a zucchini bread loaf too.

I liked it all. The loaf was a little dry, but had decent flavor and was a great option for a quick breakfast on the go. My lattes were great and I was happy to patronage a local coffee shop versus a big box coffee shop.

The atmosphere was well lit and open, welcoming for anyone looking to host a meeting or study. I really wanted to try more of their food menu, because all of it looked really good. But I know I'll be back sooner than later, so it's something I'll look forward too...

Adding local flare to the Times Square area...

Nice atmosphere, great staff, awesome food! Got the breakfast pastries and it was pretty amazing.

Wanted to try the hot honey latte but couldn't bring myself to try it. The vanilla latte was on point!

Will be back this trip.
To all my NJT communities looking for a good breakfast spot into the office.  Don't come here.  You will thank me later

Got two bites into the Poseiden Tuna sandwich when I discovered the "secret recipe" included a spicy sauce that made my mouth and stomach burn. Why wasn't that ingredient/component included in the sandwich's description? Can't be the only person who can no longer tolerate hot sauce, red chiles, etc. Too bad, the ciabatta was really good.
Perfect place for excellent coffee and a breakfast treat! Loved the pastrini and the zucchini bread. Quiet atmosphere too!
This is a great place to grab a small sandwich and a coffee. Ambience is nice, it's clean and close to the intercontinental where I was staying.

Staying at nearby hotel Intercontinental and this is just 3 doors or so down the block to left from hotel
Main entrance. Quick walk and used the Ritual App to order which is a pickup app for restaurants and coffee shops where I accumulate points for my orders. Had a breakfast pastrino for first time-which is a sandwich using a toasted buttery croissant as the wrapper OMG it was so tasty and full of flavor and goodness as soon as I opened the wrapper , it was cut in half and pulled apart with cheese stringing to both sides. Had bacon and real chunky strips of bacon not that basic bits stuff, tomato, white cheddar cheese and scrambled eggs.. you can really tell it was made to order so fresh and warm and got the Signature vanilla latte which was tasty as well. Also packed really good the coffee has Saran Wrap so no spillage and they give hand wipes i have noticed with a lot to go food orders in city. Definitely will be going back while come back when visiting in The area...oh and very efficient pick up and welcoming customer service!!
One of the most delicious savory touch of spicy egg and cheese breakfast bites I have had.  The pastrino is tasty and just the right size!

Forget the Carlos Bakery, forget Au Bon Pain, Vanilla Gorilla is the magical cafe you're looking for!

Caught a quick and tasty coffee with caramel and a savory pastrino (chicken mozzarella, YUM!) before catching a ride to the airport.  The folks at Vanilla Gorilla not only had great food and drink, but they were welcoming and had great character too!  Do New York right, skip the tourist traps and get the really good stuff!

(PS - Bathroom in the cafe! Bonus!)
Stopped by on a whim and was so happy with the service the gentlemen working were phenomenal and the drinks were just as amazing! Highly recommend you stop by

I have been coming here for years (since pre pandemic) and this has been one of my favorite places for breakfast, as they have these croissant wraps that are as delicious as they are unique. However, the reason why I am giving 3 stars is bc the size of these wraps have gotten considerably smaller to the point where they are charging a disproportionate amount more which I think needs to be addressed so that the owners are aware that you are alienating loyal customers that have been there since day 1.

The people here are great and the food comes out within a reasonable time so no worries in that regard. Hopefully things turn around bc I know you guys are busy.
Really great coffee. Roasted in Italy. Superb quality. My go to in the area. Gentleman by the name of Ron was extremely knowledgeable and personable. 5 stars
Great coffee, done the proper coffee way! Really hit the spot for us when we were after a coffee. Two thumbs up!
We had the salmon sandwich and the bananatella sandwich. Both were fantastic. Also, their mocha's and cappuccinos are really good, too.

Unexpectedly good. *Really* good. I had the breakfast wrap and it was amazing. The mocha was rich and smooth. Stopped here because it was close to my hotel and I will definitely be back. Counting the days...

This would easily be 5 stars if we didn't have to pay the vegan tax on everything. It does not cost THAT much more to use vegan ingredients. Even if it did, it is socially-conscious to just price equally and offset with the non-vegan sales. Anyway, the pastrinos were great, but my tomato mozz had too big a ratio of cheese and not enough tomato and basil. The golden chai with oat milk was one of the best lattes I've ever had. (Albeit annoying that the online menu said it came with non-dairy milk but it really didn't so I had to pay extra.)
Great coffee nice place really chill, ambience and a lot of nondairy options for the drinks. I will definitely be coming back the next time I'm in New York.
Great pizza.    You should try it.  Only 1.50 per slice for slice.  Nice staff working there.

My family and I had a fantastic evening at this Italian restaurant. The place had a genuine Italian vibe, and we loved it. We chose to sit in their cozy backyard section since the weather was nice, and it was a pleasant change from the usual street-side seating.

The kids had a blast outside, and the food was a hit! The fried calamari, watermelon salad, and pasta were all delicious. I highly recommend trying them.

What impressed us most was the excellent service and the fact that the restaurant wasn't overcrowded. We could enjoy our meal without feeling rushed.

In short, this place is a great spot for a taste of Italy with your family. We had a wonderful time, and we'll definitely be coming back.
Great authentic food. Fast service, owner was warm, cordial attentive. Small & intimate atmosphere. A fine nyc gem.

My friend and I came here for dinner last night. We arrived for an early dinner and we were seated right away. The interior is quite dark, but had decent lighting. The service was good and attentive during our meal. We each ordered the fiore blanco which was pretty good, but they had these odd lights at the bottom of the drinks and we weren't quite sure of the purpose or if it was just for presentation. For food, we ordered the watermelon salad to share and then I got the fettuccine Alfredo and my friend ordered the hanger steak. We also ordered the chocolate mousse to share, which was probably my favorite dish of the night. The salad and entrees were perfectly fine, but nothing to write home about. I don't think I'd come here again, unfortunately.

To celebrate my mother-in-law's 80th birthday, we ventured into the bustling city of New York to watch the MJ play, followed by a dinner reservation at Via Toscana located at 344 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019. Nestled in the heart of the Theater District, Midtown West, and Hell's Kitchen, this restaurant proved to be an excellent choice for our special occasion.

As we entered, we were warmly welcomed by the chef and owner, Andrea Della Pina, who personally greeted all 17 of us. Right from the start, Andrea and his attentive staff made us feel like an extended part of their family. It was a delightful beginning to our dining experience.

The drinks and appetizers were an absolute delight, leaving us eager for what was to come. With such a large group, we ordered a variety of dishes, and each one surpassed our expectations. The flavors were simply divine, leaving every single person at our table raving about the mouthwatering taste. What made it even more satisfying was that the meals were reasonably priced, offering excellent value for our money.

The impeccable service and the delectable food truly impressed us, making Via Toscana a restaurant we wholeheartedly recommend. It provided us with an amazing dining experience that added to the joyous celebration of our loved one's milestone birthday. Whether you're seeking a place to gather with family or friends, or simply craving an exceptional meal, this remarkable restaurant is sure to leave a lasting impression.

What a lucky find. A great place for pre or post theater. Or dinner. Or late night cocktails. Perfectly situated close to the theater district but on fifty second street so it's not overrun and you kind of have to know it's there. A gorgeous restaurant/ wine bar owned by the most lovely gentleman from Italy who oversees the delicious menu and beautiful and inventive bar. So many interesting wines and liquers. Everything we had, from drinks to dinner to dessert, was excellent. It's such a great place to hang out. If you are out with a bunch of friends I can't imagine a more friendly, welcoming and comfortable place than here. Drinks, tapas, pizza, dinner or snacks. I hope everyone  discovers it because I  want it so succeed so I can keep going back.

Fantastic food, great service, terrific chef.  Nice atmosphere.  I live in NYC and  love Italian food.  I'm so excited that I found this place which I'll be going back to again and again.  

My friends and I had the Ceaser's Salad, fried calamari -- both terrific appetizers.  For entrees we had pasta bolognese, pasta with mushroom truffle and hanger steak with truffle sauce.  Every single dish was outstanding.  Cocktails were good too.  Did not have time for dessert.

Do not hesitate.  it's delicious.
Andreas was an amazing host. The food was amazing.  Authentic Italian food with amazing ambiance.

I discovered this place with of my Italian friends from Massa Carrara. I love the authenticity of the Italian taste of chef Alessandro dishes e manager Andrea's welcoming demeanor. I go to Tuscany every and I miss the taste of Italy when I return but Via Toscana takes magically takes me there with every bite.
Love this place! The service and Isaiah the bartender and the owner Andrea are amazing. The food is unbeatable. You will not be disappointed!! Way better than many spots I've been to in the city

Amazing food !!

The Arancini and Black Truffle Pasta are too die for !

Very relaxed and fancy ambiance !

I love how the chef comes out to your table to mix your pasta and shred the black truffle directly over the pasta, incredible service !

ViceVersa is in a great location, has a nice interior, great table service, and pretty good italian food.

They start us off with as much sourdough and focaccia as we like. The sourdough was pretty good but the focaccia was fantastic.

I had the gnocchi with mushrooms garlic sauce and a fondue to top it off. The presentation was very nice and they drizzled the sauce on top tableside. The leftover fondue was left at the table for extra cheesiness if you care for it. The gnocchi was cooked perfectly, nice and pillowy. The mushrooms were sautéed with some butter and had a nice crisp that was delightful. The dish was slightly on the saltier side however.

The lasagnas verde bolognese is not your traditional lasagna, but still good in its own right. The spinach pasta was a nice twist and worked well with the bolognese which was meaty with a nice tomato creaminess. The cheese tied it together for a great bite the presentation was lacking as the lasagna started sliding apart. I also felt like this dish needed a side of some sort.

The duck ragu pasta was the most lacking dish. It was a bit salty and lacking in amount of duck. The homemade pasta was great and cooked perfectly though.

For the price, its definitely a nice choice for good italian food in the area before catching a show at lincoln center.

I come here once a year with my husband and we've made it our special little date night spot in the fall. The entrees change but we always get the arancini (rice balls) and the meat balls as appetizers, wow incredible. The entrees are hit or miss though and we're not typically excited for the desserts, nothing mind blowing to choose from. The staff are very professional and friendly and they always ask if you're heading to a show afterwards.

In search of a new pre-theater restaurant, we stumbled upon ViceVersa! This place is a hidden gem and stands on its own against any Italian restaurant in the city!

To start, we had the arancini and shrimp salad special. Really enjoyed the black truffle in the arancini, and the shrimp salad was the perfect fresh dish to start the meal with!

For my entree, I had the cacio e Pepe which was quite possibly the best cacio e Pepe I've ever had. I think tonnarelli may have become my favorite pasta type! Some of the best texture of pasta I've tried, and the cacio e Pepe flavors were subtle yet satisfied the tastebuds.

Probably we'll accustomed to all the pre-show guests, we were also in and out in an efficient manner without feeling super rushed. A great choice for a night out in Hell's Kitchen or before a show!

Yelp, Eater and a couple other food news missives that I get started sending me 'places to eat before the theatre' . We didn't want a touristy spot, but we also wanted to stay within walking distance! We wanted Italian and then Indian...so, first up was ViceVersa which had great reviews but we found it lackluster...the pasta was limited and most entrees were white...I'm not a white sauce fan. We started with Arancini and found it to be pretty blah. Accompanied with cocktails which tasted terrible, my bees knees tasted like a lemon spritzer...

Each of us decided on a different pasta dish to get a rounded taste, Potato Gnocchi w/Porcino Mushrooms, Simple thick pasta with a Romano cheese, and a duck ragout pasta. All 3 of the pastas were well past al-dente and soggy soft. The best sauce flavor was the duck.

We 3 shared 2 desserts, a lemon creme brulee which was just ok, and a delicious sour cherry panne cotta.

For what we paid, and a celebratory mini vacay with my daughters, we were underwhelmed. The restaurant is gorgeous though.

Looks small from the outside, but is spacious and comfortable.  The food and cocktails are all quite good.  I went for a birthday dinner,  so I cannot speak to what is available on the full menu, but all of the passed appetizers and dinner were well prepared and delicious. Mini pizzas, sliders, polenta w mushrooms....mmmm.
Farfalle w lobster was well repared and so delicious as was the swordfish with spinach.  This is not too far from the theater district and would be a nice option for a pre theater meal. The service, including the bartender, maitre'd etc were all friendly and accomodating.

Def commend for a quick, inexpensive, pre-theatre meal.

We ended up here after making a reservation and the restaurant giving away our table. We walked in and I think the host could see the fear in my eyes that we now had less than 90 minutes to sit, eat, pay and walk the 2 blocks to the theatre. They sat us outside, it was a beautiful night and advised us not to order a few things, because they take a long time to make.

There was 3 of us, we all had pasta (cacio, gnocci and ravioli) and we all really liked our meals. None of us finished the whole bowl so the portions were a nice size. We also did start with burrata and rice balls for the table.

We skipped the dessert and made it to the theatre on time.

ViceVersa is a charming Italian restaurant on 51th Street in the garden level of a lovely building. This block has the potential to be a smaller Restaurant Row, with Ippudo anchoring the northeast side, Dolly Varden across the street, and Uogashi further down. I see a lot of potential on this cozy, quiet street.

A quick note about happy hour: glasses of wine and house cocktails are half off from 4-8 PM, provided you sit on the bar side, rather than the restaurant side. I think beer might also qualify for happy hour but I didn't see the "fine print" anywhere so go ahead and ask. This is a very good deal for midtown and reminiscent of Hell's Kitchen's pre-pandemic glory days.

My girlfriend and I were celebrating a special occasion. We started on the bar side for cocktails then hopped over to a table for dinner. Complimentary bread was so good we almost asked for a second basket; thankfully we did not as the pasta portions were large.

The grilled octopus appetizer consists of a delicious tentacle served with fresh micro-greens and a potato/red pepper salad. Bursting with flavor and grilled just right. This starter was surprisingly light and established a good mood that would last the rest of the meal.

Any time a restaurant boasts about their house-made pasta, I want to put it to the test. The gnocchi receives high marks; I might have liked the pasta texture to be a little firmer. Also could have done with more mushrooms. The casoncelli was an experience, a ravioli-type dish somewhere between a dumpling and cinnamon toast, topped with sensationally succulent fried pancetta chunks. The flavor profile is out there but if you've got an inquisitive palate this is a good dish for you.

Too full for dessert! We finished off our bottle of chianti and paid the bill. Prices are normal for good-quality sit-down Italian food in this part of the city. The decor is also quite nice and the service was polite. I could see myself eating here again.

Really good pasta, just ok apps and drinks. We came on a Sunday night at 6 and it wasn't busy at all. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. Definitely a little bit on the higher end of prices but considering the area it isn't terrible. They have half off drinks till 8pm which is awesome but the drinks were not worth the original price anyway.

We ordered the arancini, the tonnarelli cacio e pepe and the sedanini di spinaci, prosciutto e piselli. They gave us complimentary focaccia with butter which was nice but weird that it was butter instead of olive oil.

The arancini was a great texture but they sold the flavor as truffle which I didn't taste at all. It tasted just like paprika to me. My spinach pasta dish was amazinggg. You could actually taste the spinach in the pasta and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente and gripped the cream sauce really well. The peas and prosciutto in it added a nice contrast in flavor and texture. My friend loves her cacio e pepe.
Beautiful decor,  great service, fun happy hour.  Highly recommend if your are in the neighborhood

ViceVersa had always been a spot I had my eye on. So glad I finally got to try it!! This place was SCRUMPtious!!!! It was about 5-6 on a Saturday night, happy hour was until 8pm. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar to hide the fact that we were considerably underdressed. Leave it to us to go out to in sweats..Boy did we NOT fit in. Anywho! We had an awesome bartender who made great recommendations. We had the Black Truffle Arancini, meatballs and a Burrata for appetizers. The main entree were Tonnarelli chicken and shrimp. Desert was Tiramisu and Crème Brûlée,!which were soooo good!! I've been literally craving the arancini!!! Drinks were also the perfect balance of taste and strength. I will be back!

Thank you!

Strange Italian restaurant nestled down 51st st - the Italian restaurant is staffed with Indian servers and Russian accent pieces inside the restaurant. The burrata was lacking in flavor and not very gooey. The gnocchi sauce was too rich and overpowering and our table of 2 could only finish half the dish - $50 for these 2 dishes
Good food and service. Not wow but solidly good food. Had the short ribs - good flavor. I do think the starters could be improved - just wanted a salad to start but nope. Good wine selection.

Came here on a Tuesday night and immediately upon entry, it seems like a nice and fancy place. I actually live about a block away and didn't notice these small restaurants tucked in and away within the neighborhoods.

The service here is excellent, they're quick and courteous. I didn't eat anything, just ordered a drink while joining all of my friends during their meals. The food did look good though.

Ordered the cucumber martini and its greeness in a martini glass had everyone thinking I ordered an appletini instead. I don't care, I'm not ashamed!

This is a nice place for a small group of friends to have an intimate dinner, or a nice intimate and fancy place for a date.

Celebrated a special occasion here upon recommendation from someone who knows how much I love Italian food, and I am happy to say ViceVersa did not disappoint! This is a super cute restaurant, especially for dates. Def try to ask for a table in the outdoor garden in the back! There's plenty of seating in the restaurant (ambience is great and so cozy), but the garden is v sweet and intimate.

The wine menu is extensive and there are definitely loads of delicious dishes for dinner -- would recommend the pumpkin ravioli and the salmon (the mashed potatoes w/ the salmon was diviiiiine). The bread (I'm pretty sure it was focaccia) was also delicious.

Our server was super attentive with refilling our wine/water glasses, and one of the owners of this restaurant came by to see how we were enjoying our meal as well (super sweet)! We were too full for dessert, but would def love to return to try!

5 stars for this neighborhood and the stellar staff!
This is close enough to the August Wilson Theater to be a go-to pre-theater option.
Generous pours on the cocktails - we enjoyed the Negronis and Aperol Spritz.
We had decided to share two appetizers and a pasta (for the main course). Without even asking, they did a beautiful job splitting our salad and pasta.
I was excited to see the Vitello Tonnato on the menu. While we did enjoy it, I felt it was a bit over-sauced. Of course, they gave us two types of bread and we sopped up the sauce anyway.
We read they're known for making their own pasta. Our server recommended the Strozzapreti Alla Anatra e Olive di Gaeta and he steered us in the right direction. It was delicious.

This is a good pre-theater restaurant. They are efficient and attentive, get you in and out for your show and the food is quite yummy. We had the cacio e pepi and the scallops and both were quite tasty.

I came here for happy hour which is from 5-8.  Drinks were half off.  I got a Negroni which was slightly sweet and strong.  The bartender was really nice and attentive.  I didn't try any of the food but the dinner menu looked good.

Amazing cucumber cocktail.  Arancini was awesome!!! Gnocchi was excellent. Highly recommend ducking in here before seeing a show.  We were in and out fast bc we didn't realize the show began at 7 on Thursdays.  We had a 6PM reservation and still made it to the show in time for curtain call. Excellent staff!!!

Well-lit, comfortable space in Manhattan.   Service was polite and professional - we very much appreciated the plating of our shared pasta dinner which was wonderfully rich.  Delicious homemade focaccia and fresh salads rounded out a very pleasant meal, and a great value.

We tend to favor French over Italian, so this was a delightful surprise that we enjoyed very much.

I came here for brunch on a Sunday at noon. Curiously enough, there was only one other party in the restaurant before my friend and I arrived.

The garden area was so pretty- it's a nice surprise to see this in the middle of Hells Kitchen. It doesn't seem like a very touristy spot at all.

I feel that this place deserves closer to a 3.5. I ordered the poached eggs with jumbo lump crab cake and hollandaise sauce. I also got one mimosa (they do have an interesting deal where you can get unlimited mimosas, bellinis, or bloody Mary's for 2 hours at just $18. If I weren't so hungover I would have wanted that). While there wasn't anything particularly wrong with the food (eggs were runny, salad was dressed, temperature was ok) I didn't think that there was anything particularly special. The crab cake could have more crab chunks, the slice of not crispy toast below the eggs added little value. It kinda needed something else to give it some oomph. Not dying to return anytime soon.
Service and food decent ! Walked in and was able to get a table! They were very attentive especially if you had theater tickets ! It seemed like alot of regulars go here
so good definitely recommend. arancini con tartufo nero di stagione, fontina valle d`aosta.

We had reservations at the restaurant but needed to stay in. So we canceled the reservations and ordered delivery. Their online process was very smooth and the food was absolutely delicious. Food arrived hot and salad cool. Cacio e pepe, Lasagna verde, and the beet salad were all lovely, and all after being delivered. I can only imagine what the food must be like fresh from the kitchen. Very reasonable prices and good portions that are plenty satisfying but not overlarge to the point of overindulgence. We hope to visit in person. Recommend!

Some of the best Italian food I've ever had paired with one of the tastiest martinis I've ever had. I got their special but I don't recall the name. All I know is it was creamy and came with table side shaved truffle! My friend got the lasagna and another got the gnocchi which all were incredible!
Great Italian insperiate food. Not a lot but the food is very rich and filling.

I've only come to this bougie place twice in my life but man the experience was amazing both times. The pasta with duck is a crowd-pleaser in my family and a good dish for beginners. I tried the cacio e Pepe and I questioned whether it was worth $27 for pasta with cheese; but it tasted decent. The gnocchi is delicious as well. Although the menu is limited, there is a lot of flavor in each dish. Note that this is much fancier than your average Italian restaurant (not a lot for picky eaters). My only complaint is that I wish the menu gave a better description of the food, or there were photos. Both times, I ordered dishes I wasn't in love with and ended up eating off of other peoples' dishes.

Don't mis this LGTBQ+ friendly place. Very, very food food and drinks. Excellent wine selections . Very close to the theaters. Had such a great evening, we went back for quiet drinks at the bar a few other evenings. .

Great food and service. Had the burrata, gnocchi, lemoncello (home made) and the lemoncello crème brûlée. All of the food my table ordered looked very well prepared. Everyone in our party was more than happy.

This was such a cute spot and definitely a hidden gem in Hell's Kitchen. Me and my friend came in here for lunch during restaurant week. It was $26 for an appetizer and entree.

I had the eggplant appetizer. It was thinly sliced eggplant filled with ricotta with cheese baked on top on a bed of roasted veggies. I loved it! It was a good sized portion and wasn't too filling. It was full of flavor and I would definitely order it again.

For my entree, I had the chicken milanese. It was simple, but delicious. It was a large piece of chicken that was perfectly crisped and served with greens and tomatoes. There was a light lemon dressing that was refreshing and full of citrus flavor. It was a great lunch entree!

We sat outside in the back patio. There were cool plants and vines all around. It was quiet and it was nice to be able to sit outside. If it isn't too hot, definitely ask to sit outside! I will definitely be back here, maybe for dinner next time!

Don't let the lack of "curb appeal" stop you from going to this restaurant.  It is a gem of an Italian place. For those that have gone to good and great Italian places, you know getting house made tube shaped pasta is rare.  It is labor intensive and they are usually making many other pastas.  The menu when we were there had 2 dishes with house made tube shaped pasta. Soooo good.  That said,  my dish with the slow roasted Long Island duck was most excellent.  

We had appetizers and half orders of pasta entrees before a show.  It was the perfect amount of food, especially if you try to manage carb intake.  If you like olives, try the meat stuffed olives. They were excellent.

We ate here on a Sunday evening for dinner, so no specials.  The food was very good, my dish was creamy with plenty of prosciutto.  No real kids menu  so my kids ate the lasagna, my son's finished the meal but it was too much for my youngest.  Not sure why they didn't accommodate a smaller portion for kids.  Overall the wine was good and the food was good too

This place was very tasty. The ambiance was very relaxing - the lights were not super bright, but you could see to eat, and the music was soft and low. We both ordered drinks, wine and a cocktail. I had the ginger pear martini, and it was one of the best cocktails I've ever had! It was very well balanced and not too sweet.

For appetizers, we ordered the arancini and mozzarella di bufala. The arancini was warm and super delicious. The mozzarella was the best we have had since we visited Italy! It was so much more flavorful than the mozzarella you typically get in the US.

For dinner we ordered the appetizer size of garganelli Verdi and the short rib. Both dishes were tasty. The short ribs were simple, but is definitely reminiscent of Italian culture, where they do fresh ingredients well. The garganelli was to die for. I was so full but couldn't stop eating! It had prosciutto and a fondue made with grana padano. It also had peas, which helped to cut the richness in the dish.

The only part that was less than amazing was that we had a late reservation and near the end of the meal they started cleaning and we felt a little rushed to leave. Otherwise the visit was amazing and we would definitely return!

One of my favotite Italian places in the Theater District. Lovely, white tablecloth atmosphere with reasonable table spacing. I love the appetizers and the "strangled priest" pasta. Prices are reasonable for the good quality. Just wish that the servers were a little more personable.

After sharing a lovely salad with avocado and heart of palm, then Tonarelli Cacio e Pepe, a thick cut spaghetti with pepper, I thoroughly enjoy the Halibut with Spinach, as good a piece of fish that I have had.
I have found that at most "good"restaurants in New York, the menus taste better than the food they describe.....not so here.
In addition, the atmosphere, service and cocktails were all first class.
I shall definitely return!

$19 gets you...half of a small burrata.  Other half goes to another table I guess..  Not sure if I have ever been served half of a burrata before.  That is a new one.  Cacio y pepe lacked the pepe.  Otherwise good.

One of the better Italian places around here! The grilled octopus appetizer is a must - I've never had octopus so soft and The strozzapreti is also an absolute must - some of the best pasta I have ever had. Lump crab spaghetti was only okay--will probably skip next time. Same for the bufala mozzarella appetizer - it was ok but only came with 3 small pieces for $15, so would probably skip that next time as well.

Average expensive food.  Convenient for theatre district. Our calamari appetizer had no pizzazz. Ravioli entree was swimming in oil/butter and cooked harder than al denté. Swordfish entree- fish cooked well over vegetables but no interesting seasoning or flavors. Will not return.
Decent-Good food at a good price point. A few odd combinations however. Great interior, but probably wouldn't come back.

Loved our meal here. Based at least on our first visit, we agreed that Vice Versa is much nicer than the typical theater district/hell's kitchen Italian restaurant, and I dare say a good value too.

The food: Pastas were outstanding. Not only all made in house, but treated with care, cooked al dente and not oversauced. Breads and vegetable sides were equally first rate and tasted of a chef who knows what he's doing and cares about the little things.

The service: Quiet and refined. Definitely a cut above the typical pre-theater restaurant. Friendly, indulgent, and efficient but not rushed.

The atmosphere: Lovely! Sophisticated, a little upscale, not cramped.

The extras: A beautiful bread basket, cookies with your coffee or check. Lovely experience. We'll definitely return.

My family and I went for dinner yesterday before a show.  It was such a great choice.  The food was fantastic and the service was perfect.  The cocktails were delicious too.  Every single dish was fantastic - the meatball app, the rice ball app, the only thing not great was the grilled octopus app (it needed more flavor).  The entrees were amazing, I had the veal ravioli and it was delicious.  But 2 people at the table had the veal chop and that was beyond delicious!  The whole experience was FANTASTIC!

I had the kind of meal here that was seroiusly so good that I keep thinking about it day's later.
The cocktails are generous and well served. The bread, many of the pastas, and desserts are made in house. The entries were both eclectic and exquisitely prepared. The service is top notch and very attentive. Stefano the chef runs a top rate kitchen and still has the time to go table to table and ask if the meal is OK. Franco the co-owner and dining room manager is wonderfully friendly and professional. Vice Versa will remain one of my favorites and among my top three picks to dine in NYC!

This is the best Italian food I've had for this entire year. The server recommended two very good pasta. The starter "eggplant" is super good. I forgot the name of the pasta we ordered. But one is with duck meat and one is a dumpling liked pasta with bacon. They are both very taste and worth the price.

Spacious, airy restaurant tucked in Hell's Kitchen with a menu that looks good but unfortunately falls short on execution. Average experience that was worsened with friendly but slow service. Perhaps lunch during during working hours wasn't a good idea. Hopefully the food pleases those looking for calories and not flavor and hopefully the service is better for those who don't need to be somewhere.
A wonderful fine in NYC near the Theater district good service and food- I recommend the veal and cookies for dessert !

Cute, nicely decorated for the holidays, had a romantic feel to it.  The service was excellent, water and wine poured timely; food timed appropriately between servings and timely delivery of check.  Never pushy or rushed.  And then the food was outstanding!  We shared an appetizer of calamari and a pasta dish, cacio e pepe; which they nicely split for us without asking them to do so.  I had the branzino and my husband had the veal cutlet.  We both thoroughly enjoyed it.  I can't imagine why anyone would give this place a negative review.  Was it cheap?  No, but it was reasonably priced for what you got, in NYC.  We will be back!

Great place great food. The menu is authentic Italian and the selection is absolutely fantastic. The decor is really, really nice and the premises are kept immaculate . I was seating at the bar with a friend for cocktails plus some small dishes. The reason for the missing star are the bar attendant who could have been more professional and the smell that at times we could detect (which reminded me of bathroom cleaning products) . Over all a great place that I will recommend.

Hopped in for a quick dinner with my girlfriend on a Monday night. The place was half empty but cozy nonetheless. Nice ambiance with warm lights indoors; they also have an outdoor seating area. We both had a large plate of Casoncelli alla Bergamasca (9 pieces) and it was delicious!! Rich flavor, very filling but not overwhleming. The service was quick and efficient. I'll be back to try more items on the menu!

Stumbled upon this incredibly special Italian eatery in Hell's Kitchen and was wowed beyond belief!  Everything had unique flavor pairings from the cocktails to the dessert and included the highest quality ingredients. The pasta was homemade and rightly served al dente!  The chef came out to greet the table next to us; they seemed to be regulars, and I can see why. This is a true find among so many Italian places in the City!

I came during restaurant week and I am really satisfied with the food and the quality. The trenette is really delicious and the cake is the best pistachio cake I ever hade. The restaurant is quite and nice. I enjoyed my dinner there

I really don't understand the low rated reviews. Sure you can get a slice of pizza on the street to go for a dollar......but my experience is you get what you pay for. There are many choices here from stromboli to pizza to deli and wings. They serve beer, wine, soda etc...

I ordered a spinach stromboli and eggplant. The wife got a slice of pizza.  Everything was tasty! The restaraunt was clean and we'll lighted. Service was courteous and efficient.

I grabbed a pepperoni stromboli to go and a Danish for breakfast. Great place and I will definitely be back.

Yeah, so about this place.....

I'm honestly wondering how this place has survived after nearly 20+ years here. How in the world is this still around? Guess no one was ambitious enough to build a competitive pizzeria in port authority.

With that said, there isn't much in the way of real estate for appetizing dining in port authority. Thing is that a 15-20 minute window might leave you with no choice but to grab a slice from here. 2 bros is a couple blocks away, but you're cutting close between grabbing some slices and running down or up to your gates. Especially true if you have large bags. Rainy days don't help either. That's probably the only reasons I ended up eating here historically. If you have 30 mins of gap before catching a bus, head to 2 bros 2 blocks away.

Pizza here is overpriced and you're often stuck with pizza that's been stuck outside for a while. No amount of reheating can save mediocre pizza. If Dunkin or au bon pajn or anything else can fill you up, go there instead.
This restaurant had very good servicee, and the food tasted very delicious the prices

I hate doing this because its so hard to mess up on such an iconic American staple such as pizza, but this place was able to do it.  I mean, it really is nearly impossible to screw up.  They delivered and do so repeatedly when it comes to messing up.  Their pizza is not that great.  It is very flavorless and the bread is just thick and hard.  It is not appetizing to eat at all.  Its just an unpleasant exercise for the mouth to go through.  I'd rather use it for something else.

Not sure if the staff is to blame, or management, or even the chef.  This being the Port Authority, expect a lot of homeless and suspicious characters to be wondering around.  They need to make drastic changes to stay in business.  Every time i come in, it is like clockwork and never fails to deliver on being a disappointment.  On top of that, it is extremely expensive and the seating area is sooooo uncleanly.  It screams "bring a disease home".  Keep in mind, this is pre-COVID.  I can only imagine what it is like now.  I won't ever be returning to this place again no matter how bad i want salty food.  No way, no how!

I received a badge for checking in here before realizing that it was for trying a really low-rated place. I was hungry by Port Authority so decided to get a sausage roll from here. It was toasted and lukewarm which was not too appealing. The roll itself was filled with oil, and tasted alright for what I was expecting. Service was efficient, but it was a small area so one can feel quite claustrophobic. I would recommend this place for a quick and unhealthy bite.

This is the crappiest pizza I have ever had the displeasure of consuming. I don't know how they're still in business. If I am in the city, and I have to pay city prices at least have the decency to provide at least okay/mediocre food.

I don't know if they were cleaning inside the oven but the pizza they gave me tasted like cleaning products.

Extremely dissatisfied.

Saltiest Mac and Cheese I have ever eaten in my life. Saltiest FOOD I have ever eaten in my life. Each bite was like eating lumps of salt cubes (if those exist). Or salt crystallines that burn in the throat an hour after I had decided on my last bite.

The food is not worth a place to sit down waiting for your bus (which is the initial reason I chose this place).

Wow. The food taste worse than a college dorm food!!!  I didn't think it could be possible but Villa managed to unpleasantly surprise me. We came here after a late flight in from California. Nothing area our hotel was open so my coworker took us to this place instead of the deli. Smack in the middle of Port Authority among Duane Reade and Radio Shack, I knew this was going to be one of those experiences you'd sooner like to forget. The cafeteria stuck food under the heat lamp should have given us the warning necessarily to run for the next exit but I was amongst coworkers so I didn't want to appear high maintenance. The chicken tasted like chicken jerky. The mash taste straight out of the microwave with loads of fake butter on top and the Caesar salad was worse than store bought. I would avoid this place like the plague. And to add insult to injury, it was about $15 per person!!!!!

As others have stated, there is nothing good about this pizza place in the Port Authority. First, the pizza slice that I received was not even hot- it was placed into the oven for about five minutes, a fair amount of time, I would say. But when it came out, it was barely warm.

Then, I receive my slice. Not only does it taste very bad, but the smell! Quite honestly, it did not smell like pizza, or even food. On my bus that I was waiting for (the only reason I'd fall for a trap like this place anyway), I felt bad to even open the box to let that smell out. Needless to say, when I stepped off the bus in Jersey, I simply could not finish the slice and put it into the trash.

If you are seriously starving... eat here. But you will not feel satisfied, especially for what you are paying. Yes, they try to swindle out-of-towners taking such services as Greyhound and Peter Pan. But never, ever come here just for the pizza place. Come on, it's New York. You can do better than this.

Terrible pizza. The only time I come here is while drunk and I still should know better. Overpriced, foul tasting, poor value. The only saving grace is that you can eat it as you walk to your gate for the bus. No matter how tasty it looks from the outside - skip this one and eat anything else instead.

Their employee Junior was SO rude and nasty just now.  He wouldn't let my fiance's daughter try the gelato because I had tried it. Mind you, I tried ONE flavor and she only wanted to try ONE flavor. He had a crazy attitude and handed me a broken cone with a small scoop of gelato on it, which I did NOT ask for. I told him again that she wanted to try it first and he got even nastier and refused to let her.  What a disgusting human being.
Quick friendly service.  Pizza was okay.  But if you are looking for something quick to eat not a bad choice. $20 dollars feeds two people.  (Two big slices, one side of potatoes and a water)

Probably the worst slice of pizza in new york.  Was really hungry and had some time to kill before my bus came. $9 for 2 cheese slices.  Nasty stuff.  Disappointed to see tourists eating here thinking this is what NY pizza is all about.

Sad!

The pizza is bad but it is NOTHING in comparison to the horror that is the pasta.  Run away.

While choking down a bowl of "baked ziti" I began to imagine what this place would mean to me in an apocalyptic scenario.  Would I be so thankful for the caloric intake that I might then truly appreciate these bites?  Nope.  And not just because I carry a couple things of dehydrated mac and cheese around with me (I am mostly that kind of crazy).  I should have just asked for a cup of hot water - my dehydrated food would have been like eating a 5 star meal in comparison.

It was the consistency of baby food.  No amount of Romano cheese was going to fix it.

Eat your own hand first.

This is literally the worst pizza place I have ever eaten in NYC. Their business model seems to involve setting up shop places where they get a lot of foot traffic but not repeat business (airports, tourist areas). Pizza looks like what they used to serve in school cafeterias. The salads looked decent so I order a "value" meal with a slice, salad, and a drink, which just about took care of $15.

The salad was tiny, I think they gave me 4 pieces of feta cheese.

I pulled out my computer and hung out there for a few hours. After a while the employees started getting irritated which gave me great satisfaction.
Don't enter here!! The most expensive pepperoni pizza slice! 5$ for a normal slice that outside port auth is just 2$! Besides, bad customer experience with the rude owner and employees.

After seeing our broadway show,"Wicked" me and my wife sat down to a nice meal of Parmesan chicken subs and a cheese pizza. Me and her absolutely loved the food. Unlike the rest of the reviews; the food,including the "baked ziti", was delicious. The service was bad but the people were nice. It is true they will hire any dialect of language and a lot of the employees were almost entirely lack of knowledge of the English language. And a homeless man also came in the restaurant and begged money off of us. But other than all of that and yes their overpriced foods. It was a pleasant sit down. I would give four stars but the lady at the cash register made me go back and forth with the amount of money she was giving back to me.
Not much to say, the pizza here is absolutely dreadful, but when you are "Hangry" this will hold you over until you can find better food - which is not hard to do here in the city.

For some reason I was surprised when my total for a white slice & water came to $6.51. I should have known better . . . in fact I did know better but it was too cold to venture out of Port Authority to a better place down the street.

It wasn't worth the calories and the show of employees hassling the homeless.
Awful place. Rude people who barely spoke English. Terrible food. Dirty tables. Stay away from this place, seriously. I couldn't be any more disappointed about it.
Probably the worst pizza in the New York metro area. And overpriced just to add insult to injury.

So here it is, eh? Yelp finally has added on this business. Well, my experiences and memories with this Villa Pizza go way back to when they first opened this location in the Port Authority Bus Terminal here in 1999. From one of employees telling me off for being a stupid fresh-mouth kid back when I was 10 or so to several years later when my mom and I reprimanded the manager of the place for throwing out an old lady who simply wanted to sit down and rest her leg, my memories here are many. I've seen employees come and go as well as the place redesign itself, adding on additional dining space as well as computers for paid internet use which is great for people who don't have computers and smartphones though I've never used them. I've come here upon arrival from New Jersey on the bus for a bite to eat and sometimes again coming home before getting the bus for many years.  

Unfortunately, as you see, my review only gives them two stars. This is because in spite of many memories here and good eating, the place is horribly mismanaged. I'm not sure if the same manager who my mom yelled at for treating that old woman so badly is still there but I recognize him and he's been there for a very long time. Employees are not very bright and there is an air of tension in the atmosphere in the way that they operate. This is coming from what I've experienced. I also suspect that this manager is not the nicest person even though he is pleasant enough on the outside. My review also is for two stars because of how horribly overpriced the food is. It's decent enough food. But it costs entirely too much. Definitely not worth the price. Even the drinks are above what they should be. One of my memories here was overhearing a woman say to the cashier that she would not pay for her salad and drink because it  was so overpriced. She then gave it back and left. Just goes to show.. I will keep coming back unless things go really badly but my review will stay at what it is until their management changes and they "reinvent" themselves when it comes to what they charge.

Plenty of other better places in the area to go to. The pizza was extremely bland and during busy hours the service is slow. I ended up paying $10 for a  stale slice and a drink, which is pretty ridiculous if you ask me.

Stumbled upon this cream of the crappy restaurant crop for a quick lunch. The pizza looked decent enough. The service was fine, and the long line moved fast as the pieces were tossed into the oven for reheating. However, the guy pulled the pizzas out too soon and they were still undercooked. It still was room temperature warm, but it was still extremely greasy and processed tasting. YUCK. It was EXPENSIVE as hell, upwards of $5+ per puny slice of pizza. Never going back.

Inside NY Port Authority building and across the hall from Jamba Juice, this pizza and pasta quick eatery should be replaced by Sbarro asap. It serves baked ziti, lasagna, spaghetti and meatballs, pizzas by the slice, stuffed pizza, etc. but it just doesn't taste good for the prices they charge. $6 for a pasta dish sounds reasonable perhaps, but there's a lack of meat and the sauce is awfully salty. The pizzas are dry as if under the heat lamps too long and greasy too. It's more of a last resort eating here than a first choice.

After buying my tickets to take the bus home, I just needed food. I had to have SOMETHING. So I stumbled upon here (right next to the NJ Transit ticketing booths) and tried it out. Let me say that I only had $8 after I bought my ticket, and this restaurant slurped all the money out of me. For a puny bowl of spaghetti and a mountain dew, it was $7.54. To get meatballs, my total would've went to $9.89. What a joke.

this is the worst restaruant i've been to, 2 piece wing with a scope of rice for 14$, WTF, even though it's timesquare but still way too expensive, the food was not that good, my fries was burned, dark as hell, would not have gone there ever again

I am aware of the really bad reviews. And my review is only based on the gelato and service, so I can't comment on the whole establishment.
