BUT, my friend and I went to buy gelato while our other friend was waiting for her bus, and the guy behind the counter let us taste as many different flavors as we wanted. I thought we probably had to make a decision soon so that we didn't seem like we were just taking advantage of the tasting option, but then he asked us if we wanted to taste more. So nice. I had the chocolate hazelnut gelato which was DELICIOUS. My friend had the stracciatella one which she was really excited about but unfortunately wanted the one I got. For three small gelatos (I swear we gave one to our other friend), the total was around $10. Again, I have no idea what their real food is like (though looking at it was definitely making us hungry), I'd definitely recommend their gelato.

My friends and I went to Villa Pizza because it was the closest one near the AMC movie theater. It costed about 20 bucks for 4 slice of pizza. We wouldn't have mind the price as much if it didn't taste like cold school pizza with toppings on it. Gross! They should be embarrassed to be serving their inedible & disgusting pizza in NY. STAY AWAY!!
Not a good place to have pizza, it is very greasy and the cheese also doesnt taste good. Service is good, but moneywise its not worth spending time and money having it.

Worst place ever. Let the homeless people breathe down your neck and come talk over your food. Not fair to those who want to eat and those spending money. The staff is friendly but just may be too friendly because the homeless people come in as their friends and they neglect to think how their customers feel being harassed for their food and money as they eat.

I ordered 5 pies for my son's Birthday Pizza party and in his word "it was bussin" that means it was great! Hus fellow class mates also agree. The service provided was more than reliable. Every detail down to providing the paper plates, and condiments.

We can definitely do it again.

I was in a rush and stopped by here to grab something to eat. I got a regular cheese slice ($5.05), the 3 cheese slice ($5.75), and a bottle of water ($3). The 3 cheese slice made me nauseous and the regular cheese slice wasn't anything special. For the standard size slices, the pizza was overpriced to me. There are so many better places nearby with quality pizza. Also, $3 for a bottle of water is robbery but I guess that's expected in the city. Definitely won't be returning to this place.

Villa Italian Kitchen had a sign out front about their 6am breakfast. Right away I figured there has to be coffee. I was waiting for my friend to arrive on the bus from Pennsylvania.
This Italian Market is located in the Port Authority Bus Terminal on the First Floor. I was greeted by a nice man. He got my small black drip and said the lady would be there to ring it up. It was only $2.34 cents and a decent size coffee. It was delicious too.
The place is clean and spacious. There's lots of seating. I sat in the back where I could see the door. I thought my friend would want to eat but he said he could wait until I was ready later. They did have a beautiful spread of items behind the counter. I didn't get photos. The pancakes looked good.
I'm giving them Four Stars for friendliness and cleanliness. I would return to eat next time I'm at the Port Authority.
service was excellent, mama pasta sauce it's the SWUACE, the pasta was good , Great fresh food and good prices

The store is very nice and clean. The mac and cheese was delicious. The employees we're very friendly and kind.
I would definitely be coming back.

The spaghetti and chicken parmesan was delicious. The store had nice decorations. Very clean the employee and service was amazing.
The workers were kind and welcoming and i will definitely be coming back to visit the store.
Great food. Customer service right in Port Authority Bus Terminal. 2nd floor I think.

Let's be honest. This is where you go if you are hungry but you only have an hour and a $20 bill until your bus leaves from Port Authority. It's convenient, it's in your face, don't expect Anthony Bourdain's ghost to be sitting on a chair beckoning you to come in.

Food is served cafeteria style. It's Italian fast food - pizzas, pastas, paninis, that kind of thing. Sure, if you went three blocks over, you'd find 99 cent slice of pizza pie. Nope, they're going to get YOU, the teeming masses, the uneducated, the "my feet hurt too much to go any further but I'm hangry now" tourist.

It can get kinda feisty if you are looking for a place to sit. Seating and table space is limited, so maybe one person can circle like a vulture for an open spot while the other person orders the food.

Had a slice of veggie pizza which was good. I seem to recall it had diced red peppers, diced onions and chopped tomatoes. It was ok.

I also opted for a slice of Hawaiian pizza (ham/Canadian bacon and pineapple.) Not good at all, in my opinion.  Thick, chewy and tasteless.

Pizza slices are large and about $5.50 each.

I could have given this place zero stars if it was available. We went in late on Tuesday at 8:30 pm and ordered Pesto Caprese and Turkey Chipotle. After paying and waiting for a few minutes was told there's no more avocado for the turkey. So I changed to chicken. Photo is half of the order of chicken panini. I don't mind paying but I do mind wasting my money. This is one of them. Will never return.

It seems to be a recurring theme.  I was finished with my business mission to Midtown, hungry for lunch and with a half-hour to kill before my bus back home.  This mode has rarely produced a joyous result, but rather, an intermediate point on the spectrum which separates the "mediocre" and "bad" from the outright "horrific."  My expectations were flat-lined when I entered the Port Authority Bus Terminal outpost of Villa Italian Kitchen (#4204, if you're keeping score at home).  Strangely, the experience was considerably better than I anticipated, but that really wasn't a difficult standard to top.

Villa Italian Kitchen, from today's experience, is a classic instance of the sum of the parts exceeding the whole.  That "whole" excludes considerations of ambiance or atmosphere; save those expectations for the legendary pizzerias Downtown.  Food is served, cafeteria-style, by reheating the contents of heat-lamp trays and bulk catering troughs.  Service?  There seems to be a communications protocol of grunts and pointing which would likely baffle an anthropologist, but strangely, succeeds in delivering a tray of food fairly quickly.

Continuing on the down-side first, a single slice with mushrooms ($5.29) and a regular-sized soda ($3.09) yielded a tab which compares with the captive audience gouging of airport food services.  Had I known that a pizza lunch was in my plans when I was walking past a dozen "dollar-a-slice" eateries, I would have missed out on the Villa Italian Kitchen experience.

The pizza sauce is blatantly canned-tasting, and the "cheese" is unquestionably a cheap imitation mozzarella.  Yet, despite being reheated, the crust is nicely chewy and thin.  Both the canned mushrooms and seasonings were generous and quite tasty.  There was a bit of a peppery bite that, together with the herbs, lent a degree of  complexity.  Much to my surprise, and focusing on only the pizza, lunch was satisfying.

I stopped by and saw that they have an all you can eat breakfast for $12.75. I went in and got on line. The usual breakfast foods were present and I asked if I was going to be able to return to the buffet and was told I could if I wanted to. I ordered the scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, two fried eggs and toast. There is no toaster present. Your order is plated along with the bread and stuck in the pizza oven. The bread is not toasted but warmed on the exposed side. None of the food is actually hot-hot-it has to be placed in the pizza oven. The scrambled eggs were somewhat rubbery and the toast is unbuttered [there wss no mention of butter or jelly] Anything you need in terms of utensils, napkins, etc has to be collected where you pay. The tables are bare. A real zinger is a cup of coffee is $4. Overall, I felt it was marginal in terms of a breakfast and regretfully, it is set up to cater to tourists. Coffee can only be had with regular milk or half and half. [ no 2%, skim, soy, or almond] The all you can eat concept does work out better for families since it is more economical. It is really not for the locals.
This place is in my opinion the biggest scam food establishment I've ever encountered. I had the balboa, and threw 95% of it away. Fries were cold. The place is a disgrace.

Defiantly in a cool stop around Time Square. I had the pepperoni Stromboli and I was not impressed with it at. Than I had a slice of stuffed spinach  pizza and again I was disappointed. I was just about to lose hope but than I took a bite of the chicken Stromboli and aha, it's was good. Nothing fantastic but it hit the stop. I'd come back to this if I ever get around to it just not anytime soon and only to try something other than what I previously had here.
Really enjoyed the pizza. Great taste & flavor. Great size for the price. They have extra seating downstairs. Place is clean, and they have a good variety of pizza to choose from.

Expensive
Food is not good
Employees doing jokes about customers
Ridiculous
I paid 17.29 to a spaghetti horrible and two meatballs, raw rice and a drink.
Don't spend your money here
Be smart

The food is decent but the prizes are sky rocking for a fast food place . way over prized . I order 6 wings for 7.99 I got 6 premature baby chicken legs  next time I will got to an actual restaurant and get my money worth.

I ended up in Villa Italian Kitchen in the Times Square Food Court (opposite sport Authority) on a cold windy day when I needed to grab a quick lunch for myself and a friend. I was hoping that I'd be done ordering salad and soup in 10 mins.
Unfortunately I was very wrong. I got locked into the order because I was charged for it (a very efficient process). I got the panini and wrap with sides after I saw the wilted and ancient looking spinach, lettuce, and spring mix.
The person who was preparing the panini did not speak and understand basic English. He took 15 mins to make the panini and took another 15 mins to locate the sides of soup and fruit salad. A lot of the time was spent with me trying to use gestures, signs, etc. to indicate what I wanted since the person couldn't understand that I was ok with paying the difference for the large fruit salad since they were out of the small one. I felt bad for him because he had to deal with all the stress, but I was angry with the management for putting him and the customers in a bad situation.
I was well aware that I was going to end up with some overpriced and mediocre grub given the location, but this place was just plain awful. I am not even sure how they manage to stay in business with such poor quality food and service. I highly recommend walking a block and half to Broadway for infinitely better options.

We'd just come in from out of town and we're hungry so we picked the closet place. The food was okay but nothing to brag about. Prices are high but remember, it's Time Square, so rent is high. Overall just an okay place .
This was a nice little stop for a quick salad. They had a nice menu selection but I was just on the run and couldn't enjoy the pies.
Bland and boring Need I say more?  Why is it that the crappiest restaurants always make the cut and land in food courts, and with expensive prices?  Is vendor selection based upon kickbacks?
Customer service is terrible. They will make you feel like your going to steal everything.  Terrible place. Shitty workers

I normally do not eat at transit stations. The prices are kind of elevated. With that said I came in for a slice while I transferred busses. My slice was prepared and served to me. As I slid the slice down the counter I dropped it. The staff was very quick to replace my slice at no charge and clean my mess. Thanks for having good service! The slice was very delicious.
Terrible, overpriced bad service, did I mention overpriced? the food should have been free for the quality.

This is cafeteria or mall food for us. There's a lot of options/choices. The pizzas made right in front of you which is pretty cool. it's quick in service for the most point. We stumbled across a line of about 20 people trying to eat on a Sunday evening and the line flowed pretty decently. Flavor is not bad or outstanding it's just good. All in all, not a bad experience just not an awesome experience. It's a good place to get some quick pizza
Service was horrible!! Staff was very rude. Dining area was filthy. Food was cold, probably the worst Caeser dressing I've ever had. Way too expensive for what u get.

Reviewing the juice bar inside Villa. Stopped by on a whim (on a very hot day) and ordered "THE EXTREME" smoothie under the "healthy" menu of drinks. It consists of açaí, strawberry, and something else I forgot but I asked to add spinach and the lady was nice enough to do so. However, she added honey water and the entire drink was way too sweet and my body is rejecting it as we speak  Cost $8.37 for a watery smoothie. There is only one worker stationed at a time and they work slow.
Ugh so disappointed...i spent $13 for a peice of MEAT lasagna but where  is the meat??? It was all pasta and cheese. On top of that NO flavor whats so ever!!!

Pizza with a great taste and served with delicious side pasta while waiting for your next bus! It's a great environment with attentive staff that make your waiting experience enjoyable. The dessert ice creams are also an icy addition to your lunch that complete its menu.
The place is over priced and the food isn't worth the money. The staff was curious. For the expense you can go to an actual restaurant

This restaurant is complete chaos! People going every which way, it isn't clear where to order, where to pay, where to pickup food etc. I placed one order for a Steak Bowl which took 20 mins. to complete. My daughter ordered a Balsamic Chicken Wrap, a fountain soda, and a bottle of diet Pepsi for me. (there was a trough of diet Pepsi behind the counter). The Manager who took our order did not give my daughter a receipt and he gave me a fountain diet Pepsi. I told him this was incorrect and he let me take one out of the refrigerated drink section. We proceed to wait for our food and questioned the girl behind the counter about the Balsamic Chicken Wrap, as to whether it was coming out freshly made or were we expected to take one out of the refrigerated case. She did not have a clue and decided that no answer was sufficient. Another employee appeared at this time looking very annoyed and ranting about something. She proceeded to make a panini for someone. At this time I asked to speak to the Manager. I told him of our quandary and he said that that if there was a wrap in the case that we should take it. I explained to him that this is not what we were expecting and so he asked the 'annoyed' employee to prepare the wrap, and offered us a free beverage or salad for our troubles. The woman makes the wrap, hands it to us on a plate(for takeout) and we got out of there as fast as we could. Eating our dinner on the car ride home, we come to find out that the wrap had NO CHICKEN IN IT! I am disgusted at the time and money we spent in this establishment. This entire experience is unacceptable.
Not New York style pizza. Thick, mushy, not crispy. Took forever even though I was the only one in there
We had the veal and salmon dishes - delicious! The service was good, the food cooked well and perfectly seasoned. We will be back!
Staff members are rude, food is absolutely tasteless and expensive. Save your money, this place isn't worth it.
Below average overly salty slice. Staff is pleasant and crust is crispy, and not many better options in the PA bus terminal.

Bad food and extremely over priced. I stopped here to get a "snack". They wanted to charge me almost  $15 for 5 SMALL chicken wings and a packaged iced coffee. I immediately told them no to the $5 coffee but kept the wings because I was so hungry. When I went to take a bite the wings were cold and didn't taste fresh. Bad experience over all. Stay away.

If I could give this place more than a 5-star rating, I would.  We were visiting New York City, and I had to rely on my fellow Yelpers for restaurant suggestions.  That brought me to Victor's! I was not disappointed.  

I'll start with the ambiance.  The restaurant was dimly lit, creating a very romantic feeling.  The tables were nicely spaced, making it feel manageable, even though it was a busy Sunday night.  

The food was everything! I opted for the Churrasco con Chimichurri.  It was cooked perfectly.  The chimichurri sauce was subtle and the perfect compliment to the steak.  My husband chose the Robo Encendido Con Fufu De Platanos and he gave me a little taste.  I can't say which I loved better. (Notice I said LOVED not liked) This was all served with white rice and black beans.  

The only bad thing I have to say about this place is that our waiter could have been more attentive. It may be because our table was on the edge of his service area, but he often forgot to come by and check in with us.  He gave us the dessert menu at the same time as our neighboring table got theirs, and they ordered dessert and were almost done with it before he came back to see if we wanted to order any.  We said no as we had to get to our Broadway show.

Victor's Cafe was nothing special but there was nothing too bad about it either. The service was good and everyone was helpful. The decor is inviting and made for a very cool atmosphere.

We went on a Sunday night and it was not too busy so it might not be too hard to walk in and get a table. It was also easy to get a same-day reservation at this restaurant.

We found that the appetizers were a bit mediocre, but the main dishes were pretty tasty. I probably would not return to this restaurant, but this is a decent option in the area if you are around and are looking for a decent bite.

Came for restaurant week dinner and had a nice meal. The restaurant is pretty big and nicely decorated, just a little loud. People with us ordered the coconut mojito and loved it.

As restaurant week meals go, this one was very good and a good deal (3 large courses for $45)! They give their usual portion sizes (alot of places do much smaller plates) and they offer their regular menu items (as opposed to ones they invented just for restaurant week). I had the ham croquettes to start, the lechon for my entree and the rice pudding for dessert.

The croquettes were surprisingly good (5-6 finger size croquettes), very flavorful, not oily even though they were fried, and not dry at all. I did not think the dipping sauce (similar to a salsa) really went with them, but it was a great appetizer and I would order it again.

The lechon was very tasty, the rice was flavorful and the yuca was a nice addition. The rice pudding was served in a medium sized glass (bigger serving than expected) and was enjoyable. Definitely would recommend for restaurant week!

This was my first visit to a Cuban restaurant.  It was very good.  We shared a pitcher of the red Cuban Sangria.  It was fruity and tasty.  We also shared the guacamole with root chips.  I really enjoyed it.  I had the 3 course tasting menu with the salad (Field greens, hearts of palm, Mandarin slices, Manchego cheese, champagne vinaigrette), ropa vieja ((Victor's house specialty - Slowly braised and pulled Grass-Fed Angus Beef skirt steak in garlic, tomato, onion, pepper sauce) and the flan.  I wasn't expecting the beef to be shredded, but it was moist and flavorful.  I also tasted my friend's salmon ceviche and her lechon Assado (Traditional roast pig marinated 24 hours, slowly roasted overnight in Cuban style mojo, garlic mojo yucca).  They were both also good.  I did not find the pork as flavorful as my beef, but it was extremely tender.

Everything was really good. We got there at five and it was empty. Our waiter at this point was fantastic. By 5:30 the place was packed with not a spot to sit. Our waiter at this point struggled a bit but everything was still well worth it. We started with the batolito and bacalao fritters which were amazing. My mom and I both ordered wine braised oxtails. They were AMAZING. Definitely recommend these on the menu!

I came here on my birthday before seeing MJ the musical on broadway. I am so happy I came here!! The most delicious Ropa Vieja I have ever had! The service was so attentive and fast, they even gave me a birthday card which I thought was a nice touch! I crave to come back here for their Ropa Vieja all the time!

Came here before a broadway show. The decor is nice. Though it felt super hot and humid in the restaraunt.

I ordered the ropa vieja and it was okay. The meat was cooked well and tender I just wasn't crazy about the flavor. I had better ropa vieja before. The rice was very sticky and good. And the beans were a little too soupy for me. There was a little problem ordering gluten free, or rather confusion. There were certain things that were gluten free that my friend was trying to order and even though it says gluten free on the menu it turns out you have to ask for it the gluten free way and be very clear. The waiter seemed to not really understand she had a gluten allergy. It took awhile for him to get that there can't be gluten in her dish. Though the wait staff is pretty professional and will change out your utensils and refill your water regularly. There is even an attendant in the woman's restroom.

The drinks were strong and delicious. I had the coconut mojito and it was very sweet. I did get a headache from it. The yucca fries I would pass on next time. Bland and no flavor. The sweet plantains were very good, but I never had a bad sweet plantain.

Overall okay experience. Food is fine nothing special and it is pricey for portion size.

Inside was beautifully decorated. The temperature did switch from cold to hot at times but what me and my group ordered was delicious. I had their mojito which was alright I could have gotten more drinks to get an opinion. But overall had a great time.

What a great surprise this place was. We were in the Times Square area and had not made arrangements for dinner before seeing HERE LIES LOVE. Spotted the place near the theater, looked it up and saw nice reviews. It was early enough, we were able to get a reservation for 30 minutes later.

The atmosphere here is great. There are several different dining rooms; we sat in the back, and I recommend that. It is slightly more kitschy, but just fun and engaging, with a nice mural and the right level of brightness.

Service was pretty speedy; not so much that you felt they wanted you to hurry along, but they are also clearly accustomed to dealing with patrons who need to get to the theater. We had several folks serve us...all were great.

And the food was great. My wife and I shared two different beef dishes, and both were outstanding. SO tasty. We also, surprisingly, enjoyed the black beans. Normally, the beans are just kinda a filler...but these were great. The plantain was like candy! Desserts were excellent too.

Only complaint is that the cocktails were a bit on the small side and a bit weak. Tasty, but for the price, would have liked more.

We had a great time, and I'd go again without hesitating. What a nice surprise!

We found this place while waiting for the Neil Simon theater to open for the Michael Jackson broadway show. The waiter informed us everything is made from scratch but still put a rush on the dishes while we ordered drinks and empanadas appetizer. Everything was flavored well and satisfying that we had to order another helping for my kids. They even made the best chocolate milk.
Within 15 minutes our Pan fried Hanger steak and pan seared Atlantic salmon were served. The steak was well flavored as it was pan fried in a Seville orange mojito. Impressively intelligent. The Pan Seared Atlantic salmon had an amazing Cuban polenta. We even had time for desert which was the expresso flan. The best flan I've ever had. It was our first time trying Cuban food and Victor's cafe made our first memorable. Def give this a shot when attending a broadway show.

We had a really good time at Victor's. It is a huge place, for theatre dinners, at first I thought it would be disappointing, but no.
Service is impeccable, ambiance is bubbly and the food was great. I really enjoyed my shrimps,  Camarones Enchilados, and the black beans with rice. I tasted also a bit of the tapas served to share of my friends, quesadillas. All good!

Ate brunch here and was surprised to find out it was still Restaurant Week in NYC.  In addition to the regular brunch menu, they offered a prix fixe menu which included 3 courses for $30 (alcohol not included).  I always like to try multiple dishes when I am visiting a new restaurant so prix fixe dining was the best option.  Considering the price, this was a steal for NYC dining.  Food was good with the Cuban Eggs Benedict being a stand out entree choice.  This dish was a spin on the traditional dish with Ropa Vieja in place of the meat. The meat was well seasoned and super tender.  

My reservation occurred pre-theater matinee time.  The restaurant was crowded when I arrived.  Noise level was a bit high for my liking but considering the amount of customers and the timing it was acceptable.  Serving staff was polite and efficient getting the customers fed and out the door in a reasonable amount of time to get to the theater.  

Overall, I would recommend for lunch.  A reservation is required.  Location is good if looking for a bite to eat before a Saturday matinee.

This high-end Cuban restaurant provides food that is good, but not outstanding. The service and atmosphere are somewhat underwhelming. While I have had exceptional Cuban cuisine at more affordable places, it's worth acknowledging that this restaurant offers a premium dining experience. However, the portion sizes of the dishes appear to be relatively small considering the higher prices.

Visited Victor's Café on the last Sunday of NYC Restaurant Week and I was astonished by the mind blowing customer service.

Our waiter's name was also Victor, and he made our brunch so wonderful, with his magnificent manners and attention.

The fixed menu was marvelous and so exquisite.
We had 3 courses and there were NO complaints about anything. I started with the Empanadas, my boyfriend had the Croquetas, then we both chose the Cuban Eggs Benedict and when we were done they proceeded to bring our desserts and asked if we wanted coffee or anything else. I, of course, had a cuban coffee, my boyfriend had a cappuccino.

Our visit to this restaurant was beyond perfection and we definitely wish to come back and try more menu items!!!

PS: Shootout to the restaurant owner or manager, they are a "Cuban" restaurant and I loved hearing every team member speaking Spanish at some point. Loved it!!!!

The ambience, staff, and food were all on point! The savory empanadas were delightful, followed by the Guacamole, Pargo, plantains, topped off with a hot cafe con leche, and cheesecake. Absolutely delicious! Must try while in NYC!

Ambience is classy but comfy.   Service was Great - the whole team was - but Our server was Vicente.  Our party ordered the rabo, ropa vieja, branzino, salmon ceviche and Red sangria.  All yum!  Perfect location too before a Broadway Show

Wow, great food and a really nice location (really dug the deco - fans on the ceiling were cool). The portions are a bit small for sharing plates, so look to order 2 or more of each option if you have a larger party.

Ambiance is full of energy!  Service is always on point - very attentive!  Food is always amazing!  I have here many times over the years and the food and service never disappoint.  This is not a place to come for an intimate dinner - music and conversation fills the dining rooms.

Love the location of this restaurant, which leans toward business casual.

The plantains, empanadas and yucca fries are all very good appetizer options. The vaca frita, ropa vieja and lechon asada are delicious choices and a great option for anyone who is unfamiliar with Cuban food.

I will say that the prices are a little high for Cuban food - not surprising when you consider the location. But this is good dinner option if you want to get dressed up a little and catch a show afterwards.

Damon( sp?) was soooo charming, as he told us there were no tables available in the dining area, as we slipped in before our show. But he suggested we sip in the bar area, at a table. I wish our waiter had been as attentive as he was. We loved the vibe in the bar. But the wait was excessive until I flagged down someone who wasn't our waiter, after all. He then got someone else, who took our order. New waiter.
We ordered La Jefe and Havana Spice. Both were delicious. We decided on appetizers due to the time constraints. We ordered Cuban quesadilla and empanadas de pollo. Both were delicious and satisfying . This is a very popular restaurant and I'd love to spend more time here.

Made a reservation and came here for dinner last night with my husband and we had a great evening. The ambiance is nice-lots of greenery, low lighting, and they were busy.

We started with classic mojitos, which were delicious and so fresh. We then got both the red and white sangrias, which were kind of like a rum punch topped with wine-really enjoyed those too.

To eat, we got the ceviche (classic version) and it was tasty, small portion but very fresh and flavorful, no fishy aftertaste. We wish it had come with crackers or plantains to scoop it up. We got the tostones con mason as de puerco which were these huge fried plantains topped with big chunks of crispy pork-very tasty. We also got the Havana guacamole (would order extra chips, or the tropical chips to go with it-which was a huge basket of thin crispy plantain chips and a side of yummy red salsa).

For dessert, we got the churros (perfectly fried crispy mini churros served with chocolate, caramel, and dulce de leche-delicious sweet ending to our meal!). We got a regular espresso, cafe Cubano (sweetened espresso), and carajillo (alcoholic espresso, with brandy I believe - very strong but good).

Overall highly recommend this place for awesome Cuban food, nice evening ambiance, and impeccable service. Would come back!

We have been here several times, the food is always great and the service is wonderful. Great atmosphere. However dont go super hungry, the portions are on the small side. My pernil/roasted pork was a yummy 2 ounces, i swaped the yuca for sweet plantains and requested white rice and beans. The small bowl of beans were served for the table to share.  The sangria is SOOO great! We will definitely will be back but wont go super hungry!

Was in the city to see the Michael Jackson musical. This place is next door, so we tried it at random.

It's a decent size, extending pretty far back. Very dimly lit for ambiance, staff is expedient & attentive, even thought they were busy. It's the city, so I have nothing to say about parking, LOL.

Now the food, one word....UNIMPRESSIVE! I had the Cuban sandwich, & while I know it's hard to top a Cubano from a bodega, this was....Ok. Nothing to be impressed by. My Wife's review of her salmon was "Ehh, it's edible."

The drinks, sent them back THREE times. They all tasted horrible, like the person at the bar wasn't a bartender, but a general employee filling in and making an attempt at bartending. They did take them off the bill, so points for that. Plus the whole experience was downgraded by the fact that they sat us next to a group of people who had one Woman who could not stop coughing. In this day & age if you're coughing like that....stay the hell home. Aside from that being beyond their control, I would not come back here. Just not worth the trip.

I had an absolutely fantastic dinner tonight for Restaurant Week! Everything I had was superb - from the cocktail to all of my courses i was absolutely pleased with it all. I loved the La Jefa cocktail (vodka, elderflower liquor, and blackberry puree). I really loved my entree; all of the components melded together perfectly. I left feeling fulfilled and extremely happy that I chose to visit. This restaurant was a favorite for client dinners at my previous company and I can absolutely see why it is the perfect choice for a wonderful and filling meal!

Although I found the food here tasty, most other stuff was lacking. The employees seemed like they would rather be anywhere else. The hostess only stared daggers, wordlessly leading us to a table. For such a beautiful space, you don't experience an ounce of friendliness, you're simply a body taking up space.

The menu uses words like "entree" where in reality you're getting a tapas-sized plate. Expect that each person will need to order an appetizer and an "entree" to feel full - and this is coming from a person that eats little and almost always takes home leftovers from restaurants.

It is too bad that this place was so disappointing, as I had been looking forward to trying it. I did find the food to be delicious - ropa vieja was solid, and the ceviche was tasty, although light on fish and heavy on mango. Alas unfriendly service, messed up orders, and minuscule portion sizes for sky high prices get points taken off.

This upscale Cuban restaurant offers decent, though not exceptional, food. The service and ambiance are somewhat lackluster. While it is true that I have enjoyed outstanding Cuban cuisine at more budget-friendly establishments, it's important to note that this is a high-end dining experience. However, the portion size of the dishes seems quite inadequate given the premium prices charged.

Great atmosphere. Food was fantastic and there was a ton of it. Our server was phenomenal. Terrific experience. I wish I had had room for dessert, as they looked wonderful, but the espresso was excellent.

My friend and I dined here for Restaurant Week dinner a few weeks ago. We were seated way inside in comfortable booth seating, but all the tables were close together and it felt a little cramped. Besides that, the interior was quite lovely and beautifully colorful with cool artwork. There were plants and lights hanging from the ceiling in one area of the restaurant. Another part of the restaurant had plants and shiny silver balls on the ceiling. Overall, this made for a festive atmosphere.

For my appetizer, I chose the Croquettes, which had Berkshire ham and potato inside. This came with tomato pepper sauce, which was just okay. The outer shell of the Croquettes were pretty tasty with a nice crunch, but the inside filling was really mushy.

I ordered the Lechon Asado for my entree, which is the traditional roast pig marinated for 24 hours, roasted overnight in mojo, and served with garlic mojo yucca, along with black rice and peas. The meat was shredded into pieces already, and was perfectly tender, juicy, well seasoned, as well as filled with amazing flavor. I also enjoyed the rice, which was cooked just the right amount. The yucca was soft, but kind of starchy and bland. I couldn't really taste a whole lot of garlic.

The dessert options were not that great. I went with the Flan over Banana Custard, but I would've preferred the Tres Leches Cake. The Flan was Cuban style egg custard drenched in a sweet caramel sauce, topped with a fragrant mint leaf. The Flan was firm, velvety creamy smooth with silky texture, as well as lightly eggy, boasting a rich toasted caramel flavor from the sauce.

Service was decent. The place was bustling, so it was sometimes hard to get the attention of the waiter. I don't think I will return because the prices are pretty high.

We hadn't been here since before pandemic and finally decided to go for our anniversary in June 2023. When making the reservation online, the site asked if it was a special occasion so I selected Anniversary. Upon arriving the host was so kind to wish us a happy anniversary and proceeded to over us a cozy corner for our quiet dinner. As before pandemic, the food was as delicious as ever, the waiter was the kindest and sweetest older gentleman and even added candles to our desert for our celebration. Worth coming back to a classic spot like this

Made a reservation for noon on a Saturday and the place was pretty packed by the time we got in. The ambiance is so nice; it's sunny, and there are lots of plants and colors around. The two of us actually got seated at a four person table - nice and spacious! Haha

Tropical chips - 4/5 - the guac was super tasty and the chips were good! They reminded me of terra chips, but I do wish that it came with more chips. There were only about 6 chips with a scoop of guac.

Tortilla Blanca - 5/5 - this was kind of like a frittata/omelette and if you don't want anything too heavy, I'd definitely recommend this dish! It was super light and flavorful, exactly what I was going for. The eggs also had plantains in them, a combo I've never had before I think, but it added a sweetness that I really enjoyed!

Aperol spritz - 5/5 - one of my go-tos and this one did not disappoint! Drinks-wise the sangria on the menu also looked really good and the table next to us ordered a pitcher.

The service was a bit slow but nothing that would prevent me from coming back again. Would recommend checking out this little oasis in midtown!!

We went here during our trip to NYC right after Christmas. I found this place through Yelp and was looking for Cuban food. My boyfriend is part Cuban and we were excited to try some familiar dishes.

To start, we got the croquetas corral. I got a mojito to drink and for my entree I got the Ropa vieja. It was so delicious - I really enjoyed this dish and it's more filling than it looks. I thought at first glance the portion size looked small, but I could barely finish! It was so tender and flavorful. I've only ever had Ropa vieja homemade before and this was definitely just as good! My boyfriend got the salmon carnaval and it was also super good. The creamy polenta was a great addition to the salmon. Service here was great, our waiter was very attentive and nice.

My only complaint about this place was it was pretty warm inside - which was a little uncomfortable since I had a sweater on in (being winter time). The lighting was very dark in here as well - which wasn't the worst thing but kinda weird. I would've preferred a more open bright atmosphere to go along with these Cuban dishes and drinks. Online, the photos of the restaurant look open, airy, and bright. So I was a little surprised how dark it was in the evening. Overall, I would definitely return. The food was delicious and it can be challenging to find Cuban restaurants this good. Check this place out if you wanna try authentic Cuban cuisine.

Very nice aesthetics and beautiful place. Enough music to feel lively but quiet enough to enjoy your dinner. Overpriced for what you get in my opinion. Ropa Vieja tasted sweet and over (tomato) sauced. Rice portion looked about 1/2 cup. Bites that had black beans, rice , and meat we're tasty...but I've had better. Red snapper appetizer ceviche was $29.
This restaurant is an institution on the heart of theatre district so all this was expected. Still an enjoyable experience. My Havana spice cocktail was delicious. They knew it was my birthday and brought nothing but we did not order a dessert-but  wished me several times

Came here for dinner as this spot was next to my hotel. The ambiance was lovely, very dimly lit which felt like a retreat from all of the lights right outside in Times Square.

The service was pretty good, mostly attentive servers and the only real wait time was for the check.

The food overall however, was just okay. We ordered guacamole with plantains and pollo empanadas to start. The guac was delicious and the plantains were perfect so those were a hit! The empanadas were tiny, burnt on the edges and pretty dry in the middle so they were a big disappointment. I got the bronzino, which was a daily special, for my main course. It was lightly grilled and a little too lightly seasoned but the salsa relish that comes with it helped. The sautéed greens that came on the side were bland and unappetizing so they weren't touched after one bite. The saving grace of the main course was their black beans and rice. Talk about the star of the show! These were seasoned WELL and were absolutely delicious - they are the must-try from their menu (even if black beans aren't generally your thing - they're that good!). Cocktails were also just okay. Oh but their churros on the s dessert menu are all fantastic! I'd come back for those as well as their black beans & rice, and their guac, or perhaps a happy hour to try more of their appetizers, if they have one.
Deeeeeeelicoous! Paella seafood so good  Highly recommend. Full bellies. So happy. Good meal.

We decided to come here in the spur of the moment, quickly made reservations and walked over. They were organized and seated people in a timely manner. Those without a reservation they gave them realistic wait times and/or let them know what seating would be available. This is already a step up from the location we left.
We had a great visit here. Our waiter Diego was awesome! Diego made the dining experience that much better with such a friendly Pleasant personality.  Talk about knowing good customer service! A+++
This was a spur of the moment visit and we made last minute reservations that were accepted and honored without issue. We arrived a few minutes early but were informed that it wasn't an issue and we would be seated soon. The restaurant may look small at first glance but it's actually pretty spacious.   We were seated in the area with the skylight which was great since it was still light out.
And the food!? Awesome!!
Our table spread consisted of: maduros, tostones, Ropa Vieja with white rice and black beans, Arroz Con Pollo, ensalada de palmitos y mandarinas, ceviche de camarónes, and flan. Everything was delicious! The ropa vieja was flavorful and the beef wasn't so shredded it looked weird or inedible. Even the black beans were good. It wasn't just a side of black beans plopped down in a bowl. The maduros and tostones both made just right! The maduros wasn't mushy or under cooked and the tostones weren't over cooked and rock hard. The arroz con pollo had nice juicy pieces of chicken
This was a plus because we were trying it out during restaurant week to see if we would want to come back in the future. We also tried cocktails  and they were the white sangria, the coconaty mojito, and the Hemingway daiquiri (which isn't like a typical daiquiri).  Plus we didn't at any point feel rushed.
After a hectic frustrating day coming here was a great ending and a pleasant time..
We are definitely going to include Victor's Café in our regular rotation!

When visiting New York, I wanted to come here as I heard that it was one of Gloria Estefan's favourite restaurants.  It serves elevated Cuban food.  I was not disappointed.  It was easy to get a quick reservation.  The service was very friendly and welcoming.  It was hard to choose what to eat.  Fortunately I came with a friend who likes to share so we could try a few things.  Everything tasted amazing and was packed with flavour and texture.  Plating was beautiful and it was just the right amount of food.  I would love to come back!

Great place for pre/post Broadway show eats. I highly recommend you make a reservation because it can get CROWDED! Personally, the sangria didn't give me the kick I hoped. The champagne one was good though... Better than the other flavor (I can't recall if it was red or white because it was not memorable - driving home my point). Kind of pricey in that annoying way of, this really should be a few bucks less and it just adds up over a three course meal with drinks. But the service was lovely and the food was truly enjoyable. I'd return.

I was looking for an early dinner spot to have dinner before our 8pm Hadestown show. Victor's was a few blocks away from the Walter Kerr Theatre and had open reservations. We arrived on time for our 5:30pm reservation on a Friday and it was pretty full already. By the time we left at around 7:15pm, it was packed. Definitely make reservations!

Staff here are extremely nice and they all spoke Spanish, which my in-laws loved. We had their appetizer sampler to share between the four of us and it was just enough for us to each have a small taste - and still have space for our individual entrees.

I opted to have two appetizers instead of one entrée - I had the ceviche and the shrimp & polenta. Both were great - the ceviche had a delightful citrus marinade. X had the lechon, which is a huge portion. In-laws split the lechon and the Ensalada de Palmitos y Mandarinas, which was delightful. The champagne dressing was light and flavorful.

For dessert, we had the rice pudding, flan, and churros with 3 dipping sauces. The flan was fantastic and was honestly one of the best flans that I have ever had in my life.

To drink, there were coconut mojitos all around. I opted for the Hemingway Daiquiri, with Blanco Rum, maraschino liqueur, fresh lime, and simple syrup. I really, really enjoyed my cocktail - it was just a bit sweet with a hint of tang from the lime.

Service was attentive, friendly, and efficient. We felt like we had the time to leisurely enjoy our meals and they didn't rush us out. They even came around with a candle and sang Happy Birthday to X when we told them it was his birthday (early birthday?).

If you're looking for an excellent pre-show meal, Victor's is a solid spot.

Delicious! The plantains are a must have. They almost have a caramel flavor. We had the pork and the beef and shared dishes. So flavorful. The yuca had great flavor and texture. The service was outstanding.

A friend of mine and I dined at Victor's before seeing MJ the Musical and it was divine! The food was delish - started with the Cuban quesadilla and empanadas and a pitcher of red sangria. Our wonderful waiter, Ricardo, was
attentive and made excellent recommendations. My friend had the Lechon Asado and I had the ponle ropa a la vaca - "the best of both worlds" as Ricardo said. Amazing! We left full and satisfied - GREAT service and
yummy food and drinks!

We went for dinner and drinks, food and service were exceptional.  
Lots of history behind this place, pictures reveal

My favorite restaurant in NYC! It was a pleasure dining at Victor's, once again. Let's start with the hospitality and the professionalism of the staff. From the moment you enter the restaurant, you're greeted by a very friendly host who will direct you to a very clean and perfectly setup table.
Our server, Diego, was beyond extraordinary. Very early into our meal, he asked if we will be attending a show or theater. We told him yes, we will be walking up to Lincoln Center......a 20 minute walk. From that moment on, Diego paced the meal perfectly and notified us when it was 6:30 PM. For that alone, this place receives 4 stars, because we were able to enjoy the dinner without looking at the time.
The coconut mojitos, that we all ordered, were incredible, and strong. Our appetizers  were all delicious and we ate every single bite.
Our entrees were, well......I think the pictures will speak for themselves. Great presentation, perfect temperature, and nice portions.
I have to admit, the restaurant is on the pricey side. However, if you want to be treated to a memorable meal, go and enjoy a Victor's Cafe "experience." You WILL return, agree, and share.
Delicious food. Lovely service. Very attentive. Stuffed by the end. Went for my birthday and they sung!

What a great restaurant! Everyone in the city needs to go here. I went at 5 and there was no wait and I felt like it was such a high class environment. When I went to the bathroom they had someone working there to turn on the water and hand you paper towels, something that has never happened to me. The service was great and I really enjoyed the wait staff. When my friend and I ordered wine they cheered with us. I will be going back here and recommending it to everyone I know.

First all of the portions are very small. I ordered a salmon on the parrilla and it was raw. They took it back and  brought me another one.
of course my date had to eat her dinner while they were re doing my meal.
SMH.

The salmon was to come with vegetables. You can acutally count the pieces.
one or two pieces that's it.  No salad, no bread with butter.

Dissatified completely.

Good Cuban restaurant for pre-theater.  For entrees, they will tell you to order 1 main dish per person.  But most dishes can be shared by 2 people (the seafood paella 3 people).  Only order 1 rice dish (Paella or Arroz con Pollo).

Recommended: Fried Snapper Filet; Lechon; Ropa Vieja

Good: Seafood Paella

Not Recommended: Rabo Encendido (oxtail not tender)

I was in town on vacation and had dinner at Victor's before my 7:00 Hamilton show. Promptly greeted and sat, water came quickly as well. An Aperol Spritz to start! I have to say my main waiter was excellent- he was chatty and just really good. So an order of empanadas and vegetable paella was put in for my dinner. The empanadas had chicken inside and there was a side of mango habanero sauce to dip - just enough heat in that sauce! My paella was outstanding - piping hot and delicious plus a very generous portion.

Here's where it got a little interesting. I understand that a woman dining by herself may be a time to deliver a little extra by way of service but here was a bit over the top. I literally had 4 waiters check in on me constantly, including the Manager who came to my table 2 times too many. It was overkill.

Aside from that, it was a good experience overall with great drinks and food. If you're going to the theater definitely have dinner here first! Don't forget to wear your mask, show your ID and proof of vaccination.

I hadn't been here in years and took advantage of restaurant week.
It was easy to get a reservation which is a plus especially since covid its gotten harder to get into restaurants.
We were seated right away and I really loved the glassy tropical decor.

I got a coconut mojito and it was very tasty. My favorite Cuban dish is ropa vieja and it was so delicious. The food here is full of flavor and the portions look small but they aren't. I actually had a hard time finishing my dish.

I will be coming back.

Arrived in hungry and departed stuffed.  Reservations a must if eating around 6 pm. The restaurant was empty at 5 but quickly filled in at 6.  The apps were delicious.  I didn't give 5 stars because my shrimp entree although good was served lukewarm . Our servers were very attentive.

1st time here, not from NY.  Great experience.  Waiter provided great service and recommended great options.

Will recommend!!

Vida Verde is an absolute gem in the heart of New York City! The ambiance is nothing short of spectacular. The lush greenery, colorful decor, and warm lighting create an inviting and energetic atmosphere that's perfect for any occasion. The menu is a culinary masterpiece, offering a delightful fusion of flavors. The nachos at Vida Verde are out of this world! Seriously, they're like a flavor explosion on a plate. Pure Deliciousness! What makes these nachos so amazing is that everything tastes super fresh. The guac is creamy, the salsa has a tangy kick, and the cheese is perfectly melty. And The steak bowl at Vida Verde it's a real winner. It's all about that perfect mix of flavors coming together to create a delicious experience. The "R U Mine" cocktail is sweet and a true masterpiece of mixology. The presentation is also worth mentioning - it's like a work of art in a glass. The vibrant colors and garnishes make it a feast for the eyes as well as the palate.

The service was really nice. The staff's knowledge and friendliness added to the overall dining experience.

When I first arrived, the place was buzzing with excitement. It was pretty loud, with people having a great time, which made it a bit challenging to carry on a conversation. There was a lot of party energy, with folks celebrating and having a blast. If you're looking for a lively atmosphere, you'd have loved it.

But here's the interesting part: after the party crowd left, the ambiance completely transformed. It became this cozy, inviting space where you could relax and enjoy the evening. The music was just right, creating a pleasant background vibe without overwhelming the conversation. It was like the best of both worlds.

I was truly impressed by the level of care and consideration for hygiene during my visit to Vida Verde. When I expressed a desire to take my leftover food home with me, they demonstrated their commitment to hygiene in a thoughtful way. Instead of simply packing the leftovers in a container, they thoughtfully provided me with the receipt and the necessary items to pack the food myself. This small but significant gesture showed their commitment to maintaining high hygiene standards, even when accommodating special requests.

Hats off to the Vida Verde team for their considerate service, which made my dining experience all the more enjoyable.

Incredibly lively spot with a kitchen open LATE!

My friend and I had the nachos and a burrito and it was delicious. They have hefty portions, so either come hungry or ready to share!

The DJ was fantastic and had a good array of top hits and Latin music. Would 100% recommend to anyone looking for a fun night and late night bite

We went here tonight for a post show meal. We wanted to get far enough away from Times Square but not too far to back track back to the train. When you walk in it definitely gives you some Encanto vibes but the decor and ambiance was pretty tastefully done. It was a nice little break from our city life.

We started with ordering 3 different margaritas. We read tons of reviews about how great the margaritas are here but we have to disagree they're equivalent to any margarita you'd get at Applebees or another chain restaurant. They were decent but nothing to write home about. The one thing I can say is when they list a flavor they truly commit to it. The cucumber marg tasted like they threw a full cucumber (skin and all) into the blender which isn't a bad thing it's actually nice to order a flavor and it not just be a hint of flavoring or a super sweet syrup mimicking that flavor. The same went for the peach and tamarind margs - they tasted exactly like their flavors promised. However, it would be nice if any of them tasted like they were alcoholic. They didn't taste like there was even a hint of tequila in any of the 3 drinks.

The drinks and food were a solid 3.5 stars but the Yucca fries were a solid 5/5 on their own. The yucca fries are worth going there for alone. They came with 4 different delicious dipping sauces (I'm a sucker for a good dipping sauce). There was mole, Aji Amarillo (a plain aioli), olive, and a chipotle aioli). I would absolutely come back just for the Yucca fries.

First up, the Mushroom Quesadilla (listed on the menu as Huitlacoche Quesadilla). It was both delicious and an amazing vegan option. Next, the Birria Tacos, they were a little dry but the consume made it taste much better. The Birria quesadillas were good but by far the best option out of our choices was the mushroom quesadilla (and I'm not even a mushroom fan). The best part of our entrees was the guy who delivered them to the table. He described everyone's dishes and sauces before leaving the table. Our server definitely hated her job but this guy made up for her for sure.

Overall this was a decent post-theater option with extra points for being away from the craziness and open late. Our food came out super fast and everything was hot. The only thing that really bothered me here was the water bottles sitting on the tables. They were closed but unsure how long the bottles and cups were sitting out before we got there. Also, a personal pet peeve of mine is when there are bathrooms without toilet paper or paper towels and sticky tables.

**Also, note that this place has a late night menu which runs Sun - Thurs 11pm - 1am and Fri & Sat 12am - 1am**

I came here with my coworkers and we had a great time! The drinks were really good, many different flavor options for margaritas (I enjoyed passion fruit). I liked the shrimp tacos more than the fish tacos, so I would recommend shrimp over fish if you're trying to decide between the two. The guac trio was also really tasty and the server was friendly.  The place itself is also decorated nicely - a festive interior. The only reason I took off a star is because of the cauliflower tacos which my vegetarian coworker ordered but didn't want to eat. He said it smelled 'meaty' so I assume maybe they cook the cauliflower in the same oil as the meat. In any case that was the only negative. Otherwise a good experience

Taco Tuesday review:

$10 nets you 3 tacos, but they all have to be the same kind, so you can't mix and match fillings. Boooo! That said, the quality of the tacos is unexpectedly decent for a Midtown joint, at least where the Carnitas Tacos were concerned: juicy, meaty, savory, and loaded with veggies. Mmmm!

We ordered the double size of the Chips and Guac, and it could've easily satiated all 6 of us. They even served the guacamole with tomatoes on one side and onions on the other, in case people had preferences for the mix-ins. Nice.

Drink-wise, we got the Happy Hour Frozen Pomegranate Margarita ($10), which was too tart, and pitchers of the Red Sangria (tasty) and Cucumber Margarita (super refreshing).

Throw in the colors and the Millennial-geared Top 40 music, and you've got yourself a good Tuesday night.

Came across this spot to start a fun Friday evening after work in Midtown Manhattan! They have several levels, and it was packed on all 3 floors! The first floor had DJ or DJ type music and fairly loud, so we opted for 2nd floor bar area, which was also crowded yet we found seats at the bar!
It was a busy Friday evening, so the service was a bit slow, but the bartenders were attentive! We ordered some skinny margaritas and they were delicious! Also tried their bar bites for a quick snack and both the guacamole and tacos were flavorful (perhaps we expect too much from NY food sceen which maybe unfair).

Overall, fun and lively restaurant/bar with good drinks and tasty food.

Unassuming from the outside but really great on the inside. We stopped by for late night eats & drinks (after midnight) and although the kitchen was closed they had a limited bar menu.
While the selection was limited the FLAVOR was in full force! We had a sampling of their menu; nachos, fish tacos, guacamole and fish tacos. Every single bite of every single plate was absolutely delicious. We then ordered a pitcher of watermelon margaritas and I can honestly say it was the best I've ever had. So good that We ordered a second pitcher (mind you there were only 3 of us).
Inside the place is lively, nicely appointed, with great music and friendly service.
We had such a good experience that we will make it a point to stop by and try their normal menu whenever we are in the area again!

Had to make today a proper taco Tuesday. I got to the restaurant a bit after 6:00 and it was quite busy, only bar seating was available. The bartender came over promptly, took my order which was a passion fruit margarita and carnitas tacos. The drink was a little sweet and not strong IMO and the  tacos were decent. I think if I had more time and others with me I'd explore more menu options.

I came here for taco Tuesdays with friends. Walking in the place is very instagramable. In the bar area looking up you see rainbow colored umbrellas which could also be viewed from the top of the staircase. Some of the things you see are disco balls, skulls and a picture of Selina.

We ordered various tacos.  On Tuesdays their chicken, carnitas and cauliflower tacos are 3 for 10$.  The usual price is around 18$.  I had the chicken and the carnitas tacos.  I did like the carnitas one better. My friends had other stuff on the menu. We all felt the food was ok but the drinks were where they were on point. I had the One for Road drink with the flaming skull with Buffalo trace, Carmel, pear, cocoa, oak and, bitters.  I loved the presentation and the drink.  Another friend had the Tiki verde which is pineapple rum, coconut spiced rum, chinola, Falernum, lime, mango and pandan. Loved how they flamed this drink.  I also had the mango habanero margarita which was actually spicy and when leaving had the frozen seasonal margarita which was a mix of pomegranate/Hibiscus and passionfruit swirled together.

Service was fast and helpful. The only thing disappointing thing was the rooftop closes early on a Tuesday something like 10pm or 11pm and they close it 30 minutes before.  Even though it was technically closed our server allowed us to go up but we had  to come back down when they close at 10pm or 11pm.  We did this.  The rooftop upstairs has nice decor but not much of view.  It is set up as a margarita market serving various margaritas.

The places seems like it's more of a brunch or weekend spot.  We would have liked to stayed later in the rooftop area and had more margaritas;)

It was a nice night, leaving we saw a DeLorean cruising outside!

This is such a hidden gem in Midtown because you would not expect to find this in the neighborhood and you might even walk past it. However, when you walk in, it is completely transformed! The inside is gorgeous. Vibrant colors, flowers, neon I mean this is perfect for content.

Made reservations for 4 and came for bottomless brunch on a Saturday afternoon. I won't lie, I expected the place to be a little more lit than what is was. The music was awesome for our taste but the crowd was dead.

The waitress arrived and explained how the bottomless mimosas work but we opted out and got a pitcher of Tamarind Margaritas instead since the crowd was a little dead and we knew we were not going to be here so long.

The menu looked delicious. We got pork and chicken tacos and steak Chilaquiles. Now I wish the waitress would of told us how big the Chilaquiles were because two of us got it and honestly the whole table could of shared. I'm lying if I say we waited 5 minutes for the food because it came so quick which was nice because we were starving.

Overall good vibes, nice place and good DJ. Would come back maybe for happy hour instead.

Came here after seeing a show which happened to be on Taco Tuesday! We started with the Cadillac margarita. We also ordered carnitas tacos and the mole chicken enchiladas. All great and bartender was really good. Drink was strong but not undrinkable haha. The mole was outstanding and enchiladas were filled. The carnitas were cooked perfectly and tender.

Server highly recommended the Birria tacos. I love Birria in general, but this Birria was super bland and just really meh. Husband had the Al Pastor, and it was also pretty meh. Ambiance was really awesome though.

Love this place.  It's the second time I have been to this amazing restaurant.

The food is off the charts.  For appetizers we had three types of homemade guacamole each one better than the last. Delicious loaded nachos and perfectly cooked chicken wings with two dipping sauces.  Perfection

The entree were a burrito, a carnitas bowl and fish tacos.  We enjoyed every bite.  

The manager Rudy was super accommodating and friendly and our server Diane superb despite being really busy she maintained a friendly disposition and handled every request

Highly recommend Vida Verde for dinner or a happy hour

It was a nice atmosphere decoration and vibes wise, but not very busy at 5pm on a Saturday (maybe a red flag). This seems like more of a bottomless brunch spot versus dinner. Tried different parts of the menu and the food was super mid and overpriced. Margarita was average. Didn't leave feeling impressed and probably won't be back.

We came here for happy hour drinks and this place was absolutely fantastic! I ordered the Holy Smokes it's Mezcal cocktail which included, Lillet Blanc, grapefruit, lime, honey, bitters, salt. The cocktail was very balanced and refreshing with a little kick at the end.

The Vida Verde atmosphere is stunning! Fun, trendy, Mexican-style decor with a fun disco ball, lights & hanging flowers! The tables were also large and spacious. However, the high top stool seats were a bit uncomfortable. We did have technical difficulties that the staff was aware of. The menu QR codes did not work for anyone in our party and the wait staff had only one iPad to pass around from table to table to view their menu. This was only slightly inconvenient, but not a dealbreaker for me.

My party and I ordered drinks and appetizers to share. We had their happy hour special drinks - frozen pomegranate margaritas and passionfruit piña coladas. They were SO tasty, decently strong, and reasonably priced ($10 each during happy hour 5-7pm). You can also swirl the drinks if you want to mix the two!

We shared chips & guacamole, queso fundido, and esquites. The guac was fresh, served with cilantro, cotija cheese, & tomatoes. The queso fundido was very tasty and had a satisfying cheese pull with every bite. And the corn esquites was full of flavor with a bit of a kick! All 3 small plates were delicious.

After we ate, we headed upstairs to their mezzanine bar & patio. The patio did seem small and didn't have a large bar. I would probably sit inside again if I were to go back to visit. They also had a Thursday $8 tequila shot special, so we ordered a round at the mezzanine bar before heading out.

Overall, it was an awesome atmosphere with attentive waiters, yummy food & drinks, and lots of fun, colorful decor. I would visit again!

Came here the other night for happy hour drinks and this place was absolutely fantastic! Here were my favorite cocktails:

Holy Smokes it's Mezcal - Mezcal, Lillet Blanc, Grapefruit, Lime, Honey, Bitters, Salt: This was really well balanced and refreshing with just a tiny kick at the end

Penicillin - Monkey Shoulder, ginger, lemon, honey, laphroigh, Float: Perfect for a hot summer day.

Last Word - Gin, Green Chartreuse, Luxardo Maraschino, Lime Juice: Light refreshing and perfect for the summer!

IG: QueenOfAdventure NYC

Tonight must not be my night me and a few friends Dc wanted drinks but the bartenders made me feel uncomfortable . Kinda like they didn't wanna serve me and my friends . I rather spend my money somewhere else .  No type of attentiveness.

I came here on a Saturday for bottomless brunch and it was a vibe! For bottomless, it's $30 per person (with a purchase of an entree) and the entire table has to participate. Bottomless lasts for 90 minutes.

My friends and I got bellinis. We ordered a bowl, chilaquiles, and rancheros. The bellinis were really good and they just kept refilling our drinks throughout the time we were there. I got the huevos rancheros and felt that the portion was a little small.

But honestly the vibes of this restaurant were great! Service was good too.
Nice atmosphere and friendly bartender. I really enjoyed the frozen mojitos. We came for team social. It would've been nice if we could bring food to the rooftop though.

This place is awesome for after work drinks in midtown west / Hell's Kitchen. They have daily deals, awesome margs and fun ambiance. Only wish was that it had more vegetarian options. Service was pretty fast, even though we had our table for 1.5 hour we weren't rushed out.

Overall rating: 4.5

It felt like impossible to get brunch reservation here, but was successful after the 3rd or 4th time.

This place is loud. It's not not a club brunch, so just prepare yourself. That said, unlimited boozy brunch for 90 minutes for $30 with the purchase of an entree is a great deal in my eyes.

I read some of the low reviews and getting the food did take some time. However, there were so many people and the energy is high it wasn't that noticeable.

I was a little nervous that with reading the low reviews on service that we wouldn't get our money's worth on the bottomless. That is not the case! The drinks kept pouring. They come around every 5 min if not less, that it's hard to count how many servings I've had!

Food was soooo good. I had the chorizo sliders and they did not disappoint!

Would recommend if you're looking to get tipsy with your friends for a great price. Def not a date spot haha

The bartender Trevor is amazing!! My friend and I waited at the bar until our friends arrived. While we waited we were served by Trevor. He was funny and made a good margarita. He made my friend birthday special by giving us a shot. I  also had a watermelon margarita it tasted so fresh. We spilt the shrimp empanadas and the shrimps was juicy. For my meal I got chicken nachos(its on the small plate menu) and it was flavorful. I had a side of guacamole which made it perfect. The restaurant was beautiful inside and reminded me of being on vacation.

Ask for RALPH! Seriously one of the best servers we've ever had, and Super knowledgeable about the menu and allergies.  We actually moved from the bar when we realized the bartenders couldn't answer our questions, and I'm so glad we did! He completely made our night, and we were left wanting for nothing!

Additionally, this is a Bombbbbb restaurant! The vibe is awesome, great music playing the whole time, really cool drinks and super delicious food. I got the vegan enchiladas (cauliflower filled) with rice & beans. Not gonna lie, I thought it was spicy but I have a bit of a lower tolerance. My husband got the chicken enchiladas and said he loved them! And he actually added more spicy sauce, so either way, you'll get your food at the level you want it. I also got the tiki verde cocktail, soooooo good! And he had $5 happy hour beers! Seriously can't beat that deal! Very much recommend!

came here with my friends for pride brunch during pride week last year. a bit of a wait even with a reservation, but it's understandable since we had such a big party size (over 10). great vibes and decor while waiting so it helped pass the time. once seated, we sat in the long table next to the window. the staff were great with the endless booze during the brunch but the food was just ok and a bit on the pricier side but that's to expect in the city. otherwise, had a great time overall. definitely recommend

Perfect spot for a celebration.

They have a DJ on the weekends so can get load, take that into consideration,

Food is delicious but drinks can be a bit weak.

Decor is fab!

Great atmosphere, food was ok, service could improve. I have visited this restaurant about three times the happy hour is great. My friend adores this place but I've been to better places with much better service.

First Impressions: came here for a Happy Hour chill night with the girls. Love the ambiance and bartenders were all dope. This spot would also be great for dates so I'm definitely bringing the hubby here soon

The Noms: we mostly ordered a bunch of margaritas, which we're ALL delicious so far... still more we haven't tasted. We ordered chicken nachos at the bar and it was HUGE! Perfect because we came here straight from the movies and didn't get a chance to grab dinner. We ended up being so stuffed from the nachos that we skipped dinner and kept drinking til the bar closed

In Conclusion: do I recommend this spot? HELLS YEAH I DO! Take your boo thang or take your girls and you'll def have a good time

Omg i loved this place! I dont drink alcohol so i just got mock tails while my friend got the real adult juice, but my mock tails were delicious. Me and my friend sat at the rooftop (?) at the top floor and we had our own bar and stuff. The bartender was very friendly and entertaining lol. The only downside (but not a big deal at all) was if you sit outside, the menu is pretty limited so if you want a wide selection of drinks and food, you might have to go downstairs and order and come back. When I got hungry I just got yuca fries from the bar and OMG, they were so yum! I'd definitely come back here and I want to try their actual restaurant food.

I came here for a little snack and for the good vibes. This places sold on both. I ordered the blueberry coconut margarita with sugar and it was one point. I also ordered the chicken nachos. Far warning! Although the nachos say "small plate", there is nothing small about this serving size. The dish is perfect to share for 2 or many even 3 people. They were absolutely delicious though! The service was very good too.

Adding: This please is good I ate here 3x in the 2 weeks I was visiting NYC! Each time the food and drinks were spot on.

Vibe is good, especially with the DJ being there!
The decor is very vibrant and fun!

My party went for brunch and it was nice. Their guacamole was so fresh and flavorful.

I got the short rib tacos (which I wasn't anticipating to have eggs / so much of the egg in them).

The blueberry coconut margarita was refreshing, as was the peach margarita! Very strong and also super yummy!

My friend got the bowl with shrimp which she said was filling.

I'd love for them to always have a DJ there or have their own music playing louder in the restaurant.

Overall, I'd recommend it!

Lula was an excellent server! She answered all of our questions, was super friendly, checked in on us regularly, and offered stellar recommendations. She made our experience that much better.

I got the Birria burrito chimichanga and I'd get it again and again. So tasty. Crispy. Tons of food. I was stuffed. Loved the sauces like green Guac salsa, sour cream, and shredded lettuce. I could decorate every bite to be exactly how I wanted it to taste. So good. Served hot.

Fun atmosphere and lighting. Good Latino music.

Things I didn't love about it is the situation of paying $8 for a small chips and salsa. Most Mexican restaurants will serve that for free, and already things were a little expensive, so it'd be nice of the restaurant to throw a bone. But hey, I'm not a business owner! The food is on the pricier side, but it is really really tasty.

I came here for bottomless brunch with a party of 14 people to celebrate our friend's birthday. I had high expectations since there were high reviews on Yelp and my friend mentioned that it was recommended through TikTok. It is $30 for bottomless brunch, not including food. A purchase of an entree is required though. The first thing that left a bad taste in my mouth was when my friend excitedly chugged her first glass of mimosa and our waiter goes "You cannot do that You cannot chug." Mind you, the glass itself was very small and she was the birthday girl. I seriously thought he was joking but he ended up being completely serious. Anyway, that was the rule we had to follow. They do not serve pitchers for you to fill yourself. Our waiter had to refill every time we wanted more. What makes this experience a 1 star altogether is the fact that our waiter did not move at all when taking our orders. He stood at the end of our table and we had to scream across and pass along the message of our order for him to hear. WHO DOES THAT? That was a first for me, in any restaurant I have been to. The speakers were also right above our table and it was insanely hard to hear each other. The fact that our waiter did not accomodate to that was mind-blowing.

Moving onto the food... The food itself was nothing ordinary special. I ordered a chicken rice bowl and I can attest that Chipotle's rice bowls are 1000% better. However, two of my friends got the salad and I heard it was pretty good! But, the tacos, steak and eggs, etc were all very mediocre. We tried a large variety of entrees as a group.

I will say the positives are the cute decor and the live DJ that gives off good vibes. It was a shame that our service was absolutely terrible. I would not recommend this place to others nor come back again.

The drinks are delicious but the food not so much. We ordered empanada and the quesadilla mexican truffle mushroom. It was very salty and couldn't taste the truffle.
The place is good for hangout with friends & drinks.

You guys, we visited this place TWICE during our 5 day vacation, we are from cali and not even here have I found some delicious margaritas like these  I can't even begin to describe how freaking good the chicken nachos were too!!!! From the start, the service they gave us was excellent and very welcoming! I loved everything about this place from the decor to the music, truly recommend!

My husband and I really want to give a HUGE shoutout to our favorite bartender ELIAS!!! Thank you sooo much for making our margaritas so delicious, the flavor of each of them was soooo good! Like you can LITERALLY taste the flavor of each of the margaritas. We tried the watermelon, cantoulpe, cucumber, tamarindo and passion fruit in which they each tasted so delicious! Muchas gracias por atendernos bien, y por ser muy atento a darnos un buen servicio! Shoutout to your manager as well  

We will DEFINETLY BE BACK!

I never thought that I would have rated this Tik Tok reccommended spot with 1 star...

We made a reservation for a party of 14 people. They did not seat us until our whole party arrived but due to the weather and parking conditions we had a couple of stragglers.

They finally seated our party but we were right under the speakers so it was very loud and I felt a headache incoming. Never the less, we were there for a good time so we did not make it a big deal. The stools were really tiny and we had no place to put our belongings down.

First bad impression was when the waiter took our orders he stayed at the head of the table and we had to SCREAM OUR ORDERS TO HIM. I was getting frustrated because the table was really long and we were right under the speakers so I do not understand why he did not walk around like a normal person to take our orders.

Second bad impression was when the birthday girl chugged her mimosa and asked immediately for a refill and the waiter said "you can't do that, you can't chug your drink". This was the first time I ever went to the bottomless brunch spot and was told how much we can and can not drink... It was $30 for the bottomless on top of 1 entree each. In addition, we were not given pitchers and the waiter said he would make his rounds to everyone in the restaurant to fill our tiny glasses.

Now lets talk about the food.. I did not think it was possible for Mexican food to be bland but this place proved me wrong. I tried asking for salt, sauce, ANYTHING to add some flavor to my bland food and it was very difficult to flag down a staff. The drinks themselves were also very very sweet; it tasted like juice with a dash of alcohol.

The only positive thing I would say about this place is that the decor was giving Mexico party vibes and the live DJ hosted a dance party for free shots.

Overall, I was very dissappointed with my experience here and I will not be returning. Also note that for large parties there is an automatic 20% gratuity.

I went here with a girlfriend and we had such a good time! The vibe was a bar scene with dim lighting and lots of cute decor. The drinks were STRONG.. those sweet but deadly ones. We had the frozen passion fruit and hibiscus margaritas during happy hour for 10 dollars and they were the highlight of the night. For starters, we had the guac and chips.
