Guac was fresh and limey, could use some more salt and spice. I had the steak and cheese tacos, they were good but could use a salsa and more salt as well. My friend had the fish tacos they were delicious! I would definetly come back and try different entrees ,  I saw they had a rooftop as well, maybe for reservation but I would def try that! Dope spot overall especially if you're trying to get lit.

Disfruta unos ricos tacos con un cocktail delicioso-  
Visite Vida Verde con mis hermanas en una noche de chicas y nos divertimos un montón! Buena musica, buenos tragos, en un ambiente súper divertido. Yo disfruté una Paloma de Piña y unos tacos de calle que estaban exquisitos.  Es un buen lugar para pasar un momento súper.

I like Mexican and highly rated restaurants so GF chose this place to close out our BravoCon weekend in NYC.

We waltzed in without a reservation at around 9pm on a Sunday night and were informed we would have to wait a while for a table BUT there was bar seating available which was the clear choice.

The vibe in here is pretty cool. Think dark and neon with a Mexican twist.

Full disclosure we had already been drinking all day (JK future or current employers) at BC so memory is a bit fuzzy but I do recall seeing a bunch of intriguing items on the drink menu. I whore out for micheladas so it was game over when I saw MANGO michelada on the menu. I couldn't really explain what exactly it was but if memory serves, it's a michelada with mango cart beer and even though it sounds weird, it actually goes really well together. Extra points for serving something that is unusual and not the same fucking shit I drink everywhere else.

When asking GF what she had to drink, "I honestly don't even remember, I think some sort of tequila drink that got me wasted".

TBH it was already decided before we even got there that we were having nachos, Fortunately, they have nachos on the menu as I would expect for a Mexican place but unfortunately, they don't actually have nachos or at least didn't have them that night. What kind of Mexican place doesn't have nachos?!?!?

I was in the bathroom and would have probably elected to swap with queso but GF made a quick decision and instead went with the salsa and chips. The salsa was pretty good, nice and flavorful, but the chips were the star of this. They are crispy and not overly greasy. You can definitely tell that they are homemade.

We also ordered the yucca fries and as someone who could live off of condiments, I appreciate the fact that they serve these crispy sticks of heaven with FOUR dipping sauces. I'm glad to look up what they are for the review because I can admit I had no idea what on earth I was eating at the time: mole, aji amarillo, kalamata olive, and chipotle AIOLIs. They were all so good I just wish there were more fries to scoop up that shit.

I was pleased to see some vegetarian tacos on the menu: the cauliflower tacos with roasted ancho-Chile cauliflower, poblano pepper, onion, tomato, baby arugula, salsa verde, avocado, and radish on corn tortillas. These bad boys were STUFFED to the point where I literally could barely pick them up. There was definitely a ton of flavor here but as I'm not keen on onions, I wasn't head over heels for said flavor and relinquished the third taco to GF.

Just to top everything off, GF ordered a side of beans and rice which comes with that white chunky cheese. You really can't go wrong with this one anywhere but they did us right here.

Service was good and food came out quickly. Overall, a good experience but I do wish they had nachos.

We came here brunch and we absolutely loved it! We made reservations for right when it opened so it took a while for it to get into its vibes, but the music that was playing was amazing and it had a little bit of everything!

they have bottomless brunch and we decided to go with the passionfruit bellinis, which were delicious! on their website, they also advertise high noons, but you have to ask your server for them, because they won't just tell you they have them. our server kept us replenished on high noons and bellinis all brunch long!

the food was amazing and so flavorful. i had the sliders and i loved them cause they werent too filling but helped me not get too drunk haha! they say that they have a strict 90 minutes for brunch, but we were there for about 2 hours, so that might be at the discretion of the server.

perfect brunch to end my trip in NYC

Honestly, I wanted to love this place, easy location, great vibes and well known. However, while the music was on point and party vibes were fun the real base of this spot being the drinks and food just didn't hit. I ordered the passion fruit margarita on the rocks and it was tasty but not fantastic. Then I ordered the cauliflower tacos which were ok but for the potential burst of flavor that it appeared to be it just didn't meet expectations. I also felt the music was so loud to have a conversation in; wish before 9 it wasn't so loud. Lastly, the service was good so I will commend them for that. Overall, I'd return for drinks and vibes but not the food.

Food came out really quick. Tacos are a bit small but everything else was fine. I thought they would have table side guacamole but it came premixed. Tostadas were also good but a bit salty.

Margaritas were good as well. I recommend the peach margarita. Wasn't that big of a fan of the mango habanero marg

Got a table for 2 right away on a Friday night. They are 21+ for dinner and they check IDs.

They had LOUD music pumping all night. More of a party/club restaurant rather than a nicer restaurant. Reminds me of margaritaville honestly.

Came to this establishment after being recommended by a friend.

Location was easy to find and walking distance from Broadway. I made a reservation for a late dinner after a show.

Music was lively. Service was great. The decor and vibe was spot on.

I ended up ordering pork belly tacos and devoured them before I could snap a picture. They were so good I needed to try them again. Luckily, I remembered to get a picture before I ate the second set!

This is a must when in the NY Central Park area.
Reservations are recommended as this place can get very packed and the tables are limited.
To start, the service was great right from the get-go.
We arrived half hr early but were seated immediately.
The server recommended great food, it was fast, tasty, and not too pricey.
Would definitely come back.
Make sure you go upstairs to have a drink

Such a fun spot for good drinks and good food! I had dinner here last month as part of a group of 4 (tip: make a reservation!). I ordered the Chicken Quesadilla and Tiki Verde cocktail, which were both fantastic. And the music! For those who don't do well with loud environments, this might not be the best spot for you. But, I was dancing in my seat pretty much the entire time! I will definitely be sharing this place with friends.

Visited with some friends on a Monday night which is an unusual outing for me. Surprised by how many people were here getting their margs in.

I ordered the birria tacos, a tamarind and blueberry coconut margs as chasers. The beef brisket was tasty, tender and paired great with the consume. That being said, 3 tacos for $20? They're not even a large size...you're mostly paying for the location. The drinks were really good and discounted, had some flavors here that I've never tried before!

Vibes were dope, they played Spanish music and had $10 margs all night. Rooftop was open until 10 PM. They have 2 floors each with a bar. Service was just ok although the bartender was nice.

Will return on a weekend night to feel it out a bit more.

Food: was very hit or miss. All the appetizers were amazing. Ordered guacamole salsa and chips. The chips were fresh and warm and salsa and guacamole were amazing. The yucca fries were also a hit at the table, not too greasy at all. I ordered the Baja fried fish taco which were not good. The fish was soggy and had little flavor and tortilla was also soggy and fell apart. I tried my friends Norris quesadilla which was good (maybe too much meat in some bites) with good flavor. Drinks left much to be desired. Had happy hour frozen marg which was very sweet and not too strong and classic pitchers at the table. Flavor was just okay and they were not very strong and pitcher came full of mostly ice (1 pitcher served 4 we were told).

Service: servers were great friendly and attentive! Worked very hard to keep table clean, provide refills where needed and check on table in general.

Price: found everything to be a little pricy for the quality. I've had better for less

Ambiance: decor is great and vibrant! It is a loud place with great music. Great for groups maybe not romantic date unless you want to yell at your date or not hear what's they're saying. Didn't get to go upstairs but the area downstairs and bathroom were both clean and decorative.

Taco Tuesdays! Every Tuesday they have a $10 for 3 tacos special (chicken, carnitas or cauliflower).

I got the carnitas tacos and they were flavorful and juicy. Also the drinks here are pretty strong and not too sweet--which I like. I got the vida verde and a mezcal margarita.

This place is definitely lit inside lol like the inside decor has a disco/Christmas vibe. It's pretty cool! But the music was far too loud and there were no tables on a Tuesday at 6:30pm.

But thankfully the rooftop patio was open so we ordered our food + drinks at the bar inside and bought it to the rooftop where I had a much better time. It was chill outside and I could actually hear people talk. I don't understand why restaurants blast music--Do they want people to yell at each other?

All in all I would return for the food and drinks! I'd just prefer to sit in the rooftop patio area.

FIRE FOOD AND SERVICE!!!!

We went here for a friends birthday and had a huge party of 15. They had a DJ, it was saturday night and he was playing good tunes (afrobeats, rnb, reggaton)

We ordered a bunch of drinks and apps and it came out soooo quick. the chips and guac is FIREEEE!!

HUGE shoutout to our server jesus, he was amazing and sooooo nice. gave me great recommendations on the menu.

i got the pork belly and birria tacos and wow oh wowww they were amazing!!!! literally melted in my mouth and was very filling!

they brought out a cute dessert with a sparkler too.

i would highly recommend coming for a big party or even date night!

Dear Yel-pers!

Such a fun night here! Got here for a late brunch and the music was pumping! They had a bottomless option however K and I opted for their cool cocktails and margaritas. I was able to snag a ducky fish bowl  that I absolutely adored! Took two of those little bad boys home! Wasn't a fan of the seating but everything else made up for it. Service was good, food was decent, drinks were amazing.The group had a lot of fun stayed for most of the night!

8 out of 10 DO Recommend

Best pizza in town! I can't believe they don't have a line out the door already. The staff told me this place just opened up not too long ago, I think it's only a matter of time before they get really popular.

I order the Margherita slice and it's probably the best slice pizza I ever had in Manhattan. I can tell they use the best ingredients for their pizza. I will keep coming back here for a long time. Yummm!!! This place is a MUST TRY!
Stopped in to check it out, an other NYC pizzeria that we dont need. 2 stars for not being original

Glad to once again have a place nearby where I can grab a decent slice. Prices seem a bit high for anything other than a plain slice, since the other types of pies & slices didn't seem all that impressive. This isn't midtown or the Village, the "just ok" quality doesn't justify slices that are $3+ & pies that are $24+. But hopefully they settle in & tweak things to improve the quality to match the price. Had a plain & a grandma--plain was good, typical tasty NY slice, grandma was so-so, maybe had been sitting out or made yesterday? Overall good for what you get, & a much-needed slice/pie place in the neighborhood.
My server was very attentive and the ambiance was lovely. Food and drinks came out fast. I was very pleased with my experience! I will definitely be back!

Personal, familiar, down to earth place with great food and great people, very hard to come by in a fast paced city like New York. Great service all around from the moment you walk in - it's very easy to feel seen and heard. My go to when I make plans to see people or just sit to read and work for a bit with some dessert and drinks in a lovely neighborhood. ps love the cod and olive oil cake.
One of my favorite spots to get a bite in the city. I love the ambiance in the restaurant and the service is just impeccable. If you decide to go do yourself a favor and get the Black Spaghetti.

My friend and I came to this elegant spot for dinner. The space is cozy with lovely, simple decor with dim lighting.

Upon being seated, we were served complimentary focaccia bread with olive oil and vinegar. The bread was nice and fluffy, topped with fresh herbs. It tasted wonderful with the traditional mixture of olive oil and vinegar.

For the appetizer, we shared the Fried Calamari, which came with paprika aioli. There was a generous helping of the calamari, which was perfectly light and crispy, well seasoned, pairing well with the bold flavored creamy sauce.

I was set on ordering the Black Sea Bass, but it wasn't available, so went for the Cod, which came with wild mushroom risotto, made with red pepper flakes and lemon. The Cod was pan seared with a slight crunch, delicate, flaky, tender, as well as flavorful. The risotto was enjoyable, with plenty of cheese and mushroom.

As for dessert, we tried the Olive Oil Cake, which had berry compote and fresh whipped cream. This was oh so tasty! The cake was super moist, melt in your mouth delicious, while the berry compote was juicy, sweet, with luscious, velvety whipped cream. All the ingredients mingled beautifully together.

Service was solid. Our waiter was friendly and made sure we were taken care of throughout the meal. My friend and I enjoyed our time here. I would be open to returning to try the Polenta Fries, NY Strip Steak Au Poivre, or Short Rib Ragu.

I'm being generous with 3 stars. It's so overpriced & they aren't concerned with attempting to justify it. I ordered a MOCKtail, costed the same as my table mates who had cocktails, there's came in a Collins glass in mine came in a rocks glass. How does that make sense? How can I have less liquid in a glass full of ice for the same price when I don't even have any alcohol in mine?

We got there shortly before closing, not my choice. I told my table mates, but I don't like to go to restaurants right before they close. I was out numbered. Sure enough... Food is coming out missing a side dish. Turns out, they're out of it. No one offered to replace it or to take anything off the check, just serve a deficient dish and look the other way? My friend spoke up and he did get a substitute upon his request. Another dish did not come out how it was described at all. I believe it was some kind of short rib. I don't remember exactly, but basically he described the dish one way it comes out completely different, and it was not good at all. There was Branzino, there was duck breast... tiny bites of food. The Branzino& the duck were good, but it was just something you would see in a movie to mock fine dining. It's $30 for two slices of food or something. I waited too long after I dined to make this review, so it's a little bit fuzzy, lol. But I just remembered it seemed like it was a place that wanted to be very important and it's not. if it were priced better, I would feel differently but I know fine dining, I worked in fine dining. If you're going to charge this kind of money, then I want to see why I'm paying these prices and when you don't show me that, then it's an imposter situation. A wannabe fancy place.

I had a nice dining experience at Vinateria recently. I went to have dinner with a friend 8pm one night and I was glad I made the drive from Brooklyn.

The restaurant was dimly lit and had music playing softly when we got there. It was a romantic vibe and gave all the feels on a perfect summer night. The staff was very attentive and came over quickly to seat my friend and I.

They gave us our menus and told us the specials for the evening, which is what I ended up having (mushroom risotto with cod). For appetizers, we had coconut curry mussels and bacalao fritters. My friend had the grilled octopus for his entree. The grilled octopus was the standout dish! It was cooked to perfection--not too chewy nor overly done. I wish I'd ordered my own, but that's okay because it won't take me a long time to order as it did this visit, lol. My mushroom risotto was a bit lacking in the flavor department. It was very rich and creamy which I was happy about but it was bland to me. My friend (who is a chef) said he thought it tasted really good. My cod was too fresh for my liking. I would've liked it to have more seasoning. I ended up bringing my entree home and spicing it up a bit more before I had it again. Sea salt and black pepper did the job.

For the chill, romantic vibes and great hospitality, I'll be back. The table that came with the bread was damn good too! Focaccia bread with lots of herbs and oil--my lord! Heavenly! All in all, I had a lovely time dining at Vinateria. I hope to be back soon! This time, I'll make sure I treat myself to dessert!

It is amazing how many new restaurants have opened in Harlem these past few years. (Hotels too)  We we're staying nearby and came here for dinner and we're pleasantly surprised. They were pretty busy, and the service was a little spotty, but the food was very good. We started with wine and cocktails, marinated olives, cheese and crackers, polenta fries and roasted mushrooms. I ordered the whole branzino- admittedly the presentation was different. I've never had it served whole as if it were still in motion- at first I thought some ingredients were forgotten until
I realized it was stuffed. It was a nice mix of flavors - chef's intention was for each bite to encompass all of the flavors and they all paired nicely together.  I can't recall what everyone else ordered but we all left very full and very happy. Highly recommend it.

My friends and I went around the corner of their building into the restaurant. It has started to rain so we didn't want to venture to far. We hit the Brunch Time as it was expiring.
Calamari Fritti for starter, it was crispy and non-greasy. The dip sauce a pinkish Chipotle Aioli was good.
The Applewood Smoked Bacon Cheeseburger were cooked to our different tastes and Mimosas to complement the meal.
Service was prompt and attentive.
Ambiance, ok, it got very loud at times.

Vinateria, an upscale Italian-Spanish restaurant in Harlem, New York. Chic, comfortable, intimate, and contemporary vibe. Serving comfort food deeply rooted in the culinary traditions of both Italy and Spain. How was it?:  Great! More satisfying in taste than I imagined. I started with the "Bitter Truth" cocktail; a sweet vodka-based cocktail made and refreshed with cucumber. Then I added the "Bacalao Croquettes," breaded fish balls set in chipotle aioli. And for dinner, I had the "Black Spaghetti." This is the dish that brought me here! I heard it was good; and what I heard was nothing less than the truth. Made with black spaghetti  noodles, octopus, bay scallops, and mussels  It was absolutely scrumptious!

I dined at this restaurant on May 16, 2023 for a friend's birthday dinner. We had a 6pm reservation for 4. Upon arrival once the hostess was available to greet me she was friendly and sat me at my table right away.

For appetizers we had the oysters which were very tasty, the bacalao croquettes which I was not a fan of, the veal meatballs were very good and the Brussels sprouts which were also yummy.

The drinks were weak and not mixed well. Once I changed to my go to drink (vodka/seltzer) the drinks were better. My guests were also not impressed with their drinks as well.

My dinner unfortunately was not that good. I got the
ROSEMARY PAPPARDELLE which is lamb Ragu with Fresh Ricotta. It lacked flavor and I was not a fan of the lamb. It was ground meat. I thought it would have been shredded lamb as in other restaurants when I have opted for this meal.  However my other guests thoroughly enjoyed their dinner choices. Fish and lamb chops.

Lastly the service. While our server was friendly and nice, it was slow and lacked attention.

Overall, great ambiance and vibe. If I did go back it would be for the happy hour good menu and try the fish.

Despite my experience I would tell anyone to check it out for themselves
I had an amazing seafood pasta in addition to wonderful fresh shucked oysters.  I wanted dessert but I was too stuffed.  The focaccia bread was also delicious.  I will definitely return.

From start to finish, the meal at Vinateria was a true delight. The first course was a fresh and vibrant salad that burst with flavors and textures. The greens were crisp, the dressing was tangy, and the addition of crunchy nuts and sweet fruits added a perfect touch of sweetness.

For the main course, I ordered the chicken dish with mashed potatoes. The chicken was cooked to perfection, juicy and tender with a crispy skin, and the mashed potatoes were smooth and creamy. The combination of the two was heavenly, and I savored every bite. The portion size was generous, too, which made for a satisfying and filling meal.

To cap off the meal, I had the olive oil cake, which was a delicious and unique dessert. The cake had a moist and dense texture with a subtle olive oil flavor that was complemented by the sweetness of the accompanying sauce. It was a perfect end to the meal and left me feeling satisfied and content.

Throughout the meal, the service was top-notch, and the owner's personal touch made it all the more special. I highly recommend Vinateria for anyone looking for a delicious and memorable dining experience in Harlem.

This is a solid spot to have as something to check out while in the neighborhood, though I don't know about an all the time thing. We showed up on weekend evening without a reservation (I didn't want to make a resy account) and they could only offer us the outdoor heated pod. TBH, I loved it! It's got a better feeling of privacy, cozy, and has lots of noise canceling foam. They checked on us a lot at the start but not so much at the end.

The first thing we were asked was if we wanted any wine, decided not for tonight. We ordered the formaggi, black spaghetti, linguini de mare, and Brussels sprouts. The waiter offered to send the brussels with the cheese plate despite it not being labeled an antipasti or the pastas, with the recommendation for the latter which we ended up going with. To be honest, it was a lot of food for two people and we probably didn't need all that! The focaccia we were given was delicious with the oils it was served with. The formaggi wasn't super interesting, even as someone who loves Brie. The black spaghetti had a lovely flavor and texture with the noodles being a bit tacky and cheesey. The linguini de mare had a very contrasting fresh tomatoey taste. The Brussels were well cooked through, among the better I've had.

Came here for a happy hour and fell in love! The ambiance is gorgeous, the service was impeccable, and everything we tried was amazing! Got all happy hour bites, including fries, asparagus, oysters, meatballs and the fried fish balls (blanking on the name!) and it was heavenly. The spritz on the happy hour menu was also a delightful, different take on the traditional summer drink made with an apertivo I hadn't heard of. Will definitely be back for dinner!
This was my first visit to this restaurant it was very sexy! The food was delicious. The bread was very tasty. I would recommend the two dishes we had.

Came here for Happy Hour and some food.  Sat at the bar.  What a lovely neighborhood place!  Loved the atmosphere which was cozy and inviting and the food and service were wonderful.  Orders yummy items off the generous Happy Hour Menu and also delicious scallops from the regular menu.  Can't wait to go back!

Love this place. They have a really great happy hour seven days a week (Matador cocktail is ), the employees are cool & friendly, & the vibes are always right. Menu highlights for me are the Brussel sprouts, polenta fries, the octopus, & the lamb chops. Olive oil cake is also delicious. Unpretentious but pretty place where you can get delicious food (& I recently learned they focus on buying from women owned wineries first which is cool). I come here at least monthly if not more often.

My birthday celebration dinner in NYC...came here with a friend.  We debated about whether we wanted to come here, but we had reservations and we decided to keep.  So glad we did!!!

I ordered the pan seared salmon, they were gracious enough to let me substitute the cous cous for the risotto and mushrooms!!!
Win/win!!!  It was a amazing and my friend ordered the pan seared scallops, which he also enjoyed.

We ordered the gelato and the olive oil cake, and somehow we ended up with all the desserts!!!  All amazing and delightful!  I think the person who gave us the desserts was Gabriella, who was very kind, attentive and just cute as a button!

Loved the ambiance and it seems to be a popular place!!! So grateful we kept the reservation and experienced this...it would have been ashame to miss!  Definitely will be back next time I am in town!

I'm astonished that it has been so long since I've dined @ Vinatería and embarrassed that I have never penned a review... Both of those realization must now be extinguished.

Last Thursday my office hosted a work soirée hosted @ Vinatería and it was wonderful.

There was an array of tapas and small plates and they were all delicious. A few of my favs were the polenta fries, the white fish balls and the calamari. Another audience favorite were the veal meatballs, which had a hint of spice. We all enjoyed the endless flow of vino.

The staff was gracious and efficient as they balanced their evening crowd along with the boisterous group of  RE agents.

Happy I have been reintroduced to this local gem.

Just A Note:

Will update my review when I return, since I do not remember my dishes from so long ago.

One of the best meals I've had in NYC! It's definitely pricey, but it's perfect for a special occasion as the taste and quality are definitely there.

My party ordered the Brussels sprouts and polenta fries appetizers to start. Both were great. The polenta fries, served with an aioli, were in particular a big hit with the gluten free members of the table.

For my entree, I ordered the black sea bass, which comes served over mushroom risotto. Holy moly...I can't recommend this dish enough. The fish was perfectly cooked, with a crisp outside and tender inside. The risotto was fantastic. I was thrilled to have leftovers for the next day's lunch.

Other members of my party had the salmon, chicken, and branzino. Everyone loved their entrees.

For dessert, my girlfriend and I split the tiramisu. It was small but decadent. Others shared the chocolate mousse, which they liked.

Overall would highly recommend dinner at Vinatería to celebrate a birthday, anniversary, or graduation.

Ambiance was beautiful. Loved the lighting and set up with both outdoor and indoor seating.

Started with cod croquettes. So glad we got these instead of calamari!

Portions were good as well. I had the black spaghetti with seafood .... I kind of wish there was more pasta to balance out the amount of seafood you get, which is rare! Most places skimp on seafood in their pasta.

Finished off with the olive oil cake. It was good, but not as sweet as I was expecting.

Service often left us waiting for some time, but can't blame them -- it was super busy on a Friday night. Still, they did the little things like switch out my plate where I kept my mussel shells.

This place was recommended by many locals. I came by tonight and it's WOW. Service is amazing. Food is so delicious. And they let me seat were it was convenient for my dog and I outside. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Another wonderful time at Vinatería.
It keeps on proving to be one my favorite restaurants in Harlem.
I came to brunch with a friend.
The food options are varied and tasty. I had the Autumn Salad with chicken and for dessert the olive oil cake with berry compote.
The atmosphere is always relaxing, pleasant. Great for conversions. The lighting and decor are elegant.
The staff are always welcoming, friendly, attentive, and engaging.
And the owner is a pleasure to converse with and ask for meal suggestions.

I can't wait to come back again.

The service could've been better and we understood it was busy. It was a Sunday brunch afternoon.

The calamari for starters was more on the greasy side, but the black spaghetti was exceptional. One of my friends thought it was on the salty side but overall good.

Back again a year later. I easily made a reservation for two in the afternoon the day before going. It was rainy so the crowd was slow to come in but it's clearly still a local favorite. Today I had huevos rancheros, coffee, the French 75, and the Loretta. The coffee was so good. I looked it up and it's a small local POC women-owned brand (Kape Catorce). The French 75 is easy to drink, while the Loretta is stronger but still sweet. The huevos rancheros felt like a nice balanced meal. I really liked the chili sauce on the side. Servers were attentive. Solid restaurant.

Came here recently for brunch after a two year or so hiatus, and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The service was great and attentive, my cocktail was memorable and their brunch deal was better than what I remembered. If you're looking for an affordable brunch in the area or you're just tired of Lido (lol) come check this place out. My picks? The blood orange pancakes are my fav, and I will always say splurge and go for the bottle service if you're looking for a boozy brunch. But their brunch entree and mimosa deal will also set you right as well.

Went up here for the underwhelming tree lighting and so since I don't know this area and I was scrambling to find a place to eat and found this place.

Came here and they were completely booked even though resy said 15 minutes, but the manager or owner was nice enough to offer a table outside. Sure it is cold, but I liked sitting outside and I want to say the restroom here really threw me off. I thought the light wasn't turned on, but it actually was on and so it is super dark and the toilet is black....so just pray to God and may the force be with you that you're not stepping in a puddle of urine or whatever.
I would love a well-lit restroom and not to mention, don't come here on your dates since you can't even go do an appearance check.

Anyways, food and service was good.

Got the following:
focaccia - complimentary and it has a nice texture but the olive oil could have been better. Not aromatastic.

Calamari fritti - good and paprika dip paired nicely, but wish there were some legs mixed with it.

Grilled lamb chop - flavour profile is good, but felt it was too overdone. Could've been better when it is medium-rare rather than well done. It made it tough.

Rosemary pappardelle  - noodles were cooked perfectly and lamb ragu was nice but then once the noodles were gone, it was pretty salty and couldn't really eat it on its own.

creme brulee - okay, this has to be the thinnest version I ever had in my life. The ramekin depth was a complete joke. Do better with the size. It is a lounging pool made for flies. Good, but seriously, where is the rest of it?

Chocolate gelato - eh, I wasn't too into it and I think it might have been hazelnut or just chocolate with chunks of hazelnut.

I would come back here but now I know what to expect in terms of the bathroom and the brulee.

Came through for brunch with friends - this was my first time dining at Vinateria, and the experience was great! Service was very friendly and attentive, the food was very good. The patrons all seemed to be enjoying themselves, and I could see this is a great place to hang out with friends on any given day. My food was perfectly cooked, which made me extremely happy. Definitely will visit again!

Food is meh. Started with the burrata w/ prosciutto and melon. This was good bad 3 measly pieces of prosciutto. It was filled with arugula instead. For the entre, I ordered the black squid pasta and it had zero flavor! Total disappointment. The drinks were good but weak. So weak the waitress took one of the drinks off. I would stick to apps and maybe wine. It's good for people watching but not a decent meal.

Really enjoyed the ambiance and the people that worked there are super nice. We ordered the calamari appetizer which was perfectly breaded, salted, with a nice crunch. The spicy aioli that came with it was bomb!

For entrees we ordered the fettuccine ragu, scallops special and brussel sprouts. Entrees were solid but not impressive. I will say the brussel sprouts side dish was the best out of everything. Nicely caramelized and flavorful.

Drinks were poured heavily so we were happy about that!

Took points off for service and underwhelming entrees. We never really had a server. Kind of seemed like a group effort and it wasn't done well.

Stellar meal here with such a delicious menu! Came here for dinner and was sat quickly. The service was quick and our wine was poured basically after we ordered. Decided to go for the roasted asparagus to share, the lamb ragu over past and the olive appetizer. The olive appetizer was very good - lots of salty and yummy olives with hummus and bread, a well put together appetizer. The asparagus was perfectly cooked and large portion to boot. The bernaise sauce on top was extremely good and elevated the dish nicely. The lamb ragu was outrageous. The ricotta on top was fun to mix around and make the dish a little richer. Savory and warmly spiced, this pasta dish was sumptuous and I was sad when it was gone! My partner got the sea bass, which was actually quite a delicious piece of fish. Glad to know I can keep this in my rotation of restaurants as this place ruled!

We walked in to dine.  The owner was mopping the floor. He said a rat had walked in from outside.  We were going to leave.  The truth was even worse. A diner walked back in to ask for her money back.  She told us the rat had dropped onto her table from the ceiling.

Black owned baby! That's first! Lol. This was a beautiful restaurant. The lighting, the decor, the bar location. Super sexy place. I ordered the chicken dish because Sam had such good things to say about it! I rarely order chicken from restaurants because I really like to get down on menu. It was such a hug to my belly! The mash and the greens gave the dish such a home for dinner feeling. I was HAPPY. I also had the veal meat balls over polenta. The veal had such a good spice level and the polenta reminded me a of grits. I could be wrong about this but I would have liked if the meat ball wasn't cooked so well. I had to use a knife to cut comfortably. Nothing to crazy but just an observation! I loved everything about this experience and can't wait to come with my honey. Service was so on point and it was BUSYYYYY! Thanks sam for all your accommodations

Excellent food and service all around. We had a variety of apps (the croquettes were my favorite), then the strip steak, ordered rare, which came out perfect. Then crème brûlée to share. The cocktail that I had tasted like a creamsicle. Yum. Will definitely come back.

So I was scrolling through yelp looking for recommendations on what I should order and low and behold who do I see? Me from four years ago! Ahhh young Jason in 2019, so naive with no idea of what was yet to come. Decided to listen to my pre-pandemic self and ordered the French toast and it was, in fact, hot diggity dog.
Squid ink Pasta is delightful. My best friend and I love it here. I'm glad it's remained a Harlem staple.

Expecting better from a Michelin rated, black owned establishment on Harlem's restaurant row. Drinks are good and curated. The service is decent. The food leaves much to be desired. Honestly the table bread was the best thing I ate tonight: here, overcooked black scallops served with equally black and over salted Brussel sprouts and thin "butternut squash" puree. Im concerned that either everyone from line prep cook to expeditor thought this was good enough to leave the window, or no one gave a F at 8pm on a weekday.

Salmon was delicious. Had to swap the accompaniment for dietary reasons. Loved my cocktail. Service was good, an almost perfect dining experience.

Dietary restrictions: It was a bit limited
Food: 4/5  |  Service: 4/5  |  Atmosphere: 4/5

"This is the bomb"= my mom after one bite of the pan seared cod. And it was. As was the black spaghetti which was full of mussels and octopus. We enjoyed the drinks (on Happy Hour on a Saturday= this is such a nice touch).  We were well taken care of from entry to seating. My father rides out with a Walker and they were super accommodating to make sure he could move throughout the space and sit without issue. The vibe was comfy and welcoming and the music was NOT louder than the conversation which was important for us. We are looking forward to returning.

Vinatería has really nice food, worth the visit! Make sure you get a reservation or go get on the list early because it can get busy on the weekends.

To be honest their food is delicious, fresh, and perfectly cooked. We tried the BACALAO CROQUETTES (COD) (x5), definetely a must they taste so fresh and the bechamel is really good, the PAN SEARED BLACK SEA BASS (over a mushroom risotto base) and the BLACK SPAGHETTI. They also have complimentary BREAD with olive oil and balsamic. I was feeling like having a red, even with seafood, and I tried the red wine Château Biac, it was a very good choice, the pours were large ;)

ESPAÑOL:
Vinatería tiene una comida increíble, merece la pena la visita! Asegúrate de hacer una reserva o ver con tiempo para ponerte en la lista, puede estar bastante lleno los fines de semana.

Sinceramente, la comida es deliciosa, fresca y perfectamente cocinada. Probamos las CROQUETAS DE BACALAO (x5), una apuesta segura, sabían muy frescas y la bechamel está muy buena, además probé el PAN SEARED BLACK SEA BASS (sobre una base de risotto de setas) y los BLACK SPAGUETTI. Sirven pan con aceite de oliva y balsámico muy rico y gratis! Me apetecía un tinto, incluso con marisco, y probé el Château Biac, una buena elección, la copa estaba bastante llena ;)

Poor service and the food was bland. I needed salt and couldn't find my waiter. I had to flag someone cleaning tables for salt. The picture is my meal that I stopped eating because didn't have any flavor. My daughter asked for her lamb to be cooked medium and they were well done. We couldn't find the waiter to ask for them to be redone.
Food was tasty with decent portions. The customer service was great as well as the drinks. Hadn't been there in years, but was glad to be back and will go again soon!

Great ambience and creative menu. Tried the hangar steak, pollo al mattone, red snapper special,  and a chicken schnitzel special aswell as the patatas fritas, brocolini, risotto. Was good but a tad salty on some dishes.  I always appreciate complimentary bread too

I went to Brunch today and it was beyond sub par. The food was cold and seemed microwaved. They gave us one menu for our table of four because they were 'low on menus' even though there were only 5 other tables currently eating. We waited for our fourth guest to get their meal and ten minutes later it arrived and our food was then cold. No acknowledgement and no apology. I live down the street and I gave it a few try's over the years and it's gotten worse and worse. We still left 20% because the staff seemed sad and wanting to be anywhere else. Avoid this restaurant. It's past it's prime.

Great food! Their cheeseburger with bacon is great!
Great cocktails. Great appetizers.
I suggest reservations. Very popular place.
Service is provided by a friendly and efficient staff.
The atmosphere is darker and intimate than most other restaurants. Not a bad thing!

My neighborhood restaurant. Outdoor seating is nice especially on 119th. I always order the Bacall croquettes and could eat two orders for a meal. The beet salad is also nice. Main courses are interesting- I usually order scallops, white fish, or chicken and they have all been quite good. Great cocktails too!

We found this restaurant online based on the ratings we got on google maps.
We order  fries and Calamari for appetizer and Chicken and a pasta for main dish.
The appetizers were good and it tasted fantastic. However, we did not like our main dish. The dish did mot have any salt and the taste was a little bit weird.
It was our first time trying this kind of food. Also their menu was either french

I love the vibe, food and decor of Vinatería. I highly recommend. My friend and I shared the beets + Brussels sprouts. I loved my Rosemary Pappadelle (lamb ragu with ricotta) the sauce was so flavorful and the noodles super fresh. I tasted the vegetarian dish my friend ordered--if I were going meatless I would select this dish. The restaurant played hip hop in the background and the lighting was dim. Our waiter, Dan, was very pleasant. Looking forward to returning my next visit to Harlem.

Our wedding party dinner was a smash hit at Vinateria. The carefully arranged table outside for a large group was beyond thoughtful and
pretty. Wine director Tom Odeen and his super attentive, graceful
team of servers saw to our every need. The food here is home-cooked
delicious. You could be in some ristorante on the Spanish-Italian border,
and never want to leave. Following, for just two options, the scrumptious house-made black spaghetti in octopus, etc. and roasted branzino in a Calabrian chili nage, we pre-ordered, for a surprise birthday dessert, the lime-lemon inflected olive oil cake, which arrived with candles and
a chorus of servers. Perfect!

This is a great little Italian restaurant in the Harlem neighborhood. Popular with locals and visitors to the city alike. Its located in the revitalized Harlem scene. Even on a Thursday night, every seat was full by 7:30.

We were there at a special whisky dinner presented by a small whiskey distributor based out of Lexington, Kentucky. I have been to wine pairing dinners, but this was a first for me. We had four whiskey and the chef did a very nice job pairing the whiskey to the food! Not being familiar with the regular menu, I am not sure how many of the courses we were served are on the regular menu.

Looking forward to returning.

The service is A1! Staff very professional and customer service friendly. A great addition to the neighborhood.

Food was delicious! Felt like I was at my auntie house! Definitely recommend.

The only request I have is to add yams to the menu

Thank you Jamar and Kenya!

I ordered via uber eats, but I'm very disappointed. The 3 piece chikn wings only had 2 pieces. The cheesy sauce on the fries was more peanutty than cheesy.
The potato salad was way too sweet.
The "shrimp" was super overpriced. It was $15 for four shrimp, no sides or extras.
With all the options in NYC, I won't be returning here.

Food - I like trying new things even though I'm not vegan nor vegetarian. I usually enjoy vegetarian and vegan foods and I was curious to try vegan soul food! While it was not quite like the traditional version, they got decently close and I enjoyed my meal. My favorite was the Mac and cheese.
Service - Pretty good! They were a small and busy establishment (mainly from takeout orders but I dined inside(, possibly understaffed. They did mess up part of my order at first but it was OK because they fixed it quickly and the waitress was so helpful in making sure the kitchen fixed the mistake.
The ambiance was chic and modern and paid homage to the culture. I liked it! Worth checking out if you're in the area.

Great stuff made fresh and friendly.  

Try the fried chicken or the ox tail or just about any damn thing on the menu.  And the drinks. Try the drinks.

House made fries were yummy, though maybe not directly made to order. We are looking forward to going back.

And the background noise level was respectful of those whose hearing may not be perfect.  Just a really friendly, delicious place.

It's all good in 'vegan' hood! Found this place while visiting Harlem. We loved the beautiful decor! The light up sign, green walls and colorful artwork make for a cute dining set up. (insta worthy!) The bathroom also has colorful art inside. Our waitress was attentive and always smiled. She even took photos for us. On Sundays they only serve items from the special brunch menu. Keep that in mind in case you want to try other items. We tried the veggie gumbo and "Nah, Chill" nachos. The gumbo is hearty and filling for one person. Comes with rice. Nachos were decent but would be helpful if they layered the toppings. All of the toppings were on the top chips, but as you get past that all the other chips below are dry and don't have enough topping.

I was impressed by the service. Jamar was very quick to keep the place clean. Even if one kernel of food dropped on the table, he was there to clean it instantly. Overall, a nice neighborhood spot in Harlem with excellent service. Hope to come back and try the non-brunch items someday.

The sign and light fixtures were so cute! Also appreciate the name matching the black Harlem hood it's in. I ordered the vegan meat empanadas and they were good. I did order in advance as I was told it takes a while. I wouldn't particularly want to eat in here but to-go I'd try another dish for sure.

Go, enjoy!!

I'm always excited to try a new vegan restaurant and this one did not disappoint. It has a Caribbean and southern soul food inspired menu. I ordered delivery.

The dish that caught my eye was the vegan oxtail. Usually any vegan meat other than chicken is highly questionable, but they pulled this off remarkably well. The oxtail was juicy and tender with a rich, flavorful sauce. I think any fan of the original dish would be impressed. The oxtail came with two sides. The mac and cheese had nice texture. Vegan cheese isn't always the best, but this dish was creamy and tasty. I also got the rice and peas, which perfectly complemented the oxtail.

I also ordered the Tunnel sandwich which might be one of the best vegan chicken sandwiches I have ever had. Fried vegan chicken was smothered in a spicy buffalo sauce and ranch with lettuce, tomato, and pickles. It was messy and delicious, served on a burger bun. The chicken was crispy on the outside with a pleasantly chewy, juicy inside.

My only complaint was the portion sizes. They were generous with the numerous pieces of oxtail, but the sides were quite small. For $17, the sandwich was also way smaller than I was expecting. With a name like the "Tunnel" I was expecting more of a long sub.

Still, this restaurant is a must try for all!

Imma give this place a solid 2.5. It wasn't bad at all. Being from the south, I've just had way better vegan soul food. To start. The best thing I had was probably the gumbo. It could've used a little salt but the roux was delicious and it was filling without the additional vegan meats.

The mac and cheese was just okay. It was cheesy and creamy but s but too sweet for me.

The shrimp and grits were good as well. The grits were very silky and buttery and well seasoned. Only problem I had was with the shrimp. They were so rubbery and chewy. It was like biting into a bouncy ball. I couldn't eat them. The breading was fire tho.

And lastly, the greens were again, okay. They were cooked well and not too soft. Had a nice bite to them but they were kinda sour. I was pleasantly surprised with two chunks of meat tho that had a nice texture.

Service and ambiance were fine.

Sometimes words cannot express the life changing experiences one can have on this planet but I'm going to do my best here...

In a word, Amazing--What I love about VeganHood is that they have a rage of options for various types of plant based diets. If you prefer not to eat soy or have a soy allergy, they've got seitan or classic veggie plates you can choose from. Their Soursop Limeade KILLED--It's refreshing and addictive, you'll definitely crave more after finishing your first round. My Oxtail plate hit all the savory notes without being overly seasoned; it reached perfect Umami balance.

The ambiance and music is a whole vibe, with a healthy mix of NeoSoul, Pop and Afro-Caribbean beats. Our waitress was very helpful and spot on with meal suggestions. There's something for everyone at VeganHood! We'll definitely be back and value it's existence!

I got to visit this quaint restaurant today. It was absolutely delightful. The service was wonderful. My waitress was new however, she was very patient and kind. I got to try the oxtail with the Mac and cheese, as well as rice and peas. The flavors where immaculate. This is the closest thing I've had to authentic vegan Jamaican food in the United States outside of bad gal vegan. You can tell the Chef puts a lot of time and effort into mastering these flavors. I almost did not give it a try due to a few not so pleasant reviews on this app. I am so glad I listened to my instinct, and decided to take my own judgment instead.

I think if you're interested in trying this, please don't hesitate go for it! I don't believe you will be disappointed :)

A small space but I found it very cozy! The decor on the inside is so beautiful! The staff was very friendly and ended up also helping us taking pictures!
The food itself was very good. I didn't think I was eating vegan food! The Mac and cheese was so good.

It was one of those days where you bring you lunch and decided to treat yourself. Since this was around the corner, I went to pickup and it was very good. The food is pricey but very filling. I haven't ate fried chicken in over 10 years and this reminds me of chicken even with the "bone".'
Also, the restaurant is a cute spot with fake flower tall over but very intimate feeling.

Hands down, the best vegan meal I've had at a restaurant thus far. I went with the rasta pasta plus a frozen pina colada. Thoroughly enjoyed the food. Plus service is friendly, the vibe was great (love the decor and music) and the establishment is in a prime location with ample parking.

I highly recommend VeganHood for vegans and non-vegans alike. I'll be back there soon on a Sunday for brunch again.

Also - this is a Black owned business founded and run by two women.

A Fan Since: June 2023

Did you ever imagine that really savory, flavorful, filling, delectable comfort food could be plant-based?  VeganHood turns that dream into a reality!

I attended VeganHood in Harlem, NYC, as part of a birthday celebration for vegan friends of mine, and wanted to already return before even leaving the restaurant!

It is rare that I would deem a restaurant an "Ave's Fave" here after only one visit, but that's how much VeganHood made an exceptional impression on me! :)

Not only are the food and drinks incredible, but so are the beautiful ambiance and the friendly and helpful staff! :)

I love co-owners Janine and Lanise's mission statement for the restaurant.  In summary, they established VeganHood in the hopes of bringing delicious vegan food to their neighborhood that involves familiar and comforting flavors.  With that, they are committed to showing that vegan food isn't all eating "leaves and water", but instead can be anything but "bland!".  Additionally, they have created some really ingenious ways to try to boost the health and immunity of their fellow community members, which they were inspired to do as a result of the pandemic, and which is really noble.  For example, they offer "wildcrafted sea moss gel to help build immune systems, VeganHood Total Tea - which contains burdock root, soup sop leaves, elderberry, and other herbs known to rid your body of sickness."

I have seen some people that aren't vegan initially scoff at the idea of eating anything that doesn't contain meat, dairy, or animal products, so I understand why Janine and Lanise (and their amazing staff!) are determined to prove people wrong (by helping to change the narrative and appeal of vegan food for all)!!  I do, in fact, firmly believe that VeganHood can be enjoyed by all, as it will exceed your expectations of what vegan food can involve! :)

I'm so impressed that VeganHood food tastes like the best combination of healthy and unhealthy - but at the same time, isn't greasy or too heavy (while still being very filling!).  I feel like this is a hard balance to create - which is a large part of why I'm so enamored with VeganHood!

I am a fan of the vegan cheese that VeganHood utilizes in some of their dishes - as not all vegan cheeses (in my opinion) resemble real cheese enough.  Additionally, as someone who neither loves the taste of meat, nor loves the taste of meat substitutes that are, and taste, very artificial, I was blown away at how VeganHood strikes the perfect balance between making their faux meat options taste incredibly flavorful and pleasantly unique in their own right.   Combined with seasonings, toppings, sauces, and incredibly delectable sides, the meal then has such a lush, varied, and well-balanced flavor and texture profile that is very much its own experience - but also still so reminiscent of its non-vegan comfort food counterparts in the best ways! :).

My friends and I enjoyed an array of different dishes that offered a variety of different meat alternatives and interesting sides.  We also loved the beverages!  I truly look forward to returning and being able to try some of the other dishes and beverages.  In the meantime, however, I will provide you with my current recommendations.

As always with my reviews, I advise speaking with the restaurant staff for more details first (as well as to voice any potential dietary/spice restrictions/concerns), prior to ordering the dishes I recommend here in this review. The staff and owners here are very approachable, helpful, and hospitable. :)

The following dishes are ones that, in some instances, come with the option of being either an appetizer or entree portion.  They are also those that were a hit with my friends, husband, and I, and that you could either order individually or to share (family style - alongside other dishes) with a small group!

* What's Good Chix & Gravy

* Saucy Buffalo Saint Nick Friend Chix'n

* Bed Stay Shrimp Saucy

* Stir-Fried Kale

* Savory Collard Greens

* Potato Salad

* Mac & Cheese

* Rice & Pease

* Hand-Cut Fries

* Peach Margherita (cocktail)

Thank you very much to the very caring owners and staff of VeganHood for sharing their passion and vision for promoting vegan cuisine and community culture with us -- both in Harlem, and in the world at large! :)

With appreciation,
Avery B. :)

I hate to be that person, but this spot didn't hit how I thought it would. I ordered the vegan oxtails along with the golden Oreo dessert and I had mac & cheese and collard greens on the side. Maybe it's because I usually don't eat vegan food, although I am pescatarian, but this food just tasted very off to me. I'm not saying don't give it a chance, but the mac & cheese did taste a bit too vegany, and the oxtails had quite an artificial taste to them. The collard greens were great and I would recommend those.  I would like to give this restaurant another try, and perhaps try the chicken wings instead, but for now my experience simply wasn't great- took a few bites then threw it out.

The vegan "meat" here is so good that, as a lifelong vegetarian, I had to force myself to place it in my mouth. But once I started chewing, there was no getting me to stop.
The cheesy fries were so good, my friend and I scooped up every drop of cheese. I really have to think hard to believe that cheese and that from the Mac n cheese is vegan.
The oxtail honestly didn't have much taste to it. Not sure if that's how to meat is supposed to taste, but the sauce was delicious.
Overall, a great unique concept that lets me enjoy soul food as a vegetarian.

The service was very welcoming as well as the ambiance, It was cozy, bright, and green. I ordered the Harlem World Burger to go. While I waited, I had a great watermelon margarita. It was a hot summer day and the chef graciously gave out slices of watermelon to staff and myself.

Received my order with beard or chest hair on top of potato salad. Won't be ordering again. 3 strikes and your out. My very first visit to this place was march of this year dine in and the oxtail dish was extremely over salted even the sides. Another time I ordered corn and was sent Brussels sprouts and this time tonight I ordered chicken  with potato salad kale and corn and seen the curly black hair. I did call the restaurant to make them aware of the hair I found in my food. Wasn't even offered a refund and of course I did not eat the potato salad and tried to eat the rest of the food but couldn't stomach it bcos of all that was going thru my mind. I really loved to eat their food but not again. They have went from 5 stars to 1 star. I will never order from there again. Lost a faithful customer! I did send the picture to Uber eats for review awaiting a response bcos I want a refund.

Vegan Hood, is the perfect combination of comfort food and  vegan innovation. The name "Vegan Hood" itself fits perfectly! It's vegan and "HOOD" at same time. How was it?:  I loved it! I will never be a vegan..but I LOVE VEGAN FOOD, especially vegan Soul Food. I had fried chicken, mac and cheese, and potato salad (with a little taste of vegan oxtails). So good! But you gotta have a vegan palete to enjoy

My fiancé and I came here for a quick bite of vegan food
The inside is beautiful, clean and cozy
We decided to sit outside to enjoy the beautiful day

We had the "Flatbush " oxtail rice n peas
N the "what's good" chick'n and gravy

In my opinion the food was ok!
But I do want to go back and try something different
My fiancé loved her food
The service was super good and our waiter was very friendly.

The only negative thing is that while sitting outside,
you can hear the trains underground . As well there's a funky smell that I assume is coming from the sewage water underground. With each passing of the train it's sends a nasty smell up .

Other then that, great place

Where do I begin!?!??
First of all the ambiance is so cozy.
The service is great! The food? Delicious!!! We went for the first time on a Saturday and returned for dinner the next evening!
We'll definitely be repeat customers!
HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Small vegan restaurant; the decor inside is very cute and the overall vibe of the place is clean and warm. The menu is a bit pricey but I was extremely full after (soulfood does not play when it comes to filling you up!)

I got the Saint Nick fried chicken starter which came with three large drumsticks fried with batter on the outside. Came out hot and crispy and was great! Only downside is that it didn't come with any side dipping sauce like ranch.

For my entrée, I got the flatbush, which is a vegan oxtail dish. It comes with your choice of two sides so I got the mac and cheese and potato salad. This was my first time trying an oxtail dish and it was so flavorful! Everything was well-seasoned and I enjoyed the mock beef they used for the oxtail texture. It was more like an odd shaped meatball but it was very tasty with the spices and sauce smothering it.

The waitor is very nice and let me sample a drink before ordering it. I'd definitely recommend anyone looking for vegan soulfood to drop by and try out a dish or two!

I absolutely love this place and cannot wait to come back on a brunch day because dinner was delicious. I honestly feel like this review just needs one sentence and one sentence alone. Here it goes: GET THE FRIED SHRIMP. Oh my gosh! I cannot believe how delicious they were.  If you are in the area, listen to me, fine in, and get the shrimp. You're welcome.

Hearing great things about Veganhood, I decided it would be my next brunch outing when back in NYC. The vibes as soon as you enter this lovely restaurant is infectious! Flowers and an abundance of colors everywhere. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. We both decided on the shrimp and grits while my friend added a side of macaroni and cheese. Our food arrived quickly. As a girl who grew up on grits, I'm particular about my grits. These grits hit the spot! Creamy and the "gravy" was pure fire! It was spicy and packed just the right amount of heat. The shrimp, a la konjac, were breaded to perfection. My God, that breading was saying my name!! The shrimp was of good consistency. The macaroni and cheese was okay. It needed more creaminess and less of the odd flavor at the end of each bite. I usually go with Vegan Chick'n and Waffles when I'm out for brunch, so I decided to get a waffle to go, for nostalgia's sake. The density seemed a little off to me and the flavor profile wasn't sweet. Makes me wonder if it would be better without having to reheat. Perhaps I'll revisit and give it a shot.

It's unfortunate to post such a low review, but in all honesty I want to help the business.

The customer service was sub par and for how pricey the food is , needs to be elevated. My family and I felt like we were a burden to the staff. We were told they had no alcohol from the jump and even though our server tried to explain the menu it felt un personalized and more generalized to "Everything on the menu is good"

My order came out wrong, and yes, they replaced the side so there's that.

However, at the end of the meal my parents did not eat majority of their food.  The server asked how it was, and we gave this honest review, and still it was like "well ok"

There was no resolution or plight to ask for any type of substitution. On top of this we didn't ask to have anything removed and still paid the $143 for half of the meals not even being touched.

The server then asked if we were vegan which I felt like was out of pocket.

Please do better we are rooting for all small businesses , but you have to keep the customers happy in order for your business to thrive.

Peace and love

Everything was good. I don't have a picture of the max and cheese however that was some of the best vegan Mac and cheese I've ever had and I'm not vegan. The service was phenomenal, the ambiance is so cute. The mimosa tower definitely one of my favorites. I will most definitely come back.

My personal favs are the nah chill nachos, Marcy Burger, Boogie Down burger, and all of the sides... All of them. I'm waiting on her answer to the chik'n sammich which I think would be off the chain! This is my go-to restaurant when I don't feel like cooking.
Great food, customer service and atmosphere. Enjoyed a mini family gathering while listening to great music and receiving help from the staff for pictures.

So I tried the vegan steak...I'm gon give you all the (non-vegan opinion) tea about this right now so if you're thinking about it hear this....Maaaaan this food is always good. I'm really not a vegan but this place makes me feel like it's doable cuz they be putting it together. The steak is made of Seitan if you're wondering. It's tender and juicy and flavorful. The eggs were with JUST eggs, which are an egg substitute. They were similar to eggs but it's like the texture throws me off but lowkey normal eggs do too if they not scrambled so that's accurate. The potatoes was cute but I like my potatoes hella seasoned but they prolly saving me from hypertension so it's cool. The restaurant is cute af inside and is just a vibe and my server was also going above and beyond to make this a dope experience, which it was!

Love The atmosphere and the energy in the place. The servers were very friendly and kind of made you feel at home!
I Have been on a fast so I thought this would be a great place to go. Surely since the name insinuates that the food is vegan.

However there was nothing on the menu that I could eat. I can usually get away with a few side orders, or a side salad that is fresh and raw. Their salad missed the mark with me. It looks like garnish that sits in ice and food is placed on top of. I love the fact that it's owned by two sisters who are African-American. If you're using the word vegan please make sure you have vegan options. I was very disappointed. However when I break my fast this would be a great place to come it's more comfort food than it is even vegetarian food there are no raw healthy options on the menu. I believe the food at Melba's would've been a better choice for me.

I could've ordered a side of spinach over there. Good luck I would love to frequent your establishment and support your business in the future, and people who have extreme dietary restrictions really embrace the definition of "vegan" which is different than "plant-based" which is different than vegetarian. people who are in tune with their bodies and what they put in them use food as their medicine for energy and for life. So it's very important that the title of the restaurant reflects the menu.

Wishing you the best I can't wait to come back to see what you have changed. I would've love to have a healthy green salad with carrots fresh vegetables even a side of fresh vegetables. Preservatives and toxins are everywhere many people are looking towards food as a way to reach a higher spirituality. I just got out the hospital and am looking for healthy options I feel mislead however the other foood looks GREAT if you are in to comfort  food ... they have chicken and shrimp that's a far cry from veganism.

Best Vegan spot in Manhattan in my opinion! Customer service was excellent and my food was delicious . The restaurant has a relaxing atmosphere. I would highly recommend it to vegans and non vegans. I congratulate the owners! Great job ladies

So today I stumbled upon this restaurant. At first I went to the wrong address because their website isn't updated nor google. But I called and the new place was only 8 minutes from the old, so I went.

When I called they told me they were doing take out and dine in but when I approached the door I was told no takeout which was confusing but after a few minutes the guy came back and said I could order. So at 416 I ordered a shrimp and grits, Rasta pasta and Mac and cheese. But called back at 419 to add another shrimp and grits. I went to wait in my car after being told it would be 20-30 minutes. Checked at 30 minutes and was told 10 more minutes. Checked after 10+ minutes and was told 10 more minutes. It's been an hour now that we waited and then was told the second shrimp and grits would take another 15 minutes. So we decided to not wait and take the three items we had already.

Got the food home and literally nothing has seasoned except the Mac and cheese but it doesn't taste like Mac and cheese and was really oily. The shrimp and grits was weird because of the breading on the shrimp, I'm not sure if it was breading or wrapped in some other meat substitute, the texture was weird, I'll post a picture. The Rasta pasta was definitely missing the Rasta. Very far from Jamaican anything. Bob Marley is not pleased to have it named after him, I'm sure. For the price I was definitely very unhappy.

The inside of the restaurant was cute but yeah no, never again.

Oh yeah and this was there grand reopening I guess.

The service is great and the food is amazing. I am not crazy about the Mac n cheese as it's hit or miss. However, my partner and I have been here multiple times and have tried several things on the menu. Everything that we've tried has been soooo yummers (with the exception of the Mac n cheese)! My fave appetizer is the Mami Empanadas and with that DMX sauce, is a HIT! My absolute fave entree is the Flatbush: That oxtail is seasoned so good and it just leaves you wanting more, the rice and peas is cooked to perfection not too dry not too clumpy just right! My fave sides: Potato Salad and Savory Collard Greens! Overall we love this place, the food, the service, and the ambience! We will definitely continue to get our grub on at VeganHood!

First time I went there they didn't have their liquor license in, but I was determined to go back and I'm grateful that I did because the food was amazing the first and second time I went !!!
I was able to experience the brunch atmosphere and experience such a vibe !!! I'll always recommend this restaurant.

I wanted to like this place. The people who work there are very sweet.

I had the nox tail and the fried chixken. I personally didn't like the gravy for the noxtail but my friend liked it.

The sauce on the Buffalo fried chicken was good but it tasted like heavily flowered seitan.

If you like Seasoned Vegan or any of those places, this chicken is aligned. Super saucy pieces of seitan or soy, nothing to write home about or call the police about.

What shocked me was the rasta pasta. It was sincerely horrid.

I ordered last night as I went over the summer, hoping to give it a second try. But no it was still bad. The kale and collard greens had to be trashed, weird sauces on both. Disappointed.

Service gets a solid 1 out of 5. Was not impressed by the food either. Taste better and healthier so called 'vegan' food. The oxtail tastes like tofu, not a fan. The service was rubbish. First and last time here on a hot summer day!!

I am not a vegan but if I decide to be I know where I will be eating! Veganhood is not only black owned but the food and the service was impeccable. Me being from Brooklyn I had to try the Flatbush which was "oxtails", Mac n cheese, and collard greens. Go check it out!

I stopped by on a Sunday afternoon and the place was packed, so I ordered the Chix'n & Waffles to go. The vegan chicken was seasoned well, with a nice balance of crunchy outside and tender inside. The waffles were fluffy with a a cinnamon/sweet flavor, plus some powdered sugar and fruit on top.
I've also had their chix'n nuggets and stir fried kale--the red peppers and spices really add a great kick to the sauteed greens. I look forward to dining in and trying more!

Black owned. Delicioussssssssssssss.
Non vegan eaters tried it out and they loved it. Highly recommend the oxtails with greens and  Pina Colada with Mango. The restaurant is super cute and has outdoor seating.

Let's just get into it. The food was okay at most. I ordered "The tunnel" which is essentially a spicy chicken sandwich and it was not great. I love spicy food but this sandwich was smothered in what seemed to be Frank's red hot sauce. It was SO spicy I couldn't even eat it. My friends Rasta pasta was also unbelievably spicy. We are Caribbean people and LOVE spicy food but never at the cost of not being able to taste the actual food and get through your meal. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts and Mac and cheese. It was okay. But aside from all of that, the waiter took our plates away without even asking if we were done. There was still food on the plates! I wish the best for the business just maybe be more mindful of the customer experience. Much love.

I have been to this place many times.  It WAS one of my favorite places.  I don't know what happened during brunch, but the service wasn't good and it was hot with no air conditioner.  And, a woman came in, sat at the bar and turned the one fan they had on herself.

I went Monday around lunchtime,the food was delicious!I had the Flatbush oxtail with rice and peas,I never had vegan oxtail like this and the texture is excellent!My sister had the beef less broccoli which was really tasty!The atmosphere was also great!shout out to the really nice waitress and the music playlist was perfect! Overall this place is a 10/10!

Food was delicious and the environment and atmosphere was perfect. I had a flatbush and my beautiful kept it hood and got the "Harlem World Burger". The taste and texture of everything was amazing, give them a try you cant go wrong!!!

We had a delicious meal and excellent service. The nuggets and "oxtail" were delicious - and honestly, even if they just served the beans braised in the sauce without the "oxtail" chunks it would be a great dish. My only critique is that it was way too salty (even for me).
The potato salad tastes just like Mom's and is so freaking good. It's very cute and quaint inside. The waitresses were very nice and friendly
This business doesn't even exist. Closed shop. Went here after an event in Harlem & the hours are a lie.

Pros: Beautiful decor, attentive staff, delicious food, black woman owned, DJ, biodegradable/compostable take out containers and straws

Cons: not many gluten free options, some of the options that the staff said were gluten free wasn't actually gluten free and we were unable to get clarity on what was truly gluten free so My partner was unable to eat a full meal.
The soursop limeade was overly sweet, plastic bag was not biodegradable/compostable

I would recommend but not for anyone who is gluten free and for that reason I won't be back sadly. But great establishment and delicious food overall!

Slap city. I wish I had gotten Mac instead of collard greens. The chicken and gravy made me want to cry, I don't know what they put in it but that dish came straight from the heavens. Vegans and non-vegans alike, you'll be in good hands.
We had the vegan Mac & Cheese, (faux) chicken and waffles, and the vegan Golden Oreo Banana Pudding. Everything was excellent. Truly exceeded expectations. I recommend all three of those selections.

Really tasty and well seasoned! I had the flatbush, buffalo chix, kale salad(which is sauteed) and mac n cheese. Loved it all! My carryout was ready in 10min and had a soursop juice while waiting. Staff was very friendly!

I think this vegan pad thai is better than regular pad thai!!! I recently became vegan and I'm thrilled to know that I don't have to give up Pad Thai! I loved it so much I ordered it the next day again! The Lychee juice is super yummy too!

I will update this review when I order again or visit in person! I saw this pop up on another website and was curious because I couldn't find it with Google Maps or Yelp! I believe this business shares a kitchen with Chu Ros Thai.

The the things I ordered tasted great. Not amazing but def. better than average. All items are vegan (no fish sauce) which is lovely! And they have some nice extras available like sticky rice or coconut rice or a side of veggies! Looking forward to ordering again.

Pros:

(+) Great location at Randall's Island
(+) Good music
(+) Plenty of seating with tables, picnic on the grass or sit by the small beach area
(+) FREE water. They had a drinking water station
(+) Volleyball set up
(+) Well organized
(+) Portable bathroom areas had a portable sink with hand soap
(+) Photo props

Cons:

(-) Long lines
(-) Would have been great to have swag bags

~~~~~~~~~

Came here with a few friends (4 of us) and did some research of each vendor before attending. We made a list of vendors that we wanted to see and came early right when the festival started. We had a game plan to tackle as much vendor booths before it got busy. The booths that we definitely wanted to check out was Vegan Dots (my favorite), These Wingz? (from Chicago), Freakin' Vegan, Monks Meats, Avocaderia, Van Leeuwen, Los Loosers (from Mexico), Daiya and Seasoned Vegan.

When we first passed the gates, there was security that searched bags to rid of any food and drinks. Our brand new water bottle waters was confiscated =(...
But, next time, I will bring an empty drink canister because it turned out they had a free water station to refill which came in handy.

There was so much good food here and was definitely worth the ticket. There was a few vendors that handed out free samples for taste testing, which was nice and I actually discovered new options because of it. It would have been nice if the festival handed out swag bags with samples, coupons and snacks already to introduce us to new vendors. Although I did bring a backpack, it would have been much easier to have had a tote bag to easily toss things in the bag than having to swing my backpack around just to dump free goodies and pamphlets inside.

Definitely glad I wore comfy shoes because there was a lot of walking and standing in lines...plus we walked across the bridge to get to Randall's Island. Even after eating so much good food, I ended up losing a couple pounds the next day in result from all that walking. Yay!

They had really good music and some games, volleyball, some photo props to get your instagram worthy photos.

When we first arrived here, our game plan was that we went to every single booth (before purchasing anything) and taste tested out all the free stuff and made note of the booths that we wanted to come back to purchase stuff. We wanted to tackle all the out of town vendors first over the locals, just in case we were not able to check all of them out, we know that we can at least visit the locals anytime. Then after taste testing all the free stuff, we all separated and went to our "go to" booths to stand in the semi-crazy long lines (during the time) and reunited...had a lunch picnic and shared all our food together. By the time we finished eating all our stuff, we were so full! I'm so happy we did that because by the time we finished our food, the park was so busy and all the lines that we had previously stood in line were crazzzzzy long. There were some vendors that tackled the lines quickly by having a separate line for cash and a separate line for credit (smart move!) and there were some vendors that had a long line that just didn't have enough help.

I'm glad we came early, because clearly a lot of the time is wasted standing in line.

All and all we had a good time and I'm looking forward to next year's festival.

~~~~~~~~~

*** TIPS to know:

- Bring an empty drink canister, they had a free drinking water station to refill with water
- Sunscreen (if outdoors) I had put sunscreen on beforehand, but...still got sunburned after several hours
- Backpack or tote bag
- Picnic blanket
- Comfy shoes
- A copy of the vendor lists that you want to check out
- Tag team with friends, lines are long..have a few of your friends stand in different lines and then come together to share your food together. Will save you time, promise.
- Research the vendors you want to check out so you know what you're standing in line for
- Tackle the out of town vendors first

Im not vegetarian or vegan but this festival was amazing! Honestly everything there you would never even know wasn't meat! If anything would convert a carnivore, it would be this festival! Try the deep fried water melon !

The Vegan Fest at Randall's island was a success definitely enjoyed the experience with my friends and enjoying great eats. The lines as expected were a little out of control but for most definitely worth the wait. My first stop was Verdure but due to the high demand they were sold out on almost everything. I did get a chance to try the Escovit mushroom which was amazing just wish I had more than 2 pieces because I had to share lol. In addition though by far my favorite was Greedi Kitchen they had a variety of things to choose from but I enjoyed all there Jerk meals :).
