I definitely plan on visiting the actual restaurant sometime in the near future.

I'm a huge supporter of anything vegan/vegetarian and was really looking forward to the vegan food and drink festival because it's very exciting to see this way of eating appealing to such a huge crowd. But that was just the problem the huge crowd. There was so much amazing food that I wanted to try but we waited on one line not exaggerating at all for an hour and a half and the second line for and hour. There was so much more stuff that I wanted to try but was not able to because of the amount of time it was taking to get a bite of anything.Our friends were in different lines and we didn't even see them for a huge part of the day due to the huge wait times to try almost anything that the festival had to offer. On a positive note everything we ate was amazing!!! But I honestly would not attend this festival again due to what a damper the lines put on the day.

Giafrffdgccf Zara google fvgthgcwc
Wx   GWNU d as.  a goodbyes o

Ouuuuii. Tax id g you need daui7

Vegan Festival was a great success! Besides there being mud from a lot of rain in the past days it was a good time. I went with a few of my friends and we tried a wide variety of things. Tbh I can't remember the first thing I tried but it was pretty good lol the second food choice I decided to try was the Banana Burger which is made of plantains as buns which is really good, especially if you love fried bananas. Then I had gf Mac and cheese that wasn't so good unfortunately. All good though lol I also had a share of guac and chips that was very good!! Then topped it off with a vegan hot dog from Yeah Dawg, where I ran into a friend that actually works at the company!! Good dawg btw. To sum it all up I had a great time with good friends and I'll do it again!!
Awesome venue...  Wet grass made it a bit messy...  Vendors were great.  Looking forward to trying out some of these stores n the near future

(Regarding 2017's first effort) This is what happens when outside organizations come to different cities trying to market on what's becoming a growing "trend" and screwing the attendees over in the process. Normally, when a local organization hosts a festival such as this, agreements are made with the city transportation department to adjust public transportation schedules to allow for a smoother flow. The fact that most of the attendees would catch buses to the island should have been a consideration. It was a mess getting to and from. Also, there were clearly not enough vendors and from what I understand, they didn't market enough to local area businesses. They got my money once (and I came from Baltimore) but never again. I saw they were trying to do this festival in another state as well. Hopefully it flopped. Also buyer beware, they charge an additional processing fee for international transaction (they're a Canadian company) to the tune of $2 which was not published on their website.

I have been coming to this restaurant ever since I was a kid in elementary school. The food was epic then and now it's an experience.WOW. The meals have a personal touch. The lamb chop Pizziaola is off the chain. The pork chops are insanely delicious and they are specifically cut to bring out the best flavor. The filet of sole stuffed with shrimp and crabmeat is truly an experience. Usually when I come into the restaurant I need 2 orders of cocktail shrimp with their homemade cocktail sauce. When my daughter was younger she would have the pizza with shrimp and spinach and now she still has the pizza with shrimps and spinach. The cannolis.  Are some of the best I've had. Please put this restaurant on your devour list. It's worth the trip

Have passed by here for years, lured in by the aroma but turned away by the lack-of-attention feel epitomized by its large "Italian Restaurant" sign. I finally dropped by to take advantage of its wonderful, expansive outdoor seating on a pleasant day but was (not unexpectedly) disappointed by the food, and the service didn't help. Pleasant ambiance with a classic American Italian feel.

My meal:

Parmesan garlic bread
- Large portion, subpar. Burnt crust represented poor dish care and undermines any integrity the rest of the appetizer had.
Baked ziti
- Reasonable portion, incredibly underwhelming. Sauce was worse than your standard grocery store's jarred sauce; water-thin, mildly sweet. Cheese isn't fused well with the rest of the dish.

I experienced poor, unattentive, mindless service. Came at 3:30pm on a Tuesday and my meal and experience was uniquely poorly attended to. However, the odd-timing of my meal shouldn't speak to possibly better service at more typical meal hours. Something eventually clicked and staff let me stick around for a while as other customers trickled in for early supper.

Will consider returning for the outdoor seating, another shot at service and other menu items.

I had the Veal Parmigiana and it still tastes great. Haven't been there in a while. My friends loved the very big pieces of Fried Calamari and ordered the EGGPLANT ROLLATINI and SPINACH & GARLIC & OIL, BROCCOLI WITH GARLIC & OIL. They had the SHRIMP SCAMPI-Large pieces of shrimp smothered in butter, garlic, and, wine sauce, served with freshly squeezed lemon juice and MUSSELS FRA DIAVOLO with pasta. I recommended V.& T. to them and they loved it and were not disappointed at all. In fact, they praised my choice.
We ran into Gerardo Gerry Velez at V&T Pizzaria & Restaurant (far left) who was on Congas & Hendrix in Harlem in 1969 when Jimi played a benefit for us teens in the United Block Association. Gerardo "Jerry" Velez (born August 15, 1947) is an American musician. Best known for performing with American psychedelic rock musician Jimi Hendrix at Woodstock Festival in August 1969, Velez is a veteran percussionist and drummer, who has performed with many artists covering a number of different genres of music.
Plus It's no surprise that when we took that picture it was May's Full Flower Moon which had been named after the abundance of flora, blooming in many parts of the world. It's a prelude to the summer months and the name has stuck with popular media. May 5th last week was a Flower Moon night. The Full Flower Moon in Scorpio happened on May 5, 2023. During this astrological event, you'll be encouraged to push yourself in all areas of life. The full moon impacts all zodiac signs, but Taurus and Scorpio will feel it most.

We came to this place after having drinks next door at the 1020 bar. This place has been around for a long time and I really like the old fashioned Italian style look of this restaurant. They have the red and white checkered table cloths and vintage pictures throughout the dining space. In the summer you can enjoy the outdoor seating. The service here is very attentive and friendly. We ordered the garlic bread,  margarita pie, chicken piccata with linguine and the cherry cheesecake for dessert. The pizza was good but a bit too soggy for my liking. I thought the chicken piccata was flavorful but perhaps we should have paired it with something else besides the linguine since the red sauce was too sweet and didn't compliment the chicken. The cheesecake was good. Prices here are reasonable considering the area.
Pizza is drowning in grease, extremely salty and generally unpleasant. The only positive is the cost if you like a lot of cheap bad pizza.

This really wasnt very good :( got a pepperoni pie and it was sooo greasy and floppy. It actually tasted much better the next day reheated but it should have been fine before that. I dont think i'll order again.. bummer since this place is so close to my apartment.

This pizza was goooood ! Yum ! Service was lack luster , no friendly face to greet us ... just straight to the point of taking our order and that's about it .

I say it time and time again .. food can be great but customer service is what keeps people coming back .

They have  beer and wine and soft drinks ... that's about all of the Info I received from our server .

Nice to sit outside and the pizza was delish !

This place has gotten more and more salty- my work likes to get catering from here. Why I have no idea. They ALWAYS forget something huge, like plates, or napkins, or utensils, or dressing, or serving utensils, or drinks... seriously EVERY TIME. Or they bring enough for 1/8 of the servings Absolutely ridiculous. Food inedibly salty, as that seems to be their only spice.  And cheese.  I don't think this is a pandemic issue, as it's been this way as long as I can remember. And that is a LONG time. Oh and rarely is it even remotely on time.

Great ambiance - a classic Italian American dining room, but not great food. Huge portions. Red sauce too bright, pasta not al dente. I doubt there were Italians in the kitchen when we went (late afternoon, weekday). Waiter wasn't a friendly guy.  Disappointment.

I was referred here by a friend who loves it. Our experience was good except the food was very average, maybe 3 star, not 4. I am giving it a 4 because the ambiance, service and prices are all good and they give large portions.  I just think they are serving the food without real quality chefs. Its an old style restaurant,  large with many tables and not fancy. Liked it except thought there is much better food available in the area, although more expensive.

I have been eating pizzas and other dishes here ever since I moved to the neighborhood 27 years ago. How to sum it up in one word? Scrumptious? Extraordinary? Unusual? Superb?

I live for the thin- crust margarita. ( pizza). A joy to behold. With peppers I find it a tad sweet; some may not,. So many choices to add on, all high quality ingredients. This restaurant has the wisdom of experience and the pizazz of a newbie. GO HERE.

Nice location, nice old school NYC Italian restaurant vibe, but honestly everything I tried was average at best. Pizza was thick and gloppy, fried calamari bordering on chewy and the salads were ice cold and heavy on the dressing. Prices were reasonable, service was great, but again, food was just mediocre.

Actually, "simply VERY TRUE" assessment of waiters rudeness complaining of kitchen staff when I asked to have my food re heated..+ true when waiter personally Complained about the customers he serves..+ asked if I would like to speak to the manager..

Well, speaking to manager now + the community at large who needs to know the truth..

Wouldn't obviously waster time/ energy..see older favorable reviews!

Take heed!

Had been a long time ago ( like 8 or more years ) and returned recently with some friends for a casual dinner.
Pasta carbonara was terrific, rich, but not too heavy or dripping in sauce. Chicken Picatta, delicious, and the perfect balance of lemon, caper, parsley.
Calamari Siciliano WS delicious, the flavors were excellent. They make their own NY Style cheesecake which was one of the best I have ever had, very light and creamy,
overall the food was well prepared, truly home-made taste. definitely worth the visit.
I had a pepperoni pizza, wine and Nonna's Cake. I recommend all three :) The server was helpful, but not bothersome and it was a great spot for Italian.
Still staying true to the classic, traditional old school Italian menu and doing it well! Good Size menu, quick service and reasonable prices for the quantity Anna quality

Very nice, family owned restaurant that is usually packed but I was lucky enough to get a table fast on a Wednesday afternoon. The service is a little slow, but from what I could tell there's only one waiter for all the tables that were there. Highly recommend the fried shrimp with a salad on the side- the pasta side is not worth it. The chicken francaise is also really good, had the perfect amount of gravy. As for the appetizers get the fried calamari- we ordered the cheesy garlic bread but it didn't have any cheese on it so not sure why it's advertised as "cheesy garlic bread". Would come back here!

The people giving a high rating wouldn't know good food if it slapped them in the face...

I've been here before and I've had some baked pasta and pizza. The pasta was fine because it was basically covered in cheese. The pizza was not up to nyc standards in my opinion. Tasted like something I would settle for in Massachusetts.

Last night I ordered spaghetti with meat sauce and zeppolis. Pretty hard to mess up for an Italian place. Unfortunately it taste like what I imagine dog food tastes like. The meat sauce must've been old or something but it was a very odd color, texture was mushy, and it had no real flavor, just nasty. The pasta was overcooked which isn't a big deal, but that meat sauce, inedible!!! The zeppolis were also old. Barely had any powdered sugar. The only good thing was the complimentary bread and even that was low quality.

They need to change their recipes and modernize a bit. Old school Italian can be very good, but this ain't it. Never ordering from there again!
A great place and the pasta and pizza are WONDERFUL!!!  My favorite is the arugula and goat cheese pizza.  DELICIOUS!!

My friend took me to his favorite Italian restaurant that he and his mom loved when she was alive. I can see why it was her favorite, authentic, loved the ambiance and the food was delicious! We both had veal parmigiana, ziti, salad, and can't forget the garlic bread! Nice portions enough to take for lunch the next day. Cosmopolitan was our drink choice and bartender was on point! Can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu, everything looks good and the pizza too! This is a great spot worth trying.

I ordered a pizza over seamless.com.  Not great like I remembered from years back, but whatevs.  Lots of things aren't like they used to be.

But I was disappointed to find out that the soda I had ordered for $2.50 was a can.  It was probably foolish of me to expect a 2 liter (or even 1 liter) bottle, but not even a 20oz for $2.50?  As far as I'm concerned that's a price you charge for that item when you have no respect for your customer and you're just hoping they won't notice they're getting screwed until it's too late.  

Ok, V&T, you got me ... this time.  But there won't be a next.
Good place for local pizza (& other Italian fare). Have been going here off/on for over 13 years. Always a good experience. Staff is efficient.

I was so excited to get pasta delivered for dinner, but they messed up the order. I am a vegetarian and instead of sending the vodka sauce they sent meat sauce. Now I have no dinner and it's late, super frustrating. Will not be ordering from this place again.

Was hungry and past this place on getting some cookies and we smelled the pizza and it smelled delicious. So we decided to come in.

There's 2 parts of the restaurant. The servers didn't look happy and barely spoke. You say something and then they leave, like it feels you got ignored. But at least they heard you and got what you wanted.

I got pasta e fagioli soup. Definitely not worth the $7. Didn't taste good. We also got mozzarella sticks they were average. Not the best but not the worst. My brother said they were frozen, you can taste the after taste.

They also bring out fresh bread and butter which is delicious.

I got broiled pork chops with mashed potatoes. They are 2 thick pieces with some onions and mushrooms and I think garlic on top. It was good. The mash potatoes needed some more salt and a bit of different flavoring, but was okay. My brother and sister got the pepperoni pizza. It was thin and okay.

V&T has been our go to every time we go to the upper west side, their Calamari siciliana is by far our favorite app! Crunchy calamari mixed with some garlic and pickled spicy peppers is to die for. Don't be afraid to order it as it is not too spicy. Our meals came at the right times and hot which is a plus!
Aldo was our server today and he's friendly, kind, efficient and popular around the regulars. Happy to see V&T open and with plenty of tables outside.

Really terrible. The service is terrible (and so rude), the food is terrible. Their vodka sauce gave me heartburn that was so awful that I had to chug half a bottle of mylanta. Really the worst. Save your money.
My friends & I have been coming to v&t's for years.  We recently had dinner at our old haunt..... as if we were back in a time warp!!!  The pizza was amazing!!!! What a wonderful meal!
This restaurant had the meanest servers and most disgusting food ever. Do not go here!

Why is the box lined with aluminum foil?! This pie has potential--a robust sauce and the perfect thickness--but is completely ruined by the foil which causes the pie to be so soggy it's like it was dipped in water. What a disappointment.

After a long 12hr shift treating Covid-19 patients my colleagues and I  were craving Italian food and we found this new place.
I ordered the Shrimp Fettuccini Alfredo. The pasta was bland and I was confused as to why the sauce had a consistency of curdle milk. It also had a smell of evaporated milk. I am sure corners were cut in order to make this dish.
One of my colleagues ordered medium prime rib steak.
The meatballs and spaghetti were bland and it was not flavorful enough compared to nearby Italian restaurants.
After noticing these issues with the food we sent the two pasta dishes back and in return we ordered a medium size pepperoni pizza. My friend didn't send her steak back because she felt bad. The pepperoni pizza came to our table I proceeded to take the first slice and to my surprise it was undercooked. I felt this was purposely done, because of the dishes that were sent back. The reason I ordered the pepperoni pizza was because to the left of us there were two older ladies sharing a pepperoni pizza and when ours arrived it looked absolutely different. The women closest to our table noticed the unfair treatment towards myself and my colleagues. I requested to speak to the manager. As he approached the table with the waiter he began to whisper in a different language, which I couldn't understand. The manager who is an older male (50 years old +) greeted us with "YOU ALREADY SENT TWO DISHES BACK WITH NO REASON" my colleague began to explain that the dishes where unsatisfactory.
My other colleague who is a bit on the shy spectrum disclosed the reason why they discontinued her meal. She explains the steak was undercooked to her liking. She ordered it to be medium and it was delivered rare and to closest to the middle raw. The women closest to our table joined our conversation with the manager. The lady explained that the pizza did look different and it's ok if the customer wants it baked for a longer time. She was truly the peace maker. The manager interrupted her and asked all of us to leave the restaurant. We were all in disbelief even the women next to us were shocked.
This was the most embarrassing experience ever. I do not recommend this place.

PS: Gordon Ramsey  would be very disappointed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
My husband and I love this place!  It's quant and food is delicious.   I love the pizza and pasta dishes!  The pork chops are very good too.

Really enjoyed V & T on a recent trip to NYC!

Italian is probably my all time favorite cuisine and this place did not disappoint. Friend and I shared a Caesar salad as an appetizer and then each ordered pasta dishes for entrees. I got chicken Parmesan and she got Penne a la vodka.

There was a huge piece of chicken breast with cheese and sauce, served with a side of pasta (I chose penne but there were other options). The sauce was really good which is important in chicken parm.

I was stuffed by the end! We both had leftovers.

Service was decent and there was no wait which was nice for the weekend. Pricing wasn't too expensive either so I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for an authentic, casual Italian meal.

This is an old review pre-Covid 19 I just forgot to post it...We came here on a Friday night and after indecisively flipping through the menu a few times we decided to just split a pizza pie. We got Pepperoni, jalapeños, and bacon and it was really good! They definitely pile on the toppings. We also tried their desserts..mine was like a frozen coffee parfait it was pretty good and the other one was like these puff balls they didn't have anything in the middle so that was so-so. They did get pretty busy in the evenings.

I come here a couple of times a year with my friend. I always get spaghetti and meatballs and a glass of pinot grigio, so I can't judge all the meals. The other dishes do look delicious though. One day I will try the pizza.

Its pretty hard to screw up spaghetti and meatballs. I like thiers because its a big portion, the sauce is good and the pasta is always cooked aldente. Its decent and affordable at only 13 dollars. I have been to places for 18 dollar meatballs and that is a rip off.

They have a huge selection of desserts too and I have a sweet tooth. The servers are friendly and the place has a nice warm family atmoshphere. I recommend for some decent comfort Italian food.

I came here for the first time a few days ago during lunch hours. The cuisine is Italian and they're going for the classic Italia experience but fail to deliver it. However, this place has close proximity to Sinai St. Luke's, Columbia University, and a bunch of nearby businesses. It's well-priced and great for a quick and cheap lunch.

Atmosphere: casual outdoor seating and more formal indoor seating available. I wouldn't say this is a casual venue to eat at, no need to dress up fancy, etc.

Food: I ordered a small jalapeño pie and my friends ordered a mini sausage pie (personal pizza) and a Margherita pizza. We also had mozzarella sticks for appetizer. The mozzarella sticks were below average, probably a 2 of 5. But breaded and fried cheese tastes decent regardless. The sticks were probably lacking some cheese and the marinara sauce wasn't as good as it usually is most places.

The jalapeño pizza was great, appropriate amount of cheese, THIN CRUST (!!!), and ample veggies on top. The other pizzas were decent as well. Overall, 3/5 on the pizza. To be honest, though, pizza chains have delivered better pizza...so don't expect to be blown away.

Drinks: Just had water, was fine NYC water.

Service: Quick and helpful! Server was friendly, answered all questions, checked up on us consistently.

Overall, while the pizza was mediocre, I'd probably come back for a cheap and quick bite during or after work. Good prices, small place, casual to eat at, definitely not the best food, but gets the job done.

This was my mother's college hangout when she was at Barnard over 60 years ago.  She took us here several times growing up.  The lasagna was the best I ever had.  It hasn't changed.  I came here today and it brought back fond memories of my mom.

Loved this place when I was young. Was shocked at how horrible the pizza was when I returned as an adult. On top of that, the owner(?) or manager (?) was incredibly abusive when we mentioned the poor pizza and aggressive to my father who is elderly and in a wheelchair. It was unbelievable. Shameful.

When you arrive to an Italian restaurant and smell garlic, you know you've come to the right place! We came here for a group event for 10 and ordered multiple pizzas and drinks. All were good and served quickly and with care. You could tell everyone in the restaurant were long time patrons because they knew the wait staff, too. If we lived in the area, we would be repeat patrons as well because we certainly enjoyed it!

Just go somewhere else. The minute you walk in the blonde lady in the front has a horrible f*cking attitude. You get a weird feeling if your not a older white couple your not wanted here.  If your placing an order to go as I was the blonde lady will ask you a million times "what do you want?" Like slow your roll I just walked in can I look. This is my second time here and same experience.

Pizza was all to one side in the box. Gave us the wrong order then when we got our cheeseburger there was a hair in it. we used to love this place but the last 2 times we ordered it wasn't good.  Maybe we'll try dining in again and give that a shot but delivery of food has fallen off for sure.

Let's begin by saying I don't even understand who would rate this place 3 stars it was delicious the pasta with clams in white sauce is phenomenal there appetizers too good I had the bruschetta and the baked clams will be returning for that and there dessert menu I am going to include a picture because I could not believe how many options they had I mean this place is really good the ambiance very cool the server is so kind I can't wait to return I ordered to go the zeppole and the chocolate mousse delicious me and the family enjoyed it ..guys they have a pizza menu with over 5 different options can't wait to have there pizza ... thanks for your service and fresh food

I like this place for consistent, standard, and satisfying options.  

Pastas are luscious and served with giant rolls (photo included). The Pesto is creamy and decadent but still very fresh. The Carbonara is thick and balanced. Neither are all that impressive, but both are satisfying.

I don't care for their pizza, as it's a bit doughy and not very cheesy, but everything else offered is wonderfully fresh and salty. The calamari I ordered last night was exquisitely crisp and had a delish breading.

Yayyyy!

After four years at Columbia down the street I've enjoyed many a visit to V&Ts. Its pizza is still among the better options in the neighborhood, and few other locations beat it in terms of ambience and access to campus.

As for pasta, as much as I enjoy ziti, the real star here is their chicken fettuccine alfredo, with peas added in. The grilled chicken they use is flavorful and slightly crispy, balanced out nicely by their creamy Alfredo and fettucine noodles. The serving is very generous as well, I often find myself stuffed with a solid quarter of the dish still uneaten.

In terms of pizza, I normally keep it simple - ordering a margherita at most. The goat cheese argula is as good as people recommend, but when I come here I'm often just craving a good margherita slice. It's definitely a pizza best eaten with a fork and knife though! The cheese has a tendency to slide off otherwise.

Like everyone else, the service here often leaves a lot to be desired. Unless you're a regular, they're not as nice or fast as is the norm for their competitors around the neighborhood. But for a relaxed Italian experience eating the staples in the neighborhood, I can't seem to stop coming back.
So good.  Very professional.  Love how the waiters dressed up.  Treat you like family.  Lasagna was incredible.   Swear was huge but delicious.

This place has been here forever and it smells exactly the same deep flavorful southern Italian food if you want something like veal Parmesan and you don't want it all gentrified out this is the place to go super authentic.And they have Zeppoli

We are gluten-free, in NYC... Yeah I know.

Service was pretty darn weak. They took ages to take our order (we were starving) and then ages to bring us our waters. She ordered the meat combo, I went for prosciutto and arugula.

You'd think the food was epic because service wasn't great right?

My prosciutto and arugula pizza had some of the best-tasting toppings. But the gluten-free crust was the closest approximation to edible cardboard.

Her meat combo likewise had wonderful toppings but the same awful crust.

I took a couple of slices home. The next day I heated them in the oven until they were black and dead. Then the crust was edible.

Next time I'm going for the gluten-ful pizza and ordering take-out.

V & T's is really a family tradition now. Im not from NYC but I sure do dream about v&ts pizza! V&Ts always delivers hit steamy pizza that is always fantastic! Thin crust or thick crust it's always crazy delicious! V&TS has a true Italian diner vibe but trust me once you sit down and start ordering food you know your home!

I've been here a few times and always have a good meal. V&T is a standard NYC neighborhood Italian restaurant. They have all of your favorite Italian dishes, a good selection of wine, and solid pizza. The prices are definitely reasonable, and you get a large portion. I do have to note that I don't always have the best service here. It's the type of place where you might have to eye your waiter to take your order or give you the check.

Definitely not the best Italian food, but worth checking out if you're hungry and in the area.
The pizza motivates me to become vegan. If you miss the few minutes when the cheese is still hot, you're stuck with incredibly rubbery cheese. I enjoy fridge pizza. This was worse.

V&T is one of our favorite restaurants! It is affordable, family friendly, and very tasty. They have a nice outdoor dining space with heaters. We usually get salad and pizza but their pasta is delicious too! We highly recommend V&T!
Awesome place. The food is delicious and the staff is so friendly. Pasta is amazing. The ambiance is nice, great place to grab lunch!

//5 stars for amazing crepe
//-1 for not up to par lavender latte

It's amazing I found this crepe place close to where I was staying. They have a variety of crapes - savory and sweet. It reminded me of a crepe place I had in the Netherlands, coincidentally. I got the banana, strawberry, mixed nuts crepe. The crape was done perfectly; the fruits tasted fresh, the nuts added a crush elements that was appreciated. The overall crepe was actually delicious - probably a huge calories but it was worth it. In addition, it did not take a while to get my food - winner!

Lavender latte: I was not super impressed with the latte. I was hoping it would be served in a cup with some ornate latte design on top, however they give you in a take out cup. I did order to dine in for reference. In addition, the lavender taste was very weak that it tasted as a regular latte. Despite that, it was a good latte.

I appreciated the cleanliness of the place and the good customer service I received while dining at this creperie. I do believe they have an outdoor seating during great weather as well.

Overall, good place to have good crepe.

what an waste of $27! i am sorry to be harsh but i was so disappointed.

i ordered the harvest bowl. the mushrooms were certainly not fresh; they seemed canned. it was flavorless. the quinoa was mushy due to being overdone. small portions.

my friend got the crepe with strawberry preserves--it was very small and the preserves were giving smackers.

Do you see the way they line up outside of Absolute Bagels for the fresh bagels? This place should have a similar line down the block for their croissants.

I'm letting the secret out, but these croissants are just way too good to exist in obscurity.
Just had drinks only today.  Chai latte and Perrier.  A very cute place. They have very good looking fruits and many different juices.
We ordered two sandwiches, a coffee and a smoothie to go. All were better than expected! Highly recommend a trip to the Village Creperie for a quick and delicious lunch!

I popped in yesterday on a long walk from Wall Street up to the 34th st east River ferry. This was a nice stop for my 2nd slice of my walk (I had one closer to wall street side, too). This place spanks the dongus hard.

I opted for the hot honey packet to top my white slice and I also chose to eat indoors.... Taking up a good 20% of their indoor counter space.

It felt like a good fit. Me and the two dudes working there. I could have just brought a sleeping bag and moved in and then yelled at them behind the counter 'yo Mikey, toss me another slice into my sleeping bag.'

Whatever these guys are doing w their crust and construction of their pizza left me wanting more. I'm currently staying w a friend in greenpoint and mulling a trip on the ferry and a long walk south from 34th to go snag another slice. Aaaand, it's raining currently. And I'd probably even go in flip flops.

That's how good this shit was. Made me also nearly forget about the first slice that I had on my journey. You, too, could become a forgetful zombie willing to move in and share a 40sq ft lobby with me and Mikey and co. (Names have been changed for illustration purposes mainly bc I also don't know actual names).

One of the hardest things I ever had to do was break up with East Village Pizza. I'll spare you the novel, but I couldn't justify paying $6.25 for a single slice of thin crust pepperoni pizza that would just wake my stomach up and leave me hungrier than before.

After taking a few months to heal, I was finally ready to get back on the horse and find a new late night pizza spot to hit after striking out at the local bars.

On Saturday, after striking out at the local bars, my buddy mentioned this place and that it was a good Prince Street Pizza comparable. We walked in here and were met with a small line and not one, but two, neon signs. I love a good neon sign.

The staff is LOCKED in and are running this thing like a finely tuned machine. I opted to get two slices of the thick square pizza, with the cute little slightly charred pepperonis on top hehe. $11.98 total for two thick slices. HUGE.

I think this may be better than Prince Street, but if it's not, it's 1a/1b. The crust is perfectly crisped, and those pepperonis are a gift from god. True artistry.

After demolishing the first slice, I was like "Damn I lowkey could have been good with just one slice..." I think I am still a bit scarred from the East Village Pizza relationship.

I have found my new late night pizza spot. I want to leave you, my dear reader, with a quote from Marilyn Monroe:

"Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together."

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

Better than Prince Street Pizza, there i said it.
Honestly everything here was amazing, I had mikes hot honey on the side and you can drizzle that wherever you'd like to your hearts content.

My least favorite was the eggplant but that's only because I had the pepperoni square first and I almost couldn't contain my gasm.

Eggplant: 7/10
Pepperoni with honey: 10/10
Vodka: 7/10
Plain: 10/10

Still as good as ever - this is still my preference over PSP. It's $6 for the spicy pepperoni slice, which a really big slice and the dough is still light and fluffy.

The staff is very nice and heat up your slice, and ask if you want any other topping like hot honey, which is a dollar extra but worth it.

There is standing space to eat outside and inside, or you can take it to Tompkins Park!

Food:
- white slice: 8/10, would taste better heated up
- pepperoni slice: 10/10, my New York slice!
Tasted so perfect even when it's takeout
- vodka slice: 6/10, not my favorite, tasted kind of bland

I have to say the pizza I had here was the crunchiest! And the pepperoni was delicious! I liked the pizza here but it is not my favorite. They have some great options on the menu! The place is small so it is more of a order and go type of place. They do have a section were there is like a high top but I did not see no chairs so we were just left standing eating our pizza. Overall I probably wouldn't go back. Wish I loved the pizza but unfortunately it is an okay for me.

Village Square pizza is easily going to be one of my favorite pizza places to go to now when I'm in New York.

I had it delivered through Door dash. Even though I didn't get it fresh, it took 15 mins to get to my hotel, it was still crispy and good!

I love these button pepperonis that these pizza shop uses. It's so addicting. Idk if it's me but it seems more spicy than the regular pepperonis. I love it!

TIP - hot honey is highly recommended! I gives this great sweet and spicy taste to it!

I highly recommend giving them a try!

Perfect for a late night snack after hitting NYC bars all night longggggg. There can be a line but it moves fast and the service is always friendly.

Get the white slice and ask for hot honey!!! It's heavenly.

It was great! But honestly it was a little expensive for a couple of small square pizzas, and they charge extra for sauces on the side. This is def the best granny slice in the east village will def be back!

It gets super busy at night so if you are looking to try it give it a whirl during the day

Honestly the best pizza I've had in NYC, and especially hits the spot for late night pizza. But to be clear it's not JUST late night pizza. Their dough is so fluffy and the crust has so much flavor as well.

The white square pizza with a side of marinara is my go-to. all the cheese complements each other and the slightly sweet taste comes through as well. They're usually pretty busy so I recommend ordering ahead.

Generally, this was a different pizza than others I've had in NY and I enjoyed it.

Ambiance: (4/5) I like the sign they had up and the bar style table where you can stand and eat.

Price: (3/5) I think this place was a bit more expensive than other places with similar pizza. It is still not unreasonable.

Food: (4/5) the square pizza was good but a bit too thick for my liking, but that's a personal preference. I think it was a bit burnt on the bottom for one of the slices. The topping choices are great. My favorite was the eggplant.

Service: (5/5) The food came out quickly and the staff was very nice.

In conclusion, this isn't my favorite place, but I would suggest people try it.

Yumm! Absolutely worth the stop. It was so good I forgot to take a pic and before I could remember I was in pizza bliss. Pizza is life here. Can't go wrong - I got classic pepperoni and my plus 1 the meat lovers. Both of us are counting down the hours to go back! How long should we wait? Just too good!
So good! Came here after a night out and then returned the next day because it was that good. My fav is the vodka square pie. The dough is fluffy and fantastic.
on their best day, clears prince street easily. hot honey on everything. if you're looking for detroit style, village square pizza is a great choice.

Close but no cigar. Village Square Pizza looks really promising, but fails to measure up to the finest slices in the city.

To be clear, the pizza here is good. But this is NYC we're talking here, and mere good doesn't mean much in a sea of standouts.

I tried 3 slices:
Pepperoni- the best of the bunch. This looks like a slice of the infamous Spicy Spring from Prince St, and tastes pretty damn close. They got the beautiful cupped pepperoni swimming in a pool of oil (I mean FLAVOR) and the beautifully tan, crispy crust. Minor dings for being a bit light on the sauce and pepperoni.

Vodka- this was disappointing to me. I LOVE vodka sauce, but there was way too little sauce here (a recurring theme). The sauce itself also lacked the depth found at Prince St.

Grandma- decent, but nothing to write home about. A good break from the other too thiccc slices, as this one is a thin, though (true to the name) still square slice.

I'd grab a slice if I were in the neighborhood but wouldn't go out of my way.

This is my favorite pizza in the city. It's not greasy, the crust is always thick and crunchy, and there are a ton of different slices available! The guys are so sweet and there's an outdoor seating area.
Village Square Pizza is my favorite square slice in NYC. No lines, hot honey, pepperoni cups. Can't ask for more.

This place had great pizza if you were looking to try a non-traditional NYC slice! The margherita pesto slice was delicious, and the white was also pretty decent. My friend wasn't as big of a fan of the buffalo chicken slice. The staff was very friendly and the service was quick. Not much room for sitting down and eating, but we just took it to go.

I have not stop thinking about these pizzas since I visited. I can't wait to return. The prices were reasonable and the taste was amazing. I loved it. They have many many options for you to choose from. Seating is limited so keep that in mind!

Village Square is a neighborhood pizzeria in the East Village / Alphabet City area that does pizza for takeout/delivery and by slice or pie. the interior is pretty modern and clean. there are no tables, just eating ledges & chairs. Village Square is super convenient to Tompkins Square Park if you want to eat outside al fresco with friends. there's a variety of round pies / slices as well as square pies / slices.

i have enjoyed pepperoni square slices as well as Margherita slices in the past. most recently, ordered a plain cheese pie aka "The Classic" for takeout and it was great. the pie came out piping hot and was neatly boxed up. the wait was a bit long but worth it as the pizza was bubbly molten cheese melty, the sauce had a nice amount of salty tomato flavor, and the crust was firm with a nice amount of crunch. this is a great neighborhood joint serving up some good pizza at a fair price. a 18" Classic pie was $22 + tax + tip. if you're in need of pizza in the East Village, hit up this spot.

staff is friendly and cool.

drops mic cuz i am living the life of pie
i out
zzz

Third spot on the pizza tour and this place did not disappoint at all. See my ratings below:

Ambiance: 3.5/5 small pizza spot but had some outdoor seating. More like a grab and go place, but we forced our way to stand in the restaurant.

Price: 4/5 a tad expensive as the 3 square slices were about $18. The slices were solid sized however i do think it's a bit expensive for the size.

Food: 4.3/5 the slices pictured are the eggplant parm, pepperoni with hot honey, and penne. In my ranking it would be pepperonis, eggplant and then penne. The square slice definitely was good and I am a big fan of square shaped pizza. I believe the penne pizza was lacking a bit behind the other two and the eggplant parm surprised me.

Service: 5/5 food came out quickly and we didn't wait too long for the order. They gave us extra honey upon request as well.

Overall, great pizza place and I would recommend to anyone coming into the city to have this place if they can.
Yes!! Delicious pizza, great prices, friendly staff, all around awesome  We weren't sure where to go but this place ended up being a winner

Awesome slices great prices. One of my favorite in NY.

The Sicilian is my favorite. Lots of options for toppings. I'd still go with the classic pep cups!
Great pizza!!!  Crust had a buttery crisp that was unexpectedly tasty!!  Small space but nice!

One of my favorites after a tough workout before the drunk food crowd is in full force. Last time I was here I took down four pieces of this thick, masterfully baked pizza and I enjoyed every bite of it. I'm not much of a pizza snob but it doesn't get any better than this for me. Vodka sauce pizza was impressive.

I wasn't sure I was a thick square pizza kind of girl until I came here. I ordered the pepperoni slice with hot honey and ranch (shout out to the bachelor Matt James for the recommendation lol). The crust was super crisp at the bottom and soft but not doughy on the inside. I'm generally not a honey person but the hot honey gave a really nice contrast to the saltiness of the pepperoni so I recommend trying it. Place was empty when we went so there was no wait and the slice was ready within a couple minutes of ordering. Would def come again!

We came in here after being in the area near by, we tried the Vodka , White & Pepperoni slices.
Pepperoni was good , the pep has a little bit hint of sweetness not bad , very good White slice , great tasting with the cheeses winner for me was the Vodka one , yummm great tasting sauce, nice & crispy the square slice was very very good.
Very small location it's more of a grab & go place, standing room .. staff was nice & friendly, prices are cheap all slices were Sicilian style.
Great slices , would definitely come back & check them out again.

Ordered: Vodka Square ($4.95)

The Vodka Square is topped with vodka sauce, mozzarella, and parmesan. Because the slice looked fairly unassuming at first glance, I was pleasantly surprised after the first bite. Simple yet delicious. The bottom layer had a very slight crunch, yet the pizza was still perfectly doughy in the middle. It had a nice chew and the sauce was delicious! Very solid slice of pizza! Definitely worth a try! I'd recommend it over the majority of the more popular pizza spots in the city.

A good pizza option, although I personally prefer the thin slice NY pizza. In my opinion, the grandma slice is the best and this shop has a great ambiance! I think they're known for offering hot honey on top of pizzas which is truly delicious.

5 stars because of the vodka slice. Eat it and you'll understand. Also the pepperoni slice *chefs kiss* those pepperoni coins make the sonic the hedgehog sound when you eat them.

If they made a vodka slice with pepperoni I would give 6 stars.

Pepperoni square slice rivals a tourist favorite: Prince Street Pizza in my opinion. Love having Village Square in the East Village - I get it as drunchies but also for a quick meal sometimes. The pepperoni square slice is delicate and freaking full of pepperonis. I love it when stores do not skimp on the pepperoni and Village Square sure doesn't.

The vodka pizza is alright, I'd get it again but it's not as good / doesn't have the wow factor of the vodka slice.

Small storefront, there's a counter and it's not hard to grab a spot during normal people hours. During drunchie time there is no space anywhere and you will have to fight to figure out where the line is and how to get to teh front. There is an outdoor parklet space but who knows how long that will last.

I'm glad that Village Square Pizza came to the neighborhood.

The must try slice: the eggplant slice. It was phenomenal! The eggplant is prepared without breading and it's tender and delicious. The slice is vegan but you can add cheese. I added cheese and it was very good but this makes the slice nearly $6 instead of just under $5.

I also tried the garlic knots which were very goodz

We ordered the Vodka sauce square pizza and it left a lot to be desired. We heard many good things about this place and were really looking forward to it. The crust was good but the rest of the slice was just kinda meh.

Make sure to eat this when hot or retoasted it tastes sooo much better fresh. There are minimal seats inside our outside on the sidewalk/street to enjoy it fresh out of the oven so just be aware of that. I really liked their pepperoni slice and know why so many people love this pizza. I'll admit i went because of the hype and it's expensive compared to the $1 slices but it is so good. The pepperoni is small, thick cut and they pile them on! My family thought they could've been more generous with the tomato sauce but the cheese was good too.
Ordered an eggplant pie and felt queasy after eating. Lifted one of the pieces of eggplant where it was layered and found mold

Great pizza I recommend if you're in the area they have multiple locations one is 1 mile from here on the in the village.
You can't go wrong with a pepperoni pizza or a plane here there's a lot of In-N-Out people coming here as well, so be prepared but it's no more than a 10 minute wait. P.S the pepperonis curl.

This is the best pizza I've had in New York! It's great for a late night snack or just a bite throughout the day. The hot honey is a must on any slice of pizza! The vodka and white pizza slices were my favorite. Each slice is around $5!
It's a solid slice that definitely scratches an itch. The sauce is a little sweet for my taste but the folks here care about what they're putting out and it shows.

Look, I am aware that Prince Street Pizza is the trendy spot and  gets all the movie stars to take photos with the owners and all of that noise.

But I'm gonna let you in on a little secret: THIS PLACE IS BETTER

That's right. I said it. They use better toppings, the slices are less oily and the the crust is just...better.

I ordered 3 slices here and 3 at the other place and I just preferred the overall freshness and the balance in the flavor profile to be better here than there.

Try it for yourself and let me know.

Happy eats!

Tried two slices of pizza from Village Square - a Sicilian style which had a thick focaccia-like crust topped with cheese and then sauce. It was fine but not my go-to pizza. It is quite bready and the cheese layer seemed to be gummy and sort of got lost. The sauce on top was too sweet for me, and was thick. The second slice I tried was a Grandma style Margherita - a thinner and crispy crust which doesn't really rise in the pan, it just bakes. Topped with sauce, cheese and a basil drizzle. This pizza I enjoyed more than the Sicilian. I think I just wasn't a fan of the sauce. They have a nice area on the sidewalk which is covered and has tables to eat.
At the NYCWFF event and just tried TWO varieties of pizza. The vodka and pepperoni ones. So so good!!! Joe is rocking it. Go give this place a try and you won't be disappointed at all!!!
Really solid pizza. I had two slices: pepperoni and buffalo chicken. Service was quick and easy. I will say I've had better NY pizza for sure, but it absolutely did the trick.

First time here. Very good place. Lot of delicious looking slices. I got Pepperoni and Sausage on a square slice. The good pepperoni ( thick and it curls up). Everything was good but the slice was a little too thick for me. As big as a big Sicilian. So too doughy ( for me)  But otherwise very good. I would try their regular slice if I went back. And I would go back.
Lowkey I think this is better than Joe's and Prince Street. Hot, fresh, quick, easy, and just plain good!

COVID report: Village square has a covered outdoor seating area.

This is my new favorite pizza spot in Manhattan. I was in search of a new pepperoni slice to replace my previous go-to, Prince Street, and this is it. (I stopped going to PSP after the whole racist comments/Blue Lives Matter thing; look it up.)

Anyway, the pepperoni and plain are both incredible. Eggplant was good, too, but I wouldn't necessarily get it again because the other two are all I need. The crust on all three slices was ridiculously good though.

Come here immediately!!
Solid option for pizza! I loved the crust on the vegetable slice. Each slice is also pretty substantial, so just one or two makes for a pretty satisfying meal.

When in doubt, go with the original location.

That is what I did here, and my golden rule still stands to this day. I had heard of this pizzeria from various sources, but refused to add it to my famous pizza project, as I needed a bit more dark horses and less of the main stream. I got myself on the L train and made it my business to give it a go, even in 97 degree heat. This is one pizza that must rank among top tourist spots, but not for the reason that you may think.

I will explain why, in the form of each slice getting its own respect of a paragraph. I got three slices, a Margherita, a Plain, and a Pepperoni Square. Heck, for $13, that is a delicious deal.

Margherita: The pizza arrives, hot off the oven, onto my paper plate. I could not yet hold this, as the slice was still hot upon first touch, and first bite, burned the top of my mouth. So now I make do like a Ben and Jerry's ice cream pint, going on mouth feel. The crust is very crispy, but a bit well done to my liking. Nice beautiful air pockets, but still, a well done crust. The cheese is flavorful and stringy, the sauce is a typical Margherita sauce. The thropple in this pizza slice works well, and makes it all pretty good. I nod in approval for this one.

Plain slice: Thirty seconds later, I try to try this slice. Again, I foolishly burn my hand and mouth as the slice is still too hot to pick up. I try a Squidward sized bite. Cheese is stringy, lots of cheese on this slice, the sauce is too sweet. Beautiful crust, but again, it is on the well done side. I try to eat this slice without burning myself and each time I burn myself. How I finished this slice with all my fingers intact remains to be seen. Could have went without this one if I had a redo, but it is a solid slice if you are looking for one.

Pepperoni Square: Intimidating, intoxicating, just one of those slices I looked at with interest and in trepidation. Just to be safe, I take a bite of a pepperoni cup. Already I am transported to another part of this universe. So good. So salty. So porky. So cheesy. I had heard they crust them with parmesan cheese. They do and it works. I had to also think about this. Is this slice better than Prince St Pizza? The short answer is yes. It is bigger. The Mike's Hot Honey is a delight. The sauce is deep and ripe but not overpowering. The pepperoni is delicious. A Big 3 of righteousness and delectability. Now, is it better than Paulie Gee's? The short answer is no. But whoever conceived putting hot honey on a pepperoni slice, I applaud you. It works every time.

There is no denying it. The slices are good, the service is friendly, and the experience is unique. Try these slices in your free time and hopefully you will feel how I feel. Who knows? Maybe you too will want to write about it.

Overall, I would recommend this. I had to reduce one star due to the lack of a bathroom and the place next door forming a long line covering the front of the shop. The pizza was fantastic and we tried 4 different kinds of single slices and came to the conclusion the eggplant was the best following the all cheese feta and the pepperoni. The seating was good and the music wasn't overly loud. The place was quite clean minus the dude before us who left a trail of trash.

Best pizza around , my kids love this place !!
I stop here at least one time a week, I order the one with vodka souse .

I stopped by here for a square slice of pepperoni with hot honey. It delivered.  Great flavor, and good texture. I really enjoyed it. As a regular traveler to NYC for work, I have been working down a list of Manhattan pizza options, and so far this is definitely in the top-10% of what I have sampled.
Delicious every time!! SO happy I tried the mint lemonade as well as my fave crepe this time!!

Village Creperie is a tiny joint that serves up crepes & some other bites + coffee + smoothies. stopped in and got an iced Moroccan tea. never had one and it was delightful drink and smooth refreshing on a warm Fall day. service was friendly and helpful.

it is a small interior and neat / clean, no seating inside. there are tables outside. Village Creperie is chill cafe where you can get a bite or coffee and relax. nice addition to the neighborhood.

Had breakfast here a few times already. Always happy with my dish. Hot sandwiches hit the spot. The crepes are an excuse to have desert for breakfast. There's an apple cinnamon option that taste like pie. Price point for the crepes I find to be a bit high but sandwiches are a deal for the quality and area we are in.
Their crepes are so good!! Limited seating though so be aware, might be best to get everything to go. Staff is so nice, they remember all their regular customers.

The crepes were ok the latte was great but the crepes
Just ok.  Very sweet and the walnuts should be chopped very hard toEat whole walnuts.  The fruit was fresh but they just weren't anything special for crepes

I have gotten delivery by Grubhub a few times. I love their croissant egg and cheese and their croissants in general. I don't eat sweet things so I can only comment on their savory crepes, I really enjoy the Gruyere Crepe.

I am very happy with delivery and customer service.

This is for the Manhattan Valley/UWS location on Amsterdam Ave. (I dont see a Yelp site for that branch.) Excellent iced  Americanos, and pastries. Lots of other foods which we didnt yet try. Helpful friendly service. Places to sit and enjoy both inside and out. Great spot for this area! on the block between W.105th and W. 106th Streets.

Pleasantly surprised by the quality of food and the numerous options available. They also have vegan options for crepes and other food options. Prices are great. Pancakes are $7 each. Bagel sandwiches with turkey ham, eggs and cheese are $5. Bagel and butter are $2.50. We all loved our food. There are sweet or savory crepes. They have smoothies and fresh drinks like orange juice, mixed berry lemonade and fresh lemonade. Very clean prep environment and they only used fresh produce and products.
Super down to earth people, a lovely space. This a place make a world a better place.

Craving for crepes & found out there are not many crepe places in the city! Here has some varieties though not many seating areas - would be a better grab & go or delivery options for breakfast/brunch/snacks.

It's a cute lil corner café with awesome staff! I dropped my latte like a clown, spilling my drink all over the floor, and the guy working the front was lovely enough to clean everything up and make me another latte

The food/drinks themselves are great too - my latte and blueberry danish were yummy. Solid recommendation for this place!

Love everything about this little breakfast shop. The owner is great. Reasonable prices. Following Covid-19 rules. There are two tables and four chairs right in front of the shop but as I'm not a fan, especially these days of eating out in the street/sidewalk we took our food to go. Our sandwich, coffee and muffin were all amazing eats. I definitely recommend stopping by.
Great service.. Came few minutes b4 closing and he still took the order and let us stay to eat.  This is the customer service.. Staying open till what the hour says....  Thanks!

The. Best. Gluten free. Crepes.

I could honestly stop the review there. This little restaurant is super quaint, but doesn't have much seating. Fortunately, with a park across the street you could take your food to go and have a picnic if they're busy.

Not all gluten free crepes are created equal, but Village Crêperie has it figured out. The combo I was looking for wasn't on the menu, so I just ordered a crepe with ham, gruyere, and an egg. So perfect. The chef even cleans the grill for me because of the allergy. My only issue is that when dining in a restaurant it's weird to be served your food with plastic utensils. This certainly won't stop me from returning though :-)

So I stopped by for the first time to try a crepé and have a cup a coffee to enjoy at the park. When I got there the guy at the counter looked out of it, like he didn't want to be there, the other guys in the back were in full conversation. I finally got to order and the cup of coffee was smaller then expected. I ordered Dulce de leche Crepe and what I received looks nothing like the picture presented on their website. It was good but the presentation and customer service experience could've been better. It seemed rushed. I expected a happier environment.

Very nice man in the front. I added an egg to mine and I was so happy, 1$ extra worth it. The gruyere cheese is so amazing and I love the veggie crepe. I will be coming very often now. Each time I come to Tompkins Park

I usually think sandwiches places are all the same. This was next level. Got a turkey and Brie with pesto. The bread was crackly outside, pillowy inside, the pesto was some of the best I've had, and i usually make my own.
I loveeee this place!! Food is amazing the staff here is super friendly and very attentive. Coffee is great I had the iced latte.

Yummy!! The guyere with mushroom and spinach crepe is divine and big enough for two to share. The brie crepe with apricot jam also smashing. Coffee is decent. Croissants are lovely and crispy/melty. A breakfast here is a great weekend reward. I get mine delivered in less than an hour.
This place is amazing. The sandwiches and crepes are very good. The owner is the friendliest person ever. I recommend the tuna sandwich and the apple cinnamon crepes. Coffee is also very good

They changed their coffee... umph! Now it's Overpriced Deli Coffee only More Acidic which burns my stomach. Their supplier told them it's the same coffee, it isn't and they don't have the discerment to tell the difference. They use to have a great coffee that tasted like you were chewing the bean without the grit. Very disappointing :(
I went there to place an order today and he is so mean.he is always cursing.if you don't wanna get frustrated stay away from here!

Really nice little spot across from Tompkins Square Park.  They opened right before the shutdown , really tough timing - they have been showing up & working long days ever since, always with the most friendly approach.  My usual is a cold brew & a delicious crepe - and I love that they have Il Laboratorio del Gelato , & great ice teas.  Two tables outside, usually one is available , & the park is across the street for backup.

Fantastic new addition to the neighborhood.  Awesome and authentic French crepes and sandwiches.  Great value for portions and taste.  Friendly atmosphere.  Can't recommend it enough.  (They've just added ice cream for the hot summer days.)
Grabbed a late night bite from them and it was one of the better vegetarian gyros I've had. The Buffalo wings were spicy and good as well. I'd order again.

Veniero's is a NYC institution. I love everything from the vibe to food here

Desserts: the cheese cake and the carrot cake are two of my favorite options from here. They are beyond decadent and filling. The cannoli was subpar comparatively.

Ambience: I love the vibe of this place. Many order to go, and you can just get a ticket, place your order, pay and be on your way in the east village. You can also sit inside! The seating is so spacious and lovely. It's gives off this up class diner feel to me.

Service: good and fast service

Price: huge desserts command slightly higher prices. The prices here are def a bit high but given how full you are after, it's extremely acceptable

The counter service is quick, but if you sit in the restaurant be prepared to wait. We tried a few small pastries and took some butter cookies home.

The pastries and cannolis were fine (get the mini cannolis instead of the full size), but the butter cookies were the best thing on the menu.

All in all, we'd try a different bakery before returning.

loved the european bistro vibes of this place -- the lighting, furniture, and food. the staff are nice but we did not get any water refills throughout our dining duration :(

the Vanilla Cannoli is delicious -- very flavorful cream that isn't so sweet. the Strawberry Millefoligie was mid; the cream was decent but the pastry sheets were quite soggy. the Lobster Tail was disappointing, the cream was good but the pastry seemed stale or not fresh -- it was hard and not crispy.

overall, I still had an enjoyable experience and would love to come back and try different pastries since there is so much variety.

I've been coming to Veniero's since I was a wee college student, and today, I tried the Sicilian cheesecake for the first time. WIthout a shadow of a doubt, it was the worst cake I've ever had in my life. One bite in and I gagged; it tasted like nail polish. The crust at the back of the cake slice was the only edible part, which isn't saying much as it was such a miniscule portion of the cake.

The strawberry shortcake was good as always--extremely moist, light and with just the right amount of sweetness. Thankfully we got a massive slice; otherwise, we would've been hungry, having not been able to consume the Sicilian cheesecake.

In the past, I've enjoyed their carrot cake and Camilla cake, which is why I'm rating this place 3 stars and not lower.

On a Sunday early afternoon, it took forever for us to get seated even though half the tables seem empty--at least 20 minutes--but once we were, and we got to order, the cakes came within 5 minutes. Water was filled several minutes after.

Stepping into Veniero's is like taking a step back in time! This place has been rocking and rolling since the late 1880's!!! And still going strong! When you walk in the counter spread is mesmerizing!!! Cakes, pies, bites, pastries, you want it? They got it! There's counter service, but if you walk around the counter you may wait to be seated in a very quaint spot! Decked in marble and coppers, this place just seeps decadence!
The cheesecake (and all its variations) are AMAZING! Top notch!!

One of my go to place for cheesecake. The servers are so nice explaining the desserts when I asked. The place just give old time nyc feels. There are some seatings outside that you can sit if you don't want to wait for a table.

Veniero's has been open for nearly 130 years, and there is a reason it's still going strong - it has some of the best desserts we've ever tasted.

We got this recommendation from someone who had eaten here 30 years ago, and it left such an impression on him, he said we had to stop and get a cannoli when we made it to NY.

The cannoli was incredible. Decadent, the best we've ever had.

The NY cheesecake, though. This was the big winner. I wish I could find the words to describe it, but it was perfect. Creamy & delicious. We found out this restaurant will ship its cheesecakes nationwide, so we will 100% be getting to eat this cheesecake again from the opposite coast.

Their affogato is now our good standard and what we compare all other affogatos to. Great espresso complimented with the perfect gelato.

The gist of this review is everything we experienced here was the best of its kind. We ate everything there, and it was so pleasant and relaxing to just sit for a bit in the afternoon and enjoy their menu.

Any time that I feel like I need some grounding East Village energy, I come here. It's pretty obvious to me that this place is here forever for a reason. If you can't get down with  Veniero's, I'm not sure you should have been there then in the first place. As a passerby/patron of 15 years, that is my New York attitude about it. It's a classic, how are you not stopping here year after year to bring a full box over to your in-laws!?

What took me so long to discover this place?!!

With the sweet tooth I have, I think that may be a sign. I literally went to middle school in this area and had not indulged in the sweet treat haven. Not until recently,  I started to check out reviews of new spots for pastries since most of my local favorites have gone out of business. Hence, the exploration on the Lower East Side.

My mom always says nothing happens before the time, and that saying applies to this situation. I originally thought about going to another bakery ( which should remain nameless), which was closed on a day during a time they were supposed to be open. All I saw our front was a sign that said, " Gone fishing until 8/22" so we went walking down to Veniero's and were pleasantly surprised.

This dimly lit cozy feeling pastry shop was full of sweet treats in every nook and cranny. We needed to find a cake that was the chocolate queen for the birthday lady. The Windmill, the Dark Chocolate Layer, and of course, I had to try the Carrot cake. After trying a piece of each chocolate slice. The Dark Chocolate Layer cake won hands down!! The Dark Chocolate Layer cake was decadent. Each slice was  $6.75, but the slices are very generous in size.

Chris, our server, said that the Dark Chocolate Layer cake was also his favorite and even the boss, who stopped by to make sure we enjoyed our selections, agreed! Lol

After sampling a bite of each we all agreed on the Dark Chocolate layer cake. With that, we ordered the 7 inch Dark Chocolate Layer cake to go on the spot. This cake was $32. He took the initiative and asked  if we wanted anything written on it. I responded with a resounding, yes, please! Then he said, "Just write the person's name down." He did a fabulous job! A true professional.

They also got the Carrot cake (my personal favorite) right. I noticed there were Carrot cake slices versus the Carrot cake rectangle. I asked, besides the appearance in shape, what the difference was? According to Chris, the rectangle slice has the nuts outside while the triangle slice has the nuts inside.

I will be back!!

All my Italian goodies! Coming from an Italian family and whose mom makes Italian cookies every Christmas, coming here was a must! Got a few cookies to try and they were all delicious! Also picked up my favorite Sfogliatelle! The bakery side is so cute, they also have a dine in side if you wanted to.

I have been to this historical landmark-y bakery many many years ago and have liked it.

Came back for a nostalgia visit and it was how I remembered it!

It has a very retro Italian bakery decor and vibe that kinda makes it feel like a Time Machine that transports you to the old times!

You can order to go in the front. They also have a beautiful area in the back for dining in.

When you walk in, you'll be greeted with cases and cases of all kinds of traditional and beautifully made cakes, cookies, pastries, tarts, cannolis, and more! They have individual size desserts as well as whole larger party size (aka individual size for me) cakes in the fridge towards the back.

Got couple of items to try:
Sicilian Cheesecake: This is something new for me and it's the one I enjoyed the most! It's a giant slice that they cut from the whole cake when you order and weigh it. I love the sweet creamy ricotta cheese - can't get enough of that! The chocolate chips and glazed cherries added some interesting flavors and texture. (Although I could do without the cherries, it tasted a bit like those canned cherries). I generally don't like alcohol flavorings, but the rum flavoring worked here - added some sophistication to the whole flavor profile! The ricotta cheese cake was enrobed in yellow sponge cake all around and another layer in the middles. I personally prefer that over graham cracker crust.

Diamond Baci: decadent chocolate concoction of chocolate ganache, chocolate cake and chocolate mousse/whipped cream.

Strawberry shortcake pastry: I normally don't get strawberry shortcake because it's always more cake than cream. Based on some reviews the shortcake here has a lot cream so I was intrigued! They definitely have decent amount of super fluffy whipped cream on top and in the middle of the cake. I would still prefer even more cream and more moist cake. Very refreshing with the strawberry and felt/tasted like summer!

Tiramisu Pastry: it's supposed to be alternating layers of fresh mocha whipped cream, yellow sponge cake soaked in espresso and Tia Maria liqueur. I personally couldn't taste much of those things, and would prefer a lot thicker whipped cream layer and thinner cake layer.

Strawberry Napoleon: I enjoyed the whipped cream embedded with fresh strawberry chunks, not the biggest fan of the pastry layers though. To be fair, I didn't eat the pastry until couple days later so they lost their crunchy texture.

Overall lovely and nostalgic Italian bakery where the desserts are good but not mind blowingly great.

How lucky am I to have walked in and had the honor to meet the owner Robert!
He was amazing and I found the delicious cookies I had fell in love with in Italy!
The lobster tail was absolutely amazing! The cheesecake and tiramisu also outstanding!
But the best thing was how kind the owner was! No wonder this gem has been around so long!

Pastries are extremely flavorful and fresh!  
Service is friendly although, they are super busy at times!
Had a 20 minute drive back home and the goodies were not harmed and still cold!
Love stopping by here

We came here for dessert to celebrate my graduation and it definitely left a lasting impression. Since it was late we were able to get a large table in the back for all 9 of my family members. Halfway through our time there someone from
another table got up to greet us, saying he was glad we were having a great time. It turns out he was the owner! He was super friendly and bid us goodbye on our way out.

When it comes to the pastries, my mind was blown. I don't even like strawberry shortcake but for some reason when I saw the waiter walking by with this one and I knew I had to try it. The creme was thick and rich and the strawberry was fresh. It's in no way traditional, and I'm pretty sure it isn't even actual shortcake--but I prefer this version by far. I would go all the way back to the East Village just to get this again. The strawberry millefoglie was great too, but I still prefer the shortcake. The stracciatella gelato was good but the pistacchio was bright green--red flag. Better to stick with the bakery items!

Adding another review to my previous review.

This is the greatest place in NYC. Go for cookies, go for coffee, go for cake.

What dreams are made of.

I ordered the mini NY cheesecake with fruit to go and the cheesecake did not disappoint. It was very creamy and the fruit tasted very fresh. The service was fast. I cannot comment much on the ambience as I didn't dine in but I would definitely recommend this place for it's great dessert selection and quality.

This is a must-stop if youre looking for some of the best pastries, cookies, and dessert in the city.

Located in the East Village at 342 East 11th Street it's right in between 1st and 2nd on 11th. Open 7 days a week, Sunday - Thursday from 8am - 10pm and Saturday and Sundays from 8am - 11pm.  Just to note, they stop seating 30 minutes before they close.

Veniero's is in the same building it originally opened in 1894, and still has many of the original details, including beautiful hand-stamped tin ceilings, etched glass, and marble floors.  Still operated by the Venerio family, this gem is a great place to stop any evening for that special dessert.  If you're not in NY and have a special occaision, you can have some cannolis and cakes shipped.  You won't be dissapointed.

Classic Italian bakery! Arguably the best cheesecake you'll ever have, though I wish they made it with the crust. Regardless, the cheesecake was like the perfect texture - firm but not hard or squishy.

The strawberry shortcake pastry was also very fluffy and refreshing, while the cannoli was the size of a baby's forearm. A must visit if you want to satisfy a craving and the place definitely has history too!

Believe it or not, Veniero's was established in 1894 which makes it almost 130 years old. It is an old school Italian bakery with all of the classic pastries. I've had their lobster tail, biscotti and cannoli from here. They were fresh and so delicious. They have many other cakes and baked goods which are all on display but I decided to go for the classics.

There is a large seating area inside too so you can enjoy your pastries with some caffeinated drinks at your leisure.

My friend who lives in the city said this was a MUST stop since we were in the area. She mentioned it was legendary and has been around well over 120 years.  If a bakery can stay in business that long - you know they've got it right! Loads of mouthwatering treats. Cannolis, cheesecakes, cookies, tarts - anything you can possibly want - it's there. I think I even saw ice cream off to the side. They have a dining  area, but we got our delish treats to go. Stop in and grab a little something, something for now or later.

My friend is a huge fan of tiramisu and saw that Veniero's was only a couple blocks away from our lunch spot this past Sunday. We got a slice of tiramisu and strawberry cream cake (?) to go and enjoyed it elsewhere. Note, if you want to eat the desserts in the restaurant, you have to go to the very back to be seated and order the desserts while seated. Otherwise, you are not allowed to enjoy the desserts at the cafe if you ordered it to-go style in the front.

The tiramisu was dry and was just OK. The strawberry cream cake was much better, but I found that it had way too much cream. My friend also thought similarly. Maybe we'll give the cannolis a try in the future since those look really popular.

Veniero's has been a NY staple for 127 years! And that is absolutely no surprise.

I've been eating treats from this bakery since before I lived in NY.

My older brother's regular dive bar always ordered birthday cakes from here. When I lived in the neighborhood I would come and pick up cannolis, tarts and pignoli cookies. And then after awhile, work made me in charge of ordering birthday cakes. I ordered from a variety of bakeries but Veniero's was the staff favorite. People loved the Fruit Supreme.

The other day I dragged my boyfriend here. He had ever been but his family has been in NY for generations.

He is always reluctant to do any tourist spots. He was more than happy with his experience.

We sat in the actual café. Monday afternoon on a holiday at 3 pm and the line was out the door for the treats. We didn't have to wait long for a table. This was a separate line. The menus had pictures of all the treats. I went in wanting the small treats but we decided on the tiramisu and the almond cheesecake. Absolutely delicious choices. We ordered two cappuccinos. Everything was perfect. We were both super happy enjoying a nice coffee and treats. The cheesecake was creamy but not too sweet. The almonds were the perfect touch. The tiramisu was a classic profile.

So happy we could take some time and enjoy what the city has to offer. Keep up the good work. And here's to another 127 years to come!

I think I've pretty much had every birthday cake from here since I was a little girl! My dad knows how much I love it so makes the trip out to Veniero's every year- even during snow storms. It's a taste of home I cannot get anywhere else and a taste that has been consistent for so many years. I don't know what their secret is, but everything they touch is SO GOOD. Please stop by when you're in the area and you will not regret it!

Iconic spot in New York with rich history. It's lively, busy, and serves amazing pastries and food. I wish I could eat through the menu. If you get a pastry please get it with their coffee, it's a match made in heaven. I'm obsessed with their lobster tails and cannolis (you have to try their cookies too). I can't rave about this place enough, you just have to visit Veniero's.

This is a great escape from NYC with a huge seating area in the back to unwind and have pastries or coffee.
Their pastries are quite delicious and this is quite popular for to go orders.
The only weird thing is if you want to actually sit in the back, you kind of have to cut in line those that are waiting to order to go which is a bit awkward.
After a long day, in the city, we decided to stop for a break and have dessert and coffee. The gelato was delicious and the pastries were yummy. I highly recommend coming here for dessert.

If you're a dessert lover, this is the place to go! I went here for a post birthday celebration with a friend. The seating area was really quiet and low key when I first got there. By 8pm, the place started filling up but everyone seemed to be catching up with each other and having a good time.

We got our desserts really quickly after you order. When you first walk in, you get to see all the dessert on display. Honestly, it's so difficult to choose.

What I ordered:
- Strawberry Cheesecake - delicious and my absolute favorite thing I ordered!
- Torta Di Mandorle - tried something new here and It was tasty. I was into the apricot flavor.

I will definitely visit again.

In the area and want something sweet, passing by this Italian bakery/ pasties place. Went inside the place, nice & clean. They have many varieties there, don't know what to get and then overheated someone said the mini apple pie is really good, so I gave it try. Mmm....it's nice.  
The server was really nice & friendly.
Definitely will go back try more items.

Had a call in order for two big birthday cakes and they not only delivered but this was above and beyond!
