When I went to pickup the cakes I stopped in their bakery quick to grab some parties to bring home!

They're so helpful here and the display shelves with all of their cakes, pastries, and treats are phenomenal!

Love it here

Veniero's and I go back, just not way back- I recently hit them up again for this past thanksgiving to pick up a few ESSENTIALS.

A few things I didn't expect to be soaked in rum were, and a lot of it was good but not great.   Surprisingly enough the mini strawberry short cakes were fantastic and the best thing I got. It was so light and airy, like eating a tasty little cloud and it wasn't super sweet or dense like you tend to dine elsewhere.

The rainbow cookies need work, I was disappointed, the berry tart was good, as was their special "Zuppa Ingles" soaked in rum, the rest was .. just aight. I sorta feel robbed paying $60 for disappointment but it wasn't bad really, just expected to be wowed after all these years.

What a fun unique place. Needed something for desserts to take for Friendsgiving and this was a recommendation. Old school with the counter full of delightful things and lots of fridges for full cakes. I'm drooling just thinking it about.

Got a variety of the mini Pattie's and they didn't disappoint. Wasn't mad at all when there were leftovers to take home

Again, the NY style cheesecake is the way to go here. I did try a slice of their Italian cheesecake too, and it is an excellent version of it with just the lightest hint of orange (I'm not a big fan of fruit flavorings).

Family owned and operated for 5 generations.....I think that speaks volumes to the popularity of Veniero's.

The line to order items to go and to eat in gives you a clue that waiting will be worth it.  

When you walk in the lovely scent of buttery desserts begins to heighten your sense of smell.  The bakery display makes you second guess which item you thought you were going to choose (I changed my mind six times lol).

The staff is friendly and efficient and considering the amount of tables they are attending to you are taken care of quickly.

I am not sure what was wrong with the bathroom (it was out of order) there was a sign directing you to where you could use a bathroom......there were arrows on the ground leading outside Veniero's and directing you to a store next door.

I hadn't been here in many years, and I really missed the desserts from here. This spot is an iconic pastry shop and cafe for Manhattan, and it certainly lives up to its reputation. Both the exterior and interior of the place are perfect for photos, and as soon as one steps inside, there is a wide array of desserts to choose from ranging from cakes to pastries. I love their rainbow cookies so I got those, and biscotti to go. The rainbow cookies are perfect because they are not oily like other ones in stores, and they are not too sweet. Since there was a wait, my friend and I decided to have our desserts to go. The staff were beyond kind, and were extremely patient with some questions I had about items. In the end, they also had a special surprise for each of us which made our experience absolutely amazing. I will definitely be back, and can't wait to try more of those items - the cheesecake looked very delicious so I hope to try that next time.

The environment is really nice and staff very friendly.
Unfortunately I went on thanksgiving, and I couldn't try the cheesecake slices.
They have a lot of options, the chocolate small tart was ok, the regular cheesecake was delicious, and the chocolate entremet (a lot of layers) was very good.

Beautiful little pastries and cakes that were delicious! A little pricey for the size but the service was fast and kind. Super cozy old school ambiance on the inside. Old timey New York Italian bakery!

Stumbled upon this place when we searched for dessert. It served Parisian vibes. There are a lot of gold accents and walls lined with mirrors. The seating is VERY tight. It seemed like a lot of people were in line for pick up or take out but we were seated fairly quickly.

We all got different types of desserts and I don't think anyone had one complaint. They had a ton of options and a lot of gluten free choices too!

Everything tasted superb.

Two words : Italian Cheesecake!

Have been comparing every Italian Cheesecake I've ever tried to Veniero's my entire life and absolutely NOTHING has ever compared.

It had been a few years and tried it again last night. WOW. Just as amazing as I remember!   So perfectly delicious and not overly citrusy. I often find Italian cheesecakes have way too much lemon zest for me. This one is just perfection.

A MUST TRY!

Beyond the cheesecake, an incredibly authentic and old school NY cafe/bakery where you cannot go wrong.

Note: Italian Cheesecake, for those who aren't familiar is made with ricotta cheese.

I've come to Veniero's twice, once for take-out and once for dine-in (dine-in at a bakery you ask? Read on!), and both were really great experiences that indicate why the place has been around for so long. During my first visit, I stopped by on a weekday morning for grab-and-go breakfast. The bakery was quite empty and service was quick, but just looking at the colorful display case of desserts is a good way to kill time if you need to.  I got a lobster tail, a huge croissant-like pastry filled with sweet cream, and I took my pastry to a nearby park to eat. It was delicious, with buttery pastry and ample filling that was light yet creamy, and I bet I was the envy of all the pigeons around.

The second time, I went on a Friday night with a friend after dinner since we noted that it was open till 11pm, but seems like everyone else knew that too since there was a long line both for take-out and dine-in. On my first visit, I completely missed that there is a sizable and beautiful dining room in the back where you can order drinks and desserts like at a restaurant, and it was a bit of a wait before we got seated. We ordered a NY cheesecake slice, tiramisu slice, and hot chocolate to share. We really could have just shared one cake slice, since they were HEFTY and we ended up with plenty of leftovers to take home. Both slices were very well-done examples of their respective cakes, and the hot chocolate was super sweet and creamy too.

Really good experiences both times, and the take-out and dine-in options make it perfect for both a quick treat or a more refined experience. The pastries aren't cheap but are so big that they're worth it if you share or have leftovers. Can't wait to try more things here!

Veniero's is over a century old bakery in Manhattan. It's truly a hidden gem. You cannot go wrong with any of their desserts and coffee. There's beautiful stained glass inside and it feels like you're in another decade. There can be a wait depending on when you go, but it is truly worth the experience.
Best Italian desserts in the city. The service is always fast and the ambiance has always been a good vibe. Been coming here for years and will Continue to do so as well!!!
Delicious Italian pastries and cakes! I loved their tiramisu and their lobster tail was really tasty as well.

A lovely Italian cafe when you are looking for something sweet! My favorite was the decaf cappuccino and cannoli. The cannoli melted in my mouth. The fruit tart was tasty as well. Service was friendly and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting! I felt like I was in Italy :)

I am surprised Veniero's isn't 5+ in ratings. It has been in the same location for decades and has always been exceptional. I can only guess that we, the regular patrons, take it happily for granted. If this pasticceria and caffe ever threatened to close there would be an outpouring in this East Village neighborhood. I myself have been going there for over 40yrs and have never been disappointed. I also have never posted a review, my bad! PS they stay open fairly late and you can actually sit and enjoy your food, cappuccino, etc in a warm comfortable cafe. I suggest instead of a birthday cake getting their tiramisu cake no one will be disappointed

Such a cute casual cafe with ample seating and great prices for any and all to enjoy. Saw folks of all ages from small children to grandparents having a blast here. There's a reason it's been around for ages!

Service is great when sitting in. If you prefer, options available to grab and go.

The menu is beyond extensive. Every pastry and coffee creation under the sun. Multiple pages with photos and everything. The two things I tried were delicious and I have no doubt I'll be frequenting this place to sample even more.

This is our go to spot for cannolis and cream puffs in the city. Service is always quick and efficient. They have some tables in the back that hold that old new york italian vibe but i've never dined in. A little pricy compared to your typical bakery but can't compromise on taste!

Historic and classic dessert and bakery spot with a ton of selection, seating, and speedy service! You can order at the counter, but they also have a decently sized seating area in the back that can accomodate groups. Their menu is gigantic and features pastries and drinks.

We got their cannolis and fruit tarts and they were pretty good! My fruit tart had giant pieces of fresh fruit on it and tasted great. Not too sweet or rich.

Interiors give off an elegant vintage European cafe vibe and feature lots of brassy accents and mirrors.

Would recommend if you're looking for one of those classic big city bakeries/cafes.

If you loveeeee cheesecake you need to try it here.

I grew up eating cheesecake. So much so, it's probably part of me. X-ray me and you will find a slice.

Warning though, this place does not give you a crust with the cheesecake.

Now at first, im like "what!?!?!? No crust??? What the f@$&"
But tbh while I was eating I was like, dude this cheesecake is friggin good, it don't need it.

The cheese is a bit sharper than usual. But it's smooth. It's sexy. And melts nicely in your mouth.

Highly recommend.

Love love love this place!  Has been here for 127 years and hope it is here long after I'm gone.  Classic Italian bakery with relatively reasonable prices for Manhattan.  I always end up getting the chocolate covered cannoli, but everything is great here, from the cookies to the tarts, to the pastries (love the strawberry mille feille), to the cakes, to the gelato.  Forget Ferrara's and the other over-priced bakeries in Little Italy.  Come here for the real deal.

This is my most favored bakery in New York since little me arriving here decades ago, period (ok I'm old, just so you know ). Their NY Style cheesecake has no rival, so is their tiramisu. This time I discovered their coconut cake is delicious too.

Can't believe that I never wrote about this cafe before.

Hello   anyone is home
I have been looking for a good vegan chopped cheese and this place has one! Fast service and very good food. Scratches the itch for bodega-style food

The food wasn't bad - I like that there are plenty of vegan proteins to choose from and lots of them could be gluten-free. I got the Just Egg omelette with some vegan cheese and veggies. (Forgot to tell them that I didn't want toast but I just didn't eat it.) Nice and filling, tasted decent (though could have used more seasoning or even just a bit of salt).

Then I saw MOUSE run across the base of the wall.

Yes, I get that it's probably difficult to avoid rodents in these older buildings even if you're not a restaurant. But it's made me hesitate wanting to go back.

If you want fast food and you or someone in your group is vegan/vegetarian, this is the place. Everything I've tried here over the course of around 5 visits has ranged from good to great. On my last visit, I had a vegan fish sandwich, with the requisite tartar sauce and lettuce+tomato on a bun. Very tasty. Their "chicken" sandwich also hits the spot. Their large selection also includes chopped cheese, falafel, quesadillas, nachos, vegan mac&cheese, cookies and more. Truly, the menu is huge for such a tiny little space and I've never ordered something I didn't end up liking.

I recommend getting the food to go. We've always eaten there, and that experience really depends on how busy they happen to be. Inside is close quarters and it seems like it's often partly occupied by people who are friends/family of the guy working there. Not a complaint, as the guy's service is always very good. He's been the one working the counter on all our visits.

There are two outside tables on a small patio, and they seat three people each but it's a tight squeeze.

It's the food from this hole-in-the-wall that makes it worthwhile -- they deliver on their promise of vegan fast food! Everyone can find something they'll like here, even non-vegans.

The food at Vegan Grill is decent but overpriced. Paying $17 for a quesadilla feels excessive, even by New York City standards. Furthermore, their delivery service has proven to be unreliable. I once ordered delivery through DoorDash, and it was mistakenly delivered to the wrong location by their own courier. The process of getting a refund from them was a hassle. So if you're in the mood for Vegan Mexican food at a reasonable price, Raíz is nearby.

There are some yummy options, but definitely fast food. My favorite might be the crunch wrap since I'm a sucker for crunch. The fish sandwich was good. The chopped cheese sandwich was a little overwhelming but good. If you are more into taste over healthiness, then you will be satisfied.

Vegan takeout by thompkins square park! Ok, so they have seating, but not a whole lot. I went at around 1 on a Saturday and there was one other person also ordering takeout so not sure if the seats fill up. They have milkshakes, breakfast options, burgers, wraps, and a make your own bowl option. I got the just egg imlette: you can pick 4 veggies, a protein, cheese, and bread options. Hearty and filling though a little expensive at $16. Wish they had coffee for breakfast! Omelette was filled up and whatever cheese they used was meaty, toast just lightly crisped. Good casual spot!

This is a diamond in the rough of a gem little restaurant Hideaway on St. Mark's Place on the lower East side.
They open 4 months ago.
My husband had fillet a fish sandwich with onion rings.
This sandwich has thousand Island dressing, lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles, on a soft bun.
it was So delicious! I wasn't crazy about the onion rings but that didn't even matter.
We both had root beer to drink.
I had a buffalo chicken wrap and I picked spinach as my wrap. It had tomatoes, lettuce, pickles and sautéed onions and you could choose from a blue cheese vegan dressing or a ranch or barbecue.
I had it with french fries as well.
For dessert we had a vegan très Leche and I think it was the best I've ever had Vegan or not.!
Everything on the menu looks delicious and the service is great!
I look forward to going coming back again really soon.

These fees?
Early on, I was into sampling everything on the menu, and figuring out favorites. Most everything was really delicious. These extra fees of late lead me to abort the order.

Tried the crunch wrap and breakfast burrito and was disappointed. The crunch wrap felt really greasy and gave me a bit of a stomachache afterwards. The breakfast burrito was pretty good, but also felt heavy (I took a bite). Overall, it's all still tasty but not necessarily quite as healthy as it seems.

Did a pickup order and they gave me the wrong item. Ordered a Just eggs omelet and got a sandwich. The omelet is like a $1 more expensive so it's not a big deal I wasn't going to say any thing. I am just annoyed I picked it up and got home to see if it's a wrong order. And was not about to walk there again.
The food was good but super expensive. $6 for tiny box of potatoes and $6 for small box of fries. Charges $5 for a croissant. $20 for chicken bowl. Just super overpriced for what you get but that's standard for this area I guess.
The taste was good my sandwich was decent but tasted like the Starbucks breakfast ones. The chicken bowl had toppings but very few. Overall I would come here again but not too often cause it's expensive for what you get. And double check your order...

Delicious cauliflower wrap! Took a picture of the menu as it's HUGE! this was my first visit and there were people behind me so I had to choose fast. With this picture, take your time and select without worry. I'll definitely try different options next time I'm in the neighborhood. Service was great too!

The cookies are some of the best I have had it's hard to believe they are gluten free!

I tried the chicken shawarma platter which was out of this world. Spices were on point and the white sauce was delicious. I will never miss out of cart chicken and rice halal again!

This is my new go to in east villags. Buffalo chicken wrap was massive and so so good - I'll be dreaming about it for months. Prices are reasonable too. It's not the speediest so expect to come a bit early.

I'm a regular and usually like the food, but they closed before 9:30 tonight when they are supposed to close at 10pm. The counter was blocked by the outside tables (which means that they shut down well before 9:30) even though the front door was still open and the "open" light was still on, and it is written on the door that they are open until 10pm. There is a new person working at the counter who was rude and lied, saying that they always close at 9:30. If this restaurant now closes at 9:30pm, the owners should change the advertised closing time of 10pm.

I watched the guy take gum out of his mouth with his bare hands, grab a piece of pita bread and eat it, and then proceed to prepare food, with no hand washing in between. Not to mention, the breakfast burrito I ordered was categorically not a breakfast burrito lol

Great food, I love the customer service. Very clean.

A little small so don't plan a party there but the food is great!

The menus a little overwhelming but that actually amazing how many options.

I will definitely be back

Marwan at the front counter was awesome - super friendly and very helpful with deciding what to order.  
The Vegan Steak and Cheese is amazing.  it's the best steak and cheese I have ever had, including prior to being Vegan and getting them on South Street in Philly. South Street can't hold a candle to these guys.

I'll start this review out by mentioning that I didn't bring my glasses with me and dangggg that menu was hard to read with that tiny az font jajaja. They also have like 100 things on there, and ya girl is an indecisive queen--so I went through a fair amount of stress before even ordering. That's a me problem though lol. I digress...

I finally panicked and went for the chicken over rice, which was pretty fire, albeit expensive for what it was at $17 pre-tax + tip (especially compared to street cart halal). BUT, this is no street cart halal. I was surprised by how clean it felt. Wasn't greasy at all.

As for the flavor, it was a bit on the sweet side--less savory than I thought it would be, but not in a bad way. Definitely a nuanced spice situation going on *chef's kiss.* I'm a bit of a maniac when it comes to hot sauce so I was LIVING for smoky, thick sawce they provided, and I think that was crucial to balance out the warmer, sweeter spices on the meat.

Not sure I'd drop that guap on the same dish again, but I do want to try the chopped cheese another time. Would recommend if you're looking for some quick vegan comfort food in EV.
This place opened last year.  Came here once with a coworker.  They have pretty good falafels that I would come back and have again.

I'm giving Vegan Grill five stars because the one thing I've had--cauliflower wrap with a side of sweet-potato fries--far exceeded my expectations.

I  had been watching the space, because the signage has been up for a week or two, and this evening when I was coming home, I saw they were open. (Shhh! They're in soft-open mode.) They're two blocks from my home, so it was kind of a no-brainer to walk in.

The place is spotless, masks are required, and they have an open kitchen where you can see the cook make your food--in mask and gloves. The menu on the wall was so voluminous, it's kind of hard to read, so I downloaded it on my phone.

I brought it  home and put sriracha ketchup on  the fries; I love having vegan  options so close to  home!

Freakin delicious
Must stop in buffalo chicken wrap so yummy and the onion rings so good as well
I am a vegan for over 30 years and love this place

So good I had to come back the next day! First, the lady at the register is super sweet, lovely service. Ambiance is a little reminiscent of Veggie Grill. The food is SO GOOD! I had the bacon egg & cheese 2 days in a row, & the crunch wrap.

I had the Sausage, Egg, and Cheese w/ spinach, mayo and ketchup and a hash brown today and it was great! I like how it was presented and the taste was exactly what I was craving. I just think I'll continue to go to the one in brooklyn because the price difference is significant.

This place is amazing such an overloading menu I passed by several times finally went in tried the cookies to die for than shortly after grabbed dinner for my son the chicken over rice (halal food) it was so delicious upset I didn't grab my own and it's completely vegan you cannot tell I mean it it tastes just like it so good amazing customer service very nice team can't wait to come back
Delicious! So glad they added this location :)) so many options. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Go taste their yummy vegan meals and treats!

Paid $16 for an avocado salad with no avocado or cheese! The 2 most expensive items I assume I'm
paying most for. Basically Just a tiny bowl of lettuce, tomato & onion. All which prob cost $1 total. Called them and they wanted to just give be a $3 credit. Sorry still not paying $13 for ingredients worth Pennie's. You can't totally leave on on the ingredient that makes the main course! So I had no protein and was starting an hour after I ate. I'll never return here. It's always something. They have kids working here and it appears no manager every time. Not a good way to run a business

I got the Buffalo wings and the Crunchwrap. The Buffalo wings themselves were good, but the ranch was the runniest consistency I've had ever had and it had almost no flavor. It was so watery it was bizarre. The Crunchwrap, which I ordered with the impossible meat, was good, but I wish it had sour cream and some type of cheese in it. I would try other menu items from them in the future to give them another try.

Meh.
I was excited that a vegan cafe was opening in the neighborhood because we really need a casual take out vegan sandwich type spot. There are dozens of plant-based date night spots but no just cheap takeout. But their menu is fast food that should be cheap takeout except it's for dine in prices at a hole in the wall. Cheapest thing on the menu is a $10 plain burger. No cheese. No sides. $2 extra to "flame broil" the burger. The sandwich I got was unexceptional but fine and was $15. I get that Manhattan storefronts are expensive but I don't see this place staying open if they don't lower their prices or make their food significantly better. At least make a cheap lunch special. The have vegan breakfast stuff so if I go back it'll be to give that a try but honestly probably not going back. For $15 I can get a really good meal at V Spot down the block or a Thai restaurant.

Stumbled upon this hidden gem when another spot in the neighborhood didn't have vegan options. Vegan chopped cheese was delicious, my friends aren't vegan and enjoyed the food which was cool! Definitely added to one of my favorites in NYC ima come here for sure next time I visit. Shoutout to the family who owns this business!!

I stopped here before a haircut this past Saturday. Just looking for something vegan and quick and this was a quiet, hole-in-the-wall spot. I wasn't expecting much so I was amazed by their giant menu and ordered the crunch wrap. OMG. I didn't know how much I had missed crunch wraps until I had one at Vegan Grill. It was huge, filling and had great ingredients plus it came out really fast. I will definitely be stopping by to try something else next time I'm in the EV!

This place is 1 to 1 match for the halal guys in terms of chicken over rice but since it's plant based it's is 10 times better. Plus the menu is fully complimentary with each item working with and enhance the flavor experience. The chick'n over rice is going to be a New York staple in the near future l with their pancakes will set aunt jemima free and pay her reparations.

rude staff. disrespectful. non chalant the food took 10000 years to come. the cashier assumed I couldn't afford avocado, and overpriced foods.

Don't go here

So it seems in less than 10 days the quality has gone down. Staff isn't the most attentive. They do not read special notes until after they make the order. They did call after the order was prepared only to state that they were unable to comply with any special notes and already made the food so they will not be able to cancel that portion of the order. To be fair, they did call less than 2 minutes before I was able to pick up the call. So maybe they can cook faster than sonic the hedgehog can collect rings. If you do order in future, please be aware they fail to read special notes, and if you have an allergy I suggest calling and reiterating that to the staff prior and post placing the order

Additionally, the Mac and cheese is the most bland dish I've had in ages. I might as well eat sand, but even that would have more flavor.
so. GOOD. their chick'n over rice is everything (and then some), as well as their mozzarella sticks. their menu is quite expansive, veganizing all of nyc staple grill/deli items

Okay I consider myself a connoisseur of vegan B.L.T.A sandwiches and this place has absolutely knocked it out of the park! Delicious but not-too-much mayo, crispy bacon, crunchy lettuce. I ate this sandwich over two weeks ago and I still think about it. I truly wish I lived closer to be in their delivery range. I am going there today to get another BLTA--although I should probably try something else on the menu, which I'm sure is as delectable. Go here! Keep this place in business, if not for you then for me!
The food here is amazing and the staff is very friendly! There are a bunch of options and everything I've tried is really tasty. Definitely try the milkshakes and chocolate chip cookies!
This place is seriously awesome the food is to die for I'm not a vegan but like !!!! So worth

This place is bomb af! I been here with my girl 2 times within a 2 day period, and every time I've ordered it has been a burst of deliciousness! So far we've tried the chop cheeze, meatball sub, the Buffalo chik'n wrap and the nacho burger. Each time we've ordered its always been tantalizing and tasty. The staff and owner are really chill and they really give time and attention to their food prep. I 100% recommend this little hole in the wall vegan spot. Please show your support theyre brand new and they are a needed addition to city. Again, 5 stars all around. I will be taking pictures of the food next time!

This place is great!
Lots of options to choose from and the place is clean which goes a long way.
Food was delicious and the staff was super friendly.
Giving it 5 stars, these guys deserve it....
The quesadilla was super delicious, cooked to the perfect temperature; great presentation and wonderful customer service. The bbq chicken wings were good also

Amazing and safe for both vegans and dairy allergy people. The crunch wrap is awesome! I've never been able to have that because of my dairy allergy, so this was super awesome to get to try and to not have any kind of reaction whatsoever!

SO GOOD. Honestly didn't expect much as my girlfriend and I stopped by on a whim, but I was pleasantly surprised. They have plenty of options on their menu, and friendly service. I had the Beyond Meat Chopped Cheese, my girlfriend had a Buffalo Chicken wrap. Both were out of this world. Highly recommend.
This little place is a gem for vegans. High quality food prepared with care. Family owned business. I highly recommend it.
Unbelievably delicious . Exceeded my expectations. Truly, enough said but yelp is asking for more words. So here they are.

Vegan Grill is definitely one of the best vegan restaurants I have ever eaten at! There are so many menu options for any possible craving that you might have. The crispy chick'n sandwich was beyond delicious & the service was amazing!
The best chopped cheese I've ever had!! The Oreo milkshake and cookies were to die for!!!
Restaurant is CLOSED. 3/26/22. Bummer. Wanted to try their food. Oh well. Please stay safe and come back!
I'm not vegan but I came here with my vegan friends. Now I regularly come back for the chick'n quesadilla.

i absolutely love this place! i'm vegan and i came here with 2 of my friends who weren't so they can try vegan food (because i got tired of their eating grass jokes.) i took awhile to order, but when the food was given to us it was so good. the cookies taste so soft and warm aswell. my friends literally loved it aswell.
Cooked to order fresh quality vegan food open late with great service to match!! I recommend the falafel wrap. Bread is the perfect texture, sauce is incredible with fresh toppings.

I have no idea why I had a review sitting here with a mere 4 stars; Veeray deserves every bit of the five full stars for just about every single order I've ever had.

This place in on top of the list when it comes to talking about my favorites in this city.   I order it monthly, it's a good deal, it's delicious, and delivered hot.

I absolutely love them.  Kind staff, good food, affordable Indian... can not got wrong!   Onion cheese  kulcha for the win.

Everything is good, check my pix for some of what I've had, it's all been great.

I tried the butter chicken and got a side of rice with naan. The butter chicken was so good. It came with a generous portion with a creamy sauce. I tried both the garlic naan and chili oil garlic naan which were both good, but I liked the garlic naan better. It's also byob which was great!

Service was quick and friendly. They were easily able to accommodate for our group of 6 and they take reservations or walk-ins. The atmosphere was great, it was pretty busy but wasn't too loud. It was pretty hot in the restaurant though, so I wished they had turned on the A/C.

Dropped in recently and found the dishes mostly decent, but there were a couple of standouts that made my taste buds dance - the garlic chilli naan and puri. They were like the dynamic duo of flavor, offering just the right kick and crunch.

The one downside? The wait. It was a bit like waiting for a friend who's always late. I mean, good company's worth waiting for, right? Still, it was a little longer than I'd prefer.

But you know what? I'm definitely going to give them a call for take-out next time I'm craving that naan and puri. Dining in? I might, if I've got a good book to keep me company during the wait. If you're not in a rush and love a bit of spice, this could be your next go-to spot.
Got a ton of food for four people and it was all delicious. Oh my God. Top marks omg biryani delicious

So happy i found this local indian spot! Was looking for a take out indian spot and it did not disappoint. We got butter chicken, garlic naan, and saag paneer and all were amazing, especially the butter chicken. I will definitely be ordering from here again and potentially eating in!

I've been wanting to try this place for ages, so I'm so glad we got the chance to! The restaurant is really cute and small, and the staff is super attentive. The only liquor they have is wine, which is nicely priced at $10/glass. We started with the bhel puri and samosa chaat. Both were delicious and perfectly portioned. For our mains, we got butter chicken, chicken korma, naan, and paratha. Everything was delicious. It definitely wasn't spicy enough for me, so I asked for a side of chilies that came with some red onions as well. This made the meal perfect. I'll also say that the paratha was the best I've had in the city. Will definitely be returning!! Amazing food, super affordable prices, and great service.

I am indian & love Indian food. My whole family is obsessed w this place so I decided to try it on a date. This is by far some of the best I've had in the city. I recommend the samosa chaat, lamb kebab and butter chicken. Omg also u need the garlic naan. We were seated from a walk-in luckily, but every person after us was rejected and they had a full house from reservations. It was a Saturday night however. You could prob walk in on a week day. Our waitress was extremely attentive. Had a great experience here. They also serve wine at a very reasonable price. The ambiance is not stellar but that's also to be expected for a reasonably priced Indian restaurant.

We tried this restaurant for the first time and had some good experience. Ordered variety of dishes and they were almost good. There mutton kabob are perfect and tasted so delicious. Curries were also tasty. They had different naans on the menu. We tried jack fruit biryani for the first time and honestly not the best. Flavor was ok but we did not like it very much. May be the jack fruit idea is not our thing.

The ambiance is neat and well maintained. The service is also good and fast. Overall this is a decent place to have Indian food.

Short review: Would recommend the kabobs the most of the appetizers (such as the chicken bukhni.) Ludhianvi Lamb Curry is a wonderful curry as a main while Shalgam Saag is one of my favorite interpretations of this dish in the city. Would recommend the Teekan Murg also for spice heads. For biryani, order the lamb or jackfruit. Goat has too many bones.

I have been to this excellent Indian restaurant a few times bringing a group and having joined others. The food here is excellent overall. In general I would say that their most successful dishes are anything involving the Tandoor but there aren't many faults in their mains either. As per normal, they gave some papadum and the normal assortment of chutneys after we ordered. They have wine and the usual lassi along with a homemade ginger drink which is essentially a less sweetened version of Limca and it it's quite refreshing. The review below is based on my most recent experience where I essentially ordered for a group of five people with the only doubling of any dish being the chicken bukhni and it came out to around $35-$40 a person with some leftovers.

For appetizers, we went with the achari chicken tikka, chicken bukhni, and bhel puri. I've also had their lamb kebab (excellent) and Amritsari Macchi (aka fried fish) which is also very good

Achari Chicken Tikka- Tandoor grilled boneless chicken cubes marinated with pickling spices, served with cilantro & mint chutney ($10)
This is an excellent moist chicken dish with my only complain being that maybe the pickling spices could be a bit stronger. While I would say that Gazab has a better version, this is pretty good as well.

Chicken Bukhni- Tandoor grilled blackened chicken cubes marinated in mustard oil, dry red chilies, Indian green chilies & jalapeno peppers, served with homemade pineapple chutney. ($10)
This is a more fiery tandoor dish as per the description with a much stronger char. The chicken is coated in spices and I prefer it over the achari version. The pineapple chutney they make works wonderfully cutting down the heavy spices. Would highly recommend.

Bhel Puri- Crispy rice puffs tossed with chopped onion, tomatoes, mint and tamarind chutney, sprinkled with chickpea noodles. ($7)
Alright cheap version. I think the chutneys could be a little bit stronger at least in comparison to other bhel puris I have had. Fine.

For mains, I went with an assortment of dishes. I've also had their butter chicken which was fine and aloo gobi which was very good.

Shalgam Saag- Mustard green & spinach cooked with turnips, flavored with ginger-garlic, onion & tomato. ($16)
This is probably my favorite interpretation of saag in the city. The extra vegetables cooked in add a delicious extra flavor while the turnips work for texture. Would highly recommend.

Ludhianvi Lamb Curry- Sonny's hometown favorite, boneless lamb cubes in a rich gravy flavored with ginger garlic, fenugreek leaves, bay leaf, and cinnamon sticks. ($20)
This is apparently a tribute to Punjab and what a wonderful tribute this is. Very tender lamb in a rich delicious curry. This is my favorite of the meat mains.

Teekhan Murg- Boneless chicken cubes cooked in Jamaican peppers & red pepper gravy. ($18)
If you are in into chili, this is a very spicy dish (I presume said peppers are Scotch Bonnets or something similar.) Nice tender chicken and the spice helped elevate other dishes but I'm not sure if I would order this solely.

Goat Biryani- Steamed basmati rice, layered with goat on the bone, flavored with saffron, rose water, plum seeds & fragrant spices. ($20.)
This was probably the only just alright dish we had. The spices of the biryani were wonderful but there are way too many bones. Would instead recommend the lamb (which is boneless) or jackfruit as you're getting the same wonderful spices but you're actually able to eat everything.

For breads, we got the Aloo Paratha, Chili Garlic Naan, and Spinach and Cheese Amritsari Kulcha. All three of the breads are delicious with my favorite being the kulcha due to the filling. The paratha could use more potato while the chili garlic naan was excellent. All three were good and they all arrived with four pieces. We also ordered a side of rice which was $4 what is the expected price for the area.

The food here has been delicious every time I've been here. While I potentially would not recommend the goat biryani just because there were too many bones, the rest of the food has been amazing with special notes going to the dishes I listed in the mini review. Staff is nice as well. Will go back again (and again.)

I've been to Veeray da Dhaba before, and I quite liked it last time.

This time around, we were made to sit a little bit more inside, and it turned out to be most unpleasant with a very loud crowd right next to us. No doubt that's affecting this review of mine, even though it's not fully the establishment's fault. What is theirs to be blame, however, is how ridiculously expensive the food is! Without naan or rice, the butter chicken was $18. Which is sort of becoming the standard, but it's to me just too much, and I think I must simply opt for cheaper Indian joints. Especially when you consider the fact that the butter chicken dishes wasn't particularly special, with small-ish chicken pieces.

What was amazing however was the tandoori chicken. It was expensive as well, but it was really tasty. The service is good.
The butter chicken was delicious and the naan were fluffy in the inside and crispy on the inside. Loved as soon as you enter the restaurant you can smell all the delicious food already!!

Good neighborhood joint with emphasis on spice with Punjabi flavors throughout. We got seekh kebabs to start which were juicy and spicy . We also got lamb biryani and butter chicken with an order or garlic naan.  The lamb in biryani was soft and tasty. Rice was a bit disappointing because it was a bit gummy and felt cooked in advance. Butter chicken was chopped up and felt a bit too small.

Excellent food. Excellent service
Very good operators. Great Indian food. Lipsmacking
Some of the best Indian food I've had in the city. Every dish ordered was a fresh take on what should be a routine staple. Price point was perfect and the service was world class!

This came recommended to me by a friend who actually lives on the upper west side. For him to venture all the way to the east side for Indian food set my expectations really high.

I thought that the chicken biryani was the best chicken biryani I've had. The flavor was there. The chicken was so moist. I've had issues with the chicken being very dry at other places.

The aloo gobi was also pretty good, but it wasn't better than the Indian place where I usually get my take-out.

I can't give this place a five star because I felt that the butter chicken fell below expectations. The flavor was there, but as you can see in the photo, the chicken pieces were cut into pinky nail size pieces. I almost felt like a baby eating the chicken. Was it intentional? Were they afraid that I was going to not chew and choke on the chicken?

The flavor is definitely there! The portion size is questionable. But given how amazing the chicken biryani was, I would return here for dine in or take out!

The interior is narrow, but there are wonderfully delicious smells upon entering the restaurant. It made me want to order everything!

We ordered takeout. We got the chicken and lamb kebabs had decent flavors but the chicken a little bit dry. The naan had good portions. The goat curry was flavorful, but a tiny bit saltier than what I liked. The basmati rice a bit undercooked and hard. We wanted to order chai to go, but the staff member said that they don't have that to go which is a bummer, but is also a good excuse to come back!

The staff is very friendly and patient. We asked so many questions and they were always ready with an answer.
Great food! Casual atmosphere. The service was great as well. Definitely worth a try.
Veeray has a relaxed, casual atmosphere. Delicious food. Lovely service. Highly recommended.
Butter Chicken, Chicken Korma, Lamb Biryani, Garlic Nann all tasty and fabulous!!! Our server was awesome!!!  Cute decor!!!Will be on my hit list when next in NYC!!!
Best chicken tandoori I've ever had. It was juicy, spicy yet balanced. It's one of the few times my tandoori wasn't all dried up.

This is a relatively new restaurant - opened less than 2 years ago.  Came here at the recommendation of friends who live in the neighborhood.  Like many NY restaurants In the east village it's not very big and the layout of the dining room is long and narrow with tables lining one side of the walls.  There is no outdoor space.  The front side is a good place to sit if you want to have some natural light.  We were there early evening on a weekday so it wasn't crowded which was good as the tables were now not in any way distanced.  Food and service both quite good, especially the butter chicken and the Parantha bread, soft and flakey and non-greasy - we got extras to take back which made for excellent breakfast.
Very good Indian food in the East Village. Great attentive service. Small, nice restaurant

This is one of my favorite Indian restaurants in the area. I had the aloo tikki chole and paneer makhani with garlic naan. This place has pretty standard fare for an Indian restaurant, but it's all executed really well and at a pretty reasonable price.

The food was so yummy! The portion sizes seem small but it's def enough. I recommend 2 appetizers and a main with naan. Should be enough! I wish they would serve rice but that's about it ! They also have an assortment of wines and beers.

FYI: BYOB.

Came here on a Friday evening with a large group and it was quite crowded--even so, service was fast and attentive throughout which is always a plus. Big fan of the interior, which combines the wooden minimalism of a modern establishment with brightly-coloured chairs more reminiscent of a hole-in-the-wall. Presentation is clearly a priority here: naans are sliced and placed neatly in baskets and dishes are served in gold-handled pots and pans.

We got the samosa chaat to start, butter chicken, saag paneer, and chicken biryani. I was particularly impressed by the samosa chaat and the saag paneer. Biryani was fluffy and had great texture but tasted slightly bland. In general nothing we got was very spicy, and surprisingly not very heavy either.

The naans were perfectly pillowy and warm; highly recommend you order at least one. We got three: classic, garlic, and chili garlic. All were great but chili garlic was my favorite by a long shot. Wish more places had this offering!

So many vegan options! The staff/chef are very knowledge about what's vegan and what's not - just ask! The food is so good and portions are perfect.

Some of my favorite dishes (as of 5/2022):
-Veeray di Gobhi
-Bhel Puri
-Shalgam Saag
-Jackfruit Biriyani
-Masala Bindi
-Pindi Chole
-Tandoori Roti

Veeray is a great hole in the wall for Indian food, perfect for a rainy day. Staff was very attentive, our waitress Urja, I believe, was super engaged and offered food suggestions. For an appetizer we got the achuri paneer and for our main we split the butter chicken. The garlic naan was excellent on the side to complement the chicken. Overall, fantastic meal and we will be back to try other dishes!

I walked past the restaurant many times, but I am glad that we stopped by and dine. This is a Punjab restaurant which offers their take on many of the staple dishes. We ordered Puri as appetizers, lamb saag, lamb curry, rice and garlic olive nann. Food came very quickly and everything tasted fresh and bold with flavor. I enjoyed everything with no complaints. There are a few indian restaurants in the area that we dine- I'll be adding Veeray da Dhaba to our list of regulars.

Butter chicken was to die for!
No frills but good vibe and delicious food. Perfect for a Sunday night!
Excellent food and service! Teeka Murga and Butter Chicken were both delicious! Wait staff was very attentive and cheerful.

Uhhhmmaazing food - the biryani was better than a lot of the ones I have tried in India
Must try - highly recommend

A small, nearly hole in the wall, type restaurant nestled downtown that you might almost miss it if not for the bright mustard sign. The rare 5 star rating on Yelp, is much deserved for this restaurant!!

While we were one of 2 tables during lunch on a Tuesday afternoon, we couldn't have had a better experience. Garlic naan perfectly dressed and crisp, Basmati Rice cooked to be precisely fluffy and fresh, A deconstructed Samosa Chaat that bursts with the perfect balance and flavor combination and a Butter Chicken so tender and well-seasoned.

For an Indian restaurant with a Michelin star chef, the prices were incredibly reasonable. Definitely breaks my top 3 for Indian joints in the city

Tried to order through Yelp as delivery and never received it. The weather was really bad, so that was probably part of the problem.

I'm sure the food is amazing, but I'd suggest going to the restaurant or ordering online through another service.

Stopped by for quick dinner with a friend. They were very welcoming and place was cozy. We got seated right away. It wasn't busy but a lot of deliveries were going out. We ordered few appetizers like Malai and Seekh Kababs , presentation was amazing. In the main course it was definitely butter chicken and garlic naan and we went with paneer saag. Food was very authentic to Indian roots. Definitely will be back.

Ambiance- 10/10 Small Cozy Dhaba Style
Service - Amazing 10/10
WiFi - Not Sure
Parking - Goodluck
On All Delivery Platforms

The food was excellent! If you're looking for a cozy, relaxed atmosphere where you can grab some delicious Indian food, you've chosen the right destination. The waiters were very friendly and helpful.
So good i genuinely cannot stop eating here .. amazing every single time & the best indian food i have had in years
Delicious, fragrant Indian food, great service in a cute setting. Fluffiest naan ever.

Went here on Friday night around 7:30pm and the place was packed. Reservations are generally recommended but we managed to score the last available table for 2. Service by Yankee and the owner Sonny was impeccable.   The glasses were regularly refilled with water. Staff was attentive for extra silverware or plates. The food was delicious. We had a deconstructed samosa chart for starters. For the main course both the butter chicken and goat bhuna delighted our palates. The naan was tasty and filling. Bonus the place is currently BYOB until their liquor license comes through. Would highly recommend and plan on returning!

"Dhaba" and "Michelin-starred chef" usually don't go together in the same sentence, but alas here we are, with some renowned Punjabi cooking coming out of a tiny hole-in-the-wall on 1st Avenue. The quality cooking here might find a better home on the famous Delhi-Murthal Road.

We selected some dishes that a dhaba would do best to start: kadhi, daal makhani, and garlic naan. The kadhi was excellent, with the lovely flavor of haldi infusing the pakode, which were neither too hard nor totally melted as is often the case. The daal was deliciously rich and paired well with the naan.

We also ordered a paneer tikka (dry, not gravy) - very well marinated and perhaps a contender to beat my other favorite in the city at KP on 27th street.

Next time will be back to try the chole kulcha and sarson ka saag makki di roti!

We got an assortment of dishes and tried some of the appetizers and drinks. The food came out pretty slowly so all told we were there for probably a couple hours. Service was not great, when we were giving our orders the main guy in charge had to go answer the phone -this is not a great look. There was a girl standing outside the kitchen doing nothing for pretty much the whole first hour, I'm sure she could have either answered the phone or taken our orders.
The mango lassi and salty lassi were decent, nothing special. At this point you'll never hear me say any mango lassi is amazing though.
The samosa chaat was alright, but too expensive for the small morsel of food that we got.
The Gobi Manchurian was excellent. Probably the best Gobi I've had in a really long time. That's single handedly pulling my rating here up from a 3, frankly.
The chili garlic naan was really good -honestly seems like a no brainer; how do you improve garlic naan? Add chili!
The mains were all pretty standard fare. Not great, and not a lot of food given they were all pretty pricey. I ordered the spiciest dish on the menu and it certainly had the appropriate level of spice.
Overall -not great, not awful. The hunt for good Indian food in NY continues!

EXCELLENT food...

Was visiting NYC, was told about this place.  Food was great, would go back again and would recommend.

While Veeray da Dhabba might not seem like much from the outside, the food tells a different story. Everything was flavorful and cooked incredibly well. The garlic naan was perfect. I would recommend the aloo tiki chaat, the teekan murgh, and the butter chicken. If you want an extra punch, ask for some chilis and onions on the side. This place is definitely a good place to go if you're craving quality Indian food!

Food was very good but buyer beware of price changes when you get your bill.  I stopped  in  the restaurant on a Friday afternoon to ask for a menu because I wanted to order and eat at home.  I live near the restaurant.  A staff member handed me the take-out menu from a pile of take-out menus on the  top of  the service table in the middle of the restaurant.  That evening i ordered from the menu given to me - two main dishes and bread and told them I would pick up the meal myself since I live so close.  They said to come in a half hour which I did and the dishes were ready and packed.  I was handed the bill and took a look.  I noted the main courses which were listed at $18 on the menu were $20 on the bill and a convenience charge of $1.89 (as I recall the price) was added.  I inquired why I was billed $20 for each main dish instead of $18 as printed in the menu I received.  The gentleman who appeared to be in charge told me the prices have been changed but the were waiting for new menus.  he also informed me that the convenience charge was for using a credit card and that if I had paid in cash there would not have been a charge.  As I was perplexed because no one informed me about the change in price nor the convenience charge.  Be that what it may, i was annoyed that no one indicated these price changes/additions before i order and though surely someone should have manually changed the pricing of the dishes in the menu.  The prices were $2.00 more than printed.  I went out and noticed a big menu in the window and took a look.  The big menu in the window priced each dish $1.00 more than was printed in my take-out meno at $19 instead of the $20 i was charged.  I returned inside and again inquired about the price differential. The man in charge again said they were waiting for the new menus. I left.  I did not look to see what the pricing was on the menus for those seated inside at tables.  It may be a small amount -  a bit less than $10 on my bill but I think they should have honored the  prices printed on my menu.  They made no offer to adjust my bill.  I did not want to argue.  Thus, even though the food was good, I will not eat there again. Those who go to this restaurant, if you care about prices, ascertain cost of each dish from the person who waits on you before you order.  I do not trust this restaurant now. They engender no good will with this customer.
Everything is delicious! We ordered the chicken kormah and paneer makha. The naan is also a must have!

Picked up food from this restaurant. I was a bit hesitant to order food from here based on the slightly negative reviews I had read.

I ordered the samosa chaat and butter chicken.

Samosa chaat was quite tasty and flavorful but the portion was tiny compared to what I had seen on reviews. Butter chicken... was not good at all. There was barely any seasoning. This is shocking since I'd read that this restaurant has a Michelin star chef? It was so bland that I had to add more coconut milk and seasoning myself.... very disappointed.

Will be looking for a different Indian restaurant in the area :(

My sister and I were craving Indian food, and this place happened to be right next to my old apartment building and two blocks away from my current one, so it's always been on my radar.

After my experience, I can confidently say I'm never going to get Indian food delivered to me again now that I know a place like Veeray da Dhaba exists and is obviously much more conveniently located than any another Indian restaurant that I'd only really be able to access via food delivery app. The atmosphere is very clean and welcoming, and from the moment I walked in, my sister and I felt like we were being welcomed to someone's home in a way. It was just that comforting to be there.

Everything on the menu sounded really good! I definitely plan to keep coming back to try more of their offerings, but for our first visit, we kept it simple with Butter Chicken (since that's what my younger sister is familiar with) and also tried Gobhi Paratha for the first time--both did not disappoint whatsoever! The meat was very tender and the paratha, though simple, was very tasty and something that I still think about until now because of how good it was.

Besides the food, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. I just felt very at-home and taken care of. Because of this, this will be the only Indian restaurant I'll most likely keep coming back to and supporting, especially after reading about how the restaurant came to be and knowing how passionate they are about spreading and bringing exposure to Punjabi dhaba cuisine.

So, if you're looking for a comforting and high-quality Indian restaurant that'll make you feel right at home, this is the place for you!

I've finally found a solid Indian option in the city (that's not some form of fusion). Veeray presents tasty North Indian options that are pretty spot-on in terms of flavor and portions. Prices are slightly on the higher side, but that is to be expected with Indian fare in the city these days. What I like most about the options is that there is something for everyone; the menu features staples such as tandoori chicken and butter chicken while also including more unique options like Pindi Chole and Amritsari Macchi.

Teekan Murgh -- This was the only dish I tried, but boy was it good. As a spicy food lover, I'm often disappointed to see Indian restaurants in the city tone down the spice on traditionally spicy items as a means of catering to a wider audience. I was thus hesitant about the spiciness of this dish (despite the name translating to "spicy chicken") but was pleasantly surprised when it delivered both on spice and flavor. The gravy was hot and well-seasoned with a generous portion of chicken chunks. I enjoyed the gravy with some basmati rice (comes with all entrees). Overall, the meal was filling and very enjoyable; at $16, it is a bit pricy but definitely in-line with similar places.

I'm so happy to see small businesses thriving during the pandemic and am positive that Veeray will thrive in years to come. Definitely check this place out if in the area and try some of their more unique options!

I've lived in the east village a long-ass time and I have to say, I practically grew up here on the Indian food from back in the day when East 6th street was THE place to get it. Sadly, if they are still there, those establishments have not really stood the test of time. Enter: Veery da Dhaba. WOW. The layers of the flavors are so rich and full, the textures are perfection - you can TASTE the LOVE in the lamb curry that only an Indian grandmother would make. We were so delightfully surprised by the Saag Paneer, a typical dish that isn't so typical here! The flavor profiles are ones that are familiar but ring with a new and bold life! Consider us converts. We've found our new NYC Indian restaurant home. Thank you Sunny - (owner and all-around great guy) for this wonderful food.

No photos because I was enjoying the time spent with my 4 friends! Overall, service was a little slow, but the food was worth the wait! For the five of us, we got Shalgam Saag, Paneer Makhani, Dhaba Dal, three breads (Garlic Naan, Butter Naan, Onion cheese Kulcha), and 1 portion (waiter told us it served 2 people) of rice. We also got 2 mango lassis and one of each dessert (Rasmali and Gulab Jamun). Total came out to less than $20 per person (before tip), so very affordable! My favourite was the Shalgam Saag - it was my first time having this dish, and I was pleasantly surprised by the flavour.

The place is on the smaller side, so there's only 1 bathroom. But, it was well kept, so I can't complain there.

The butter chicken from here has become one of my top 10 cravings. So satisfying. The portions are large and every time I find myself getting closer and closer to finishing it all in one sitting because it's just too delicious.
Very authentic and delicious food. Sometimes service is not a quick but reason for it is crowdedness.

Waited about 5-10 minutes for an indoor table on a Monday night around 7:30.

Pierogies (boiled): mushroom/ saukraut + short rib 5/5, I thought these were excellent! Especially the short rib. Next time we'll try them fried
Beef Borscht: 5/5, also delicious although I think the $6 cup portion is very tiny. We got the bowl.
Beef stroganoff: 2/5, needed salt, meat was bland, and the noodles were way too soft/ mushy. Not an expert on this dish (so maybe that's the goal) but overall I just did not enjoy it and wouldn't get it again.

No complaints on the service or ambiance! Informal diner setting

Came here for dinner since we don't typically get Ukrainian or Eastern European food, glad we tried it but wouldn't come back personally.

Friday night so there was a long line that thankfully only took 20-30 minutes. Service is brusque and efficient, which I appreciated given the crowd necessitates faster table turnover. We were seated outside alongside the restaurant wall which meant lots of pedestrians and waiters rushing past between the restaurant and parklet.

I wasn't impressed by the food though. Potato salad was a decent side but pierogis and stuffed cabbage were disappointing. Some cuisine bias definitely plays a part, but I'd prefer most other forms of dumplings, potstickers, or gyozas in terms of flavor and texture. Matza ball soup is like a plain and simple comfort broth.

The beef stroganoff meat was extremely tender, but as other reviewers have said, bland enough for me to add more salt+pepper complementing mushy noodles. I guess we shouldn't expect al dente pasta, but the lack of texture left me underwhelmed.

I've always wanted to try Eastern European food, so I stopped by Veselka for some Ukrainian dishes! We ordered the Chicken Noodle Soup, Peach Salad, Latkes, and Deluxe Meat Plate, and I'll break down the experience:

The chicken noodle soup was nothing spectacular, but to be fair, the matzoh ball soup is more popular and recommended -- I should've gotten that instead. I was disappointed by the pierogies and even more so by the latkes :( They weren't crispy but were wet and soggy? I think we got a bad batch though because I've heard great things about the latkes. To end on a high note: the salad was surprisingly good -- the table's favorite -- and I'd consider returning just for it.

All in all, the food was alright, but I'm confident there are better Ukrainian restaurants in the city.

I came here for a late dinner after watching an off broadway show not too far away. Since I came here late, they were not busy, and I got seated right away.  I got the borscht, short rib pierogis and an assortment of the other ones.

The food came quickly. The borscht hit the spot, but the bread that came with it was meh, even after I dipped it in the soup. The waiter said the pierogis taste better fried, but boiled is traditional, so I got an order of each. I definitely preferred the fried pierogis. The short rib filling and the various other fillings I tried were all good.

+1 to some of the other reviewers, it doesn't look like a lot of food, but it fills you up. I am not sure that I am a big fan of the cuisine, but definitely recommend to anyone to give it a try.

Didn't realize when I added this place to my list that it was such an iconic NYC restaurant. Hubby and I were staying in the lower east side so I saved some places near the hotel - this one made the list b/c I wanted authentic pierogies since it's something we can't find often on the West Coast.

The restaurant is low key with a diner like vibe and was busy on a Monday afternoon. The service was prompt and our waiter was friendly. I ordered the
Borscht to start and was very pleased with it. My husband had a salad, which was good but def go for the soup b/c that's something you don't usually make at home.

For our meals I chose the vegetarian tasting plate and he ordered the one with meat.  Both came with 3 different pierogies - cheese, potato, and  sauerkraut & mushroom, stuffed cabbage and kasha his a grilled kielbasa. The pierogies were excellent as was the stuffed cabbage with red sauce. My husband was excited that they had this on the menu and I was happy they offered a vegetarian version. I wasn't a fan of the kasha but it wasn't bad when mixed with the beet horseradish salad. We also ordered a potato pancake b/c you kind of have to and also ended with blintzes b/c again why wouldn't you?!

Excellent Ukrainian comfort food.

After I was recently dumped, the weather mirrored my mood/mental state and decided to cry relentlessly, marking the first official day of soup season.

I had remembered seeing a Tiktok where Michael Cera talks about how they would go to Veselka for soup all the time after filming one of his first movies. It was described in such a romantic, idyllic way, so I knew it was time to make the 4 block journey to Veselka.

I am traditionally introverted, finding quiet joy in spending time with myself, so I came on my Table for 1 vibes. That'll be the title of a sick Romcom I will write one day. "Table for 1."

I waited about 3 minutes for a table before I was seated by the blonde hair blue eyed hostess at the front. What a nice lady.

I know Veselka is pretty well known at this point as it has been an East Village staple since the 50s, so I really wasn't expecting an authentic experience. My expectations were kicked in the liver as my waitress was speaking broken English and I had to dumb down my normal 21st century American millennial prose when ordering. My "what's the go-to here if I want something as authentic as possible" was met with a confused gaze and a "vvwhut?"

I mean this, my dear reader, as the highest possible compliment. I was like oh damn I gotta lock in like I'm overseas to order, this is AWESOME. Veselka has really stayed true to their roots. The authenticity in here is tangible.

After ordering the Ukrainian Meat Borscht soup and the Veselka breakfast bowl, I began talking to a gentleman eating at the table next to me who was also eating alone. Table for 1 gang.

He got to telling me how he lived in the apartment next door 20 years ago, and how the whole area has changed completely, with the exception of Veselka. I'm paraphrasing in my 21st century american millennial prose, but he essentially said "Everyone else switched up, but Veselka stayed true."

The soup was EXACTLY what I was hoping for, as it came out hot and flavorful. I sat in this comfortable diner-like environment, sipping my little cup of soup and felt it was warming my soul with every sip. For the less adventurous, they also have Chicken Noodle and Matzah Ball soup, both of which tempted me.

The Veselka breakfast bowl was made up of 4 potato perogies, scrambled eggs, and a sausage. It was a fantastic breakfast, with the perogies obviously being the highlight.

As for me, my dear reader, don't worry. Even cowgirls get the blues sometimes. Rumors have it the blues can be cured with a few sips of Ukrainian Meat Borscht soup. Just rumors though.....

THANK YOU VESELKA NEVER SWITCH UP!

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__
Super nice folks here.  Ukrainian made food... absolutely delicious pierogi's!  Came here for a quick bite and it was exceptional!

I got there on a weekday around 6:30 and was seated as soon as we had a full group. The food was hearty and authentic.
Deluxe Meat Combo (4.5/5) Very nice assortment of food. It didn't look large at first glance but ended up being super filling. I was surprised by how good the pierogis were! The cabbage is stuffed and really dense and filling. The sausage had decent flavor and the side salad was quite large.
Medovyk (3.5/5) Good chocolate flavored layored cake. It was moist and had good flavor, but was a little too sweet for my taste. It would have been great with coffee or tea though!
I'd come back to try more Ukranian food!

Not too bad. The meat borscht was very interesting - the beets probably made the soup so much "stronger". The pierogi was a bit bland for me, but my friends enjoyed it so I think it varies by taste bud.

Food was quite different from what I'm typically used to eating. I'm personally not a fan but this is one of the more popular Ukrainian restaurants so definitely give it a try if you've never had Ukrainian food before.

A timeless NYC institution, serving authentic Ukrainian comfort food since 1954. They are open from 8am to midnight every day, and offer a special brunch menu on Saturday/Sunday until 3pm. The restaurant is filled with natural light, and has a homey diner feel. They are seemingly always busy, and for good reason; the food is incredible.

My husband and I came here at 11am on a Saturday, and did not have to wait for a table. Service was lightning fast and attentive. Our waiter, a young Ukrainian guy, was genuinely friendly. I started with a cappuccino, which was one of the best espresso drinks I've had in NYC. They dust a very fine sugar on top; unexpected and amazing.

I loved the Deluxe Vegetarian Plate, which includes three different pierogis (potato, cheese, sauerkraut/mushroom), one meatless stuffed cabbage, kasha with mushroom gravy, a side of sour cream. It also came with a side salad, served with a decadent creamy dressing. A great option if you want to try several menu items without ordering a ton of food.

My husband got their Borscht, and Potato Pancakes, both of which were exceptional as well. He insisted we get Medovyk for dessert (even though this was technically our breakfast), and I am so glad we did. It was the best rendition of this traditional honey cake I have ever enjoyed. 10/10.

My boyfriend and I came here during restaurant week (Aug '23). For $30, you could get an appetizer, an entree, and a dessert. We chose the mushroom barley soup, the vegetarian plate (1 sweet cheese pierogi, 1 mushroom pierogi, 1 potato pierogi, vegetarian stuffed cabbage, 1 potato pancake, and kasha), and the peach almond cake. We also ordered the chicken paprikash with a side of beet and horseradish salad.

Overall, we really liked everything we ordered. The potato pancake (so crispy!) and the stuffed cabbage were my favorites.

Great food and incredibly fast service. I ordered the veal goulash with a side of sauerkraut. Was pleasantly surprised by the tenderness of the meat, the sauce pairing perfectly with the mashed potatoes. Sauerkraut was a great side of acidity to cut the richness of the veal.

We got a delivery order and the food was excellent! We had a deluxe vege combo which came with several pierogis, a Vege stuffed cabbage, borscht and kasha. We also got a deluxe meat combo which had meat pierogis, a meat stuffed cabbage, a grilled kielbasa, a beet salad, and a mushroom barley soup. We also got a potato pancake, and a cheese blintz. I really can't say anything critical about any of the food. Everything was tasty, well seasoned and fresh. These people really know their style of food. Delivery was quite fast. Packing was well done. The food was warm.
I highly recommend this restaurant!

Solid service and food. Ate here with my sister and her Oakland-based family when they came to visit awhile back, and my nephew mainlined on the Reuben sandwich. (A great place to take West Coasters who are pretty spoiled with the freshest Mexican, Asian, and American cuisine.)

Came recently with my partner on a Sunday night. Short wait for table indoors, and service was on it from the beginning to the end: Zero understaffing here. Loved too that they've switched to paper straws. After years of plastic, the adjustment doesn't seem to have cost their business; the place was humming with New Yorkers: friends, dates, and singletons.

Descent food in a festive & raucous environment, fast friendly service. Got the borscht soup (hot & cold), meat deluxe combo with stuffed cabbage, latke combo with stroganoff, raspberry blintz & honey cake.
The borscht soup was good, i preferred the hot version over the cold. Stuffed cabbage was moist & mild in flavor, pierogi was good, sausage was almost like dry hotdog. The beef stroganoff was creamy & yummy, potato pancake was pretty much hashbrown, the blintz crepe was delightful & light.
Ukrainian food is casual everyday fares. The honey cake however was fit for the Czar: multi layered, creamy & decadent.  It resembled tiramisu but more sweet.
See attached video below for better visuals.

youtu.be/HwhTqnQ_HpA?si=…

Came here for the pierogis and had a great time

I ended up getting the buffalo chicken pierogis fried which were much more dense than I had imagined, but so good! I had to split them with a friend.

Just a heads up the, the line is significantly longer than you're expecting so dress warmly if you're going in the winter and bring a friend to wait with you.

This place is absolutely worth the wait though.

IG: QueenOfAdventureNYC

Stopped by on a Saturday morning around 11am with no wait.

Stuffed cabbage was delicious, especially topped with that creamy and savory sauce. The warmed sauerkraut added some acidity to balance the flavors.

Blintz was tasty, although wish we didn't get the extra raspberry compote as the jams in the table would have been sufficient to add a different dimension of sweetness. Filling was a textured cheese filling, that left a round and full-fat aftertaste in your mouth. The blintz plate would be a rather heavy meal for one, so I'd recommend splitting w the table if possible.

My friend ordered the Pierogi sampler (8), and said she preferred the boiled ones, especially the potato and cheese.

Total came out to be $72 (with tip). Felt a bit steep, but this is a NY staple with a reputable history and Wikipedia page to match.

First time there and I went for restaurant week. It was very good. $30 for that much food at such a popular place was a very solid deal.

Classic NYC restaurant, definitely seemed like an iconic institution.

Both me and my friend got the meat options for the platters and it was really great. Large portions and very filling. I've never really had Ukrainian food but it was a great introduction. I'll definitely get it more often.

There was a 30 minute line before we got in but it was worth the wait. I wouldn't wait too much longer though. Would definitely recommend!

They're celebrating their 69th anniversary for a reason. Both styles of stuffed cabbage were very good, as well as both the boiled potato and the braised beef pirogies. The pirogies came with sour cream, house sauerkraut, and a beet horseradish salad. I preferred the latter although the other  two were fine. I wanted to try the short rib pirogies, and I saw the table next to had them fried...so we tried the fried, which were okay but not as good as the boiled. We would for sure return.

Amazing service, love that they have outdoor seating. It's nice to sit outside on a summer night.

It was my first time at Veselka, met up with my cousin and family, who are regulars there. I tried a little bit of everything.

The schnitzel was delicious, the desserts too. I just can't remember what they're called.

Excellent excellent excellent!

There's no reservation option but my party of two got seated in less than ten minutes. There's often at least a small line during dinner time here.

We sat outside and split everything family style. The hot borscht was AMAZING!! That's a definite must try. The pierogis were yummy and packed with flavor. The blitz - a crepe like dessert filled with a cottage cheese-esque cheese - was very light and yummy with the raspberry jam. We ended on the layered honey cake which was very very sweet and filling but amazing with the little bits of walnut for texture. The cake was fluffy and mostly whipped cream so very splittable.

The service was friendly and efficient. The inside was nice although the bathroom line can get long.

This would be my first time trying Ukrainian food. I was introduced to this place by my Ukrainian date who lived in Ukraine as a child. We got the periogis (potato and beef) and it was pretty expensive at 8 for 16. It was okay. Not much flavor at all and very small. The kasha was tasty but dry.
The chicken schnitzel was crispy and I enjoyed it but it really does need more flavor. Maybe at least some salt and pepper. The soup borscht was good but was very tiny. All in all, I'm glad this place exists but I probably wouldn't go again
The portions are small and the price is pretty expensive. My date said it tasted authentic though but said she's had a few better in Chicago.

I'm so glad we decided to stop by here for a late dinner after a broadway show. There's great floral artwork and Ukranian accents among the decor. We were promptly seated after arriving and our server was very polite and gracious with explaining that the kitchen would be closing soon in about 20 mins, luckily we knew what we wanted.

The food was so good! i had never had Ukrainian food before. I opted for the meat plate. It comes with two braised beef pierogis and two potato pierogis with stuffed cabbage and a beet horseradish side. The stuffed cabbage was delicious, it was filled with a savory rice filling and topped with a delicious gravy. The pierogis were tasty  with the tender dough and stuffing. It was served with sour cream and caramelized onion. My friend had the beef stroganoff. I thought it was fine, maybe could have been a bit more seasoned. I believe we had our best meal there. 10/10 would recommend.

Super delicious pierogis and super friendly staff. I did 8 pierogis, assorted fillings. I loved all of them, especially the potato and the short rib!
I tried both fried and boiled and preferred boiled.

I also picked up a packaged slice of poppy seed loaf, too--which, at first, I thought it was less sweet than I wanted, but then I really enjoyed it.

Great atmosphere, indoor dining is colorful and fun + sidewalk or street-eatery options for seating.
Pickup is very convenient in a separate entrance.

Terrific, classic, and well-known spot in East Village. I finally made my way over for an outdoor brunch over the summer and started with a an iced coffee. A huge size at a great price! It's impossible to choose an entree, essentially forcing the agonizing choice of either a latke- or pierogi-based dish. I couldn't resist the salmon latke benedict, with a hearty portion plus a refreshing side salad and fruit salad. Eggs were perfectly cooked, hollandaise sauce and capers balanced out the flavors, and of course, the latkes were the unique star of the show. Service was efficient despite the huge crowds, and for the quality, the prices can't be beat. A must-hit for any local or tourist.

My friend recommended Veselka on Saturday around 4pm to introduce me to Ukraine cuisine. We ordered a choice of 4 pierogi (potato and beef) for $9 and chicken paprikash for $21. There was a choice of fried and boiled pierogi, but we opted for the boiled. It came with sautéed onions and sour cream to dip. The outer wrap was chewy, and the inner filling was flavorful. I enjoyed it with the sautéed onions.
The chicken paprikash included egg noodled, boneless chicken pieces and diced red peppers braised in an herb cream sauce. It was delicious. The entrée came with a choice of side, as well.
The food was great! Only con was we felt our waiter was passive-aggressively trying to make us leave after we finished eating even though it was not crowded and there were many other tables available. We only stayed for an hour.

If you are interested in Ukrainian food, then Veselka is arguably the most well-known place to go in Manhattan. They have a wide range of authentic Ukrainian foods and also some more traditional breakfast/brunch options. I ordered the Stand with Ukraine Bowl ($21), which came with 6 pierogis of 3 different varieties with grilled kielbasa sausage and some bacon bits on top. The pierogis were all high quality, and I especially like the sauerkraut mushroom one. The potato one was a bit plain but that is to be expected. It would've been better if there was more kielbasa/bacon or something else to go with this though. Also, the menu said that there was supposed to be caramelized onions in the bowl, but I didn't have any. Important to note that the proceeds from the sale of this particular bowl go to Ukrainian Relief Efforts, which is an added bonus during these times.

I also tried the Stuffed Cabbage (Holubtsi), which was stuffed with beef, pork, and rice with mushroom gravy on top and Ukrainian beet and horseradish salad as the chosen side. I appreciated the uniqueness and authenticity of this dish, which was very tasty. It was actually more of the stuffing than the cabbage itself, and the mushroom gravy was particularly good. I would also say that this beet and horseradish salad is a bit of a strong flavor to eat by itself, but goes very well together with the stuffed cabbage. For $21, this was a fair price.
