The restaurant does not take reservations and is pretty popular during peak hours, so there can be some wait times expected but nothing too crazy. I came during a slightly off-peak time and had to wait around 10 minutes. The interior is pretty large with lots of seating and they have a decent amount of outdoor seating as well. The interior is decorated with lots of Ukraine-themed decor, as expected, which adds to the authentic feel of the restaurant.

It seems that this already-popular restaurant has gained even more popularity in recent times as people show their support for Ukraine. Aside from supporting this cause, Veselka is also a high quality restaurant offering authentic Ukrainian cuisine so I would definitely recommend stopping by.

Everything really hit the spot! The fried pierogis were all delicious. I really liked the texture - crispy on the outside and a nice bouncy chew to the dough. I like how you can customize which fillings you want. We got the potato, cheese, braised beef and short rib and all of them were spectacular. The blintz was a nice dessert to end it. It had a hint of lemon it, light and airy. Line moved pretty quickly. Don't be too discouraged by it !

Lively atmosphere. Quick service. Outdoor seating.

Blintzes - large amount of cheese. Lemon, sour cream and raspberry sauce. Fluffy

Beef stroganoff - intensely dry beef. Bland. Well cooked noodles

I would say Veselka is one of my favorite restaurants ever! We had so much food  

For appetizers, she had Borscht soup and I had Matzah Ball Soup. The soups are so hearty and amazing!

The main dishes were great too! She had the Deluxe Meat Plate which included Meat, Potato, Mushroom, and stuffed cabbage Pierogis with Grilled Kielbasa.
I got the Vegetarian Plate which includes Cheese, Potato, Mushroom, and Butternut Squash Pierogis with Stuffed Cabbage, Potato Pancakes, and Kasha. We also shared cheese blintzes.

Then dessert! I got Apple Crumb Cake and she got Medovyk which is a layer cake that has honey and sour cream.

The service was very quick and the place is full of life inside!

Overall, incredible!! Veselka is a very iconic Ukrainian restaurant and you can't go wrong with any meal here!

We came mid-afternoon on a Sunday, and had to wait a little while for a table (outside, but heated). Worth the wait. The food was delicious. My husband said "I was lied to, growing up, about what goulash is!" Indeed, I had a bite of his and it was nothing like what I was served as a kid, that's for sure. I had the vegetarian combo plate which was also delicious. Admittedly, i have only had pierogies from the freezer section of the store, and these cheese-filled ones -- filled with farmers cheese -- were amazing. Everything was so, so good. The borscht, the mushroom gravy, the sauerkraut. I'll come back and try more things -- the potato pancake -- for sure.

Modern, clean interpretations of classic old-world dishes pleased all of us. A long-time favorite of my two companions nearby residents, Veselka shined.

Each dish was tasty, pretty, and distinctive. I felt as though we might've been in the Ukrainian Culinary Institute.

The ambiençe - the décor, the restaurant presentation and layout and upkeep, and the people-watching from this corner location - were just right. Exactly what I needed for my first meal beach in the city.

Go. All your senses will thank you.

A great generational restaurant for me and to enjoy my heritage foods from my grandmother and my mother.  Always try to make a trip when in New York.  Brought my daughter with me this time and they were great!  But she stills says her gramma's pierogis are better but this is a very close second!  Wait staff are friendly and responsive.  Food is has always been great and comes out timely!  It's worth the visit to enjoy some Ukrainian food !

What a fantastic restaurant with a cross between Ukranian and Jewish comfort food.

We sat outside on a stunningly temperate day. I had a cup of chili to start. It was a bit on the sweet side, but thick and chunky with lots of beans and meat. Very enjoyable.

My main was the stuffed cabbage in tomato sauce with a side of sauerkraut.
The sauce again was a little sweet, but very flavorful. The stuffing was almost meatball quality and had to be eaten with a fork and knife. The cabbage didn't cut so easily and mostly slid off. I still loved the dish.
This is not your father's sauerkraut. I can't explain how it is different from usual sauerkraut, but it is and it's awesome. Just try it.

I was pleasantly surprised by the Ukranian Obolon beer. It tasted like a very full lager and was light enough for a beautiful day outside. I wasn't driving and had two....

Service was very friendly, accurate, and timely.

Remember to tip well.

Pierogis, borscht and a pilsner here is like a warm hug from an old friend. The wait times can get insane on weekends and evenings. Generally though, I know what I'm here for (the borscht) and I know it'll be good.

It was worth breaking my routine. It's the weekend, so I will occasionally have fried food on the weekend more than I usually would during the week. I also usually intermittent fast. I usually start eating at noon, but I ate here around 10 am. So to break my rules, the food should be worth it. It absolutely was worth it.

I imagine if I had a Ukrainian grandfather, this is how he would make goulash. It was delicious. It was brighter than I expected, with the herbs being visible to the eye and the palate.

The pierogis were tasty. Perfectly fried. The beef pierogis were slightly larger than the potato or the mushroom. They were all tasty, perhaps the beef was the best by a smidge.

One note, everything could have used more seasoning. I made due with a bit of salt, which helped. However, I would have much preferred more delicious Ukrainian spice! I don't think most of my family would enjoy this food. If you like this food, but want more spice, put it in your next Yelp review!

Phenomenal. Food: omg. Atmosphere: lovely, decorated. Service: so speedy

Visited at 2 pm on a Monday and it was pretty crowded but not bad. Service was speedy!!

I got a cup of the cold borscht and a single blintz. Blintz was sweet and lemony and large enough to fill me up! The borscht made me cry it was so good. The COLD BORSCHT is the most refreshing, comforting, and purple thing I've ever put in my mouth.  

I am definitely coming back if I'm ever in New York. Definitely bringing everyone I know.

Went with my friend for restaurant week! You get three courses for $30. I got the cold borscht, deluxe meat combo, and my friend and I shared the two cake options: peach almond cake and apple crumb cake. I checked the price against the regular menu and you save around $10 and I also felt it was a good value portion wise (had leftovers)! The apple crumb cake was really cold and kind of burnt so that was probably my least favorite but overall thought everything was decent.

Maybe the greatest gem in NYC.

Get the pirogies. Get the schnitzel. Both are wonderful.

Also, the beets are the hidden gem here, so good. GET THE BEETS!

I went to Veselka on a Friday night. I was prepared to stand in line and you should be too. I arrived around 6:30 and waited for an hour. It was cold, so most people didn't want to sit outside. Once inside, the warmth of the restaurant made it worth it. The vibe inside is so lively and homey. The food was good, and came out fast. Decently priced too.

Pierogis: 9/10

I got them boiled. Four different flavors. There was a good proportion of filling to the dough. The filling wasn't dry and they tasted so good with the sour cream, applesauce, and grilled onions! I wish I got more!

Bacon egg and cheese: 9/10
Beef: 10/10
Potato: 8.5/10
Arugula and goat cheese: 9/10

Blintz: 7.5/1"

This wasn't really my thing. It was good though but the filling was a little too much. The raspberry sauce was too watery too. If you like sweet cheese then you may like this dish but there was nothing special about it for me.

Latke: 8.5/10

The latkes were very good and very crispy!

Beef stroganoff: 0/10

I feel awful but this is NOT beef stroganoff. It was a dish of incredibly overcooked pasta - so overcooked they were slimy and had no texture - sitting in water with extremely dry pieces of meat on top. There was no creamy gravy or flavorful sauce. I love beef stroganoff so trust me when I say this is not where you should get it.

Veal Goulash: 9/10

SO GOOD! The veal came out piping hot. There were so many pieces of the veal in the stew. It was so delicious to eat the stew with the mashed potatoes too. I was pleasantly surprised with how delicious this was!

Meatballs: 8.5/10

The meatballs were very good! I really enjoyed the flavor of the meat. They weren't overcooked or dry. The mushroom gravy was very tasty and added a nice contrast to the meatballs and mashed potatoes.

I highly recommend the potato salad as a side dish. I typically don't like potato salad but this one was so good! There were carrots in it, and the potatoes were well cooked. There wasn't too much mayonnaise, and the dill added a nice touch!

Atmosphere: average

Service: notably below par. No water refills, they stack food plates on top of each other when they bring you your food, and they literally jerked the card swiper from me as i was on the tip page

Food: average. Sauces were below par (apple sauce wasnt sweet, sour cream for their latkes were viscous)

All in all a disappointing experience

We went to Veselka on a rainy Saturday afternoon. Because it was raining and we were willing to sit outside (on a covered table!) we were seated quite quickly, around 5 min.

The table was tilted so we had to be careful about things falling, and the heat lamp was not that strong, but we were dry and in 54 degree weather it was quite pleasant!

We placed our orders, and food came out quite quickly. We all got our soups first. The vegetarian borscht tasted more earthy and sweet than the meat version, but both were quite good! The pierogis were also very good, and the sour cream was sauerkraut were great complements to the meal!

I think everyone should come here at least once! Its reputation for being a NYC institution is well deserved. We recently stopped by for dinner and had a great time. It happened to be Restaurant Week and for $30, you get the perfect taste of their food and generous portions. This time, I had the stuffed cabbage, which was delicious and comforting. I finally got to try the honey cake, which I loved, I would definitely recommend getting it if you like cake. The Blintz was another winner. Service was friendly and attentive at all times. The atmosphere is lively and although the space is pretty big with both indoor and outdoor seating, I recommend getting here early or during off-peak hours to avoid waiting in line.

The Line Moves Fast
^^Just remember that next time you stop by Veselka for one of the best meals in the East Village.

This place is truly a gem: great food, attentive staff, and fast service.

Always get the perogies. I don't care if you don't want them, get them. They're delicious, there's not a single bad one, but if you're on the fence, you could always go with the safe potato pierogi. And make sure you get sour cream and onions for dipping.

As for the meals, the chicken schnitzel is delicious. It's a big chunk of bird fried to crispy eastern European perfection.

The potato pancakes are also amazing. As are all the sandwiches.

Honestly, go to Veselka with a bunch of friends. Go wild and order everything. It's worth it.

Sooo delicious. The Perogies were so fire. Moderately priced and definitely gives authentic energy. Ukrainian food is absolutely filling and delicious.

Not much else to say besides absolutely make this a stop in East Village. Fast service too.

We came here as an unintended stop for some food just to tide us over between activities, but ended up having to order two rounds of pierogis because they were so good. We loved the sauerkraut, beef, and cheese pierogis (fried). Although there was a line when we got there, they moved quickly and we were seated within 10-15 mins. So enjoyable, would come again :)

OK, this place is super hyped so I decided to try! Decided to come in for brunch, we had about 30 minutes and got a table.

They were very nice servers but honestly did not enjoyed my dish very much. :(( I got the eggs Benedict with salmon and a mimosa. The Mimosa was pretty weak and the eggs Benedict was not flavorful / not great. I've definitely had better crispier potato latkes elsewhere.

Went last week on a Tuesday around 11AM, place was almost full but still able to get a seat right away. However when we left there was a line 15-20 people deep (probably lunch rush).

Servers were friendly and came quick with the food. Could have came around a little more often to refill water or just provided a bigger cup. But service was still good.

Ordered the Deluxe Meat Combo w/ Borscht and Potato Pancake Combo with Stroganoff/Mushroom Barely

Borscht (5/5) - Perfect morning soup. We'll balanced and hit all the notes you want in a borscht. Great with a little sour cream. The bread could be passed on since it didn't seem the freshest or maybe it was just dry sliced bread

Deluxe Meat Combo (4/5) - Great option to try a bit of everything. The Stuff cabbage and sauerkraut/mushroom perogie were probably the best things on the plate. The sausage was just ok and the other perogies fell a little flat. Would recommend if it's your first time to get the variety. But would probably order the items individually

Mushroom Barely Soup (3.5/5) - Don't get me wrong the soup is great, I just found it hard to eat a whole bowl. Very hearty and creamy. Great on a cold day just after half a bowl, just felt like I wanted to stop. Maybe if it was snowing and just finished exercising this would have been the soup.

Potato Pancake Combo (3/5) - Wasn't my favorite dish that we had but still well done. The latke was really good, basically a crispy hash brown. The stroganoff was decent, felt a little one note/fell flat, maybe it needed to be over the egg noodles but instead just came as a stew

Overall experience was great, definitely will be back and recommend. If you do decide to check it out be cognizant that there could be a long line

Love coming here for pierogis, borscht, and other Ukrainian and old world eats.

Always a lively scene and sometimes a long wait but worth it. Nice service and plenty of seating. Not the place to come when dieting though!

One of the most fun bars in the area.  It seemed liked all the waitstaff was from France and had a deep knowledge of the wine they were selling.  Great ambiance and a ton of fun...worth a pop in for sure

Let's start with the highlights. Vin Sur Vingt has excellent service and the ambiance is absolutely adorable. Low lit wine bar that has a romantic feel to it, great for date night. When we went, it was not crowded at all. All that said, I imagine on a night where it does get crowded it gets very loud. The tables are right against each other so this is just a heads up if you come with a group.

They have decent wine deals and the food is cute/tasty but pricey. Expect to spend starting at $16 for a small bite (as you can see from the photos I posted with this review). It was delicious, but the portions are small for the amount of food you get.

Overall, excellent and I would come back. They have many locations around the city and whoever is working can recommend different wines to you and will allow you to taste test wines before fully committing.

We were looking for a quieter bar when we found this cute place after dinner and absolutely loved it! This is a small place with service that was a little slow for our liking but definitely yummy wine that everyone was satisfied with by the end of the night. I got a red wine here and absolutely loved it even though I can't remember the name of it. Definitely a nice spot for a date night or a night with some friends. Ample space and comfy seating with a cute cozy interior!

There are so many amazing wine bars in This city and this is not one of them. We were greeted by a host that was friendly but bordered on ridiculing us as he mimicked our taking off sunglasses while walking and shaking your bum. My friend was greeted as "go México". Why?
The menu is limited and very expensive. Bottle prices are inflated even by New York standards. The charcuterrrie plate at $60 was the most expensive we ve ever had and far from the best. As places around the city add fruits and nuts, dried fruit, spices, different presentations to their charcuterie board. Here was pretty straight forward and classic, the portions of 3 cheeses - Brie, hard cheese and a goat were quite small and the cheeses delicious but nothing exciting. Little gerkins were the best part. We couldn't get our water refilled, we didn't get any attention as the place filled up and there were only 2 servers, one of whom preferred flirting to doing his actual job. We paid over $40 for one glass and shared charcuterie and left to find some real food and more affordable drinks. Only one champagne on the menu at 30 per glass and $150 per bottle. With the summer coming. They better add more bubbles and more affordable options to the menu!!!

This review is for the East Village location.
We had recently had gone to the Nomad location and had a wonderful experience.  Here in East Village it was great as well, we just did not explore as much of the menu as we had in Nomad.
We walked in late on a Saturday night, and luckily got the only empty table, the place was busy inside and out.  It was a small space, and coolly dark, with dark but soft woods, and distressed antiqued mirrors on the walls which I liked.  We only had dessert: the tarte tatin, and the chocolate cake, both of which were ok.  We had a nice bottle of Alsace pinot noir and a white which unfortunately I don't remember.  Nice vibe, and server was fine, kept our bottles chilled till we were ready for more.  To give a fairer shot would like to come back and try more of the menu.

7-9pm happy hour for a $10 glass on a week day, the place was barely filled with couples, and one excellent waiter who greeted me with a smile. Dining alone, this place was perfect for a wine and literary journal night.
They're known for their wine selection and the waiter is happy to walk you through the options and be attentive to your needs

Highly recommend!  Came here tonight to celebrate a friends birthday with some casual drinks and apps.  Kir royale was perfectly poured!  Wine selection was excellent and our server gave great advice on which wines would be best suited for each of our tastes.  Cheese and charcuterie board was a little heavy on the charcuterie ratio but everything was delicious.  Ambiance was chill, service was excellent.  Will definitely come back the next time I want to hang out with friends and catch up over some good wine.

We went here for drinks on a work trip. While going over my receipts/statements afterwards, I noticed that this place charged an extra 52 cents on my final SIGNED bill (after tips).

52 cents is obviously not much, and would not raise any alarms (unless you had pictures of your receipt, like I did, as I was on a work trip). However, this highlights some sketchy practices (plus, 50 cents per table, for all tables, could add up), and I would recommend potential customers to stay away from such a dishonest business.
Like every location, always a good time. Enjoyed a nice glass of beaujolais (vin sur vingt bottle) and a glass of sparkling rose. Shoutout to our server Gustavo for being attentive and sweet!

Stopped by the wine bar on the way to a friends birthday. They have happy hour from 4-7 pm everyday for $10 glasses of selected wines. I got the rosé and my friend got the white wine. The sommelier was from France and seemed very knowledgeable. We got multiple tastings of different types of wine.
Gentleman manning the bar was very rude for no reason, and not in any sort of charming French way. TGI Friday Wine Bar with French aesthetics
Love this place, the ambiance sitting outside at night!! A must go if you are in the area whether for dinner or the shows

What a great find!!!  We are visiting NYC from Las Vegas and had a couple of hours before our dinner reservation.  We luckily stumbled on this place.  Gustavo waited on us and steered us in the right direction. We had great French wines and great service. He also paired our wines with three different cheeses. Such a fun experience.
Another great place by Vin sur Vingt. Beautiful Pauillac, professional and nice service.... But we want our Croques & cassolettes back :(

We came to this bar last night with a group of friends and we had so much fun we ended up talking 5 bottles of wine!
Which i think means a lot.
The wine is the best we have had in any wine bar and the french waiter I think his name Ishen he was very attentive to us​ and os pleasant and professional.
We Will definitly be black to this location to have another great night !
And i Will recomend it to the rest of my friends.

No issues at all with the food, wine or service as all were very good. In fact, I want to highlight how terrific the service was even though we could clearly see that the restaurant was understaffed (appeared that there was only the one server working a very crowded restaurant). So extra kudos to the overworked server for ensuring we had a good dining experience.
Hugo was great! Such thoughtful service and great recommendations for wine! Would definitely come back and try the food too :)
Incredible French wine and great service with phenomenal recommendations! Delicious!!
Fantastic service food and wine! Make sure to pop in and have some bubbly and beouf bourgignon!

What a lovely French wine bar. The service was excellent, the waiter was actually French, and he was extremely professional- kept an eye on us but let us linger over our rosé.  We enjoyed the olive tapenade along with the rosé at happy hour and will definitely be returning.
Lovely place, I felt like a I was back in France. Great wine selection and delicious bites that can be paired the wines offered. Shout out to our friendly server Felipe.

I'm a local and always wanted to come in and I'm glad I came. Hugo Castro really sold this place to me. Amazing service, increasingly personality and the man run an amazing one man show. Knowledgeable of wine too! I will be coming back
Hugo was an amazing server! The flat rose was divine and he gave us complimentary sparkling rose. Overall experience was 10/10
Nice place, pleasant staff and vibe. Solid and uncomplicated. Tasty food and quality wines

Shout out to Victor. I will admit - my knowledge of wine is low. We came here to learn more and enjoy the cool French ambience at the East Village location. What made the experience truly special was our host Victor - who went above and beyond with individual recommendations. The story behind the wine are most interesting, and we appreciated the host taking the time to explain the regional wine differences in France. Great service, great venue, great location! We will be back.
The hostess accused of me sneaking in food. I had simply entered for a post dinner glass of wine. Horrible service and was rude the entire time.

Me and my friend went to the one near flatiron one before, the food and wine and service was impeccable there. Today we saw a new location in east village and we were happy thinking it'd be as good as the other one. The wine was good as usual. BUT I can't give the same to the service,  the French guy server(bartender) was SO NASTY... we walked in and asked for a table, he looked like literally someone owed him a million dollars, or his just got dumped by his gf or what. The whole vibe of misery came from him..... the way he poured the wine( made so much mess on the table)  and the miserable tone he talked.  We felt so Unwelcome, he clearly didn't want to be here either. I came here to enjoy my glass of wine, and paid for my wine and 20% tips for the crappy service that he provided. Whole 40min of he showed up at the very last min. I immediately asked for the check cuz I wanted to get the heck out of here. Be aware of that miserable dude there , absolutely not coming back to this location as long as the dude is there.

Awesome wine selection and delicious food. Really cute patio area and the inside has great ambiance as well. Highly recommend!!! My go to spot when I want a drink after work. The Croque Provencal is delish!
First time in this place and we loved it!! Hugo went above and beyond for us and we will definitely be coming back. 10/10

Everything seemed good. I had it delivered, so sometimes things can get a little soggy, but it wasn't too bad in that regard. The food was good, and I appreciated that the bags were stapled and included napkins and ketchup packs - o - plenty.

I'm not a huge foodie or anything, but everything was better than I would have made it myself, and that's my general metric for whether or not a food place is worth the expense.

Food (4/5): Got the matcha bubble tea. It was decent but not the freshest or best I've had.

Service (4/5): Bubble tea came out fast and they were reasonably helpful.

Ambiance (3/5): It has nice color tones and cool poster decorations. However it is a bit dirty and the floor and walls seem like they've seen some wear and tear. There is a food amount of seating but no restrooms.

It's decent bubble tea, but nothing special. It's on par with KFT and Gong Cha, with bit more gourmet feel. Wish they made the interior a bit cleaner and easier to sit around, but it's supposed to be more of a come and go type of place.
A quick afternoon stop always 10 stars nothing less. As far as the service I'm not sure the cashier said hi the interaction was fast . No indoor seating but the bubble tea was great

This bubble tea chain seems to be everywhere I look nowadays. I think there are like 30 of them in the city.

This one on 14th street is pretty much the same as all the rest. Same look and feel. Same menu featuring all kinds of bubble teas, along with some food items like popcorn chicken.

I've only had the bubble teas from here as they have a nice variety and do a good job with them. Some good deals on them too. Not a meat eater so I avoid the chicken here. Not sure I would eat chicken from a bubble tea spot anyway.
Take my money. Relatively cheaper and reasonable priced bubble tea shop! If you're looking for some boba, this place is the way to go.
Got the garlic popcorn chicken from here and it was alright, not as good as the chicken from the location on 3rd ave 9th street Popcorn Chicken

I was disappointed when i received my drink because it didn't taste anything like it's name. I've had many brown sugar milk teas before and this was by far my least favorite. It was much more milky than anything else & simply did not look like the posted pictures. Taste is subjective so dont write this place off with my opinion alone but it just wasn't for me.
Staff not super friendly and bad drinks. I love sweets but there was something gross about these drinks. Bad flavor. Hard boba. All I can say is they have some tables and are open late.

Came in with some friends after a late-night dinner. I took a look at the very large menu and decided to go with a Taro Milk Tea with Soymilk. I have been a fan of taro milk tea for quite some time, but I had never personally had from ViVi. The employee behind the counter wasn't particularly friendly while he took my order. I paid a little under $5 for a medium, which is around average bubble tea pricing.

My tea was ready in about 5 minutes, and I was excited to try it. I was overall really disappointed with it. Firstly, I did not find the taro flavor to be strong at all. Secondly, I was asked about sugar level, and made clear that normal, or 100% was fine. However, I found that it wasn't very sweet at all.

Overall, with my tea quality and mediocre customer service, I probably wouldn't come back. I had originally stopped in due to the late hour that I was out  and many other locations being closed. There are plenty of other bubble tea locations in this area of NY.

Another decent boba tea place in East Village. Fun customer service and very clean inside.

Ordered the Vivi Bubble Milk Tea, flaming Brown Sugar Milk tea, and Thai Milk Tea. All 3 had the perfect amount of sugar and tea flavor. Price was on par with Kung Ku Tea and not as busy.

For sure will be back.
Outstanding everytime i come!! Everytime i visit New York i make it a chance to come and get a drink. It is the perfect amount of sweetness!

This area is bound to meet all your bubble tea needs (with GongCha and PaTea being right across the street). That being said, the major thing Vivi's has going for it are its discounts and prices. They're a bit easier on the wallet compared to GongCha.
Also Vivi's milk tea is easy on those who are lactose intolerant (in my experience).

The worst worst viv popcorn chicken ever!!!!
That 2 star is for bubble tea. Bubble tea taste normal and average!!!

If it were Lychee, it'd be my largest cat. But it's not, it's Vivi.

This is one of two Vivi locations which I came to and enjoyed a drink and then the pictures disappeared. I don't know if I uploaded them and then they disappeared or they just completely disappeared off my camera.

But I'm a fan of the bubble tea here and it's pretty good and I wish them all the best and I'll definitely be back at some point when I'm in this part of Manhattan.

I am enamored ViVi's mango green tea $3.50 which I usually opt without tapioca black pearls or jelly, but I always request for a towering amount of ice.  Yes, Sally W. a loyalty punch card is available upon request only and interchangeable usage at ViVi's locations.  The loyalty punch card also serves as a business card.  Minimal seating is available as my goal was to rest momentarily away from the fast-pace daily grind, daily deal, daily life's intake.  A moment of phlegmatic was absorbed.  Service is average.

Note:  No restroom facility is available on premise since seating is under twenty and not required by law.
Don't like this place anymore! Just ordered popcorn chicken and not worth the price! It's getting less and less. I will never ever come back again. Thank you!!!

Vivi's is a chain bubble tea shop in New York. In addition to bubble teas, they serve slushes and sweet juices. Additionally select stores have food items such as sausages, chicken, fish balls, and taikoyaki.

This shop has the food items. Additionally their reward card gets you a free drink after six drinks (the one in Chinatown is after the tenth drink) and you can also upgrade to a large drink for free with a student id. Bubbles are also free.

I like Vivi's more than Kung Fu, it's pretty standard across all stores. It's also very similar to a shop you would find in Hong Kong or Taiwan which is fun. Cards are excepted for payments over $4 otherwise you'll need cash. The wait was quite short although we did have to wait a bit longer for the chicken. All in all, I come here quite often.

Now, bring your school ID and they will boost up your medium bubble tea to a large one. If you do not mind getting fat or you are like me doing cheat meal everyday, go ahead.

Location: ViVi is close to the new Gongcha. I never want to come to ViVi because I am a hardcore CoCo fan. Nevertheless, my friend told me that their popcorn chicken is great. I was like, okay, lemme try. This place is interesting, very Asian. The cute design and weird logo, way to go, babe. The line is really quickly, looks like everyone knew what they want? I went with bubble tea without sugar, without ice. And popcorn chicken and omg fried oreo.

I did not try fried oreo since the calories behind it would be insane. I would just watch people eat instead of letting myself stuck in the fat hole. But I did try popcorn chicken. Delish! It tasted exactly what I had back in middle school. I cannot describe, but it was with emotion in it. LOL, I just want to emphasize how good it tasted.

Bubble tea is average but bubble is very good.

Overall: a 3.5 experience. And I usually do not write review for beverage shop, this one is so good that I decided to write something. Although rate is not high, I recommend people to try bubble tea and popcorn chicken here. Better than Gongcha for sure tho

Such a cute place in china town, for a quick and tasty bubble tea break. I got the classic Vivi bubble milk tea, which was a classic black milk tea with bubbles. The tea itself is like any other tea, fragrant, well mixed and with a ratio of tea, milk, and water. The bubbles were made perfectly tender and chewy. I wish there was something putting it more out there from other bubble tea places, but it doesn't. But it's also not bad. They offer small snacks too such as onigiri , which i also got but did not picture. It was also well made. The rice was soft, tender, the meat was tender and not dry. And it's a great snack.

Vivi is the worst of the bubble tea chains around the city - I really wish they were so much better since they have more locations around town where I end up being, but every location is as underwhelming as the last. The milk tea here is very powdery in flavor, and the boba is consistently too soft and completely flavorless. Across the board. Every Vivi. Don't come here. Find the nearest Kung Fu or Coco!

Totally going to ViVi on 14th Street because of the advertised special of 2 for $4 Passion QQ or Peach Ice Jelly drink. I like the Peach Ice Jelly drink.

IF YOU ARE HERE OFTEN, ASK FOR THEIR PUNCH CARD. THEY WILL NOT AUTOMATICALLY GIVE YOU A PUNCH CARD UNLESS YOU ASK FOR IT.

Service here is odd. The person at the register doesn't know what goes in my drink. Kept on telling me boba is in the drink I ordered when it doesn't. And doesn't know how to omit the ice out of the cup!!!

If they keep on having this drink special, I'll keep on visiting.
Refused service before closing time (20min)  because they only had enough supply to cover online orders. Wtf?

It got the job done!

I had to pick up a relative after a minor surgery. He was under anesthesia and i knew he would be really loopy. He doesn't drink coffee or tea so i decided to get him the Mango bubble tea from here and a passion fruit bubble tea for myself.

He was definitely loopy but he did manage to walk a few blocks and the tea definitely helped! Also for someone who isn't a tea or bubble tea fan, he said he really liked it. what more can you ask for?

Two months ago my friend and I went to a Ukrainian restaurant in the area (which I wrote a review of too) and afterwards we walked over to this place.

Inside it's not the biggest place but then again for these sort of places they don't really have to, though it could've been a little cleaner. The color scheme and design though blended in well with the sort of establishment it is.

One cool thing about the place is that they accept my friend and I's student cards for discount, so if you're a college student in the area they should accept it too.

I'm more of a traditional ice cream / milkshake guy, but if you like the sort of shakes and teas they have on their menu, definitely visit this place. so even though I might not come here often, it was nice to visit nonetheless and hopefully I can return to try out the food they have on their menu.

Ordered through Postmates, at the time there's a promotion $3 off $15 order, was delivered from this Vivi location rather than a closer one.

Brown Sugar Milk Tea with boba: 90/100, so far the best brown sugar milk tea I had. (Compares to Yifang and etc)

Taro Milk: 70/100. Don't really like milk...

Popcorn chicken (garlic): flavor is ok, but portion is too small

I think the decor is cute and the cups with the little skeleton figures is cute, but the bubble tea was bland. I got the 3Q, which is the one with grass jelly and egg custard. It's all the rage these days. I felt that the tea was not sweet enough, the boba a bit soft, and the grass jelly and egg custard to be on the bland side. It's probably healthier than those where you can only taste the cream, but I honestly wanted something heavier. Since you have the option of getting less cream and/or ice, I figure people who want a healthier version can get that.

The nice thing is that the price seems alright. They also offer a musubi with a boba for only $5. Not bad at all. You can get an upgrade from a medium to a large with a student ID, but don't expect them to prompt you.

Stopped in here after picking up some groceries from Trader Joe's. Ya break a sweat from waiting in that line, y'know? Jokes, jokes...

Anyway, the past couple times I've come here it's been alright.

(!) WHAT WE GOT: Usual choice is the iced milk drink, which is good, albeit a little sweet. FYI they use Lactaid milk, for all y'all that are lactose intolerant. This time the fiancée got that one, and I got a thai milk tea. Both large. Add an order of popcorn chicken to that cause the picture looked enticing.

(!) HOW'D IT DO: Large is quite large. Definitely get that if you're sharing, otherwise, you're taking that thing home! Boba was soft and just how I like it and, both drinks, while a little sweet, were refreshing. (I believe you can alter the sweetness at the counter when you order though. Popcorn chicken was breaded interestingly, it wasn't like, fried fried or anything but the coating wasn't really... breaded. It was unique. Tasted good but it wasn't what I was looking for at the moment.

(!) TIDBITS: They take card but they have a minimum. All in all, will be back if in the area.

From experience some Vivi's chains sells different types of food items (popcorn chicken etc). YES THIS STORE HAS POPCORN CHICKEN!!! And it is GOOD!!! All the stores sell about the same selection of bubble teas, which are a staple for the store. The bubble teas are pretty solid, but it is the popcorn chicken that puts them over the top. So delicious. The Taiwanese sausages are very good as well. Oily and greasy, however 2 sausages for $5 is pretty extreme, so i stick to the popcorn chicken. My favorite flavor is the basil followed closely by the spicy, but in essence all 5 flavors are delicious.

PLEASE READ: SOME YELP READERS ARE MISGUIDED. Vivis does have a loyalty program, but you have to the read the back of the loyalty card carefully.  The loyalty cards are not INTERCHANGEABLE AT ALL VIVIS locations. For example The loyalty card I have is only accepted at 5 Vivis stores (2 Chinatown locations, Little Italy, Financial District, and Chelsea) and thus I had to get a new one for this location.

Definitely will come back as this is a one stop shop for both my bubble tea cravings and the popcorn chicken.

I ordered two cups of milk tea and a salt crispy chicken. I was very angry. The salt crispy chicken couldn't be eaten in one bite. The first time I encountered such a food, the salt crispy chicken was super invincible. The meat could not be described!  !  My own fried at home is more delicious than this, it just makes the chicken dry and speechless, I want to call and complain and didn't answer !  Please come to do business and come up with such a thing. I will not order any more.

***Student discount, Easily accessible, Quick service***

If you're craving boba or any other Asian type drink, stop by here! They also will upgrade your drink size if you have a valid student ID!

Taiwanese popcorn chicken is becoming less of once-in-awhile treat to a guilty after-workout pleasure. Which is bad, because now I'm calling every form of physical activity a "workout" to justify my nasty (but delicious) habit. It doesn't help that my brother also goes crazy at the prospect of fried chicken. Maybe we're genetically doomed to be fatasses.

The chicken can be... inconsistent. The "spicy" I ordered the other day was indeed teary eyed spicy but it was lacking in sodium. I fear this has something to do with the health conscience area. Stupid green movement.

Oh well, I can always just tell them to kick it a notch and it's not like I have any other options. Seriously, where else around can you get popcorn chicken and fried Oreos? This place has a vice grip on my balls. I don't know why a Taiwanese place is serving carnival food but it's better not to ask questions.

Sshh sshh sshh sshh *inserts*

I went in tonight ordered two drinks the girl made the drinks and put them on the counter. It wasnt super busy there wasnt anyone really in the store around this time. My drink was super watery I got the flaming brown sugar milk tea which is usually amazing im not sure what happened tonight. Second drink friend said was also water which was the taro creme brulee. The serive bothered me tonight because i was by myself with the drinks so usually when this happens they put them in a bag and its easier to carry i asked for a bag since she just placed them on the counter and she hands me a bag as if i was annoying her. She didnt bag it or give me straws like every other person has done and I frequent this location alot but after tonight Im not sure if I want to continue visiting that location.

Cute store front. Good bubble tea. Had the passion fruit with boba. Love the decor in the place.

This was my first time having bubble tea like this and I'm in love. I pretty much stopped by here every day to get my fix while I was in town.
A Lovely shop . During the afternoon，it is not too busy. I come her every week with my friend.She and I love the popcorn chicken and the blue Galaxy drink.

It's a good place to grab milk tea with bubbles. I got the ginger milk tea. If you like the taste of ginger, you can definitely taste it in this. It is really strong in the drink that I got. It's nice to have on a nice, fall day which in that case, I should've gotten something a little sweeter instead of spicy.

Tried the yakult (small yogurt type drink) green tea and it tasted like my childhood. The bubbles here are pretty good. Soft and chewy. Its along the busy 14th street, but pretty hard to miss with their bright colors. This location also serves hot food/snacks.
There are a few seats inside along the walls, but overall, pretty tiny. If you have your school ID, you can get a free upgrade to a large (works for any school ID!).
You can use credit card at this location, but there is a minimum purchase.

I love VIVI! They have great flavor sand fast service.

I usually get the bubble tea with the boba & pudding in it. It's also nice that they have Lactaid options for those who can't handle regular dairy. Overall, this place is consistent & will always have good options since it's a franchise.

I'll be back!
The service is really bad here. Also the drink is not as good as other vivi. Avoid this place if you can.

The waitress here at Saturday afternoon is super super rude - she is a short fat Asian lady with very arrogant attitude - I thought one drink was mine and was gonna ask about it and she scalded at me "it's not yours don't touch it" and subsequent conversation is just very rude and disrespectful.  
She should get fired.

Disappointed in this establishment's customer service and their lack of regard for their loyalty coupon. I'm been going to this establishment for years always bring my card to earn a free bubble tea. Today I tried to redeem my free drink only to be told that the drink would only be redeemable for a flavored tea minus the boba. If changes are made in a establishment 's customer rewards system there should be some transparency and regards for long-standing customers.

Solid bubble tea. Everyone needs one every now and then. This is my neighbourhood go-to. This joint uses lactaid instead of milk. I'm not lactose intolerant but perhaps this helps others in deciding whether to dine here or not.

Bonus: it's just $3.00 for a generous medium-sized standard bubble milk tea.

I've had sooo many bad bubble teas before that sometimes I'm afraid to try new places, but a couple years ago my friend (who I trusted) wanted to get bubble tea and we were in Chinatown (different location than this one) and I got one and it was delicious! The place screams Asians since it's super "kawaii" but it's definitely an "in" place for younger Asian people. All the bubble teas they make are delicious and I recommend you get the 3Q Milk Tea if it's your first time trying it, it's honestly a favorite of mine, but I got the Green Tea Yakult, which is a light yogurt drink (Also good).

In the past I've also gotten the takoyakis before and I've tried from "authentic" places before and it's pretty good if you want to try octopus balls. I know it sounds weird but give it a try, it's pretty good and perfect for carrying around in the city while on the go.

So to sum it up, you get great bubble teas, pretty decent small snacks and everything is at a decent price!

The one thing I love about this location is that they provide seating, which most ViVi's don't and that it's in a location where there aren't much bubble tea places around.

I love their 2 bubble drinks for $4 deal which I take advantage of after work!!!!

Keep this deal going and I will keep visiting!

I must have asked for unsweetened because mine barely had any sweetness to it but I that just attests to the goodness of their drink because from all the desserts I've had that day, my palate needed it unsweetened and you know what? It was perfect! Perfect amount of pudding, grass jelly, and boba! It was so flavorful I did not miss the sweetness!

The Thai tea is excellent! And there are a few tables to sit and sip (though not many). I asked them a question about the milk tea and the girl gave me an irritated look and mumbled something, so there's that.
One of my favorite bubble tea places! They make the mango green tea with the perfect amount of sweetness and the workers are always super nice. The location is also convenient which is a plus.
Amazing bubble tea! The staff is very friendly and work very fast. This location is always clean and welcoming!

So happy to see this location here! Seems more expensive than the one in Chinatown.

Still relatively cheap and service is quick.

Chewy boba (hate when it's mushy) that wasn't too sweet.

I like that you can choose the level of sweetness of your drink.

I go to Vivi's exclusively for their grapefruit green tea, and this visit was no different. They use actual grapefruit instead of syrup which is what other places use. The only downside is that this branch didn't seem to have as much grapefruit in it as the other branches I've been to! Also, $5 credit card minimum; I had to upgrade my drink because I had no cash on me to meet this minimum. Anyway, their other drinks (at least at the other branches) aren't so great, but the grapefruit green tea is good!

So glad that I don't have to travel all the way to Chinatown to get vivi bubble tea!

Makes the perfect ending to any meal whether you had halal down the street or baohaus next door.

The place itself is small, but bigger than the one in Chinatown.

Boba was consistent with their other location: bombdotcom.

Your standard Chinese-American takeout place.  The decor is really nice and the food is good.  The prices are average for NYC chinese takeout.  The staff is awesome and always put extra items in my takeout orders.  If you're in the area, definitely check them out.  Good for before or after a movie (Lowes is right there or before a night at Webster Hall).

Cheers
Pork bun was dry. Chicken was bland but the dumplings were solid. Just deeply deeply meh.

We ordered food from here through DoorDash on a Monday evening around 10pm. I ordered blueberry pancakes and my hubby ordered French toast. We also ordered a side of home fries. All of our items tasted fresh and were yummy! The blueberry pancakes reminded me of cornmeal pancakes and the blueberries were plump and not those tiny frozen ones that other places use. The portions were large too!
The home fries don't look like the ones pictured on DoorDash but more like actual home fries, are seasoned and have pieces of bell peppers throughout. Our food arrived quickly and was warm upon arrival. Their menu items look amazing with sections named "pancake snob", "French toast snob" and "bagel snob".

Definitely recommend checking them out and bring an appetite!

Waited....and waited......for an OMELETTE order that was supposed to take 20 minutes. After an hour, I figured this must be the best omelette ever if they were taking such care.

After an hour and a half (!) the "Snob" canceled the order.

At least have the grace to cancel when I place the order, not 90 minutes later while we have been waiting for breakfast!
Given the other reviews, this seems to be SOP for this place (or, conspiracy theory, the place doesn't really exist and is just a delivery scam LOL).....and apparently I would've been disappointed by the food anyway.
Do not bother!
The food is fine. The BEC Bagel was $11.99 and I expected a little more for the price. I gave 5 stars since I had no issues with the food or delivery, but I probably won't return.

Cheese wasnt even melted in a bacon egg and cheese... the eggs tasted raw and nasty.

The desserts are all typical prepackaged deli desserts that they charge $13 for. Its a scam stay away

This place should be called the village breakfast SLOB! The food is disgusting! My pork sausage was a patty that was microwaved from the freezer, the eggs were overcooked and the home fries might as well be mashed potatoes! The best part of my meal was the toast (at least they didn't screw that up)! I would've added a picture but I was so disgusted that I threw the food right in the garbage bin and requested a refund from doordash!

Just go to ihop this place is not worthy to be a snob should be call the breakfast basic chick cause u can basically do this sugar hunny ice tea yourself, your mediocre  deli food best prolly when u come home from the club
Food was fresh and tasty. I was charged $5 for 3 pieces of bacon. DONT ORDER THE BACON. French toast didn't come with any syrup. Don't order out from here. I'm sure they're  better at the restaurant.
This is a FAKE SCAM RESTAURANT do not order from here!!! There is no real "Village breakfast snob" instead it is a tiny disgusting deli scamming people on uber eats. Worst food of my life

I was here one day for a business event. This is a bistro dining & nightlife experience. There is the mezzanine level with plush burgundy couches and soft leather walls with candles surrounding giving it a soft touch. On the menu has a mix of 30 different kinds of brick oven pizzas, calzones, southern Italian style pasta & entrees. If dessert is what you crave, you must try their chocolate calzone. I know you're probably thinking what? It's a hazelnut flavored chocolate stuffed calzone served with fresh berries along with home made whipped cream. Don't knock it, till you try it.
Late night comes, DJ will spin the hits, sip your drinks, single ready to mingle. Lol
Drinks are fairly priced, must try their Blu- Raspberry Mojito.  
No cover charge if you only want to chill at Via.

Design:
Beautiful decor. Soft setting. A real knockout.

Dinner:
Really delicious menu and the pizza is amazing (although the oven looks really stupid behind the bar)!

Minus a star for the fact that the waiter didn't warn myself or my date that gratuity was included and I tipped (scumbag)! Since when is tip included with a party of two? Straight grimey tactics!

Nightlife:
If you could call it that. I really never had a good time during the parties here. Underage crowd, music was not pleasing, and I once busted my ass on the "dance floor" cuz it was all wet (that part was hilarious though)!

I'd say try it once for dinner, even twice. However, don't count on it for a party.

My dad alway said if you cant say something nice..... but I think this place is one of the most mis-managed places out there, I mean I have seen worse, but this is one of the top 20 places where things will go wrong.  I wish it wasnt the case, cause the place looks nice, and sometimes there may be a good vibe going on, but everyone I know that goes comes back with a horror story.

I myself had my bday screwed up where they ran out of Amstel Light, and some vodka what place that sells liquor runs out of it before the middle of the night.

Girls I know also complained about there only being 2 bathrooms in the entire place, and this includes the gents washroom.

Its a pity cause the place did have potential.   The only thing that can probably save them is the pizza, the pizzaman can make 1 hell of a pie, but its never open on time to serve anyone, so if your lucky enough to give them business, you can try that out.

I went here last summer and I only stayed for about half an hour..  I ended up checking another place out.  The place itself wasn't bad.  I just didn't like the crowd.  At first, it was just the ppl on line but when I walked in...it was even worse.  It just didn't seem classy enough for me.  Maybe it was the night I went.  Honestly, ppl looked cheap and under dressed.  They kinda looked like bums.  I dunno, maybe it was just me.  A friend had a party here last Friday night and they all seemed to have fun.  I don't really know the details but it might have changed.  I guess it all depends on the night.  If you're a hookah fan, then this is the place for you.  I've never tried the restaurant though, someday.

If the place didn't look decent, I'd only give it 1 star.

I went to the vivacious "Via" for a birthday party last weekend.  From the bongo player to the carnival dancer to the hookahs to the upstairs VIP room swathed in brightly colored fabrics, everything at Via that night was hot and "spicy."  I'm not sure what it's like on a regular night, but I'd definitely keep it in mind for parties.

I had my bday at club via last week... nd it was the worst bday i ever had. The promoter, his name is Dee. He promised us that there was only one other party that night and we'd have a nice VIP area to ourselves and open bar from 10-11. We got none of those. We had to stand in the line for hours even after having a guest list and after 11, there werent letting anyone in from my list. I told the promoter (Dee) and he was being a complete d***! and all my friends had to pay. i had the most horrible experience and I am never going to have a party with this promoter or at this club. PLEASE AVOID ANYONE FROM BOLLYWOODREMIXEVENTS or FRIDAY NIGHTS AT CLUB VIA.

A truly excellent dining experience, ideal for celebrating something special, a little pricey but worth it and you'll feel the quality.

Have been a Collector member of Fotografiska for several years and enjoyed Chapel Bar but had been saving Veronika for a special occasion and half we did.

From the moment we were greeted by the maitre de to seating in the beautiful adorned dining room, this felt like a visit to proper high quality restaurant.

Rose was an utter delight to be served by and added magically to our experience. Secret tip; definitely order the bread, an in-house specialty similar to a croissant. We encountered a tray in the elevator and found it hard to resist pleading for some to take home haha

Cocktails are nicely prepared, could do with a little extra muddling. Wine servings are generously poured.

While I selected a beautifully cooked steak, it was boring compared to the wife's lobster omelet with a delicious beurre blank, among the best most tender mains we've had.

A visit to the photography museum before, will provide good conversation starters or afterwards with a post meal glass of wine after a sumptuous feast.

This is New York City at its best. Cultural and gastronomic excellence.

Went to Verōnika to celebrate my best friends birthday! Absolutely loved everything about this place from the staff to the decor and food/drinks.

First things first! While Verōnika is open to all, it's fully enjoyed by only Patron Level Members of Fotografiska and NeueHouse Members, who get full reservation access. I would suggest reading their website for more info.

Okay now for the experience! Bar Verōnika is beautifully situated right at the front of the restaurant and the bartenders were so friendly! They overheard my best friend and I complimenting their pens and they gave us each one. (I'm a sucker for collecting pens from restaurants I visit.)

Once seated, we orders more drinks. My drink of the night was the Gold Rush. So good and not too sweet. The salmon was fresh and perfectly cooked! Very tender and the fries we shared on the side were crispy and tasty. To celebrate the birthday girl  we had the carrot cake and the strawberry and cream meringue for dessert.

It is a pricier option. But definitely recommend for a special occasion!

Gorgeous restaurant, though smaller expected. The complimentary popover croissants came warm and were so good! I had the seared tuna and really enjoyed it. The tuna was very fresh and tender. The Ortiz anchovies and seeded mustard gave it just the right amount of seasoning. I also hadn't had quail eggs in a very long time so appreciated the childhood throwback. I tried a bit of my friend's chicken schnitzel and was very impressed by how tender and flavorful it was. I'd get this if I ever come back. The carrot cake is the cutest thing - actually a mini cake instead of a slice.

Service was on par with the food and ambiance. Overall, great time.

Went here Saturday night to celebrate a friends birthday. Intimate yet loud would be the best way to describe the atmosphere! The food is pricey yet delicious. The downside is we had a late reservation so some menu items we wanted were "sold out" (the porterhouse steak and the flambé dessert) our waiter gave us free champagne for the pain, which was a good way to ease our sadness!  I ordered the salmon, potato purée and broccolini DE-fucken-LICIOUS (& yes I had to curse to emphasize my point) When it comes to the sides, I recommend sharing with someone! I was able to eat the two sides I ordered on my own because I'm greedy ‍ but my friends weren't able to complete their sides.

We had such an amazing time for my best friend's bday! Her name is Veronica so it was a no brainer lmao!
The service was top tier! The wait staff looked so dapper. I was in love!!! I'm telling you the place is picturesque! The menu is a great size. Not overwhelming and a pretty nice selection. I had steak and frites but the best item we had at the table was the jagerschniztel! I know I didn't spell that right but you'll find it lmao! Giant piece of breaded fried chicken! Delish! It's a vibbbbeeeee!!!!!

Inside Fotografiska you'll find this beautiful restaurant called Verōnika. My friend and I had reservations for 5 pm which is when they open. This is one of the most beautiful restaurants I've seen in NYC. From the decor to the ambience, to the service and the food, everything was impeccable.

This is definitely not an everyday place, as is on the pricier end, but definitely worth the visit. You can basically have a 3-1 experience here. You can have dinner and drinks at Verōnika l, check out the the super cool photography exhibition at the museum, then go for more drinks at Chapel bay downstairs.

Once my friend I got seated, we ordered our drinks and then were served compliments crudités with vegan aioli which was delicious, as well as the most amazing croissant like pastries with the most beautiful looking butter that was in the shape of a star. For my drink I ordered the Acholado which was basically a pisco sour and was delicious. My friend ordered the Rumble which she enjoyed as well.

For our entrees my friend ordered the lobster omelette and I ordered the Jagershnitzel. I loved my Jagershnitzel. It was topped with this delicious mushroom sauce. My friend also really enjoyed her lobster omelette. The portions were quite big and, we were definitely stuffed by the end of our meal. We really wanted to try the dessert but, we were way too full.

I'd definitely come back here again, and try more of the food and the desserts next time around.

Take a picture of the bill and check your credit card statement. My friend warned me beforehand how she was overcharged and I dined about a month after her and was also billed more than I paid.

Other than that, loved the staff and ambiance. Great cocktails! Didn't really like the food but experience was overall positive.

Jagerschnitzel
Chicken & Frites
Carrot Cake
Strawberries and Creme

Espresso Martini - loved
Floradora
Monte Carlo - loved

The food was impeccable.  Everything we ordered had an amazing and unique flavor. The service is as expected, server was extremely knowledgeable and very attentive.  
Expresso martinis are a thing at this place, so if you like them, order one!!  You'll see one at almost every table.  

The vibe was amazing.  You'll love the art and the trip down memory lane.  It is not easy to get a reservation, so plan way in advance.  

I will definitely go back.

Wow, pictures don't do justice to how beautiful this space is! Just walking upstairs, you can already feel the vibes. I loved the high ceilings, ornate chandeliers, and velvet seats. Even just having a drink at the bar would be fun, loved walking through that space, too.
My friends and I shared a bottle of the Domaine Bechtold Riesling, which was delicious. The complimentary crudites and croissant popovers were very yummy and a nice way to start our meal. The oysters were refreshing and the Organic Farmers Salad was a great complement to our mains. We loved the Halibut; the lemon sorrel sauce was bright and creamy.  Both the Flank Steak and Jagerschnitzel were perfectly done as well.
The desserts had a nice presentation. They were tasty but not too memorable.
Service was cordial and attentive. I would recommend coming here for the overall experience of a special night out.

Absolutely stunning restaurant and excellent service. The decor was so romantic and beautiful. I enjoyed my entire dinner from the bread to the dessert. The food did not disappoint at all. Keep in mind it is on the pricey side but it's worth every penny. I ordered the lamb which was delicious but had more fat then I would have liked but nonetheless delicious. Get the strawberries and cream dessert and prepare for a cute surprise.

Where can I start! Verōnika is gorgeous!!! Entering on 22nd and Park, it feels like walking into a roaring 1920s speakeasy paired with grandeur of the Golden Days of Hollywood. Verōnika is visually and texturally velvet, luxurious, and glowing warmth.

I went to Verōnika with a few friends to grab dinner. Our reservations were for 9pm and we arrived at 8:15 for drinks. My friend Rene has been a few times and the waitresses remembered him and his drink order. After sitting for a few minutes to wait for the rest of our party to arrive, we were served our drinks and a bar menu just in case we wanted to order a few bites prior to being seated at our table.
Soon after our friends arrived, we were seated and attended to.

As an appetizer we ordered half shell Maine scallop, Tuna and Uni tartare, and two of the three tempura oysters. Everything was delicious. I ordered the tuna tartare and must admit... I loved my choice the best.

For dinner SEARED TUNA IN HERBS, FAROE ISLAND SALMON, two orders of the Halibut, and one order of the potato purée for the table. The fish was extremely flaky and delicate. The tuna was flavorful and felt like butter on the tongue.

For dessert my friend ordered the strawberries cream meringue, and I chose the soft served gelato which I didn't know was large enough to share with the table. The chocolate gelato had shaved dark chocolate in it and tasted like a mousse, the salted pistachio gelato was chef kiss perfect, the avocado coconut was interesting but delightful, and the raspberry gelato was the amazingly tart.

If you want to go to a restaurant that gives you the aural and visual drama that you deserve, check out Verōnika!

Ambiance: check. Service: check. Food: check. This new hotspot members' club hits all the right spots!

The design is modern yet cozy. The food is sophisticated yet comforting. And the service was amazing. It's a fairly expensive spot, but we'll worth it.

Can't wait to go back'
I love this place, the food excellent and the drinks. Loved the environment and the music vibe. Will highly recommend it.

Saint Veronica is the patron saint of photographers so it is fitting that Veronika is in the Fotografiska (photography) Museum. A truly elegant museum with classic European cuisine, Vernonika is an elegant, formal restaurant serving great food and cocktails to a very trendy crowd that you would normally expect to find in a far more casual restaurant. The service is impeccable as you would expect to find at this price point. For once the food equals the scene and the beautiful room.

Can't remember the last time I went to a restaurant and everything was good!
The entire venue is gorgeous, the building, bar and dining room are beautiful.
Staff was very friendly and attentive, our waiter disappeared at some points but there were plenty of other people around to help.
Cocktails- I tried the classic espresso martini and the airmail, both were great ($21 each)
The complimentary bread was delicious, similar to a croissant.
For dinner we started with the farmers salad which was a nice light start.
Entrees - party of 4, we ordered different things to try, everything was delicious!
Seared Tuna - cooked to perfection served on a bed of tasty veggies
JAGERSCHNITZEL- a large shareable portion, served alone with an amazing mushroom sauce, one of the best schnitzels we've ever had
Chicken & frites- delicious, chicken was very juicy, also a shareable portion
LOBSTER OMELETTE & FRITES- very light and tasty, served with a creamy lemon sauce
For dessert we had the strawberries and cream which was excellent, not too sweet. A perfect end to a great meal.

An off night? or the truth behind the hype for this place. I spent hours at dinner and only about 20 minutes of it actually eating food. My reservation was for 9:30 but I wasn't seated until almost 11 and it wasn't for another 40 minutes that we actually ate food.

Dinner didn't conclude until 1 am. We had to cancel the plans of going out after because it got so late and we got so frustrated having to sit for so long. Kudos to management for handing out glasses of wine to all the patrons that were waiting so patiently but it just wasn't commensurate of the inconvenience it truly was.

The drinks? amazing The food? cooked well but flavorless. Although the kampachi and scallops dish was very fresh, it felt incomplete and lacking. No acid or heat just oil. My shrimps were dry and overcooked. The veal desperately needed seasoning. Arugula salad was a basic bowl of greens.  

Our server Nicholas is the reason for the two stars. He was amazing and we made sure to let him know that he was doing a good job despite our miserable visit.

This is the perfect restaurant for a date night, business dinner or whenever you want to feel and be treated fabulously.

From the beautiful art work on the walls to the beautiful art on my plate, this dining experience did not disappoint. Our waiter was extremely attentive, friendly and happy to answer all of our questions. Our large party ordered seasonal oysters, tuna & uni tartare and kampachi scallops. Every single raw appetizer was delicious and extremely fresh.

Many of our party ordered various schnitzel dishes and everyone raved about how mouth watering and perfectly seasoned their dishes were. I ordered the broccolini and whole red snapper. The red snapper is located on the share portion of the menu and they mean it. I was able to share my dish and still have leftovers. The snapper was filleted and the waitress drizzled a new season olive oil over the fish which gave it a very nice flavor. The dish is simple and the snapper is truly the star of it.

For dessert, we ordered a petite carrot cake with a classic cream cheese icing , double chocolate cake, Mille-feuille and soft served gelato in 4 flavors. If you love gelato, run to Verōnika just for the dessert because you will fall in love with the very first bite.

To end our wonderful dining experience, we received a complimentary drink and beautiful edible necklaces and chocolates. I had such a wonderful experience from beginning to end that I highly recommend everyone to visit. If you want to feel and be treated like luxury, don't look any further because you will feel spoiled by the end of your dining experience. The next time I'm in NY, I will be going back for seconds. A job well done from the host to the amazing chefs creating and delivering such outstanding dishes and service.

The food was delicious (though priced on high end) and the atmosphere impeccable. The waitstaff while you're eating is kind and on top of their game. Highly recommend their cauliflower main dish - it was like eggplant parmigiana only with cauliflower and the crispy outside was cooked to perfection! The little mini carrot cake for dessert was delectable as well! Didn't love the strawberries and cream, I think there was a jelly-like champagne substance inside of the meringue? But overall great food and beautiful restaurant.

Knocking off 2 stars because the girl working at the desk when you first enter before going upstairs is one of the most miserable, unwelcoming people I've ever encountered, as was another girl who worked there Tuesday night in a green dress. The girl in the green dress knocked into my group and I multiple times while we were waiting for our cocktails from the bar and didn't say excuse me until she could see we were visibly upset. Once she did she excuse me, she said it in a way as though she were doing us a favor. It's a big miss for an establishment who's doing everything else right to have people like that up front.

Wandered in here by complete accident while at an exhibit at the Fotografiska gallery.  What a hidden gem!   It is the most beautful space - formerly a Masonic temple 100+ years ago - they have left the soaring ceilings and original stained glass windows intact.  We were there in the afternoon and with sunlight streaming in it felt like church!   Excellent  mixology and service.    I would love to try the restaurant next time

TLDR: Look, this venue upstairs to the Fotografiska Museum is SO BEAUTIFUL, and everyone is dressed well in this classic and upscale bar. But the staff was surprisingly rude to us even when we were celebrating 3 birthdays and asked us to move from our table to the bar because we "weren't ordering food" (even though we got apps and desserts PLUS multiple drinks per person).

FOOD (4/5):
Fries were really good (though $16 for a cup of them?), Mille-Feuille wasn't really a mille-feuille and definitley not what we were expecting (kind of like a cheesecake with a layer of raspberry on top), Chocolate cake was pretty good and plated beautifully, though would have preferred without the coconut (we DID expect the coconut here)

DRINKS (4/5):
All their drinks were at the very least really beautiful, though some didn't quite meet expectations. The most unique one we tried was the Floradora, which we ordered 3 of during different rounds. It's a ginger-shot type of drink that was unique and felt "good for you" as you drank it....

SERVICE (2/5):
- We were so shocked when the 4 of us were asked to move to the bar. All in, we easily spent as much as we would have if we ate food here, and nowhere on the website did it say that we needed to order entrees in order to sit at a table. There were open tables in the dining room all night, and we had made a reservation for the table well in advance. I totally understand that there may have been rules, but if those had been conveyed anywhere before the dinner, we would have been happy to move. We had already been handed our first round of drinks when they asked us to move, which was disappointing.
- Had a very long wait to get upstairs to Veronika even though we had made a reservation for a specific time
- Credit where credit is due -- afterward when we ordered desserts they did make an effort to add "Happy Birthday" customizations to the desserts with candles, which we appreciated

ENVIRONMENT (5/5):
- Beautiful, Gatsby-vibes space with tall ceilings, velvet booth seating, and lounge seating by the bar (though seemed harder to sit in than normal chairs)
- Dim setting, not too loud, but lots of big groups here (and suitable for large groups)
- Very cool setting in the Fotografiska Museum

My wife and I went on Saturday night.   We had no reservation but we were immediately told we could have drinks at the bar, which is all we wanted.  The hostess was wonderfully pleasant and friendly.  

At the bar , we met Alban , who is an incredible bartender.   I was drinking a Gold Rush and my wife was having a Paper Plane

Alban truly knocked it outta the park , and my wife and I enjoyed the friendly , witty banter we had with him.   We both watched in awe of how smooth and effortless his motions were at running his end of the bar while also controlling service.   My wife and I both agreed , we'd hire 10 Albans if we could

We only had the pleasure of meeting Seth for a brief moment , but he also seemed on top of his game.   A true professional !!!

PROS:
- The restaurant interior is really nice... But, the food is why I go to a restaurant. (I'm sure rent is expensive hence the expensive priced dishes [see further below].)

CONS:
- Reservation was for 7:45 sat at 8:20p
- Food overpriced
- Very loud

IMPRESSION:
If I am paying $100 for a plate, I'd expect a bit more. They had a cancellation policy where if you don't show up to your reservation, you pay $50 per head that did not show up. When we arrived for our reservation at 7:45pm and waited until 8:20, there was no apology. There was no sense of urgency. There was the script they were all taught: "please wait for your table at the bar." We waited there and ended up having to tell the waitress that we'd be late for our show after.

NOTE: IF YOU'RE GOING TO CHARGE PEOPLE TO BE ON TIME, THEN YOUR CUSTOMER SHOULD EXPECT TO BE SEATED AT THE TIME OF THE RESERVATION.  Sorry but the punctuality was really lacking. BOOOO!!!

Stunning, elegant, sophisticated, sexy, and envious mixology. We originally intended to get some champagne to pay for the privilege to see the impressive architecture and interior design, but found ourselves lingering for hours enjoying cocktails and snacks that each seemed to tell a story in a film noir voice with the mystery, intrigue, and invitation of Wes Anderson proportions. Definitely get the Reserve Martini Tray or any one of there espresso martini innovations. The martini tray is a one of a kind cocktail experience, that doesn't need repeating... the espresso martinis however seemed to invite friends and back-ups such that the bottom was never found.

There is a reason places are great and people gravitate toward them like bees to pollen. This place is a feast for the eyes as well as an after work drinks location with the best fries at the bar. Is it pricey...sure but you are paying for the experience as well. The hey I'm having drinks in a place that looks like a movie set with other glamorous people. I'm living a NYC experience.  For anyone wanting to dine here, please take the reservation process seriously. They do. And ensure that you impress your guests that you can score a table. Worth every moment to go into a place where the bartenders know your name if you are a regular.  No food photos or drink photos because yes it will be great, but they are not the only reason that you will go.

The indoors was so beautiful and reminded me of Le Coucou. This would be a nice spot for date nights. It was spacious in comparison with manhattan standard. The bread was warm and yummy. The oysters were fresh. The lobster omelette was pretty average, maybe other entrees would be better. For the dessert, the chocolate cake was delicious, but not memorable. Overall, I would come here for the vibe, but not so much the food.

I went to Veronika with a friend on my last visit to NYC. We had an incredible experience from the moment we walked through the doors. First of all, the ambiance is very inviting, classy while also very warm. The service alone deserves five stars. Valeria and the whole staff were incredibly attentive throughout our whole visit, provided great food recommendations and gave us ample time to enjoy the experience. Food, where do I even begin. While one might be surprised to find a lobster omelette on the dinner menu, I strongly encourage you not to hesitate. It melts in your mouth and absolutely lives up to hearty expectations you would have from a dinner entry. And for dessert, strawberry cream concoction was absolutely heavenly.  All in all 10 out of 10. Oh and if you have time for a nightcap, peak inside Chapel speakeasy right next door, you won't regret it

Officially one of my favorite bars in the city. This is exactly what I mean when I want a luxe NYC bar experience. From the moment you walk in, everything is just absolutely gorgeous. Veronika doesn't just rely on her looks, what she's got to offer is just as good. The drinks we had were perfectly crafted, and we enjoyed being able to watch the bartenders do their thing. We ordered fries and a lobster roll. It was a very small roll, but I expect smaller portions in places like this. Size doesn't matter in this case, because the freshness and flavor was 10/10. Probably one of my favorite lobster rolls I've had. The service was incredible, and no pretentiousness whatsoever. I can't wait to go back!

The food here was good but not amazing. We came here as a group of three. This restaurant was incredibly beautiful and is in the same building as the photography museum. The waiter was incredibly disappointed that we did not order drinks and did not hide this well. I don't think it should be an expectation for anyone to have drinks. My dining companions both had steak that came with sauces. The sauces were brought via the wait staff and could not be left. We did ask for them to left on the table. They were spooned on to the plate. Anyways, just felt odd that they could not be left in small bowls on the table for them to take as much as they liked rather than having to ask again.

What can i say, i really wanted to love this place,but sadly i cant. Gorgeous interior, gorgeous hostess , plating, shakers, menu all so charming. Excellent mini veg comp, super cute. Nice dip. All for the 2 stars. Then comes the food, 3 apps all at once, oysters deepfried into nothiness, didnt care for it at all. Kampachi & scallops..soso
Half shell main scallop..soso. lobster omelette was fine. This is a place i would come sit at the bar, have a drink and admire the interior decor, take some beautiful photos. Thats about it. As for the yummys, take away the ys. its just umms.

I was impressed with everything about this place! It's an experience, not just a dinner. Everything was presented beautifully and tasted amazing. The service was spot on; there when we were ready or needed something and waiting in the wings when we didn't need to be bothered and just enjoy. The people watching in this gorgeous and grand restaurant was also a hot topic of discussion with my friends. We didn't want to leave we were enjoying so much!
The server was not efficient enough in explaining the details of the menu and didn't care what kind of seat I had reserved.
