This place is amazing. The drinks are so high quality and perfect and beautiful in appearance. The ambience is amazing; the ceilings are super high with huge chandeliers, and it's so well decorated. The service is also excellent. I am dying to go back and highly recommend this spot.

Very nice room and setting.  The night we were there was a photo opening so we were invited to see the exhibition and have drinks which was was fun.  It however, was a bit crowded as a result, but that did not interrupt the prompt service.  The food was good.  Chicken spätzle was generous and well prepared.  The halibut was very good.  Salads were fine and mascarpone dessert was was rich and creamy.  There was live jazz music the night we were there which added a nice touch.

I came here for dessert with a friend . The ambiance was laid back . Also it was almost closing time. We ordered dessert at the bar. We chose the strawberries and cream meringue , I enjoyed it much. I'll be returning at some point for the full experience.
Amazing ambiance.  Not so amazing food.  Oysters were good but the rest of the food was okay.  Good date spot to impress your partner.  Younger crowd mostly in 20s and early 30s.

The most beautiful restaurant I've ever frequented. Delicious food, service and overall dining experience. Everyone treated us like family and even VIP's. This restaurant is now in my rotation of favorites.

Wow if you can snag a reservation, you must try veronika. This place is a vibe, super sexy perfect for a date night or small group. Think European flair I didn't feel like I was in the US once I stepped in here. The service and ambience blew me away. On to the food, the menu has a variety of food, we tried the tuna tartare with uni which was so divine, for entrees we had the chicken which was ok and the salmon which was really tasty. On to dessert, we tried the strawberries and cream and the carrot cake, we probably could have done with 1, but either was we were so excited to try everything. Classy place with beautiful people. Loved everything about it. They also have a really nice cocktail menu as well.

The food was lovely, I mean superb the steak divine the mushrooms I inhaled. I could go on.  However the service is terrible.- if I didn't know I wasn't welcomed by the long wait for standard small asks vs my lovely counterparts who shared a steak whilst on my birthday I spend over $400 for mediocrity and being judged by my Apperance to originally being sat in a corner by the sliver ware. If my partner hadn't requested a different space to sit it would have truly been a horrible birthday dinner. - to follow up and follow through it was rather disappointing and frustrating to pay for bad service and to be made to feel unwanted unwelcome and the interaction at Veronika will haunt me for some time. It's just taking me a few days to muster the strength to share my experience.
Beautiful interior. Fresh food..excellent service! Highly recommended perfect spot for a date night

Despite Anna Delvey's scammer ways, which you might be aware of from @netflix 's "Inventing Anna," she really did have impeccable taste.

@veronika_nyc recently reopened this summer in the 19th century building that houses @fotografiska , an international photography museum along Park Avenue. The restaurant's name Verōnika is a nod to the patron saint of photography, so it is only fitting that the interiors of the establishment have been meticulously-crafted with grand archways, opulent brass chandeliers, luxurious velvet upholstery, and walls lined with hand-selected modern photography throughout. Specializing in European fare, Verōnika transports visitors across Europe through its food and cocktail program.

When you come to Verōnika, you come for drinks and vibes, not necessarily for the food. Bread service here is bomb, but who doesn't love freshly-baked croissants. Small plates were kind of disappointing -- salted beets are worth the reorder, but the crudo lacked flavor and acid, the tempura oysters were giving just tempura, and the half shell maine scallop was past the tipping point of rich from the uni and mint butter.

Always a sucker for schnitzel, we ordered the Jagerschnitzel, which swaps veal for chicken and has a nice rich mushroom sauce made with porcini and chanterelles. And you can never go wrong with breakfast for dinner, so definitely don't sleep on the lobster omelette. The omelette was very light with smoked artic char caviar, a bright lemon sauce, and crispy hand-cut frites on the side, just perfection.

They should go to jail for that meringue and carrot cake, but the salted pistachio soft serve gelato was nicely spun and had a great nuttiness to it. Fair warning, the soft serve is definitely fit for more than two people, and you can order all four flavors (they also have Raspberry, Araguani Venezuelan Chocolate, and Avocado Coconut) versus doing what we did in mistakenly ordering just one flavor.

Although it was a mixed bag, Verōnika does have some good bites, so inevitably you won't have to exclusively drink your calories here.
--------
IG: @dinelikeaduchess

Came here to celebrate my good god mom's birthday. The service and fools were superb. From. The time you walk in until the time your walk out ever interaction is elevated and special. The ambiance is to die for, old world classic with a modern twist and the food again...amazing. The cocktails are as strong as they claim and the desserts...chef's kiss!
The atmosphere, the service and the food were all equally amazing. I'll definitely be back

Shout out to Fernando and Hans. They were both super attentive. Fernando suggested some amazing options and did a great job explaining things to us.

We went here for our anniversary, it was a lovely place to celebrate. They didn't miss a thing. If you are making a reservation for a special celebration definitely write that on your reservation.

What we got that you should get:

1. Cocktails: traditional pisco sour & caviar with vodka, we also had some white wine that was so crisp and perfect pairing for the fish we had
2. Oysters of any kind on the menu are delicious
3. Scallops
4. Red snapper to share with mixed greens

We left feeling so content, we weren't stuffed and uncomfortable. It was so perfect. Thank you for an awesome experience.

Reviewing this from POV that you just finished touring Fotografiska and you want some pre-dinner drinks. My BF and I came here right at 5 pm on a Sat and snagged the couch right in front of the beautiful  bar. BF had a Gold Rush - he orders this drink quite a lot and said that it was the best version of this drink he had ever had (!). I ordered an espresso martini which was similarly excellent. We also tried the quail eggs (didn't taste too "quail-y" , aka it's quite accessible to someone who might be scared to try quail) and munched on some French fries. My advice is to skip Fotografiska (until they have better exhibits) and go straight to Veronika for drinks!

To echo the sentiments of many, dining here is an absolute experience. Are you looking for a place that still holds mystery in a world full of restaurant vlogs? The Veronika still holds that air. Greeting at the door? Check. Walking up a sweeping staircase? Check. Hassle free coat check? Check. Walking through an immaculate bar with the perfect mood lighting to be led to the dramatic yet well spaced out dining room? Big check! If you couldn't tell by my checklist, the Veronika has it all. My experience the past couple of times I have dined here has even prompted me to consider membership! The vibes are that immaculate. With a well thought out dining menu as well as a great variety in both their cocktail and wine list, Veronika has something for everyone. They were even able to provide viable offerings and substitutions for someone in my party who was gluten free (here's looking at you fresh gluten free bread served with their usual mini croissants!) My recommendations? For appetizers, the scallop and kampachi and the tuna tartare are amazing and refreshing to start. I'd go for any of their steak dishes for an entree - the ribeye is especially flavorful - and they all come with delicious frites. And lastly, you cannot leave until you've tried their Martini and caviar potato offering as a cocktail. Long story short, do yourself a favor and treat yourself to the Veronika - if you can get an 8pm reservation when the space seems to really come alive, you won't be disappointed. And don't forget to take advantage of your museum discount as well.

Verōnika is beautiful. Exquisite client orientation. Gorgeous decor. Delectable dishes, all of them. Cocktails - including non-alcoholic - outstanding.

The bathroom is not up to par.  Overflowing trash bin, and lights so dim I winced to think of the bacteria running around (who can really clean a bathroom properly without adequate light), not to mention the likelihood of poor aim, understandably, due to not being able to see the toilet.  

Verōnika, you are beautiful, however, hygiene and sanitation are sacrosanct.  My mother always proffered, "you can tell the standard of a restaurant from the standard of the restrooms."  

Raise your bathroom game, Verōnika.  It really brought me down.

Completely disappointing.
- it took 25mn to sit us down. 15 in which the hostess informed us that the table was ready but never guided us towards it.
- upon seating, it took 20mn to receive a menu. 20mn to order and 20mn to receive some bread for the table.
- the waiter never asked for our meat cuisson.
- one order was wrong.
- it took 30 minutes for all dishes to arrive because the kitchen was overwhelmed.
- we constantly had to ask for a water refill.
- we had to track down multiple waiters to receive one steak knife.
- took 20mn again to receive the check.

Establishments can't charge a minimum of $60 per meal and be this mediocre.

Ambiance: 10/10 - great music, aesthetically pleasing, and dim lit  (only complaint is that it is a little crowded)
Food: 2/10 - for the price, I wouldn't recommend eating here. The burger tasted like it came from a fast food chain and was undercooked.  I'd only come for drinks next time.
Staff: 5/10 - my waitress was very polite, however, I was at lounge seating and got a little tired, so leaned into the sofa and was asked to not do so by a staff member. I can appreciate the image they're trying to portray but it didn't need to be told to someone just leaning on a couch.

One of the most beautiful bars! Came here on a night out with a few friends. We showed up earlier than our reservation. and they were able to accommodate us. We were seated in the lounge area. It was a elegant but cozy vibe. Drinks were good and presented beautifully. Would come again!

Without a doubt an immaculate location, but it's the service that's the true spectacle here. Inviting, engaging and swift with the wrist I witnessed a bartender (Mat) go above and beyond the other evening. Tasty bites! (We came for the drinks) cocktails are creative and flavorful, but for me their Silent Night espresso martini cocktail is top tier. You will not have better. And If you get to watch Mat make it at the bar - again, you will not have better.

Tom Colicchio's first Italian restaurant right by Union Square is a great spot. With so much great Italian cuisine in NYC, it's hard to know what's really worth it or not. Vallata is great whether you're a party of 2 or 8! The food is delicious, the staff is very friendly, and the general ambiance/decor is quite lovely. Not stuffy/fancy, but definitely nice!

Service was excellent but the food was inconsistent, surprisingly. Rose wine from Sardinia was a real find, as was the panzanella - both delicious. Arancini were good, the eggplant focaccia was tasty, although the eggplant was applied with a very light hand and did not affect the flavor really. The shocker was that none of the pasta was al dente, and the risotto was nearly inedible with a gruel-like consistency and no flavor. I couldn't figure out what it reminded me of and the next day I realized - it was like it was made with Minute Rice. The paccheri with fennel sausage, leeks and rabe was the best dish of the table, as was the spaghetti with lemon and basil.

Dessert was a chocolate caramel pannacotta and that was excellent. Server and manager (I think) apologized for the risotto, offered to replace it - but not sure why we would try it again given what was sent out to start with. It was removed from the bill, which we appreciated. But the meal was not at the level we expected from a restaurant in the Craft group.

Vallata has always been a solid choice with terrific food.  Tonight was a mixed bag.  It did not start well.  We got to our table, got menus and water. We hadn't been there more than 3 minutes when a server came over, Introduced herself and said " I want to remind you this is an Italian restaurant.  Now, what do you want to drink?"  We hadn't decided yet so we asked , very politely, if we could have a few minutes.  She disappeared and never came back.  A server we knew from Craft came over after about five more minutes and took care of us.  He was golden.
The good: the ramp focaccia, the chickpea salad and the fava salad.  More than good, great ( although the menu needs to be clearer about the focaccia. We thought there were four different types. No, it's one type with three additions on the side available. You could wind up spending 11 bucks for two squares of the stuff).
Then , the bad and the truly awful. The bad: spaghetti with ramps had so much acid in it that it was inedible. The risotto?  Oh dear: Chef ColiccIho excoriates Top Chef contestants for cooking bad risotto.  He needs to get home.  We got served " cream of rice' with so much tarragon ( whose idea was that)? it was inedible. I'm serious when I write that the risotto might have been the worst dish I've ever had in a restaurant.  Now, our server saw our unfinished plates and asked. He WAS very concerned. We didn't want an issue so we told him we weren't very hungry. Then I did tell him the risotto was a disaster.  He tried to fix it.  He told us his manager told him to serve more wine, and to take the risotto off the bill. Good recovery, but where WAS the manager, and why did this happen anyway?
A real shame.  we love Vallata.  Do better!

Another Tom Colicchio establishment and it did not disappointment. We came here with kids for weekend brunch, it's $45 for two cocktails and two courses, an amazing deal on the city right now when anywhere reputable cocktail would start at $20.
​
They were able to make some delicious kids pastas, one in pomodoro sauce, one in butter sauce. Our kids devoured their pastas, and I personally thought it was yummy enough to be adult pasta. Our two entree pasta dishes were very well cooked, flavor was great, but I personally wish it were a little more al dente.
​
Service was attentive and warm. Decor is beautiful. Bathroom is spacious and clean. This is a slam dunk for lunch.

02/28/23: This spot has been in my collection and my Seated List.

Cute and cozy Italian restaurant.  Greeted warmly and seated immediately. Plenty of seating available however within about 15 mins it started to be busy. Would recommend reservations.

Our server Stephani was amazing. She was extremely friendly and highly knowledgeable about the menu and gave great recommendations.

Drinks:
I had a cosmo very yummy and strong. My friend had a Spaghetti Western.. very strong and spirit forward.

Appetizers:
Chickpea Salad with squid, shrimp and octopus not a fan of chickpeas but Stephani made it sound so inviting.  Indeed it was, fresh seafood and it had a kick to it. Would have preferred it on mixed greens.
Arancini, basically fried rice balls with a spicy to tomato sauce. Also very yummy.

Mains:
Malfadine with short ribs: yummy, good portion.  Unfortunately it was very salty I tried to get through because it was so good. Couldn't do it I had them redo and it great.

My friend had the steak..it was a bit on the rare side we sent it back and it came back how she liked it. One negative just having a steak with no sides and when asked for sides it was an additional cost.

Dessert
We shared a scoop of homemade passionfruit gelato.. deliciousness.

All in all enjoyable dinner.

I usually avoid celebrity chef restaurants at all costs but i was lured in on a random Monday night by their summer restaurant week menu. I had the marinated tuna filet as an appetizer, the paccheri with broccoli Rabe and sausage  as an entree, and a delicious, light-as-air ricotta cheesecake for dessert. The verdict? I enjoyed every bite! This small, intimate restaurant is romantic and cozy. It also has some of THE ABSOLUTE BEST homemade pasta I've ever had. Tender yet still al dente, the tiniest bit chewy, and slippery and silky, not the least gummy. I have raved about this place to everyone I know. I hope it becomes a Manhattan mainstay for many years to come.

My wife and I are big fans of Top Chef so we were really looking forward to dining at Tom Colicchio's Italian restaurant in Gramercy. We dined here with my daughter for Brunch on a Saturday just before Christmas and had a great experience! The restaurant is small and beautifully decorated. The service was excellent...attentive, and we weren't rushed at all.

From our drinks to kick the meal off (the Bloody V was great), to the focaccia appetizer, to the entrees, all 3 of us loved the experience. Our entrée's included Lumache Bolognese, Fried Egg, Pancetta and Fontina on Ciabatta, and Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. I had the lumache and thought it was fantastic, the bolognese was so good! I also had a taste of my wife's pancakes and thought they had a fantastic lemon flavor.

If you're in the area, looking for a great meal, give Valatta a try! We didn't meet him, but our server said Tom is frequently there, so maybe you'll meet him!

I am a huge Tom Colicchio and Top Chef fan.  I've also been craving cacio e pepe, so it seemed like a perfect opportunity to try Vallata on a recent getaway to NYC.  

The Mr. and I  had a reservation and even though we arrived early, we were  graciously seated by the hostess.  Since it was before 6:00 p.m. we were able to take advantage of the pasta  + house wine special for $29.00.  We both chose the Bucatini Cacio e Pepe for our pasta choice, he had the red and I the white wine, and a  shared order of the Veal and Ricotta Meatballs with tomato and grilled bread.  

There really is nothing simpler than cacio e pepe and in this case the sauce to pasta to pepper ratio, was perfect.   This was exactly what I wanted and my craving was satisfied.  

There were three delicious meatballs that were as big as the palm of my hand.  I was trying to save room for dessert so wasn't quite able to finish one.  My loss equaled the Mr's gain, and he happily finished the other two + the rest of mine.  The grilled bread was the perfect accompaniment to the tomato sauce at the bottom of the serving plate.  

Dessert was the ricotta cheesecake with candied orange and it was creamy, light and flavorful.  

We appreciated the great service, open kitchen, cozy ambiance, and delicious food.  If we lived in NYC we'd definitely be regulars.

Came to try during lunch hour since now they open Wed to Fri for lunch. It was a bit slow since there was only one waiter servicing.

Simple and cozy.

:::Appetizer:
Salad with Anchovy - a bit heavier on dressing but till tasty.
Arancini - yum
White Bean Soup - quite straightforward flavor, I enjoyed it but would be more fun with some other ingredients.

:::Entree:
Campanelle Pasta with Brussel Sprouts and Cranberry Beans - pretty good
Ricotta Cavatelli with Short Rib - pretty good
Hanger Steak Rare - a bit more cooked then rare but exactly what I'm looking for. A basic hanger Steak cut though.

Overall pleasant lunch.

The service was perfect--professional, friendly, attentive. The food was a mix--my fellow diners loved the cod and chicken dishes, and apparently the vegan bolognese was amazing. My dish, the campanelle with brussels, pancetta, and sage, was over salted, had a watery sauce, and was just not balanced (too much chewy pancetta and not enough Brussels). Execution needs some supervision. The place is quiet enough for conversation and rustic--very pleasant.

I went here on a thursday night during restaurant week.

First of all, I really like the casual setting with the open kitchen but it makes it a little confusing when you look at the price point. The bruschetta with marinated tomatoes was my favorite thing. YAY TOMATO SEASON AND CREAMY WHIPPED RICOTTA. The cacio e pepe was delicious and simple but a little to rich and fatty for my personal liking. The bread was a little bit too crunchy (aka burnt).

The service was great but kind of weird. One of the bartenders kept saying happy birthday and they even wrote it on the dessert but it wasn't our birthday.

I guess I was expecting a little more from a Tom Collichio restaurant. Nothing was terrible but you can find equally as good Italian food for a lower price point in NYC. I am still glad I tried it just wished there was a little more oomph. All i know is I NEED to learn how to make whipped ricotta.

Best Cacio E Pepe so far in town.
Food was really good and drinks also made their points.
I liked that was easy to get a reservation during the same day.

Price: $50 (tip included)

****Tables are close together, Small menu/portions, Good service***

I didn't find this restaurant very memorable with their menu selections. Food is decently priced but the portions are fairly small. When the restaurant was full it was fairly loud and I had an issue with how close the tables all were. Our waiter was really nice and checked on us frequently which I appreciated.

This place is totally a wast of time. 1/10 overall

Logistics 0/10 We had a 7:30pm reservation and wasn't seated till 8:30pm. The entry way is extremely small. When the restaurant is overly booked, the entry way is packed with angry and hungry customers. It was at least 15 customers who were in the same situation as us. They will keep telling you it will be only 20 more minutes. Eventually at 8:30pm we were seated at the bar, now even a table.

Food 1/10 the pasta is very small portion with interesting fusion. My pasta might have some fruits (maybe blue berries). Portion is way too small.

Bar staff 10/10 Christian at bar was amazing. He's the only highlight of this restaurant. He knew that all of his customers who got sent to him were hungry and angry and was able to calm and cheer up all of us.

Oval - avoid it at all cost. Usually "fancy" celebrity restaurant, always a let-down.

I went to Vallata for a private even  and the food was AMAZING .The service was good to I was offered many type of foods and the lighting wasn't
to bright ,it was warm and I liked it

IG: @mrtravelfoodie

I was told that this was a restaurant opened by the great @tomcolicchio from @topchefm6. When my friend came to town, we found a reservation and quickly came to check it out.

From the outside, I didn't think too much of the place. It seemed pretty, had great design and looked like many other restaurants of this style. However, once I entered inside, I loved the art on the wall, the intimate dining space and the open kitchen in the back! By now, you know I'm a sucker when it comes to open kitchens.

What we ordered:
- Bucatini Cacio E Pepe
- Paccheri w/ Guanciale, Leeks, and Rapini
- Lumache w/ Bolognese and Thyme

Let's talk about the Cacio E Pepe... It might look so simple, but my friend said this was the best Cacio e Pepe he's ever had. The texture of the noodles, the flavor of the sauce, the balance of spice, noodle, sauce, savory, and all the elements that come to create this dish made it amazing. I didn't think I would actually enjoy that dish but it was incredibly delicious for such a "simple" dish. Next, the Paccheri was like an explosion of flavors. I don't know how to describe all of it other than I want more. Every bite was just flavor packed, and the ingredients balanced so well to create a very complete pasta dish. Finally, I got the Lumache and this hit me hard when I took that first bite. Initial reaction was am I going to like this? Shortly after, I went into this dish is freaking amazing! The pasta was very Al dents and chewy, so not what I expected, but the bolognese and thyme were so good! This dish is definitely for the meat lover as it had meat flavor with every single bite and after I finished that last bit of pasta, I was left wanting more.

Overall, I was incredibly surprised at how well these dishes were crafted. The flavor profile hit every mark that I could ask for in a great pasta dish and the service was also amazing. Highly recommend adding this to your list!

Rating: 8.9

So sub par. There's so many Italian restaurants I wouldn't come here. They have a good deal of pasta with a glass of wine for $29, which is the one plus. Unfortunately the wine tastes awful (I got the white). I'm no wine snob, but I really didn't like it. The portions are normal for Italian restaurants. I got the cacio e pepe, and it wasn't super flavorful. Pretty bland. The service also was not great... it felt very chaotic inside with lots of people running around yet hard to get our waiter's attention.

This place is good, not great. And, with so many excellent Italian restaurants in NYC, it might not be my first choice in the future. We had the white bean soup, which was pretty good, and the lobster pasta and pasta with Brussels sprouts. Mine (the latter) was something I could've made at home for half the price that would've tasted about the same.

Good service though!

Restaurant week deliciousness! Amazing service! Sat at the bar and Christian was attentive, funny and let us enjoy our meal without feeling rushed. The arancini were amazing(just didn't get a pic)  all the apps, entrees and desserts were also to die for. All the staff were also fun!
Loved it and will definitely be back!
The food in this restaurant was outstanding. My family and I also ordered a couple of bottles of wine that also were excellent. Great service

Went here on a whim and it had a very nice ambiance. I got the veal meatballs with grilled bread and the meatballs were quite tender and tasty. While the food was good, I wouldn't say it's anything to write home about. Overall, this restaurant certainly is not bad, however a bit pricy all things considered.
Always sit at the bar - bartender is fun. Food is always consistent and good. Go with my wife and we split a an appetizer, salad and pasta then generally get our own entree.

The food was amazing. Was one of the best meals I ever had. For appetizer you must get the focaccia bread. It was so good I wanted to order another plate.  The service is on point. The wait staff is so nice. The ambiance is perfect for a date night or group setting. If you are in the area definitely check this place out!

As longtime fans of Craft and Tom Colicchio, we were excited to try Vallata. Colicchio's first Italian restaurant started as a pop-up, but thankfully it is now a permanent restaurant. The menu is not huge, which is good because otherwise making selections would be even harder than it is. The food is simply delicious. The focaccia may be the best we have ever eaten. Do not skip it. The service is amazing. The cocktails are inventive as well. As for dessert, I have one word for you  .  .  . BOMBOLONE. Eat, drink and be merry at Vallata. Thank you Chef Colicchio!

My fiancé and I came here because we were huge Top Chef/Tom Colicchio fans. We were delighted to actually see Tom at the counter expediting (maybe cooking?) food - we even took some faraway/creepy/stalkerish photos.

The food can be described as homey Italian. Overall, almost everything was good but nothing really blew our minds. However for the prices (most entrees were sub $30), we were happy to try out a Chef Tom restaurant (and have an opportunity to see him!) without blowing the bank.

- Veal tongue - my favorite dish! It was so tender and rich in flavor. They were very generous with the slices too so it made for a hearty appetizer. The salsa verde on top also brought a bright, acidic pop to the dish and I found myself liking it more and more with each bite.
- Meatballs were also really good - it was so savory and tender! The sauce also made each bite so succulent and juicy - one of our other favorites of the night.
- Radicchio salad was very fresh and herbalicious - I like the little orange slices and the light citrus and olive oil dressing. Overall I enjoyed it - but would I order this salad again? Probably not.
- Cavatelli - probably the most disappointing dish I've eaten in a while. The pasta was almost a little too al dente. It was supposed to be an oxtail cavatelli yet there was almost no oxtail in it other than small ribbons in the sauce. My protein-loving fiance was very disappointed with the lack of protein in this dish ("if I wanted a vegetarian pasta, I would have gone with the cacio e pepe"). I was also not a fan of the giant rosemary that's kind of floating in the middle of the dish (rosemary: good for flavoring but not for chewing or eating).
- Braised chicken - it's almost like Mexican shredded chicken. The sauce is a bit subdued after eating the vibrant sauce of the meatballs. The dish was tender and juicy but missing a certain wow factor. My fiance loved it because there was (1) a lot of chicken and (2) the price was only $25 for a protein entree.
- Olive oil cake was a simple dessert but it was a good combo with the tart strawberries and sweet whipped cream - satisfying end to the dinner.

This passion project of TOP CHEF judge Tom Collichio, located one door east of his flagship Craft, gets and deserves my best rating and is one of the best values I've ever found.
Named for his family's ancestral village in the mountains east of Naples, Vallata features simple regional fare, beautifully prepared.
I went twice this past week, once alone, once with a date. Both times I was ably guided by Olympia, who was charming and very informative about the menu. A hallmark of Tom Collichio's restaurants is the exceptional caliber of his staff, in my opinion the best trained, most professional and invested in the industry.  William, who bartended that first night, was equally helpful and informative. At their suggestion I had the simple cacio e Pepe and the veal meatballs, both excellent.  (And both a total bargain at $21/each) Tom, who cooked that night in the open kitchen, came over and had a brief but thoughtful conversation with me, clinked his wine glass and exited for the evening.
3 nights later I brought someone to share the experience.  We shared an outstanding chick pea, calamari, shrimp and octopus salad, and had the skirt steak and braised pork shoulder entrees, both delicious.  
Every day one can order any pasta dish and a glass of wine for $29.  This is a handsome dining room, top notch service, wonderful food and bargain pricing. Go

Quite an average meal. Not what you expect from a Tom Colicchio establishment. Service was average -  we went during restaurant week and ordered off the prefix menu (go with carte blanche option). the waiter recommended we order family style and recommended food items for us, I though it was funny that his recommendations included two of ever menu item that was a surplus - might be coincidental but yoh could tell the waiter was clearly trying to jack up the bill throughout the meal.

Food with not worth the price- pastas were overcooked/saggy, sausage order seemed to be boiled and didnt have a crisp bite thay youd want from italian sausage. If youre looking to dine in Flatiron plenty of better options

I really wanted to love this place but it was lackluster and mediocre. The staff however were friendly and hardworking.

Atmosphere- it's a small elongated space, but was neither cosy nor bustling. There was really no atmosphere. It was like eating in a room. Maybe better music/ lighting might help.

Staff- excellent, attentive and very friendly.

Food- was average. The bruschetta was tasty but not amazing. The cacio e Pepe was good but not great. The affogato was banal.

Drinks- the chasing spring cocktail was very good and refreshing.

Overall we had a good time but nothing special or noteworthy. We will remember the great staff more than anything else.
Delicious food. Atmosphere is quiet, good for a calm evening with good food. Oxtail ragu was my favorite.

My fiancé and I went to Vallata for our first time last weekend and WOW!!!!!!! We had SUCH. A great experience!! I'm an atmosphere kind of girl and this place was aDORABLE. It felt romantic and intimate and just good vibes. We were sat in the corner and so we got to watch the whole restaurant in its groove! Christian was our waiter and was amazing. He was SO MUCH FRIGGIN FUN and hilarious. And honestly, Andrew and I did not know what to get so we let Christian order for us: we were not disappointed. Everything tasted SO amazing. The pasta, the meatballs, the artichoke, pork shoulder, dessert! It was a great way to celebrate Andrews bday!!! Christian our waiter kept us laughing all night and was so attentive. Literally, we dropped a napkin and had a new one in seconds. I can't rate this place highly enough. We can't wait to go back!!
Excellent. Came here to grab a drink the bartender Christian was excellent made great us great drinks. Good vibes and true mixologist and def recommend this place.
Great ambiance, delicious food and great staff! I highly recommend this restaurant. Went there for restaurant so got a good sense of their food. Everything was delicious!

I mean, come on. It's Tom Colicchio's restaurant. There's no way it could even be mediocre. It was outstanding of course. The decor lacks a little warmth, especially being right next to Craft, but I'm looking for good food, not interior design help. I love that there's an open kitchen in the restaurant. Staff was awesome. The food was a mix of different and traditional, and I loved every bit of it.

Spectacular experience. The ambiance. The service. The food! All top notch. One of my favorite meals in NYC. Adriana and Olympia  made us feel so at home. Friendly, efficient, exemplary. It was my friend's birthday dinner, and I couldn't have chosen a better place. Congrats Tom Colicchio! I'll be back.

This food here is hit and miss.  The prosciutto (Lady Edison ham, nectarines and grilled sourdough) dish was outstanding, as were the veal meatballs with ricotta with and tomato.  The halibut, rice ball (amatriciana arancini), and bumboloni were ordinary. The rice ball could have used some cheese inside and more sauce.  The wine list was pricy with most bottles over $100 and no good, less expensive wines to be found.

Absolutely incredible service! I can not recommend
this place enough!!! The staff always goes above and
beyond to make every guest feel special. This is one
of the few restaurant establishments where my
trans, and gender non-conforming siblings feel safe,
empowered and respected! This is a huge reason
why we will continue to return to support the
wonderful food and ambience of the restaurant!
Thank you for always greeting my trans sibling with love, respect and class. This was my second time dinning at Vallata! Not only is the cacio e Pepe the best pasta in the city, but we will always return for the incredible service! The staff always goes above and beyond to make every guest feel special.
My wife and I had the pasta with a glass of wine for $29.  The choice of pasta was poor.  The portions were extremely small and both our pastas were bland.  It was a total rip off.

You can tell that Vallata is still struggling to come together although the right ingredients (pun intended) are there.  My first visit was all in all a pleasant experience but, because expectations are high when you're dining at a Tom Colicchio restaurant, I did walk away somewhat disappointed.

I arrived at around 6:30pm for a weekday dinner, which is generally prime dinner hour, but after being seated had to wait more than 15 minutes for a server who ultimately never came to serve me.  I was served the entire night by bussers, who are perfectly lovely, but couldn't speak to the wine or describe the dishes which may be the reason why I ordered a dish that was a miss: the chickpeas, octopus, squid, and shrimp salad.  The chickpeas were simply a bit undercooked, the seafood a bit overcooked, and the entire dish generally a bit under-seasoned.  When you're cooking in a minimalist way and relying on the freshness of the ingredients to make a great dish, you really have to get the cooking right otherwise it ends up reminding you of something you can make at home (which was on my mind as I chased chickpeas around my plate).  I'm no expert in cooking chickpeas, but understand that there is a proper way to cook them so that flavor penetrates its hard, sizable surface area, and that didn't happen that night.  The seafood was in contrast bit mushy.  And, generally, the whole dish was texturally strange, unwieldy, and fell flat.    

That said, the "regional" wine (which, again, the busser couldn't speak to where it came from and didn't know to show me the label even though I was clearly curious) offered as part of the $29 dinner deal (which includes a glass of wine and pasta) was surprisingly good given the price point.  That said, again, because bussers aren't as well-versed in good service, I got the bottom of the bottle (where tannins reside) and a pretty stingy pour because they didn't know/think to open up another bottle to top off my glass.  It wasn't overly jammy and was a good companion for whatever you pair it with, which I did with the ricotta cavatelli with guanciale, leeks, and raisins.  And, that was the dish that pretty much saved the experience because I was pretty irritated at that point.  The ricotta cavatelli were cooked just right and, instead of the indulgent but somewhat unctuous way that many Italian chefs use guanciale, here it was also cooked perfectly and delicately combined with bright, not sickly sweet, raisins and something earthier, perhaps cocoa.  This dish was a nice balance between contrasts and reminded me of the elements that make a great mole.

I'm not sure if I'll be back yet, and certainly not until they have a few more weeks/months to pull together their service and improve on it.  I could tell that there were many trainees in the restaurant so it should just be a matter of time for a restaurateur like Colicchio but, until then, Italian cooking is very competitive in NYC.

Excellent. The food is comfort food cozy and immaculately executed. Cacio and Pepper bucatini were perfect. Pork shoulder in milk broth made me like pork - not a fan usually. The broth was divine. Surprised this place is not mobbed.

although the food was absolutely scrumptious and cooked to perfection, i have to rave about the service. as a gender non-conforming person, the staff was so friendly and made me feel very comfortable. i will always recommend this place! thank you vallata!

Good Italian food, nice setting, and wonderful service. Cacio e Pepe and cavatelli with braised oxtail and raisins were standouts. Cod was underwhelming, and particularly disappointing since it was only ordered because there was no  flank steak.

Talk about DISAPPOINTMENT... Reservations were made for 9:15 pm, but we didn't get seated until 40 minutes later!!!
- Front of house staff was kind and attentive. Apologizing and making it known they were on it, so no big deal. I understood enough; shit happens.
- Menu was simple enough and exciting to my mental palate; after all,  I'd been to other Tom Collichio restaurants like Riverpark (excellent all the way around), so I had good expectations.
- Ordered:
Cacio e Pepe
Paccheri with Guanciale and Peas
Veal and Ricotta Meatballs w/Tomato sauce
Foccacia.
So let me be very clear, flavors were on point, BUT both pasta dishes were quite undercooked!! Under al dente by at least 2-3 minutes!! WTF!!! Amateur night!
When asked by the barman (who, BTW, was silly and unprofessional but nice), he offered to remake. However, at that point, we were too famished to wait another 20 minutes, so we ate the stiff pasta.
Meatballs - Delicious and on point.
Foccacia - umm... Toasted? It's my understanding Foccacia should not be toasted. It's usually soft and yummy with EVOO to be left alone.
Bottle of Crafted Bubbles (cava) - Very good and reasonably priced.
- Lastly, as the 2 chefs/cooks s had exited the kitchen, the barman only had one dessert to offer: Bombelone... not bad but not great.

RATINGS -
Front-of-house staff: 4.5
Barman: 2.5
Food: 2
Dessert: 2.5
Drinks: 5
Overall experience: 2.5
Final note - what with all the waiting and undercooked pasta, we remained gracious and friendly, and the GM thanked us for being so. However, not one item was taken off the bill. I also mentioned to a staff person that it seemed the kitchen was so backed up that they seemed to be pushing the food out and lost their QC... They agreed!! "Yes, in fact, I'm sure that's what's going on," they said.
One would think at that point, you sort of mention to GM and perhaps handle or undo the disappointing dining experience and make it "right." Right? NOPE.

In a word, AMAZING! Not surprised as we expect nothing less from a Tom Colicchio restaurant. The food was fantastic from start to finish from the sinfully delicious potato focaccia, to the ribollita (beans, root vegetable, kale), veal/ricotta meatballs, skirt steak, and cannoli bombolone. The nonino and negroni cocktails were also wonderful. The space is elegant and comfortable, and the staff is peerless, from the manager, John, to the lovely woman who served us---did not get her name-to the glorious Chef Amanda! The restaurant will start serving lunch on March 7th, and Tom will be there for that week. We have already booked our reservation for then. This is not only a neighborhood gem; it is a precious gift to our beloved New York!
Loved our meal here. The pasta was fantastic and incredibly original, especially the spaghetti aglio e olio. So fresh and delicious. Great waitstaff too.

A few of my colleagues and I booked dinner reservations at Craft earlier this week, and when I heard that Tom Colicchio would be cooking at Vallata just next door, I jumped at the opportunity to see him behind the counter and watch him cook firsthand. We ordered a variety of dishes to taste, but the asparagus, braised tongue, and hanger steaks were the stand outs of the night. I've never had asparagus prepared in this fashion before and would gladly come back for this dish alone. The tongue was so soft and flavorful that I wouldn't even bat an eye if you told me it was pâte. The hanger steak was also another winner. Since I'm a meat and potatoes girl myself, I generally opt for steak when given the choice, and it was prepared to a perfect medium rare. The braised onions paired with the steak had a nice bite that cut right through the richness. We also ordered cocktails and desserts that didn't disappoint either. Overall, the menu was well thought out and so expertly prepared that we didn't have a single bad bite.

The staff was also super accommodating with all my last-minute requests. I'll admit I'm a bit of a superfan who's watched every episode of Top Chef, and they even relayed the message to the Tom. He was so kind to come over and greet the table along with allowing me a picture. Tom was even nicer in person than I could've imagined. Run - don't walk - to Vallata and Craft.

I loved the ambiance of this place, especially the big open kitchen (where Tom Collichio himself was hard at work!)  The veggie-forward appetizers were probably the highlight of the dinner. The lamb sausage and pastas were also good, though kept simple. Our service was just OK (it took about 15 minutes for anyone to come take our drink order), but given that it's a brand new restaurant, I'll chalk it up to that.

Vallata was such a nice experience! I brought a friend here for her birthday on Friday night and I must have mentioned it when I made the Resy reservation and they printed her name on the menu and had complimentary glasses of champagne waiting for us! It was such a treat. We had the artichokes, the pesto pasta and the cod which were all delicious!! The Focaccia looked amazing too.. would definitely order that next time! At the end of the meal, the bartender suggested a Bambolino dessert which they brought out with a candle and Happy Birthday written in chocolate. It couldn't have been a better experience if I had planned it myself! Great service, great food and ambiance.

My husband and I and another couple finally had the opportunity to dine at Vallata last evening. We were looking forward to it, being huge fans of Tom Colicchio. And we were not in any way disappointed! The service was excellent, and the food outstanding. We each had a different appetizer and entrée, and shared a dessert--every single dish was excellent and rave-worthy. We can't wait to go back.

Vallata was pitch perfect. The service by Christian was over the top. We sat at the counter and started with a cocktail followed by a raw artichoke and kale salad. Both were amazing. Then it was cod with garlic and tomato and a hangar steak with cippoline onions and scallions. All were cooked to perfection. The Italian red wine blend recommended by Christian was a perfect compliment. We will definitely be returning for the food, service, overall vibe, lighting and music.

Can't express how excited we were to eat at a Chef Colicchio pop up where he would be physically in the kitchen. Unfortunately, it ended up to be disappointing. While Chef Tom left 10 min after we sat down, our Negroni cocktails then arrived unshaken and warm with way too much Cointreau, followed by food that was under seasoned. The spaghetti was fine, but needed salt and you could barely taste any Bottarga, if at all. The cacio a Pepe was also needed salt (hard to do with that dish). Ironically, far better pasta can be had at Top Chef alum restaurant LaRina, in Brooklyn. Honestly, the best part of the meal was the salad & the focaccia. Just wanted that meal/experience to be so much better than it was. Oh well.

I love this place. First time here and I was amazed by the quality and taste of their steaks ! We had the porterhouse to share and ribeye and it was all
Cooked perfectly per request ! Also has the corn , truffle Mac and cheese:)

The sauces are dope and enhanced every bite. We had a bottle of the red wine (Brunello del Montacino) delicious and brought the vibes !

The servers were super attentive and brought extra good spirits ! Loved the vinyl theme and the Music!!!! Loved hearing Nas on wax!!

This place is so f'ing cool. Such a sleeper in the making.

It's, admittedly, in a little bit of a weird spot, but don't let its downtown location fool you - it's a top notch steakhouse by every measurable standard. It's just in the artsy downtown part of NYC, which means it comes without the stuffiness of a midtown place. The quality of the food, the ambiance, the service, were not lost in translation - and they spin the classics on vinyl.  No prepackaged playlists or radio stations.

We had dinner at the bar because the place was a little busy. Even the bartender (Steven?) seemed to be trained at a five star level. EVERYTHING WAS JUST RIGHT. At every turn.

PS - the potato pave (potato lasagne) side sounds so strange, but it was so decadent. Who knew you could do that with a potato?!?

Just awesome, awesome all around. We had the best experience at Vinyl from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. Every person we had encounters with, the music, the decor, the wine list, the vibe and of course, the food. All just so, so great.

It's not always easy to dine with a 17-month-old toddler and our experience dining with her at Vinyl was one of the best we've had. The staff was so welcoming to our little girl and was accommodating to everything we needed. We'll definitely return and it's nice to know we can go for a date, or a family meal!

My boyfriend and I have a list of places we want to go for date nights and we finally got around to trying Vinyl Steakhouse and it did not disappoint.

The ambiance is super retro, the service is on point and the food was delicious.

I am a huge vinyl lover and was excited when I learned about this restaurant, as you enter you are hit in the face with vintage artist posters; everyone from Billie Holiday, to Andy Warhol, on the adjacent wall is a ton of vinyl albums which you can make a request for one to be played.

When we arrived at the restaurant we were sat immediately and greeted by our server. I cannot say enough about how great the service is at Vinyl! The drinks and food arrived in a timely fashion and at the end of our meal the waitress brought the table complimentary glasses of champagne.

The food is out of this world and here is what we had:

- Truffle Mac N Cheese (This Mac N Cheese will blow your mind)
- Crispy Sushi (the spicy mayo was so good!)
- Warmed Ricotta (Omg!! I can't stop thinking about this dish and the grapes)
- Hen of The Woods Mushrooms (I am pescatarian and loved everything about my main course! The truffled vegetable were fantastic!)
- Salmon (our friend who joined us had the salmon and said that it was cooked to perfection)
- Burger (my boyfriend said that the burger was incredible and hit the spot)

As far as cocktails go, I am a martini drinker and would highly recommend the 'Vinyl Martini' it was such a unique take on the dirty martini.

Although Vinyl is a steakhouse they have a lot to offer any dietary restrictions.

I would highly recommend anyone to give Vinyl Restaurant a try and I am looking forward to my next visit in the near future.

Thanks for a great night out!

Excellent NYC steakhouse!
Service was great, locally owned and operated. We started with the Caesar salad, and crunchy shrimp sushi then had the Cajun rubbed ribeye, truffled Mac and cheese, and asparagus ... all of it was made to perfection. Wine menu was carefully picked and top notch.

I have to say this was one of my best steakhouse experiences in years . The service , ambience , and food was absolutely exceptional . I would rate this restaurant as one of my top steakhouses ever. . Definitely check them out if you're in the area , hands down one to visit !

Definitely recommend We had an excellent dinner at Vinyl Steakhouse after a long day of exploring.  The atmosphere was inviting. sexy and upbeat and the tunes were great!  Our bartender, Alan, gave great suggestions and made sure that we had everything we needed including a celebratory dessert :). We had the crispy sushi, the scallop dish with charred broccolini, the Cajun ribeye and fries along with cocktails and a banana split!

If I can add an extra star, I would! This place is great for date night. The ambiance was cool. The food was absolutely delicious! My date was very happy and full!  The Cajun rubbed ribeye steak was cooked perfectly. The drinks were delicious. The service was great! I will definitely come back!

Vinyl is a great, more casual steakhouse! Quality is on par with your more traditional NYC steakhouse but has a much more relaxed vibe.

The drinks, service, food and of course, music are all great. The steaks are cooked to perfection, most importantly.

I'd highly recommend Vinyl for any occasion that warrants a good steak.

Great ambiance with plenty of vinyl records. Been wanting to try this spot. Ordered the crispy rice, potatoes mac and cheeze and porterhouse. The crispy rice was a fantastic app with a nice crisp and chewy interior.

The porterhouse was cooked to perfection and was very tender and paired well with the bone marrow butter.

The sides did come out a bit cold, and i'm assuming it was kind of left out and the service was a bit off but overall it was great.

We came here on Valentine's Day and it was DOPE. The food was delicious, every single dish. See my pictures.
The owner came by to chat and talk about the concept and my wonderful husband who knows about vinyls and music taught me a lot that night over a great meal (thank you hunny!)

& Thank you Vinyl Steakhouse!!!!

Great steakhouse in NYC smack in the middle of flatiron. Interior with old records etc created a unique atmosphere. Steaks and sides were delicious. Icing on the cake was a friendly group of waiters etc.

Dining at Vinyl Steakhouse was a lovely experience. Starting from the hostess who greeted myself and my friend creating such an inviting experience right from the door. Once seated, Denise our waitress provided great drink and for recommendations. Denise was very attentive making sure everything was to our liking which I greatly appreciated. To start, my friend and I ordered the Maryland inspired crab cake which was amazing. One of the best crabs cakes I've had in awhile. I also ordered the kale salad which was very filling and had a great dressing. Our entrees included the 10 oz Filet Mignon and Scallops with the sides of asparagus and shoestring fries. The steak was cooked to perfection and very flavorful/juicy.
The scallops were delicious and I enjoyed the cauliflower purée.

The restaurant played great music. I couldn't stop dancing in my seat. It was great to see the owner, Kevin, touch every table including mine to ensure that folks were having a great dining experience. I will be back soon and have already told my friends/family about how great vinyl steakhouse is.

Amazing food, great service, and lovely ambience! My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and this place was the perfect spot. Cocktails were spot on. The wonton appetizers were delicious. The steak cut like butter. Our server, Julia was awesome. We met the owner, such a nice guy! We will certainly come back! I love when delicious food and top notch service meet each other in a great setting. Highly recommend.

For some reason, I thought given the name, this Flatiron restaurant would look like a retro Tower Records store from my youth when I bought 33-1/3 rpm LPs by the armful. Instead there were concert posters and framed blow-up photos of Blondie and the Beastie Boys on the walls, but most importantly, there was the owner's record collection which they said numbered over two thousand.

Their gimmick was that they provide a leather-bound catalog listing all the album titles by artist (photo: bit.ly/3Tnu1cu). Since Jamie W. and I were the evening's first diners, we got to choose the first album. I went with "Aretha's Greatest Hits". R-E-S-P-E-C-T. Find out what it means to me. R-E-S-P-E-C-T. Take care, T-C-B. It definitely put us in the right mood for a casual fine dining experience.

Familiar favorites on the speakers matched the vibe of the place and the approach in the traditional American menu. We started with cocktails first, of course. Jamie went with the $18 Magickal Childe, which they described rather mysteriously as "If you know, you know". It had Empress Gin, Cointreau, and lemon juice with a brown sugar rim on a martini glass. A bit on the sweet side for me.

I ordered the more familiar $18 Rose Negroni with Bombay Sapphire, Bombay Bramble, Luxardo Bitter, and Martini Rubino. Quite satisfying with a kick (photo: bit.ly/3MMSYvH). For our appetizers, Jamie ordered the $19 Vinyl Chopped Salad, a robust plate of romaine, iceberg, hard-boiled egg halves, cubes of fresh mozzarella, smoked bacon, prosciutto, and tomato slices drizzled with a sweet vinaigrette (photo: bit.ly/3zmPfj1).

Good, straightforward plate suitable at a high-end deli. I went with the $17 Classic Caesar which was true to its name with big romaine hearts, grilled house croutons, shaved parmesan, and grape tomatoes. It was drenched in a Caesar garlic dressing (photo: bit.ly/3VF7jON). Well done though I did miss the fresh anchovies. We were surprised they offered sushi options albeit stylized to suit a steakhouse.

I had my eyes on the $69 Bone-In Ribeye but was told they were out that evening. Instead the bubbly server sold me on the $66 16-oz Cajun Dry Rubbed Ribeye (photo: bit.ly/3VLNPrz). It was prepared to my preference of medium rare, and it was quite tender with a nice char. Jamie was less indulgent and had the $44 Scallops, four of them jumbo-sized accompanied by a cauliflower purée, crispy prosciutto, and roasted cauliflower (photo: bit.ly/3SlGXhJ).

Drizzled with a thick and tantalizing balsamic lemon vinaigrette, it was pretty tasty and surprisingly filling for surf versus turf. We had side dishes as well. The first was the $15 Roasted Butternut Squash with cauliflower and goat cheese (photo: bit.ly/3TnFzMQ). It was very hearty with a nice sweetness. The other was the $15 Roasted Asparagus with basil oil, lemon and shaved parmesan (photo: bit.ly/3TmV7Ar). It was just the right healthier side compared to all the indulgences.

Believe it or not, we ended up sharing dessert rather than each of us getting our own. It turned out to be a smart move as the $15 Upside Diwn Apple Pie was plenty. It featured dried cranberries, Gran Marnier, a cinnamon glaze, and a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream (photo: bit.ly/3CUqStB). The staff was definitely perky and present throughout the evening even as the restaurant started to crowd with larger parties. A fine dinner and get your album requests in early.

FOOD - 4 stars...solid American fare where the key was the execution and less on creativity
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nice vibe for a special occasion with a vintage vinyl collection
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...very enthusiastic and attentive
TOTAL - 4 stars...keep the tunes playing

RELATED - Hungry in NYC? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2YS9ELs

Heard and read good things about this steakhouse. I looked at the menu and decided to have the Chicken Parmesan and the Bone Marrow Corn delivered.

The food arrived in a timely manner. The portions were small for the price point. The Chicken Parmesan was tough, dry and stringy suggesting to me it was overcooked. Overall, it was bland as was the small amount of fettuccine that accompanied it. The Corn was served in a husk. It tasted fine, but it was marred by having to pick out the corn silk which became incorporated into the corn from the husk. The portion was very small.

The concierge at our hotel recommended Vinyl for our family of six.  We actually ended up having 10 people (mostly kids) and the restaurant was very accommodating.  The experience was great.  The adults had fun DJ-ing with their extensive record collection, we drank some amazing wines, and the kids fought over who got to gnaw all the meat off the T-bone steak - ha.  One of the kids ended up accidentally leaving behind a toy, and the owner, Kevin, tracked it down for us and offered to mail it back to CA.  Service is above and beyond!  We so appreciate it.  Great spot.
Outstanding ambience. Even better steak. Even better service. A vinyl lounge and one if the city's best steak houses executed perfectly.

Incredible experience.  Very unique steakhouse that pairs vinyl music with wine and food.  Kyle, our server, and Kevin, the owner, were both incredible people who pay close attention to detail and make the dining experience second to none.  This is by far one of the best restaurants I've been too in the United States and a top 5 steakhouse.  I highly recommend going if you are in New York City!  Ask for a wine to be paired with a record!

Decent food I suppose but really didn't like the ambiance. The prices were that of an upscale steakhouse but the interior seemed too casual, loud, and crowded. Bonus points for the creativity of some of the dishes (like corn in bone marrow butter) but otherwise wasn't particularly impressed. Sadly won't be returning.

Amazing evening! Perfectly cooked steak, excellent wine pairing, attentive staff and awesome vibe. The classic vinyls that played during the evening allowed for a fun evening with incredible, upscale food.
Love, love, loved it!

I wish I could give a better review since the staff was extremely friendly and the interior had cool vibes, but the Cowboy Ribeye was hands down the worst cut of meat I've ever been served (backyard bbqs included). It was 75%+ fat and essentially inedible. The 3 bites of actual meat I did get were delicious, which honestly made it that much more frustrating.

The Truffle Mac n' Cheese and Crispy Sushi were also very good. The Creamed Spinach, not so much.

Some advice to management: If you're going to charge $150+/steak, you'd better be 100% sure every plate you serve is a top quality cut.

I really like this place! Perfect date night!
Love their cocktails. Especially, they cooked my steak perfectly, the way I like it! "Medium rare"!!

Stumbled here on a whim. It's certainly not a frugal decision as it was rather pricey, but worth every penny. From the short rib potstickers to the cajun rubbed steaks and the brownie sundae, it was a well rounded experience with excellent service and a lovely ambiance of retro style vinyl records adorning the shelves.

Shades of Legacy Records at this family run Flatiron steakhouse.
Ate:
Caesar salad
Shrimp cocktail
Ribeye
Salmon
Corn in husk with butter marrow
Total: $ 169 before tax
They're amazingly nice here!!!! Gave us lovely champagne for our one year anniversary. Bread service will be rebooted as it should. Music is on point and the steak is cooked perfectly. I really like salmon skin on with salmon  otherwise my boyfriend loved his steak & do not miss that corn side- it's a showstopper. With a bit of menu refinement this could be superstar steak spot.

A contemporary twist on the traditional steakhouse.

You get everything that you would get at a traditional steakhouse and more. The meats are cooked perfectly. The sides are really unique. Must try the crispy sushi. Everything was top notch. We even met with the Owners who are super nice, down to earth people. Everyone, including our waitress, was a Somm which is impressive to say the least. If you want a steak with a cool, relaxed vibe this is the place.

They play vinyl records - classics - mostly classic rock, hence the name.

It was busy for a Wednesday night so I can only imagine it would be busy on the weekend - Id suggest looking into a resi for a weekend spot.

Decided to try Vinyl steakhouse after reading some food reviews.  Made reservations.  When I arrived i was greeted by the maitre de as well as the owner.  They both assured me I would be in for a different steakhouse experience.  Once seated the service was prompt and friendly.  We had the salad wedge.  It was good.  Would have preferred more dressing.  Had the flatiron steak.  Spinach Carbonara and shoe string potatoes.  All excellent.  With a bottle of a nice Brunello.  A key like mousse for dessert. Prices are NYC.   Music was great.  And not a stuffy steakhouse
Great food and service. Menu had some creative appetizers that were a hit with everyone. steak was excellent and perfectly cooked. Will definitely go back again when in the area.

Absolutely outstanding steakhouse. Every item we ordered was delicious and the steaks were some of the best I've ever had. Service was also top notch and very personable. Kevin, the owner, came over to say hello and we had a great conversation with him about the restaurant and how he created such an excellent restaurant. A must reservation when in NY!

Can't say enough great things about the decor, ambiance, service and of course the food.   This is basically a high end steakhouse spinning old school 70s and 80s rock albums.  They even have a catalog you can choose from so the DJ will play your album of choice.

Appetizers:  Crab Cakes (very good), Sliders (Awesome), Warm Cheese (Awesome).

Entree:  Bone-in Sliced Ribeye (Awesome) - pre sliced is a nice touch

Dessert:  Cheesecake (Awesome)

Wine:   Leviathan Cabernet Sauvignon (Very good) and Tout De Suite Pinot Noir (Very Good)

I will definitely be back.  I highly recommend the sliders and rib eye.

Great spot. Excellent service, cool atmosphere and design, constantly running great vinyl on a nice system. I was joking with friends that it's almost too cool of a spot for the neighborhood.

While it isn't quite at the level of the best steakhouses, it's more casual and more reasonably priced. Food is great. Drinks are great.

Go here!

By and large, steakhouses should focus on one, primary goal - deliver a great cut of meat, at temperature, that is flavorful.  The Signature Cajun ribeye was flavorful, but the cut was far too thin and contained more fat than a ribeye should.......at $68. This is a butcher/sourcing issue, the chef is cooking the best that he orders.  To boot, the presentation is lackluster on the plate, which you may see in the photos posted - no fanfare, garnish or proportionately-sized plate for the cut. Same comment for the asparagus side that was ordered; lackluster presentation for $3/spear.  

That side, the atmosphere and energy are great as is the wine & cocktail menu.  

You're almost there, just dial it up a notch with your cuts.  Even if they are more expensive from your purveyor, patrons will pay it if cooked correctly and the cut is worth the value in weight and marbling.

I really love the music vibe of this place plus it's relatively informal but "nice" atmosphere.

Service was outstanding and the food was excellent. The owner is on site and was constantly checking to make sure everything was going well. It really wasn't necessary as his staff was right on point. His attention though was much appreciated and impressive.

The salads and sushi were excellent. The shared porterhouses were outstanding. The spinach side was enhanced by by the egg and pancetta contained within it.

The music made it fun

Such a fun concept, and every dish and cocktail was amazing! Our server Isabella was so sweet! It was our first time dining there last night and she made our experience a great one.

The ricotta appetizer was SO good and I will definitely be craving it later.

Not your momma's steakhouse. This Chelsea spot advertises casual, but it's a cool casual. It's a whole vibe, from staff spinning their or a customer's selected record album, picked from a wall of racked albums...to a friendly, good looking staff trying to ensure the service provided is personal and first rate. These folks are happy to see you, not just your credit card.

We started in the cocktail bar with some of their signature drinks...Manhattan Transfers and martinis were nicely made by Allison, who was as friendly and accommodating as her cocktails were delicious. We had the potato croquettes as an appetizer, which were velvety smooth inside and crunchy outside. They were very good lane but even better with their bleu cheese sauce. Unfortunately, hungry hands were faster than my camera. They are the type of good that you remember the next time you walk in. We were taken to our table and greeted by our server, Elizabeth. Again, lovely and friendly just like Allison. We decided to try the Crispy Rice Sushi as I was looking over the wine list. The wine list has plenty to choose from in the usual varietals. Quality and prices range from good wine/decent price to the stupid good/stupid price, I opted for the very good/hey, it's a restaurant price. One of the two sommeliers and owners, Kevin, was as friendly and helpful as the rest of the Vinyl staff; yes, accommodating and lovely as well...no gender bias here. The were other staff we interacted with that we didn't catch their names, but they also provided service that greatly impacted the evening positively. But, back to the Crispy Rice Sushi...I was too distracted when it hit the table to ward off my companions in time for a photo. I assure you, four peoples were quite happy to have consumed them. We opted to order the Caesar Salad, Spinach Carbonara and the Loaded Potato Pavé as our shared sides. My three beautiful companions all selected the 8 oz Filet Mignons, and I chose the 16 oz Bone-in Ribeye. My companions, historically, only eat 3-4 ounces of their steaks, whether at home or at a restaurant...they each ate at least 3/4s of their steaks tonight, because their filet mignons were so good. If your not familiar with the filet mignon cut, it is generally very lean and tender. Ribeyes, especially bone-in, have more flavorful fat on them. I tasted my wife's Filet Mignon, it was almost fork tender and very tasty. My Ribeye made my mouth very happy, it made me happy...it was absolutely terrific. We ordered the house steak sauce and marrow herb butter for the table, and while they were good, we felt the steaks were so flavorful that the sauces weren't needed or wanted. Nothing extra should be put on those steaks, they're that good. We all enjoyed the Caesar Salad, and the Spinach Carbonara was as well received as it was interesting. The Loaded Potato Pavé was quite good and a definite do-over. Although we were all full, Elizabeth suggested we share their apple dessert of the evening. It was kind of a deconstructed apple pie with dried cranberries. We enjoyed the dessert, but just a note regarding personal preferences and cooked fruit. The apples were fresh, not canned or frozen, and were cooked slightly  al dente. Some folks like their fruit to be softer, others appreciated a little bite and tartness in their apples. To me, it was prepared to my liking.

To sum up this rather lengthy review...this place was vibing; fun, friendly and very good food. There is no reason for you not to try this place out, unless you're a pretentious fop with a stick up your bottom.

Love the concept. Great music, fine dining experience and come as you are. This was a family day and we had walked all over the city. No need to go home and "get ready" for dinner.

Super genuine people who welcomed us and made this a special night.

Amazing will definitely go back! Everything was great. Really liked the wedge salad - walnuts, dressing, croutons all great. The signature cajun ribeye was cooked perfectly medium rare and had phenomenal flavor. Loved the chocolate brownie banana dessert. Nice, fast service and relaxed atmosphere.
Fantastic food and service and ambiance. Will be back to try the warm risotto with grapes and more.

The food is very good, to great (depending on the dish you choose), albeit a bit overpriced for what you get.  The worst thing is the atmosphere and service.  

I was looking forward to the atmosphere with a DJ spinning throwback tunes, but due to the layout & decor, the noise level is so high, you can barely hear the music, unfortunately.  Also since I thought I might be late I pushed out my reservation by 15 minutes, so I was moved from a regular table to a high top. Ordinarily I wouldn't mind a high top, but to maximize covers they seat you at tiny high tops that are not meant for 2 adults, which they have jammed up against the wall, immediately adjacent to the tables next to you.  You don't have the wing room to cut your food without your elbow hitting the wall.

Additionally, they do the annoying chain restaurant move of taking away the big wine glasses and the wine list when you order a cocktail, which is shortsighted as most diners start with a cocktail and then pair their entree with wine.  Of course, the other chain restaurant move they do is when you order wines by the glass, they bring you a small wine glass which doesn't allow the wine to open up.

To add insult to injury the bartenders and other servers periodically do a swoop by your table to grab your cocktail glass, despite them still having a decent sip or three remaining.  I don't know if they think they are smooth or have a desperate glass shortage, but the bartender did it to me and a server did it to my date.  They don't even have the common courtesy to ask if your finished, unlike the busser.  

The bottom line is the food is great, and the cocktails and wine list are both very good, but the place has horrible CX.  This place is the classic example of "the juice ain't worth the squeeze".

Thankfully, we have plenty of other hipster restaurants in Manhattan and Brooklyn with great food, a funky atmosphere, but which provide excellent service in a much more comfortable atmosphere.

Had a dinner here with some friends, and thoroughly enjoyed it.  
The cocktails were excellent - strong and smooth.  I highly recommend the Sazerac.  

The crispy sushi appetizer is a must have.  We also ordered the warm ricotta, but I wasn't a huge fan.  

We all shared the Porterhouse, and it was correctly perfectly medium rare and simply delicious.  

My favorite sides were the loaded potato pave and the truffle mac and cheese.  

To top it off, the servers were all so friendly and helpful.  Can't wait to go back.

I was searching for a place with great service, good food with a casual dress code since I was bringing my elderly parents along; they wanted to try a steakhouse so Vinyl fit my needs...
We arrived earlier than usual for dinner just to be cautious for my parents. Open kitchen in the back, looked very clean. Ordered still water for the table since I do not drink tap. Our glasses were always filled.
For appetizers, I ordered the crab cake and a shrimp cocktail. The crab cake was delicious, should've gotten two. Really fresh.. Shrimp cocktail wasn't worth it, tasty but overpriced for 4 reg sized shrimps.
For entrees, I ordered filet mignon for my mom, ribeye for 2 for L and my father. Ordered scallops, salmon.. sides.. corn, potato pave, and creamed spinach. Filet was very tender. My parents loved it. They were able to lower the sodium in several of the dishes so my mom could try them. That was really nice. Ribeye was good but not as great compared to the filet. I tried a lil of everything. Scallops and salmon, both great options if you want something healthy. The creamed spinach was really delicious. Rich but I could clearly taste the spinach. The corn and potato pave was good but the spinach is the one you definitely need to order.
The food tastes pretty similar to how I cook at home, so for me what I loved was their drink menu. The cocktails are amazing here. I would've easily had a second drink if I wasn't with my parents. Smoke in the rain...expertly made. One of the best drinks I've had. These drinks are strong and so creative. My father and L ordered a few beers but I suggest getting a cocktail.
Service was excellent. Staff are all very friendly. Owner came around to introduce himself. Fantastic restaurant, love their story. Already recommended this place to others and they've been back a few times since the drinks are again...amazing! Great for family dinners or business meetings. I hope they expand their food menu just a bit.

Quite a find! Fairly new-9 months. Near our hotel so we gave it a try. Great menu. Wedge salad was huge and shareable. Our steak was nicely sliced medium rare. Steak sauce choices were nice but ours was butter based and hardened up pretty soon once arriving at our table. A warmer like you get with lobster would have helped. Potato pavé was a nice alternative to a baked potato. Hundreds/thousands? Of vinyl records line walls. Requests are taken and their albums are listed in a leather bound folder. This made it very fun-we requested The Stones, Commodores and Weezer. All we're played. Very enjoyable atmosphere! Not your typical stuffy steak house!

Ate here a couple of weeks ago for my son's birthday. The atmosphere is amazing. You get 5 star service but can come as you are. I think that was the best part, it wasn't a stuffy steakhouse atmosphere by any means. Ordered the Cowboy Ribeye with Cajun seasoning. It was cooked perfect. And the sides were delicious. We love this place. You can even pick from the music menu what songs you would like for them to play on their record player. They had hip hop and R&b selections that was right up our alley. Hopefully it can stay a bit of a hidden gem so we can get a reservation when we come back to NY.

Came here for opening night - great food and services :)

My personal favorite was actually the  cherry turnovers, I was debating if I should get it because I was so full after the scallops, crab cake and the NY strip, but hearing that it was Chef Alex's grandma's recipe - also a dish that inspired him to cook - I had to give it a try.

It's not too sweet (aka highest compliment to desserts you can ask for from an Asian), paired with perfect puffiness/softness texture. It just melts. It has to be the best turnovers I've had. It also was refreshing to my palate because we ordered pretty heavy stuff like crab cake, scallops and NY Strip.

Ok sorry I know this is a steakhouse, and yes everything else is great too - but leave some room for the cherry turnovers in the end!
This was so good. It's a steakhouse and the steak was great BUT THE SCALLOPS were absolutely a reason to go back. The music is jamming, and the service is baller. Go.

Loved it!  The vibe, the theme and the drinks all hit with my mood!  Service was impeccable, food was just as good.  Loved the creativity of the menu, putting some spins on some classics.  When in NYC gotta visit this place for a great experience.  A+
All around great food, wine, service and experience. Definitely would recommend. Servers and owner is very nice

This is my new favorite restaurant in New York. BEST filet I've ever had! I loved everything that came to the table. Tried 4 appetizers and every side and every dessert with a big group. LOVED it all!!! Service is amazing and ambiance is perfect! 100% recommend this restaurant

We were looking for a special occasion steakhouse without the old boy's vibe, Vinyl did not disappoint. From the moment we were greeted by the owner Kevin, we knew we were in good hands. The steak, sides, key lime mousse & bottle of Brunello were all outstanding. Don't wait to make a reservation, word is spreading fast and soon it will be impossible to get a table.

Awesome spot. Great for team events or for bringing family/friends when visiting. Super cool vibes and ambiance. Records and music posters on the walls. Delicious food. Love the Mac and cheese, brussel sprouts, fries, filet mignon, and WARM RICOTTA appetizer. KEY LIME PIE dessert also so good. All so tasty. Love this place
Second time here.  Both times 5 star.  The wine, the boeuf bourguignon, croque monsiier...everything so good.  Both times bartender recommended great wine reccs with food. And it's such a cute place!

This place is my absolute favorite. My fiancé and I live close by and frequently come for foie gras and wine. Their happy hour prices are incredible
So show up before 6 pm if you can! The service is amazing and the vibes are as close to sitting and drinking on the street in Europe as you can get. A house favorite!!

Most generous and tasty cheese plate in the area! Even better than Eatly! Paired with their house red during happy hour, you'll go home happy and satisfied! We sat outside, literally on Broadway! We felt safe and totally relaxed while watching all the people going by.

Our waiter, who also sat us was so nice. He went over the wine menu with us and gave us some great ideas. I'd planned on a wine pairing but he quickly alerted us to the happy hour that was ending soon. Great idea!!!! They have some tasty wines for $10 a glass and they do offer a generous pour.  

I am eager to go back for cheese alone but I also want to try their actual meals!!! This place is legit and serves up some typical French fare in NOMAD!

Vin Sur Vingt sets the stage with a dark candle-lit ambiance with quant understated elegance. They offer a HUGE wine selection with french classic dishes.
