While we also received the broccoli tortellini (which was fairly standard as far as pasta dishes go; you're not missing anything if you don't experience the pasta here), which was another service issue.  When we mentioned that one of our guests ordered the venison, not the tortellini, a debate started about who remembered what who ordered.  I understand from a restaurant perspective that you can't have persnickety guests changing their orders when they determine they don't want/like something once it comes out (which seemed to be the implication here), but sometimes admitting a mistake makes more sense (especially when it is a legitimate mistake).  We ended up receiving a venison order at the end of the meal, and I understand we were charged for both the tortellini and the venison (it was my birthday, so I wasn't paying...). At a bare minimum given the circumstances, just charge for the venison (the more expensive of the two) and the memory of the negative aspects of the experience won't be so strong.

The dessert menu clearly lacks a pastry chef and relies strongly on panna cotta, churros, and chocolate. Regardless, the churros were an easily approachable and casual finish to the dinner.

Villanelle appears to have a reasonably priced tasting menu ($80) that I might opt for next time to avoid any service confusion.  It also may be more cost effective to go that route for both the consumer and restaurant (which makes me wonder why they don't just commit to a tasting menu only/primarily). Ultimately, Villanelle walks that very fine line of being a functional restaurant, but I think makes enough missteps that it could be hard to significantly differentiate itself.  I'm in the area enough I'll almost certainly try it again and I look forward to what changes to my opinion that experience will bring.

Food was really boring.  Server recommended the beet tartare.  It was a stereotypical beets with goat cheese and dill.  Plated in a perfect circle but the dill wasn't cut so when we tried to take a bite a large, long piece of dill would come with it.

On top of that our server was very strange.  When he would come to the table he would only look at my male friend for the order.  The backwaiter told the server we had a question and he immediately looked at my friend closely and asked him what the question was.  Is it possible that a woman could be thinking and have a question to ask?  It's not the 1950s anymore.  Very off putting service.

I've come to Villanelle a few times now since it opened, the first time on a recommendation while looking for somewhere to eat to celebrate a special occasion. Villanelle promises vegetable forward fare and it definitely delivers.

Service is beyond fantastic. Everyone is incredibly helpful, attentive, professional, and friendly. The food itself is delicious. I've had two different versions of the Thai snapper (on different days, both were great!), the crisp octopus, the black bass, brussels sprouts with no cheese, and the beef. Everything was great to the point where it is hard to choose favorites. The octopus is one of the best octopus dishes I've ever tried, and the beef was unbelievably delicious.

And now, the important part: the wine list. The bottle list was amazing and contained some great gems. The by the glass list was small, but very thoughtful.

The atmosphere is classy and beautiful. This restaurant is great for dates and special occasions. Yes, the prices are high, but the food really is fantastic and the experience of dining here is definitely worth it.

Villanelle is quickly becoming one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. Highly, highly recommended.

I will be back again and again, for more food and for some bottles of wine.
I ordered the burger during the restaurant week (to go). The burger was so juicy and just right. I'll def order again soon!!

Fresh review off the dinner tonight at Villanelle!  It is a resounding "wow"!

Food offerings are creative, veggie-centric and of course, yummy! Wine by the glass are short listed, yet well curated with some interesting biodynamic options like a Hungary-born Furmint. Everything on the menu look quite appetizing and we picked out what we wanted without much effort.

My favorite tonight is definitely the sunchoke four ways - : sunchoke puree , braised heart of sunchoke, crispy sunchoke skin and sunchoke infused trout roes, on a bed of creme fraiche . It is heavenly , even tho I don't usually like sunchokes! The seasoning and ingredients, while having very different characteristic, orchestra seamlessly, delivering a  salty sweet symphony. The bright orange, Pearl-like trout roe is the cusp of all these elements, leading to the climax of the performance. Take a forkful of a little bit of everything and let the roe burst in your mouth, blend with the creamy savory symphony. Fireworks! Pairing it with a Riesling cousin from Hungary - furmint sec, works like a charm.

Also enjoyed very much the raw brussel spouts with cheddar, rye and cashew. The savory, mildly pungent cheddar contrasts well with the nutty sweet sprouts. It is beautifully plated - spring time in a bowl :)

Main we are sharing the crispy octopus - boiled then flash fried. Juicy tender inside and crispy outside. The accompany, soft and creamy-ish palm and potatoes adding additional layer of texture. An interesting twist of the regular preparation of octopus. Yum!

Service is good considering the restaurant is new and is a busy Friday night. The bar area where we seated, are beautiful, good vibe and high energy.

All in all, we have a good time and will def come back for more of those magical sunchokes.

The words are out now and this place is already a hot spot. So make your resy now!

Service, wine, cocktails, and the fooooood were amazing! We made the right choice by ordering half the menu and will definitely be back for the other half.

PS: Hands down best Octo I've ever had!

Cute little place with delicious food

Food:
Shishito peppers - good
Octopus - delicious
Risotto with shrimp - delicious
Brussel sprouts - very good
Sweet corn - delicious
Torrija dessert - must get this

Went here on a double date and absolutely loved my meal. Shared the following with my husband:
-Brussels sprouts
-squash
-cod
-octopus
-torrija dessert

Everything was amazing and highly recommend it all! Will definitely be back!

Enjoyed dinner here last night. I was so impressed with everything from start to finish. Amazing food. Gorgeous atmosphere, but still casual...the perfect balance.
Wait staff was knowledgeable and had great answers to our questions.
If you're looking for a place to impress a date -- this is it.

So, this place is very nice. Takes customer service to the next level. It is an experience! The intimate setting yet vibrancy makes dining here a relaxing and fun time.
The menu is very diverse and let me tell you, the food is so so delicious and proportioned perfectly. I highly recommend it. You will not regret it.

Really good meal here.
Everything was super fresh, tasty and healthy.
Particularly enjoyed the Bolognese

Victor was our waiter. He got us in and out in our small time frame stipulated. Lunch was GRAND. Risotto so fluffy and full of chanterelles. My husband had the bolognese. Exquisite! Come here. You won't be disappointed.

Had a private party at this gem of a restaurant.  Delicious food, great service, fantastic wines (Syrah particularly) but more importantly super inventive chef.  The Brussels sprouts app (shredded leaves and chopped hearts with nuts and cheese) was off the charts as was the lamb dinner (a mix of loin and belly) that was tender and full of flavor.

This is a hidden gem that you will thank yourself for discovering.

Villanelle is a tiny dream in the middle of Greenwich Village. I live just two blocks away and had heard about Villanelle,  but didn't make it in for dinner until one of my girlfriends recommended it after she had a successful date there. Apparently it's been open for a year which I didn't realize.

To start, the cocktail menu is spot on. Their mixologist is as close to genius as it gets and the drink combinations were seasonal, creative, and bang-on delicious. The "Oh, Peas" featured spring peas and gin. I also had the best Pisco sour I've had outside of Peru.

I'm preferential to vegetable forward meals and Villanelle was spot on for that. According to our waiter, everything on the menu is lovingly curated from seasonal finds at the Union Square farmers market. I'm also a fan of Loring Place for their focus on vegetables and I'm a regular there, but Villanelle is a better overall dining experience in my opinion both for it's intimate atmosphere and unique, delicate flavor profiles.

We loved the the peas and green goddess dressing for a starter. For the main, the cavatelli had little bits of white asparagus mixed in which surprised and delighted me. The octopus was another standout dish.

We tried torrija for dessert which was surprisingly good. I've had torrija at other restaurant and have been unimpressed so I was prepared for another mediocre bread pudding, but this was melt in your mouth special. I don't even want to know much cream went into the dish to give it that texture and softness, but honestly, it was worth every bite.

I'm so pleased to have discovered this gem. I don't know what took me so long to find it, but I'll be a regular here from now on.

It was love from first order. Viva Mexico was dubbed as my go-to Mexican spot from the very first time I tried them.

Their food is always delivered hot and quickly. My favorite dishes are their chipotle chicken quesadilla and their tamales verdes. The quesadilla is super zesty but comes with extra red sauce if you like your taste buds flaming. Every time I unwrap the tamales, my glasses fog up from the steam that rises from it.

I feel like the chosen Yelper to live right around the corner from Viva Mexico!

This fish taco, smaller than a penny, was $4.50. I want my pesos back

We actually had great food from here before. They must have switched chefs or management or something. I guess nothing is permanent.

I'm giving it 4 stars because we ordered two different drinks, mango margarita & mojito, they were amazing! So good and strong for just 5$ each (it was during happy hour). The food was okay, not the best I've had not the worst. Wish the tacos came with different kinds of shells not just soft. Overall I would recommend!

Viva Mexico indeed.

Best AUTHENTIC Mexican food on the island.

Beats my usual Mexican long line 3 choice taco place in Chelsea Market.

If feeling a sandwich I go for a CEMITA- choice of meat (breaded chicken cutlet, grilled chicken or ground chorizo), string cheese, avocado, lettuce, onion, papalo herb, chipotle sauce on a sesame roll OR if I want something more hearty with a protein I get a TORTA- choice of meat, avocado, pickled jalapeño, refried beans, lettuce, tomato, onion (yes- it all fits in one sanGwich))).

TACOS I've tried are carne enchilada, arabe and taco with nopales. All were excellent.
Mexican authentic tacos don't come with crazy add ons and only include meat, onions, cilantro but you have an option to Americanize your taco for a bit extra to add tomatoes and cheese (which is well worth it). All tacos come with a lime wedge, green (mild) and red (hot) salsa.

SALAD is fresh and a very good value for $5, which is a rarity in this part of the city- comes with a side of oil and vinegar.

AQUA DE JAMAICA (Hibiscus tea) is delicious and crazy healthy (rich in antioxidants, vitamin C and helps you lose weight).

And for those vegetarians/vegans/veggie lovers who don't know what NOPALES are (see pic)- meet your best friend- grilled cactus. Sound weird- tastes amazing. Hopefully it will be added to the menu as a side order.

Just a word of caution to those of us who are used to Dominican shakes/batidas- shakes from here are Mexican shakes (shocking for a Mexican restaurant, I know) and made with cinnamon. That was completely unexpected for me- I finished it but would not order it again.

I've ordered here twice in one week, that's how good it is. This place is right around the corner form my apartment and I'm so upset I've been missing out on this place for months! Their drinks were strong and an excellent price for NYC happy hour at only $6! Tacos are declious and everything is fresh. This is now one of my go-to spots and I will be here many more times!

First time coming in to eat here although I live right across the street... pleasantly surprised. Quality of the food was remarkable! The staff is super attentive to your needs and even remembered the orders of the usual costumers that were there. I love a clean place and this place was spotless! Extremely organized, the classic Mexican theme makes the entire place pop even from the outside. I 100% recommend coming here if you're in the are you will not be disappointed!

Ordered via UberEats and was disappointed. Grilled chicken burrito, buffalo wings and a agua fresca. The grilled chicken in the burrito lacked flavor and color! The buffalo wings were SO SALTY!!!! I could not eat them. And the Jamaica was a little too sweet for my liking.

Craving for some burrito tonight so I chose to try this place. I ordered Carne Asada Fries, beef was so dry and it was tasteless. Burrito de pollo was ok, it came in the big potion and I couldn"t finish it. Lemonade was a bit bitter but good.

Finally: an excellent place to order from in an otherwise culinary desert. Chips freshly fried. The guacamole  needed extra lime juice, but that's easy. The enchiladas were vibrant and excellently constructed. I look forward to exploring this restaurant's menu in full.

This is my favorite place to buy tacos. Even if you order delivery, everything, the tortillas the meats and veggies, it all stays so moist and all the flavors are similar to how my mom makes them. Get the tacos arabe, it's a super Mexican thing to get.

This place has been keeping us alive during quarantine! On the days we don't feel like cooking, we order from here. As a native Los Angeleno, their food reminds me of home. Authentic taste and the portion sizes are adequate considering we live in NYC. I love the mole chicken which is much more savory than other places I've had in the city. I'm also also a fan of their horchata, not too sweet. Thankful to have this place in the neighborhood!

The food was okay, it was a place my boyfriend and I went too to get quick food before heading out for our adventures in New York since we were staying at an Airbnb around the area. The first time we came here I got the tostada which comes with basically what I would think is a big tortilla chip with chicken, tomatoes, lettuce, cheese and sour cream. I told the lady no sour cream but I guess she forgot but it's okay because I ate it anyways. He ordered a burrito with guacamole on top which looked pretty good but he said it brought more rice and beans than actual protein. They also give complimentary chips and salsa to start. The next day that we went, we had kind of like a Mexican breakfast. It came with scrambled eggs with ham, black beans and yellow rice. My boyfriend had ordered his with steak but the lady didn't bring it correctly, and she said that they didn't have steak even though when we placed the order she said yes it comes with steak. The waitress on the second day was a little rude but it was a quick stop so I didn't let it bother me. Overall, I'd recommend for people staying around the area that want some quick Mexican food.

So I saw this place on UBEREATS...
And decides to give it a try....
The tacos are ok....if I could just eat the meat of the taco that would be great. The chicken and fish were seasoned well... however the onions and cilantro were just thrown on top.
I also ordered the Guacamole...DONT DO IT! It was HORRIBLE.
My advice is to order from Las Sirenas... the food is amazing.

Food was alright just wish that they had a better way of packing to go food orders. everything looked tossed around a better presentation would've definitely been more stars. my chips are all soggy so I'm not completely satisfied. delivery was fast but the food was flavorless I wouldn't order again.

This place is the BOMB! Cannot rave enough about the sopes, the flautas, the gorditas, the carne asada fries, and the TOSTONACHOS!! Best Mexican joint in all of uptown Manhattan, I swear by this crew! Thank you!!!
I always order from them and they're are always on time and on point. Food is amazing, specially carne azada tacos and the elotes!

We ordered a steak Quesadilla and a Carne Asada Burrito. The meat was chewy on both dishes and the rice was crunchy and overcooked in the Burrito. Overall flavor and portion size was good but chewy meat and crunchy rice was a big turn off.
I've had the best shrimp tacos In the neighborhood at this place. The staff is always courteous and your food is prepared immediately in front of you

The absolute worst! Almost 2 hours later the food comes and I have to pay for it because I rejected it. Sorry I don't want cold food. Your establishment will be out of business in a matter of months for this kind of bad customer service

Very good burritos! It's the cream and cheese style so be prepared to get your fingers dirty. The size is very generous and the meat is delicious. I had al pastor and I enjoyed it a lot! Will be visiting again

I never leave reviews but felt the need to do so here- I was surprised to see there aren't a ton of reviews for this place. We ordered from here last night and honestly it was one of the best delivery food experiences I've had!! We live in Hoboken and I'd order here over the places in Hoboken any day. The food was AWESOME- fresh, delicious, great portion, came quickly. Super authentic Mexican food and highly recommend. I'm already craving it again.

The list flavorless Mexican food we've ever eaten, and we eat way too much Mexican food! Food was made wrong for starters, but we ate it anyway. It has no flavor, tastes like mush, and definitely wouldn't recommend it. Take your money elsewhere. As my friend put it "I only ate it because I paid so much money for it!"
True Mexican food. Great for ingredients and good kitchen food. They were even able to cook vegan for us.
It was the worst quesadilla I've ever had. Zero flavor and the consistency of a rubber tire. Don Taco ( a few blocks away is a THOUSAND times better.  Quick delivery though...
Very fresh and tasty authentic Mexican food! This is our favorite place in Washington Heights.
The food taste good and delivery is fast, but I give 3 stars cuz I think the price is a little expensive for the quantity of food you getting especially when order plates

Disappointed. Been craving elotes and decided to go to a different place instead of my solid place in the Bronx and man, I shouldn't have. People are nice inside but the food could be better, especially for the price. Elotes barely had enough dressing and spice, tasted real bland. At $3.50 a pop, they should be a bit bigger and definitely more flavorful. I also ordered the taco salad and spent wayyy too much for what was given. Decent workers but food need to be better, especially for the price.
Haven't been there in person, but delivery is fast and the pork enchiladas are excellent! Love the tomatillo sauce :D
Love the food, sometimes a little inconsistent. Friendly staff and the best Molé sauce I have had outside of Mexico City.  Very reasonable pricing, as well.

Every neighborhood needs a really good legit Mexican spot. I've tried others around here and they were...meh. This place opened up less than a year ago and it's been my go-to since. Great service, excellent food, and all for a good price. They also have a "salad bar" if you want to feel "healthy". Highly recommended. Hope they stick around for a while.

do not order from here ever!!!!!!! food was cold and an hour late. delivery guy was so aggressive and rude. he put his hand in my door and would not let me close until i gave him a more than appropriate tip. never order from here its not worth it.delivery guy tried to fight me i was so scared. i should've called the police.

The name is United 16. I came here for the Martinelli's sparkling apple juice. My first time here and they have it. I've passed this store so many times. I decided to come in and I was greeted by the store cleaner. Great customer service they provided. The food variety is better than other deli's in the area. The store is very clean and the food looks fresh. I'm ordering the Halal food. The set up here is fantastic.

Very good food at affordable prices. Entrees are very good portions!

Love the seafood and veggie chips as well meatballs, lamb. Reserve a table for indoors on Saturday: service wonderful too. Would return !

If you like Tzatziki (a salted yogurt and cucumber dip that's made of strained yogurt, shredded cucumber, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, salt, and herbs), I highly recommend ordering it at the Village Taverna Greek Grill. Lunched there yesterday August 05, 2023) and in my opinion, their Tzatziki is quite simply the best I have had in a very long time. The Keftedes (Greek meatballs) were equally delicious and my luncheon companions were thrilled with their chicken souvlaki. But the cherry on the top was the Galaktoboureko desert (a traditional Greek dessert made with layers of golden brown crispy phyllo, sprinkled with melted butter, and filled with creamy custard).

The service was prompt but unhurried, allowing diners to relax, communicate, and enjoy their meal.  And the overall ambiance of the establishment was light and airy - exactly what one needed on a hot summer's afternoon in New York City.

Highly recommended.

Came here for lunch on Friday after we walked by and saw the cute outdoor decorations. So many flowers and made you feel transported to another country!

I asked the waiter for his favorite salad and he said it was todays special, which was the watermelon salad with feta, heirloom tomatoes, and mint. It was really refreshing and yummy and the dressing was super flavorful. Only miss is that it was $23, which seemed a bit steep even for NY prices. We got fresh pita served at the table which was SUCH a highlight. The pita was perfectly crispy and had a herby flavorful, and the olive oil had a really unique olive taste.

My friend got the chicken souvlaki and said it was amazing. The rice was also really flavorful (which I tried).

Overall a great place, but taking down a star for the seemingly steep price of the salad (the souvlaki was $19) and we ended up having to wait 25 minutes for the check after asking for it.

Would definitely stop by again!

This was me stepping out of my comfort zone, I've never tried Mediterranean food. I won't say that it was nasty, I will just say the flavors were new to me. I order a steak skewer with rice and salad. My friends enjoyed their meals (they've had Mediterranean before.

I wouldn't personally try this spot again, but it was very well put together. The decor and seating was perfect. Very nice place. Can be a bit pricey, so have a wallet handy lol.

The staff was friendly. We say outside and it was such a nice lunch vibe. Try them out!

The food was delicious and reasonably priced with generous portions, and the ambience was really nice. The service was friendly and attentive. It was a very enjoyable place to grab lunch with a friend.

Loved the souvlaki, pita, tzatziki, and vegetable chips at this place. Always on the hunt for a good Greek restaurant and this place met expectations. Our only minor issue was that the chicken was a bit tough to get off the stick for the souvlaki but everything was well seasoned and delicious and felt like authentic Greek food.

*SERVED ME RAW CHICKEN*

I ordered the chicken skewers and I will say the portions were great and the first 2-3 skewers were fine until I looked down and there was RAW chicken. I got
my waiter and he sighed and shrugged and said "Well, you ate the rest of the skewers." I let the waiter know that I never noticed anything wrong with the other skewers but it didn't matter as this is raw chicken. He kept trying to argue with me of why I ate the other skewers (again, I hadn't notice anything wrong - and those others may have been fine). The waiter told me nothing could be done as no manager was on duty. He brought me another plate of the same dish and I said I didn't want it. I explained I am now sick to my stomach and could get sick. He kept arguing with me. He did take my plate off the bill but still argued with me even as we were paying. Horrible service and gaslighted me while they served me raw chicken.

Also, I find it funny that there was "no manager on duty" for my issue, yet the same waiter spilt a glass of wine on someone and compt their meal and gave them a free bottle of wine.

I did not want anything free - I just wanted to let a manager know what happened.

Cute restaurant though.

This amazing restaurant is located in union square and has both indoor and outdoor seating. My sister called 20 minutes before we went and they reserved us a table outside. The outside area is beautiful and the heater kept us warm on a cold night.

Thinking about this dinner, makes my mouth water. The service was impeccable from the matre D to our waiter and the bus boy. I was really impressed. So attentive, constantly filling our water. Made sure there was no sesame in anything he brought out due to my recent allergy. He even kept checking on us to make sure we were warm enough.

Now for the dinner. My sister and I shared the PSITO MANOURI which was manouri cheese with honey on top. It was so delicious. The waiter also brought us pita to accompany it. My sister recommended the best salad. It was a Greek chopped salad. The waiter was really amazing with modifying the salad. I just removed the red onions and my sister removed the green peppers. We both got gyro on top. Honestly, one of the best salads I have ever had. I can't wait to come back.

We had a lovely dinner here -- sitting outside under their outdoor street structure. It was a warm day and the server was quite responsive -- We ended up ordering the special branzino (fish) with a base of squash puree and vegetables as well as lamb kebab with lemon potatoes and roasted vegetables. To start we had the special appetizer -- an arugula salad with a watermelon, feta cheese, and poached pear inclusion. All were fabulous -- even though the day was muggy -- so the sparkling water really helped. Oh and I almost forgot, they also brought us olives and pita. There were many gluten-free options to choose from -- though it was nice that the olives were separate from the bread.

Really lovely and well priced spot in a convenient location. The restaurant itself is beautiful and the staff are friendly and extremely attentive. The food itself was pretty good. The portions were large and it was good quality, but taste-wise not anything to crave. The best part of the meal was the pita appretizer. Definitely recommend this spot if you're looking for a sound, healthy and affordable meal.
Had the Dover sole (catch of the day) as well as the special salad and Horta. Great service and great ambiance. Food was delicious but overpriced.

My friend and I came here for dinner. The interior-exterior decor was beautiful. They placed fresh fish by the entrance without any fish smell. Good!

Miguel, the waiter, was good at taking our orders and questions. The table pita was average, like most the other Greek places. We shared Octapodi (Octopus salad) to start. This appetizer was to die for, but I live to eat it! I would have ordered two just for my dinner. Then I ordered the organic chicken, and my friend had the gyro platter. My dish was fabulous! The chicken was cooked perfectly and came out juicy and tasty. My friend's dish was pretty dry. I didn't care for the Gyro much. I thought the taste was just average.

The Octopodi was the best part. I recommend this and the organic chicken for your dinner date.

Based on some recent reviews I had read I wasn't sure if I should have too high of expectations for this place. It turned out to be an excellent lunch. The moussaka was a hearty delicious serving of my go-to Greek meal. The chicken souvlaki platter was also very good and perfect for my little ones to share. Perfectly grilled chicken skewers, good fries, pita, and a generous salad with tzatziki. My wife had the mussels appetizer special as her main and they were fresh and plentiful. The broth was great for dipping pita in.

Service was excellent and there is ample seating not only inside but outside on the sidewalk as well. If you're in the mood for Greek this place is definitely a solid option.

I give it a solid three. You are provided with complimentary pita and olive oil. We had the organic chicken and also the shrimp platter and the social filo feta deep fried with prosciutto and fig jam on top.
The full feta was good I think it was well balanced with the figs my friend felt it was too sweet. The pits was warm and tasty. Now my friend hyped up this organic chicken. It was good but not "life changing" as he claimed. It was moist and nicely flavored came with green liked asparagus and fingerling potatoes in a lemon hunter sauce. My friend said her shrimp dish was great and the rice pilaf she had with it was delish. It is a pricy spot so dint think your getting out without spending at least 30-40 per person.

We had an impromptu visit to this restaurant after watching a short film nearby. Although we didn't have reservations the host seated us outside at a table with a heater and a fabulous view
The food was fresh and delicious!
The servers were amiable personable and always smiling
They were very attentive and courteous
The appetizers were plentiful and presented beautifully
The octopus was tender and juicy
The chopped salad was fresh and flavorful
The chicken was marinated perfectly and the lemon potatoes were divine
If your in the area ... stop by for some wine and fresh pita bread and olive oil
It Will be worth it
Thank you for a great dinner

Pretty Greek spot in East Village featuring a large selection of greek wines, many of which I had never heard of, and a delicious assortment of appetizers and entrees. A friend and I shared the meat platter while another friend ordered the gyro plate. We also ordered two appetizers - kolokithokeftedes and dolmades. We enjoyed the appetizers but could barely make a dent in the entrees since we were already full from the appetizers. Portions were much larger than expected and I think the meat platter could be shared with 4 people (see picture).
Nice but not original. This is what my Arabic friend saying about the food. I like saganaki kinda like a dessert and gyro, the roatate meat

The decor is really nice and the food was fresh and tasty. Our waiter was pleasant and engaging. Everyone seemed to know each other. And even one of the older patrons stated "she never saw us there before and then told me I look like Diana Ross" super cute huh..
I would definitely revisit
I got this on UberEats and the food was good, as were the portions. Nothing crazy but overall a reasonable price given the quantity and quality of the food.

I'm late in writing a review but really want to now. this is not only my favorite Greek restaurant but literally my favorite restaurant for any occasion. the food is always fantastic, the service is impeccable and the place is wonderful to have a meal. every thing is delicious, even if you just want a salad  the chopped salad is perfect, as is every fish, chicken, meat dish. wine selection great. separately I ordered a delivery for the first time last night. it came on time with enough of the delicious pita to make me very happy. don't forget to get the orange pie for dessert

Delicious, aesthetic Greek restaurant! The ambiance for a Sunday dinner was relaxed and peaceful, a perfect mood for the day. I sat inside at the corner table, mesmerized by the fresh fish at the front. Service was quick and friendly. I loved the complimentary pita, oil, and olives to start. They were hot and tasty. We started with the hummus, which came with the same pita bread. The hummus was decadent and whipped up nicely with a great taste. With the entree menu so large, it was hard to decide but I got the chopped salad--a Greek twist on the favorite. It was incredibly refreshing with cucumbers, onions, tomatoes, capers, olives, green peppers and more (I added an avocado which was a great choice). Even without the feta, the salad was still super flavorful and I had leftovers. Prices are a little high but common in Union Square. Overall great spot, would return!

It was the best brief experience that left a taste for more. We came here after dinner and we were sad that we didn't have dinner here.
We came without reservations so we sat at the bar. The host was welcoming, at the best Greek tradition. Rafael at the bar was professional, pleasant and attentive and so nice! We had drinks and we were treated like queens! We had a plate of amazing Greek bread with oregano, olive oils and few olives to "munch on", on the house. It was delicious. , even though we were clear we are here for drinks only.
Looking at the plates that were going out of the kitchen just made us feel even more sorry we didn't have e dinner here. The smells that followed these dishes were also mouthwatering.
The wine list is amazing and of worldly variety!
So as I said, we came for drinks after dinner. We will be back for dinner! Hopefully soon!

This place went really downhill. Some dishes like the spanakopita and the tzatziki are still good, but the hotra was like water overcooked and almost no leaf or flavor. The halloumi portion is like three pathetic match book size pieces also overcooked. The gyro plater portion is decent, but again overcooked and overpriced for the quality of meat. I used to love this place, but I for almost $100 a head there are far far better Greed places where you get far better quality and quantity.

So good !! Arrived around 9 pm not too crowded and quick service. We ordered fried calamari as an appetizer  which was very good and gyro platter with fries for an entree. More food than we expected so we didn't finish but still tasty. Nice ambiance and kind servers too

I visited this restaurant with my girlfriend and was excited based on the reviews. We sat down and placed our orders within about ten minutes. The waiter said he would bring our appetizer soon so we'd have it before the entrees. We kept waiting and waiting -- they brought us pita bread and kept filling up our water, so we knew they hadn't forgotten us. But after a full hour of waiting for our food, we were getting hungry and thought it was ridiculous. My girlfriend went inside to ask about it and they said our waiter never even put our order in. They had to call him to ask about it because he just got the order from us and then left work without putting it into their system. I don't think this is an acceptable way to run a restaurant.

We're just here on vacation and we don't appreciate that this restaurant wasted over an hour of our time.

I have been to Village Taverna several times and is always a go to whenever I'm craving Greek food. The interior is beautiful and spacious and the service is always welcoming. A favorite dish of mine is the Lamb Shank Yiouvetsi: the lamb is fall off the bone tender and the tomato sauce is yummy. Plus their free pita bread is one of the best I've had and they're generous with the serving. Def recommend!

This Greek restaurant is on a corner and feels very spacious in comparison to most NYC restaurants. I liked the dark wood decor and cute flower arches in the outdoor seating area. We came in as they were shifting from lunch to dinner, so it was not very busy. After listening to the specials, I decided to go with the organic half chicken since our server raved about how delicious it was. My friend ordered the lamb kebab. I was starving and ate all of the complimentary pita, which was nice and warm. The chicken came with some fingerling potatoes and asparagus. The chicken had some delicious crispy skin and cooked in a light buttery sauce. You could taste all of the flavors, but nothing was overwhelming. The ingredients all complimented each other. I tried my friend's lamb, but it was too dry for my liking. This place is expensive as the bill came out to around $70 each, and we only ordered 2 glasses of wine and 2 entrees.

I am a loyal
customer and had a problem the other day and the manager Peter called me directly and fixed it and explained it. he is terrific. the food here is always fresh and right!

Peter is great also! highly recommend

We're regulars here. Been coming since 2015. The thing that I love the most about this place is the service. I often get take-out. When I came in on a hot day, they let me sit at the bar and have a glass of iced water. My favorite dish is the veggie mousaka, because it always has quality vegetables and is cooked just right.

I first noticed the place when I was walking by and they were setting up their outdoor seating (it's very beautiful and really inviting). I popped in for a bite to eat on my way home from a late night at work. The staff were friendly, and were patient when I asked them many questions about the menu. The food was tasteful and filling (I got two servings of the gyro plate). Having such a good first experience, I came back a second time months later with my family. We had more the same experience as I did the first time, and everyone enjoyed their food, especially the lemon potatoes!

The Octopus salad is excellent! Perfectly cooked octopus! Loved the atmosphere! Outdoor seating is the best in the city!
My son loved his chicken gyro platter!

Had dinner with a friend here on a recent Saturday night. The main issue was that the staff were not all that friendly (a somewhat brusque greeting when we arrived, the waiter told us we couldn't put in our appetizers first and had to order everything all together and he was a bit impatient with the check, flustering my friend).

I had liked their menu and the emphasis on fish. While we waited for our salad, we had the warm, grilled flatbread, which was delicious! The Village Salad was also great (loved the cheese that was in it). My friend ordered the grilled octopus. It was a massive amount of red onions and not a lot of octopus. She was disappointed with the dish. I had the salmon with lemon potatoes, which was well made and a pretty generous portion.

I'd go back but hope the staff are a little more gracious.

Came here on a Friday night with a friend with no reservations. We were seated at the bar which was fine - it wasn't too crowded or noisy. We each had a glass of wine and I ordered the gyro platter. Lamb was delicious though the fries were a little soggy.

Quick and easy Greek dinner.

We came here for the ambiance rather than the food... and the fact that they had seating available on Valentine's Day without reservations.

Great outdoor seating setup with kind service--super cute transparent sheds lined with fake vines and dim lighting from hanging heat lamps.

Food wise, a no go. All the meat in the mixed platter was extremely dry and lacking flavor. It had "some" flavor, but the meat was just soooo dry and underseasoned. Our jaws hurt from chewing. We had to stop eating the meat about halfway through the meal.

Salad was basic. The olive oil tasted a bit too flat, metallic, and grassy for my liking... in my opinion, the quality of the EVOO can make or break greek cuisine.
Wandered in to this place -- had a perfect meal, perfect ambiance, perfect service. Totally reasonable prices too.
The BEST food and service. The Feta Philo was one of the best things I have ever eaten! 10/10 recommend this restaurant, amazing food and quick and attentive service.
Great food and service, generous portions, wonderful ambiance, indoor and outdoor seating. My friends and I have been here many times and are always happy with it.

The food is just ok. The waiter service is horrible. Never got our drinks and couldn't get anyone's attention to get anything.  No one checked in at all.  Fire your waiters and promote the bussers as they are the only ones that even tried. Best part is they were infighting as the bussers were fed up with the lazy waiters.  Will not return.

Rude and Racist

I've been coming to this restaurant for 10yrs, amazing service until today. My experience there today was humiliating, rude and borderline discriminatory.

Upon arrival the host sat me down. Five minutes later my waiter asks me could I move my seat. When I expressed that I was comfortable where I was, he then asked me "Who sat you?" as if I mysteriously sat myself.

A completely different waiter (a woman) comes over and hastily asks "Are you ready to order?"

Afterwards I see her politely greet two other parties, and shared with them the specials of the day. No one shared this information with me.

No one ever came to check on me after placing my order.

I was served burnt pita bread which the bust-boy actually called out.

My biggest regret is not leaving in the beginning of my service when I was asked to move my seat.

Never coming here again.

The first time I went I loved this place, because I love Greek food. But the second time I got an upset stomach from the food. So I won't be eating there again. (Until I got sick on the food, I would have given it four stars, because the lamb shanks were pretty good.)

The only thing good about the vegetarian moussaka is that it is big enough to split into two meals. It's the worst I've had in NY. Just bland, veggies cut to weird sizes, not enough béchamel.

I picked this as a last minute spot when I didn't have time to think too much about where to eat. The prices are high probably out of necessity due to the location and I'm okay with that, if the food is still good!

Completely uninspired menu. Outdated wine list. Everyone picked at their bland food and took most of it home. The complimentary pita was hard after 10 minutes.

The food is so mediocre it's insulting. Nothing worse than not being a chef and knowing you were better off making the same dish at home and not spending almost $30 an entree on nonsense.

The best Greek restaurant I've ever visited. Foods were so delicious!! Still dreaming about Lamb Shank Yiouvetsi. A big chunk of Lamb was juicy and tender. The Tomato sauce was creamy. Both had ultimate harmony with orzo pasta. My friend loves Grilled Chicken, too. Another perfect 10 was service. All staffs, including our waiter Spiros, were VERY friendly and professional. I almost forgot here was New York City, lol. I'm sure that was the result of the restaurant's well training. I'll definitely be back again!

Great place for dinner in the city if you're craving Greek food. I've been here twice and everything I've eaten both times were delicious! Their saganaki is absolutely delicious! The same would apply to mousaka, perfect comfort food!

The experience is delightful every time and it's definitely a place I'll be coming back to often!

5 stars isn't nearly enough for this place. I'll get to the food in a moment but what really stood out for me was the incredible hospitality. As a wheelchair user, I often encounter inaccessibility and a lack of willingness to accommodate me at a restaurant. Instead, the owner, Angelo, could not have been more lovely and willing to accommodate me and my two friends who also have physical disabilities. This shouldn't be noteworthy in 2023, but it is. Access and kindness go a long way in creating a memorable experience. The owner was patient and attentive and assisted us in getting seated even before our reservation time. He was quick to move chairs and the table to make room, and to grab pillows for my friend to help her be more comfortable in her seat. All the waitstaff was similarly lovely. And as for the food--so delicious! I particularly enjoyed the tzatziki, and I had good chicken souvlaki for my main meal. For dessert, I had galaktoboureko, which was delightful. To top it off, they have a lovely outdoor dining area with twinkle lights which makes for a nice ambiance as it gets darker out. Overall, would recommend and cannot wait to return!

The food here was very good! Had some great appetizers and entrees. The service was also very good. We sat at the bar for a glass of wine while waiting for our friends before sitting down for dinner. The servers were knowledgeable and attentive. My only issue with this restaurant is that we constantly felt rushed. The server (and I'm sure it wasn't her fault) would not allow us to order appetizers first. They want everything ordered at once. I'm sorry but that's not how I eat. I want to go to a restaurant and enjoy the time with our friends..at a leisurely pace. We placed the order for the appetizers and entrees. As expected, we weren't even done with our appetizers and they were already shoving the entrees onto the table. I'm sick and tired of restaurants rushing you to eat dinner. I will not give repeat business to places that do this. It's disrespectful to their customers who are spending a lot of money to eat there.  So despite us having a good dinner, I walked out feeling kind of pissed off and frustrated. Not how you want your customers to feel when they leave your restaurant.
A neighborhood favorite! Dependably delicious food, and has good outdoor seating. The owner and waitstaff are all great, makes you feel like family.

I don't know what happened but my spouse got terrible food poisoning. Ordered the chicken, business as usual, and ate it with the yogurt with dill (which had the strongest flavor, too much). Something was spoiled. This was the only meal of the day so we are sure it was this place. We won't eat here again. Food hygiene needs to much better. I read a review from a month ago that someone got an upset stomach from the lamb.

Went to Village Taverna on a Thursday night for dinner with my wife. We were looking for places with private outdoor seating due to covid but also still a cute vibe. We mainly went for the outdoor seating but were told that we needed a reservation and that the outdoor seating wasn't available for parties of 2. This isn't clearly
stated anywhere though the outdoor space is being used as a selling point. The indoor dining room was cute and had plexi glass between seats but still not the cleanest. There was food on the soft pillows and the restaurant didn't really seem to be too busy at the time. We both had gyros that were okay. The chicken gyro did seem to lack flavor beyond the grill marks. The lamb portion was generous and definitely gave the classic gyro feel. With that, we probably won't visit Village Taverna again even if we sit outside with a larger party.

To start, the meal was excellent. The pita as a starter in itself was delicious - fresh and warm. The babaganoush was so satisfying. The halloumi (starter) was grilled and the fresh cucumber tomato salad complimented it well.

Their platter options are LARGE. Enjoy it as leftovers for another 1-2 meals. The chicken skewer platter exceeded my expectations. The chicken was moist and grilled well. The accompanying salad was not a typical Greek salad in the best of ways. I choose rice pilaf over the French fries option and am happy I did.

Ordering was tough since the menu is extensive and all the options sounded delicious.

We ate as four people in a private outdoor plastic "house" which was much more refined then some of the other pop up outdoor situations.

Overall, I am thankful to have finally been introduced to Village Taverna and plan to return very soon to try out the entire menu.
Pastitsio is delicious and service is great. Dug in too quick to take a picture of the dish when it came out fresh.

I wish I could have given them more stars but when service just sucks, it affects the whole experience.  I discovered this place from MUG NY which listed it as a bargain place for its daily $28.50 prix-fixe menu.  So being a visitor in town, I decided to try it as I liked what the menu had to offer and the location.  The restaurant has 2 rooms---a cozy front room and a larger open aired back room plus a small patio for al fresco dining.  We were seated in the backroom and shortly thereafter our waitress came over to ask if we wanted tap water or bottled water.  After bringing us tap water, she then returned after a few minutes to ask us if we wanted a drink and we mentioned that we wanted a glass wine which was included in the prix-fixe menu.  No questions were asked of us as to what type of wine other than red or white or whether we had any questions about the prix-fixe menu.  Then we basically never saw her again.  Our next waiter (he looked like Beekman) then took our order, no smile, no acknowledgment of our presence, no desire to be there.  We indicated that we wanted the prix-fixe menu and he just stared us for our entree selection and appetizer choice.  We were too startled to ask questions.  Luckily the food was very tasty---I had the house Chicken which was nicely crisped and spiced on the outside and tender/juicy inside.  The mashed potatoes were buttery and smooth.  My friend had the salmon which he said was excellent as were the vegetables.  After our entrees were cleared, the waitress (Linda or Lisa) magically reappeared with dessert menus which surprised us as we thought we only had 2 choices from the description on the prix-fixe menu (creme brulee or sorbet/ice cream).  That should have been our first clue but we didn't say anything nor did our less than helpful waitress.  To be safe we ordered a sorbet and a creme brulee which were both delicious.  When we finally got the bill (from Beekman who continued to ignore us), we noticed that it was for $87 instead of the expected $57 plus tax.  After finally flagging down Beekman, he sniped at us and said that the bill was correct except for the 2 coffee's and that despite the misleading menu description dessert was extra.  Basically, the prix-fixe menu was a glass of wine or beer, a CHOICE of appetizer or dessert, an entree and a coffee or tea.  So basically our bill was $75 plus tax which was fine if we had only known beforehand so as to not order both desserts.  

In the end, the location of the restaurant if handy and near the hip NYU-Washington Square area.  But given the service and general pricing, there are TONS of better places around the corner to go to which have lower priced food (but still quality) along WITH friendly service.  Don't waste your money here.

Food was pretty bad - and the fushion, is straight up perplexing.  

Mozzerrela sticks?   Burgers?  And pad thai?!   Is this a in between place for people from the midwest!?

But if I 3 storefront down @ Kati Roll, and wanted a drink after, I would  hit up this place.   Home of the $6 vodka martini!   haha.   that is all.

I don't want to pile on, but this place is terrible. Worst Thai I've ever had.

I have no idea how they are still in business.

I couldn't believe this place was listed as Vietnamese, Thai when gazing at the menu and to even consider it fusion is futile at best. The authenticity was already shot when our waiter couldn't pronounce some of items on the menu and whats worse is the food was garbage. Service was not all that great since we were under the impression we were being rushed out and the place itself while dimmed and dark, probably has the lights off to keep from highlighting the rest of the decor. It was a very disappointing experience despite how accommodating they were to a big group (which is no easy task when the restaurant is crowded and small). However just because my experience didn't turn out the best, doesn't mean anyone should be discouraged to stay away. Just proceed with caution.

Oh, oh god. I can't even think about this. But I'm addicted to yelping. So I must. A group coming from a lame benefit event on 6th last year, it wasn't crowded (there were only two other people there) so we sat to get some drinks a maybe a quick bite. The waitress obviously didn't want to be there but she tried her best in the face of such adversity.
Some of the college crowd used to come here when i was a freshman, but I don't see why. The chicken in the dish I had (I forgot what it was) tasted almost bitter, I was wincing. We stayed less than an hour and left.

ehhhh I walked in with a group of my friends after the worst date in the world.  The whole point was to get drunk and instead of walking straight into off the wagon we decided to stop here and have a quick drink.  First I paid $8 for a shot... OKAY i get it we're in the city, but WTF come on.... and here's the kicker.... it was a shot of 151 that was WATERED DOWN... F*&k my life :(

It seems like I always visit this restaurant when I come to New York. The service is impeccable, the waiters are very friendly, the food is homemade and delicious. I would put it on my to do list when you visit NY.

We came here on a last-minute change of plans (re: hangry and desperate), otherwise I don't think I'd ever have willingly entered.

Villa Mosconi is your tough, blue-collar Italian uncle in restaurant form. The interior is old, dingy and depressing. The furniture feels stuffy, the wall decor feels outdated--everything is just '80s Sopranos. Right down to the service--the one highlight--which was friendly in a gruff and tough kind of way.

Unfortunately, the food wasn't impressive enough to make up for these other drawbacks. Our Stuffed Zucchini Flowers were still frozen inside (sigh). The Veal Ravioli Special was decent, but my Paglia e Fieno featured overcooked noodles in congealed sauce.

Not my vibe, but there's a certain type of NYC clientele that love this kind of place. So to them I say, go forth and pasta.

Located in Greenwich Village, this little Italian spot has old world charm and has a lovely atmosphere.

We were served complimentary bread, as well as sesame bread sticks. The bread was soft and yummy, especially with some butter.

My friend and I shared the fried calamari, which was decent. It was pretty crispy, but slightly chewy.

For my entree, I ordered the Stuffed Pork Chop Valdostana ($32). This was made with well seasoned, savory mushroom sauce. There were also artichokes. The pork chop was wonderfully tender, juicy, and full of flavor. It came with vegetables, as well as a potato croquette. I enjoyed the croquette, which had delightfully crispy breading with soft, pillowy potato interior. The broccoli and carrots were steamed perfectly.

Service was a little off and slow. Prices were medium, especially considering the area. While the food was decent, there wasn't anything else on the menu that I wanted to try so I am not sure I would return.

Amazing old school Italian Restaurant!  Stumble upon here randomly and definitely gives an old school vibe but I enjoyed it! My friend and I sat at the bar area and became BFF with the bartender ha!

We ordered fries which is homemade potatoes fries (SO GOOD)! My friend is gluten free so they provided three different sauces for her to dip into. I ordered half linguine pasta with tomato sauce and veil ravioli which was amazing!

I would 1000% come back here!
Best Italian restaurant in the Village, one of the best in NYC, and that's saying something.  Ask Danny the waiter what his grandmother recommends.
The host was horribly mean to his employees swearing and yelling at them so loudly from the kitchen that we could hear it in the dining room.

We tried this place on our weekly date night - it was random. We were seated right away; our waiter was always within ear/eye shot and tended to our needs (his name is Carl - awesome and friendly guy).

We had the Bolognese for dinner and capped the evening with a cappuccino (BELLÍSIMO!) we would definitely try this place again if we're ever in the area.

What a classic old-school Italian red sauce joint. Don't expect tiny servings or up to the date modern preparation's. This is old world Italian at its best. I've known many old folks in the who used to come here all the time though I've only been here a couple times. This time I sat at the bar and had a couple old fashions. Bartender Joe was gracious and friendly. Place to go when you're going for good. I had the chicken parmigiana, classic old-school. Jo knows how to make a drink.!
Nice restaurant in Greenwich village.  Pleasant change from other restaurants my wife and I have been to.  Lack of TV's and loud music was a definite plus.  Food was very good, and service was good.

I was visiting NYC from Boston with 5 friends for a fun weekend and was told, Villa Mosconi was The Place to eat! ;) The hostess, dining room, and waiter were lovely and the chefs prepared delicious entrees. None of us were disappointed. I  had the chicken marsala paired with their house red which I wish I got the name of, because it was very tasty. Overall, I highly suggest this restaurant. :)

This was our first time visiting this little Italian restaurant. I can not say enough good things about our experience. The food was outstanding, all homemade. The hospitality was above and beyond. We will definitely be back next time we visit New York.

You can tell this restaurant knows good Italian food. The menu allows you to pick from fresh pastas and "any sauce" you desire. The regulars really appreciate this restaurant, there's a big crowd even for an early dinner.

My dad and his colleagues (now all retired) have been going to Villa Mosconi since 1976. His team recently had a "Christmas in July" party that was wonderful.

The Mosconi team - particularly Chef Pietro and Jerry - were so happy to see my dad and his friends.

It's been a few years since I've dined at Mosconi - and boy, did I forget how amazing the food is. From the apps through the desserts, everything is excellent.

I particularly like:
Apps - Fried artichokes, baked clams/clams casino
Pasta - Paglia e fieno
Entree - Veal Bolognese
Dessert - Zabaglione

Great venue for a team lunch. They offer a lunch special that involves a pre-fixed 3 course meal - appetizer, entree, dessert plus coffee or tea for $28.  I opted for the Artichoke Hearts Oreganata
for app, Eggplant Parm, and the Spumoni.  All classic Italian dishes done well.  Service was excellent.

I love this place! Absolutely amazing service by Julio.
We sure loved the food, absolutely divine.
Say hi to Jerry the owner. True New yorker.

What a great find!  We instantly fell in love with the place.  The place harkens back to a time when family-owned Italian restaurants could be found all over the City.

The food was amazing.  I had the pest gnocchi with a glass of chianti.  Kevin had the tortellini with a glass of pinot grigio.  Everything was just terrific.  I also had a cannoli for dessert.  It was so good with rich pasty cream filling.

Our server, Roger, was just the best.  He was so friendly and really knew how to take of us.  One of the owners, Jerry, stopped by to say hello and was a delight to meet.

Make sure you come by for dinner sometime.  You will really enjoy it.

Nice looking place with that old school charm and feel.  There was a $28 prix fixe lunch menu but there really wasn't anything that I could have so I ordered the pork chops off the regular menu.  Turns out for some reason they were out of pork chops so I wound up having the grilled veal chop instead.  It was OK but I really would have preferred to not spent $40 for my lunch main course.  And honestly, there was nothing special about it.  

Since I eat low carb anything breaded or a pasta is out of the question so that kind of limits my choices.  Our servers were outstanding.

Went here for lunch with a friend.

Fabulous service (like a 15/10), amazing food, and such good company! I would definitely recommend the pre fixe menu, such an incredible bargain!

Will definitely be coming back again!

I loved the food and service style, but I checked into this restaurant on the Seated app, and upon requesting a separate check for a party of two, the server didn't ask how we wanted to split the check, he just didn't humor the idea.  

My roommate and I both selected this restaurant for the rewards back, and as a result of me simply asking for separate checks and the act of not both being able to receive rewards, there was contentions.

I can't tell you how badly I look upon restaurants that discourage that last step of service. It's classicist, it's disheartening, and its uncomfortable.  I work in hospitality, it's the end of the slow season, and it's my first slow season in my position in New York City.  After my own personal struggles I wanted a nice night for dinner with my roommate, and I wanted a pleasant evening. That's why I chose this restaurant, and why I chose seated. I wanted to enjoy good food, good service, and I wanted to feel good financially about treating myself.  

Now, the 20 percent rewards feels like it's not worth the negative feelings I have with my roommate, and I feel guilty for standing up for myself in a tough time.  

For this reason, I will not be returning, and it makes me look and feel petty.  That's bad hospitality, and I am a little sad to see this from a family ran business.  

I've worked in diners, pizza joins, and fine dining. This is bad service standards for the last action, and I'm so sad that I have to say this publicly, because it further makes me look sad and desperate.

Please revisit your standards.  Split checks are steps of service; not desperate.

This place has been around for decades. Food and service is why. Villa Mosconi has an abbreviated menu right now but a good selection. Everything is fresh,cooked to order and the main dishes come with a side of vegetables or pasta. We had crabcakes and chicken marsala with some Prosecco and really enjoyed our dinner. Service is always attentive without hovering. This is a local restaurant so if you are a tourist looking for pseudo Italian-look elsewhere. Villa Mosconi is the real deal.

Was it really a perfect 5? Oh yes it was.

I got the broiled Salmon and it was perfectly done along with a FULL plate of spinach I ordered as well.

Fantastic food and great ambience.

Definitely worth a return trip.

Loved loved loved Villa Mosconi! I was craving a ole plain grilled salmon. And that is exactly what I got. A huge piece of simply delicious and perfectly seasoned grilled salmon. It comes with pasta or veggies, I opted for the veggies: potatoes, carrot and brocoli with olive oil and garlic. There is perfection in simplicity and this meal was perfect!!! And that olive oil was super delicious, and it took the simple veggies to the next level.

The hubs got the branzino in lemon and caper sauce, with the side of veggies too. It was great!

Between our 2 entrees, we both packed half of our fishes because the portions were quite huge!

The bread in the bread basket was delicious. The service was impeccable and the owner is a gem! I can't wait to try other traditional dishes on their awesome menu.

After the Film Forum, wifey and I were in the mood for a traditional Italian restaurant. Unbeknownst to us, we would soon accidentally hit gold with this easy-to-miss place. A modest front hides a delightful experience inside. The owners are friendly and appreciative. The waiters are professional and one was really funny. The place was cozy.

   But one is there for the food. It was so delicious that I'm going to steal the whole darned structure and move it to my neighborhood. Baked clams, shrimp oreganata, salad, come on, even the AIR seemed to taste good.  I didn't even want dessert but couldn't stop eating.

   And when the check came, know what. I mean let's face it, no restaurant is cheap in Manhattan, they probably tax these poor owners for going to the bathroom. But compared to my normal outlay in Manhattan, it was very reasonable.

    Just a totally winning experience. It was so good that we are plotting a return to Film Forum just to eat in this restaurant again.

     I noticed somebody said "only tourists give this restaurant good reviews". Umm, pal, I'm from Brooklyn. I ate in Del Dios Canarsie starting at 2 years old in 1958. Been eating in NY Italian restaurants for SIXTY ONE years according to my math. That qualifies me as a very old expert, and I say this place is a winner.

Full disclosure - My boyfriend and I won a lottery for a voucher for Villa Mosconi and it said "Dinner for Two". To be honest, we were reluctant to use it because there was no dollar-amount on the voucher and we just didn't want to be treated like we were there scamming for a meal but OH BOY, was I wrong about it!

To start off, we met the owner, Jerry, right at the entrance and he was as nice as a gentleman can be. "Order anything you'd like!" He generously said and even though I knew we could have gotten away with it, my boyfriend and I just split one appetizer, one pasta dish, one entre and each had a glass of wine.

Carl (or Karl?) provided us with an amazing service. I would go back to Villa Mosconi and asked to be seated in his section again. He was informative, funny and gave great suggestions. The Oyster Rockefeller were delicious and we totally just ate up the pasta dish called Paglia e fieneo (straw and the hay) that is made with thing pasta noodles with peas and tossed in a light cream sauce. We also got the Veal in a mushroom sauce and everything was cooked to perfection.

After dinner, the owner gave us a tour of the restaurant and we got to see their beautiful back garden! He told us that it is a multi-generation business and I just love the food, the story and their passion.

I would certainly go back (as a paying customer this time!) and try out other dishes. I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant if you just want some no-frill Italian food made fresh by an Italian family! You just don't get charm and service like this anymore!

This place is a simple / classic old school Italian restaurant. Everything was good, but nothing blew my socks off. The veal was great, the pork chops were good and all the appetizers were solid from the artichoke, baked clams, calamari and antipast etc. This restaurant is also part of the Greenwich village walking tour so I've been here now a few times.
The kindest people. They've been there for 45 years!!!! We felt like family In this locally owned & small restaurant.

This is my first review for Villa Mosconi, but definitely not my first time here. The last time I was here was 4 years ago and true to form they never disappoint. We came in without reservations and we were lucky to get seated right away. The food was exactly as I remembered it Delicious!! Since we were going to a show which we mentioned to our waiter He made sure to get us out on time.
My husband had the homemade lasagna which was so good. I had the linguine and white clam sauce one of my faves it was just the right amount of garlic flavor in a clear broth with parsley it was perfect. Our wine selection was a Montepulciano recommended by our waiter ... we love wines on the dryer side this was perfect. And don't leave without having their tiramisu you won't be disappointed

Food delicious and Service impeccable. Looking for a place for great Italian food..They don't disappoint

This place is amazing in every aspect.  From the moment we walked in we were treated with exceptional and friendly service. The ambiance is warm and inviting and Carl, our server, was phenomenal. His wine suggestion was spot on and the food was impeccable.

We had a carafe of the Chardonnay special, the calamari and the baked oysters, and the pasta specials (shrimp and white fresh mushroom sauce). Everything was absolutely delicious.  

Our dinner was one of the highlights of our trip and is hands down one of the best dining experiences we've ever had.

Thank you Villa Mosconi for making our experience (and my birthday celebration) so amazing!

A true neighborhood gem in Greenwich Village. My family has come here off and on for years whenever we come to New York from Kentucky. The service and food is always outstanding. You can't really order wrong here.

A must try on the menu is any of the homemade pastas. We ordered it as an appetizer and the waiter split it up between the 2 of us. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp in the special sauce (so good and fresh!) and I ordered mixed seafood entree over pasta and homemade tomato sauce. The fish was cooked perfectly. Even if you don't like fish they have so many options.

Of course I highly recommend the desserts so save room! Since it was my birthday we got homemade tiramisu and tartufu. SO. GOOD.   We told them we wanted a relaxing meal and we never felt rushed. I love this restaurant!

Forget about trendy Italian restaurants in Manhattan, this is the real deal. We have been going here for years and every time we bring friends or family for the first time they are in love with the food/ ambiance. Our recent visit on Saturday 11/10/18 was with a group of 9 for a birthday celebration. We were in the party room in the back which is lovely. Our waiter, Roger, could not have been more thoughtful and professional. (When I told him that I always get the linguini with clams but decided to try the salmon in white wine sauce ( perfect, by the way) he had the chef add several clams in their shells to the dish). The homemade pasta is delicious. You cannot go wrong here. The wine list has a good variety at reasonable prices. One of the few restaurants that serve tartufo for dessert !
Trust me, once you eat at Villa Mosconi you will add it to the list of your favorites.

Enjoyed our dinner here

Walking distance from the Washington square hotel and all the happenings on and around bleeker street

The service was excellent
We ordered the buffalo mozzarella appetizer but changed on the suggestion of the waiter and it did not disappoint

The bread was excellent but breadsticks in cellophane perhaps  a little tacky for a restaurant of this caliper

I ordered linguini and clams it was very good

Capellini and bolognese excellent

Tortellini with meat another winner

Desserts
Ice cream very good
Cannoli excellent

I would give this place a 5 star review but for the fact we had a disabled person and the hostess was not happy about stowing his scooter

Otherwise highly recommend

i ate with my family and we all loved it! i had their spaghetti with tomato sauce. very good and flavorful! had to take some of it home :). i also had their Caesar salad and the mozzarella appetizer. both very good and a nice size salad. dressing was good too. might have been home made :)

This is most likely a place I will never eat in again, ever.
We had a simple meal, we shared the baked muscles which were very good. We also shared the lack lustre Arugula salad, Arugula with pale unripe tomatoes. My wife and I both ordered the linguini con vongole, it was spaghetti not linguini first off, it was a bit dry we had to work to get the broth off the bottom of the bowl. It did not have a lot of flavor at all. We are both of Italian heritage we make this  dish, we grew up eating it we know what it is supposed to be like. The clams were not fresh shucked, they had to be canned.

The service we got was great however, another waiter stood at the service area with his huge handkerchief blowing his noise at the dinning room. We got asked 3 or 4 times by every waiter and bus boy if we wanted a drink. I supposed if we had one the foods lack of flavor would not have mattered. We skipped dessert after the waiter panned the Pears Mosconi, we were told they were the most boring thing on the menu.

We stated on our opentable rez we were celebrating, they did not check us in BTW. It was a disappointing meal and got more disappointing at 2 AM when my wife and I were up trading places in the bathroom to get sick, the clams got their revenge . We spent the night sick and some time at the walk in emergency place during the morning. We were celebrating my having finished 7 rounds  of chemotherapy which went on for 6 years, for a cancer I got from 9/11. This was no celebration.  I was fortunate to have a good appetite through my treatments which ended a month ago, this was no side effect except from tainted food.

Next day I got my head off the pillow at 4:30 PM and called Villa Mosconi to tell them of my first experience eating in their restaurant. They offered us a gift certificate, I was too tired and weak to argue. No offer to put the nearly $75 back on my card. No ask of how much the bill was, some random amount gift certificate will arrive. You could not pay us to eat here. They should have offered to refund us. Do the right thing, especially when you tell me this does happen from time to time.  An expensive night after we added in the doctors visits and the prescriptions co-pays, this was more than the bill.

Native New Yorkers do not forget and we will tell everyone where not to eat.
Thanks Villa Mosconi for ruining a long awaited celebration.

Went here last night for a holiday dinner with my family and was very pleased with the service and the food. Our waiter was so kind to read off the specials and explain everything in such detail. We had many questions about the menu and he was very helpful, attentive and friendly. We started out with a few apps from the specials. We got two burrata, artichoke hearts and a salad. Everything with delicious and flavorful. As for entrees, they were extremely accommodating as I wanted to create my own dish. I asked for linguini in pink sauce with shrimp and it exceeded my expectations. My mom has the gnocchi with pesto which was also an excellent choice. Everyone was pleased with their meals and we will definitely return. This restaurant has been here for quite some time and gives you a very warm, good feeling in your heart. This place is a hidden gem.

This restaurant is surprisingly large. Without having THAT much frontage, it seems to run on forever with private seating areas at the back beyond the entrance to the kitchen and to the back left where they enclosed what seems to previously have been an outdoor seating area.

Everyone who works there is very polite and the place is clean and nicely maintained.

I had the Chicken Parmesan with spaghetti and found it to be very average. There's not really a lot to say about such a relatively basic dish that could've been done differently. It just tasted like a thin piece of chicken covered in red sauce. There were no really apparent flavors.  I also tasted the Eggplant Parmesan that my father ordered and it was reminiscent of slices of rubber stacked on one another and covered with a bit of mozzarella and red sauce. His meal came with a side of vegetables that were a saving grace for him.

I wish I could say better about the food because everyone certainly seemed to be trying to make the experience a good one.

While in NY, many of our meals were mapped out and planned out with reservations, but eating at Villa Mosconi was total happenstance. We were hungry and a party of eight and they had a table for us. From the minute we walked in, we knew we made a great decision. It has a very old-school neighborhood feel to it. You could tell that the guys at the bar were regulars. Everyone there seemed to know each other and most of them welcomed us to their favorite hang out spot.

We ate outside in the (heated) courtyard and enjoyed the stereotypically Italian soundtrack full of Rat Pack classics. Our waiter was perfect. With four adults and four kids between the ages of 8-15, I always expect a few hiccups, but there were none to report. Timely, friendly, funny...a total pro. I'm going to guess that he's been doing it a little while.

I cannot remember what everyone ordered, but we ordered a lot. Soups, salads, pastas, specials, bottles of wine, desserts...and everyone...all eight of us...loved it. I would recommend it to anyone.

I have been on a mission for years to find my favorite dessert, biscuit tortoni.  If you've ever had a Good Humor Toasted Almond bar, you have the general idea.  I used to eat Tortoni for dessert all the time when I first moved to Denver, but that place is now long gone.  I have even reached out to the no. 1 distributor of Italian desserts in LA, but no go.  I have also had it a couple of times in Little Italy here in the Big Apple, including when we went to the feasr of San Genarro about 12 years ago, so I figured this trip was my best shot.  

So I check Yelp and come up empty for anything in Manhattan.  I Google it, and find an article about biscuit tortoni in a column entitled, "Lost Foods of New York City" that says it "celebrates the food and drink that once fed the city, but have disappeared."  This, of course, struck terror in my heart.  Fortunately, as seems to be the case with so many headlines these days, the news wasn't quite that bad.  It allowed as how there was one old school Italian restaurant down in the Village that still had it.

Well, I'm here and it's the real deal.  The staff is speaking Italian to each other.  The background music is a combination of Andreas Boccelli and Frank Sinatra.  Surely some Mafia boss has been mowed down here at some point in its 41 year history.  (Sorry, I know that's a horrible stereotype, but I just couldn't resist.)

Don't go expecting the latest culinary creation here. It's seriously old school.  But if the idea of Italian comfort food appeals to you. You'll love it here.  The artichoke hearts were to die for.  And the biscuit tortoni?  Yep.  Perfect.  Worth the trip from California.  I'm an environmental lawyer.  I feel pleased to have done my part here to save an endangered species.

I bet a lot of review for Villa Mosconi start out with, "It was a Monday so X and Y were closed, and we came here by default." That's more or less how I finally got to try VM, but really, there's no good reason not to give it a shot other than the fact that it's not particularly "cool" in a neighborhood that sees new places open every week.

VM is old-schools but not ancient. There's a little bar area where regulars can hang out and shoot the s--t with the owner while cursing out the Giants or whoever happens to be on their large-screen TVs. Then you enter the dining room, which is smaller than I expected and has a certain coziness to it. It definitely takes you away from MacDougal's nuttiness but keeps you in a 1960s/70s red-sauce state of mind.

Service is standard old-school Italian, which means ceremonious waiters with sum fresh-a-peppa (should you like it, of course), and cheese on your pasta. They had some really nice wines at friendly prices. For food, I ordered the Pollo Mosconi, which was a huge hodgepodge of chicken and vegetables in a sweet reduction. Definitely a "hunter's" dish for big appetites, or if you want to have leftovers for lunch the next day. The pastas looked pretty strong, too, from where I was sitting.

Not a bad thing to say about this place, so give it a try if you want some classic Italian-American food without pomp and fuss.

Summary: there are much better Italian spots in the village...I don't know why this has such good reviews (tourists maybe?)

- ambiance: seems like an old school Italian place from the suburbs...Not the best atmosphere and kind of bright in there

-staff: really friendly and polite. This was the saving grace of the restaurant

- food: oh boy. We ordered a number of dishes (apps and mains) but nothing was good. Even the spaghetti bolognese came out and looked like it had some grey meat sauce that was just poured out of a chef boyardee can - it didn't look good and didn't taste good either.
