My dish tasted like the pasta wasn't even cooked at all in some parts. It was crunchy which was weird. We asked to have our food boxed up because it was so bad and we didnt want to offend them. We literally didn't take more than one bite each. In hind sight maybe we should have mentioned it was bad but considering EVERYTHING was tasteless, not cooked or just funky looking we didn't want to take our chances, left, and gave our doggie bag of food to someone less fortunate on the street. Although now that I think about it I'm not sure we really did them any favors ...
They are closed due to Covid.  No outdoor dining and take out no delivery.

Home cooking! Came here for lunch  only 2 tables occupied.  The place is a bit old school, needs a small face lift, but for the food they are serving I guess it fits,  like going to grandma's house.  For lunch I would def. come back but likely not for dinner.

For those days where you don't want anything fancy and missing the  taste of home, Villa Mosconi is a safe bet.

Five stars. I love this place. I love everything about this red sauce joint. The people when you walk in are so warm and welcoming, there are always a couple of old timers at the bar watching a ball game- quintessential New York. The coat check lady is very sweet, the service is great all around. Very old school, polite, accommodating, so nice. The food is amazing, I love the pasta. All of the pasta. Something else I really appreciate is the space. A lot of restaurants in this neighborhood squash you in and your seat is a miniature bar stool. Here, every table is great. Just really comfortable experience from when you walk in until when you leave. They are celebrating 40 years soon, cheers to 40 more.

Well .. we were really tired from a traveling day and were just hungry.  This was close to the hotel, got a decent rating and claimed to have homemade pasta.  The pesto gnocchi was mediocre.  There was a lot of garlic and though that in itself is not bad; the garlic was undercooked.  However, the service was impeccable.  Our waiter, shame on me for not knowing his name, was awesome and the wait staff as a whole were very attentive.

So very happy to return to Villa Mosconi once again - the food was even better than we remembered. I had artichoke hearts and my husband had asparagus as appetizers - they were both spring fresh and so tasty. For dinner I had shrimp oreganata over angel hair and he had the stuffed veal chop.  Again - both were delicious. Cocktails were well made and our waiter Carl was a pleasure. Looking forward to returning again soon.

This place for now on is my favorite place in New York the pasta the owner the wine everything was absolutely delicious I will definitely be back next week be back my family for sure for sure! Thank you Jerry

I visited this restaurant for work team dinner. Everything was preset. The salad was very fresh and pasta was rich and good. My favorite was pasta, artichoke and the pork chop. Pork chop was so tender and very flavorful. Artichoke was surprisingly good. I think calamari could be seasoned better or cunchier. I would love to try this place and see what they have on their menu.

The few lousy reviews should be thoroughly disregarded. Anyone can have an off-day, only The Lord is perfect. Villa Mosconi, though, is pretty close as restaurants go. I was there on July 31st for a private fundraiser for a remarkable organization that protects innocent babies. The simple menu consisted only of two different types of pasta (penne alla vodka and tortellini Alfredo) along with warm bread, fried calamari and zucchini but it was as good or better than anywhere in New York. What makes this venue special aside from its sumptuous cuisine is its authentic, cozy atmosphere and the welcoming embrace of its staff, particularly its owner. When it got busy Jerry was out there on the floor pouring coffee and checking on patrons rather than hiding in an office counting money or somewhere out on the town. So, bottom line, this place is superlative.

Go there. Don't think about it, just go.

What an amazing meal and experience! The owner, Jerry and our waiter, Carl, were so welcoming and friendly - exceptional service that is difficult to find these days. And of course, the food and wine were superb. Will absolutely be back!!

Hard to believe I have not reviewed Villa Mosconi before today. I've been coming here for 25 years and the restaurant has not changed much at all. The service is lovely and attentive. The menu has so many great options of old school Italian food, with plenty of daily specials to consider too.

I was in my old neighborhood on Saturday night and decided Villa Mosconi would be perfect to avoid the Halloween crowds and have a great meal. We shared the best baked clams for a starter. Our entrees were perfectly cooked and tender veal picatta and linguine with clams in a white wine sauce. We had the option of red or white sauce, and the choice of spicy or regular. The spicy was actually spicy and delicious.

If you find yourself in the neighborhoods of Soho or West Village and want to have a great old school Italian experience, or, if you have a large crowd then come here. You will not be disappointed.

Just had dinner with  our whoLe family (6 adults & 3 kids), we heard about this spot from a friend. What GREAT service from the owner and full staff. Food was great, they brought out the kids food quickly and that bruschetta they bring out is great. Will come back for sure and highly recommend it

After a day of shopping with my OOT girlfriends, we were HUNGRY.  Standing at the corner of Bleeker and 7th Ave S, we surveyed the options and saw this Italian place on the corner with a warm glow inside.

The host/waiter was odd.  Not sure if he couldn't speak English, was "slow", was extremely intimidated by our hotness, or was just on something.

The owner (I think) took our drink orders, and recommended an amazing wine.

We had the calamari for appetizer, also amazing!  

The decor was romantic - dining by candlelight.  

That's where the positives stop.

We waited forever for our food order to be taken.  Some confusion as to whether owner or wierdo host guy was supposed to take our order.

After the wonderful wine and calamari, we were expecting amazing food.  The descriptions sounded wonderful!

But we were horribly disappointed.  The food wasn't bad.  But it was average - my fresh tagliatelle d'alba (pasta with truffles) - tasted like olive garden fettuccine.  And for the prices this was unacceptable.  

It was worth going once (the calamari was THAT good), but I won't be going back.

NYC has many Italian pasta spots... The reason you come to Via Carota for its Cacio e Pepe and this review is for that pasta dish only. I've had their pappardelle and it's forgettable. The pepe is where it's AT. The hand made noodles are cooked to utter perfection, perfectly al dente and have a satisfying chewiness mouth feel to them. I've heard some batches of pasta don't have enough pepper in it, but fortunately every time I've gotten cacio e pepe, the black pepper is the hero. A delicious saltiness comes through from the cheese which just brings the whole pasta dish together.

We get our food as take out every time because the line is just too long, and the pasta is still so delicious even after it sits in a takeout container for a while. Only downside is there will be a small pool of butter if your takeout gets cold. But honestly don't care because it's so worth it.

For those who aren't impressed by Via Carotas cacio e pepe, please DM me your recs for better spots. Until then Via reigns supreme.

Overall pretty good, would come back to try more dishes!

It's a little tricky to get a reservation, so what my friend and I did was go around 5:30pm, stand in the line to get onto the waitlist (~30m), wait on the waitlist for about an hour while window shopping in the neighborhood, and come back at 7pm for a perfectly reasonable dinner time. We got seated outside, which was pretty fun as we got to people watch during our meal and try to spot famous people walking by us.

Service was quick and ambiance was fine. Now for the food -
- Burrata e Verdure: 7.5/10. My friend LOVED it, i thought it was pretty good. Everything tasted fresh and very well flavored.
- Pappardelle and Tonnarelli: 8/10. Solid bowls of pasta. Nothing terribly incredible, but definitely expertly cooked pasta with well-seasoned sauces and good consistency.
- Dessert (panna cotta and crostata): 9/10. This was the highlight of the meal for me. I had the panna cotta and thought it was the perfect balance of sweet and sour with the marmalade on top. This was a must-have.

I have wanted to try this place and it lived up to the hype! My favorite part of this place is the walk-in availability. The hardest part of NYC is getting reservations at certain restaurants and the restaurants not accepting a lot of walk-ins. Via Carota changes that. I recommend going around 5pm and you can put your name down for a certain time and they will text you on when to come back! My sister requested 6:30pm so we could have a little Happy Hour before dinner.

My sister and I loved our dinner here. You must order the frito misto, it was not heavy and the perfect appetizer. I am a sucker for calamari and fried shrimp so this dish was just perfect. We are about balance so we ordered a salad and a restaurant salad, they are so good. Now on to the pasta, we were so happy with our Tagilatell order. The taste and the texture, all of it was so good! Of course we had to order a bottle of wine to go with this meal and they have affordable bottles between $50-$60.

We will definitely return because not only is the food is good, but the experience of being able to put your name down for a certain time and grab a nearby HH before, perfection.

4.9 or just about as close to a perfect meal one could have.
On my bucket list for a while, and on a whim, I made a Resy reservation about a month in advance.
What I noticed is that the time slots for dinner  were either very early or very late. I snagged a 4:45/5 PM slot and we were sat outside. A line started to form around that time with most people being accommodated, including indoors! Go figure.

Browsing the September/current menu, we ordered the Gran Spritz cocktail  which was a refreshing twist comparable to the Aperol only a different liquor and color (yellow). It was very delicious and kind of strong.

Our server was helpful and offered feedback on ordering since portions were  on the generous side.
The selected appetizers were Fritto Misto (calamari and shrimp) and Tonno with beans.
They both arrived to the table around the same time.
The Fried Calamari were piled high and included  just 2 jumbo shrimp and the tentacles (of the squid). It was served on its own without side Marinara sauce but oh so delicious. Cooked just right. The seafood was tender while the batter was crispy. Not oily or overly seasoned, this pick was a winner.

When we got to the Tonno with Beans, it was unlike anything I ever tried. Pieces of cubed raw tuna mixed with cannellini beans tossed with grape tomatoes and parsley in a delicious dressing.. A must order selection.

For main, we shared 2--- the Skate and Risotto (with Meyer Lemon). Risotto came out first---creamy and lemony. Excellent choice.
The Skate, which was perfect for sharing, was pan fried and sprinkled with capers. Another delicious selection.

Our meal ended with the Italian Zabaione  served with berries. If you aren't familiar, this is a must try. In a nutshell, it's an Italian custard and very good.

A few things to note:
Both the Skate and Risotto were a little too salty for my liking.  I wish they weren't as over seasoned . I wouldn't say it was a negative to the experience but some people such as myself aren't a fan of dishes being prepared with too much salt.
Another observation--the Skate was pan fried (although it could almost pass as deep fried) and had I known, I would have selected another main.
Having ordered the Fried Calamari, it lent to too much fried like selections. I wish it was described as such on the menu.
When our original server ended his shift, service went downhill at times.
Glasses and plates remained on the table just a little too long. I get it. Via Carota is a happening restaurant and rightfully so but there were a few lulls when it came to service.

The overall experience was phenomenal and we agreed that dinner at Via Carota was one of the best meals we've had.
Highly recommend and would absolutely return again (if I can get past  the headache of the reservation process).

Great place, service and food!
If you write down your name you'd probably get a table in 30-40 mins, and it's worth it!

Great friendly and kind service. The food was great! We got artichoke, zucchini, salad and leeks. Artichoke was beyond and second best east the leeks!

We've tried 3 pasta; cacio Pepe, Ragu tagliatelle and peas and prosciutto tagliatelle. I love love love yhe ragu, and if you like a lighter taste the peas was a great touch on tagliatelle!

Not a fan of tiramisu and the green salad but otherwise everything was beautifully made and tasted delicious!

This was the dining experience I've been craving from NYC for a long time. Located in Greenwich in a super cute neighborhood where the street side seating offers the best people watching.  The food was to die for.  The highlight for me was the tagliatelle with prosciutto and the bold wine list filled with Italian specialties.  The service was outstanding and we will definitely be back next visit!

Awesome spot! Every single dish was amazing. We didn't necessarily order everything I wanted, since the girl I was with eats much healthier than I do, but we got the Brussels sprouts, artichoke, pappardelle, and branzino. Everything was great. There are lot of great Italian restaurants in the city but this spot stands out as 1) girls really want to come here because Taylor Swift once ate here and 2) the ambiance, really cool setting

For how much hype this place gets, it was just ok. There is definitely better italian places in the city. We came here for an early dinner on a Friday. We got there around 5:15pm and were seated immediately outside which we were super excited about! Shortly after we saw a line start forming so definitely get there earlier! Here's what we got:

Cacio e Pepe - this is usually my favorite thing to get at any italian place. I heard a lot of great things about this dish here so I was really excited! Unfortunately, it didn't hit the mark for me. There was not enough sauce and there was just no creaminess that you expect with a cacio e pepe. It also didn't have enough pepper. Overall, this was not it in my opinion.

Lemon Risotto - this was also ok, really lemony so if that's not your vibe steer clear but it was like very runny. Usually risotto has a bit of a bite to it but this was very soupy in my opinion

Papardelle Ragu - my friend got this and he thought it was good but again nothing super out of this world

Overall, this place is very expensive and overly hyped in my opinion. I've heard their apps are pretty good so maybe I'll give those a try next time but I don't think I'd come back for a full meal.

It was tasty, not life changingly so, but good nonetheless. Everything was made w a high level of precision. The octopus and heirloom tomatoes were great, cacio e pepe definitely the star. Tiramisus pretty yum and not too sweet (!!!), heavy on the cream filling.
I think there are probably a lot of nice italian restaurants around the city u could get the same quality of meal without the difficulty of getting a spot, and for me it was just missing that special flair to draw me back for another visit. But it was a good meal fs

I was so excited that I was able to get a reservation. My reservation was at 10:30 pm on a Friday. My friend and I were wandering around West Village and decided to see if we could be seated earlier than 10:30 pm. We were able to be seated at 10 pm.

The restaurant has a very cozy and homey vibe. There is seating outside too. We were seated inside. Paper menus are on the back of the chairs.

There are 3 single stall bathrooms in the back.

We weren't that hungry so we split:
- Grilled artichokes - Super yummy

- Pappardelle - Beef was tender and melted in your mouth  

The food came out fast and was delicious! I prefer Via Carota to L'Artusi for the food and the vibes.

Would've been a "great" meal if it weren't for the last dish that we ended up getting because none of the $30 dishes were filling enough: the bruschetta with the chicken liver (see photo). It has WAYYYYY TOO MUCH CHICKEN LIVER which was "chopped" into such erratic pieces that it only ended up looking like a pile of POOP  (see picture). The chicken liver was also too salty and just extremely heavy. No idea who thought it was a good idea to have this dish on the menu. Like, there's literally nothing aesthetic or enjoyable about this dish. Salty mushy poo liver for $18? Nah. Showed the picture to our friends afterwords and they literally gagged and then burst out laughing hahah. Sorry to be savage but there are no excuses for that dish at an establishment such as this one.

The highlight of the meal was the bruschetta special, with gorgonzola pear and walnuts. Nothing bad to say about that it was delicious.

Still, I think this restaurant is severely overpriced for the quality, and saltiness. Considering how many people complain about the saltiness I'm surprised that it tastes like nothing has been done to address it. Also the green salad for $21? That was a very simple vinaigrette with a bunch of uncut fresh leaves. Yummy, refreshing, but I don't go out to eat things I can make at home. Not sure what was so special about that.

I'm going straight to the reservation portion. It's hard and the key is to just walk in right when they open. Was there Sunday, sat at the bar because the place was already packed at 11am! Bartender said Sundays are their slowest day. Lol. I can only imagine this spot on a weekend night. Thank Taylor for the free advertisement! Had the CAVOLETTI SALAD (shaved Brussels sprout salad) & the cacio, guys you can't go wrong with their cacio very simple dish but absolutely delicious! Will definitely come back and hopefully for dinner next time.

This and I Sodi are probably my favorite restaurants in the West Village and definitely among top 10 in New York City. The food is absolutely phenomenal. Their insalata verde is much talked about and with good reason - never would I have thought that a simple green salad of lettuce, watercress and endives would have such complexity of flavor. It is truly the holy grail of green salads. The pastas here are also must orders. The cacio e pepe has got to be one of the best in the city. I've also had the rigatoni with bolognese (a special the last time I was here) which was equally delicious. Both pastas are cooked to a perfect al dente and enjoy a just right ratio of sauce to noodle. This is truly one of those places where it's hard to find anything wrong with the food or the dining experience. A well-deserved 5 stars.

I think this 4 is based more so on it not living up to hype than a fully objective view. On a Thursday it had a 4 hour wait (5:30 entered; seated at 9:30), which if you live closeby, is stomachable. Just put your name down!

The environment is cute, especially to be seated in a small back room with a longer table; feels like I'm in a wine cellar in Bologna, ya know?

The starter was what stood out to me; a whipped ricotta toast with sundried tomatoes?? So beautiful to look at, and even more tasty. Don't miss out on it, as those tomatoes were just perfection. My entree fell a bit flat (one of the daily specials: a pea pesto pasta with ricotta (the green one). The sauce was pretty chunky (nuts from the pesto), making for a strange texture; flavorwise, it was a bit lacking, dominated by oil + butter rather than spice. However, my favorite at the table was the Cacio e Pepe, if you're looking for a suggestion

Got a Zabaione for dessert which was good (especially the sweetened strawberries), but a bit more cream than I could muster to eat. Overall, I appreciated the service in the end, but I don't know if this meal is worthy of the #4 NYT restaurant in NYC. Would still say people should go and see if the hype is real!
We arrived at 11am on a Monday so no reservation needed and sat outside. Service is great and the food is phenomenal. Every bite is delicious!

We stopped in last night and took our chances on finding a walk-in table. We were hoping that the gloomy weather would discourage a long line of people, but it didn't! If we weren't so lucky enough to get a table for 2 right away, the wait would have been minimum of an hour.

We were seated outside at a small table. We started with the Cynar and Gran Spritz, which if you haven't already had one before, is an acquired taste. We got the fried rabbit as an appetizer to share. It was so juicy and delicious, and came with some fried bread.

For mains, we shared a cacio e pepe and a wild boar ragu. Both were so fresh and flavorful! I think my friend liked the cacio e pepe better, but I was a huge fan of the wild boar ragu.

For dessert, we shared an affogato and semifreddo. The affogato is usually hard to mess up, and was delicious as always. The semifreddo was SO tasty! I think it's a hazelnut mousse, and it's absolute perfection!

The service was pretty good. Our waiter was attentive without being overbearing, and friendly.

I definitely see the hype about this place. It seems like as the night goes on, the line gets shorter, so maybe try your luck later in the evening for a better chance to score a table.

I'll definitely return to Via Carota!

There was this server who looked like a tik toker so I kept staring at him and I know he could tell I was staring at him because when he would approach our table he would look down at me in like a dominatrix kind of way (maybe he should do that on the side?) but anyways he was very accommodating for our time restraint and made sure to ask when we were trying to leave by -- to catch our flight -- and made sure to have all the food out in time so that was nice.

Food was good, someone else paid tho so can't rate the price to quality ratio

Via Carota definitely lives up to the hype. The butterhead lettuce is absolutely delightful, and the pastas melt in your mouth. It may be difficult to get a reservation, but the wait time is manageable if you walk in!

Got here for a quick lunch, surprised I didn't have to wait for long. I arrived when the restaurant just opened on a weekday (11am) and got seated within minutes at the bar table.

I ordered their Piselli salad

The salad was perfect. It was refreshing, creamy and flavourful. The greens were fresh, the prosciutto was high quality, perfect with green peas and robiola cheese and oregano. The favlour combination was so well thought out with their ingredients selection. Definitely one of my go to spots if the wait isn't long.

Ordered all their classics, standouts, and the food is authentic and delicious, but don't come here unless the ambiance further justifies the price.

There's better Italian food in the city for even cheaper if taste is your only criteria. But for example, Via Carota is noticeably better than Carbone. I'm not the first to propose it, but claim the crown Via Carota.

Standout Italian food and very cute. So an unparalleled date spot if pasta and Resy are a few of your favorite things. But worth all the hype?

after wanting to try this place for years, decided to walk in w my friend @ 11am on a sun... restaurant was empty, breezed right in!

didn't order much but both the prosciutto salad and cacio e pepe were truly to die for... did not disappoint and was def still riding off the high of getting seated right away

had heard reviews of the cacio being salty or slimy but did not experience that at all !! paralleled the ones I have had in italy with such good black pepp flavor
Good portion sizes on the food but I was slightly underwhelmed by the flavor. Servers were great and attentive. We went right at opening without a reservation and were sat right away.

The best pasta I tried while in NY. We stopped by and were told they had no open reservations but could wait. We waited and 3 minutes later had a nice table outside!

I got the side of mushroom and cacio e pepe. It was simple but perfect.

I've been wanting to try Via Carota ever since Taylor Swift dined here back in April!

My friend and I walked-in around 6:00 pm on a Thursday evening and were seated right away. Between the two of us, we shared nduja arancini, funghi and the famous tonnarelli. The portion size of each dish was great, we even had some leftovers. Out of the 3, my favorite was the arancini, which had a spicy and flavorful filling. I liked the savory cheese in the funghi entree but overall found the dish to be too bitter. The cacio e pepe was a bit of a letdown compared to all the hype surrounding it. I thought it was pretty bland and similar to all the other cacio e pepe dishes I've had.

Overall, the food at Via Carota is decent. I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to secure a reservation here or wait in a long line but if you happen to be in the area, it might be worth a try!

So glad I finally got to try this place! We came on a Tuesday around 5pm and had to wait 45min for a table inside..  which wasn't so bad. It was pretty busy already. We could've gotten seated outside right away, but our party wasn't complete, so we decided to get on the waitlist for indoors.
The menu is pretty big, good for sharing. We started with the beets, fennel salad, and fried calamari & shrimp. It was all delicious and refreshing. The fried seafood was perfectly done. Then, we had the cacio pepe, tagliatelle, and fried rabbit. The pasta dishes were well-executed, they didn't feel too heavy. The fried rabbit was a highlight, flavorful and crispy. For dessert, we had tiramisu and panna cotta. This was the right amount of food for our group of 3.

Service was friendly and attentive at all times. I'd definitely recommend coming here for classic Italian fare in a lively atmosphere.

Food was great, but the service leaves a lot to be desired. Our hostess Josie was rude and did not make us feel welcome. We had to wait for 45 minutes post our reservation time, and she was annoyed and irritated by us asking when we will get seated.

Wandered in for lunch on a Friday. Only learned after I dined here that it's one of the most hyped restaurants in the neighborhood. As an expensive whimsical lunch, a nice surprise. As a dinner planned two months in advance, a bit iterative.

Dropped into NY recently to catch sole shows and I had a list of restaurants to try, Via Carota being at the top of the list.

I got out of my Broadway show a little after 9:30 and took the train down to the  Christopher St station. I have to stay I was quite surprised they sat me but there were plenty of seats available. What happened to the city that never sleeps? This places closed at 11pm! People in NY used to go to dinner at 9:30 and 10pm.

The bar was full so they gave me a seat at a communal table which I thought was a great idea. I liked that as an option and more restaurants in LA should that. I think  République does this.

I ordered a lot. A cocktail, the bread, the cacio e pepe, the skate and the cannolis for dessert. The pasta is one thing everyone raves about and while it was good, I still thought it was on par with a lot of other restaurants with the same dish. The cannolis were pretty bland and the bread was good. The skate was the real star. Wish I hadn't filled up on pasta. That fish drenched in butter and lemon literally melted in your mouth. Amazing! So I amazing dish out of 3.

All in all, this does seem like a place you just go to be seen. I mean Dakota Johnson was sitting at the table next to me. It's just a tiny bit overhyped. Still good! The service was impeccable and they sat me immediately with no reservation. So thumbs up on all that! For the food, just don't expected too much and enjoy yourself. I'll be back.

Dined here twice now and sorry I simply cannot get the hype. I love love love their sister I Sodi but I simply cannot fall in love with Via Carota. None of the dishes I had convinced me, I even forgot their names (the pasta with peas and prociutto, the cacio pepe). I am the greatest pasta lover but yeah those are not for me. And the salad with prosciutto, way to much dressing.

But other people love it so give it a try if you make it in and make up your own mind. You'll find me at I Sodi (if I make it in there ;))

Just okay.  Mediocre food.  Tagliatelle pasta should've been more al dente and lacked flavor.  The Brussels sprout salad needed acid.

On top of it, we had a really condescending and inattentive waiter.

We visited on Saturday for lunch.  Perhaps we got the B team or maybe it was a off day for Via Carota but I won't be back to find out.  There are better, more consistent restaurants in the city.

Via Carota  is a hidden gem that I keep returning to, mainly for their outstanding Cacio e Pepe. This place knows how to get it right! The dish is impeccably buttery and creamy, with just the right kick of pepper. It's a taste sensation that keeps me coming back for more.

Not only is the food exceptional, but the service is also top-notch. The staff here is incredibly friendly and efficient, ensuring you have a memorable dining experience. They've got the quick service down to an art.

While I'm usually all about the pasta here, I recently tried their Tiramisu, and it was an absolute delight. It was decadent and packed with flavor - a perfect way to end a fantastic meal.

Via Carota consistently impresses me with their quality, and it's easily one of my favorite spots in town.

Finally got to mark this one off my list!

Amongst a party of three, we split the 'Nduja Arancini and got our own cocktails (Spagliato, Gran Spritz, Aperitivo Blanco) and pasta dishes (Tagliatelle, Pappardelle, Tonnarelli). I'd love to go again and try their other dishes to share for the table and order the Tagliatelle.

The interior vibes were intimate but still bustling, and there's two outdoor sections - a few tables that face the street (for a more Parisian effect) and right across are some heated tables.

We sat at 4pm on a Friday and we were glad we came early because the line was really long when we were done at 5pm. We enjoyed the lemon skate fish, Cacio e Pepe, and boar ragu tagliatelle. My favorite was the Cacio e Pepe since it was creamy and had the right amount of pepper. We finished with tiramisu for dessert! The service was good and the place is a cute restaurant. Remember to go early to skip the line!

This has been one of my favorite restaurants in the city for years.  Delicious food, and a lively yet cozy atmosphere.  

I was on my way home late on a weeknight and decided to try to make a quick stop for dinner at the bar.  My cacio e pepe was as delicious as ever, and the service very attentive.  

But I was just a bit let down by what felt like a lack of polish/upkeep - maybe needs a little TLC or revamp to keep it fresh.  And some more seasonal menu changes.  That being said, I was surrounded at the bar by regulars, and there is a reason for that - the food is great.

Okay Via Carota really is that girl. Taylor Swift loves it for a reason. The Pappardelle was very tasty, the tiramisu tried and true, and the Tagliatelle w prosciutto & peas was WHERE IT WAS AT! Great balance of richness with the sweet peas and nutmeg for balance and sharpness. That said my absolute favorite bite was the Zabaglione with berries, especially delicious during the hot summer with ripe summer berries. I could eat that ALL day long, and even made a version of it at home. Via Carota really is a little crown jewel, with reasonable portion sizes for the price and deliciousness I have to say I will certainly be back.

Solid Italian dining in the west village without being stuffy or pretentious. The service was on point and the space felt authentic. We got the pesto stracci and the daily pasta special which was a tortellini with caramelized onions. The artichoke bruschetta was so unique and flavorful - highly recommend! The svizzerina which was basically a beef patty/steak tartare was okay. The mushroom (funghi) with scamorza (baked cheese) was memorable though and unlike anything I've had. For dessert, we had the olive oil panna cotta and hazelnut chocolate semifreddo.

Came for a late lunch/early dinner on a Sunday. We sat outside under the heaters which are toasty enough. The menu is simple and has the cocktail/wine list on the back. Cocktails are not described and basic: martini with grappa instead of vermouth, manhattan, old fashioned. I asked for a cosmopolitan.. I know. How Y2K.. server said "we don't make them"... I asked what was similar. He referenced the above martini. I said OK how about a Diet Coke.. they don't serve those either. I get it- you want a vibe. But also- hospitality, no? Assuming these two requests come often enough.. wouldn't you have alternative recommendations at the ready? Instead they'd rather forgo an additional $50-80 in bar tab? Odd. Finally asked the waiter to speak with the bartender to see what they would recommend.  Their answer? Grapefruit juice & vodka. The grapefruit juice was fresh pressed..but that's the best cocktail you can make? Yikes.  Still. Our table had 5... so... a plus to them otherwise they would have missed out on the $.
Onto the food: had the chicken liver bruschetta. Taste good- but literally just chopped chicken liver. No fruit. No jam. No arugula.. nothing more. Grilled artichokes were sublime. Great charred flavor & excellent texture. The cacio e Pepe.. eh.. could have had more Pepe.. and the portions are teeny. The tagliatelle with prosciutto was better and seemed like a larger portion. Server never came to see if we wanted pepper or cheese. Weird.
Dessert was the tiramisu- best I ever had and I typically hate it. The panacotta had a weird bitter citrus jam on top that tasted as if it was made of rind and pith. No thanks. All in all. I have eaten better Italian at my local pizza place.

I walked in for Saturday lunch and we got a seat at the bar. Our server was very nice and had to recite the specials. We had the Cynar Spritz, burrata with zucchini and eggplant, wild boar Ragu, chicken, and affogato. The burrata was tasty and balanced with the side veggies. I wasn't a big fan of flavor of the Ragu. The affogato was the best part. That espresso was amazing.

This restaurant is worth the hype. Walked by on a Monday around noon, and got lucky with an open table for a party of 4. The bread and olive oil were amazing, and the cacio e pepe, pappardelle with wild boar ragu, and piselli salad were my absolute favorite. Love the classic Italian decor inside too. Excellent service. Will definitely come back!

We sat outside in their dining shed, and had a lovely experience at Via Carota. We managed to get a last minute reservation, by checking Resy week of, and when we arrived at 6:30 we were seated right away.

The service was excellent, and our server was able to help answer questions around dietary restrictions. They don't have gluten free bread or pasta, but the risotto and most of the vegetable, meat, and fish dishes were able to be made gluten free.

The risotto was delicious and the pasta was a hit, but the surprise favorite of our table was the Piselli salad. Highly recommend trying one or more of the salad/vegetable options.

Is it worth the hype and waiting in line for a chance walk in? Hard to say. It isn't the best Italian that I've had in NYC but it was certainly a fun experience trying it out and people watching!

Disappointing food. I was SO excited to try the infamous Via Carota- known for their cacio e Pepe and star-studded regulars- as it's been on my list to try in NYC for years. It's also owned by the same chef as I Sodi, its equally as well-known sister restaurant.

We were able to walk-in and get seated with only a 30 min wait for Saturday at lunchtime. Reservations are almost impossible to get, but they're one of the few "top restaurants" that accepts walk-ins.

Overall, the food was fine. Not great, not bad, just fine. I truly don't understand the hype? We started with the Gorgonzola, pear, and walnut bruschetta, and that was honestly the best part of the meal.

Then, my sister and I split the cacio e Pepe and one of their specials of the day, a ricotta tortellini with mushrooms. The special pasta had a lot of flavor, and it got better with every bite, but it wasn't my favorite pasta flavor.

Now, for the ever disappointing cacio e Pepe...when it came out it was very clear that there's almost no cheese on the dish- just some grossly torched mozzarella on the top. The pasta itself was homemade (you can tell), but there was ZERO flavor, so all you could taste were little pepper chunks. It felt like I was eating straight pepper...

The tables are close together, so we ended up talking with the couple next to us, and they agreed everything was simply fine. They also didn't get the hype.

We didn't get the salad, but it seemed like every other table in the restaurant did. When I tell you that it's straight lettuce (not even cut up) with no dressing- what are these people thinking?! It looked like they grabbed a bag of lettuce and put it in a plate and served it for $22.

Overall, would not come back as there are 17937161 better Italian places in the city. Also, this restaurant group is known for their rude service.

Although something neat is that they don't have any sodas because they make their own. My sister got the pomegranate soda, but it tasted like pure juice with no carbonation.

Oh...and the Trader Joe's cacio e Pepe is better than Via Carota's. I said what I said!!!

This place was very solid all around.  I went with a buddy and grabbed a reservation a month in advance through Resy, and given how notoriously difficult it is to get a reservation, I had high expectations coming in.  The staff was great and prompt, and the ambiance was very nice inside and a little posh which gives it a cool vibe. The food was good - I got a few dishes with some corresponding pictures below:

Arancini: not pictured below, but these were really really good. Light and crispy with chili oil inside gave it a very nice kick to the creaminess of the filling.

Cacio e Pepe: I've seen so many reviews claiming the best in the city, but this was so so and not worth getting again imo. The noodles were very very firm, and there was too much butter. Not for me unfortunately.

Tagliatelle: this was a very unique take on a tagliatelle inspired dish and I honestly was impressed, even tho it was heavy again on the butter.  The dish itself was like a butter cream sauce with prosciutto on top (the prosciutto was definitely imported btw because it basically melted in your mouth), with parmesan sprinkled on top. What made this unique was the use of nutmeg in the sauce which gave it an aromatic bite that reminded me of like a fall dish - very cool, and I would probably get it again.

Pappardelle: another classic, this was the best dish imo. This came with a boar ragu that tasted very similar to an osso buco like dish - with the Parmesan balancing it out the dish was very well rounded and the noodles were great (you can tell they're homemade too based on the texture, delicious!).

All in all, it came out to about $120 after tip with no drinks, so it's right in the price range of the nice Italian restaurants in the city (arguably with a bigger portion size than rezdora for example).  I think this gets in between a 4 and a 5 on yelp only because of the cacio e pepe, which again as usual is overhyped in nyc. Still very solid Italian food and if I could somehow score a res again I would def come back.

This place usually has a long wait for a table or during dinner always booked with reservations. My friend and k luckily got here at a great time (1:15pm on a Sunday) and were able to get a table right away.

Service was a bit slow but the team is very nice

It's a cute spot, of course nyc scaffolding really sucks and takes away from their cute outdoor aesthetic but inside is adorable.

Food is decent. Not the best Italian, my noodles were a little too soft but flavor was good. Cacio e pepe was cooked perfectly. Artichokes were SO good.

Pasta run about $25+, and medium sized portions.

Pretty disappointing. Took a lot of effort to get a reservation (practiced refreshing Resy right at 10am) and can definitively say it wasn't worth it.

We had mixed reviews on the food. We enjoyed the fried olives and the fried rabbit, but the cacio e pepe was very average, and the carrots were cold and bland, bad enough to be difficult to finish.

Service was also a bit lacking. They were running about 10-15min late on reservations, and service felt rushed. It was hard to get a hold of the server, and we had items forgotten from our order.

Disappointed. Went after a long day at work and wanted to walk in for a solo meal of wine and pasta. Was seated right away at the bar which was good. Ordered a glass of red wine, sad pour for what you are paying, got the parpadelle ragu, fine but nothing special, tiny portion. Dont need to go, there is plenty better, glad i crossed that off the list, wont be returning.
Side note, cocktails that i didnt get looked good and guy next to me's cacio e pepe smelled bomb. :)

I've tried several popular Italian restaurants in the city, and Via Carota was the best recently (my second favorite was Misi in Brooklyn). Via Carota not only makes fantastic pastas, but also it has lots of other choices for balance, like meats and vegetables. My favorite non-pasta dish was the Radicchio Treviso - which is grilled radicchio, with some soft goat cheese on the bottom and pine nuts on the top. It was super delicious!! Many restaurants have great salad, but barely has great cooked veggies.

Speaking of pasta, I ordered gorgonzola gnocchi and my friend ordered mushroom ragu stracci - the latter one was not on the regular menu, it was a special dish. Both of them were super nice!! I was going to order cacio e pepe, but had a craving for gorgonzola so I decided to try how it goes with gnocchi, and it turned out to be a delightful surprise! And mushroom stracci was also nice! The only thing that was not perfect was the stracci pasta sticked together a little bit - it didn't affect the overall experience, but could've been done better.

The fried green olives with pork was also great! Never tried this kind of combination and I liked it!

Last but not least - the dessert! They have too many dessert choices and I wanted to try them all - too bad I only have one stomach lol. Finally we ordered zabaione and coffee affogato. I liked them both! They were not super heavy or sweet, so they were perfectly balanced.

Finally I want to mention the services. Before I came here, I saw some reviews saying they were famous for rude services, but my experience was great. Our waitress and other staff were far away from "rude". They were super nice and considerate. When we ordered, we were too hungry so we ordered much more than we could eat, so in the middle of the meal, we asked our waiter if we could cancel the rest dishes that had not been served yet, and she very kindly did it for us.

Overall all, I loved Via Carota and will definitely come back soon.

I heard a lot about Via Carota, it is a bit overrated. The food is good but nothing worth going crazy about especially for the price! We had 2 different servers that night, which one of them was extremely rude. It's cute and intimate but a bit loud.
The mushroom was everyone's favorite dish. I definitely would not get the tiramisu again. It was pretty bad. I dont know that I will be going back.

My partner and I wanted to have an impromptu date night, and we were fortunate enough to get two seats at the bar at Via Carota (was around 8:30pm on a Sunday, place was packed). This Italian restaurant has been on our radar for quite some time and we were excited to be able to finally try it.

We ordered a couple drinks to start (the house Italian martini and a glass of rose); I would probably do one of their nigronis next time instead. The rose was delicious though!

The service was friendly -ish, attentive, and spaced out dishes at a very appropriate manner, which we greatly appreciated!

Now on to the food... We ordered a total of four dishes between the two of us (and yes it was a lot of food). But I do recommend 3-4 dishes if sharing with another (5 would've been perfect for 3 people). We started with the bruschetta with cultured butter and anchovies (little pricy, but one of my favs for the night), then got a generous portion of Frito misto (which tasted fresh and was delicious), then we got the famed tagliatelle pasta with prosciutto and peas (I recommend either this one OR the cacio y pepe - as quite similar in sauce), and last we ended with the char pork and onion dish (forget official name, but this was a surprise sleeper too!)

Overall, happy we were able to finally try Via Corota and happy with the dishes we ordered!

The best and most consistent Italian spot in the city.

The grilled artichokes are a must! My favorite pasta dish is the Tagliatelle.

In my Top 3 restaurants of all-time. When people ask for NYC eat recommendations, I point them to Via Carota. This quaint little restaurant transports you to Italy, with decor that reminds me of travels through Europe. The food is always a hit. Not only are the dishes tasty, but the drinks are also delicious as well. The Bicicletta is a great take on an aperol spritz. Although the dishes are smaller in size and pretty pricey, it is a nice place to splurge once in a while, I definitely think it's worth it to try at least once. Will be back many many times!!

The wine and the charcuterie was well paired. what a lovely board they presented. The cheese and meats and especially that fig jam was magnificent. The beautiful baguette they provided could stand on its own but what a great combo. If you Just order this, you'll walk away so happy with this restaurant. Do not order entrees or dessert.

The salted cod dish was bits of salted cod mixed in mashed potatoes. Mostly potato, almost no cod. But a pretty dash of chives cut perfectly lightens it up. The beef bourguignon had nice cubed vegetables but the beef was a chipped beef and very hard to chew. Very good work out for the teeth. Maybe this is a traditional rustic recipe for the most poor villagers who has the luck of getting some dried meat to present. In that case, extremely traditional. The sauce is very well seasoned. Can barely detect any red wine used in creating it. The strong seasoning is not amiss.

The chocolate cake is delicious with a molten center. Unfortunately we didn't order something to counter it. A pretty dessert wine will make a difference. The Paris Brest was not what I remembered having in Montreal - maybe that event for bicycling in Montreal got it wrong! The one in Montreal had a crispy light and almost brittle choux. This restaurant presented to me a different Paris Brest. It's still a circle but Maybe choux should be authentically chewy and a little chunky? Maybe it soaks up the cream flavor better that way? I did not finish my beef. My friend did not finish her fish. I did not finish the Paris Brest. My friend did finish her chocolate cake and I got a spoonful. That was lovely.

Waitress was attentive and lovely.

This is for the West Village location.  
Nice little place with a great lively atmosphere, packed when we went on a Saturday night, but everyone we came in contact with was wonderful -- our host and hostesses and our patient server got our group a nice spot with high top seats along the counter but the windows.
Place was dark and elegant and crowded but somehow felt open, maybe because of the windows and the warm lighting.
We only had a short visit this time and I had a glass or 2 of the Baptiste Aufranc artisan fleurie gustie charmin 2021.  But we've always enjoyed our nights at Vin.

I didn't enjoy being recommended an off the menu bottle of the house label Rose that was actual swill (and we were unable to finish it)...only to find out it cost $87 when I got the check. Am talking something so bad you would pay $8 retail for it. Come on guys, no one comes to a French wine bar to be ripped off like this

The service was good but the wine was very uninspiring. We came on the first warm day of the summer and it was absolutely packed. It only took 5 minutes to get seated but we left before even finishing our first class. The prices are cheap but for the most part the wine was very bad

I just left this place !! Amazing EVERYTHING about my experience. The staff were very friendly, the store OMG very nice and clean beautifully designed a lot of hard work and dedication in that place and it shows !! I got the grilled chicken and rice ice cream drinks all for under $20.00! it was very affordable and very tasty nice and very fresh . My new favorite spot definitely will be returning to try the other tasty looking items the have. Lol I would have taken a picture of the food before had I know it would be so good lol sorry I have no pictures

Just left this nasty food restaurant where there is flies by the already cooked food. This restaurant has the worse customer service I have ever seen. It's so many flies on the glass protector, I was getting ready to order a fly smh ‍ Just horrible ! The manager of this restaurant needs to fire this guy as soon as possible. He doesn't clean up and the customer service is horrible. The guy left 3 people waiting gave them cold food and had them wait and extra 15 mins ‍ Smh Get it together Village Chicken

So, it's across from my building, their neon signs have been lighting up my way home for years but today, today I went in for the first time. And I ordered a chicken sandwich (cause why not, it was $4) and tried their fried chicken, mash and slaw - and I must say I don't remember my excuse for not eating here earlier; I was so satisfied. Everything was juicy and tasteful, felt fresh and service was great. The location has really got a face lift from the renovation, super clean, great menu options, price is fantastic. Totally surpassed all my expectations!

Thank you Village Chicken!

(Only downside is all the packaging in these plastic/styrofoam containers... I don't want to ruin our planet for some chicken.. solve that and this is a 5+ star place)
If this place was not cash only, I'd eat here all the time. They just got a makeover. No more dining in. Nice clean facade. Amazing prices. Lots of options. Good tasty fried chicken.

I have only eaten here twice. First time it was a tad bit greasy (but, duh, I am ordering fried chicken). Second time it was totally outstanding. Fed myself and my two kids for $10 (mind you my kids will just eat 2.5 pieces of chicken and all the fries).  My test for great chicken is if it can get a bit cold, so you can grab it and head to a park for a picnic. Village Fried Chicken totally passed that test. As soon as the weather warms up, I am grabbing a 12 piece and some of their salads, calling some friends and heading to the park!
Forever my favorite place, clean, good comfort food. The people who work there are always lovely.

What's not to love about your local hood chicken spot?! With the chicken tasting the same at all chicken spots ie... Crown / Farmers / Kennedy you can't be upset.

Grabbed two wings from this spot to make sure it was certified AUTHENTIC and it got the HOOD APPROVAL! Seriously go in here and order 6 piece wings with a sweet potato pie and you will not be disappointed. Just watch out because sometimes they try to charge $1.75 for the pie but you gotta be like "Ayo what you mean $1.75??! $1.50 dats' all I got!!!!" Then the guy will say "okay okay my friend $1.50 for you." Yea... There's a NY thing when it comes to these places, know the prices get the prices. Know the food, good the food. "Wings and a Sweet Potato Pie around 9" yea that's it!
So much variety and options to choose from! Perfect for me cause it's halal as well. Highly recommend this place, love it!

The best fried chicken in Harlem! Super clean with many options on the menu. Not too greasy and always fresh, crisp and juicy. Goes great with their cole slaw, mac & cheese and milk shake. nom nom nom

What you see is what you get; fried fried and fried. Chicken, shrimp and then some uninspiring rolls and ok instant mash and gravy.
The kids find it yummy, but not as good as the competition on Fred D. Blvd.
Chickens always juicy,  tastes great.  Their crispy fries (seasoned) are so good.  They have coconut ice cream!  Wtf they're great!

I recently discovered this hidden gem of a pizza shop in Harlem, and I must say it exceeded my expectations. Their fettuccine alfredo was absolutely delicious, and the wings, especially when u order them extra crispy, were a treat. The food arrived still hot, which was impressive. I'll definitely be ordering from here again.

Ordered a few cheese calzones.  They were really good.  The filling was flavorful and fresh.  The dough was crisy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Very light and airy.  Was a wonderful find.  Will be ordering then again for sure.  Also want to try some of their other food too.

We called in an order for pickup (wings + pizza), and the staff was friendly and helpful. She also called again when our order was ready.

Our total came out to $30, and the food was hot and really good for a New York pie. We'll for sure order from here again.

Average pizza. Another quarantine try. They used to have a $10 large cheese pie, not anymore. This made it more desirable.
Garlic knots were large and probably the worst I've ever had. Will avoid them in the future.
The pizza is likely to get more tries due to quarantine.
Staff is friendly.

Cheap and cheerful great quality and tasty food!!!! A local fave and a hidden treasure in the Heights.

I've ordered numerous items from here and my fave would have to be the pizza

Should of checked the pizza right when it was handed in the box. But we opened it when we got home. What kind of Hawaiian pizza is this? Should of known when we asked for pizza with pineapple they looked at us like we had 3 heads.

Maybe this place got new management recently or something because I'm REALLY surprised at the low reviews this place gets.

This is a *SEAMLESS REVIEW.* I have ordered from this place at least 3-4 times now, usually on a Friday or Saturday when I'm feeling lazy/antisocial and want to stay in and "watch Netflix and chill"... by myself.

FOOD:
-The food is not handmade-mozzarella-just-for-you-with-unicorn-sparkles gourmet, but they use real ingredients and not some soybean oil "cheese" and never skimp on the toppings (see picture below). I can't even pick up my pizza at times because the thin crust doesn't support the weight of the toppings (this is a good thing).
-Sometimes the pizza isn't piping hot but just warm, and might require a brief reheating in the oven/toaster.  Come on people this is NYC in the winter and this is a mom and pop joint. If you want piping hot, order PICKUP. Pro tip: set your oven or toaster oven to boil for between 2-5 minutes until the cheese is fully melted for all delivery cheesy things in life.
-Their veggies are awesomely fresh and the chicken is white meat chicken breast. You can conceivably order a pizza that is reasonably healthy if you wanted to.

PRICING: I don't think their prices are steep at all. I just tried to duplicate my order on Domino's and it comes out to about the same. (Seriously...1 star ratings just due to the price hikes? Have you noticed the rent increases in the neighborhood? Tons of mom and pop shops are closing down because they can't make the rent. Be realistic.)

SERVICE: I've gotten calls from a female owner/employee pretty much every time I ordered to clarify my delivery order (yes I'm THAT girl who makes a billion modifications). I appreciate their communication. Additionally, the pizza has arrived within or under the estimated delivery time. This is mostly why I'm giving this place a 5 instead of a 4 star review.

CONCLUSION: A dependable no-fuss spot for decent pizza.
Solid pizza + decent pasta. This is based on me usually getting their cheese slices and their vodka penne. Excellent customer service.

This is the second time we order from this place while visiting new York. The first was through delivery and this time we ordered to go. The place was filled with customers waiting to order.
The cheese pizza and pasta is awesome here. Prices are fair. The service is quick and the employees are friendly. We have definitely made it a must visit pizzeria while in New York.

Victorio's Pizza Plus is simply remarkable. Overall, great atmosphere, ambiance, cleanliness and customer service. Most everything I've tried thus far have been quite great. The crew was very pleasant and service is extremely good. So happy with Victorio's Pizza Plus.

I am impressed, Victorio's Pizza Plus was truly awesome. Delicious menu items at good prices, fantastic atmosphere to unwind at. They certainly have a wonderful menu too. Team are very helpful and service is very swift. I would recommend Victorio's Pizza Plus to anyone.

Yea so when this place first opened I was very happy with it. I usually got a pasta dish -some type of sauce broccoli and shrimp. The food usually takes awhile but that was okay it was good and affordable.

Then one day I came back and they changed their prices! I was ordering from the menu they had posted on the wall (don't go by those prices anymore). When I went to pay it was a lot more expensive and for not as much food. You have to look at the prices in the paper menus!!!! Let's just say it's more expensive and not worth the wait (in my opinion). The pizza isn't amazing either.

It is clean and most of the people who work their are very nice. But it always seems to take a long time to pay and the last time I went the woman at the register was a little snippy.

It's nice to have a pizza spot in the area but I've switched my business to Mama Tina's instead!

Don't think I'll be going back.

OMG, Victorio's Pizza Plus was definitely terrific. Excellent service, nice atmosphere. They have a magnificent menu as well. All of the staff are incredibly friendly - you most certainly feel welcome and taken care of. Victorio's Pizza Plus is a must go, fantastic spot I am so glad to have found.

Absolutely HORRIBLE! Not only was my pizza wrong, it was under done. When I phoned to tell them ; the lady on the line was rude and didn't seem to care. In a city like NY it is a shame if not almost impossible to get bad pizza. Boy was I surprised.

Let me tell you, Victorio's Pizza Plus was actually great. Location and service was great. Every thing was very flavorful and I can not wait to go back already. Team are extremely helpful and service is really quick. That place is a must try! You will not be disappointed!

Ordered delivery.

Pros: 1) fast delivery took 26 min; 2) big choice of food; 3) easy to order online through Yelp.

Cons: 1) taste of pizza not super good; 2) chocolate cake is bad too , something wrong with a cream, taste is bad; 3) I don't like that on the middle of pizza everything is falling out.

Just ordered from them for the first time and I'm impressed. Ordered the sausage and pepper hero and chicken piccata and they are both delicious. Apparently the restaurant sent out the wrong pasta dish - they delivered a replacement before I even knew something was wrong. Great service!

Omg... this is the hidden gem of Harlem. I have ordered many things from this place but my god the penne vodka pasta and cannoli will have you seeing GOD. I can't even talk about how much I love it here. Just order it.

Umm....This place is not good.  Mediocre pizza served in an unclean setting riddled with flies.  A sign for $2 slices might bring people in initially, but the reality of the experience will not encourage repeat business.

One of the worst pizza places I have ever been to in my entire life. This place doesn't even deserve a review. Horrible service, super rude cashier lady, careless people serving pizza, dirty tables and poor quality pizza. Expensive for the quality and portion. I had to wait more than 25 mins for one Alice of pepperoni. I mean, come on!! When I told them I was leaving because they were taking forever and asked them for a refund, the slice was given to me in less than 30 seconds.
The staff is chatting and laughing away and seem to care less about the customers. Disappointed on so many different levels.

i've been in mandatory quarantine for almost 2 weeks and this place was suggested on slice. i took a gamble and ordered lots of different stuff so here's how i feel about their food:
margherita pizza slice: 9/10, can't complain at all
victorio's pizza slice (the white pizza with arugula and prosciutto): 7/10, a little dry
meatballs (side): 7/10, the meatballs are packed a little too tight so they're not as soft as i'd like
arancini: 6/10, it's one huge fried mess for $4 but it tastes pretty good
carrot cake: 10/10 super good and only $4!
chocolate cake: 10/10 also really good!!
sausage and peppers hero: 8/10 i ate it for leftovers and the flavor was great. not saucy, just straight up sliced sausage and green peppers

their covid procedures are pretty good too, they're alright at communication and delivery times. can't wait to visit in person once in person dining opens up!

For a pizza by the slice place, their pasta is pretty good too. This tends to be my go to delivery spot. The penne alla vodka is great! They tend to be a little heavy on the parsley for my taste. Lasagna is also delicious. Fettuccine Alfredo is flavorless though. The arenccini (?) tastes a little odd. Zeppoli's are good!

Edit****

So because this is the pizza place I pass on my way home I have been in a couple more times. Pizzas is still good and the staff attitude has improved
***************

It was ok as far as pizza is concerned. Not the best. Not the worst. It would have been 4 stars instead of 3 if the girl at the counter was not so rude. I have to many options for ok pizza and rude staff.

**Also there is a $15 min charge to use credit card

I am currently laying on my bed, extremely full, but happily drunk off delicious mozzarella sticks and wings. These wings were really good. And I would know--I order wings a lot. Like, a lot A LOT. Too much, some would say. No one has ever said that to me but I assume that people are thinking it.

My roommate even stole two mozzarella sticks from me while saying, "I don't even like mozzarella sticks but these are delicious!" So I feel like that's a pretty impressive indicator of how good these mozzarella sticks are. Wish I had the two she ate though.

Also ordered a slice of carrot cake. The guy delivering it gave it to me in two big bags which made me feel like he thought I was maybe having a party or something. But I wasn't. It was all for me. I regret nothing.

Except now I feel a little sleepy and 7.50 isn't a great time to be tired. It seems like an especially bad time to take a nap. Keep up the good food making.

They sell good stuffs over here. Since my boyfriend was craved for italian food so we decided to ordered from here for 1st time. And not disappoint!! Meatball was juicey and tasty. My chicken cordon bleu was great. Huge potion, not pricey and good taste. Delivery was on time, actually faster than estimated time.

Delivery review:
I Ordered 2 veggie Stromboli and a salad, requested side of marinara with the Stromboli... 1 Stromboli and the salad was delivered, in 55 minutes, no marinara side. Stromboli was lacking 2 of the advertised fillings (no eggplant and no tomatoes). The woman that answered when I called to ask about the other half of my order was unapologetic and seemed disinterested. Zero rush to deliver the missing order ... 30+ minutes.
Classic NY cheese slice and it's only $2. Which is a reasonable price compared to most NY pizzerias.

This is not a 5-star establishment, but it doesn't have to be. Prices are great for slices - I think I paid $3.50 for a buffalo chicken slice, and it didn't taste cheap. I think I heard them charge another person $2 for a regular slice. This is probably going to be one of my regular slice spots going forward.

So disappointed with this food and service. I ordered two large gluten free pizzas, that clearly stated they had 8 slices each. What arrived were two small pizzas, with only 4 slices each. When I called the restaurant, they said gluten free pizzas only come in one size (even though it says each pizza will be 8 slices). They refused to give me my money back and told me a manager would contact me, and they never did. I would not recommended.
Hudden jam!! I usually don't eat pizza because I'm lactose intolerant... but I can't help but stop here and grab a slice because it's so delicious!

I ordered take out last night of Chicken Parmesan, Penne A la Vodka, and a house salad. Both pasta dishes were above par for what you would expect from a pizza shop. Very good sauce on both dishes actual flavor in the sauce not just tomato taste. In addition the food tastes freshly made and not reheated. Both the woman on the telephone and the woman at the register when I picked up my order were pleasant, professional and efficient. I would definitely order from here again.
By far the worst pasta I've had in my life. Pasta was extremely overcooked and broken apart, which is insane. How can you overcook pasta to such an extent? What a waste of money!
Went into the restaurant around 4:00PM Monday Oct. 10, I had an Italian sausage and onion sub, which was to die for. You can tell the ingredients are fresh.

Decent pizza in the area is good to find, and the spot is clean, with seating for a quick bite on the way to the subway.

Plus- I left my backpack here and they kept it for me, untouched, until I could pick it up- an NYC miracle!!!

Recommended.

This pizza was good at one point I swear!!

My family has been seeking a new place to get our pizza fix since the previous place closed some time ago. I remember walking in here last year and getting two delish margherita slices. I initially got one and went back for the second because I was so pleased. Plus, they have a hefty selection of items and it was a win all around. Did I mention friendly workers? Win+

What in the hell happened?

My family ordered a pie from here a few weeks ago and it was laughable. A Margherita pie with pathetic slivers of cheese (85% sauce without a doubt) and not even hot. I had nothing but praise for this pizza shop and it didn't remotely live up to it. My sister got some kind of roll with cheese and possibly meat that she enjoyed, but I can't remember what exactly it was.

Despite this, I walked in the other day for a quick slice and it was like I relived the delivery pizza experience all over again. Somehow worse because the cheese wasn't properly melted despite being HEATED UP IN THE OVEN RIGHT BEFORE MY EYES.

Man, this honestly is some one star stuff right here, but I haven't tried other dishes and I am willing to give those a shot. The pizza shop I used to frequent had the most average of pizza, but their gyros and fries gave me life. So who knows, Victorio's might have slamming calamari or wings. I'm willing to find out, but avoid that pizza.

Decent for a quick slice and soda. Prices moderate. I had 2 pepperoni slices and a Pepsi...$7. It was served hot and crisp on the bottom. A little greasy, but still good. Make sure you get a few napkins and you should be fine. I wouldn't mind coming back.

Legit, great pizza and great people behind the counter. I'm new to Harlem and this is hands down my favorite pizza around. Fresh ingredients, a big menu (other italian dishes), feels like classic NY.

I'm thankful I tried this place, and very surprised w/the low review on yelp. It smells great when you walk in, like garlic, warm  pasta, basil, mozzarella (does that have an aroma?). The pizza is cooked well, not like the other garbage around.

This place deserves a 4 star average, do yourself a favor and try it out.

I was starving and happy to see a new pizza "joint" in my neighborhood. I walked in for my favorite Penne ala Vodka dish. I asked the cash registrant/manager for her recommendation and like the Italian woman I know pinched her fingers together and kissed them. After the assurance of an excellent meal I upgraded to a large and even added shrimp for an extra $4. The food smelled and tasted delicious. She is not the most smiley or hahaha friendly woman but she sure knows her food. There is a few tables to sit in there but probably best to order from the freindly delivery service guys who seemed to be in and out quickly and frequently.

The taste of the veggie pizza was good. I wanted a quick meal before heading to the airport. I appreciated the customer service from walking in to leaving out of the door. I'll make it a point when in New York to visit Victorio's again!

This is our favorite pizza place in the neighborhood, by far.

Also, we recently ordered from them via GrubHub and  even though there seems to have been a glitch on Grubhub's end (it reverted it to pick up instead of delivery when it processed... and we only realized this after the order was done and we were notified to pick it up) we called up Victorio's and they were helpful and even though they presumably already had a back up of scheduled deliveries were able to get our food to us pretty quick after we called, all things considered.

That being said, the pizza really is good and my wife really likes their wings as well. The pasta dishes are usually very good as well, though a bit rich/oily (which, makes for great tasting dishes, if not terribly healthy I suppose, lol)

- Jules V's husband

I've lived in NY for about two weeks & I've ordered takeout at least four times from Victorio's.  I'm slightly biased due to the convenience factor as it's very close to my apartment but everything I've ordered has been excellent-- even the salads are great (which are usually hit or miss at a pizza place). Their menu is huge, portions are generous and prices seem fair--I can't wait to try more things!

I wish I would have read the reviews before ordering. I ordered a large pie with mushroom one the whole pie and pep and jalapeño on half. First, they charged me for three toppings - whatever.

Apparently the instructions weren't clear. The restaurant called to try to clear it up but the guy who called had an attitude. Whatever again.

When the pizza gets here its half mushroom, half jalapeño half pep. Not only should they def have not charged me for 3 toppings but the mushrooms and jalapeños they use are canned.

I called them to let them know the order was wrong. Instead of nasty canned shrooms and peños I asked for just half pep. They refused to adjust the price and then delivered a medium.

At my wits end, I called grub hub to see if they could help. They called the restaurant but they still refused to do anything.

Needless to say, I'll stay away next time for any one of the 10 complete errors and refusals they made.

Ugh.
I used to order from here all the time, standard really, a salad, Philly Cheesesteak, w. onions and peppers, same order every time. Except today I order and there are two small problems; no dressing for the salad and no cheese on the cheesesteak. I call the restaurant to inform them of this and proceed to have the most ridiculous conversation of my life, talking to a defensive woman who insists that she put the dressing in the bag, and that I never ordered CHEESE on my CHEESESTEAK. Absolutely awful customer service, and I will NEVER be ordering from them again. So disappointing.

Live in RI when in NY, Victorio's my go to spot for lunch or dinner. Their food is amazing staff are super friendly and hard workers sometimes times it can get a littler busy but that only means one thing and is that people love their food. Two  up!
They make some really good pasta here. I like the seafood pasta with white sauce. Man, I'm getting hungry just thinking of it...
Awesome for delivery! Quality veggie pizza, cheese pizza was the right amount of greasy and it satisfied everyone that ate it! I will order here again!

Negatives first, the website stinks no printable menu. They are cheap with the tiny piece of side bread. The upsides are the pasta sauces are comparable to RAO'S. the menu is very ambitious for such a small place and done very well also the delivery was very fast. My new Go To Spot but definitely not for the pizza, not even their sauce can fix that Oooof.
The gluten-free pizza is a lie, do not order it if you have celiac, it made me very sick.

Also known as Victorio's Brick Oven and Pizza Restaurant on Seamless.

So I was a big fan of this place with their gluten free Italian options and quick delivery, hence the reason why they get the extra star.  That changed though with my most recent interaction with their customer service over the phone.

I had ordered a chicken marsala with pasta, gluten free option.  Get a call from their staff and she tells me the chicken marsala is not gluten free, which different sauce would you like instead.  She gave me some options and I said mushroom.  I get the delivery (friendly delivery guy by the way) and ready to eat my food. I noticed there was no chicken anymore.  I called the restaurant back and the same woman answers the phone. I asked why there was no chicken in my meal and she said if I had wanted chicken I should have said that. Uhh..NO you asked what SAUCE I wanted replaced and the fact that I clearly ordered in my seamless history that I wanted CHICKEN Marsala should indicate I want chicken.  Just because I want a different sauce doesn't mean to you totally take out an essential piece out of my order.  From an outsider perspective this seems like a miscommunication had happened.  I get it, sometimes mistakes and miscommunication happens. What I have issue is how the woman handled the situation and put the blame on me. That is rude and poor customer service.  Please remember what it is that you said, hold yourself accountable, provide more polite customer service and not blame customers for your error.  Thankfully I reached out to Seamless who had much better customer service and understood that I was not in the wrong, ensured I got my refund and gave me compensation credit for a future order.  

I'm sorry but not sorry to have take this out of my list of go-to delivery places.  Hopefully this woman learns better customer service or gets demoted/fired. See-ya Victorio's.

An avid eater of Victorio's! Moved to Harlem on 141st in February and can't count the amount of times I've ordered from here. It's my favorite delivery spot in the area by far. Great customer service, great understanding of my GrubHub orders, and always willing to fix any issue.

I recommend the Penne Alla Vodka (w/ grilled chicken), Grilled Chicken Wraps, and the burgers are always cooked well. Really good salads too. I love Victorio's!

Best burger I've ever had. Ordered via DoorDash. Food came quick and was still hot when it arrived. Idk if they specified that it came with regular fries and I just missed that part, so I ordered a side of garlic fries. I'm not mad tho. Will DEFINITELY order again. 10/10 would recommend

Loved the decor in this restaurant. You will be asked to check your coat, they don't allow coats draped over the chairs. When we sat down, that made sense. The chairs are not ideal to hang coats on and would take away from the aesthetic of the restaurant. They provide a mini table handbags.

We had the Toro, Black Cod, Sushi rice, Orange Sorbet, Brook trout, big eye tuna, cheesecake. Our favorites of those were the big eye tuna, sushi rice, and black cod. Of course, the signature cheesecake is super cute with the little mouse.

We were a little underwhelmed cocktail wise. Good visual presentation, but a little lackluster and sweet - we had the whiskey crush and elijah craig.

Food tips: Big Eye Tuna, Black Cod, Sushi Rice.

Yeah......... no.

Simply put this was just awful.

My party of 5 ordered different place and 2 appetizers and it was mediocre at best.

The wagyu steak my bro in law ordered he said was comparable to the basic steak and eggs he had earlier.

The pasta my wife ordered was barely cooked.

My gnocchi was nothing special.

The plates are also quite small and it kinda blew my mind when something didn't arrive, we informed the waiter, he looked around the table, and then asked "you didn't get it?" like no dude we didn't and you can clearly see it's not there.

No one enjoyed it and we're looking for another place to eat as I write this because we are HEAVILY DISAPPOINTED in this supposed Michelin starred restaurant.

1.5/10

I am spending sometime at The Dominic Hotel. I was planning to spend sometime drinking and eating at Vestry but the hostess with gold long shirt was so buy so rude that we left. We will never come back to this horrible place to couldn't care less about the customer. If I could give this place negative stars. I would do so. Probably the restaurant think we are not good enough for them. Maybe because we are not white. It would be amazing to know why we couldn't stay there. Very sad a Michelin star restaurant like that.

I forgot to say... she invited us to drink in the hotel lobby instead of inside the restaurant

We had the back table for 10 people with a minimum spend and prefix fixe menu. It just wasn't good. It is a beautiful restaurant, but our server was terrible and the food was worse. I was so disappointed, and so were my guests. Once course was a giant bowl of rice with fish eggs on it! Everyone was so confused. who eats a giant bowl of rice in between courses?! Nothing tasted that great. The dessert was very creative, but tasted just okay. I don't understand the hype this place is still getting.

I don't know how they received Michelin recognition. The presentation and service were pretty good however the food taste is below average. The cheese  cake was very interesting to look at for pictures but taste awful! I'm u sure if it is even safe to consume.

Known for their Cheese Cake, it is something special. One of the only places where you can have a mouse on your plate and not squeal.

Their cheese cake dessert tastes more like a cheese pudding in the form of a piece of yellow cheese you would picture in the movie Ratatouille.

Their bread and butter is amazing. Honestly the best part of the meal was the bread and the après so martini  

I was disappointed with the scallop dish. The scallops came out over cooked and then came back cooked properly but not hot.

Service A+
Atmosphere A+
Food B

I was excited to try this Michelin star restaurant, heard a lot of good things from my colleagues. Seating was tight, but the furs on the seats were a nice touch to keep them warm. They also had some outdoor seating if you prefer that with heaters. In the middle of the meal they raised the lights and turned off the music which was a little bit weird, it looked like someone was trying to wipe down some of the glass on the second floor or something. Ruined a bit of the ambiance during the meal as people commented.
