They weren't joking when they said thin crust and personally, I'm not usually someone who eats the crust at all but the dough here is absolutely delicious and I devoured the entire pizza. We came in on a Friday night and we're seated immediately but for a larger group I'm not sure if you would need a reservation. I also saw that they have some great lunch deals during the week so I will definitely be taking advantage of that. Can't wait to return!!

The best thin crust pizza I've ever had Delicious!! Very Casual vibe...
Excellent service. Hands down I Recommend this place.

A solid thin crust pizza and liked the bacon on top! The crust was thin but didn't get too hard and it had a good ratio of toppings to pizza. Also got the spinach salad but the pecans were rancid!!!! Even though any reviews raved about the salad (which was good minus the rancid nuts), don't think I'd get it again.

My favorite place to eat pizza when I visit NYC.

The pizza is delicious!  Great atmosphere and service!!

Absolutely the worst excuse for pizza I have ever seen! It was raw and looked like it came out of my grandma's toaster over. It is embarrassing that they serve such crap and then charge $18.00 for it. Tooo many good pizza places to ever eat heee

Very friendly owner who greeted us and seated my party of 9 right away. Clean utensils and plates, with very fresh water. Not bad of a space for medium size groups! Our salads were amazing and they came out pretty fast. The pizzas have thin crusts, but they are firm and won't be saggy. So it's easy to pick up and eat!

The Big Pineapple pie had small pineapple slices in the center and I wish there were a bit more all around ):
The Classica Margherita was, as its name states, a classic.
The Meat Lover's Pie was a bit too salty, and I wasn't able to finish the slice.

An authentic NYC pizza dining experience in the unique Murray district, Vezzo offers up a delicious thin and crispy crust pie that is not to be missed.  We went with a simple pepperoni and mushroom pizza ... loved every bite of it!  Highly recommend this place for the food, friendly service and entire dining experience.  It's everything you'd hope a New York neighborhood dining experience should be.

I wasn't at Vezzo for a year.  I was looking forward to their thin crusted pizza.  The crust was great but something was wrong with the cheese.  It was extremely salty.  I'll try it again in one month to see if they've changed back to their delicious cheese.

Want some fire pizza in NYC, but tired of the same ol' shitty 99¢ greasy slice of cardboard with absolutely no substance or flavor? Then Vezzo's is for you.

House pies are very fun and creative. Tried the Salsiccia Dolce (we added portabello) and Parma pies. The Salciccia Dolce was about as refreshing as a pizza could get, with the apple and arugula complementing the balsamic perfectly. The flavors were bussin and i think i ate like 2x what i should've. Also, the thin crust was so perfectly crispy and made the pizza angelically light amidst the many layers of toppings.

A nyc pizza must-try!!

I'll have to come back here in person, but we did delivery and this review is on a food-level basis.

We ordered the 9" plain cheese pizza and it was okay.  By the time that it got here, the pizza was cold, but I don't think it's a knock on the restaurant.  Willing to give the pizza a second shot and will order a different one next time, but I can't spot the difference between this and any other slice shop.

What did impress us was the Pappardelle Carbonara.  It was really good and I could've eaten this all night long.  The pasta was creamy and everything from the meat, mushrooms, to sauce converged tastefully in mouth.  I'd recommend getting this dish.  For sure.

Super buttery and fluffy garlic bread! I really liked the Big Pineapple pizza. Our group also ordered a meat lover's and a margherita, but those were a bit dry and the meat lover's was definitely on the salty side. That being said, the crust was amazing -- it was like eating pizza on a chip! Might come back and try some others.

Solid artisanal thin crust pizza. The two of us easily finished a pie given that it was so thin. We got margarita and then prosciutto and arugula which was good but not what we expected as the prosciutto was cooked. It was more like like burnt prosciutto pieces. It was good, just not what we expected. Small but nice selection of wine bottles and service was attentive. I would go back.

Vezzo is our go-to thin crust pizza place in the midtown east area! I was particularly impressed by the Milanesa this time around which had the perfect ratio of cheese, chicken, and greens.

Moreover the pastas here are so good, not to mention the crunchy perfectly toasted garlic breads. The pappardelle carbonara with shredded chicken & mushroom was amazing and perfectly seasoned for me. The penne vodka is also a top choice as well.

The dimly lit ambiance is a nice plus as well as friendly service!

Probably the best thin crust pizza I've ever had. I'm honestly not a fan of thin crust usually but this place may have changed my mind. I highly recommend eating this there while it's hot and fresh out of the oven. It was my first time so we tried 2 personal pies, half pepperoni and half cheese, and another with half the chickpotle and mushroom specialities. I would definitely recommend this spot and can't wait to go back!

Best thin crust pizza in town, south of the 34th.  Perhaps north if the 34th too ;-).  Balance indulgence in pizza with excellent salads to reduce guilt, if you need to!  Nice family oriented ambiance.  Good service--tho that is table stakes for NYC, right?

This definitely hasn't been one of my favorite places to eat at. We got there for a weekday dinner and the inside was full due to the rain, so we were seated outside.

The service was really slow - we were there at the same time as another group, but the server didn't serve us/didn't see us (?) and went in with that group's order, and then came back out and then went straight to another table that came after us :( We finally managed to get our order taken when I went in to ask if we could just place an order there for us to take it to eat outside.

The pizza itself was quite okay - I definitely do like thin crust over normal pizza. However, while it was good, I would probably not recommend this place anytime soon - there are a ton of other places around the city!

Excellent thin crust pizza. Great lunch specials too
Really enjoyed having lunch here
I love the thin crust here n all their salads plus outdoor seating . We saved room for bread pudding too. So good!!!

First time going back after the pandemic and was sad to see that they completely changed the interior. It's not as nice as it used to be inside and it's much smaller too now. They also surprisingly didn't have an outdoor dining option, just a super tiny indoor area.

We ordered two large pies, the mushroom and the meatball pizza. The crust was as delicious as I remember pre-covid but the meatballs on the meatball pizza was not great. It also seemed like they changed their menu quite a bit. So overall the whole experience was a bit underwhelming.
Absolutely amazing  great vibe. Attentive service. Good value.  Great meal.  Best in the city!!!
Very good pizza, with great topping options. Service was also lovely, one complaint was that the salad was a little over dressed. Great outdoor dining option!

I love the whole Grain Crust Pizza and the wings were pretty good.  I must go back to try even more pizzas with that particular crust.  The thin crust is a must as it's just the right amount without the guilt.  I also loved their Greek salad.  I will be back, for sure!

Really good thin crust pizza spot. They have a few different branches throughout the city all with a similar if not same menu. The pizza is so crispy, perfect thin crust. I highly recommend the Milanese and the mushroom truffle if you like truffle. I've also tried the chipotle which was really good. They have build your own options as well but I decided to stick with the house pies. Personal sizes are great if you want to try multiple flavors and share. The wine is inexpensive and pairs well, I got the chanti. Def recommend this neighborhood gem. They tend to be a bit busy, walk in only, so best to be prepared on that.

This place caught my eye while in an Uber on the way back to my hotel. Looked it up and saw RAVE reviews.. figured I had to try it. NO REGRETS. The ambiance is great, and it wasn't super packed, which I was pleasantly surprised with.

First off, everyone else on here is absolutely right - the thin crust pizza is phenomenal. Definitely worth the almost $40 price tag. The large is good for 3 adults who can eat. The pepperoni is so spicy and flavorful, it was truly delicious. The thin crust makes me feel better about eating as much of it as I did!

But the true hero here.. was the Spinach Salad! With thin cut pears, craisins (cranberry raisins), and the lemon vinaigrette.. ugh. Even my never-orders-salad father wanted to steal it from me. I'd come back for the salad alone, but don't get me wrong, the pizza was *chef's kiss*

Came here last Friday night for dinner with my friends. I thought the quality was pretty good and I like how the crust is thin and crispy. I'll come back again if I'm around the area and I'm in the mood for pizza.

Worst Pizza. It's like eating a thin piece of cardboard. No taste... You call this NYC pizza. I call it cardboard... Will never eat here again.
Banned for life.
I wish I can do no stars!!!!

Was looking for NY style pizza and some calamari to take back to my hotel. The pizza tasted pretty good, but was limp and textured like it was on a soft flour tortilla. The calamari didn't taste fresh-- kind of rubbery and lost its crunch in the takeout container. Maybe it's better  when you sit down and are served fresh! But the textures were off-putting in the takeout order.

Great thin crust pizza at a very reasonable price.  They also have gluten free crust and pasta available.  The prices for food and drinks are great - especially for NYC.  Very friendly and attentive servers!

The website says they have vegan pizza. But they only have vegan CRUST (which is true of pizza crust in general).  They don't have vegan CHEESE.  They tried to convince us it was fine since the cheese was gluten free. Not the same thing!

Returned after many years.  Only had the meat lover's pie after learning they no longer do pastas after a recent fire. Pizza was very good, though a bit salty.  Service is super friendly.   Looking forward to coming back for the shroom pie.
Very delicious food. Super fast service and the beat happy hour deal! Accommodating staff as well.

The Classica Margherita is a must. Out of all the pizza I tried in NY for four days straight it was my favorite and something i could see myself eating multiple times a week bc it was delicious and also light. I will come back just for this pizza.
Delicious thin crust pizza. The pineapple one and the sweet Italian sausage pizzas are great. Caesar and kale salads both delicious too.
Service good but the pizza did not taste the same.Cheese too salty as was the sauce

Came here around 5 on a Wednesday with a friend. We were the first group here for the day and had our pick of seating. We sat in their outdoor seating set up, which is cute and sturdy. We did their happy hour special which is daily from 3:30-6:30. You get a free large plain pie with the purchase of any bottle of wine or pitcher of beer. The pizza is very tasty, super thin crust and flavorful. You have the option of pay the difference if you want toppings or their house pies. Service was excellent. Great options for wine, definitely something there for everyone!

A gem of the neighborhood
Food delicious!
Service great!
Atmosphere A+
Thank you for my great beet salad

Unfortunately, my experience was an unpleasant one. It was my birthday and we had made a reservation for the restaurant week pre-fixe menu. The appetizers came 40 minutes after we ordered it and were miniscule.  It should not have taken 40 minutes for two small pieces of food.

We were consistently asked if we wanted drinks, but were not given any food to supplement the drinking. Not even a bread basket that I saw other tables receive. Every table around mine was checked on, but the waiter never checked in with me.

The restaurant ambiance was nice, but their customer service needs to be worked on.

I

Am

In

Love

I mean, seriously, I cannot rave enough about how perfect they made our night and experience, how comforting, how relaxing, how wonderful our entire night and every single aspect of that meal was.
These are the rare finds in this city that bring you back to where you've always been called to.

I am fully smiling writing this review, I was fully smiling telling my mom about the place this morning.

I am fully smiling like I have a crush on Villa Berulia -  I do! I do have a crush on Villa Berulia.

From the moment we sat down we knew it was just going to be a perfect night, exactly the vibe we wanted. The staff treated us like royalty. They were the absolute best and I hope I tipped very well.  
I will be back monthly if not weekly!

Almost Indescribable is the best way to describe every bite of every dish. Talk about a breath of fresh air!   It's a place that feels like home because it's in our blood and it's a place like Villa Berulia that must be cherished, supported, and kept around forever.  

For last night alone, it will be forever in my heart.

If there is one thing you could do for me, it would be to give this place as much business as you can.  It's a very reasonable price and the night was priceless.  

I truly hope the staff sees this and feels my utter appreciation and gratitude for a wonderful evening.   I want to thank them for the freebies, thank them for the service, thank them for delicious food, and the best ambiance we could have asked for.   There is simply nothing we could have asked for further.

I will be giving them all my money.  

I'm calling HR and making them the beneficiary to my retirement plan haha

Villa Berulia is my entire Murray Hill Heart

They can easily accommodate large parties and have private party rooms! We had a party of 20 heads! Very delicious Italian food but def on the smaller portion size

Service 5/5
Food 4.5/5
Ambience 4/5

Skip the beef and go straight for the ravioli & pasta

5/5 taste
5/5 price
3/5 portion
5/5 service

This place does very typical Italian food. All the classic dishes. Although it wasn't the pinnacle of Italian cuisine, all the food was solid. The fish was amazing and the dessert was heavenly.

I like this place because the prices seem pretty good. $45 for a restaurant week course is decent. $13 for most of the glasses of wine is pretty typical--can't complain there.

My only gripe is with just how small the portion sizes for the restaurant week dishes were. It was literally a few bites. The whole course couldn't have run higher than 500 or 600 calories.

I don't know where to start. So awesome. The place is small but that's a good thing. Waitstaff 5+ stars. Food 6+ stars. Price is totally worth the experience. Bottle of Wine, apps, two entrees, after dinner drinks and cheesecake. $160. More than reasonable. Highly recommend.

I went to this old school restaurant with five others around the month ago. They had a party in front (I believe a firm merger or something similar) and I've heard that a lot of spots around here choose this place for their corporate events. As this was the case, we sat in a backroom along with a few other groups but the area back there was nice. The restaurant is way bigger than it looks on the outside and the space inside is comfortable. The server was very friendly and gave good recommendations. They gave us two things at the beginning includingsome bread topped with olives, sun-dried tomatoes (similar to a bruschetta) along with a mix of breadsticks and a loaf. To drink I had the Paper Airplanes which is essentially the same thing as the official cocktail known as the Paper Plane. The drink had bourbon, Aperol, Amaro Nonino, and lemon juice and it is one of my favorite cocktails partially since Amaro Nonino might be my favorite type of amaro and therefore one of my favorite drinks in general. The drink has a bitter and sour element with a touch of sweetness and the version here was nice. The server went through a few specials and some of the people partook in them. This included several appetizers as well as several mains with one of them being a beef stew that I might have preferred over my main dish. Some others started with a salad (special avocado, some tomato based one, something else) and someone else got another appetizer which I don't remember.

As my dish was $52, I decided to just go with a main dish which was the osso buco with gnocchi as my accompaniment (with the other choice being over over arborio rice) and I got the daily vegetable special as my side dish (which was $10.) The massive dish arrived with the vegetable with the osso buco on the plate and once I let them know, they very quickly replaced it with the gnocchi. They came over with some parmesan to put over the gnocchi which was nice. The braised veal shank fell off the bone and it had a nice richness and very good flavor though I would say that some of the parts weren't braised enough as there was a little bit too much chew. My only other complaint was that I would have preferred a little bit more gnocchi but the small amount that was there had a perfect texture. My side which was a mix of three vegetables (zucchini, carrots, and spinach I believe also judging by the photo) sauteed in olive oil was alright. The portion size was plenty especially for a nice place like this but the olive oil flavor wasn't strong enough so I found it slightly bland but the other people enjoyed it as the portion was big enough to share especially with the massive shank. Two other people got the buzara which is a Croatian (specifically Dalmatian) stew which is either in a red (na crveno) or white (na bijelo) sauce and they loved it. I didn't try as there was some squid in there as it was with mixed seafood. I tried the Tortellini Alla Berulia which consisted of said pasta with a bolognese sauce and some mushrooms and they were perfectly al dente and I would maybe get an appetizer and get that as my main next time.

For dessert, I went with the peach sorbet stuffed into it's own fruit shell or sorbetto alla pesca di ripieno I believe. There was also the same thing with lemon sorbet as well as a flourless chocolate cake, tartufo, and something else (I think a cheesecake but I'm not sure.) The dessert was presented nicely and it was very tasty. I'm unsure if they use some brand or something but I found it tasty. I believe it was maybe $10 or something similar.

The food here was good. Nothing extraordinary but then again I don't tend to find Northern Italian food to be the best. I can see why they've been in business for ages though as it was solid and the service was nice and the portions made it more worth it as well. Upper 3.

You will not find better service than Villa Berulia. Owners Alex and Steve make you feel like family. The restaurant is pure warmth, authenticity, and serves up fantastic food and drinks. Perfect romantic date night spot in Murray Hill!

"Old school" restaurants are me & my family's favorite!!! Decided to come here for Mother's Day & was so happy with everything. From the hospitality to the food to the decor! Pleasantly surprised to hear it has a little bit of Croatian background which made us feel even more welcome!
They have "live music Wednesday's" and a Portuguese night / Croatian night coming up soon that I plan on attending!
I personally was a big fan of the mushroom risotto! The desserts were my favorites - we got Apple strudel, chocolate mousse & torta de la nonna & it had to have been the best torta de la nonna I've ever had! (& I've had PLENTY). So fresh! Def recommend!

Greetings and salutations yelpers. This spot is in close vicinity of the job and the pics on line looked awesome plus they are seated so it was on my list to try. Decor very nice pleasant staff. I ordered the grill calamari and baked clams casino. I was very disappointed. First I'm used to calamari in little pieces not 3 large pieces. It was very chewy and rubbery I could not enjoy. The baked clams casino has a weird taste and the bacon atop was not properly cooked. Also did not enjoy. It was not an enjoyable meal but I am willing to give it another chance and order other items.
Recommend 100% for anyone who loves Old School Italian in a Midtown neighborhood spot.
Great ambience, food and service. Close to ferry from NJ and convenient meet up in the city spot.
The food has been the best Italian I've had in New York. The ambiance was perfect. Additionally, both my entree and pistachio cheesecake were delicious. Service also can't be beat. Thanks!

Wish I could rate this place 10 stars. Outstanding dining experience. We arrived a little before 4pm on Wednesday evening. There was only one or two other tables at this time. We had some time to kill before a show so we intended on leisurely enjoying our meal. We were immediately offered water and bread. We ordered a couple of glasses of wine which were reasonable priced and good. We decided to split the soup, a salad,sol, and lemon meringue pie. Everything except the desert was suggested and tasted fabulous. You could tell everything was very fresh. Each dish came out with timing so that you could enjoy the previous course. They split everything for us giving us two plates which made sharing and presentation great. The Flavor of everything was incredible. We were checked on multiple times by the manager and staff. We finished up with coffee and a complimentary peach schnapps. When we left they were starting to get busy and we can see why. This is a don't miss it restaurant if you are in the city. We will definitely return the next time we are in in town.

Sometimes a restaurant knows how to treat their customers right so they'll want to return.  This was true of Villa Berulia. In making a reservation online, I casually mentioned we wanted to sit in a quiet area and also that we'd be celebrating a birthday. So we went and the food was very good.  The service was exceptional from the moment we walked in.  That was a good feeling. After dinner, and to our surprise, the hostess brought out a slice of birthday cake with a candle and offer us after dinner drinks on the house!   I was totally and pleasantly surprised.  How nice.  We'll be sure to be back soon.  When we eat out, we love a dining "experience".  That's exactly what we got at Villa Berulia.  See you soon.
Excellent food, atmosphere, and service.  It definitely deserves a try.   Highly recommended.

February 2023
My daughter and I ate here our first night in New York City. We love Italian that is authentic but different than what you find typically just anywhere - and Villa Berulia really delivered.  Our waiter, Al, was delightful and entertaining.  The food ( I had Pollo Berulia- large portion), the wine, the dessert and the service were top notch.  The tiramisu was made in house and the best I've ever had.    Loved it!
Easily 5 stars, not only was the food amazing, but the service was that much better!! Best Italian in NYC

A 3.5 star restaurant in my book. Ambience is very 'old-school' and it seemed like 90% of the restaurant were regulars. In fact, the couple that came in after us greeted everyone by name and were ushered to their seats before we were even acknowledged by the host. In all fairness, the couple pointed at us multiple times saying we had gotten there first, but the host insisted on seating them. Granted, loyalty is great, but we also live in the area. As a couple many decades younger than the average clientele, we could also be potential regulars...now, not so much.

Apart from the host, the service was decent. We shared the Clams Oreganata which they thoughtfully split into two portions before it got to our table. We ordered the Farfalle ai Scampi and the Buzara (traditional Dalmatian seafood stew). The farfalle was supposed to have truffle oil but we tasted none. The buzara was delicious and the seafood was plenty. However, the shrimp in both of our dishes were cooked beyond death. They were so rubbery and hard that I couldn't look past it (hence the 3.5 stars and not higher). I wonder if it's because that's how the regulars like it, because the rest of the seafood (calamari, mussels, clams etc.) were cooked perfectly.

We shared homemade tiramisu for dessert and it was delicious. If I come back to Villa Berulia, it would just be for the tiramisu and a drink or two.

Basically, don't order shrimp in any form and you'll be okay.

I've lived next door to this gem for 4 years and can't believe I just had my first meal there last night. Amazing thoughtful service (a very clumsy guest at our table spilled his drink and we were promptly handed a new one) with even better food. The Caesar salad was so crisp 10/10 and do yourself a favor and order all the dishes that have the word "Beruila" in them. Vibes are super cozy and they basically let us shut the place down. Will absolutely be back to see my new friends Alex and George!
Fantastic atmosphere with candlelit tables, knowledgeable servers, myriad authentic Italian food options that are delicious. Owner is a great guy, too!

Cozy place with wonderful bar for drinks. This is quite a gem in midtown east. The stag were really helpful and wine selection had great options . The portions can however be quite big. We tried their special squid linguini and the special menu for NY restaurant week , and mozzarella caprese as appetizer . Everything was just perfect with friendly and helpful service staff

Found this place on an app with ~25% off, so my boyfriend and I decided to try it. Turned out to be really good!

When you enter this place, it feels very cozy. The lighting is dim and while it does feel ~romantic-, it mostly just feels comfortable. Everyone seems to be regulars and the servers seem to know a lot of people by name. This place was pretty lively when we went around 7PM on a Thursday, and most of the customers seemed older. Loved the vibe and the family feeling to this place. Made me wanna be a regular!

We ordered a glass of wine each, a merlot and Shiraz. Both were filled to the brim, and I enjoyed the Shiraz.

For an appetizer, we ordered the fried calamari. It wasn't too oily or salty and the tomato sauce that it came with was fresh and delicious. While it was fried, it didn't taste unhealthy. Thoroughly enjoyed this calamari and we finished it in like 5 minutes.

For entrees, we shared a tortellini and an Osso buco. We were lucky in that the flavors of these two dishes paired really well!

The osso buco was literally AMAZING - the meat fell off the bone. The bone marrow part was also good and it was just overall very well done and flavored. The gnocchi was a bit lacking, but regardless I would HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend this dish.

Tortellini was also great. Again, I enjoyed it more because of how well it went with the osso buco. The flavoring was good, not too salty, and a really great sized portion. Nothing to complain about here.

At this point, we were SUPER FULL.... but for some reason, decided ordering a tiramisu was the move. It was definitely a decision I did NOT regret. The tiramisu was really large in size (which left us even fuller), but we finished the entire thing because it was GREAT!!!!

Honestly, I have nothing negative to say about this place. Service and atmosphere is great, and food is delicious.

Still the best in the area.  I go there regularly and have had office parties also.
Went back for lunch today with 2 clients.  They were truly impressed .

This cozy "Old School" Italian restaurant continues to shine amid challenging times. From the warming welcome to top line service to - of course - the extensive menu family and friends will leave with smiles.

Our recent dinner for three included shared appetizers of Baked Claims Oreganata and the Mozzarella Caprese (mozzarella, tomatoes, red peppers) - plently for the table. Two orders of "Vitello Alla Griglia" (king veal chop) was tender and flavorful. The grilled Atlantic Salmon was a winner as well.

Looking forward to our next visit...

I've lived in NYC for a number of years and frequently walk by this restaurant.  I finally decided to give the restaurant a try, and I was blown away.  I've been missing out on among the best Italian food in NYC.  The caprese salad and chicken parm were outstanding - fresh, perfectly cooked and delicious.  I look forward to returning with friends and family.  This is a hidden gem and must visit restaurant for a high quality Italian meal.
Excellent date night spot. the place is an institution. Get the Chicken parm it's just incredible.
Yummy osso buco. Fast and pleasant service. Really delicious. I had it to go due to our traveling and they accommodated our request. Will be returning.

My friend and I enjoyed our meal here (aided by the fact that the two of us downed a bottle of prosecco).  The eggplant rollatini appetizer was terrific.  We shared it -- but next time I'd probably get one just for me. I had chicken parmesan and my friend had sole.  The entrees were a tad expensive, but we were happy and full.
Can't believe I never ate here before. It was delicious, beautiful place with exceptional service.  Restaurant week menu was great.
Atmosphere was nice but the food was truly pedestrian. Nothing so out of the ordinary that it would warrant a trip into Manhattan for it, e crept to get together with friends.

Unclear why this restaurant is so highly rated. We ordered 2 pasta dishes (ravioli and spaghetti) and one chicken francese, and were severely underwhelmed. For starters, the bread was stale, dry, and lacked flavor and we were served cubes of prepackaged butter. However, the bread was the best part of the meal. The spaghetti and chicken were flavorless and the ravioli was dry inside. For the steep price tag, we expected much better quality
This was the perfect date night spot! The food was absolutely delicious! All staff members were friendly and attentive. We were given complimentary wine after dinner. We will definitely be back!

I thought this was a real hidden gem. Unfortunately its a bit hard to find because of dumb scaffolding outside, but god damn this is excellend Italian food. Started with the mussels which were in an excellent white sauce. Ordered the tortellini as a main course which really blew me away. The portion was huge so you def get your bang for your buck. The tortellini was perfectly cooked and the sauce was so unique and tasty. I generally dont even like tortellini that much but hot damn this was good. Service and overall atmosphere were great as well.

This is the best Italian restaurant I've eaten at in New York City. The outside is a bit unassuming but the food and service is top notch. You'll have some of the best hand made pasta, and the veal is perfect. It's all done amazingly classic Italian style and I haven't had a meal here I haven't liked. The service is amazing. They're accommodating, ensure you like everything you're served, and love to give you their full attention.

Needless to say, this is my new to go. I'll be coming here as frequently as I can. Oh, and need I say happy hour M-F 4-6pm with tasty wines, beers, and perfectly mixed cocktails? Seriously, check it out!!!!

What a spectacular place! We hosted a milestone birthday here for my great aunt, and from the very first email to the minute we walked out the door after the party, the service was impeccable. Alex and her husband Stephen make you feel like family. They made exceptional recommendations throughout planning, the party packages are a great value, the food was to die for, cocktails and wine were outstanding, and we are truly sad the event is behind us. We will be back (a lot). Highly recommend for anything from dinner with friends to a special occasion celebration!

What a wonderful experience! Such a classic restaurant! Service was impeccable and the food was excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed my lobster and shrimp linguine. I'm surprised I didn't come across this place earlier. There aren't many delightful eating options in Murray hill and so I was very pleased to come across this timeless restaurant.

Manhattan is very much a Cafe culture city. Our local bars and restaurants become our extended family. It's what makes this City great. We lost a lot restaurants over the past couple years. So having the ones make through this difficult period is wonderful.  Villa Barilla is one of those places that is a iconic local place. Been around for close to 40 years. The food is great and the staff and owners are awesome. Just as important the place is packed and feels like pre-covid.  Very much worthy of your dining dollars.

I would give 6 stars if I could, or ten. We looove coming here. The staff is always very warm and welcoming. We haven't had a bad experience here and we come here at least three times per month for the last two years.

We have brought our parents visiting and they loved it too. We always have the same dish because we love it, but having tried different stuff it was always great.

I go for the grilled salmon with red sauce and my fiancé for the Dalmatian Buzara (seafood pasta with marinara sauce). They make it spicy per request and are flexible to accommodate any changes. My fiancé has tried similar dishes in NY buy says no one compares to  the one here! Hard to beat!

And we love the Croatian wines and desserts cart :D

For more years to come!! Save our spot this weekend!

We came on a trip to New York and we just happened to run into this place as we walked the streets. It has an extremely cute exterior and it is even cuter once you walk inside.

We came in without reservations on a busy Saturday night and they were still able to accommodate us right away. The manager was extremely pleasant and the servers were quite attentive. We were given several options for food and drinks, which by the way were delicious!!
I am not sure what I ordered but it was the chicken special of the day. The chicken and veggies were so tender and had the right amount of seasoning/sauces. The spaghetti sauce was the best I have ever tasted!

All in all, this place was amazing! When I return to New York from LA, I will make sure to stop by again!
Favorite NY local restaurant. Always great service and food. Always my go to place when visiting NY.
Food was fresh and plentiful.  Staff was professional, helpful and friendly.  We had pasta with shrimp.  Loved everything and enjoyed the evening.  We'll be back.
Excellent dining experience. My family has been eating here from almost the beginning. Service, food, atmosphere and the friendliness of the staff is wonderful.

Service is homey and polished. Traditional Italian. Felt similar to the places I went to as a kid.

Eggplant is a A+ best in NYC
Ravioli is a B good sauce but think they need a better supplier
Grated cheese is a C tasted as it it had a lot of cellulose in it  
Osscobucco A- generous portion but a bit gamey

Fabulous food. Fabulius service. Fabulous homey comfortable feel. Cannot wait for Covid to go away so I can go back.  I'm thinking Chicken Berulia...no, Veal Parm...no, Lemon Sole...no, clams, salad, pasta, eggplant, risotto... think I will want it all!
Old school, awesome Italian spot.  The service, the host, the food, the wine-- all absolutely superb.  Loved my night here!

Awww this was the sweetest place! Came here in fall 2017 to celebrate me getting a 770 on the GMAT exam :D

Romantic, fancy little restaurant, very sweet older waiters (who said we looked cute! And seated us so we could look across the table and see ourselves in the huge wall mirror), white tablecloths on circular tables. Very nice atmosphere, calm and sophisticated :) There was almost no one in the restaurant besides us, so once again it was just us haha ^.^

I got the Tortellini Alla Berullia (Ring-shaped cheese-filled pasta in a light cream bolognese sauce) and he got the caesar salad with chicken and a glass of wine. Portion was good and food good also!

Would be happy to come back here :)

A friend of mine recommended this place.  We enjoyed it but it was not great - but it was good.

The lasagna had way to much cheese and  less meat then  expected. I ordered veal with spaghetti and got mashed potatoes. The veal portion was small but tender and tasy.The veal parmesan the other folks got and mushroom risotto got rave reviews. The bread choices were excellent.

We did not go for dessert - and frankly the waiter, whose charge  this is - did a less than stellar job in trying to convince us to be tempted.

The manger was friendly and gregarious, the wait staff cold but efficient. However, I like to be asked if we are finished and if the plates can be cleared, not string a finger in a circle over the table with a singe word, "done"?

Overall just ok, would like to try again and track and trend how they are.

A great restaurant in midtown Manhattan.  If you don't look closely you might pass it.  Service is great and food is even better.

One of my favorites in New York.

Good service. Good food. I ordered soup and salmon and it tasted well. Bread and butter was good too. When I entered the restaurant, the smell wasn't too pleasant. When the server lighted the aromatic candle at my table, it is ok.

The ice cream was amazing. Honestly cannot beat the creaminess and insane flavor. 10/10
Loved the atmosphere. You just felt instantly happy when you walked in with the bright but calming colors. The service was very kind and scooped a gracious amount.
It was a small hassle to walk through the building and find it but it's worth it for the jaw dropping taste.

Ice cream was creamy and good! The ingredients tasted of quality! For its price tho, I think we have better options :)

Service was good! The server was accommodating and patient with me!

Ambiance is great, cute design. Matches the brands vibe.

Loved it!

This was quite the busy place for a Saturday evening but I understand given the unique ice cream flavors they have.

I had tried a 2 scoop Marionberry cheesecake and PB Brownie honeycomb. Both great flavors. Had the chance to try whatever flavors desired before officially ordering. This was quite pricey for ice cream ($9 for 2 scoops). Next time, I think I'll just buy a pint

Love all the different flavor choices! Staff was so great letting my try so many options before picking which one I wanted :) I love the little quotes in the walls inside ! The ice cream was creamy and had great texture plus flavor. I love the facts I get a cone with the cup !

The service here is pretty fast, considering that it's always packed every time I've been here. The ambience is really cute and has outdoor seating as well. I really like the flavor I got it was vegan cookie dough, not too sugary and still pretty good. A lot better than their pints available at target lol.

Really good ice cream! The flavors are wonderful and the texture is perfect. I h had the cookies and cream. My friends ordered the coffee and the strawberry and both were good as well! A little expensive though. Was about $7 for a single scoop.

A strong five star review. I sampled three or four things and they didn't seem bothered by it. The ice cream was excellent, the customer service was excellent, there was a bathroom inside to wash off my kid's sticky hands, there is room for everyone to sit and enjoy. If you're trying to find good ice cream on the upper east side, this is where you want to go.

We stopped by just before closing and still got a very friendly, warm welcome! This was my first time trying Van Leeuwens and all of my friends raved about the honeycomb flavor, so of course that was what I had to try. The ice cream is really delicious and really creamy. It's very clean inside and there's a couple seats to enjoy. It would definitely be cheaper to just buy a pint from a grocery store, but where's the fun in that? Excited to come back to try all the other flavors!

Words can not describe the love I have for ice cream And this place does not disappoint. So unique in flavors and creativity. Hard to find good ice cream in general let alone dairy free/ vegan ice cream. Honestly, from a ice cream connoisseur their vegan options are just as good if not better than the regular ice cream. I normal place a picture with a review but I've never seen three scoop go so fast!

It's open! Great place for ice cream in the area. Ice cream is enjoyable all year round, even during winter. They have seats inside. Friendly staff. I didn't think I would like the vegan ice cream, but I tried it upon the staff recommendation. Is delicious! Had the vegan brown sugar cookie dough brownie with the waffle cone. This new location is very close to the 72nd St Q train and buses.

Ive tried theVan Leeuwen sold at whole foods and thought it was fairly good. For some reason the storefront ice cream taste a lot better. I had the vegan strawberry shortcake and the cookies and cream. One of the best vegan ice creams I've had. They ran out of the whipped cream so was not able to try, but next time I'll get a sundae.
So yummy, I love their earl gray ice cream. Staff was very cute and gave us very big scoops!
Best ice cream in uptown NYC. Has multiple locations around Central Park. Must try Lemon sorbet.

An exciting addition to the UES neighb! Much shorter lines than the 2nd Ave location and if you're lucky enough to get Yerial as your ice cream scooper you'll really be winning  So grateful for the great service, fantastic recs and her patience through our flavor indecision. They have fantastic vegan selections that taste just as good as dairy if not better and be sure to go on Tuesdays for a free topping
On the more expensive side but I thought the ice cream was worth it plus the staff was friendly. There is also a good amount of indoor seating!
Love that there are both traditional ice cream flavors and vegan options, fast and easy service, limited lines and all around great quality.

This Ice cream was nasty. I tried three before I settled on strawberry. The strawberry ice cream had so much cream and not enough strawberry flavor. It almost tasted rancid like if the cream used went bad. Not good.

Discover an incredible spot for genuine Brazilian cuisine that has been delighting taste buds since the late 1800s. I relished their chicken fillet with perfectly seasoned rice and beans, accompanied by freshly cut fries. Each dish was a testament to their commitment to using the freshest ingredients and crafting meals to perfection.

Have been coming to this place for several years now but not sure if I will ever go back after the rude behavior by the employee behind the salad counter today.  

Think twice before you finanacially support this establishment.

Food is good, lots of variety. All day breakfast. The service could be better. They won't have patience for you if you have a family.
It's almost like they don't want your business. I would have returned for a few days because I liked the food.

There should be a zero stars option. DO NOT under any circumstances order from this place if you want to be charged money for food that is NEVER delivered and be treated like trash in the process (don't complain later, you've been warned).

I decided to give this place a chance and ordered from them for the VERY FIRST time via Seamless. What a miserable mistake that was. Of course, the order NEVER arrived, and of course, when I called to inquire about the order an incredibly argumentative guy answered the phone and said his delivery guy had dropped it and taken a picture. I told the guy a million times that no one ever ringed my apartment so that I could grant access to the building and that there was NOTHING outside of my apartment door, but he just kept speaking over me and treating me as if I my only goal was to steal a meager piece of chicken from him. Who knows where the #$%^#@ his delivery guy dropped my order but it sure as hell wasn't HERE!

I hanged up the phone as I refused to spend more time trying to convince the guy that they were actually charging me for something I never received. I contacted Seamless and they were shocked at how bad this was handled by the restaurant and how sketchy the whole thing was. They immediately gave me a full refund. Won't ever order from this nightmare of a place.

Don't do it. There's much better and more reliable options in the area.

Extremely overpriced. Tiny portions. They will nickel and dime you for everything. A slide of Turkey and two spoons of vegetables is $19. Also asked for a splash of soy milk in my coffee (literally said a splash) and they said that would be another $2.
The food itself is fine, it's just extremely overpriced for a mouselike portion.

great prices and food! I come every day for my iced coffee on the way to work, and it's the least expensive one i've found in the area- plus its great coffee! staff very friendly and efficient. would recommend !

BEWARE!! If we had a dollar for every time we found large bones in their chicken we would be rich! The buffalo chicken salad wrap had multiple bones on separate occasions and needless to say today we ordered a salad with breaded chicken and this bone was is it. We did call and tell them about it in the past, they offered a free coffee for the inconvenience. A coffee?! Really? This is really dangerous, they need to do better someone could choke or worse!
Delicious food. Fast and courteous staff. Quick in the morning on the way to work

Been coming here for months and today will be my last day didn't even order today.
Every time I come the atmosphere is nice until I get to the register. The food is like a buffet style you choose what u want and they put it in a bowl and "heat it up" for you. My food  is always cold and luckily I have a microwave in the office to heat it up. The people making my food try to be generous when serving BUT  if the manager or supervisor is there that will not happen
They will skimp ur food and heat it up for 30s on a  Flat top grill -___- meanwhile the veggies are burnt as if they left it on the grill .today i went in and there was just scraps left during lunch hour the busiest time  I didn't even order ... not paying 14.99 +tax for chicken and 2 half sides not even full sides rather spend the extra 2$ and go somewhere more filling

Veritable just showed up today when I turned a corner. The scaffolding has it hidden. It was the outside seating that appealed to me so I went in. I was taking photos when the manager questioned why. I said I was planning to eat and hopefully do a favorable Yelp review. I said it looks like a very nice place with fresh food. He thanked me. At that point I told him I needed a restroom first. He said they don't have one. I said I thought food establishments had to provide one. He explained it is 18 tables or more that require a restroom. I learned something new. He didn't know anywhere nearby I could relieve myself!

After all that I decided I really needed to eat too. I told myself I'd grab an empty table and then order. I think Sunday's must be turning into my French Toast Day. That's what I ordered. The place was busy and it was taking what felt like forever. I explained to the food preparation employee that I needed to use the restroom but wasn't allowed. I told him I hoped it wouldn't be much longer. It appears all the sandwiches and breakfast bowls came first. Plus people ordering bagels and spreads were getting their food. Finally mine arrived prepared just as I ordered it. It definitely was my least favorite of the three restaurants I've had French Toast recently. The price was right at $7.08 with tax. French Toast was $5.50 and a $1 for adding fruit.
Will I return? I feel conflicted about an answer to that question. It's really 3 or 3 and 1/2 Stars. The bathroom privilege is important to me. Speed of food preparation is important and the employee had trouble ringing it up like no one orders French Toast with fruit.

I'm going to leave the decision up to you. The prices are good. They didn't ask for proof of vaccination, and the hand sanitizer near the door was empty. They ARE very very busy so I guess I can excuse them and give them Four Stars. Especially for the nice men that prepare the food! I felt like they would have let me use the restroom if it was up to them! Plus it's Marathon Sunday and that might add to their business today.
Reliable Breakfast spot with freshly made sandwiches/entrees that appropriately address the morning hunger. $9 a dish. 4/5 stars as a breakfast spot.
Nice spot for an iced latte on the way to the subway! Had a variety of pastries I'll have to try next time I'm in the area.

Best tuna sandwich EVER! I'd also like to add that there was an issue with an item that I ordered and when I called the location they were happy to help and ended up giving me a refund. Great customer service.
Very good fresh sandwiches and hot meals. Not Deli style but cooked on premises.  Roasted Turkey is roasted on premises. Not your typical deli.
Veritable has amazing takeout. I love the variety of veggies and they are all cooked perfectly. The brisket is a family favorite!
The best iced coffee, iced teas and sprinkle cookies. And their hot foods are. very good too.

Veritable, based on the experience I just had, is running a pricing scam. An item (banana walnut bread) costs $3. The sign says $3. The clerk said $3. The price charged? $3.54 "including tax." That's a tax rate (18%) more than twice the legal tax (8.875%).

Could it be the sign was wrong and the clerk was wrong? He insisted it and he was right. So where do you think that additional almost 10% goes?

This was probably the best breakfast I've had in NYC...from the service, perfect cappuccinos to the perfectly toasted bread and bagels. They buttered my toast, which I absolutely love when the restaurant butters toast while still warm and the multigrain bread was absolutely delicious!  For 4 people we paid $41, not a bad deal in Manhattan. The service was exceptional!

I picked up pre packaged food from the refrigerator and I got home and opened it and it was moldy!!!! I was hungry so had to walk all the way back to get a refund. It's inconsistent food here. Also I've asked for food to be hot and it wasn't. They also have a weird system where they keep taking walk in orders before they finish your placed order so you wait longer. It's a good location and good choices and average price but food is so so.

I am a big fan of Vertiable after my first Grubhub order. I will order again soon.

The quinoa with berries and bananas is wonderful. Lower carb and more protein than oatmeal. Yum.

And the omelet wasn't flat and brown like most cheap bodega omelets.
Good potatoes too. Spinach/cheddar/onion plentiful.

Delivery was fast and food was hot.

I'm not going to walk down to 1st for breakfast but I will order online. And definitely going to try for lunch and dinner. Healthy and delicious.

I've been trying to find an affordable yet delicious breakfast/brunch spot in the area and I found the perfect place. The breakfast is very affordable and absolutely delicious. I got the three egg omelette with three toppings. It came with home fries and toast. It was plenty and I was super satisfied. It's a great spot. I fully recommend.

Swung by here to grab a quick breakfast before my friend went off to work. It was pretty empty but service was a tad slow. I got the 3 egg omelette and they only allow you to pick 3 ingredients to add in your omelette, making it really hard for me to decide. It is a good place to grab and go on your way to work. Nothing too fancy/special about this place.

They sell excellent tiramisu that's moist at the bottom and creamy at the top. You can really taste that rum and it's not overly sweet! There's also a great tea selection with a variety of fruity green tea options.

But they also have the dirtiest and smelliest bathroom in the world. I wish I hadn't gone in there. Seriously debated between 2 and 3 stars rating bc of the bathroom situation.

For $9.95, you sure get alot of food. So you get to pick your protein (southern fried chicken, jerk chicken, ribs etc...) and 2 sides (mac n cheese, mashed potatoes, roasted broccoli, roasted sweet potatoe etc...) and a sauce (gravy, lemon tahini, marinara etc...)

The food is really good and plenty for the price. Great value.

It's clean, modern, and they have about 10 tables and plenty of chairs-ppl are friendly and helpful.
I dined in and just they had reheated my food more + the street is super noisy and they had the door open. These are minor things so overall this place is good for a complete lunch.

Salmon just melts in your mouth.

Came here for a quick bite on Thursday for early dinner. I got the "build your hot meal" ($9.95), which consists of one protein, two sides and a sauce. I went with the salmon for the protein. Btw, salmon is additional $2. So for the sides I went with grilled vegetables with tomato sauce and macaroni and cheese. I also got the lemonade and iced tea combo mix for the beverage.

The salmon isn't a large piece or anything but it's the perfect amount if you're getting the combo with the sides. Seasoned perfectly, moist on the inside, just falls apart in your mouth. Mac and cheese tasted healthy, if that makes sense. Yeah it was cheesy, but it was definitely not drenched in butter or mixed in with other types of cheeses if you know what I mean. As for the grilled vegetables, they were delicious. So was their beverage with the lemonade and iced tea combo. It wasn't tart like I expected and was really refreshing.

If you want something healthy, this is the place for you. They also have other drinks, a wide variety of pastries, omelettes to customize as well as sandwiches, salads and soups. I just poked my head in because I was around the area and was so hungry that I couldn't wait until dinner. I just needed something quick before I went to eat my real dinner consisting of not-so-healthy options.

The build your hot meal was perfect for one. You can also share it if you don't want to get too full from it. Also, feel free to ask for hot sauce if you'd like. Overall, staff are friendly, it's spacious inside with lots of seating and plenty of healthy eats to choose from. I can imagine this place getting packed though during lunch hours. I'd probably come here for lunch every now and then if I lived or worked around the area. It's just a convenient place to grab and go. One thing I'd recommend is perhaps having the staff clean/wipe down the tables afterwards for those who don't clean after themselves.
Great customer service, super patient and very friendly. Food is also spectacular. So many options and good price.
Wow. This place is amazing. So many options and all so good. If getting a bowl get the yogurt dill sauce! The chia pudding is incredible and I love their Buffalo chicken lettuce wraps.
Fresh food. The guys behind the counter are nice and quick. Expensive. The owner is nasty.

This place is great. Came recommended by someone my husband works with. They have a special where you can get a meat and 2 sides (daily generous portions) for about 10 dollars.
My husband and I tried the salmon and jerk chicken (like rotisserie) both very good! A lot of variety. Sides were mixed vegetables, green beans, Mac and cheese. Mac and cheese is a cleaner version than what ppl are probably used to. But still good. Plenty of side options!

I looked at a lot of reviews about bad service. Last few times I have been there service has been great and very friendly. Like going out of their way friendly. So maybe management took note and made changes?

They also have a pastry/dessert/coffee section. And that is the reason I LOVE veritable. I'm picky with my lattes. I got an iced latte that was excellent!! Would definitely get it again. Quality coffee. But the real winners are...(drum roll)...the STUFFED COOKIES!! I've tried every flavor. Exceptional. Amazing. When ppl come into town and visit I always take them here. Warm gooey. They have a double chocolate stuffed with white and milk chocolate. A sugar cookie stuffed with strawberry Vanilla filling. A red velvet stuffed with cream cheese.
There were nights where I would go to bed proud of myself for resisting the STRONG urge to walk there and get another cookie. I will say tonight my husband and I stopped in and grabbed a double chocolate stuffed cookie and brought it home. Later after dinner we warmed it up and ate it with mint chocolate chip ice cream. It was the greatest thing ever.
Needless to say this place is EXCELLENT

Been here for breakfast several times while in NYC
It's clean, well priced, and fresh!
I love the oatmeal bar where you can choose which base cereal you like, and choice of healthy toppings... Nuts and fruit
Pancakes and waffles are not pre prepared as they display but they are cooked to order here and very good!
Eggs are also cooked to order and not greasy.
Staff is nice too just wish their hot coffee was a better quality... Their iced coffee tastes better
They also have a quick grab and go case and I've had a good chia pudding.
Will try lunch on my next visit!

New healthy option deli/ cafe!!!!
This place is awesome! They have salads, great warm meal options, cakes, pastries. The people are really nice there, and they let me try some of the meats because I was debating between which one to choose for the main. I actually like the face that they don't too many sides because it can be overwhelming at times. Better less variety and higher quality which I think they do. Will be back to try the other entrees!

This place has quality salads that are worth it for the price. I've never had a bad experience with the quality of the salads. They taste so fresh and this is why I keep coming back.

I have a difficult time ordering (apparently none of us can hear each other). To obviate that I just write everything I want down on a sticky-note to make things easier.

Decent Food but Disrespectful Staff  
I work right down the street and I used to get coffee, breakfast and lunch here frequently. The coffee is decent and the food is usually pretty good but can be pricey depending on what you get. However, after multiple instances of the staff behind the register being rude, unwelcoming, and confrontational, I won't ever be returning. Other colleagues of mine who also frequented Veritable had similar experiences with unkind staff and rude behavior. Fortunately there are many other places in the area to get good coffee and food.

Needed to kill time before a doctors appointment so stopped here.. freshness is advertised on every window but was disappointed to get a stale and definitely not fresh croissant.. ice coffee and bagel with egg and cheese were good and reasonably priced. Appreciated the contactless pickup from their app which offered 25% off. Had a few chairs outdoors with shade - overall did the job.

The coffee was already overpriced and on top of that there was an overcharge. I asked for an iced late which is about $5 and change. With almond milk and tax it came out to over $7. I asked for the receipt and I was charged twice for a non dairy milk (.72). They should learn that having repeat customers is what keeps your income consistent, not cheating them.

I really want to like this place- they use Balthazar bread and there's a lot of seating/clean space inside. However, I got the caprese sandwich today and the mozz was sliced thinner than a Kraft American cheese slice, and had a pitiful amount of tomatoes and pesto. Not worth 10 bucks at all.

Best value in NYC. Food is quite good. The jerk chicken sandwich is awesome. Much of what you can get is fresh made to order. Desserts are so good...maybe too tempting.

Staff is super nice. I don't understand the negative reviews but maybe if you're rude then you get back in return? I've only had positive and friendly experiences here. Lived on block and probably have been there 50 times.
Food was fine but the portions are minuscule, even by NY standards. $15 for half a piece of salmon, a scoop of beans and a 10 Brussel sprouts? Stingy!! You're better off going to Dig Inn.

Ok Veritable you have my attention. $9.95 gets you a protein and 2 sides! What a bargain!! Especially for the UES!  Well portioned, delicious entrees and sides prepared with quality ingredients. From crispy southern fried chicken, to melt in your mouth texas brisket, to tender roast turkey, to spicy jerk bbq chicken, to vegetarian meatballs,.. you can't go wrong. Yummy sides like mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, roasted sweet potatoes, roasted broccoli, green bean almondine, kale and quinioa, and many more.. Nom nom! They also have a creative menu of sandwiches and salads made fresh to order, desserts, baked goods, and a coffee/tea bar. Wallet friendly breakfast sandwiches, pancakes, waffles, and eggs..  ($5.95 omlet with 3 fillings and toast!).  Oh.. the fresh lemonade is gooood (specially the blueberry lemonade !!). I usually take out or order delivery but there are a few tables to eat in. Is this fine dining? No. But It's good food fast!  Bon appetit!

Just came in for coffee but all their food looks good and fresh. I couldn't turn down the scone and was definitely yummy with my coffee. Good for a quick bite and to get inside to hide from my hay fever

I stopped in for a quick bite before meeting friends for happy hour drinks.   They had a good lunch/dinner option of one protein and two sides for 10.95 but I was looking for something smaller.  
I picked the beet salad from the to-go section and ordered a small lentil soup.

The lentil soup was underwhelming. Lentil soup isn't my favorite but this one was flavorless.  
The beet salad, which looked promising in the package was nothing but beets, two cubes of feta cheese and a sparse walnut or two.  I like beets, but I thought there'd be more cheese or nuts hiding under all of those beet cubes.  

The food did its job (sustaining me though happy hour) but I would rather go to Subway across the street next time.

I love the food here. The food is fresh, flavorful and you get a lot of it for a great price. I love their hot foods that come with 2 sides as well as their breakfast, desserts and matcha! They have a ton to choose from. Great addition to the neighborhood.

Comfortable UES neighborhood cafe where you order in the back at either of 2 food stations and then order drinks at the cashier station. Self-seating; bus your own trays.

My gf ordered the "meal" - a protein with 2 sides for $10 -which was too much food for me (planning to have a big dinner that night so didn't want to eat too much). I had a grilled ham & Swiss sandwich which was pretty good. The mango ice tea which the cashier recommended when I asked her whether she preferred that over the matcha ice tea was pretty good, too. A decent lunch for around $10 in the UES is a good thing. My only complaint would be that the tables are not regularly cleaned after customers leave.

I have visited Veritable several times during my 2 week trip. Coffee was good. It's not SB, but they price it that way. I ordered a plain toasted bagel with plain cream cheese. The lady in front of me ordered a plain bagel with butter. There was a bit of confusion for some reason. I just knew I wasn't going to get what I ordered. The lady pushed into my hand and TOLD ME, it was mine! Went upstairs, my mistake, I should have checked it immediately. It was a buttered bagel. I went back downstairs and showed them, and she motioned to get in line.  Lol, I'm not getting behind 10 people to fix and order you f'd up. When I told her to keep it, she motioned me to the counter, now she was ready to help me first, as I was walking out. That's the last $3.25 you are going to get out of me. Next!
Expensive for coffee which tastes like Dunkin. Haven't tried the food but if i'm going to pay $5 going to go to Birch down the block.
Really great quality and range of food. Great addition the neighborhood!!!

My girl friend and I were so excited to try our new neighboring coffee spot, but unfortunately walked away beyond disappointed. It's beautifully designed for an in-and-out coffee shop/cafe, but the ingredients were not fresh, the baked goods were dried out and the coffee was poor.

More on the coffee: the barista clearly lacked any skill in using the espresso machine. The milk was scolding hot, and I burned my mouth; the coffee was burnt; the flavor was unpleasant; and lastly the foam had little froth.

Very disappointed overall, I'm sorry to say. Perhaps the management will take this into consideration and will up their game a bit. It's a pity this comfortable spot was a raging disappointment.
Paid $3.50 for this bagel "with cream cheese" come on! That is ridiculous.  Every time I come here I always say "I'll give it one more chance" ... think I'm finished with this place forever.

Dry food, with small portions, and an unwelcoming atmosphere.

I was running late for dinner due to errands and what not and decided to stop by here at 8:30pm. By that time, 3/4 of the menu was unavailable. Their sandwiches, soups, breads, and some of their meats were unavailable, even though the restaurant was open for another 1.5 hours. I ended up having to settle for a dry piece of chicken, some boiled broccoli's and fries in a food-tray-esque container. I know this place is not supposed to be fancy, but I'm literally sure I could have gotten a classier, better quality meal at the MCDonald's down the street.

Maybe the bakery part is better and maybe my experience is skewed due to the fact I came a bit late, but I really do not have much good to say about the place. Nothing horribly wrong with the place, but for the price, they should do better.

Great place to go to for all meals of the day. Food is always consistent. The reason why I took a star is because in the evening the food can be dry from time to time as a result of it staying out for quite some time. But otherwise always a good choice to go to when you're in the need of a quick food meal.
Ever-y-thing we are ate was  fantastic! Vegan shumai are you joking me?!? Whole menu was off the hook. Do yourself a favor and drop in to this spot. So unassuming, so memorable. Loved it.

If soup means slices of veggies mixed in a veg broth then I'm give up. in name of veganism you can't alter however you want. I was expecting a nice thick pumpkin soup, this is a big disappointment.
Next comes steamed veggies.. guess simply half boil the veggies with pepper and your job is done. There is no need to add salt or little garlic to add flavor.
I had to blend the soup and cook it more myself and cook veggies again in garlic to make it edible.
This place is a joke. Money wasted.

Ginger root restaurant was closed permanently
New owner , new management , food was going downhill.  I ordered pad Thai Vegetable, it taste off, very strong fish sauce, and the vegetables seems from last week, won't be back

Stopped by for lunch at this great Vegan Asian restaurant. I had the Eggplant String Bean lunch special $10.50 and it was delicious. Started with a miso soup and the lunch plate of sautéed eggplant with string beans with rice and also includes sweet potato and a vegetable roll. I'd like to try another item but I may get the same thing next time.

作為亞洲同胞，日本人，我第一次嚟呢度，佢係世界頂級嘅素食主義者。
素食龍蝦卷好正。
我支持好多素食亞洲餐廳，因為我係停止亞洲仇恨運動嘅一部分。
As fellow Asian, Japanese, my first time here and it's vegan top of world delicious.
Vegan lobster rolls are amazing.
I support many Vegan Asian Restraunts as I'm part of Stop the Asia Hate movement.
Great food! Order the sweet & sour sesame protein and the portion was huge and delicious

My boyfriend and I went to Ginger Root before a spa appointment nearby. Otherwise, it's not a place I would have gone, as it's sort of off the beaten path, far away from any tourist attractions. There was a bit of confusion as to the opening time, as some signs say 11:00, while others say 11:30, but we did get in shortly after 11:00. We both ended up getting lunch specials, which come with a decent miso soup, a nice spring roll, brown rice, and a slice of pumpkin. I got a soy protein dish that came with pea pods, while my boyfriend got a seitan dish with kale. They were both pretty good. And the price was also really good.

I wouldn't travel to the Upper East Side just to go to the restaurant, but if you're in the area, it's a good place to get an inexpensive meal.

I was craving more vegetables and tofu in my life after eating out a few too many times this past week and felt that I needed a little bit more green in my diet. I came to Ginger Root for take out on a weeknight. Ginger Root is located on the UES and is a specialty vegan Asian restaurant. It looks like the menu is mostly Chinese dishes but they also have some classic Thai dishes. They had tofu and saitan as meat alternatives.

I ordered in the restaurant and waited for about 15 minutes for my food. I got the Teriyaki Tofu which comes with steamed broccoli, brown rice, and miso soup. The miso soup was pretty tasteless in my opinion. The Teriyaki Tofu had a sweet flavor and I liked the crispy edges of the tofu. The dish is served over a bed of bean sprouts. I was pretty surprised I finished the whole dish! Overall good vegan Asian place on the UES.
Their homemade dim sums are so delicious.  I like their wonton soup and fresh mix mushrooms dumpling too.  They are 100% Vegan.  Will definitely go back again.

This place is a hidden gem. My entire family has come here for years and it is worth the trip from Long Island every single time. Their green tea noodles and all of their seitan dishes (sweet and sour, general tso, orange, etc.) are two things that are so tasty, every other restaurant's version tastes subpar to me. My mom also loves the pumpkin soup and the mango rolls.

Simon and his wife are the sweetest and most accommodating ever. Your water glass will never be empty, your food will come out fast, and you will leave feeling very satisfied. So much yummy variety here for a vegan diet and everything is so so good. Highly recommend!
Black pepper seitan lunch special!! Really great food and big portion. I would highly recommend!

First, a disclaimer: I'm not a vegan, and I don't typically eat vegan food, so I don't have many references (and came here with minimal expectations). That being said, I came here for lunch and had a wonderful time. Came on a Wednesday at 11:30 AM and was seated immediately. I ordered the ginger root macro bowl and the pumpkin soup, which was a lovely combination. The ginger root macro bowl was very healthy (it came with tofu, sweet potato and an array of beans and green veggies), but still surprisingly comforting and satisfying because of the fluffy brown rice and soft pumpkin. The pumpkin soup was also wonderful - light and flavorful.

Ah Vegan food . It's generally over priced and not too tasty . This place is amazing. Do not be put off by the no frills decor . I think the only thing i have a complaint about is I noticed they used canned pineapple .

I stopped by Vegan Ginger Root while wandering around Midtown East and the Upper East Side and enjoyed a delicious lunch (the pepper beef special) that began with a lovely conversation with Simon, the owner. I wish I lived in the area so I could make it one of my go-to restaurants! Nevertheless, I'll definitely stop by whenever I'm in the area.

The website listed on this restaurant's Yelp page contains malware/virus links (tries to install a browser extension) -- DO NOT CLICK!! -- gingerrootveganny.com

The CORRECT (non-spyware) website is: gingerrootveganNYC.com

How can restaurants be so stupid and irresponsible!??  Stop putting incorrect
/ outdated links to websites you don't maintain that have been hacked or taken over by scammers!!

Wow, I'm so surprised how good vegan food can taste in this restaurant. The vegan nuggets was crispy and flavorful, so is the general Tso's soy protein. Sauce is good, sweet, spicy and salty! And the broccoli in the dish is a nice touch!

Got the lunch special through seamless - was fine and liked the quantity of food but was kinda flavorless? Wanted more spice. I got the tofu stir fry special and like the kabocha squash and vegan spring roll. But the miso soup and actual veggies really needed more spice and flavor.

I have ordered delivery  from this restaurant several times and I am always pleased.  This week I had the crystal dumplings and the pumpkin soup, plus the orange seitan, my favorite.  The dumplings were okay, nothing exciting, as they were kind of drowning in the sauce that had spilled in the container during transport.  The soup and the seitan were delicious, as always.  
I will keep ordering from this vegan gem.
The food was good and the price was great for the lunch combos! The server was also very kind.

Pros:
-Fully vegan menu
-Lots of seating
-Food is quick to come out
-Staff seems to be passionate about veganism
-Quick takeout pickup

Cons:
-Some of the appetizers were hit or miss (lots of items seems like they were frozen then fried) (overly saucy to mask the quality)
-waiter kept taking plates and sauces away before we were finished using them

My favorite is the soy protein nuggets and as one other reviewer said, I appreciate that they cut a small hole at the top of the lid so the nuggets remain crispy! They're so good. The spring rolls are also delicious and always come hot and crispy. I haven't tried much else on the menu. The Singapore noodles were just okay and a little too dry for my liking, but I asked for more sauce the following time and they were better. Overall, great spot for quick, tasty, vegan.

This place is so good! Fast, FREE delivery (at least within a certain miles radius), easy online ordering system, and a varietal menu. I ordered the pumpkin soup, which I thought would be a little thicker, but still good flavor. Also got the macro bowl with brown rice, kale, seaweed, tofu, chickpeas, and beans, and a cilantro dressing on the side - SO GOOD! Will def be going back.

The pad Thai is actually very good, and I'm pretty picky about pad Thai. It's spicy, saucy (when you eat it fresh), and flavorful. Love their udon soup - get it whenever I'm sick. Scallion pancakes are good. The crystal dumping filling is great, I just wish the dumpling skin weren't so thick. Didn't like the seitan skewers. Mekong noodle salad bowl too sweet. Mango roll is refreshing.

Love this place, my family's been coming here for years ! Can't say enough great things. Simon always helps us out and is extremely accommodating with recommendations and any dietary restrictions. Such a great, warm feeling & amazing hospitality every time we come into the restaurant. We love everything, especially the mango summer rolls and the green tea noodles !! 10/10

Great option for vegan food that comes fresh and fast! The fried foods come in containers that are properly vented, showing that they care that your food arrives crunchy, not soggy.

Pad Thai is a good option, and so is the hot and sour soup (it's tangy and delicious). Really the most important part of this place is that everything is consistent. Shows they've got a well run kitchen.

Honestly couldn't be happier with a vegan Asian take out option in the city. Decided to order a lot of food and have a pig out night and was delighted by every single thing.

The pad thai was surprisingly really good and you DEFINITELY get your money's worth on everything. It may seem steep but the quality, flavor and amount is so worth it. Our favorite was the Tempeh Satay. It was honestly so good I'd go just for that. I'm also a sucker for the steamed pumpkin slices because I haven't seen them anywhere else and it's so good!
The steamed veggies entree is such a great healthy option and definitely love it! Especially because it comes with a side of rice and miso soup which really brings the whole meal together.

I'd recommend going here for take out for sure. They really have it down with quality and delivery.

I order delivery from here way too often because they're literally the best! The food is delicious and I also love that the delivery is super fast and almost always arrives before the estimated drop off time. The delivery guys are always very courteous too.

The jap chae, soy protein chicken nuggets and peanut butter cake are my current favorites, but every time I try something new, I end up loving it, so I really don't think you can go wrong. One small detail that I really appreciate is that they cut a little vent on the container for the soy nuggets so they don't steam and get soggy during delivery. They're always nice and crispy when my order arrives. So many restaurants don't take this extra step and it really shows that the staff at Ginger Root actually care about the food they're preparing. I really can't recommend this place enough!!
Thankfully, Ginger Root Vegan opened back up. I come for lunch and get the Malaysian curry stew, regularly. The menu has an extensive list of tasty options. Great local vegan spot on UES

Ginger Root has quickly become a staple in my family. It's a great spot for a healthy lunch or dinner, and if you don't feel like going out they have super duper fast delivery. It's usually at our door less than half an hour after we place the order, even though we live half a mile away.

Favorite dishes are the Black Pepper Seitan, Smoked Teriyaki Seitan, the Fisherman Soy Protein, and the Eggplant String Bean. I can't say enough about the eggplant, y'all. They're the little Japanese eggplants and they're cooked til they're buttery soft and absolutely delicious; perfectly complemented by the snappy string beans and not overwhelmed by the mellow brown sauce.

Entree portions are large and all come with delicious brown rice (which has some sort of bean in it too!) and miso or salad. Opt for the miso soup, which is flavorful and has lots of seaweed, rather than the salad, which is just a handful of romaine with dressing. For a hearty winter soup, the hot & sour is fantastic. It's thick and a little spicy, with lots of mushroom and bamboo shoots in it, unlike the thin soup you get at your typical Chinese take out spot.

There are quite a few entrees on the sweet end, which we don't love, but maybe others are into that. I'm looking at you, Sesame Soy, Citrus Soy, and Mango Soy.

The lunch special is a great deal: you get miso soup, a spring roll, a little slice of pumpkin, and a lunch-sized entree for $8-9. Can't be beat!

Ginger Root Vegan is amazing! I had not been there since COVID began, but I just had a late lunch delivered and the food is delicious! Everything is very fresh and the portions are generous. We ordered 4 dishes and they were all wonderful. I'm so glad to connect with them again and will be ordering regularly from now on. It's great to have a fabulous vegan place in the neighborhood, especially after the permanent closing of two other favorites  last year. And you don't have to be vegan to love their food! :-)

I've eaten at Ginger Root a few times now and it's become one of my go-to restaurants in the area. I appreciate that the entire menu is vegan and has a variety of Asian dishes, Chinese, Thai, Korean, etc. The portion sizes are generous and staff are friendly.
