So far my favorite dishes have been the Pad Thai Noodles and the Malaysian Curry Stew, but I get something new to try every time and it's all been delicious.

Asian dishes prepared vegan - done really well. Nothing too saucy or fried. Dishes are flavorful and innovative. Tried the homemade ginger ale and mango lassi. The lassi tastes as thick and delicious as the real one (for the non-vegan who've had and may prefer the traditional version).

The crispy soy protein and the tofu skin wraps were similar in that they were both fried. Both were accompanied by sauces that were orange and personally I didn't feel complemented the dishes they were paired with. The sauce for the crispy soy protein was sweet and sour-ish and tasted off. I requested hoisin sauce which improved the flavor of the crispy soy protein, which definitely needs a sauce otherwise it's quite dry. The crispy soy protein are like vegan chicken nuggets and the tofu skin wraps like fried spring rolls.

The cold green tea noodles were light and refreshing ..Subtle on green tea flavor and hopefully high on antioxidants!

The basil soy protein I thought would be Thai style however the makeup was different - I thought the protein should've been minced and the dish was quite saucy. The orange seitan was good as long as I got the pieces not overly doused in the gelatinous sauce. Bibimbap was a good choice and very flavorful as long as it's mixed well.

For dessert, the crispy fudge brownie is excellent as was the agave-sweetened coconut-based organic chocolate hazelnut ice cream.

I'll definitely be back as overall the meal was delightful and I am interested in trying more items on the menu

Came here with a friend for dinner. Seating is kinda (but not very) limited so I don't think this is the best place to go to if you have a big group. I also don't think this is the greatest place to go to on a first date (maybe unless you are vegan haha). Also the music was from Studio Ghibli!! Great music choice.

We were hungry so we ordered Singapore mai fun (which comes with miso soup or green salad), General Tso's soy protein (which comes with brown rice), and Ginger Root macro bowl. I'm not vegan but I thought everything we ordered was pretty good. I didn't miss meat or dairy at all while eating. My only complaint is that the portion size of the General Tso's was kinda small for $16 even though it did taste pretty good. There is a dessert menu but we didn't get anything. I would probably get dessert next time though.

Service was very attentive and the food came out quickly. I was satisfied overall!

I am obsessed with the seitan on a bed of kale here. My dad always gets the macro plate because he is on a heart healthy diet where he must eat low sodium and low fat. He loves the macro plate and the sauce it comes with. Simple and delicious. The seitan here is perfectly seasoned and tasty. The sauces are all yummy. A perfect mix of healthy and rich, hearty flavors. Portions are amazing and I usually have leftovers for a snack later on. If you are vegan or interested in healthy food in the area it's a must!
Ordered takeout here and I highly recommend the summer roll! It's so flavorful, light, and fresh!!

I ordered the eggplant and string bean lunch special: the entree is served in a basil garlic sauce, sort of a teriyaki, which is utterly delicious. The meal included brown rice and a spring roll, and a wedge of pumpkin, as well as a green salad with miso dressing on the side. It was superb, all of it, and I highly recommend it.

Was not a fan of the food we got for pick up. The mushrooms tasted like they were canned, the beans tasted like they were canned and the food was just so bland I ended up eating the avocado on top and tossing the rest. Wouldn't go back ever again.

What a hidden gem for vegans/vegetarians!! Worth the visit. Probably the BEST quality/price ratio of any healthy meal you can nom on in Manhattan. I would come here every day if I lived close by.

Came during lunch hour and the service was phenomenal. Smoked teriyaki seitan (mock duck) - crispy skin muy delicioso, totally worth getting all the time; eggplant & string beans - up there with some of the best Chinese eggplant I've had in my life; and pumpkin cheesecake - good gosh so worth it. Btw...linner is the best meal of the day.

TL;DR - This is the vegan restaurant I've been looking to find for YEARS. Super healthy, super tasty, and super cheap.

Got the Pad Thai and teriyaki delivered. I don't even typically like teriyaki but my friend wanted to try it so we got it and omg it was so good! The consistency was so similar to meat that you wouldn't even know it wasn't meat! The Pad Thai was pretty good too

This place is just ok.

The interior is a bit drab. Definitely not a place to take a date you want to impress.

There are plenty of options of different types of dishes that sound very appealing, but they aren't very flavorful. I tried one of the veggie bi bim babs. The quality is fine, but I wouldn't return. Off to the next vegan spot.

I was walking by and saw the pretty sign that said vegan in lights.
They just opened 3 months ago.
I went over and checked out the menu.
It looked so delicious. I wanted everything, literally.
a pretty Chinese woman came to the table. There was a bit of a language barrier but that made it all the more enchanting.
I got the Thai coffee which was super good and tasted just the way it should have.
Then I got general Taos Setan not spicy with sweet & sour soup that was Amazing! And
Coconut rice.
The coconut rice had such authentic Asian flavor I truly felt like I was in a cafe in Thailand.
The General toes came with broccoli and battered I think with a wheat gluten and a brown sauce that was fabulous.
They also serve wine & beer.
I could not finish my supper so I got more rice and took it home for my son to try.
The restaurant was Spotless Clean!
I Cannot wait to come back here, bring my family and tell my friends.

Lovely place. Best Brownie ever (Have it warm). Love the sweet sesame chicken dish and the chicken nuggets taste like KFC OMG! wow.

They also let me take food in my own container so I love them even more  :)

The side salad is very delicious. I'm not quite sure what the dressing is, but it adds a very zesty lemon-ginger orange citrus burst of flavor to the leaves! A very bright and refreshing light dish. Normally I hate salads because of how bland most restaurants flavor them, but this place really hit the dressing on the mark without overpowering the rest of the meal. The highlight of my dinner was probably the Satay Tempeh. It was really crispy and filling, and the drizzled sauce accompanying the dish was lightly sweet and delicious, adding a lot of seasoning to the leaves underneath. For my main course I had the sautéed vegetables with tofu. I ended up liking the Tempeh much more though, if I stop by again I might just end up eating that. It's small, but it had enough protein to be almost a full dinner on it's own. All in all, a great veggie-friendly meal.
Definitely my favorite vegan spot on UES - lots of great veg Asian choices. Best for take-out.
My GO-TO take out restaurant. My order is always perfect, fresh, and delicious. They pay attention to the notes and delivery is always so fast. Highly recommend!

Ginger Root is the very best of the restaurants that have expanded or imitated the original menu initiated by LuAnn's. Ginger Root's dishes are clean, healthy, and elegant. We order delivery from here quite often; our go-to dishes are the vegan macro bowl, bibimbap, kale avocado shitake bowl, and my husband likes the soy medallions with broccoli. Appetizers are perfect, especially the oshitashi and fresh summer rolls, and a side of pumpkin slices is a must! The bundt cake slice is too indulgent for me, but I must admit it is an amazing dessert.

Yummy! Healthy & delicious! I'm so glad to have this place pop up right by my home. I've ordered in, dined there & picked up orders to go, every time spot on. I am not a vegetarian but trust this kitchen & even ventured outside of my go tos & tried new dishes. Always a great dining experience.

Weekday during lunch wasn't busy at all, we didn't need a reservation. Service was on point and very fast. The spring roll that came with the fish was delicious, salad was fresh and soup felt great in the the chilly afternoon. The stir fried Singapore Mai-Fun was pretty spicy . In the end it was a lot of food, quite cheap.

Best vegan place for Asian food I've found!

It's absolute incredible. Food is amazingly delicious, service is great, and prices are great!

If I had enough money, I'd eat here every day! So glad I found this place.

Staff was very warm, friendly, and inviting. The fried dumplings were very good. Stuffed wontons are okay. They need a garlic or ginger combined with the spinach. We had smoked seitan and General Tso's non-chicken both of which were prepared lightning fast, hot and yummy. We will definitely return.

one of my fav spots in the UES for a quick bite!

Loved stopping by here when strolling around the UES for errands or whatnot.

Nothing crazy about this place, but it's just a nice, comfy, reliable spot with decent coffee and small bites to grab.

I always get the Tentazione panini, which I think is a great combo of flavors.

Service can be a bit slow, but other than that love this spot!

After taking our morning leave of our friends (Gator and Laurie), Gayle and I decided to take a long stroll through part of Central Park.  As we approached the Met around mid-day, we both agreed to delay our Museum visit and find some place for Lunch.  A few things popped up under "Lunch Near Me", of which looking at the reviews followed.  We finally decided to walk over to Via Quadronno.

It was on the late side of the Lunch hour and the place was largely full, except for an available table within their parklet.  Our timing turned out to be good, as a line formed soon after we were seated.  Service throughout was quick and efficient, which certainly helped turn tables over.  At the same time, we didn't feel rushed.  The parklet was a little confining within this pretty and leafy Upper East Side street.

Our Lunch choices were Panini (Moretti La Rosa and Non Ti Scordar Di Me) plus Proscecco for Gayle and Lo Spazzino (Beer) for me.  Our sandwiches were a little on the small side, but very tasty.  In hindsight, we should have ordered an additional item off their fairly extensive menu.  For future reference, Via Quadronno also serves breakfast, dinner, and dessert.

Called for a reservation for 7:45PM and arrived 20 minutes early with no issue! They let us sit wherever we wanted and were attentive as soon as we sat.
The food was good, nothing crazy. Big portions and not too greasy. The seasoning itself was different than most Italian restaurants, it tasted like their version of Italian food.
The tap water they give tastes awful, I overheard another person complain about their water tasting weird!
The gelato and the pecan tart for dessert were delicious, a nice topper for a big pasta meal.
Overall can't complain about my experience, atmosphere outside was calm and warm for a Sunday night in the city. Although, it was kinda pricy $$$ considering it wasn't authentic Italian tasting in my opinion, but again, it was still delicious.
We had a lovely meal here with family in early October 2023.  The food and service was absolutely on point.  It was a great experience and I hope to visit again someday.
Excellent food and atmosphere. Great servers . Visiting Manhattan you must visit this place

Are you stopped by this place since another one of our coffee options was closed and the other was way too crowded. It seems the universe was smiling upon us since we were able to try this place. We ordered a few lattes and I ordered myself a Panini was soppresatta.

This place looked super crowded and I was kind of sad that we weren't able to sit and eat anything on the menu since we were on a time table, but I hung out at the bar for a little bit while waiting for our orders and all of the servers were super kind and funny. They made sure everyone was taken care of and you could tell that there were several regulars that came in. If I had the chance, I would love to return to this place and try some of the pasta that looks so delicious. The Panini I got itself will definitely be worth coming back for!

Nestled between a great shopping district and wonderful area to walk around in Manhattan it's perfect little Gem has delicious food great ambience whether you sit outside or inside you can enjoy wonderful dishes, lovely cocktails and if you're looking for conversation with someone.
Always love the simple food here! Its made up of such high quality ingredients. Their service is also great. Come here at least once a week for a panini for lunch.

Sat outside on a beautiful afternoon. Atmosphere quite European as is the menu. Mostly sandwich Dash centric. Good for Lunch or wine and snacks or coffee and pastries. Not a ton of options for vegetarian but if you eat cheese, you'll be OK. Coffee is served an individual pass with hot steamed foamy milk.

One of my favorite quick lunch eateries in the UES. This Italian spot is famous for their paninis and cappuccinos, so naturally I get both, and SERIOUSLY the best cappuccinos ever and delicious paninis.

The spot is a bit tight and I would definitely recommend it as more of a breakfast/lunch spot than a dinner. It's great to grab a quick bite and is located right by Central Park in the UES.

Straight forward service.  A pleasant enough stop for an espresso or gelato while in area. Though no food will I order in the future after tasting their jiggly flat panna cotta with a pungent syrup on this visit.

Cheers!

Very consistent restaurant. Menu has many options. Paninis and soups are priced around 15$. Pastas are in the 30 range. They have a cozy little outdoor area for dining. All the staff are very attentive.

The space is great for any day when you are able to sit out on the sidewalk area. They have a floral arrangement to the sitting area that feels like you've been transported to a quaint European town somewhere.  The interior is nice too, if narrow. The interior feels Old World.

The waiter staff seems very attentive and friendly. I didn't have to wait for the hostess to notice me and accommodate my friend and me. My friend and I sat there for about two hours, and no one rushed us at all. I really loved how unobtrusive the staff was. Other than asking to see how we were, we were welcome to stay all day.

We had coffee and dessert. The dessert was advertised as the Italian answer to creme brulee. While the dessert was tasty, it wasn't a substitute for creme brulee. It was fruity, which has it's own character.

Best tiramisu I've had in a while!!

Great service and ambiance.

Loved the pasta it was perfectly Al Dante.

Decor is super cute too

Loved the food here. Stopped by for breakfast and lunch and they were very accommodating to us cuz we had a huge stroller and baby with us. Breakfast is a simple menu but still delicious.
The sandwiches for lunch were delicious as was the pea soup. All the ingredients seemed to be prepped with a lot of thought and care.
Will def go back to try more sandwiches.

Non Ti Scordar Di Me Panini: Bit underwhelming 6.5/10

Chocolate Mousse Cake: Great 9/10
Really tiny spot but their spaghetti carbonara was really good. The bread that came with it tasted bad but I liked the pasta a lot

This is a great little bistro / cafe type place tucked away on a side-street. They specialise in baguette style sandwiches.
Their lunch / sandwich menu is split into 2 parts, simple and more complex. The simple ones are cheaper say $10 and the other more like $15.

It's really tasty, various meat/ shrimp sandwiches with all sorts of flavors, cheeses etc

You can eat inside or out, and it's a pretty area/ side street, near to Central Park.

I don't know why anyone would want to line up to go to this place. They said their tiramisu was their most popular item and all I could taste was cream. There was no coffee flavor or texture. It was extremely dirty, and the staff was clearly overwhelmed by the crowds so they were not friendly. In short: don't come here on a weekend, it is dirty, chaotic, noisy, and simply not good.

Causal but excellent service. Extensive menu with a variety of options. I love the outdoor seating area, it's very quaint and comfortable. The food was very fresh and well made

I couldn't decide what to get, everything looked really good!

We stopped by for a quick lunch. We ordered their rigatoni arabiatta, Caprese sandwich and veggie sandwich. The place is very cute. European vibe. The service was a bit slow. We had to flag the staff whenever we needed something. The pasta was flavorful. But a bit overcooked. The Caprese sandwich was very bland. Adding some balsamic made it better. The complementary bread was nice.

Great restaurant with a lively energy, a number of outside tables, an additional outside seating area, and fantastic food. My friend recommended we meet here, having been here a number of times with her pup along.

Ambiance.  Red umbrellas cover the sidewalk tables at this restaurant on a pretty street, and adjacent buildings have beautiful architecture and details. There is also an additional outside seating area.

Food. Everything was wonderful.
- Beef carpaccio. Delicious, thinly sliced filet mignon served over a bed of fresh arugula with sliced Parmesan and a light dressing.
- Sole. Fresh, and delicious, served with mixed vegetables and mashed potatoes.
- Salmon. My friend enjoyed the salmon, and the bite I had was very good.

Service. The service was slow, and not attentive. Friendly when we saw the server but they likely needed another server to accommodate mostly filled outside tables.

Great restaurant to meet for dinner with friends, family or a date.
Great place for a nice pot of tea  and some finger food! The menu has a full array of items to select from! The tiramisu is to die for !

Discovered this cute spot after a 4 mile race near Central Park. My friend and I LOVED the baked eggs here for breakfast. This has now been my nee favorite egg dish , simple but also very sophisticated!

We really liked the food here. Love how they have a fans outside for a hot day, cute Parisian theme seating with shade for us to be relaxed from that heat. The cheese and bread was flavorful and toasted. We all really enjoyed our paninis, BUT.... I would say the service could have been better. I'm not sure if the staff was well equipped to service the amount of tables they had but no one really checked on us and we had to flag them down to take our order and get a check.

They even accidentally threw away a lady's desserts on the table and got mad at her for leaving it on the table when she was trying to order more desserts inside. The bus boy who threw it away got really angry and said she shouldn't have left it there. Possibly something that could have been avoided if they were more attentive to the tables instead of many of us feeling we need to go in and order.

Good, albeit heavy, and a bit overpriced italian food. The location is close to the Park and the Met.

The gnocchi and spaghetti are both a bit heavy. Otherwise the flavor was good; not too salty, a bit rich.

The tiramisu is good, although a little overly sweet rather than coffee-leaning!

The service is good, although you may be waiting a while to be taken care of in regards to getting your bill.

After tax and tip, our bill came out to $90 for two entrees and a dessert (no drinks).

The best cappuccino I had in NYC and staff was so attentive and considerate.  Tried the Salmon Tartine and the the namesake panini which where all delicious and not oversized.  The deserts were fabulous too.

Lunch break from the Met. Via Quadronno offers exceptional paninis here. Restaurant offers a wide variety of selection which seems like you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. So far, we have eaten 4 paninis and each time it has been delicious. This is a must stop after the Met for us. I can't wait to try every one of their paninis.

They have a nice heated/social distance/hand sanitizer outdoor seating. Staff wear masks.
This is the best spot to grab lunch! If you love a good soup, panini, and/or cappuccino - you've found your place.

Great outdoor seating.
The staff is super efficient.
Not sure if they take reservations. We walked there from the Met and were lucky to be seated immediately.
There was a long line forming but it moved very quickly
The food is delicious. Everything on the menu is fresh.
Will definitely return.
Absolutely the best bolognese I've ever had, amazing. Ambiance was very pleasant, and the staff was very helpful. Great experience!

Had a lovely lunch here after an event in Central Park.  It's usually hard to find something good and moderately priced in this area but Via Quadronno did not disappoint.  We started off with some burrata and then I had the spaghetti carbonara and my friend had the lasagna.  Both were great.  My friend actually fell in love with the carbonara and ordered another one to go.  Service was good.  And they had outdoor seating.  Definitely a good spot close to Central Park if you want some Italian food when in the area.

Never in my life.....
Shopping in the area, it was dinner time so I took to Yelp to find a food restaurant close by. Perfectly, there was one, 2 storefronts away. We were so pleased.  And it was Italian which we love.
Upon entering I notice it does not appear to be overly clean, but I look past it and we are offered a window seat which had the glass doors open to the street which I normally love on a bright, sunny day, except for there was a downpour shortly before.  It was quite dank& still.  The dampness made me uncomfortable so we asked if we could sit in the dining room in the back.  We were told the back was closed- found that odd.  
Anyway, we order linguini in white clam sauce, and grilled bronzino with herbs & olive oil.  Both our favorites & often order. Immediately after we ordered, the helper started sweeping the floor towards us & loudly and a mere 5 feet away.  All the dust was stirring up into our faces. That was pleasant! ‍ We had to ask him to stop.
We were enjoying our wine when the meals came. My friend noticed on the wall was a review from Conde Naste, raving about the restaurant only a year before. He says to me, wow- looks like we are really in for a treat with being rated 21st best Italian restaurant in Manhattan.  I couldn't help my self ( through experience all too often) but said due to my thousands of meals out, let's hope they live up to it.  He rolled his eyes at me, like I didn't know what I was talking about.
My meal came out looking quite foreign-breaded & deep fried, basically the opposite of what I ordered.  I immediately sent it back as I am gluten free & not what I ordered.
My friend was eating his linguine in white clam sauce & he proceeds to tell me the pasta isn't cooked! He's eating it anyway, something I am not capable of doing.  Anyway, he continues eating and finally says- "I can't do it, it's that awful and the clams are undercooked & taste bad (old clams.) He sends it back & asks for bolognese instead. They were accommodating without being rude. Something hard to come by these days.
We are fine sitting & relaxing with our wine.  All of a sudden I hear these "zap,zap" noises.  I was facing the kitchen and see a man with a Zap racket killing bugs! He's swinging the Zapper all through the air & the Zapping was instant.  He want on doing this a good 10 minutes with no end in sight. With every zap my stomach turned- I'm talking about 100 or so.  It seemed there was no end.  And there wasn't. I finally looked at my friend & said I can't stay here, I'm nauseated with their big infestation- and in & around the kitchen as well.
We walked out without waiting for our food, very annoyed & hungry. Of course left money for the wine & beer on the table.
I can't imagine this will be open for business much longer.  They don't know what they are doing & id have to think it was sold during or post-COVID and will never be the same.
Don't waste your time or your money.

Horrible  horrible horrible Italian restaurant and clueless server. Bad lasagna! Zero star will not recommend. They stop selling pasta at 3:30 pm and they only have sandwiches and lasagna bad idea for an Italian restaurant and they don't even know what's in there's salad

Nice little unassuming cafe with a really nice menu of sandwiches, pastas and salads. The sandwiches are comprised of excellent quality meats and cheeses on absolutely delicious bread. Most of them are served warm, but not hot/pressed like typical paninis. They're not huge sandwiches, and unfortunately they really don't have appetizers so we ended up splitting an additional sandwich. We had a mozzarella, tomato and basil sandwich, a prosciutto, mozzarella, tomato, and olive pate, and one of the ham sandwiches, don't remember which! But they were all delicious! Really good. Also had a very good cappuccino. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're anywhere in the neighborhood.
Amazing and friendly staff. Great location. Everything to appease your appetite. Family friendly and service with a smile
They serve the WORST RISOTTO I have ever eaten. If you don't trust ME, go ahead and order it, let me know.
Found this niche spot tucked into a corner as we were walking through Central Park to the Met. Great ambiance and pleasant people.

Beautiful lunch in the Upper East Side - great atmosphere and amazing food. Staff were friendly. I had the lunch special carbonara for $28 and I want it every day for the rest of my life (see photo) - great place to go if in NYC!

Pleasant outdoor seating.  The servers were nice, but the meal went slowly because they were busy.  This is the new pandemic normal.  The garlic-ish bread slices that were served looked suspiciously like repurposed panini bread from lunch.  The chilled asparagus and house salad were ok.   My linguine with clam sauce was OK.  My wife's lemon sole was very fishy and earned the rare distinction of being a dish that we sent back.  She switched to a safer pasta dish.    

Mediocre restaurant with nice outdoor seating. Upper east side prices. Subtract half a star if dining al fresco isn't important to you.

My friends & I grabbed sandwiches for a picnic at Central Park! Not only does this restaurant serve great panini (wrapped in aluminum foil so they stayed warm on the walk), it's on Madison Ave so it's really close to the park. They had seating available but also had a takeout-style counter inside. The sandwiches were ~$13 each so considering how small they were, It's not a great bang for your buck. I was honestly surprised at the size! Nonetheless, the sandwiches were tasty! My friend also had a raspberry & pear tart and he said it was delightful! If you have an appetite, this may not be the spot for you.

We stopped off at Via Quadronno for lunch!  We had the minestrone soup as a starter. We then each ordered a couple of panini sandwiches. They were very tasty. The soup was just ok.  The service was very slow. Ambiance was nice and fun. We ate outside and enjoyed the seating.  We would recommend.

Fabulous Fantastic I am blessed to have Via Quadranno around the corner. I am there several times a week. All plates are superb! Ice Cream out of this world!
I love the purée vegetable soup ! And thee pastas. Thank you for being around the block. See you later. PhyllisK

I had lunch here on a Sunday when it was rainy and a little bit chilly and I was sitting outside. Their outdoor seating is great, you can't feel the cold and the heaters really help when it's around 50°. we got three Panini not the simple ones but the warm hot Paninis and they were all amazing. We also got a cappuccino and a pot of tea, just a warning the pot of tea is about a cup and a half of water-not that much. It's definitely on the pricier side however the Paninis are affordable.

Given the long line, we were expecting a delicious meal. Instead, we had mediocre service and a mediocre meal. The $15 sandwich we ordered looked and tasted like pre-wrapped airplane food, the $30 pasta was overcooked and tasteless, and the $20 salad consisting of one egg and a few spears of asparagus was very overpriced. While it was nice to eat outside, and the service was quick, the food was underwhelming and we will not be returning.

During my recent stay in the UES, I found my way to Via Quadronno on several occasions - first, for dinner, then my caffeine fix a couple days in a row.

First, the coffee. I'm afraid that aside from the creative latte art, which you will not get in a to-go cup, I can't say that this was a standout latte experience. In fact, it was very middle of the road. So was the panini, which is reportedly so wildly popular. The dinner (I ordered pasta) was also just fine. Service is mediocre, as well, to make Via Quadronno an all-around OK experience.

If you are in the neighborhood, stop by, but otherwise do not make a destination out of it.

Its one of my favorite places in the city / UES to take my friends. I love their ambiance, menu & parking space.
I have been there several times & I never fail to get the tiramisu & a cup of cappuccino. Although I have tried various items from their menu, their mushroom risotto is my favorite!
Amazing amazing amazing the cappuccino OMG the foam! Panini's best I ever had and don't forget about the amazing tiramisu

My mom and I stopped here for lunch after a doctor's appointment since they had heated outdoor dining. The heat lamps provided enough heat for us to be comfortable. We ordered a caprese panino ($13), a lentil soup ($13), and a cappuccino ($6). The panino was good, although the portion was on the smaller side and I wasn't completely satisfied. My mom really enjoyed her cappuccino (she said it was nice and creamy), but her soup was lukewarm. Overall, it was a nice place for lunch but I don't know if I'll be back.

The food is only ok - everything thing tastes like it was delivered early in the day and then heated up rather than made fresh. The look of the place is very nice, especially the interior, and it's a lovely spot to sit when it isn't too crowded. However the music really interfered with the experience. It looks like a wonderful little European cafe, but instead of soft music they play loud, bad pop. It really throws the mood off.

Viand has been excellent fast and friendly since the late 80's when I started going there. The food is always fresh and delicious. The atmosphere is busy but fun and light. The staff starts your day off right! I was worried when George wouldn't be there anymore that this might change, it did not. Thank you for your commitment to excellence every day!

Customer Service: Could be better. Be careful of what you say around customers. You have no clue of knowing whether your customers know Spanish and if they can tell if you are speaking down on them.  Good / bad vibes are a universal language. Si?
Was not greeted by staff but watched staff members hold the door open for White customers. I understand it's Manhattan and maybe that is the Vibe of Viand Cafe

Food: Ordered $9 fries.Why are these fries $9 to begin with.
$5 worth of them were just burnt toasted fries. Not sure why all the fries on the bottom were so crisp that they were not edible.

Old school diner in Midtown. Came here with my friend after landing from my redeye because I really needed a bagel and this was a close spot to his office. There booth seating available for two as well as bar seating. Cash only.

I had a bit of sticker shock when I saw that the bagel with lox and cream cheese was $18 but I guess that's New York pricing. It came cut into four pieces and there was a generous amount of cream cheese. My friend got the French toast, which came with a lot of butter on the side. We were in and out in under 45 minutes.
Everything at the Viand Cafe is vicious. This is my favorite spot on the Upper East Side. The atmosphere, the staff and of course the amazing food add to this unparalleled NYC experience.
Great customer service and great food! Just be aware that it is cash only! We were a few dollars short and they were extremely kind in response
Pancakes are 10/10, service is fast and this place is just special - has a charm about it that is rare to find in NY anymore.

What a great local stop. They remind me of a Waffle House. Great food. It was so good. I would pick this stop over any place in Times Square. It was a super small and had a great local feel. The booths were for 2 people max and the was a counter. The food was amazing. AMAZING! We had the bacon cheeseburger with fries. We ordered potato salad as well. This is a cash only establishment, but worth every penny. They have a full menu of breakfast and lunch all day. Plan on filling up if you stop here.
A really terrible and expensive breakfast. The espresso I believe is made with instant coffee both the bacon and scrambled eggs were way over cooked and it's not cheap.
Great food, super fast service, super cozy!! Workers were so nice, the perfect spot to sit and relax:)

Went in for breakfast.  Ordered four eggs scrambled, turkey sausage & whole wheat toast.  Nothing else -- no coffee, no potatoes, no nothing else.
The sausage never showed up, but the check did, with the sausage still on it -- $19.55.  I told the waiter I never received the sausage, the check needed to be adjusted.  Revised check -- $18.55, for four scrambled eggs, two pieces of toast and a glass of ice water.

Total ripoff.  Don't go there.

A great go-to when I'm in the area, and I'm never disappointed. Had the Big Apple Salad, a side of fries. Everything was perfect - the option of having turkey bacon instead of pork on my salad, the hot fresh fries that stayed hot throughout the entire meal, the friendly staff!
I will definitely be returning

I love how intimate and classic this Viand Cafe is. Although their menu may be, "limited" compared to other diners, (i.e. no Belgian waffles), you can not go wrong with their pancakes! How delicious, truly. At the end of the day, this Viand Cafe gets the job done.

They say this is a coffee shop but it looks like a small little diner. They have a few places named Viand cafe so I am not sure if they are all connected.  These types of places are fun and becoming increasingly rare in Manhattan.  They have a bunch of pastries in the front that all look delicious. I don't think they make them on premises though. Good spot if you are looking for comfort food. I always stick to eggs or turkey club sandwiches at these types of spots.  Not sure I will be back but this spot definitely has a niche in the city!
Old school, yummy warm and fresh blueberry crumb cake, enjoy while you can!! Good drip coffe. Cash only.
Wow I just order a bread with butter and a capuchino and is $8.50 price gap is real in nyc

Probably one of the best delis without a restroom in all of NYC.

It's a narrow corridor with tiny chairs and tables to one side and the long counter with stool seating on the other. There are hooks for your belongings under the bar which is great for smaller items like shopping bags and purses. It's best to stow your jackets on your seat or if business is slow, the stool next to you is ideal.

Across the counter is the kitchen area. Everything is clean and fresh. We saw roasted turkeys and just out of the oven rice pudding. Mmmmm!

We asked the manager what this deli is known for, and low and behold it is turkey! And they're right. Everyone around us got a turkey dish of some kind.

I had a turkey melt and my mum had a turkey sandwich.  Both were delicious. They modify it to your needs/liking. The kitchen staff are friendly and will take your order if the manager is too busy with other customers.  

We had coffees. I drank mine black. It was too good to add milk to it, even if it was half n' half. And we splurged with dessert of the lightly cinnamon covered rice pudding in front of us. It was so good that we ordered a third to share among the two of us.

Happy eats !

Pleasantly surprised by my cheeseburger and fries. Only ordered because of the 5 bucks off on Grubhub.

The food came FAST (I live a few blocks from Viand but still) and it was hot when it arrived.

It was LARGE too! I did not finish. Ate half for lunch and half at 11PM. Good fries. Old-fashioned, smaller than steak fries but not that shoestring type where you can't tell you're eating a potato.

Cheaper than Burger Heaven, which is wildly overpriced.

The cheeseburger platter (with fries, cole slaw) is 15 and it's a much bigger burger. Medium rare, as requested.

They forgot the onions but otherwise terrific. At 10 bucks this was a real bargain and the deal wasn't just for first time order, so I will definitely check to see if they are doing this 5 off again.
mediocre food at high prices.  I went there on Sunday and they wouldn't let me use the bathroom.  scratch this off your list

Over priced, rip off.

Literally came in for just a can of soda as there were no stores nearby and charged me $3 for a can of soda when the menu says $2.25? It's not the extra $0.75, it's the principal of it.

This place is crazy expensive during breakfast. I can't speak for other times because my visits were during breakfast. Given the location, I get it, but geez. Breakfast is always supposed to be the cheapest / most important meal of the day. At least in my mind it's supposed to be cheap. lol

The space is tiny and filled with blue suit--white collared men. So if you're looking to escape the hustle and bustle of NYC, this is probably not the diner for you. Ironic the aesthetics scream "a place where everyone knows your name."

The staff is friendly. However, there was a manager (maybe) speaking loudly, directing folks to buss tables or being condiments that was slightly off-putting. I appreciate them being attentive to our needs but in such a small, already loud space, it was very jarring. So much it was difficult to have a conversation with my friend who was siting just across from me.

I'd go again if I'm ever in the area and needed something quick - because our waiter was awesome and the food was decent - but it's not exactly the first on my list.

This is a very small, compact diner - but if you're in this neighborhood and looking for a great diner breakfast, check it out. There's a row of narrow booths that seat 2, and then the counter. I recommend the sardine platter - exactly as described. Omelettes are good, too, quite large. Coffee is excellent for a diner. Yes, it's probably the most expensive diner breakfast I've ever purchased, but do you know what neighborhood you're in? Still, a better deal than eating, say, in your hotel's restaurant. Lots of local people seem to like the place.

My experience was that the service was highly expeditious. Waiter was attentive throughout the meal.

Note that they only take cash.

Really small old fashioned diner. The path between the booths and counter is narrow. I was bumped throughout my meal. The manager doesn't help because he passed back and forth barking orders to his help.
I saw customers walk in and then turn around and leave. Some customers the manager/owner knew. One customer asked to use the restroom. Manger said its across the street in Barney's!!
They have a lot of delivery and take out.
It was overpriced. Food was the way I like it though. I prefer to add my own seasoning. Another down side for me is no sweet potato fries!!
I'll have to give it some thought before I return.

First of all, what kind of restaurant doesn't have a bathroom where you can wash your hands? Let alone go to the bathroom?  The Cobb salad really wasn't a Cobb salad, and the grilled chicken had that gummy tendon texture. Pancakes were chewy not fluffy. Chewy pancakes? What is this place? Never coming back here again. Thanks!
Absolutely loved this place!!! Great service, AMAZING food for my buddies and I. 100% Recommend this as a great breakfast stop right by Central Park

June 3, 2019 update - WHAT! No BATHROOM.
4 STARS for Food, PRICE$ and  Service, but 1 STAR for NO BATHROOM.   And I am sure the owner has posted this notice on the front window or entrance door of the restaurant.  But, I rarely think people scan the window and entrance doors to read everything posted.   I sat at the counter to eat and a woman next to me asked where the restroom was - the guy  behind the counter said they did not have one.
I thought he was lying, so I got up and went to the back of this narrow establishment that seats over 20 people, and there was no bathroom.   CRAZY if you ask me.   And according to NYC.gov "Patrons are not permitted to use any toilets where the patron must walk through the kitchen or any food storage or food preparation area."    So, lucky for the restaurant because they do not have to provide a bathroom for their Paying$ Customers - but Unlucky for the Customers who may have to use a bathroom.
My suggestion if you eat here which has a great breakfast at any time of the day is to wear "Depends Underwear" or cross your legs :(

My boyfriend used to come here on a regular and this used to be his favorite spot.... until the other day he came and bit in a hard pastry that he noticed had mold growing inside!! He ordered a pastry the guy behind the counter picked the pastry and gave it to him. It was a cheese danish. After noticing the disgusting mold in the pastry my bf went back to tell them and can you believe they had the audacity to say it was a blueberry!!! Wtf?!? They had the nerve to say the mold was a blueberry are you kidding me! Disgusting and stay away

We stopped in for a quick cup of coffee and ended up with two giant fabulous cookies.  The black and white was like a short bread with icing, but big and fluffy.  The raisin bran was good, too.  We had one cappucinpo, two cups of coffee, and two cookies for $18.  ...but, this is New York! Great service.

To me, it's a diner. A diner that time forgot. For me (and many of the regulars), that's a plus. There's a crowded lunch counter where you'll sit cheek by jowl with some Sutton Place doyenne having a bite, who will be well known to the staff, or someone shopping the Madison Avenue stretch grabbing lunch or coffee, or perhaps a local office worker or ex-governor. A row of small tables on the left, a counter on the right, a narrow aisle down the middle, fast service, easy and informal, it's one of those great casual places that are almost gone. Who knows, with this Covid-19 business, it may go, but I don't think so. I think they've survived this long, they'll keep going. That's a blessing to this New Yorker.

Finally made myself into this famous yet low-key local coffee shop located at the center of midtown. Not surprisingly, they only take cash (not even check!), and you could even see an ancient cashier on the counter! Everything was displayed pretty much in an old-fashioned way (yet still made me mouth-watering simply by staring at the bakeries).

However, my cappuccino was underwhelming...it was bland, lack of the espresso flavor, and did not even carry a good outlook. Priced more than 5 bucks for a small cup, I would expect something much better.

Would probably be back for their sweets and savories, but I would certainly skip their drinks.

No bathroom. Food was decent. Service was great. They only accept cash :(
It had a nice New York feel.
Lots of food choices
Club sandwich is $20 :(
This is a nyc classic. Excellent food. Staple for decades. Excellent midtown location.

Viand is the quintessential New York coffee shops/diners. Fast talking workers, fast service, decent food, outrageous pricing. Usually I'll have the oven roasted turkey sandwich which is pretty good or the pastrami, which is good as well. However, be prepared to spend around $30 if you want to have a full meal.  Also, beware that they do NOT take cards, only cash. Lastly, there's not that much space, so don't go during lunch rush hour unless you want someone brushing up on your back while you try to enjoy your sandwich at the bar.

Oh... there's no bathroom. :)

It's true, they rush diners out during rush hour.

So if you don't care about having a 5-10 minute meal,eat here!

Had the cheeseburger which was good and came quick

Cash only which in the area and this day and age seems ridiculous. They do offer an ATM which to be honest I would put a card in personally because of so many skimming scams with cards these days.

Food was good and quick but slightly overpriced but on par with the area. Service was good but seating tight; I ding them for not taking credit cards or Apple Pay; even that with a posting of "minimum charge" for cards is better than cash on IMO.  Reason being we went there after a Central Park run and just happened to have cash because of planning on buying something at an event in the park. Ironically that vendor took cards and Apple; in the middle of Central Park, but not this place. Go figure.....

Ah, my first one star review on Yelp.

As we step in, an odor hits our face - I'd describe it as a mixture of ammonia and insecticide.

Food was average, not bad, but not good.  We got a chicken salad sandwich and a BLTC - kinda hard to mess that up.

But where things really went south was the service - the server was mostly fine, except he wouldn't come by to take payment.  I waved my credit card at someone who turned out to be the owner, to which he replied "no card, only cash".  Which surprised me since there wasn't a sign outside the diner.  I said to my wife "I don't think I have enough cash", to which he replied "Cash right here!" and proceeds to hit the top of the ATM really hard with open hand 5-6 times.  BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM BOOM.  It was loud as hell, and really obnoxious.  I looked at him in disbelief, tipped better than I should have and got out of there.  It was one of those moments where one asks himself "do I want to make a scene right now?", but decided against it.  

My wife and I live a few blocks away, we will never be back.  Such a bad memory.

First breakfast in New York!

It was a very good experience, since I really love eggs in the morning, and they have a very wide variety here.
Unfortunately my mom doesn't feel this way, and she had a little trouble finding something she could eat on the menu. She ended up having French toast, my dad and I got omelets, a farmer's omelet and an omelet with feta and spinach. They were really good.

The portionsize is very generous, and we were definitely fulfilled afterwards.

The atmosphere was cozy, and very typical American diner style, which was cool.

The staff was friendly and added to the good experience.

I only gave Viand 4 stars because they only accept cash, we would have preferred to pay with a credit card, as we didn't have that much cash with us.

Overall I really liked it. The only reason we didn't go back, was because it didn't have options besides eggs. (We couldn't get mom to try the eggs haha :))

The workers here mainly aim for tourists.

I came here with a friend while we were around the neighborhood to Pokémon go hunt. I was really hungry so we decided to check out this place.

First I'd like to say: my bill was around $40-$50. Why? All I ordered was pancake with bacon and a drink.. I never knew pancakes were so expensive (lol). This caught me by surprise. I paid for it anyways without complaining because we were in a rush.

Just something for you to keep in mind. Make sure you know what you're paying.

Aw man this spot bailed us out!

Great little breakfast spot. Came here after working a midnight shift. Was Sunday and everywhere was closed. Looked on YELP and I found Viand and they were open!

Typical breakfast diner. Also would be a good spot for comfort food. Only drawback is it's kinda small. Maybe it's a takeout spot more.

Definitely coming back while I'm here.
Bagels and coffee were on-point. Full breakfasts were expensive, but it's NYC. Tiny homey spot right off of Madison Ave, conveniently located. Friendly staff, prompt service. A+!

Good little place to grab a good breakfast/lunch. My sister really enjoyed her Everything bagel with bacon, egg, and cheese -- I had a bite and can verify that it was delicious!

There is not a lot of room to sit, though, and the staff definitely wants you to eat quickly (which is common in NYC, but still).

TIPS:
1) It's very tiny and I wouldn't bring more than one other person with you if you're planning on sitting down
2) CASH ONLY
3) Stick to the basics when ordering! Order things like bagels, pancakes, french toast, eggs benedict, etc. if you want to be 100% happy -- they do those the best...other, unusual things not so much.

Weird rude manager! The place is cute- small but very old school. Food is really average. It was the manager that was weird. I finished my food(I ordered an omelette and not just coffee) and sat there for 15-20 mins more to work a bit. The manager tells my server to ask me to leave. I was so shocked- lots of other tables were empty and there was no wait. I was like are you asking me to leave? He's like it will get busy soon..so I mentioned there is no wait and that there are other empty tables.
So the manager goes like "I want everyone to leave, not just you."
I don't know if he was trying to be funny. But that was so ridiculous. Would not recommend for dine-in basis this. The servers are nice, not the manager.
Best tuna and fresh turkey sandwich in New York. Also amazing French fries. Simple quick and always amazing been coming here for years!
The food was DELICIOUS, the service was great! The coffee was also super good coffee. This easily became one of my favorite diners in the city. It is definitely worth checking out!

The food I got wasn't that good. American cheese, an egg, and some bacon on a trashy peice of bread. It is a very narrow place, barely enough room for two people to stand, and with how crowded it was, it felt very claustrophobic. The place it's self is kinda md of a dirty hole in the wall. Would not recommend.

Viand is a reliable place to grab some quick and easy diner food - always consistent and hits the spot whether you're feeling a stack of pancakes or a turkey club. Service is fast and efficient and often highly entertaining.

I crave their Greek salad on a weekly basis.

Prices are a little high and it's cash only.

Not a place i would revisit, egg and bacon roll was ok and the pancakes were food but the place seamed unclean and i understand the location but $5.10 for a very small cappuccino was a bit ott. Nothing to shout about just a small diner.

the viand on madison avenue is the quintessential new york city experience.on any  day you can take a seat at what George calls 'the bar'which is of course the counter, the bustle and energy is like a taxi cab racing to go to Queens at rush hour. The food is great especiallythe turkey sandwich-best in the city.ththe noise and contstant movement by the waiters is like a franti cdance.the calling out of the orders is so new york. i just love it.if you have not experienced the viand at lunch hour- you have not had the a true new york experience.jane grobart
Wow...a total throwback in time...old school diner with an egg salad sandwich that will change your life!  Love love love this place and will be back many many times!  Super friendly staff!

My review is based on service. To be honest I came here to buy a homeless man dinner. I have heard that this place is somewhat of a institution in NYC. So when I ran into this man who wanted money. I offered to go down the block and get him a good diner style meal and some coffee.

The inside is quite small. They have old school bar style seating and a few tables in the back. It was cramped. The staff was great. I was at the door and I couldn't walk back to the counter to place my order because there were to many people waiting for there food for take out (this place is small). The 2 staff members came and took my order through all of the people.

There were 2 girls my age that were eating and started talking to me. The atmosphere was very relaxed and open. They actually asked if I wanted to join them. I told them why I was here and they were surprised. When I say the place is old school and chill, it really is. It's solid good food that will cost $20 for 2 people.

I will be back to this place. I do recommend coming here if you want a old school meal. Just like it was 30 years ago. The people are friendly. Just good vibes all around.

I was so hungry, alone, carrying a large heavy bag on Madison Avenue with the sun blazing down. I didn't want to deal with a fancy snooty Madison Avenue restaurant so stumbled into Viand Cafe. It's exactly what a New York diner should be- nothing fancy but I knew it would hit the spot. I've missed New York City diners, living in CA the last few years, so wanted to get something classic - chicken salad melt on toasted rye was pretty insane. I could hardly finish it! I've been missing the classic nyc diner where everything is exactly as it should be with no frills attached. I don't have to explain how to toast myhe bread or what a breakfast sandwich looks like. Warning this is cash only! ...maybe the only one update they should work on???

Vegan Night Market is a vendor event featuring Vegan chefs/food businesses. It happens every Tuesday from June to October in Central Park on the upper tier of Wollman Rink.  It's an awesome time and shows the multifariousness of vegan food.

What I loved was that many of the vendors combined vegan cooking with their cultural background. NANSENSE was my favorite! They served vegan Afghan  comfort food. Amazing flavor from their bean and eggplant combo.  There were some other good places that i enjoyed too  but there were also a cpl vendors whose food I just didn't like.

My only issue with this weekly event was the prices. It is free to enter but Many of the vendors had dishes/meals over $15. Being that I'm not 100% Vegan, I wanted to eat and sample from as many places as possible not eat 1 meal from 1 vendor. I noticed that those who had items around  $10 and under sold out of those items rather quickly.

Again there is no entry fee, yes FREE!!!  And the same food vendors are not there every week so you can visit multiple times and experience different Vegan goodness every week! I hope this is/has been really successful because I would love to see the Vegan Night Market to return year after year!

The Vegan Night Market pop up happens in Central Park on Tuesdays next to Wollman Rink, which is currently a Pickleball Court for summer 2023.

Some of these vendors may be familiar from Smorgasburg or other events, but it's nice to have an all vegan feast where you don't have to ask if there are any animal products or not!  The "cheese", the "sausage", the "chicken"... it's all plant-based deep fakes that taste really good.

Everything vegan from southern fried chicken & Mac n cheese, to grilled sausage and cheesecake- items that are normally not in a vegan vocabulary but harken back to those days when plant-based alternatives weren't even an option.

Seating is available at a few picnic tables overlooking the rink, or behind the tents on the lawn, or bring a blanket and make a picnic out of it for sharing on the lawn with friends.  Best bathrooms nearby are at the Chess & Checker's House that looks like a treehouse right now!

First time visiting and supporting this business. The staff are very polite and friendly. I love the pizza squares and the vibe inside the dinning and the showcase of variety of pizza types. I Will remember this place to visit and support when I'm in the area working from Nj. Thank you. Importantly very clean sit and dinning area and clean kitchen. Great customer service and hospitality. Thank you staff. ;)

We stopped by close to closing time, luckily they still had a bunch options on display. We ordered:
- White Square: Mozzarella, whipped ricotta, parm, honey, olive oil
- Vodka Square: Mozzarella, parm, Vodka Sauce, Olive Oil
- Buffalo Chicken: Chicken, mozzarella, Hot Sauce
- Pepperoni and Sausage: Mozzarella, Pepperoni, Sausage

I enjoyed the slices and thought they were generous with the toppings. The staff was really friendly.

I stopped by on an early Saturday afternoon with my friend. I got a square slice of the pepperoni and sausage ($6.50). It was good and not too greasy/cheesy. But I do think that $6.50 is overpriced. My friend got the vodka slice and a side of ranch ($1.50).

I didn't like how the prices were nowhere to be found on the menu.

There's a couple of stools to sit at on both sides of the restaurant. But I would say it's more of a place where you stop in for a quick bite.

Try: Pepperoni Square Pizza, Bruschetta Square Pizza, and White Square Pizza.

Why: Really good pizza squares that are filling! They are generous on the toppings like pepperoni and veggies. I thought the Bruschetta was unique and it was packed with chopped tomatoes, onions, and basil on garlic crust. Got a lil messy but worth it! Pepperoni and White Pizzas were classic bites. I'm more of a thin crust person and these squares were thicker doughy so I was full faster. I was happy and enjoyed the pizza squares!

Notes: I went on a Sunday late lunch around 1:30pm and there were a couple people in front of me. Convenient setup for a quick bite. Open layout with no tables but they have standing wall bars on both sides with some high stools. I dig their motto and sign: "Get Lost in the Sauce." Workers were friendly and efficient. Location was clean. Don't recall bathrooms but they did have hand sanitizer at cash register. Will def come back to try other slices!

We did pop in right around 11:30 and they open at 11AM, so I'm pretty sure we got yesterday's leftovers.

Definitely not as good as the location in the East Village by comparison but still decent! My friends and I got the bruschetta slice and the pepperoni Sicilian.

I'd come back during busier hours to try it fresh.

Five of us came here the other night after another pizza place didn't work out (no seats inside and too cold to eat outside). Lucky for us -- we loved the pizza here!

The guy working behind the counter greeted us when we walked in and was friendly and informative. He mentioned that the top row of square slices on display behind the glass had meat and the middle row were all vegetarian options. Helpful info as two of us are vegetarians! The bottom row had thin crust triangle slices. But since this place is known for their thicker square slices (and you can get triangle slices everywhere in NY) I would stick with those.

I only had one square of their white pizza ($4.95 - with mozzarella, whipped ricotta, parmesan cheese, honey, olive oil). They provide extra hot honey packs and I added some. So delicious and filling! Everyone else in our party had two slices each. My daughter especially liked her eggplant square (mozzarella, fried eggplant, crushed tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil).

Village Square Pizza boasts: "Our pizza delivers on all sensory notes of crunchy, crispy, tasty, sweet and savory in every bite." It's true!

They also score points with me because although seating is limited to some bar stools along the wall, there are hooks available under the counter for your jacket and bags.

A new arrival to join the many nearby pizza places. They seem to mainly focus on square slices which I guess is their differentiator.

I prefer crunchy or corner slices so that part appealed to me. Pepperoni was decent. Some of the slices looked like they had been sitting there for a while, I guess hard to make pizza look great in a cabinet.

A good slice. The deep dish pepperoni slice had a sweet crust and sauce. I'm not a huge fan of that, but I ate it! Definitely needed to be dipped in extra marinara sauce. No table or outdoor seating, just barstool seating alongside each side of the walls. Cute lil' light up sign (see photos). I also got a regular slice of pepperoni and I preferred that one by far. Still needed to be dipped in extra sauce though imo (I do prefer extra sauce in general though).

Really tasty pizza! I've been here a few times and have tried the upside down slice, pepperoni slice with hot honey, and the white pizza (ricotta). All were pretty flavorful, with ricotta being my favorite. The dough is chewy, with a crispy end/edge. The staff is super nice, and always make you feel welcomed. I highly recommend!

Soooo happy that VSP has joined the UES! Armando makes me feel so welcomed every time I come in. I normally get the square pepperoni pizza but I just had their Margherita slice tonight and it was divine. Great quality of ingredients and great customer service! If you want a pizza to sink your teeth into, visit Village Square Pizza for suuuure.

If your idea of ambience is eating in an white antiseptic empty space with limited bar-stool seating and narrow counters, then this is the place for you. Greasy, expensive hipster pizza.

Don't do too many reviews but this particular experience described below which occurred a couple of weeks ago pushed me to write up this bit of nonsense.

Asked the register girl for a cup of water with the slice of Margherita pizza. Said she didn't have any. Not true since I had a cup of water with pizza the one time I was there before trying the greasy regular slice. I pointed to the cups and water/soda dispenser and said a cup of ice then please.  

Response "75 cents."

Ice and a cup doesn't cost 75 cents.  

You want to gouge potential customers?

Not me.

Told the indifferent register person I would not return - she politely replied - "that's fine."

It is? If that's the way you do business then you won't stay in business.

Sorry - but to the owners of Village Square Pizza - you should hire people who actually care about their jobs and don't pull nickel and dime stuff and gleefully permit permanently losing customers.

So I'm never returning here again and I've told many people about the experience. Even if I didn't write this review,  remember - word of mouth is more powerful than the internet.

We just got to NYC today and walked down to Village Square to grab a few slices for dinner. We had the White Square, Sausage and Pepperoni Square, and the Grandma slice.

The white slice and pepperoni and sausage were absolutely delicious. We were not as much as a fan of the Grandma slice, but it is more of a preference (too much sauce and not enough other substantial toppings).

The guy who took our order was very friendly and accommodating. Great vibes all around.

This is a new spot in the neighborhood that I've been eager to try, because the pizza always looked so delicious every time I walked by. I finally tried it the other day and was SO thankful I did-I'm still dreaming about it. I got the pepperoni/sausage pizza, which was so incredibly flavorful, and the consistency was just perfect. The crust was nice and crispy on the bottom which I love, especially in a square slice. The employees were also so friendly, and even gave me two free garlic knots since they just came out of the oven-so kind! I can't wait to come back soon and try some of their other options!

The pizza was good, and there was lots of space and everything was clean. Took off a half a star because it wasn't anything mind-blowing. They were running pretty slow for a pizza shop but it sounds like they were understaffed today. Everyone was nice and very accommodating.

One of the best slices in NYC. The pizza was incredibly flavorful with a nice crisp crust. The service was great too. It's a smaller place with limited seating but great if you're just grabbing a slice on the go.

Finally some GOOD pizza in this neighborhood!! Love VSP so much especially their pepperoni slice with hot honey. Also the white slice is phenomenal. Grandma is also really good if you prefer a thinner slice. If I'm doing take out I like to heat it up on a pan or even better in an air fryer to get the crust crunchy again. If you've never had VSP the next day toasted for a few mins in an air fryer you are missing outttt. Can't wait to come back and get my fix!! I'm drooling already

I'm on vacation and wanted some good pizza. I just walked in and met the coolest New Yorker ever. Didn't catch his name but great FRIENDLY service with even better pizza (great variety)... this is my new "go to" for pizza when in NYC!!!
Great Pizza spot, people are friendly and welcoming and the food is delicious. Glad to see them in the neighborhood!
Some of the best pizza in the city highly recommended and the staff there are top notch friendly and helpful

Pretty delicious pizza, a cut above other places in Lennox Hill. Place seems clean and staff is friendly. Will definitely be returning. Recommend the white slice with some of the hot honey drizzled on top.
Best pizza in the area. I never go anywhere else. The pepperoni square slices are the best. They are very nice and always consistent.

Came in around 12am, so there wasn't fresh pizza. They heated it up for me & started off well but cooled down fast, making the pasta on top turn a bit hard and cold. However, it still tasted fine. The crust was my favorite part.

+ Just keep in mind that they don't allow outside food (including your friends), but they do have tables available.

Went here for a bite after going to a few bars last night with friends.

Although it is a smaller place, there were a bunch of different options. The pizza was alright. I had the Sicilian and it was just average, a bit cold. My friend got pepperoni and it was kinda stiff and also cold. The staff was nice and fixed everything quickly. For what was available at the time, it was alright. However, there is much better options in the city.

Very average pizza place. Pizza doesn't look appetizing at the front, but it becomes passable once heated. Cheese slices were $3.75 each which is much more than most slice spots.

Lunch special from 11am-5pm is $7 for 2 slices and a can of soda.

This was my first time here. They accept credit cards and have tap to pay. I had a slice of the Buffalo Chicken and a slice of the Baked Ziti pizza. I wanted to like it, but I wasn't impressed. The Buffalo Chicken pizza didn't have much of a buffalo flavor, and there was this weird brownish sauce on it. The Ziti was dry and tough. We went late on a weeknight, so I'm wondering if it just wasn't fresh, but it didn't taste very good. The crust was also dry and tough. There are other better pizza places close to here.
Best pizza on the upper east side hands down. Crust is cooked to perfection.  Worth all the calories

Good thing we got soda with our order because the pizza slices were so dry and bland. The pizza slices are $5 or close to $5 each and I was hoping to get more flavor than what I got.
Never got Pizza from Vinnie's before this, and probably won't again.
2* for the soda and for how quick the order came out

tl;dr an upscale takeout pizza joint brought down ten notches by its expensive and otherwise mediocre slices

In the hunt for quick slices on the Upper East Side, Vinnie's inviting storefront beckoned toward me and my growling belly. The space is clean and airy, featuring subway tiles on one wall opposite exposed brick on the other, marble tables with bright red metal chairs a retro cast-iron "Eat" sign complete with antique bulb lights, and wall art vaguely correlated to Italian culture. Acoustic, multilingual music plays unobtrusively in the background, mixing with the clatter of ovens and utensils. Straight back, a wide variety of colorful pies are prominently displayed on the pizza counter. A slow trickle of other patrons continued throughout our visit.

However, the good vibes ended with the decor. The slices were lukewarm, and the cheese wasn't even melty. The crust erred on the cardboard-y side. The cheese slice was bland. While the pepperoni was infinitely better with its rich and spicy oil, this was offset by the $5 charge per slice. With so many cheaper and tastier pizza joints across the city, I see no reason to ever recommend Vinnie's except for sheer convenience.

The prices are steep for the quality of pizza, about $5 a slice. The margarita was decent, but the crust was too burnt and hard on both slices. I've never had baked ziti on a pizza before so I was curious to try it out, but was disappointed in the lack of flavor so I had to add a bunch of red chili pepper and garlic powder to make it more palatable. I think it's just the concept of that slice that doesn't work but it's seriously just like biting into a large block of doughy flavorless pasta, definitely not for me. I also tried my friend's bbq chicken pizza, which was pretty flavorful, but had too much cheese for my taste.

Some of the worst pizza I've ever had. It was six dollars for a plain slice of pizza, and the only reason I paid for that was because it was the only place open and I wanted to try it out. Never going back because there are just so many better and cheaper pizza places in the area.
This slice tasted "regular". The flavor didn't give "buffalo". Unfortunately it taste like school lunch pizza. I'll try again for different slice. But this was "blah". I love a good slice.
Super quick delivery and they'll deliver slices instead of just pies - all 3 types we got were great

Vinnie's Pizzeria on Second Avenue is a pretty cute place. While it looks brand new it's old school to me. The man behind the counter couldn't understand what I was saying about no tomato because of my allergies. Finally another customer got him to understand. I detected he had what may be an Italian accent.

All that said, service is great and there's seating outside and inside to eat a slice. I have two options without tomato. One is chicken and cheese, and the other is just the cheese. I'm not a fan of chicken on pizza so I opt for the plain white slice. I'll be back!

A pizza joint in the hood that I have dropped in at many times over the years. It's a reliable slice of pizza especially when you're out at night bar hopping along 2nd avenue.

A slice will cost you around $3. Decent pizza with nice balance of cheese and sauce. It's a small place with a few tables and chairs inside, and they also put a few on the sidewalk at times.
Meh pizza, awful service, the owner is an asshole and wouldn't let my two friends sit down and eat with me because they had burgers. Not how you treat a paying customer.

I hate to do this.
I hate to knock a small business during these hard times.
But dear Lord...
It. Was. The. Worst. Pizza. Ever.
We didn't check reviews or anything... they were the only ones delivering late night... it arrived quickly... we were pumped.
Even though we were dinking and starving we could not choke it down.
Even smelling it was an offense to the senses.
It truly tasted and smelled rotten... like they hoped the late night crown wouldn't know they were consuming authentically rancid ingredients.
We had to walk it out to the street to throw it out as it was nauseating everyone with it's stench in the apartment.

Pizza deliciosa a un gran precio.

El local es pequeño así que no es para familias. La salsa de la pizza es realmente buena. Joyita!

Pizza is delightful!

Got harassed in this pizza shop tonight and the owners stood around, watched/listened, and said absolutely nothing. Won't be back.
Seemed like a good spot. Got a slice, plain cheese. Heated up properly, timely and tasted good. Good solid New York slice. The interior was cool.

I was in the area and stopped in for a standard slice of cheese. The pizza tasted good. It has a nice crunch and fair amount of firmness. It was hot and ready right away. It was close to $5 which is higher than I'd hoped. There was some indoor seating and one table outside. The entrance did have a short ramp. No visible bathroom.

Great pizza shop that sales by the slice if you need a quick bite. I was pleased with my cheese pizza and I think it was better than some of the suggested favs of NYC. The crust was the perfect thickness for a NYC slice. Thank you!

I really  wanted to love this place! Let me start by saying I came on a Sunday night so maybe in the day time it is better? The cashier was not friendly in the least and seemed annoyed that I was there to make a purchase. Cool, I'm there for pizza so no biggie. The pizzas all looked dried and were not the most appetizing to look at... but looks can be deceiving, right? We ordered a plain slice, a pepperoni Sicilian, and a ziti slice. As we waited we noticed the cashier completely ruined 2 "fresh" pies. I mean they looked horrible but again not my pizza not my problem. We tried to pay with a $50 bill and the cashier said they didn't take cash... but had a register. Okie dokie card it is.

Finally left, get home and it looked so off putting but I am very particular so I still give it a go. I tried very hard to like this pizza, but half way through I started feeling sick. Mind you I was starving so this was a major red flag. The Sicilian seemed ok and we just neglected the plain slice as the sauce was basically a dark brown color and was so dry it was not worth it to try.

Needless to say I woke up in the middle of the night with a very bad stomach ache and ended up with food poisoning. I am almost 100% sure those pizzas sat out all day, and while I understand not wanting to waste food this was the worse pizza I have ever had in my life and was very negligent on their end. I have never gotten food poisoning  from pizza before. Thanks Vinny's for teaching me a very valuable and depressing lesson.

Margarita slice was okay too hot burning my mouth

Now the chicken parm hero. Way too much sauce way too much cheese, cheese and sauce overtook the bread. Sauce and cheese stuck to the aluminum while trying to peel off. Sandwich cut into but not completely in half so when I pulled it away bread rip and chicken fell on my lap.

Completely unsatisfied will not return

I've been to this pizzeria and they normally are fine, but today was just awful. I got a slice of pepperoni and that was passable.  it was greasy And the slice was kind of thin.  I also got a mushroom slice & this slice, the dough was thick, the mushroom was, I don't know what the mushroom was all about. I wasted $10. No more. Maybe an off day?

I've walked in here many times in the early evening and often leave as the pizza looks like its been sitting out awhile.  Bad timing I guess, but I walk down a block to La Mia if I don't find anything to get here.  I usually get a slice of pepperoni or buffalo chicken pizza when it looks fresh.

Nothing too crazy to write home about.  It's pretty average and its close to my place. Staff is friendly enough.

This is my neighborhood go-to pizza spot for a quick slice, delivery, or late night snack. Small pizzeria with a few tables but they are known for takeout. They are consistent in taste so I go here somewhat frequently. They also have a punch card.

They have a lunch special of 2 cheese slices plus a soda for $5.99. For a quick slice or late night snack I get a cheese slice plus a random specialty slice (usually something meaty) and that fills me up. For delivery, I get their large pie because I like cold pizza leftovers!

I also appreciate that they are not too stingy on cheese, meats, or toppings. For example, they top their Cesar Salad with tons of parmesan and chicken, and on their slices with a good amount of meat and sauce.

Average pizza place. On the Upper East Side. Typical family owned and operated kind of place. Simple menu. This place is very cramped so get takeout.

It has several kinds of pizza. Most popular of course is the New York style. The pizza is sold by the slice for about $2.75, which isn't terrible. It also has calzones. These are about $12 so kind of high. Offerings here are pretty average. This is not the best, but it's not the worst

Wish I knew what Antoinette L. had here. She mentioned how good the vegan pizza was, but the owner said they never had any. Too bad, there's always Two Boots Pizza.
I wish I could give less stars. The pizza was good but the service is terrible. Open one Friday night and closed the next. Not worth your time to gamble. Don't go here, trust me.

I love the pizza and have counted on this place for a late night slice for years but was very disappointed to be recently served by a man with no mask on.  It made me extremely nervous and I'm unlikely to return. Covid times! Do better!

It's sad there's not much of an option when it comes to late night food in the UES. This was one of two pizzerias on 2nd ave open at midnight, and I'm sad to say both were just average. It gets the job done when you're 5 shots deep and are craving greasy. But I wouldn't choose to have this pizza sober, there are so many other pizza options in the city.

They have a variety of menu items including pizza, salad, calzones, and I only tried the pizza so I shouldn't rule out the other menu items I didn't try.  

The shop is very small, with only a few number of seats available. Mostly a take out place. The AC is very small as well, so it's not a cool seated eatery in the summer time if you are looking for that.

The Second Avenue Subway IS HERE and it has changed my life.

I no longer walk home from Lexington, passing old standbys Shake Shack, Sweetgreen, and Little Italy Pizza. Now when I emerge from the underground, I see Vinnie's Pizza staring me in the face. I grabbed two plain trial slices last week after work, and it was pretty lackluster. Not fresh, reheated, nothing special. They need more volume in order to be a good slice joint.

However, I was intrigued enough to order a whole fresh pie this past Friday night. Now this was good. Freshly prepared, the good quality ingredients started to make their presence known, and I could appreciate the abundance of smooth sweet tomato sauce, and nice thin crust. I'll definitely order from here again.

Stopped in here cause I needed a cheap lunch special for lunch.

(!) WHAT I GOT: $5 lunch special ($5.50 with tax) which includes 2 plain slices and a canned soda.

(!) HOW IT DID: It was alright. It was far from the best pizza I've ever had, Crust was very plain and it was... y'know, just fine. Standout of the pizza was the tomato sauce. All in all, it was $5.50 that I didn't regret spending. I'm willing to bet that if I had arrived when the pizza was freshly made, maybe it would've been fresher & better. But it was about 3:30pm and the slices I got were put into the oven to be reheated.

(!) SEATING: Minimal seating. You're probably better of taking it back to work or back home.

(!) SERVICE & AMBIANCE: I'm not looking for a long lasting foodie relationship with these guys, and I like it. They ask what I want and I let 'em know. They take my card and ring it up. They slid the pizza box over. This place shines on ambiance and it felt like an old-school shop--though word in the reviews is they opened up a month ago!

(!) TIDBITS: $5 minimum credit card charge. There's an ATM in the shop too in case you need cash for a slice... though I don't see why people would use it if the minimum is so low. Lunch special goes until 5:00PM, which is great.

Overall, if I need a cheap meal for work, this place is up for consideration if I'm not trying to walk too far and if I'm eating a late lunch. I think I'll be back, if only to see if the pizza will be better next time.
Cute little pizza spot! Pepperoni pizza was yummy and the service was nice and fast. Will def be coming back for another one of these slices :)
