As a local who lives a block away, I can testify that Vinnie's Pizzeria erases the flaws of all surrounding pizza shops nearby.

The one thing they can promise is good food that is fresh and I cannot thank them enough for giving me real pizza in my neighborhood.

Note: I was FRIED when we came here...That aside, the pizza was bangin.

Food: The vegan pizza was better than the regular pizza. I didn't even bother taking a photo of mine. And to be honest, the regular slices weren't that memorable. Again booze aside.

Conclusion: Seriously tho, this place is the best of both worlds. Would return.

Oh my God, Vinnie's Pizzeria was simply amazing. It was a remarkable experience. Vinnie's Pizzeria is one of these places where all the menu items look terrific, I had Vegan Pizza and it was amazing. The team are super attentive and kind and they're great at giving recommendations. Definitely recommended.

Vinnie's is a very small and narrow pizza spot with only a few chairs inside. You are better off going here for takeout only. Overall, their NYC style pizza is very average. The slices here were not too big and not too small and are normally priced ($2.75 cheese, $3.50 pepperoni). They had a decent amount of cheese on them, but one thing that I did not like is that they are very stingy on the sauce. As a result, the pizza was a little dry and rubbery.
Vinnie appears to be the actual person making and serving pizza. Very yummy and perfect authentic NYC pizza experience.

One morning i took my time to wake up while my friends got up early and ate breakfast themselves. I had no issue w this as often times im not much of a hungry boy, however, this morning as i was walking out the door, it hit me. Something i never feel, i was unsure, struggling to believe.....that i was hungry. As my fellow friends and i took upon the subway and migrated east from Jersey to the big city. Leaving the station of subways there it was, not knowing what i was about to get myself into i said "ahh whatever imma just eat there" and man when i tell you i made the right decision we'll i'll be damned. After taking my first bite i was walking around the city of new york feeling like an Italian mobster, almost like if you looked at me funny i'd slit your throat. It was so good i wanted to go back in there and kiss uncle vinnie himself and join the family. I came all the way from sunny san diego and trust me im going back to NYC just to see uncle vinnie. Oh! and not only is the pizza good but this man is the sweetest most precious pizza making man i ever laid eyes on. if you're not eating at vinnie's pizza joint you get out of my face.

Not once, but twice, Vinnie's has stolen my money. One occasion I was charged $5 for one plain slice of pizza and when I questioned it, a staff member (I believe he is the owner though) said "oh yeah sorry" and handed me adequate change.

Another time, I used my debit/credit card and the following day I saw two charges on my account. I went in to question the charge as I was not surprised they had pulled this again. I stood my ground and asked for my money back as there is no way I would have had two separate charges for one slice of pizza. He told me to come back but obviously I did not because I would never see my money again. Eventually the wife gave me cash and I left.

NEVER stopping there for pizza again no matter how convenient or hungry I may be.

I don't know where the pictures here come from, but I made sure to look at them before I ordered a large pie with mushrooms on it. I thought they'd be fresh mushrooms like the pictures here, instead I got canned mushrooms (the smell was awful and unbearable).
Plus I think the canned mushrooms must have had a lot of liquid in them, because the pie was saggy too. It was the worst pie ever! Ironically when I ordered through seamless a few hours ago, I specifically wrote a note on my order saying "thank you for making great pizzas", because in the past I've only ordered plain cheese and it's was ok. This time I made a huge mistake relying on the pictures here and ordering mushrooms on it. Who in the right mind puts canned mushrooms on a pizza? Very disappointed!

Update: Today I received a compliment from a staff of this fine establishment with a very nice comment as you can see in the picture. Instead of owning up to their mistake, I guess they chose the option of offending an honest comment online. Am I surprised that this fine gentleman chose to respond to this comment this way? No, I'm not. His bullying and his attitude matches that of his business too I'm sure. Instead of focusing on improving his CANNED BUSINESS he is focusing on offending me! What a great pathetic human waste he must be!
Great late night pizza right by the penrose. They are still making fresh pies at 1 am.

They have good food unfortunately the staff do not seem too concerned about following New York City laws regarding face coverings in the middle of a global pandemic. I walked in today to order food and the two employees standing at the cash register, by all of the food, had nothing covering their faces. Not even a bad attempt where it's down under the nose or on the chin. They literally just had nothing. If they can't be bothered to follow basic Laws meant to save peoples lives then it makes you wonder what other health code violations are happening in this restaurant! I just feel bad for the people that order online and have no idea!

Order of garlic knots and there was literally not even a hint of garlic or oil on them. They were just dry pieces of bread. Inexcusable.

I also added a photo see you can see for yourself.

Not sure where all the bad reviews are coming from but I've really enjoyed the pizza here and have visited this shop a couple of times. The pizza isn't overly greasy and I've gotten pepperoni slices with mushrooms as well as their bbq chicken slice. They are also super generous with toppings and affordable. Owner has been really friendly. I also really like their tiramisu which is in a fridge in the back.

Prices were good but regular slices were a bit below average.  Take into account I was there late night.  The slice wasn't terrible.  So I'm giving this place the benefit of the doubt.  Might be an a-okay slice with a pie right out of the oven.

I wandered around 2nd ave and I was craving for pizza and I came across this place. What attracted me to this place was the smell of the pizza and I have no regrets for coming to this location. The cheese pizza was my favorite one cause I really enjoyed the cheese and the saucing which was perfect for this pizza. Overall best pizzeria in NYC and I recommend you checking this place out!!

Again, like Omar's review a similar situation occurred where the owner charged me for a soda without informing me.

My fiancé (who is Asian) walked in with a Diet Coke and I walked in with a Margarita and ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza ($3.50).  The owner asked my fiancé twice if we had gotten a drink (the coke) which she responded negative, too and charged us $6.  I paid for it without thinking until my fiancé pointed out that it was incorrect.

Walking back inside, I demanded to know what happened, and he insisted that we had gotten the coke even though the fridge was full, lol.  He gave back the refund but did not offer an apology.

The issue I saw was how he politely greeted the white customer who was in the store but was rude and gruff with us.  It's ironic as our intention was to buy from local business to help them during this time.

Judging from Omar's remark, this isn't the only time this type of overcharging has occurred and I can't but imagine it wasn't tinged with racist or prejudice attitudes.  I work in big tech and my fiancé is a doctor...no reason to suspect us of stealing :/
It was closed and never received a refund. No indication anywhere online that this was the case.

Awesome Pizza Friendly Owners!

I come here often to get pizza when I am done working a shift. The pizza is always made with good ingredients.

Worst pizza I've had in a long time. Ordered a bunch of slices, they were hard as a rock. Obviously they had been re-heated several times. Crust was burnt on the plain ones. Couldn't even chew the crust.

Where do I start? I ordered from Verdict through Seamless as our firm uses different caterers everyday. It was my week to order and all I can say is that the quality, quantity and service by far exceeds so many of the other well known restaurants. This is my new favorite and will always order from Verdict for all of my important meetings and when it is my week to order lunch. Yum!

I was pretty pleased with this place for what it is, a fast casual local chain. The chicken and basil boiled dumplings were actually delicious, would recommend! I also tried the veggie steamed bun, which was alright. The filling seemed to be like whatever they probably in the veg dumplings. After 8 dumplings + the bun I was still a little hungry, but it was a good price. They also have a good variety of drinks, although I only tried the cold lemon-honey beverage (which was good). Got my food to dine-in, but it was all still packaged in plastic.

Super affordable place for dumplings in UES. We only tried the pan fried chive & pork, and the boiled cabbage & pork, plus a small wonton soup. The wonton soup was surprisingly good, so would recommend that (we tried spinach & mushroom). The pan fried dumplings were tasty, though a tad on the salty side even without adding any sauces. The boiled dumplings were great as well. All in all, it is not the best dumplings in the world, but they are fast and super affordable. It is mostly a takeout place, as they do have some seating, everybody that was in the store was doing takeout when I stopped by (about 5-6 parties). We didn't try their noodles this time around, but I imagine they're pretty decent as well.

The indoor looks very nice since it is a pretty new place. They include the dumpling sauce in takeout orders, so no need to add your own. The items come out super super hot, so be careful when handling the containers! I had a simple order, so it took about 10 minutes to come out (there were a few orders ahead of mine). They don't do delivery, but you can order ahead by calling them.

Delicious new dumpling outpost! Love the chicken/shrimp fried wontons, and vegetable dumplings. Ordered an assortment. I wish them the best!

Also tried the kimchi and seaweed salad, which are on the sweet side. Still delicious!

Honestly I was so hungry I could have eaten anything when I walked in. Are these dumplings the best in their class? No. Do they hit the spot on a day when you're craving dumplings? Absolutely.

I ended up ordering the fried chive and pork dumplings, the boiled chicken & basil dumplings, a plain sesame pancake, and a coconut bubble milk tea. Again, if you're hungry, these will 100% do the trick. The skin is a bit tough, and the pan fried dumplings don't have that crunch that you look for in a fried dumpling (I'd actually recommend the boiled dumplings over the fried ones. I found that those were much juicier than the fried ones.)

I was hoping the sesame pancake would have more of a scallion pancake feel to them, but it was more bready and thick than a scallion pancake usually is. It was good starch, but lacked flavor.

I had insanely low expectations for the boba, but it was edible! The coconut milk  tea was definitely on the watery side, but it had solid flavor. The boba was softer than I'd like, but listen I'm not going to be picky since this is clearly a dumpling house, not a boba shop. I will say that it wasn't filled to the top when I got it. My friends opted for fruit teas and yakult drinks, and those seemed to fare better than the milk teas.
I love this place. It's affordable, service is good, and the dumplings are very good. I usually get the spicy scallion sauce. I prob go once a week and am never disappointed.
Tasteless and unappetizing. Wouldn't go back. 2 stars for convenience but not for taste. No soup dumplings here either

So wanted to like this place. Got assorted and Dan Dan noodles. dumplings were like. 2.5 and the noodles were a -1. I'm not even sure they were actual Dan Dan noodles. Maybe they should try out Han Dynasty's dan Dan noodles for comparison and try again ‍

This place need to really get its act together on logistics and operations. You place an order (no matter how large or small) and then stand in some unorganized cue as one of the staff members shouts order numbers back and forth. Sometimes she'll forget the number and shout out the wrong one. Really painful experience to come here for dine in or take out - and the food is just okay. You're better off eating at Tri Dim Shanghai if you're looking for dumplings (just a few blocks south)
Vegetable dumplings were burnt/black on the bottom and dried out. Nowhere to wait for your order.

Was happy to see them in my hood. Went to the one in Chinatown a few weeks ago. Both times I had the pan fried pork dumplings- delish. Ordering and pick up is typical for this type of place- you wait for your number to be called. Easy.
Soo good, great price. Very happy to have this in the UES. The Cucumber salad is an awesome side. So far all the dumplings I've had are incredible.

I'm Taiwanese, so I can really appreciate the menu here.  I've been to other Vanessa's Dumpling Houses, but this one was the best.  I was starving, so I ordered the assorted steamed dumplings, hot and sour soup, pickled cucumbers, and scallion pancake chicken sandwich.  The service was pretty good too!  I told the cashier I was so hungry and she gave me the hot and sour soup and told me to get the cucumbers from the case so I could eat while I waited for the other food.

Everything was so good!  I think the pork dumplings are the best.  The chicken dumplings had some basil, which tasted weird.  I sat at one of the tables and enjoyed my dinner, with dumpling sauce and hot sauce at the table.

Excellent hot and sour soup!  I also tried to order the chicken corn soup but they were out.  The cucumbers were good too.

I ordered once from this place,
It was good so I wanna try the actual restaurant

I wasn't disappointed, good service, nice and clean
And the price is pretty good too

(Of course, the food was yummy)

Delicious dumplings! I got the pork and cabbage dumplings and then got another order for the mixed dumplings. I also liked the scallions and noodles.

The interior is clean with a small selection of seating.

The staff were kind and the food was ready quickly. Highly recommend here for some delicious food especially quickly!

5 out of 5 stars

I would highly recommend Vanessa's
Dumpling House to anyone looking for a great dumpling restaurant. The food is delicious, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is very clean and comfortable. You will not be disappointed!

I hope this review is helpful!

Relatively cheap lunch option in the neighborhood. You're guaranteed dumplings coming out piping hot. This restaurant also has a liquor license so enjoy a cold one with your food. Good amount of seating here and they accept Apple Pay!

This is a good place for quick dumplings but honestly they don't taste that great. I think because they have expanded so much they've lost the flavor and quality of their dumplings. The skin is super thick and the meat isn't juicy.

The dumplings were very good. Place is nice and clean. It was a little confusing on where and when to get your food. I'm very happy to have them in the neighborhood and will definitely be hitting them again!

Had the chance to try this place a couple days ago. I was pleasantly surprise to have very good quality food for a very affordable price, specially in the UES.

Went there around midday to place an order to go, however if you want to eat there they have a couple of tables, the decor and interior design is simple but beautiful.

I tried the fried pork and chives dumplings, the steamed dumplings the variety plate  (4 flavors) the shrimp wonton soup and the sesame pancake with beef. Everything was good but my favorite was the sesame pancake and the fried dumplings. The pancake could have been warmer though but the flavor and size was really good.

Staff was friendly and offered free sodas with my purchase, service is a bit slow but nothing crazy and I think they could use some help with someone cleaning the tables more often, other than that I think is a great place to eat well for a few bucks.

I would definitely come back.

Try: Pan Fried Dumplings (Pork & Chive; $5.88), Assorted Boiled Dumplings ($8.88), and Hot & Sour Soup ($7.68)

Why: Dumplings were good, not as delicious as their Chinatown location, but I'm happy they opened a location on UES for when I crave dumplings. Both the Fried and Boiled Dumplings did stick together so the skin would break apart and the meat inside was small. They were still tasty and satisfied my cravings. I also liked the Hot & Sour Soup as it was flavorful with a good amount of egg drop, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and tofu. Would have been great if it also came with fried wontons strips for added texture.

The Spicy Beef Dan Dan Noodles ($9.88) and Wontons in Spicy Sauce ($8.88) were good options to try and were flavorful.

I also tried the Steamed Cabbage & Pork Bun ($2.68) but did not like it much. The bun was a bit cardboard-y and the meat was small and not juicy. The Steamed Bok Choy in Soy Sauce ($7.88) was ok, but I wanted some veggies to go with my dumplings.

Notes: I came twice; once during grand opening and another a week later, both times for dinner. The first experience was insanely hectic. The takeout wait was at least an hour, which they shared ahead of time. They did get some orders wrong and workers did yell at each other. But, I had to give them a second chance since that was grand opening day. The second time was much smoother, and it took 30 mins for takeout. They seemed more organized and didn't have a long line. I think the prices are fair and portions are decent for a tasty meal. They also have Boba, which is great for the UES since there are not many places that sell it in this neighborhood.

Finally a dumplings and bubble tea place in the higher UES area! Vanessa's Dumplings is a chain originating from Chinatown.

Get your fast food steamed or fried dumplings along with delicious Chinese sesame pancakes and noodles! They also sell merch and frozen dumplings!

I tried Vanessa's again for the first time today since my initial review.  I'll stand by that initial review.  While the lines are gone, the food is still just "ok".  I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to come here.  There are better options.

Vanessa's Dumpling House is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. The food is fresh and good. The red bean bun is delicious. They have every kind of dumpling you can think of.

The customer service is fantastic. They accidentally delivered part of my order. When I called to let them know, I was quite annoyed. They very quickly rectified the situation, the rest of our order was delivered within 15 minutes of me calling them - on the Lunar New Year!

Bravo Vanessa's Dumpling House, welcome to the neighborhood!

I really wanted to give these guys a good review, because there aren't many decent Chinese food options in this neighborhood... but this place is pretty ghetto. The food is flat out mediocre. They don't offer water for in-house dining, unless you buy bottled water. And worse of all, regardless of whether you order food to dine in or eat out, it's still served in the same cheap takeout containers. it's unfortunate because if they just stepped up their game a tiny bit, this place could be at 4/5 instead  out of 2/5. And then when you check out, they expect you to leave a tip, I'm not sure for what? It's only self serve counter service.

Friend chicken and shrimp wontons were pretty bland, had to douse in siracha and chili oil for it to taste decent, milk taro bubble tea was creamy and sweet. Service is pretty straight forward, order at counter and wait for your number to be called. Well lit ambiance with 2000s pop playing in the background

So far so good! Highly recommend.
My favorite is the Chive & Pork dumpling! Must have!

Wow! I didn't know Vanessa's opened a location in UES. A friend recommended going to Vanessa's in Chinatown but now I guess I don't need to go all the way down.

The dumplings are definitely flavorful and the noodles are fairly standard. However, it did take a very long time to receive my order. I hope they could improve the wait times. It is definitely a bit more expensive than the Chinatown location, but it's still relatively more affordable than the restaurants in UES.

They also have a mini freezer on the side where you can take home dumplings for yourself. Flavors are limited but they are all prepped from the central kitchen (and so are the cooked foods if you order for dine-in or take out).

5 stars for customer service and food! I loved the pan fried wontons w/spicy sauce. I'm not a fan of dumplings but love this is place.
100% recommend everyone to try this place and please do make sure you appreciate their service.
Thank you for your service and being so kind!

Just as good as I remember, if not better since I don't have to go all the way down to Chinatown to get the best dumplings, sesame pancake sandwiches, and anything else (noodles, boba tea, etc). I friggin LOVE this place. Super affordable pricing too. Come and eat as many dumplings as your big heart wishes!!

Popped in on a Saturday night and ordered the assorted boiled dumplings with a side of kimchi. The dumplings were pretty good and were ready pretty quickly, I really liked that they offered a variety option, all of them were tasty, but I think the pork was likely my favorite. Kimchi was a pass, it was tasty, but didn't have a trace of gochujang on it which I really missed, was more of a vinegar base. Also tried a bite of the sesame pancake, which is a nice side of bread, but nothing too exciting. Seating is a little tight too, but it's a small place so that is a bit to be expected. Great price for a decent meal and staff was very helpful, friendly and quick.

Food is literally amazing and flavorful. I think everything I got was spot on and the service was impeccable. I would give it 4 stars but the second time I went the noodles that we got was not good and we had to throw away the food. This was disappointing but nevertheless it might of just been a fluke. I love their food and their prices. Definitely recommend trying!
We tried a whole bunch of things, including the dumpling sampler, spicy pan fried pork and cabbage, kimchi, a steam bun, and sesame pancake. Everything was hot and delicious.

I don't know if I want to laugh or if I want to cry, the original first Vanessa's dumpling was down on Eldrige St. between Grand and Broome, they opened during my college years back around the early 2000s and my buddies and I would use to hang out and pick up their dumplings once in a while where we hung out at the nearby game store where across the street was a glass shop that some of my old buddies worked at. Even then the pot sticker fried dumplings  (鍋貼) was just okay, given how much they had to make on a daily basis it was much more fresh back then, but still it's not even close to what I've had back home in Shanghai or Sichuan. Since this Upper East Side location has opened, today was the 4th time I had the pot sticker here, it's literally a complete failure and disaster at its worst. The skin of the dumpling is so thick, it's literally amateur hour and the filling was dry, no juice at all. The typical beef pancake was so hard, my jaw started to tire from eating it like it was a literal workout. It's a shame how far they've come and how far they've also fallen.

Very excited to have Vanessa's in the neighborhood!  Visited on a Thursday evening and dined in. This location has a steady stream of customers getting take out, a testament to the ease of travel with the namesake dumplings.  Tried a bit of everything... Chive/ Pork pan fried dumpling, Assorted boiled dumpling (pork/ veg/ chicken/ shrimp), Cold noodle with Sesame peanut sauce, white meat chicken sesame pancake sandwich.  Clearly had leftovers to take home.  My fave is the pan fried dumplings so looking forward to trying a variety of those next time.  Do yourself and make it spicy with chili oil, scallion, garlic and cilantro for an extra couple bucks.  An order of dumplings and a sesame pancake sandwich would definitely be sufficient for a meal for me.  Great prices, clean dining room, tasty!  Looking forward to my next visit!

These dumplings are absolutely to die for. They were hot, fresh and delicious. I ordered the chicken and the shrimp (a mix of steamed and fried) and they were AMAZING. Seasoned to absolute perfection and soaked in a spicy sauce with more seasoning on top. I also had the vegetable pancake which was really soft and filling.  I will def be ordering these often!

Such a delicious spot for authentic Chinese food. The owner Vanessa has been there everyday working hard to get the service up and running here. The wait times can be long, but the staff is learning the ropes and serving up the food with love and kindness. The spicy pan fried vegan wontons were delicious! Spicy, crispy and flavorful inside and out. The red bean bao is my favorite. Warm, fluffy, sweet red bean paste that makes my mouth water. Food is so reasonably priced compared to other noodle and Asian spots on the UES. Highly recommend if you're looking for the Chinatown experience without the subway commute.
The bubble tea was decent.  Dumplings in spicy sauce were decent.  Everything else was terrible (noodles, regular vegetable dumplings, buns).  Waste of money.
Usually pretty good but found multiple hairs in my Dan Dan noodles tonight. They did provide a refund on the dish, but I won't be back.

So happy they opened this new location in the UES. Food is delicious and prices are reasonable. (Store is nice and clean!) Bought some frozen dumplings home and they were delicious. If you're a dumpling person this is a place to go to!

Love Vanessa's on the LES so we were surprised to find a piece of GLASS in the spicy pork dumplings. We just picked up Vanessa's for dinner and about halfway through the meal my girlfriend but something hard and it was a piece of GLASS. Just glad she's okay, make sure you're careful here. Extremely disappointed in the care and attention to detail taken here. Never eating here again.

I went in today for what I thought would be a quick bite. I ordered wontons with spicy sauce, pan fried buns and bubble tea at 12:26. At 12:49, my number was called and I was told they didn't have anymore pan fried buns... like what!? Why have me wait 23 minutes when you don't have something I ordered? The entire restaurant kitchen and front desk is super chaotic. There are 9 cooks, 3 front desk people and no one seems to know what is happening. I asked for a refund and suddenly my food was going to be ready in 2 minutes. I still asked for a refund as I was now closer to a 30 minute wait time at this point and I only had a watery bubble tea because it was made right away but, no one called my number so the ice melted. The guy then said they couldn't actually find my ticket and did I have mine. I asked why everything was so disorganized and his reply with a laugh was," I don't know. that's a good question."

The food at Vanessa's is good but, I likely won't be returning if the waits continue to be up to 30 minutes and the whole restaurant just feels chaotic. This restaurant is in desperate need of a manager who knows how to run a kitchen.
Amazing dumplings and boba would always come here no matter the day! service is amazing!

Welcome to the neighborhood Vanessa's. So great to have an affordable option nearby.

I've tried the boiled veggie and spicy vegan beef dumplings as well as two soups- hot & sour and spinach & mushroom wonton. I've liked everything.
On my two visits, I encountered short ordering lines and a wait of less than 10 minutes after placing the orders.

My only quibble is that vegetarian options are not labelled. The menu board should notate any item that is meat-free (there are quite a few).

I will be a regular.
Delicious and fresh! We enjoyed the pork and chive pan fried dumplings and the chicken and basil. We will be returning.

I'm so happy to have Vanessa's in my neighborhood!  Great dumplings, the only negative is that they were all stuck together, but I just cut off bites and enjoyed them anyway!  

I went early in the afternoon.  The line to order take-out was about 10 minutes.  They just need more people.  They have one person taking orders, taking payments and answering the phone.  So even with only one person ahead of me, it took 10 minutes.  Then another 10-15 minutes to wait for my order.  I can't imagine how crazy the tiny place will be at lunch or dinner!  

I wish them the best of luck, and hope they improve the take-out experience.
The service in this one is really rude and when I ask for a bubble tea they told me it wasn't ready but someone else ask for it they made it right away. I'm not coming back to this location again.
Fresh and unusual. Worth the trip. I particularly like the spicy beef dumplings. They have the option of boiled and pan fried.
Very good food. Nice addition to the upper East side for fast Chinese food that is tasty.
I was so stoked when I found they opened up on the upper East. And it definitely did not disappoint. The spicy veggie dumplings are the food for my soul.
The spicy impossible beef dumplings were good, Dan Dan noodles and vegetable pancakes were okay. Fairly inexpensive. Perhaps meat items might be better.

i've been to the one in chinatown a few times and it never disappoints. similarly, the new UES location also didn't disappoint. they don't have a lot of people working in the kitchen so be prepared to wait a little, but it's worth the wait. have patience and enjoy vanessa's delicious and very affordable dumplings!

My friend and I came here to catch up and wind down after a long day. We ordered a bottle of wine to share and a charcuterie: the pork pate, a cheese, and bread.
It's a really nice spot, with nice interior and good vibes! I think it'd be a really nice date spot. We asked the server what he recommended for white wine, as well as which cheese to pair with the wine. Everything tasted good, and no complaints.

If only I were richer because it was hefty to enjoy nice wine and a charcuterie (a small block of cheese alone was $10) T_T But I did feel like it was worth it here!
Good wine with good food.  A French neighborhood feel upon entering.  The seating arrangement allows for a community feel with the right amount of distance to allow for private conversations.

Wow, this is an amazing find on the Upper West Side. it is totally unassuming on Riverside Blvd, but once you go inside you see it is much larger than initially appearing, and with much more than just wine to offer.

I was overall very happy with the food selection and quality. Excellent cheese options with a great variety of wine selections as well. Really quant spot with good service and relaxing, easy-going feel. Perfect for after work or before/after dinner. You can also have a decent amount of food here for a meal as well.

Overall very happy with the experience and so happy this location is awesome!
If you are vegan and you want to eat tuna tartare, I can recommend you tomato tartare here because I ate tomato tartare instead of tuna tartare.

We've been living on Riverside Blvd for almost 5 years and Vin Sur Vingt has always been our go to. We LOVE it! Tonight we found out that the menu has been changed: all the vegetarian/easy to make vegan options had been removed. No more tartine with avocado or the tartine with tomatoes. Not even a salad! The salad was to die for! The 4 of us had to go to Cipriani. We are seriously hoping and pleading that whomever manages Vin Sur Vingt on Riverside Blvd comes to their senses and goes back to the original menu, which was perfect for every type of diet and palate. Please and thank you :)

Overpriced and low value, do not recommend for the food. They also have a very small and not great wine list for a place that's supposed to be a wine bar. The Nicoise salad and escargot that we got were both pretty tasty but higher price points. Their charcuterie plate was the real disappointment and definitely way overpriced for the amount and quality of meats and cheeses that were provided. As you can see in the photo it is a pretty sad looking charcuterie plate with so little food that they charged $47 for, which is pretty ridiculous. I could make a much better looking charcuterie plate myself for way less money from Trader Joe's or other supermarkets.

I've been coming to this place for almost three years now and have loved it!

However, the most recent visit was really disappointing.

I'm betting this location has been franchised - this particular location is far below the standard for Vin Sur Vingt.

Gripes:
- Wine list has shrunk way down
- Food was inconsistent with other locations - but priced the same
- No small touches
- No expertise offered by the server
- No fun wine specials
- Severely truncated wine list full of sub-par choices - not interesting, not delicious, zero sparkling wines offered, and all overpriced even by industry standards for wine markups.
- ....And for some reason the pours have diminished to about 4.5 oz. Yeah, it was $24 for a 4.5 oz pour - though the table next to us was served observably larger pours; so who knows. Not great.
- Bathroom was filthy and had the most pungent smell.

All kinds of disappointments, large and small, have taken this place from the sparkling five stars it used to be, down past a 3-star shoulder shrug, to land at an honest two stars. I'd love to see it rise.

This was a spot for me to grab an end-of-a-long-day glass of nice wine (a 2016 Chateauneuf-du-Pape), along with a grilled shrimp and endive salad with crumbled blue cheese. It also allowed me to chat with the experienced and engaging staff. Hugo and Carissa gave me the background on this year-old spinoff of the VSV empire.

The place was busy, with only a couple of bar seats available - which is always my fav spot anyway. The food choices offer a tasty array of small plate choices.

This is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood, which, considering the population of the Riverside Blvd buildings, suffers from a lack of good food choices, especially the sit-down variety.

I'll be back.

Got the beef tar tar, escargot, BLT(I know not very french) and chicken salad. It was really good. Escargot and beef tartar was the highlight. Service was amazing and you know it is meant to be when they leave the empty escargot pan on your table because you can still dip your bread into the leftover parsley garlic butter. Heaven. Steak tartar was the best quality with larger chunks of meat and with had flavorful mustard in it. More please!

Will be back.

We had a really great experience here! The staff was very friendly, the food was very good and reasonably priced, and there was a nice wine selection too. We'll definitely be back for another after work casual dinner night!

Victor was our servicer. He knew the wine and food very well. We tried the Malbec and loved it also tried a drier red wine he recommended and it was also great. I had the Hanger steak sandwich and the Meat was thick and delicious. A lot of salad to follow. Friends had the charcuterie with cheese and wine. Highly recommend.

I applaud these folks for getting a Headstart on fixing global warming by disdaining to use air conditioning indoors, even in the middle of New York's first brutal heat wave of the summer. So, if you're a fan of sitting outdoors in super hot weather, this may be the joint for you. For what it's worth, management could not have been more unpleasant.

Nice little hidden gem on the UWS.

We had a nice bottle of Rose and a delicious shrimp appetizer.

This neighborhood vineyard is so friendly.  The owner treated my friend and I complimentary drinks before the holidays, and once my friend got confused over the location and I had to leave before I can finish my wine - I already took a sip!  They just wouldn't charge anything.  It's the great wine and mostly, the people that set this place outstanding!

Hidden away on Riverside Blvd. on the ground floor of a residential building sits an amazing gem of a wine bar that's worth the trek. It's small, cozy and overlooks the Hudson, making it a perfect place to enjoy a glass of wine from their robust list of French varietals.

The staff is so kind and knowledgeable about the wines and will help you find the perfect fit for your palate. There's also a nice array of foods, including awesome charcuterie platters, which I've indulged in many times.

They even have great happy hour deals until 7pm, even on weekends.

Finally! An establishment above casual Chinese and coffee shop chains in the neighbourhood for nights where I want to eat out and have a drink within a 2 block radius from my place.

Visited on a Tuesday night and it wasn't very busy. I hope this place picks up because the neighbourhood is in dire need of such establishments. The space is not very large which makes for an intimate setting.

We had some sparkling by the glass. The wine list was nice and I'll sure come back soon to try more wine varieties. What stands out for me is the menu, which was longer than expected. All choices were very French such as charcuterie and cheese selections, croque monsieur, and other French classics. Prices were very affordable by New York standards and we very much enjoyed our meal and time there. Will definitely visit again.

I went for happy hour for the advertised "50% off a bottle of rose" just to be told by the waiter that they're not offering that at the moment. Even though I was disappointed I decided to stay because I was hungry and didn't want to look for another place. Had a small glass of $18 wine and ok food. Stale bread.

A sidewalk (at the moment) French wine bar overlooking the Hudson. Standard but well-executed menu items such as  quiche, steak tartare, mussels and charcuterie. Nothing earth-shattering  but well-made, with friendly service. A nice selection of wines.  This is one of several branches of cafes of the same name.  A nice neighborhood addition.

I am almost afraid to write this review because it might draw people to this simply great hidden French gem.  
The service is nothing short of wonderful, they helped us select great wine and food choices while saving a few bucks.  The special are (which include wine by the glass and bottle)  a welcome relief to the otherwise overpriced UWS.  The food is purely French and served with a smile.
The restaurant is small and mirrors the neighborhood French cafe.

A great find has been had..

Best wine bar in NYC.
Their wine is perfect, the team is amazing, the manager is always making sure you are having the perfect evening and I always had very good food!!!
You really need to go for a nice drinking with the sunset!
Great wine bar on riverside boulevard.  Really solid wine selection, great food, friendly service and a beautiful spot.  The outdoor seating is perfect for sunset.  Huge fan.

Great spot just next building 2 mins walk :) me and my friend we had a bottle of red wine with great cheese plater which by them recommended:)  was very busy on the Thursday night:
Btw love the music too ;)

Be careful here! Save your receipt or pay cash! They added a tip (15%!) to my credit card even though we left a substantial tip (over 20%) in cash.
The waitresses were lovely, the food was really good - a bit expensive, though. We had the meat and cheese board - $45! My companions had the French onion soup and loved it! I had the grain bowl. I expected it to warm, but it was cold. Good flavor, though.
Won't return and won't recommend it!

Shhhh... Vin Sur Vingt is a true neighborhood gem for the residents along Riverside Blvd. The restaurant is conveniently located to help you entertain lady guests in a sophisticated yet comfortable setting. The service is exceptional. Wine selection expansive. Dinner and brunch were delicious. I recommend the beef tartar and mixed charcuterie. Looking forward to the Mac and cheese dish.

A true gem and my neighborhood brunch hideaway. Love this place! Great French food, excellent mac and cheese, smooth Motown grooves, and quite flavorful coffee. Anytime friends come in from out of town, I take them here -- it's guaranteed to be a classy, but delightfully at-ease, dining experience.

Can't even begin to describe how happy we are with this place !  Food is delicious - they do brunch and a dinner menu.  The shrimp sandwich is the best and the side salad makes it healthier.  Can't go wrong with the mac & cheese either.  Wine options are plentiful and do not disappoint.  A wonderful atmosphere with friendly, authentic service.  All on Riverside Boulevard, quite convenient

Very glad you are here but PLEASE TAKE COVID precautions seriously. Tonight there were groups of people gathering around large high top tables without masks and (gasp) shaking hands. I realize you are in a tough position as you need customers in light of the economic fall out but please respect the community and prevent COVID spread.

Vin Sur Vingt never disappoints. Great outdoor seating really feel no threat to Covid at all. I told Mus (waiter) what I wanted in a wine and he delivered perfectly. Food menu is also fantastic. Almost didn't write the review so it can stay a hidden gem of the UWS.

Good luck getting a table.  I called Friday night around 7ish and said all tables were taken and there were 6 people ahead of me on the waiting list.  Went today, Sunday afternoon at 4 and thankfully snagged a table before they were all taken.   And after tasting the salmon tartine I understood why.  Had a nice red wine but don't remember which one.  I am looking forward to trying more menu items before the winter weather sets in.

What a gem!
Went for a happy hour after visiting abc studios. $32 for a bottle of Rose was a marvelous surprise. Not that crowded as your average after work spot.
Was actualy able to talk there without damaging vocal cords .lol. Melted Brie with Honey was to die for.

Recently, my husband and I went to Vin Sur Vingt. A receptionist showed us to our table, across from a table covered with the shredded napkins and bits of mushed food left by a family with a toddler and we waited and waited. Finally, the waitress (the same person as the receptionist) appeared to take our wine order and to apologize for the wait, explaining she was the only one working that night. We then waited and waited until the wine appeared, with a further explanation that, not only was she alone, but it was her first night on the job. A family came into the restaurant with a very small child and was offered the uncleared table. The child rebelled, stated firmly (and quite rightly) that he did not want to sit somewhere "so messy." Service halted while the waitress--apparently also acting as the busboy--cleaned up. Eventually, our food order was taken and we waited some more. A woman near us wondered what it would take to order some wine. Time passed and the waitress came back and said that the "machine" was broken and she had been unable to place our order, what was it again? More time passed and the waitress brought out our dinner, but mine was not what I ordered. The waitress apologized and asked if I might want it anyway. No. [Note to waitress, when the "machine" is broken an alternative technology that might help is the "pen and paper."] I thought another glass of wine might help, but realizing that ordering wine might take a rather long time, my husband went to fetch some from the (wine) bar area, where the waitress was--surprise--also the bar tender. Eventually, the food came: perhaps the teensiest portion of salmon I have ever seen.

I have been a few times to Vin Sur Vingt before. The food is indifferent and the prices are too, given the size of the portions. (And, I say this as a really small person who does not eat much.) The service has always been lousy. This is not because the staff is poor, but because the manager is not hiring enough staff to cope. What sort of manager sends a young person, on her first night on the job, out to act as receptionist, busboy, bartender, and waitress all on her own?

On the plus side, the rose is nice and poured generously and--I assume this is what is responsible for many of the positive reviews--it is bliss to have a restaurant, any restaurant, in this culinary desert on the upper far west side. But, my advice is, if you are not within a few-block radius, go elsewhere.
Amazing place. My boyfriend and I have been a handful of times now and absolutely everything is delicious! The rose is fabulous and is always 50% off. Highly recommend to anyone!

Went here for brunch late on a Sunday and only three tables were occupied so much to our dismay it took one hour to receive our food. Our waitress made no apologies, but the other waitress came by and offered us a free drink and said there was a problem with the computer, but we saw others receive their food before us despite arriving after. When our food arrived one dish at a time the goat cheese tartine was very tiny although tasty and the pancakes were excellent. We really wanted to like this spot since it's in our neighborhood, but they need to do a better job at service.
Found this place while walking through the neighborhood. What a great addition! Great selection of French wines, knowledgeable staff, and excellent service. We will definitely be back!

Love this place for a drink before I head home. Such a great addition to the neighborhood. I cant wait to take friends and family when they come to visit. They do have some food options but it is not extensive. Great if you need some light bites! Definitely taking advantage of their happy hour!

Great wine bar to catch the sunset on the west side. It's quaint, not too loud, and a great place to take a date and have a great conversation. Carissa is great and very knowledgable. She'll take care of you.

Appreciate this location. Went in with my family, and they were very lovely. They played my son's honey blueberry crepe, and made a yummy berry smoothie. Due to health needs, I inquired about gluten free option and got the omelette one with the buckwheat (win for the gluten free option!). Great service and staffing for that one.
Decent iced latte; wished it was stronger but appreciated the oatmilk option. My husband and sister enjoyed their selected crepes.
There was inside and outside seating options which were a win during today's lovely day.
Recommended.

Nice quiet little crepe place. Outside seating is available and comfortable. Not much inside seating,, rather small in that area. Staff is helpful and friendly. I had the Turkey Royal crepe (without tomato sauce) which included Gruyère cheese
and it was very good. A little lite on the turkey, but tasty. The hubby had the New York Crepe, which was loaded with ham, egg, and Gruyère cheese. It was also very good. I added a Dulce de leche iced coffee to round out my meal. It was, okay. Our food, as well as a nice seat outside for people watching, made for a delightful start to the day.

Great little crepe joint. I got the Amelie crepe which comes with spinach, goat cheese, mushrooms, and basil. It was very tasty! The goat cheese really added most of the flavor. Would love to come back and try a sweet crepe. $12 for one crepe. It wasn't huge so it didn't completely fill me up, but it was still a decent amount of food.

It's cool that you can watch the workers make the crepes in front of you. Very tight in the restaurant with not great seating options for groups bigger than 2. But there is outdoor seating with larger tables.

Yum! Delicious crepes, and plentiful indoor and outdoor seating in a great location for people watching. Got the Amelie (goat cheese, mushroom and spinach) and a Nutella / banana. Very clean bathroom for customers downstairs. Will be back!
Stopped in to grab a crepe before a show at AMC nearby.  Had the ham and guyere one which was tasty.  I'd go back to try some of their sweet ones as those all looked delicious.

Probably the worst crepe I have ever eaten. Do not get the savory crepes, might be easier with the sweet ones. So I get that the buckwheat batter is made for both savory and sweet crepes, however there is no salt added either to the batter or inside. I got the caprese crepe that I couldn't eat beyond two bites, there was no salt at all.

While it's slightly pricey, the food and service is great! Visited at 10:30 am on a Saturday and the place only had one person working. She was making 3 crepes at a time and was doing it masterfully!

We had the Goldi-lox crepe with lox (ha, see what they did there) cream cheese, lemon zest  and capers...wow! The flavors blended perfectly and wasn't too fishy.  

Also had the dulce de Leche with bananas and walnuts, which wasn't too sweet and had a lot of walnuts. So it's good for your health!

Lastly, the seating was outdoor only but had 5 tables Under an awning. Gets the job done in warmer weather. Overall a great experience and kudos to the only employee holding it down. Will come here for all my crepes needs!

Love their crêpes!!! So yummy! I always go here when I'm in the mood for crêpes and I always leave satisfied. my go to is Dulce de Leche with strawberries. There coffee isn't bad either. I've tried two locations and they were both good.

Food: Wanted a change of pace from basic breakfast meals and a savory breakfast crepe definitely sounded enticing! Came here with a friend to try the place out together- we both ordered a savory crepe and enjoyed our time devouring them!

Cost: These cost of these crepes are a bit on the expensive side- and it can get up there if you want to customize/add some extra stuff!

Environment: The inside of the place was small but they did have a cute outdoor seating option that we took advantage of! Not a lot of tables available so first come first serve!

Service: Superb service! The guy who took our order was extremely nice and he definitely made the overall experience ordering and eating here that much more enjoyable.

Uniqueness: Breakfast options can get boring and so when you're craving for something a little different, a savory breakfast crepe is the way to go!

P.S.- if you're lucky, there may be cute puppies that come along your way so you can enjoy your crepe and see some adorable furry pups!

Zenny the manager is absolutely sweet. I enjoyed a Nutella strawberry and banana crêpe I had thought this place was closed because of Covid, but she had mentioned to me that they're open from 9 AM to 8 PM every day of the week. Plus the top it off they serve coffee latte, milk, shakes, and smoothies. This place is an absolute go to and I hope that this team continues the great work. Thank you. Zenny

Not many restaurant serves Crepe in the upper west, so I gave it a try this morning.
The store is small but it has outdoor seating, however, I found many flies around the counter and on the menu board. (Like 4-5 flies)
Food is okay, but it seems the guys who serves me is kind of new.
Really enjoyed my Nutella and white chocolate crepe. It was $12ish but a fun and delicious treat.
Way overpriced, not worth it. Taste was fine and location is awesome but I wouldn't go again

The service was fast which was nice for a quick breakfast. The goldi-lox crepe was yummy, and enjoyable for a quick bite. I prefer crepes to be pretty thin, this one seemed kind of think, which could be preferable for others. The coffee is decent but nothing great. Honestly, the best thing was the fruit smoothie. The smoothie was flavorful and refreshing. Not a bad place to go for a quick breakfast or lunch.

Came here to meet a guy I met online.  I had a hot chocolate that was pretty good.  No crepe but it did make me think of having them when I was in Paris this past summer.  We got to sit and chat for a bit and the staff didn't make us feel like we had to get out of there.  Nice random find in the neighborhood so no complaints here.
Got 3 crepes. Ham and cheese was amazing. The chicken pesto was good but wished the chicken was thinner. The butter and sugar was perfect. Cute packaging and cute place. Definitely would go back.

Woke up wanting something a little different for breakfast because I was tired of the same old eggs or pancakes so I thought why not go for crepes- and boy I'm glad I did!
The Nutella banana almond crepe was warm, tasty and packaged well. I have never had almonds in my crepe but the texture change was nice surprisingly. I had a can of whipped cream at home so I added that and it def was a nice, light addition!
As a drink, I got the Nutella Mocha coffee and it was delicious! It was honestly like a creamy hot
Chocolate and I was here for it!
A little overpriced but pretty good! Cute packaging but makes it a little difficult to eat. Got the chicken pesto, ham and cheese, and sugar and butter. Yum!
Great Crepes! Try the breakfast one with goat cheese. It's amazing.  Also the Nutella crepe.

This small crepe place is famous and well known to many in the manhattan area. My first time was a few months ago and I loved it, but recently I tried it again and still loved it. The ratio of fillings to crepe was almost perfect. It was flavorful and easy to eat. It was also hot and made as you order. The only downside is the price. Almost $11 for something that won't suffice as a meal. The price is not so exceptionally high that it impacts my rating to much so I still give it a five stars.
The Crepe's are excellent, but like many other reviewers have said, the prices are a little high for the amount of food - even for New York!

Three years ago my wife and I met for the first time and went ice skating in central park for our first date. On our walk around the upper west side after we came across Vive La Crepe and fell in love. Three years later we are married and still celebrating with crepes we love them. Please come with family and friends.

Decent neighborhood spot for a quick crepe. Prices seem steep as similar crepes elsewhere are significantly cheaper. But rent on Broadway doesn't pay itself so I understand.

We got a Nutella and banana as well as their NY cheesecake crepe and both were very good with just enough chew on the crepe itself.

The crepes are good; HOWEVER, they are extraordinarily slow...wait for a single crepe is 20-30 minutes minimum (likely longer). If you really love crepes, would suggest ordering ahead for pickup, but I strongly suggest not visiting to order in person.

They're also very disorganized. People were arguing about who ordered when and crepes are apparently given out by type and not by person's name...so if you order a cheese crepe, for example, and someone comes in 20 min after you and orders the same and claims the first cheese crepe called out, you're out of luck.

This establishment had a very diverse menu, and all of the food we got was delicious.  However, it was tiny with very little room to sit and the tables upstairs are all high-tops.  You may find a spot to sit and eat, but are probably better off picking up the food and taking it elsewhere.  There are a few tables downstairs, but you need to go down a steep circular staircase to get there.  Also, the bathrooms are down those stairs.  Which is another reason that I would recommend this restaurant for take-out rather than eat-in.  The employees were very nice and acommodating to special orders.  There seemed to be a lot of customers who are regulars, and the employees greeted them as such.

Staff did not put a table together. We had a baby with us. Gave ice cream before serving the crepe. I asked them to give it as a whole dish. The server then put the ice cream inside the crepe spoiling it completely. It was like a milkshake. When asked for cutlery they just gave me a paper plate. I had to ask for a fork and knife. Terrible experience.Dulce De Leche Crepeà

A cozy, solid option if you're around Lincoln Center. I'm not a full-on crepe lover, but this place was quite alright for my liking. Should I end up having a crepe craving, I'll come on down.

(!) WHAT I GOT: The #9, Chicken, gruyere, pesto, tomato, and spinach ($9.50)

(!) HOW IT DID: I wasn't really expecting much but I found it good. The crepe fell apart for me, so I had to really strategize each bite. All in all, each bite was alright, and the ingredients tasted pretty fresh--save for the chicken, which was a tad bit dry.

(!) SEATING: Two seater tall stools with tall tables abound (say that fast!), with tables and bathrooms downstairs via a snazzy spiral staircase.

(!) TIDBITS: Would definitely give this place another go if I'm hungering around Lincoln Center... a fine alternative to the other, seemingly pricey spots in the area. My cousin also got the #2, ham and gruyere ($9), which seemed to hold up better. I'd get that one and honestly, recommend that over the #9!
Quick service, delicious crepes with many different options for filling. Love the Nutella mocha latte  So good! Would definitely return
Pretty overpriced for a single crepe. The presentation was also very difficult to eat from. The crepes weren't bad but were way too overpriced
This is such a lovely place to have a delicious Crêpe, some coffee and a chat with your friend. The staff is incredibly welcoming and the place is clean, neat and charming!!

I ordered two crepes  and paid $ 20
Crepes were unacceptable one had raw potatoes and others were completely empty with a cheese and a ham.
it is too expensive and tasty nothing.
I never go again.

When we arrived, there was only one person working everything - taking orders, making crepes and espresso drinks, cleaning the restaurant. That setup isn't exactly 5-star worthy, and caused us to wait a lot longer for our food and drinks.

However, the one person working - Kashawn - was SO quick and efficient and SO pleasant the whole time, it more than made up for it. I kept thinking, I don't know how this guy is keeping up with all this and keeping a smile on his face!

As a side note, just as we were about to leave, another cook showed up and was NOT pleasant - very grumpy. If she had been the one helping us, this review would be quite different.

I wandered into Vive La Crepe on a drizzly, Sunday afternoon that reminded me of Paris. The restaurant itself pays homage to the French cooking tradition in a respectable way, but the menu and environment are underscored with predictably cliche, chain restaurant roots.

For what it is, as a place to pop in for a quick bite or coffee it serves its purpose well. The tables are small, discouraging patrons from lingering, but if you do want to sit and chat there's a cool spiral staircase in the back that leads to a couple extra tables and a unisex restroom in the basement.

I ordered the #9 (chicken, gruyère, pesto, tomato & spinach) which the server mentioned was one of the most popular items aside from the classic ham & gruyère. It came out promptly and was very tasty!

I'm not a crepe person at all and I have had a lot of bad crepes, which is why I'm not a fan. I've had a lot of soggy ones in particular. But no so here. As far as crepes go, this is the best I've had. A shell on the crunchy side, it was just the right balance between crunchy and soggy.

We shared both a savory and sweet - the turkey and gruyere was so good that I tried to replicate it at home as a sandwich - tomato sauce, mushrooms and oozing cheese. So good! For the sweet, we had the chocolate and added some bananas - very rich and delicious.

Limited seating, good for a quick bite, or pick up and go.

Yum! Fast service, fresh ingredients, reasonable prices. Healthy filling food, plenty of vegetarian options. Excellent espresso coffee. Seating outside, inside and downstairs. Restroom downstairs is not easily accessible.
Crepes made well enough but far too stingy with fillings.  Couldn't see anything more than a few dots of powdered sugar when I opened up the crepe and couldn't taste any sugar at all.

Tried two different crepes, the salmon with spinach, and potato with parccutto little taste, rubbery crepe

All ingredients had zero flavor, except the usual salmon and parccutto.  The spinach was just fresh leaves,
Potatoes not seasoned at all.

Very cute atmosphere - the waitstaff are even in character. Quick service for when you're in a hurry. Fun to watch them make the crepe in front of you. I ordered the spinach, mushroom, goat cheese crepe - too undercooked for my taste. Maybe a sweet crepe would have been a better choice? Still would
go back. Worth a visit.

Four stars because 1) the checkout area is cramped and 2) they were a little short staffed, so there was a bit of a wait.  I ordered to go so I can't really speak for the sitting area, but it was neat to see them prepare the crepes in front of the customers.  

This was my first crepe experience and it was TASTY.  I ordered the egg, goat cheese, and spinach omelette crepe but I also added bacon to it.  Did NOT disappoint!

I look forward to trying a more indulgent - maybe peanut butter? - crepe in the future!
Cute place with delicious crepes! We got the "Savory #2" Ham & Gruyere and it did not disappoint! Fun to watch them made right in front of you!

My main complaint is their consistency. I got a crepe here the last time I came to this part of town and it was delicious.

But this week I stopped by twice. Monday, my crepe batter was rock hard and too crunchy, and today, they didn't put sugar in the sugar/butter crepe but put powdered sugar on top instead. So it was essentially like eating a pancake (though the batter was good this time).

I just want a crepe like the first time I was here! Is that too much to ask?

The crepes here are pretty good. Honestly they are a little pricier than what they are worth. I have had better crepes in NYC. The staff were nice and trying their best to keep up with the orders. I have only went here once and it was packed. So I had to wait much longer than I have had to wait in other places for crepes.
Overall it's just fair.

I always stop by this place when I'm on the upper west side.
Great Crepes made to order...love my mozzarella and tomato w/basil extra crisp!

My Phat Phoodie Breakfast continued with Breakfast #3.... at Vive Le Crepe. We ordered the #7 with raclette cheese, proscuitto and potatoes. And since I was planning on eating Breakfast #4 and #5 before moving on to lunch #1 (all in one day....) we split the crepe amongst three of us. Passing it around in circles each taking a bite a la smoking a joint style.

Service was fast and prompt. Minus one star for minimal seating and no one actually coming around to wipe the tables after we're done.
Solid dessert and savory crepes. Love their mozzarella crepes and Nutella crepes. Always quick and delicious. Nice points reward system too

I had my usual (no. 4: spinach, mushroom, goat cheese, basil)  along with coffee.

Terrific coffee and when they put in cream, it's frothy without being a cappuccino or latte.
I have only gone to Soho location but wanted to walk a lot my last day here for 2 months (sniff, sniff).  

I am feeling nostalgic, having spent so much time on the UWS during years dancing.

It's so charming on Columbus from 65th to 75th.

Sigh... It's so hard to leave New York!

Although, I always seem to get lost getting to Columbus because Columbus, Broadway and Amsterdam get tricky in this area, I had a geographically savy friend direct me to Vive la Crepe  yesterday. I wanted to go back because I had tried it once last year and remembered the crepes being incredible. The ambiance is very welcoming and makes you feel like you are in a well decorated crepe shop somewhere in Europe. However, it is very tiny and also feels like a hallway. Last night i tried a crepe with strawberries, bananas and nutella. I don't think they put in enough nutella though. The banana nutella crepe includes more nutella which is disappointing. I will definitely be back to try the nutella hot chocolate and savory crepes! Overall, a great, cozy spot on the Upper West Side.

Probably 3.5 stars but I'll round up to 4. We got the sugar and butter crepe ($6.50) and it was really quite good! I don't know that I'd go out of my way to come here but if you're in the area, it's a good place to stop for a quick bite. They serve Kusmi tea, which I love. The side of ice cream was also good, though a bit overpriced ($4 for a very small cup).

I went here with my little cousin after a long walk in Central Park. There are a number of crepes to choose from, everything from savory to sweet crepes and they make it right in front of you so it's a pretty cool experience overall. While the place upstairs is small and compact, there is a downstairs seating area which is pretty cozy.

Overall a good experience and very yummy! Had the #2 Ham and Gruyere.

PROS: Yummy crepe, nice area, cozy seating area for a quick bite
CONS: $10 for a crepe was kind of expensive

My friend and I wandered into this place on NYE as we were looking for something warm and fuzzy before the Midnight Run in Central Park. As most other places weren't open in the evening of NYE, but this place was, we came in and I was pleasantly surprised.  

The girl behind the counter seemed very bored and didn't get our whole order. Maybe her mind was elsewhere being it was NYE and all, but still.  Had to go back up and get the coffee that I ordered.

They have a nice variety of crepes, from the most basic, to more common Nutella crepe, to just about any kind of gourmet goodness you could get inside a crepe. We split the standard crepe which was pretty delicious. Just the right amount of sugar and butter. And it came nicely wrapped up in case you needed it to go.

The place is small, with a few tables upstairs and a few tables downstairs, and a bathroom downstairs. The place was clean and the décor was adorable. Definitely a good place to give a try if you need something on the go, or looking for some dessert.

Old School Diner with an old school UWS diner semi-charm.    I was surprised how expensive diner food had gotten in NYC but NYC is so expensive to operate in so prices go up.     Prices were equivalent to regular rest. prices and certainly not cheaper diner food.  

The staff were super friendly - the waitress used all the old school waitress terms for us, sweetie, love etc.   She was very nice as was the rest of the staff.
Food was Ok - Burger decent, Chicken Dinner was quite large but overall bland.     Definitely a decent diner if your in the area to stop at.   Their deserts looked really good.

This is the quintessential New York diner style restaurant.  Good grief, I forgot to look if they had an egg cream on the menu! Yes, it is that type of place.

Came with a friend, and it was a very good experience. They have a variety of seating, booths, tables, and outdoor seating, too.  We opted for an indoor table.

The menu is what you'd expect with many deli type options. I absolutely had to have a corned beef on rye bread sandwich.  It came with a kosher pickle, a small container of deli style coleslaw, and a small bowl of potato salad ($21.).  That, and a glass of ice tea in a traditional fountain glass w/straw, and I was quite satisfied.

The sandwich was delicious with a heaping serving of very good corned beef with all the fixings to fill it out.  I found the coleslaw and potato salad is what is to be expected, nothing special yet good.

Service was competent and provided everything in a timely manner.

If you want an authentic New York diner experience, this is the place.

I've been to Viand about 10 times.  Today I had a Greek salad. Tomatoes, cucumbers, onion and feta. No Protein. My friend had the same thing.  With chicken, our bill was $60.  It's our bad for not looking at the prices, which clearly have gone up, but I still cannot believe we paid %60 for two salads.
Good ambiance, service is pretty good, but food is decidedly mediocre.  Even bagel was tasteless.

Was craving spinach pie and Greek salad, historically standard at NYC diners, so got takeout. Food was overpriced and mediocre. Plus Viand is now levying a surcharge on credit cards. So two orders of second-rate IMO spinach pie with salad came to $45.08. Just not worth it.

I visited this place for brunch today, Sunday. My friend and I were seated promptly, but I incorrectly chose a table for two that was not very well stabilized. A couple across from my table started to leave the place, and we decided to take the their table (after asking one of the servers for her okay). Unfortunately, one of the male servers was kind of perturbed by our move, although I explained that the other table was unstable. My point is: the server should have been more sympathetic for my situation. Other than this, the place is nice and the food was delicious, and the ambiance was excellent. A funny note to this story is that the two people that occupied the unstable chair, very quickly moved to another table.
Nonetheless, I recommend this place!

We stopped by this casual restaurant for breakfast. We enjoyed the Belgian waffles, eggs Benedict, and omelets. The coffee was good and hot. Prices are reasonable for NYC. $103 for 4 including tip.
Seating is tight but comfy. The restrooms are just okay and could use some remodeling.
Overall, it was a nice experience.

Do not come here. The food is way over priced for diner food. You can expect to pay over 20 dollars for every item in the menu. At such high prices one would expect the food to be better but it's boring, bland, over cooked and dare I say odd? I ordered the cream of turkey soup. The turkey in the soup resembled Campbells chicken noodle soup chicken. I also ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. It was by far the worst spaghetti and meatballs I've ever had in my life. The meatballs had an odd taste of cumin and coriander in it. It was overpowering. I've never had Italian meatballs taste like that. I could only eat one because it made me sick. The spaghetti was over cooked and bland. The tomato sauce was tasteless. I will never come here again. I only give it two stars to the service
Excellent deli ambience. The service was super fast and efficient, kudos for that. I had the Reuben sandwich and the pastrami was excellent!

Really great place to stop and relax before a show at the Beacon. I had an excellent turkey club and we relaxed in our booth until we were ready to walk over to the theater.

It's not cheap for a diner or cafe, but given the location, it's understandable.

Service was incredibly friendly and accurate.

Remember to tip well.
I had pancakes and chocolate mousse cake. The pancakes were good, but the chocolate cake was really intense - that one is probably better off shared. The meal was a lot pricier than I was expecting.

Viand Diner aka Viand Cafe at this location is in the Beacon Hotel close to the Beacon Theater. I lived nearby for many years and I still visit this neighborhood as much as I am able.
I find all the Viand locations are below my expectations. It's overpriced. The service is old school which is costly. It's okay when I'm are nearby for a show or movie. I'm not going out of my way to eat here. I know it's popular with some people, I have to be honest. This is not the Viand I remember from years ago when it was on East 86th Street! When that location closed I tried the others and it just isn't the same.......

Food was great and served extremely fast. They didn't skimp on bacon, which I always appreciate. The only downside was that there was no A/C and it was sweltering the entire time. The staff was very courteous and apologetic for the A/C issue.

I was going to an event at the Beacon Theater and was disappointed to see that the Beacon Bar had permanently closed. I was hungry so I stopped in at the Viand Cafe to eat. I ordered meatloaf with mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables. The servers were great, but the food was awful. Not going back.

I'm only giving it 2 stars because our waitress was very friendly. If your looking for ambiance, a good flavorful basic breakfast in a clean diner .... We'll keep walking.
Buss boy didn't bother moving any of the table condiments when he cleaned and reset the tables. Omelet scorched, potatoes barely brown, toast butter less and the whole thing was lacking something..... oh I know FLAVOR!
Seriously, if you don't want to do breakfast right sleep late and open for lunch and dinner only.
Ughhh crappy way to start the day.
I usually this sometime because they're good service faster and Chef has a good cooking around 15 mins depending on early but not always. I love this restaurant Viand Cafe.
Food was good but service can be better and space was can be cramped. Tiramisu was not bad. Crab cakes were decent.

Haven't been since Covid but had the absolutely worst spanakopita I have ever had. Tasteless, greasy. And the salad was all onions. Seriously gone downhill.
G

I ordered breakfast and the food was mediocre. I got the salmon benedict. The salmon was somewhat warm and the hollandaise sauce wasn't exactly how hollandaise sauce should be. The bacon was decent, it wasn't crispy. Maybe the food is better here if you sit down.

If you need a quick bite, this is the place! Fast service. Not gourmet. High prices. Noisy. Crowded. Decide what you want to eat before you arrive and order completely. No one will ask if you want seconds, dessert, a refill, or the check. The check is delivered before you finish chewing and swallowing. As I said, this is a speedy environment. Our table was cleaned and reset before we even got up to leave. Food ok

We had lunch here yesterday and breakfast today. The food was great both times. The people are super friendly and attentive considering how packed it was. Highly recommend if you're in the neighborhood!
Service was unreliable and absent, they were all very pleasant though. Food was a good six out of 10. Definitely just a stop along the way but it's cute and well-maintained.

I would classify this place as more of a diner than a cafe. The thing is it is always packed!  I'm not sure what the draw is with the place. The food is bland and like I mentioned it reminds me of your typical diner. Listen, I love diners but this "cafe" doesn't hit a home run.  The egg white omelet was bland and although it was a big portion that didn't help. The prices are reasonable so that is a positive. Another positive is that the food comes out quick.  

Perfect place to grab a quick bite before getting back to work or in a rush. Don't expect to be blown away though.
The food tastes like crap and the servers are rude. There is literally nothing redeeming about this garbage diner.

Bad.. not recommended...
Bad plating
Weird burger (wrong food combination)
Weird potato (tasteless

Don't get the Caesar Salad! They have a grocery store right across the street and they can't even get Caesar salad dressing they gave me watered down ranch dressing like wtf. They could at least actually buy Caesar salad dressing or come with your own dressing.

The food is ok, so I know that tipping is optional and when it comes to tipping I'm not stingy. I know that many servers depend on tips but the lady who took our order just bad. I was going to give around a $10 tip because it was just me and my friend. As we were paying the server kept hovering above us like "whyy? No.. please tip more". Excuse me? I've never met anyone telling the customer how much to tip, especially over just two order of omelettes. How absurd! The place itself is okay but that lady needs to check herself!
Perfect restaurant with a large menu of items to eat and next to the Beacon Hotel. I highly recommend this restaurant to eat . Thank you Viand

Really good diner food.
Homemade chicken was bomb.
Service was really good.
Pickles were eh
Our go to neighborhood cafe for breakfast! Gluten free options are amazing and everything is always cooked to perfection!

Nice atmosphere, good food however, left my credit card inside the holder on the table, after removing the copy of my receipt. The following day a charge of $12,999 was made on the card. Spoke to the manager who was pleasant but insisted it could not have been one of the staff. Simply posting this as an "fyi", remember to take your card.
why dont you update your specials on a daily basis on uber eats / seamless so that we know what you have available!!??  easy right ?

Gigantic menu with just about anything you'd want. I had Greek panini - big portion, couldn't finish! Was going to get a Turkey Reuben, but they only had fresh roasted Turkey... which is great for the restaurant but not for my craving. But no prob.

Staff was super nice. Waitress very sweet. Everyone attentive. It wasn't busy, 5:30 on Friday.

For 4 ppl - 2 sandwiches, a kids burger and a yogurt dish, and 1 (warm) glass of rosé, $70. Eh.

I recently discovered this restaurant and once I went there, I knew that I had found my favorite diner. The food is so fresh and delicious - it really is like homemade. Everyone is so friendly and helpful there - I couldn't be more pleased. Try the Cobb Salad - you'll never go anywhere else for one.
I only wish it were opened until midnight.

It was better than I expected for a coffee shop.
It has a more upscale feel now. (Just the bathroom
still felt old). We sat outside which is lovely to do in nice  weather. I just wish the coffee cups were bigger! I felt like i kept having to ask the waiter to give me more coffee all the time! My omelette was perfect-well done. We actually were very nice to the manager who asked my friend and I to move our table back a bit to allow these 4 men to sit at a table next to us- since  everyone was so pleasant, it was easy to say yes!
A lot of attitude, poor service and mediocre food. There are better choices in the neighborhood.
Found this café/diner 2 blocks from where my son and I stayed in Upper West Side. Had breakfast 2 mornings in a row. Great service, great food!

We stayed at the Beacon Hotel and had breakfast here since it was right next door.  We walked in on an older gentlemen (manager?) scolding the hostess at the restaurant.  We were seated at a table, then approached by a very curt waiter who took our order and delivered it after some time.  The simple order of eggs over medium, potatoes, and toast was cold.  All of it, even the toast.  The eggs were not over medium, they were runny and under-cooked.  We did not see the waiter for a very long time so could not ask for a correction.  When we finally did see him, we asked for our check and although we were paying cash, we were charged a fee for a credit card.

Stopped in for a quick breakfast and this checked all the boxes for a diner. As a Jersey girl, I know a diner and although the name has "café" it was way more casual/divey.
I ordered the avo toast w a side of bacon and coffee. Coffee was just ok, I did not request a second cup. My meal was just ok also. The two eggs were cooked sunny side up and avo mash was a bit bland. I'd come back if I was in a pinch and needed some sustenance after a late night.
Our waitress was decent and made the experience pleasant.

I feel sorry for the staff who work here. The prices on the menu on their website are not accurate. BY A LOT. I looked at the menu and went here only to find out the pancakes (and everything else) are 30% more expensive now. Naturally, I asked why the discrepancy.
