Him: "Those prices are 20 years old."
Me: "Ok, but I came here today because of them."

Him: "That's Grub Hub, so I'm not responsible. We don't have a website."

Me: *points out that it's a menu ON THE RESTAURANT'S WEBSITE*

Him: "We have a website?"
Him: "I don't handle those things."
Me: *he walks away while I'm mid-sentence*

After I ate, I approached him and applauded the professionalism and courtesy of his staff, and that they should be managing things. The jerk had nothing but excuses and more excuses. Two employees quietly told me he thinks he knows everything and refuses to listen to feedback.

As a business owner, I can't imagine treating customers (and apparently staff) so poorly.

Great food and fast service. There is an outside and inside and the food was good! I got pancakes and they were filling but delicious. A bit pricy but was definitely worth it. Great place to stop by if you are in the area.

I have been frequenting this establishment, especially in the evening for dinner.

I stopped in for breakfast on 11/27/21 at approximately 11am. Within 5 minutes of sitting I heard a commotion. It appeared to be a customer getting loud with a waitress. Disruptively loud. Further investigation, and I noticed it was the OWNER of the restaurant berating his own staff at the entrance of his Cafe.

I took it upon myself to address the issue with the owner himself. When asked if he was the owner or manager, he initially refused to respond. I made it clear that he used poor judgment speaking to his worker like that right on the main floor of a packed restaurant. He tried to say he was having scheduling issues to which I replied, "Not my problem. You take business outside or in the back. Not in front of paying customers. Your behavior has made me want to no longer support your establishment."

He proceeded to get loud with me, to which I replied, "I'm sorry, are you getting loud with me now? That's completely unacceptable."

After I left the restaurant a man ran up to me to applaud my confrontation with the owner stating I hit the nail on the head and that he too has seen this man yell at his staff in the past.

There are so many wonderful places to eat on the Upper West. Please do not support a business that treats their employees like garbage.

NICE LUNCH ! We had just checked into our apartment for an 8 day stay at the Hotel Beacon at 2.15pm on Saturday, Sept 25th and we were starving ( breakfast was a distant memory from 7am that morning in Niagara ). This cafe was right next door and I snaffled a copy of the lunch menu from a female server before we headed up to our suite. I showed the menu to my wife and her response was...let's do it ! So we scuttled back down in the elevator from the 21st floor and bumped into the hotel doorman at the hotel entrance. Our doorman friend said that this joint was just a diner but we told him we were starving and it was close. DONE DEAL ! We walked inside around 2.45pm and the same female server came by to take our lunch order. My wife ordered a Turkey Club ( bacon, lettuce, tomato..served with french fries, cole slaw & pickle ) and I selected the Italiano Panini ( grilled chicken, roasted peppers, fresh mozzarella & pesto on thin panini...served with french fries ). We also asked for 2 x Lattes. Our lunch order arrived within a very short time and looked beyond sensational.....the biggest thickest paninis I've ever seen (around $20 each ). Everything on our plates tasted fabulous....the French Fries were killer good ! Our Lattes arrived and didn't look so good and didn't taste so good. We complained to a server and the manager came over and said they are WET LATTES ( no frothy milk ) which is what New Yorkers prefer. I thought he was full of shit so we asked for CAPPUCCINOS. They eventually came out to our table and even though they looked better...tasted pretty average ! However our lunch sandwiches tasted AWESOME even though the size of the serves was beyond our ability to finish ! We came back the next evening and bought a couple of slices of different chocolate cakes for dessert later in our apartment. Not cheap at about $20 for the 2 slices and pretty average taste we thought. We are not diner fans and and this was the only place where we ran into the New York stereotypical model. We didn't come back !

We were looking for some place that offered both breakfast and lunch items. Viand Cafe was the perfect place! I enjoyed one of the lunch specials--a fresh mixed greens salad with chicken, strawberries, oranges, and sliced almonds, served with the delicious house vinaigrette. My husband enjoyed the Eggs Benedict and potatoes. The experience was great, and Miguel C, our server, was friendly, attentive, and efficient. We'll definitely go back next time we visit NYC!

I am a fan of hot turkey sandwiches and I gotta say that this one takes the cake. The turkey breast is perfectly cooked -- moist and flavorful. The turkey gravy is tasty as well. I was pleasantly surprised that the peas and carrots were fresh, unlike many places that just serve you frozen, basic peas and carrots. Extra turkey gravy took this over the top for me. I think I am ruined from all future tastings of hot turkey sandwiches.

Just great   First knew them from Madison Avenue when they open on 75th St. I continue to go there since I live on the west side their food is consistent always good and they run a very clean establishment

Zero stars. Yelp requires at least 1 to post a review.

Downright rude behavior has led me to stop going to the diner I've been going to for 20 years. I ordered my mediocre eggs, with soft, tasteless potatoes, and subpar bacon. But hey - it came out fast. I was on the phone with my family - having just experienced the tragic loss of my father. The check came - and the waiter - seeing that I'm on the phone -  told me to 'take my time.' I paid immediately, and tipped him. He returns to charge my card and in that exact moment tells me "we're busy now." I confronted him and the owner/manager. I said 'I felt like I was being kicked out. I'm going through a tough time. I just lost my father.' The owner/manager said 'it's very busy - you can't just sit here for 2 hours.' I said 'I was there for less than an hour - and I tipped my waiter.' They said the same thing again. Zero sympathy. Zero consideration for the customer. Zero interest in returning. Zero stars. And if negative stars were an option - they'd get a -5. Kindness, respect, and good food are the pillars of the restaurant business. Viand has none of these.
a good easy breakfast choice in the heart of the UWS! The outdoor dining are is very cute, with a good balance of ventilation and warmth.

Wait staff was attentive and service was.prompt.  The waitress was attentive and friendly.  There was a very extensive menu.  There were a lot of tables in the restaurant, but it didn't feel crowded.  The bathrooms were clean and bigger than I would have expected.  I would definitely go back.

Diner food, but really high quality scratch made diner food. It might seem pricey, but you're paying for the quality.

The Turkey especially. And the Turkey club.
I didn't go to this so I shouldn't be writing any review but I wanted to add that I would have totally gone if I had heard of it and please make it a regular thing!!!

LOVE the idea of the first all-vegan street fair and really hope it becomes a consistent thing -- BUT the lines were dreadfully long! And it was held in a court, so everyone was crammed rather than being on a street. I loved seeing so many vegans and vegan-friendly people who wanted to go and who wanted the food enough to wait in each line 35+ minutes (EACH. LINE. FOR. EACH. PLACE.) but there are definitely some kinks that need to be worked out for the next one.

Food was great, with vendors like Dunwell Doughnuts, Three Chicks Bakery, and more serving up everything from seitan skewers, lentil burgers and mint-mojito iced cream bars. Love it all, keep it up!

My wife and I had the pleasure of dining here earlier tonight.  We really enjoyed our meals.  The service was excellent.  The place had a great BBQ vibe.  

As for the food, the hush puppies appetizer with maple butter was a generous serving and as good as it gets.  My wife ordered the brisket with a side of BBQ beans and loved both.  The brisket was very lean.  It was well done and she appreciated that.  I tried it and it was good but I prefer pink to be showing on the meat.

I ordered pulled pork and smoked chicken.  Both were solid.  My cheese grits and coleslaw were too.  I really liked the hot sweet and spicy BBQ sauce that was on every table along with a mild version and a mango and jalapeño BBQ sauce.

We will definitely return on our next visit.

This was my Best experience out of many. Anthony in takeout was Amazing/Outstanding. He went above and beyond assisting with my order placement. Anthony is very a personable, he gets it and assists where needed. Anthony deserves a Promotion and a Raise! Kudos to Virgils for having Anthony on the team. Thank you Virgils and Anthony

Walking on 42nd st today we were going somewhere else they were closed on Sunday. Then I walked by Carmines. There was a sign saying Carmines sister Restaurant. So it was right across the street. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and seated. The food was amazing. The atmosphere was light and friendly. Our waitress was fun and funny. A lot of people were there having a great time.

My daughter ordered from here as a gift for my wife's knee surgery recovery.   It was on11/19/22  We are seniors and live 2 blocks away from Virgils on the Upper West Side NYC. We had a menu at home and gave her the order. Well 21/2 hours go by and no food, no call, no delivery! I call my daughter and tell her and she is so upset! She calls Virgils and they tell her the delivery guy fell off his bike and they will redo the order. It is 2 blocks away. Finally food arrives 3 hours past ordering  and it was ALMOST what we ordered! It was cold and the fried chicky was overfried! and the fries were cold and soggy.  We ordered corn bread, NONE! We orderd 2 slices of Key Lime Pie@ $9.00 a slice! One was half the size of the other!!! We got baked macaroni which we didn't order to top this off!!!! I wish I could post pics cause I have em.
NEVER EVER AGAIN ORDER FROM THIS JOINT OR EAT THERE.

I had the texas brisket sandwich from here and it was not bad at all! They gave a generous serving of brisket on the sandwich, along with some extra BBQ sauce. The meat was sliced thickly and tender, though it probably could have been smoked for just a touch longer. Staff were very friendly and prompt.
Horrible food. Google reviews are fake, buyer beware. Brisket tastes like cardboard. Even cardboard would be easier to digest.

Decent but I would not go back. The ribs and brisket were all cooked well, but slightly dry tasting instead of juicy. The macaroni and cheese was bad, it tasted like colored water over pasta. The mashed potatoes and gravy was entirely too salty. They also forgot my beans. And the "banana pudding" tasted like a container of miracle whip, a ton of bananas, and maybe like 3 nilla wafers thrown in. Overall I would not return. For the price point I didn't expect the food to taste this average.
Tastes ok but the portions were minuscule and the prices astronomical. I mean, straight robbery. Will never go again.

The food is good, however the service is terrible.

Our time for pickup was 7:05. We show up at 7, they say it'll be about 10 mins. We go in to check on the order, another 10 mins...this kept happening til 7:45. 40 mins after our initial time given to us by Virgils. Really sucked.

We ordered the trash ribs, which are miniature ribs. They were good. Also got the wings and these were great. Huge wings. The disappointment was the pulled pork sandwich and fries. Sandwich wasn't too good and the fries were soggy.

Lots of other quality restaurants in the UWS that won't make you wait 40 mins in the cold for your order.

This food is inedible. Probably the worst take out I've ever ordered. Dry chicken with excessive seasoning, over cooked mac and cheese, repulsive collard greens. Just about everything was bad, as in really bad. No wonder there are so many bad reviews

Yesterday's cold windy weather made us ready for BBQ. Dinosaur's erratic delivery schedule led us to try Virgil's, previously avoided because it seemed comparatively pricey. However, menu was similar to Dino's (minus fried green tomatoes), so we chose the small family "Pig Out" platter, very reasonable after all, at about $50 for the two of us, undeterred by the online warning of 90-minute delivery.

Not sure what to make of only (bad) reviews, from last spring. Of course we were starving when a hot tasty feast finally arrived! But we were not disappointed. Nothing was overly dry or super greasy--though Dino's onsite smoker produces distinctively superior BBQ, how could it not? Virgil's was still very tasty and a welcome change: Brisket, chicken, pulled pork, and ribs; full pints of beans and slaw; bag of warm cornbread.

Only proviso: sauce and sides have a sweet edge. And meats, in a huge aluminum tub, were sauced uniformly. Suggest less sauce in the overall assembly--customizable via free accompanying  1/2 pint--and none on the chicken, please!

Wings are great and that's that. The greens were passable. The ribs are over spiced and smoked and closer to a jerky consistency. Dirty fries are ok but nothing special. Corn bread is more like a small corn muffin but a better choice than the biscuit which by the way I will never order again.

While Broadway scene and offices are closed as of this post, Times Square hotspot Virgil's Real BBQ has debuted a new outpost for takeout and delivery on the Upper West Side. One would expect the usual Southern comfort foods, filled with meaty ingredients, but also decadent desserts including key lime pie and banana pudding. When most are working from home, UWS residents don't have to travel far for a taste of Midtown memories.

Disappointing.  Ribs were dry, chewy and loaded with unrendered fat.  Wings came in a large puddle of grease, skin was soggy. Sauces had no flavor other than heat.  Very expensive ($22 for 8 wings, which, after fees and tip, puts them at about $4 each).  Brisket was also dry and crumbly; fell apart when served.  "Free" coleslaw was about 2 tablespoons.

These are difficult times for restaurants, but this was pretty bad even so.

Twice I placed a whole slap of ribs on line and and received ribs cut up and not the whole slap. The first time I ordered a whole slap as a pickup order I received a whole slap The second and third time I order a whole slap as a delivery order I received ribs cut up. When I called to complained I was tolde that they were too busy to replace my order but offered a credit which took a week. My next delivery order of a slap of ribs again they came cut up and the delivery would not take them back. When I called Virgil's I was told that the slaps always come cut up and that if I want a whole slap it has to be indicated when I place the order. Their web site does not state that you must indicate that you want a whole slap and my order states a whole slap not cut up ribs. I was not offered a replacement nor a credit on my card and both the staff and manager response to my complaint made me feel it was my fault and that I had to live with it. If my first were cut up and not a  whole slap of ribs I would not have expected a whole slap on the two subsequent orders.  This is the last time I will place an order from Virgil's since what is advertised is not what one receives. I will not recommend Virgils to others.
Always great.  Stop by when I'm in nyc to grab the mushroom ragout Togo and the chicken saltimbocca sandwich.  Sandwich is killer

The L'artusi team just opened their second new spot of the year, a few doors down from B'artusi, the other new one. This one is a grab and go spot, with just standing room and a few tables set up outside. They have pastries, salads and sandwiches, plus stuff to cook at home.

I tried the Cacio e Pepe Scone ($6), which was great, as was the Huckleberry Pear Poptart ($5), but the real showstopper was the Chicken Saltimbocca Sandwich ($14.75). This is a super satisfying sandwich with crispy chicken, spicy capicola, arrabbiata sauce, provolone and mozz. If this is any indication, the rest of the sandwiches will be excellent too and I'm looking forward to returning to try more of them.

Because I'm such a fan of the L'Artusi team I was super excited to try Via Porta. It's a tiny little spot right next door to B'Artusi with some outdoor seating. They sell pastries, sandwiches, salads, and even have jarred versions of the sauces from L'Artusi.

From the start I could tell things were a little chaotic. There was a lot of staff moving nonstop behind the counter and a lot of customers coming in and out.
We ordered the Chicken Saltimbocca sandwich, the mattanza tuna sandwich, the ribollita soup, pumpkin chocolate chip loaf, and the olive oil loaf. Somehow we ended up with a sunchoke Caesar salad and they accidentally gave us two chicken sandwiches instead of a tuna. They were quick to give us the right sandwich once we pointed it out.

The two winners were the chicken sandwich and the olive oil loaf. Everything else was just ok. I'm excited to come back and try more of the sandwiches and other new items coming soon as they get more into the swing of things.

Solid outpost featuring L'Artusi items. Via Porta is a good grab and go option if you want something less formal but still capturing the flavors of the team.

Here's what you should know:
1. Yes, the sandwich prices can feel steep but I usually get about 3/4 of the way through before I start feeling full.
2. They have fridge where you can buy the soups and sauces for other meals that you might be making.
3. Coffee and pastries are also excellent.
4. Standing room only with one table outside
That uovo sandwich is a big no. I was excited to try it based off the reviews but the eggs had that awful weird overcooked taste which completely overpowered the entire sandwich. Couldn't finish it

Charming little provisions shop with coffee, sandwiches, and fresh baked goods to-go. Owned by L'Artusi team. They even sell L'Artusi sauces and meal kits. I tried the Huckleberry Pear Poptart  and was wholly impressed. I didn't try any of the sandwiches, but they looked legit. I wish that the sandwich menu was larger and that it included more vegetarian options.

amazing baked goods, and that chicken parm sandwich is absolutely unreal. their frittata is slept on and the mushroom sandwich is the best thing on the menu. they also have unbelievable takes on Poptarts

Wanted to love it.  Went out of my way to get there.  Big fan of Italian sandwiches and thought this one would be great.  Quite disappointing.  Bread to filling ratio was terrible (way too much bread).  If the bread was good, I may have less of an issue but it tasted like day-old bread, which made it all the worse.  Had to combine the filling of both sides onto one side (creating 1/2 a sandwich to make it at least palatable.  The L'artusi guys can do better.

I was excited because L'artusi is one of my favorite restaurants. Ordered the chicken saltimbocca sandwich. Flavors were fine, but the chicken was dry and not crispy as advertised. Not worth the high price.
Amazingly decadent and delicious cinnamon rolls! The staff are super friendly also and seem to get along well with one another.
Love their food, but waiting for 2 hours for delivery and still missing.... They need to get their service in order and retrain their team/reevaluate delivery partner.

This was the best rectangular shaped (Sicilian style?) pizza by the slice I've ever had. It was fluffy on the inside, just the right amount of crisp along the outside edges, and boy was that pepperoni nice and crispy as well. Wow. I'm salivating just thinking about it..this place is worth walking the extra 6-8 minutes to come here instead of some random pizza by the slice that may not be as good. Just remember this is the rectangular style pizza, not your thin crust triangular shaped slice of New York pizza. I think this is way better.
FYI: $10 minimum credit card charge, otherwise Cash or Venmo (no minimum).

What a gem! We were turned away from another pizza place down the street because they had just closed (it was only 10pm!) and they weren't taking any more orders despite there being tons of people around. We walked on and found Village Square a few doors down and I'm glad that we did!

The pizza was delicious. I paid about $12 ($10 minimum for cards) and got two square slices with toppings - about what I expected to pay. The eggplant pizza had a very flavorful tomato sauce and the eggplant was roasted perfectly with just the right amount of char and crispness. Sausage and peppers slice was flavorful and well seasoned. The crust was perfect, almost like focaccia. Not too thick or doughy, great flavor.

Seating on stools in front of a ledge for maybe 10 people max. Good for a quick bite.

I'm giving them 1 star after yesterdays experience.

I showed up for a slice at 12:15pm on a Friday afternoon. The door was locked. The employee was making pizzas. I could see a bunch of pizzas made and fresh through the window.

I motioned to the employee for the door and he gave me the "we're closed" hand gesture....at 12:15, lunch time.

Ok...plenty of other places to get pizza in the village.

Omg I am in love with this place. Some of the best I have ever had. The cup n char pepperoni is amazing and the pizza has a nice crisp to it. We got 2 slices of pepperoni for about $11-$12 and a bottle of cold water for $1. They take credit card but there's a $10 minimum. Cannot wait to come back here again!

Great, quick service!

The plain and vodka slice were both very good and crispy. It's a thick slice if that's not your vibe, and I thought the vodka slices could have used some more sauce but overall MUCH better than other pizzas around the block!

Definitely coming back when I am in the area.

Village Square Pizza serves a good slice when you need some carbs, sauce, and cheese. the  regular cheese slice is a NYC-style: thin crust with some chew and crispness, layer of sauce, topped with a thin blanket of cheese. the sauce had flavor flavorful without being sweet or salty--just a subtle balance of both. the slice was served extra hot and it hit the spot. the interior looks new and is very clean--a few seats (no tables) inside and there is an outside shed in front. variety of slices and pies on display. service is friendly and quick. definitely a good option when you need a takeout slice or two or a minute to catch your breath and scarf some calories. nice casual slice option in the West Village.

Came here on a weekday evening, and after asking for the most popular slices, I got a pepperoni slice and an upside down which is mozzarella with sauce on top. I was debating whether to get another one but decided I'll eat these ones first. I paid and then sat to wait for my slices; there's a $5 minimum on credit cards. The slices were quite delicious: thick and good amount of tons, but the flavor was a bit light. Not too oily which I appreciated, and I liked the crust a lot. Not too much space to sit as it's all counter space. Really friendly employees!

[Sidenote: this is my 3400th review!]

Awesome pizza, and a large variety of options to choose from (including a vegan option).

I tried the upside down pizza and vodka slice. Since the slices are big, I thought maybe I was going to have leftovers, but I devoured both.

You're out in the city on a busy Friday night and every restaurant you pass is packed to the gills. Weak from hunger, you gaze up and see the sign for Village Square Pizza shining like a beacon. You stumble inside and the scent of pizza overwhelms your weary soul.

You can't really go wrong with any slice here, but the eggplant slice was the clear winner. It's the kind of slice that makes you feel like paying more than $1 for pizza is actually well worth it. Not much seating inside, but enough to take refuge long enough to enjoy your repast. Definitely worth a repeat visit. Be there or be...well, you know.

My cousins and I went to try this pizza since we heard good reviews on the internet. So we went to try it out our selves. The service was great!! Pizza was also delicious  
An employee overheard us celebrating my birthday so he went above and beyond to add a special touch.
If we ever come back to NY we will come back plus also recommend to anyone that comes to NY.

Amazing pizza.. we reach NY around late afternoon for our 3 day foodcation trip and we walked from our hotel striaght to village square puzza for late lunch as our first atop and it did not disappoint.

We had pepperoni, reg, buffalo chicken, one with ricotta and pesto with some drinks.. peppo with hot honey was amazingly awesome and there is no such combo here in Boston and we absolutely loved it.

The person working there was really awesome explaing which all slices were on the display and bought us the pizza after warming it up to the tables outside...

Overalll great experience and as youtubers say it is a must place to visit..

It's a no brainer for a quick bite of what NY is about. Square slices, though not your typical NY slice you think of, but are starting to become a norm in this city. Still a fair representation of NY pizza if you ask me. Pizza in this city just hits different and definitely on a different playing field. VS is a sort of new comer to the pizza game and are doing it right. Of course everyone knows prince st. pizza and they'll always have a place in my heart, but VS is as good if you're going to compare apples to apples with the square pep slice. Less wait times along with some more modern takes like hot honey, Village Sq is an easy choice to satisfy that carby goodness we all crave.

Stay fat mother sucker

BEST SLICE OF WHITE PIZZA EVERRRRR.

Seriously though.  Best damn slice of white pizza I've ever had.  The thick crust is the perfect base for mozz cheese and that glorious glorious whipped ricotta.  and the honey drizzle takes it all to another level of deliciousness.  SO SO GOOD.  

Their Pepperoni Square slice is also ammmaaaazing.  And totally comparable to another pizza shop a couple neighborhoods over.  The sauce is sweet, the pepperoni a little spicy and together they just make another perfect slice.

Staff has always been cool when I have stopped by for a slice (usually two).  There are stools and a counter for indoor dining (when that's allowed again), a couple tables outside (al fresco!) and they accept cards after $10 (which is not hard to do...).

Yuppp, totally obsessed w/ this spot.

I had the pleasure of trying their pizza for the first time at a non-profit event and let me tell you, I LOVE their pizzas. I frequent this store whenever I'm in the area. Sometime I'll even make a pit stop here as I'm heading to Brooklyn.

Must try - You have to have to get their grandma slice. This is my favorite! The crust is thin and has a great crisp. The sauce is sweet and works very well with the pesto. I usually get two slices of this. I couldn't find any pizza place that can beat their grandma slice. Trust me I have tried.... and failed miserably.

Other delights - I have also tried their pepperoni, Buffalo chicken, volka, mushroom and white pizza. These slices are more Sicilian. Their dough is crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. The pepperoni is my second favorite. You should definitely get it with the Mike hot sauce (if you want a kick).

This is probably one of the best pizza places in NYC. I'm sad I live in Queens and can't come here everyday.

Stopped by for a few slices of pizza and they did not disappoint!
My favorite was either the vodka slice or the white slice. But also the bruschetta slice was so good too. Too hard to decide.
Love that they serve it with hot honey packets too.
Service was really nice and the inside was super clean. There are some bar stools / bar tables and then a bar table along the front window. Perfect for people watching the streets. They also have a nice outdoor setup as well with a few tables.
Will def be back whether it's here or their east village location - and they are opened late night !!

Super friendly staff, even though we were waiting outside when the doors they opened, we were serious about hitting certain pizza places while visiting NY and this place was a great recommendation by @brettcconti, the hot honey was amazing and the pizza was even better.
Add it to your list!

I used to walk from Chelsea to the East Village just for a slice - they make the crunchiest, greatest pizza in NYC. All the ingredients are so top-notch. This new location in the West Village is a DREAM come true. Tons of outdoor seating, too. Helloooo, our new weekend spot.

You've gotta get the classic margherita slice, the pepperoni slice (add honey hot sauce), and the cheesy garlic knots. The vodka slice is also so rich and comforting.

5 stars!!!!!

I love this spacious pizza shop! It is easily in my top 10 favorite NYC pizza joints. My favorite has to be the square pepperoni with a drizzle of hot honey. I suggest you don't get the corner pieces so you can get less carbs and more pepperoni. There have been a few instances where I've travelled all the way from lower Brooklyn just for a slice of heaven.

The staff here is very friendly, so make sure to ask for suggestions! If you can tolerate it, get that hot honey for an extra $1.50. The hot honey brings the flavor from wow to Oh My God!

This place is kinda a hidden gem. It's not as crowded as the other pizza places in NY and the service is a lot better (I like the bad service cuz that's how I can really tell the pizza is gonna be good). This place had a lot of options and it seemed like you definitely couldn't go wrong with whatever you pick. I got the vodkas pizza and my friend got the peppers and sausage. Both were really really good. What I loved most was the crunch of the crust, it was perfect. Then once you crunched through the crust there was a perfect airy, light, and fluffy dough. Not only was the crust perfect, but so was the sauce and cheese. Everything was amazing.

So good! This place was recommended on a YouTube channel I had watched and I just had to try for myself! The crunch, the flavor, the sweet heat from the hot honey. So, SO good! I definitely see why it made the list for one of NYC's best pizza spots!

I will not give them zero stars because it is not posible. I bought the pizza close to 12 am. I paid for it and gave them a tip. A minute after I was told "we are closing". They didn't let me eat it! They gave me a box and off you go. They practically closed the door on my face. Never again. BTW it does taste good but I believe they should allow people to eat it inside. 5 minutes tops.

As soon as I walked in it sounded like the first hour back in high school where i got bullied, to loud. Group of teenagers running the orders, I asked for a classic pizza and i was given a pepperoni square when i went to the front to ask for my initial order the cashier stated the address to my mothers house and said "I turned her into a meat lovers" verbatim. I never got my classic pizza slice or a refund plus pizza mid.

Finally a good Sicilian pizza place in the West Village! The place just recently had their soft opening so it isn't too crowded yet, but the pizza here is top notch.

We tried three of the pizzas (the pepperoni, the white pizza and the vodka) as well as some garlic knots. The pepperoni was definitely the best, and tasted almost exactly like the one at Prince Street Pizza. It was crispy and amazing on the outside, while still having an amazing sauce and slightly chewier center.

The white pizza and the vodka pizza were decent as well, but I think the purely tomato pizzas taste better. Garlic knots were a little cold and I wish they heated them up more, but the knots themselves were good with a nice amount of garlic.

Overall solid choice, will be back!
Worth the hype! Had the white pizza and pepperoni pizza with hot honey. Service was incredible and no wait on a Saturday night

Owners of this place are supportive of nonprofits! Had a chance to try their pizza at a nonprofit event and omg it was so good! Even overnight the pizza was so good, so I had to come support. This time I got the grandma slice and my friends got the pepperoni and margherita slice. My friend who got the margherita slice liked it so much she got another one! I highly recommend this place! It's probably one of the best pizzas out there in NYC
Not good pizza. Overall taste was lacking. Sauce is too acidic. Meat is kind of flavorless. Crust has good texture but does not have enough flavor.

My boyfriend and I have been here a couple times and fell in love with Village Square after drunkenly stumbling upon the East Village location one night. It was a classic NYC love story where we just needed something to eat at 2am after coming home from the bar, chose the random pizza place on the corner, and were still talking about how good it was the next day.

Last time we ordered, we got the Buffalo chicken pizza which was exceptional...but, don't waste your time. This weekend we got the grandma square pie and it was just heavenly - he and I were both raving about it mid slice. Great crust, crispy but not burnt, fantastic sauce and the best pesto I've ever had. We ordered the garlic knots too and they were great.

It's def a little on the pricey side, comparable to
Prince Street, but well worth it. Great pies (oh, and the employees have been super nice at both locations every time we've gone in).

Stopped by on a pizza tour and had an enjoyable experience. Cute outpost that seems fairly popular, and based on reviews was expecting some of the best pizza in the city. Definitely felt the quality was up there, but in comparison with some of my other stops felt the quality was a bit lower here, and the crust a bit too crunchy (good if you like your pizza that way).

Would recommend if you are in the area, but may not be worth a special trip.

so after eating here a few times over the past few months.I tried to stop in last night on my way home from work. I walked in as another customer was walking out. I understand that they were in the process of closing. So I asked for 2 slices to go. I was rudely told NO by the employee that was there by himself. I said to myself okay and walked out. I walked a block west and found another piazza place. On my way back to the subway, I walked by and found this place with about 6 " party girls" and 1 or 2 more guys ( whom either worked there or were with the women) laughing eating and taking pictures inside. All the lights still on. I hope that places like this , that treat their customers this way. Don't have their lights on for too long. PS..... before last night, I would have given them 5 stars for every time that I had been there. They just lost a customer. the picture below is from when I walked back to the subway. you can see one of the young ladies inside

AMAZING! This is their second location and their first one is in East Village. Both places have the same quality and that sign inside too. Literally taste like prince street pizza. When you order a fresh new pie, make sure you tell them you like it crispy! By the slice, since they're reheating it, it's always going to be cripsy and crunchy.

Stopped by on a Friday night and my friend and I ended up getting a classic grandma pie and a pepperoni square.
The classic square was thin and the sauce was on the sweeter side. Oddly enough it was a good combo and I enjoyed the slice.
My friend enjoyed the pepperoni square, for a dollar extra you can get a side of mikes hot honey, which was a great combo he said.

It's a cool place, should check it out if you're in the area.

One of my favorite pizza spot in Manhattan. The square pizza has a nice, crispy bottom and not skimpy with the toppings. They'll reheat the pizza once you order.

Definitely need to get the hot honey on the side to drizzle over the pepperoni pizza. I'd definitely make a stop when I'm in that area!
Great service. Reasonable prices. The pepperoni with the hot honey is a MUST. Best slice we have had.
Very quick bite to eat and good food. Nice change up with the square slices. I never thought of hot honey as being an additive to a piece of pizza but it was great!!
Great place to eat for less than $15! Huge portions and the flavor is amazing. You should really try the hot oil with your slice! Excellent pizza and lived up to hype.

Yay! They open their 2nd location in the West Village!

Still the same great quality pizza as their east village location. Do yourself a favor and get the whole pie. It tastes great fresh out the oven and the next day in the air fryer. You seriously can't go wrong with their white or spicy pepperoni squares. Highly recommend.
Absolutely one of the top five square slices in Manhattan. Love 'em. Not much else to say.

Village Square Pizza is up there in terms of great pizza in NYC. Yes-- I am aware of other great pizzeria around the corner and a few blocks. I know that everybody has their personal favorite, but you are missing out if you don't give this place a try. I found the the pizza to be absolutely flavorful and delicious. I can't find any criticism regarding any weakness to the pizza.  They mainly specialize in square pizza.  There is a ton of options with square. All of them are a good choice. I got the pepperoni and the eggplant. The toppings are plentiful. If you are in the area, you should consider this establishment for a visit. No regrets.

Cute pizza shop in west village with a variety of pizza options. Unfortunately they were out of the vegan type which I was hoping to try, nonetheless we tried a variety of different slices and enjoyed them all! I like the option that you can purchase a whole pizza pie or individual slices. Also they have a small little outdoor seating area with heaters. Covid friendly.

The spicy pepperoni Sicilian reminded me of the Prince Street spicy pepperoni square but this is better, it's not as spongy and it's way more pillowy, and light, with a crunchy bottom. Sauce is spicy and generously herbed, on the robust side. Cheese amount is perfect, never messy or greasy, aside from the high quality hand cut pepperoni, which is encrusted with grated cheese.

The standard Margherita had a different sauce, it wasn't as bright or full of tomato flavor. The crust was great though, but a little bit under-sauced and dry toward the back end. Perhaps it's better to get a pie than order slices of that one.

A generous slice and surprisingly delicious. Although it's slightly off the beaten path, it may be worth the trip.

However being charged $5.40 for a slice that is supposed to be $4.50 just ain't cool + a $10 minimum purchase is just plain bad business and not away to treat customers.

Must try!!! Last night was our first time ordering from Village Square but it certainly won't be our last. We ordered a couple white squares, vodka squares, a Buffalo chicken square, and the cheesy garlic knots. Everything was excellent! Not as heavy and doughy as some of the other square pizza I've had. Dough was light & airy and had the perfect amount of crisp!

Yes, yes, yes. It's about time the village had an authentic, fast and simple slice joint besides Joe's or Bleecker St. Not that I don't love those guys... but Village Square is different. Generous on toppings but not to the detriment of the undercarriage. The base is delightfully crispy, fresh and hot.
Plus, there are nice guys running the joint... so highly recommend for pizza aficionados or simply hungry boozehounds alike. Five stars.
It's good . I liked the sauce and good amount of cheese . Clean space . Convenient location off the trains . Prices are a little high but I guess everything is expensive now with inflation.

This review is NOT based on the food. We had a slice of classic, marinara and pepperoni. Quite good. I would give 3 or 4 stars for the food. Here is why 1 star: there was a large piece of a copper colored staple in my classic slice. Super sharp. Thank god I spit it out. I showed it to the young man at the counter. He said, "Wow!" That was it. I sent an email to the owner. No response. Thus 1 star. Please be careful eating here.
The pizza here is incredible. It's the perfect amount of every topping. If you're hungry - get the grandma slice. The pepperoni is also really good. It's a cute little spot, and the service is great.
Delicious but bc it's so thick you have to order it extra hot otherwise the topping may still be cold, or it may not the cooked all the way through. Yes to hot honey!

Pepperoni slice is the best, you won't disappointed! best square pepperoni pizza ever! Must tried if you are in the area or it's worth to travel there to get a pepperoni slice! amazing pizza friendly staff, highly recommended for a quick square pepperoni slice very pepperoni very cheese and crispy five stars!

Great new pizza spot in the west village area. Very easy grab and go spot where they have available selections on display. They will heat it up for you when you order so it maintains optimal crunchiness. They also have an outdoor space if you want to eat it while it's fresh!  I tried pepperoni, white slice, and the grandma slice. All were amazing but the grandma slice (not pictured) was my favorite! The pesto on the slice is soooo flavorful. Don't miss out on this spot!
Best pizza in the neighborhood. The owners and staff are wonderful! My personal favorite is the grandma pizza and buffalo chicken.

I was disappointed in the Italian sub. Honestly, I didn't finish it. I threw the other half way. I hope it was just an off day because the staff was kind and the food area was clean! There was a lack of communication between the employees.
The sandwiches are so trash they don't know how to cook.It's not worth spending your money in here.

They have a cat that likes to take and shit and piss in the litter box then immediately jump all over the countertops.

Who has a cat knows that they have litter box feet and full of bad germs!!

How can a place like this stay in business with such disgusting hygiene?

What other disgusting things are these people doing to the customers??

Run away as fast as you can, unless your into eating from a litter.

I drove by yesterday 12-11-19 and I noticed that they covered all the windows with advertisement to prevent anyone from seeing the cat jumping on the countertops when the place is closed.
Had a great breakfast sandwich here, the place is clean and the employees are friendly. New to the neighborhood so will definitely return and order breakfast for production crew.

I've come here for their deli which has a good selection of items, and has good prices compared to other delis nearby. The service is fast though the staff making the sandwiches and wraps could be friendlier. Overall, a good spot to go to to grab something quick.
Great neighborhood spot, making tasty deli and breakfast sandwiches. Well stocked with everything you'd ever want to grab from a bodega. A friendly grey cat keeps an eye on things.

Placed an order on seamless and they cancelled it 40 minutes after I placed it and cancelled my order due to "Restaurant Difficulties". Called them to find out what happened and they said they have no delivery driver. Guy was totally rude and told me it was my problem. GET OFF OF SEAMLESS THEN YOU IDIOTS.
Good pizza, great price. $14 for 2 tasty slices of pizza and two cans of coke...Bargain!

A great and classic New York pizza experience! It's a small shop with only seating for about 10 so it's mainly a take out.
The staff were kind enough to cut my toddlers' pizza into smaller cubes.
Overall great experience!

It's a pizza joint and its ok not the best but still a very tasty nyc slice!  The spot is small so seating is real limited.  There is a park across the street.  so on a nice day a slice or two in the park to people watch a good lunch day.

Really good sliced pizza in New York. Just what my family and I needed on a summer day. There's seating on the inside but not much. Just a grab and go scene. The guy who served our pizza was kind enough to cut one of the slices into smaller pieces for my toddler son. This was greatly appreciated. We had a slice of cheese, broccoli and chicken, and the Hawaiian slice. All were yummy tasted great. Definitely check them out in New York.

There's nothing wrong with a slice of pizza to go. Easy in, easy out. Pizzas already on the counter and ready for a walk after a brief time in the oven.

I got my slice and enjoyed it very much. A little doughy but a delicious combination of crust, sauce and cheese. It needed nothing except the plate it was served on.

[Review 18336 overall - 336 in New York - 1858 of 2022.]

The pizza was nothing out of the ordinary of what you expect for NYC style pizza. Was very good and quick served as well. There was not many people in the store that night but a good flow of people coming in and out which was fine. Overall the flavor was good and was not bad at all. A bit more doughy and the cheese was pretty generous which was a good change of pace compared to the regular $1 slice pizzas. Would come back for more.

I have to say pizza has been spotty in NY. Trying to always find a cheap and decent slice is not easy but I LIKED THIS PLACE.
Got a pepperoni slice as well as a mushroom slice.
Both great and highly recommend. Small shop, great people.
Good, fast and helpful staff!  And we're kinda pizza snobs.  So good, even made the cut on our YouTube video at Lyfe Untethered!
Cheap, solid, fast slice of New York pizza. Everything we were looking for with nothing extraneous.

I was in here around 2 today. No other customer there. I looked at what was in the display. I saw pepperoni pizza slices so I asked for one to go. Once it was heated, the man behind the counter asked if I wanted to put any seasoning on it.  I don't recall many pizzeria employees asking that unless they know you.  I liked that.

Now to the pizza.  It was greasy but in a good way for pizza. The crust was firm enough to fold and hold the topping without bending.  There was enough cheesy without being too much. The sauce was good too.

There are several pizza spots on 14th, and I've tried them all. They're all terrible. I finally went to Village Pizza and I've never looked back. Their pepperoni pizza is the best slice in the neighborhood. It's delicious. The crew that works there is super nice too.

Worker is extremely rude and we had a massive misunderstanding that when we tried to rectify he started yelling at us and no matter what we tried to do he just kept yelling at us.

Pizza is very good though just had a bad experience with a worker.

Great pizza by the slice with roli's and hero's. Thin and thick pies. Canned and bottled drinks Pepsi and Snapple. Rustic condiment tray and limited seating. Quick service. Plenty of toppings, good basic pizza.

Used to be the best pizza place in the area. Not so anymore. Pizza is different from one time to the next. Today I called to order a meatball sub and the woman who answered said they didn't have meatball subs. I asked if the were out and she said no we don't make them. I asked again saying you have had them for the last 20 years. She finally asked someone but it was too late. This place has really gone in the toilet since the gentleman who ran it for many years stopped working there. Maybe hire someone who can read the menu board?

This pizza is delicious!! I love a classic Nyc slice and it can be pretty spotty around the city. I stumbled upon Village Pizza today and was so happy to find them, since I just moved into the neighborhood. The guy making the pizza was also super nice! I will be back regularly!
Good pizza and relatively good value.  Would definitely go back again next time I'm in NYC.

I still don't think their sauce is very flavorful, and they use too much cheese on their plain slices for me. But the slice with pepperoni, bacon, and ham is bomb! The toppings are really fresh and they're generous with them. Stewart's root beer in glass bottles. Friendly service. They also are the only place I've seen with all the Italian spices mixed into one container - what a time saver! Oregano, garlic, red pepper flakes. They're also available individually if you don't want all that flavor, you'd be wrong, but it's still your choice.

Maybe I'm just used to real New York style or New Haven style pizza, but this just wasn't good.  The ratio of cheese to sauce was off. Extra cheese,  yumm, but the sauce was ummm... idk where it was? maybe they were running low.  I only ate 1/2 the slice and threw the other half away.  Such a waste of $4.75...

Also, My brother had a Sicilian slice and said it reminded him of a cheese sandwich... and he threw his away as well

* this place earned an extra star for manners! Their customer service was on point!

I mean it was more like a $1 slice ...it was a small slice..doughy and just overall meh. It was busy Ofcourse considering it's location. It's casual, and the decor has a cool old school vibe. I wouldn't come here again because there's too many other great options in NYC

BIG FAN OF THE ORIGINAL OWNER.  A perfect NYC slice.  He moved to Hawaii, bless him.  He earned it.  

New Management - still a good slice.  Love the younger energy.  However, does this slice still compete with Joes (or even better)?  Joes is only a few blocks down the road!  Only you can decide.  

Change the price.  Never change the pizza.

I absolutely enjoyed my visit to little Italy and Village Pizza. I ordered a 10" Margherita pie because they do not do individual slice. The sauce to cheese to topping ratio was perfect and the pie was fresh and delicious. I will definitely visit again to try their different pie options. You cannot eat in because it just a small location but, there are plenty of places to eat outside and around the area. Overall, great pizza, awesome staff, and I loved it.

Mediocre on the night we visited. Maybe it's because it was nearly 10pm and the pizza had been sitting there a while - it was definitely ok and good for a quick bite, just nothing to write home about.
Excellent NYC classic pizza. Slices @ $3.27, room to sit, and great friendly service. Enjoy!
Their food is excellent. This is our go to for takeout. Their food is consistently tasty, their prices are reasonable and it's a family-run business that I like supporting.

This was our "go to" until COVID hit. Despite safety requirements they have allowed folks to parade in with masking which can be dangerous and is utterly annoying. Still, three stars for great pizza. Now we go to Joe's which is quite phenomenal and has complied to safety regulations.
too expensive for one slice- sauce and cheese was fine, crust not special. i wouldnt seek it out again unless i was desperate for an overprices single slice of pizza

Decent. The pizza was straight forward. NYC style for sure. Our friend made the mistake and folded in half in the beginning. It's grease dripped down the back and front of her hand, in a classic New York style. We pestered the manager so he kinda got irritated with us but its food and when something goes wrong with our food we complain.
Let me explain. We simply wanted pep and one cheese. He was busy so he kinda snapped back. Then we asked for two drinks, changed our mind and asked for three. But its all good. We sat at Jackson Park and ate the box of 6 pizzas and fed some pigeons and finches.would I recommend this place, yeah. Its good. Its a do again if you live here BUT I don't so i wont be back

Solid slice joint.

Service can be a little curt, but they're here to make pizza, not friends.

Some seating, but don't come expecting to sit as it does get tight. And definitely don't expect table service.

I appreciate their chicken and broc slice but all pizza is appreciable.

Cash only.

This pizza was so good. They were super fast and hit the spot. When you are hungry and tired of walking in NYC, we came upon this in the nick of time. Lol. It was packed and looked delicious and the price was right. A legit NY slice of pizza. No complaints here at all!

This place is the reason I got Yelp just to leave it a review. The pizza and the service was HORRIBLE. Me and my boyfriend ordered a slice and asked to add another slice the guy got bothered that he didn't even heat up the pizza correctly.

Not sure what happened to this place but got 2 cheese slices last night and couldn't eat the 2nd on at all, gave it away to homeless guy. The flavor was awful, the dough was gross - not sure how to even describe it and the cheese didn't seem melted. Not sure I'll ever go back when there are so many good pizza places out there.
I always go here for a real slice right before work. In the cut so you can miss it if you aren't looking. Not like rockys at all. This pizza has a classic feel.

Always saving a slice for you.
Foldable $2.50 cheese slices with ever so slightly sweet sauce. Its better than any of the other late night. slice places I've been to.

I'm a fan!

This was the only place I went for a slice while on a recent week-long vacation in NYC, but boy oh boy was it a good choice. Village Pizza was my girlfriend's neighborhood pizza joint of choice when she lived in New York in the early 2000s, and I can see why.

The place itself is about the size of two claustrophobic broom closets...I would order to go 10,000% of the time. We got there right around lunch hour and it was well-ordered chaos inside. Orders are called back and forth over the counter to 4 hard-working pros working the kitchen, and lots of Italian was being spoken too. As others have noted, it's cash-only and quite affordable.

We each ordered plain cheese slices, sprinkled a bit of pepper flakes on them and then ate in the little park across the street. The slices were amazing--hot and juicy but not greasy (I used my napkin but I didn't need it to save my life or my clothes or my pride or anything like that). The sauce was super flavorful and I'd say just a tiny bit tart, and the cheese was the perfect amount, texture, and flavor...cheese like this is probably the highest hurdle between me and veganism. They serve cheese like this in the Dairy section of heaven. The crust was foldable at the point/middle and crispy/chewy at the edge.

An outstanding first-time New York pizza experience.

Always come to village pizza when I come to NY.  
Excellent and very affordable! It's a small walk in place. A couple tables. Great place for lunch on the go.

Solid pizza spot! Easy to miss and limited seating inside. Didn't look like there was a minimum credit card fee. I had a classic slice of cheese and it was perfect. Not recommended for groups because very limited seating, but if you're just looking for a quick slice of food NY pizza this is a good spot.

Happened to be in the area and went in for a pair of slices. For NYC pizza it's good, but not great. The bread needed to be crispier. The sauce needs a bit of work as well. Salt, pepper and few other spices. The cheese was a bit too heavy. Overall, it needs more love. What they have going for themselves is location. I won't say it was a disappointing lunch, but definitely wouldn't say you need to get to Village Pizza.

Great NYC Pizza. Fast service!!

Meat lovers pizza was excellent!

Prices are good and it was enjoyable.

A lowkey small pizza joint in the village...The perfect option after a work event in the Meatpacking District. I ordered two (cheese) slices for $6, it's a small spot with a couple tables. If you're looking for a solid, no-fuss slice or two and in the area, this is a great option- a step above the other cheaper fast pizza places.

As I always  say sometimes customer service it is everything.

Thre PIZZA here is Amazing 5 starts  always good!!! however the service  could get better.
I came few days ago for a pizza, they do not have a prices on the pizzas, so ofcourse I asked how much the slices, the gut asked me wich one, I was like all, he looked at me like (do you Really  want me to go over all the price).  He asked me to point on the ones I want to get, I was like it is depends on the price.
Anyway Ended up asking only on a 3 slices.  (I could of get one of each) but he was too tiered going over all the 7 selections he had.
So the pizza are ready he asking me to pay,  before I'm  handing the money I asked how much, I told him I thought it is would be less, so ask him to rep it the prices, in which he did, BUT WITH HUGE ATTITUDE
and then say ed something in Spanish  to his coverker I think It was very disrespectful!!!
Loved this place. The slices are so huge for $2.50 and pie cost $15 but the slices are not as huge. Really good pizza!

My fiance and I went here on a recommendation a few years ago - BEST CRUST I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!

Light, flaky, tasty, amazing!! Everything else was really good but that crust was incredible!!

This seems to be the closest pizza slice to the south end of the High Line Park.

I got a fast reheated broccoli and chicken, which is my favorite NYC slice and it was really good.

There's very little seating but the fat guys behind the counter are very nice.

Randomly popped in here this evening and was glad that I did. The place is a no frills pizza shop with your basics - cheese, pepperoni pizzas with a few other varieties and, of course, a sicilian. Ordered a pepperoni slice and it was $3.75, not bad, and around the same price of most similar pizza spots. There's minimal seating inside, but let's be real, in classic NYC fashion, everyone's folding their slice and taking it for the road.

Pizza was definitely bigger and cheesier than expected, but not as saucy as I would've liked. Delicious nonetheless. The pizza was chewier than your typical Joe's pizza, which my friend loved (he likes doughier than crispier). This pizza joint embodies the quintissential NYC pizza, and think its one of the better slices I've had in the city so far. Also, this is my friend's new fav pizza spot, which was a huge plus.

Also, doesn't hurt that this spot has Julianne Moore's stamp of approval. Not bad at all.

yelp hours are wrong got here at 10:40pm and they are closed.   i was here 20'years ago though, the slices were
good back was then, today? - who knows??  not
me!

It got a B health rating and I went in anyway. I was hungry, ok?
Let me say right off the bat, this is not a pleasant place. Five tiny tables, crammed into a place so cramped the garbage bin had to be outside. This is clearly meant to be taken to go, though many people don't - as evidenced by the crumbs and old napkins littering the table. The staff are gruff, with short, loud bursts of language, and will glower a bit as they heat your slices. So why the 4-star rating?

This is some damn fine pizza. Ranging from $2.50 a slice for plain to $4.00 for two-topping slices, these guys nail it across the board. Tasty thin crust that juuuust cracks when you fold it? Check. Flavorful, well-seasoned sauce? You bet. Real cheese that doesn't miss any spots, but doesn't drown the pizza? Spot on. So my advice to you is to let the barks of the staff roll off place your order, and take it to go - this pizza is definitely worth it.

Cold, overpiced pizza. The veggies on the slice were less than lukewarm even after I asked for it to be reheated and got an attitude from the counter person. Go two blocks down and get better pizza for 1/4 price, literally. Terrible slice for over $4 ,ridiculous
The pizza here was BOMB! This is one of my top two places for a NYC pizza slice. If you're in the neighborhood, this place is a must!
Great pizza by the slice ($3) or a whole pie ($21). Drinks are expensive ($3) per can.

What can I say. If the judge of a great slice is the good 'ol plain/cheese version... we found this one to be a lil' tasteless. The crust was wonderful and the pepperoni was better, but yeah... service was typical and the place was pretty dirty. We wouldn't come back here actually.
Guy behind the counter is rude, food isnt fresh but IS overpriced.

Beware. This is not pho at all. Flavorless broth and chicken tasted weird. $18 from grub hub for small pint of broth and overcooked noodles. They gave a lemon instead of lime and small amount of bean sprouts.
This shares the same location as the NY Thai & Sushi Bar. Pho lacked flavor (tasteless) and noodles fell apart. Pretty much no toppings.

Holy crap this place is good. That's my review. 10/10
Please go here. Eat their food. Everything was so delicious

Just landed and checked into our hotel and we're starving and viola came in clutch! I can't even remember what we had ordered it was recommended to us from the lady taking our order. It was great and we will for sure be back. Good was so good and welcomed I didn't even snap a picture first!

I had the jollof rice with plantains and goat. Absolutely horrible and really expensive. The rice is tasteless. Taste like tomato and the goat was so chewy. I think I broke a tooth. And really ext compared to the excellent options available in the area.

I got take out and what can I say?

The food was good.
The service was fine.
They have a humble space so there's not much ambience to speak of.
It's New York City so in and out you go.
The jollof rice was OK.

I won't go back because the prices were out of proportion to the quality of the food, but I'm not mad at them.

These are the kind of places that need recognition versus the usual affair in NY. Voila Afrique is a restaurant that specializes in home cooked food from the African continent. They are most well know for their Nigerian food.

The inside is cramped with 2 tables (1 has four seats, the other has two seats) but most people take their food home. You get a real feel that everything here is made from scratch. There are two cooks working tirelessly with pots and pans everywhere. There are bags of rice and spices everywhere. It felt refreshing and made me hungry!

The service was fantastic. The cashier explained a few of the menu items that seemed alien to me and she was a genuine delight. I ordered the beef suya ($22.99) and goat pepper soup with plantain fufu ($23.99). The only issue is that because everything is made fresh and there were 4-5 people ahead of me, cooking takes time. I waited around 25 mins. My advice is to order on their website or DoorDash and pickup an hour later.

Now onto the food. This was AMAZING:

- Goat Pepper Soup - the soup itself was meaty, rich and spicy. There was some oil on the top but it added great flavor. The fufu absorbed all of this and was a delight. There were 7 big chunks of goat on the bone and it was so tender. It just fell apart
- Beef Suya - this had thin beef strips cooked in a spicy tomato-based sauce and vegetables (onions and peppers). The beef was cooked perfectly and packed with flavor and spice.

Despite the price tag there is enough for 2-3 people here. You need this food in your life!

My partner has been looking for a place that sells FUFU and we finally found it.
plantain fufu - paired well with the egusi. lots of interesting flavors
pounded yam fufu - paired well with the goat pepper soup. goat is quite tender and the soup is a bit sweet/spicy
banku - tastes like a ball of corn tortilla. paired well with the fried tilapia in tomato stew. tomato stew is slightly sweet. tilapia was slightly dry but still good

Never had west African food before, but definitely loved it and would see myself coming again.

TL;DR: One of the few African restaurants in the city, discounting buy in bulk options. Captivating introduction to African cuisine.

This over the counter restaurants serves Nigerian + Ghanian food in an unassuming manner. It's hard to benchmark the food quality given the dearth of African cuisine in the city, but the food comes close to what my best friend's Nigerian mom cooked for us.

Regardless of the time, be prepared to wait; between the the two times I've been there, we waited at least 30m. This speaks to the demand for their cuisine, especially from delivery apps.

My advice is to pair a starch and meat. The fufu (a bouncy rubbery bread similar to mashed potatoes) is a fun and interesting option. The egusi (classic dish) might be too fish (has crawfish) for some peoples taste, try some of the meat stew. Ultimately, the most representative food of Nigeria + Ghania is jolly rice. Every party/wedding/celebration will have it.

The jollof rice here is a bit dry, but still has a flavorful smoky punch! Not to mention that the portions are huge.

I recommend stopping by!

Got the fufu, jollof rice, and vegan egusi (since my friend doesn't like shrimp) and added beef.

We were a little nervous at first about asking for a vegan egusi with beef, but the workers were super friendly and accommodating with the customizations. We were about to get two balls of fufu but the worker recommended we get a jollof rice instead, and I'm really glad he did! The fufu and jollof portions are huge. Beef was a little on the dry side, but jollof (smoky!) and egusi were flavorful, so 4 stars for food.

The total for those three items came to about $40, which may seem a little steep, but this meal could easily feed  4-6 small people. My friend and I took the leftovers home and a worker graciously handed us plastic bags to carry them in without us having to ask. They also directed us to a sink in the kitchen to wash our hands before eating, which was nice :)

Overall, incredibly filling food and very welcoming service despite this mainly being a takeout spot.

I found this on Uber eats vegan African kitchen and wow I didn't know this restaurant would be sooo good. The Jollof rice and tomato stew was amazing! They were sold out of the pepper spinach soup I wanted but it's ok because we are definitely coming back! It's rare to find a good African spot in nyc this spot is the best hands down

Came here for dinner on a Wednesday night with a fairly large group. There's a few small tables for indoor or outdoor seating, but they're certainly going more for the to go crowd.

Regardless of the time you come definitely be prepared for a wait. Between the time it took for us to order and the food to be prepared we waited about 45m. Understandable given it's made to order, but something to keep in mind.

I had the egusi with goat and thought it tasted great! I initially was going to order the peanut butter soup, but their only size was 24oz and I was looking for something I wouldn't have left overs. The person working the counter recommended the egusi as something similarly rich. It reminded me of a spinach artichoke dip, but if you switched out the cheese for mashed sunflower seeds. The goat was tasty as well, but there were only 4 small pieces.

Removing the time and lack of space, the only ding I have for this spot is the price and small amount of protein in the dish. The entree with fufu came out to $28 for a to go dish. I know inflation has impacted the industry but that still feels like a poor enough value where I can't justify giving them 5 stars.

Overall, I'd highly recommend giving them a try, especially if you haven't ventured much into African cuisine before. However you may want to split dishes within your group to get a better value rather than each of you going for your own meal.

I ordered the beef suya with jollof rice and the goat oxtail soup with fufu. The jollof rice was good but had a slightly scorched taste... I added a little salted Irish  butter to it and that improved it. The beef suya was perfect. I had never had fufu but I enjoyed it. I loved goat soup but wish I would have gotten the stew as it was difficult to eat with the fufu. The menu is very confusing and despite them having a "bowl" with jollof rice as a base and suya as a protein, the cashier wouldn't let me order it. He stated that it was an option although it was there in text on the menu. I believe this was a tactic to get more money from me. My total bill was $65 including a pineapple ginger beer.

I would go back again but I think they should provide clarity on the menu and change it accordingly. (The man in front of me was confused as well so this must be a common occurrence). The food was ready in 10-15 minutes and the portions were HUGE.

Date night! We never tried Nigerian food before had no idea what to order but the staff was so friendly and helpful we got the perfect amount of food and it was AMAZINGLY TASTY 10/10 recommend they even put a new table outside for us to eat at because the others were taken

Voila Afrique has insanely good fufu and egusi. The stew base is creamy, leafy, and strongly shellfishy, with a generous portion of tilapia laying across the top, and the fufu is a gleamingly smooth mound of starch, reminiscent of gluey mashed potatoes. Despite this being an undeniably oily dish, I still felt super healthy after eating it, what with all the greens.

At first I was grumbly about 'why is this $28' but I quickly found out that it can easily feed two people (or 2-3 of me, anyway). I was alone on my business trip, so it ended up being dinner and then lunch the next day.

I made it all the way down to Washington Square Park and onto a bench without the food getting anything less than scorching hot. They package it tightly and securely, which is important when your dish is stew coupled with something that gets soggy when exposed to moisture.

Don't plan to eat inside; there's only room for about 4 people.

The food was amazing. Their portions are very generous and everything is properly seasoned. I tried their jollof with the goat and plantains and it was absolutely delicious. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

I went to Voilà Afrique this past evening with some friends. The food was really tasty! Some things were pretty overpriced for the portion size, however, like the vegan beef. I probably wouldn't get that again for that reason. It tasted good but the portion size was tiny.

I really enjoyed the fried yellow plantains, vegan chickpea tacos, and jollof rice. If I went back, I'd buy more basic items that were vegan and had protein (like rice and beans). The prices fit the portion sizes better in those cases.

The location is tiny. There are 1.5 little tables in the restaurant and a few outside. Be prepared to take your food to go or pray there's no one else sitting inside (call 20 min before you arrive to be sure).

i got their bean rice + collard greens combo. pretty solid, but i wish you had a choice of another sauce/stew for their combo options. although it was a lot of food (mainly a lot of rice), it was on the pricy end for takeout...

Customer service is 5 star. Unfortunately I wish that I can say the same about the food. Apparently the jollof rice that was received had a burnt smell. The halal chicken didn't have any flavor other than tomato paste and chicken. I was very disappointed because I read the reviews of how delicious the food was but it didn't exceed expectations for $45 that I've paid for.

Come One, Come All!!! This place is Amazing! I have never had Peanut Stew or Egusi due to being vegetarian, so I loved the fact that she (Chef Margaret Duncan) has vegan options for all of her dishes.

I returned for a second time because the food is so good. I enjoyed the vegan Egusi and vegan Peanut Stew along with my vegan Jollof so much that I took some back to Harlem with me.

I thank Voila Afrique for making my first experience of eating Peanut Stew and Egusi an enjoyable one. From the chef to the staff, they are a wonderful group of people with great spirit, which is the kind of spirt you want over your food!

- Prescott (Harlem, USA)

Voila Afrique never disappoints. We've spent time in Ghana, and this food is authentic. We ordered the peanut stew, jolly rice, plantain fufu, and plantains. Everything was delicious. The portions are generous, and everything came well wrapped. There's lots of choices, even for vegetarians. We really want to try other things on their huge menu.
Authentic African food, I got the Egusi soup w goat & beef and a side of pounded yam. The service was great and everyone was very welcoming! Only down side is there's limited seating.

Ordered delivery. Immediately.
Get plantains, the tomato peanut stew, the egusi, the fufu, and jollof or coconut rice. It is the most warming, comforting meal of all time.

I've been here three times; once by myself very soon after they opened originally, once with a larger group on a Saturday, and once afterwards. I find the location a bit odd but it was fun seeing this here of all places. The first time I ordered the jollof rice which I have had prior with oxtail as well as the plantains. The rice was very well flavored and while there wasn't a ton of oxtail, it was quite tasty. The rice made it a filling meal and overall it was fine for the price. Sure it's not the prices you'll find in Harlem but this is Midtown East so I'm not exactly sure what you're expecting. I have noticed on their menu that they have added more dishes which I am happy to see. The plantains are not to my preference though this might be personal bias as I prefer sweet plantains over these though I also didn't like the texture much.

The next time, I was here with three others and we sat outside at one of the only setups. Again we got the jollof rice as well as the coconut fried rice, kenkey, beef suya, egusi with greens, shito, and the full fried snapper which used to be only on Saturdays I believe. They also gave us a free container of their peanut butter stew which was nice.

As before, the jollof was good. I found the coconut fried rice to be a bit bland by comparison even with all the ingredients but the texture was nice. The kenkey went with everything and I liked the fermented flavor. My preference was the beef suya which are kebabs cut into small pieces that almost look like sausages with a lot of spices as well as peanut powder. The dish was quite spicy and it packed a ton of flavor and if I was in the area more, I would definitely order again. The egusi with greens was unique. I knew egusi as melon seeds but I wasn't expecting the fish inside. The fish had a strong flavor and a texture almost reminding me of fish jerky and the dish had an interesting texture. I happened to get this one other time to see whether I really liked it and overall I like the fish but not the texture as much and I'm happy to see that the current menu has multiple versions of this dish. The fried whole red snapper was excellent with a perfect fry. No complaints at all. Finally the free peanut butter stew had a nice flavor and it went quite well with the kenkey and especially to help flavor the coconut rice. The shito or black pepper sauce had an interesting texture and it was very well flavored also and not just heat.

Overall outside of the coconut rice and the plantains (and the egusi but it might just be an acquired taste,) everything here was very tasty. It's a pricey place but it is in Midtown East and the food is halal so it's a bit more expensive. The place is overall a nice change from the rest of the places in the area. I'll definitely go back for the suya at least if I'm in the area. My only complaint is maybe that the menu didn't exactly list but was in some of the dishes but it appears that they have fixed this since I went there years ago. I apologize for taking so long to write a review as I just happened to find out that I never wrote one here.

This review is for a delivery order during the pandemic. Me and my boyfriend got the kenkey, jolloff rice, and oxtail stew to share for lunch and it was plenty of food!

It was the first time I had kenkey, but I liked it. It's like a non stuffed tamale with a sour vinegary twist. Soaks up the flavor of the sauces very well! The jollof rice was packed with flavor and is a generous serving. The oxtail stew's sauce was great and had a few big chunks of oxtail.

Delicious and accessible African food in the city.

So happy there's a restaurant serving vegan versions of some of my favorite West African delicacies!

We had the jollof rice, coconut rice (I've never had a rendition from this region), the tomato stew, the peanut stew (same as the Senegalese mafe that I loved when I tried in Dakar), and a collard green stirfry (our least favorite). The hot sauce paired well with everything, and had a lovely tangy flavor, not just pure spice. Of everything the simple yet full-bodied tomato stew was probably our favorite.

Will definitely be a new repeat customer of this gem.

This was my partner and I's first time trying egusi and pounded yam so we weren't sure what to expect but we loved it! We got the egusi with goat, amazing. I can see where some reviews are coming from when they say the goat meat is dry, but if you just mix it up into the egusi, it's fine. The jollof rice was good too! I believe they were all decently priced, we couldn't finish all the food - so it's more than enough. There's only enough seating for 4 people inside, but they do have 2-3 small tables outside as well. In my opinion, it's much more satisfying to eat with your hands at home. We ordered for pickup on GrubHub since other reviews mentioned a long wait time, and our food was ready in ~20 minutes. As I said, we loved it - but take my review with a grain of salt because we've never had these before so we have nothing to compare it to.

This was the besssst food I've had in New York! Everything was so flavorful the portions were a good size and the staff was very friendly and nice. I haven't stopped thinking about it since I went last night. I'm going back as soon as possible. It's a little hole in the wall so there's only two indoor tables for seating. I loved the peanut stew with goat and the fufu was to die for. You could order the dish and eat it for lunch and dinner and breakfast the next day! I'd never tire of it

Delicious! I'm glad to have Ghanaian and Nigerian food near me.

I first read about Voila Afrique on NY Eater.

I ordered fufu, jolof rice, peanut stew, fried plantains, beef with onions, and collard greens in palm oil. Wow. The jolof rice and beef with onions were so flavorful. The peanut stew was mouthwatering and a new experience with the fufu, since I've never had it before. I wish I ordered the spicy option for everything.

I can't wait to try more! Lots of vegan options.

I ordered pickup on Door Dash. My order was packaged well and hot. The portions are BIG. I'd say you could get 1 base and 1 main and share it between 2 people.

Voila Afrique brings a promising looking menu of Caribbean, Latino, and African specialties to the Midtown East neighborhood, which definitely has a dearth of most of the menu items they feature. Their array of dishes tout anything from Halal Goat Meat Stew to Vegan Beef Suya, and their carefully crafted descriptions were enough to entice me to make an order. I was so excited for this meal, especially since it had been a while since I had such easy access to kenkey, ugali, or jollof rice. Considering the prices, Voila Afrique did not deliver on value nor on flavor, and despite their carefully laid descriptions, I had no idea one of their dishes largely consisted of meat, since that was left out of the ingredients listed.

The prices listed on their menu are somewhat deceptive, as most entrees are listed at $12 but all the carby accompaniments like rice or yam that would be remiss to do without each cost an additional $8, which is a hefty price for a side like rice.
