Though the portions for these sides are quite generous, the entrees are not, making this $20 per person meal feel pricier than what they're worth.

I was pretty stoked about ordering the Egusi, a common Nigerian dish named for the melon seeds it's made with. The description lists palm oil, collar, healthy fats and fish in the description, but when I received my order there were huge chunks of what was unmistakably some kind of meat like goat or beef. I don't even know because I don't eat land animals, but the large pieces of bone and meat dominated the dish, which is why I'm pretty shocked they left this out of the description. Perhaps folks who are familiar with this dish would expect there to be meat in this dish, but considering their menu contains plenty of vegan and halal items with careful descriptions, this seems like an oversight.

Of the four things I ordered, the thing I enjoyed the most was the jollof rice, which thankfully came in a large container and was plenty flavorful. I liked the black pepper sauce you can get with your dishes, which had a lot of flavor and really packed a punch. Kenkey on its own is quite sour but otherwise doesn't have much flavor, and since I didn't eat most of my entree I was left with excess kenkey, which wasn't cheap.

Delivery was pretty fast and everything was packaged nicely. I know they also have some tables set up for outdoor dining so if you order at the restaurant just ask a lot of questions lest you end up as disappointed as I was.

This restaurant has a variety of African taste treats. It is a very small area for inside dining two round formica tables seating two a piece. Outside there are 4 more little tables. So the ambiance is nothing you would take a special date to. Your tables inside share space with boxes of  soft drinks and your chair may be blocking cabinets that the staff needs to access.
That said, the food is good and plentiful. Very reasonably priced. I went with-a group. We were 4. Yes, we reserved the two  
Indoor tables. We ordered 4 different dishes to share. Each of us paid $18. No-one left hungry. We had tacos, beef kabobs , goat meet with sauce and a side of special rice. When you order you can determine the level of hot and you select sauces. Our waiter was very helpful.   The drinks are water of soda. These are in a refrigerator for your selection. If you are looking for wine a nice setting don't come to eat in . I would be a nice place for carry out or delivery options.
The location is very convenient, just a few blocks from Grand  Central Station.

Voila Afrique is a great addition to the Midtown East/UN area! Outside of the food trucks, I don't think there are other options for African cuisine in this area, so I was happy to see a place with Nigerian and Ghanaian food open up. They also have vegan options, which I appreciate.

I got the vegan beef suya because I was so intrigued by it, wondering how you would turn that type of meat dish into something plant-based. It turned out to be more of a patty here, but with all the flavoring and spice you would expect from suya. They did not hold back on the heat, so if you have a low spice tolerance, maybe try a different dish, but if not, their spice blend was delicious.

I also tried some of the oxtail, which had tender meat and an incredible sauce, and the egusi in collard greens, which was a generous portion of melon seeds, collards, and fish. Each of the mains was $8.99, and I would try any of those again.

The bases are ordered separately at $6 each for a small container (there is also a petite version), so they can get a little pricey. The jollof rice was tasty, but I preferred the kenkey, because it was more filling and lasted longer to soak up all those delicious sauces and spices.

We ordered takeout in person, but they have lots of online ordering options. Can't wait to try more!

The food is decent:  It's not easy to find African food in the city. However, for the price of 26 dollars for the peanut stew with goat I expected the portion to be larger or should include a small riceZ this is a portion for one person to eat well.
The goat was very tough, and had to pull out the pieces and cut them off where Stewed goat usually is more tender. It tasted like came from a big batch probably from earlier in the day. They clearly
Heat it up from a big batch and send it off so delivery is quick.
I think the price feels more about rental price of the space and less about paying for the quantity and quality of food.
The fufu was good but almost too soft as it usually sticks to my fingers but it was  too much and almost too hard to eat with the hands. Not sure it's worth the 10 Dollar price mark. I would have been happy to pay 26 dollars for the food and the fufu. But 36 plus tax and I feel a bit like it's not worth it.

Thanks to my travels in Africa, I've been obsessed with finding some of the dishes I had there in NYC.

Sadly, the West African community here is nowhere near the size of Chicago, where I used to live. There, I could have peanut stew and melon soup (egusi) all over the city. Here...not so much.

Enter Voila Afrique: conveniently located, deliciously authentic AND plant-friendly. Yessir, they have an entire vegan menu for plant-based folks! The peanut stew is every bit as savory and nutty as I remember, and the organic collard greens stew is the stuff of dreams.

Of course, the dish by which West African restaurants should be judged is the simple jollof rice. I've been fortunate to have eaten the homemade kind from Ghanaian and Nigerian friends, as well as the high end, restaurant kind. Voila Afrique's is one of the better ones I've had (though nothing beats my Ghanaian friend's mom's).

Pro tip: If you love food history as much as I do, eat your meal while watching Netflix's "High on the Hog" series and really experience the soul in soul food.

The only reason for the one star missing was the wait time. We ended up getting the food delivered and nearly cancelled the order as it took over an hour for the delivery to arrive. We weren't far from the location and the possibility of rain made us do delivery rather than go to the restaurant as planned. I am happy we didn't cancel the order but definitely plan ahead with ordering here. The driver had to wait an extra 40 min at the location before he got the food.

Now for the food: we got a side of tomato stew, side of collard greens in Palm oil, pounded fufu, beef stew, and jollof rice. I would happily ear everything again besides the jollof, the spices were a bit too strong and wasn't as enjoyable by itself. You needed a strong flavor to over power it so seems like a waste if time when they have other bases as an option. Everything else was fresh and satisfying, portions were on point. I love the clear vegetarian options on the menu and how delish those were without fake meat substitute. I definitely recommend giving them a try just be prepared to wait. Oh and have a light drink prepared as the food we got after a while felt a bit acidic and salty, too be expected with the choices we got though.

The rating system i am using for this review is the American Grading Scale

pages.collegeboard.org/h…

Shared the link so you can see the conversion

Customer Service
-----------------

C

Very confused when i got in, i ordered through phone for pick up and gave them my name. When i entered the shop took 5 min to be assisted after I asked for help and had awkward eye contact with the staff cooking behind the counter.

Waited 20 min for a side dish of veggie stew, combo , and fries

staff kept making sure i checked my bag to make sure everything is there

Packaging
----------

A

well packaged even put tin foil over the containers in case oil leaks

Sauce
------

D

red sauce was okay

brown sauce is not spicy, on website says scotch bonnet is in the sauce, staff said they don't have scotch bonnet.
Then why lie?

Food Preparation
-----------------

F on all 4 counts

I never ate a place before that doesn't know how to make fried plantains. I had to spit out the plantains. Parts of the plantain were dry and spongy while very random parts of it were oily, and soggy. Overall plantains where terrible my trash was able to finish them.

I did the combo of Jollof Rice and Goat.

Rice was a solid miss. Rice tasted burnt because i know the bottom of the pan of rice that day burnt and they didn't take the rice out in time. I thought Jollof Rice was supposed to have taste, because fried rice from the chinese store down the street had more taste than this.

Goat was not cooked properly. Needed to be cooked for
another 3 hours at least and add seasonings. Even though the two pieces of goat where fat, it felt like i was trying to bite into a piece of jerky that wasn't seasoned. Hard pass on the goat. Also the stew that came with the goat was nonexistent and unnecessary because it didn't add any value to the experience. Plus it was so little stew ( two table spoons worth of tasteless stew), didn't make sense to even add it to the combo.

Fries were terrible, that's all i can say. i ate the fries last so i didn't have any hope left for this dish

A , C , D , F , F , F , F

all weighted at 1 credit

Overall grade
--------------
D

Worth the experience here. My husband and I stopped by on a Saturday for lunch just as they opened. We ordered a lot of food since the prices were so great.
We got the fufu, kenkey, banku, and jollof rice. Our favorite was the fufu and jollof rice. The rice was full of flavor and delicious with everything. The fufu was a great texture and also went well with everything. The kenkey is definitely an acquired taste. It has a sour taste to it but we're glad we tried what it was.
For proteins we got the beef suya, egusi with beef, beef stew, goat stew over coconut rice, and peanut stew. My favorite was the peanut butter stew. It was so rich in flavor and great to dip the fufu in. The goat and beef stew tasted the same. It was just different meats thrown into the standard stew it seems. The egusi itself tasted original and yet delicious. Also went will with the starches we ordered.
Overall, the flavors were so good here for each dish. I subtracted a star because all the beef we ordered was on the tough side. Maybe it's cuz we ordered right as they opened? But it was hard tearing off bites from the big pieces of meat. The beef was more tender the next day when I recooked it in the stove or air fryer.

great quality food, high prices for certain items, i recommend getting the medium size rice dishes to split with others, its more food for only a few more bucks, not a lot of seating, don't recommend for big groups :] beef stew 10/10

The place is good, but the food prep times are a bit long. I know they have a sign that says or used to say that you need to wait 15min or so for food prep - as in it's quite freshly made. That's something to take note of.

However my recent experience was I called in at 7:00pm and was expected to have my food ready for pick up at 7:20pm. I arrived at 7:25pm and my order wasn't started yet or it was forgotten. They probably took 10-12 min to make my two dishes and I left the restaurant at 7:35/7:40pm. It just sucks to wait when the food was supposed to be ready by the time I walk in.

The food is still good and highly recommended

Absolutely astounding. As a vegan, it's so difficult to find really good vegan African food and this DELIVERS. I ordered the plantain fufu, collard greens, and peanut butter stew with jollof. When I tell you it was worth every penny, I mean it! It was 10/10 & worth the 40-minute trip!

THE BREAKDOWN:
Plantain Fufu: Immaculate. So pillowy and soft and perfect with any stew or side dish. Honestly I regret not ordering two servings instead of one!

Organic Collard Greens: I have no idea what they put in these greens but they're the best I've ever had. So so tasty. This was my absolute favorite thing that I ate. It was seasoned perfectly and I'm definitely going to be back for more.

Peanut Butter Stew: Highly recommend with one of the bases! With the fufu, it was great, but with rice it was even better! Thick and rich with a hint of the peanut butter flavor. It's spiced so well, you won't even miss the meat.

Jollof: Super flavorful with a kick! The tomato-y flavor and spices in the rice were incredible and the rice was fluffy as well.

The owner, Margaret, is incredibly kind and so is Tony, who I met as well. Give them your business!  and don't forget to tip your local eateries

I went here because of the reviews I read here but I was more than disappointed. I bought beef stew, goat stew and jollof rice. Both meat weren't tender at all, quite opposite actually. Both of them were really dry and hard to chew, it felt like I was eating leftovers. I won't be coming back here that's for sure.

This place has very tasty food! I got the beef stew and chicken stew with the traditional tomato based sauce. Beware, if you get the spicy version it's quite spicy even if you can't see any pieces of pepper! Rice and beans were tasty and so was the vegan greens with palm oil! Would definitely recommend this place!

Voilà Afrique, a new West African fusion spot located in Midtown East, was already on my radar. I interviewed the owners for Black Restaurant Week and have been excited to try the food ever since.

I ordered one of the $9.99 rice combos: Jollof Rice and oxtail stew with a side of shito (Ghanaian spicy chili sauce). The cashier asked if I would like my oxtails spicy, and me-being the heat fiend I am-answered affirmatively. My food was ready in five minutes.

Overall, the food was good. It was fresh, well-seasoned, and a nice-sized portion. You could taste the fusion in that the Jollof Rice seemed to be seasoned with flavors often found in Jamaican cuisine such as curry and allspice; while the allspice was a little overpowering, the rice was still tasty. I was a bit disappointed that the oxtails weren't falling off the bone tender, and would try out a different meat next time.

First time trying a lot of dishes! The egusi stew was delicious. The pounded yam and ugali were new to me and I didn't even know how to eat them with the stew (I had to look it up after).

The portion sizes were quite large and I had plenty of leftovers. One thing I didn't know was ugali hardens after keeping it in the fridge.

This place is an absolute hidden gem. I've been twice and I'm obsessed with it. You get amazing portions of outstanding food, especially if you like spicy although they have lots of different things to choose. I really love the beef suya which is something I had never had before. The staff is super friendly and it's really easy to order through their website. I can't recommend it enough.
West African here. I ordered the beef suya and plaintains. It was good but a bit overpriced in my opinion. Also service is very slow so factor that in if you order food to go.
World class service! As a South African I can vouch for this place being one of my favorite food spots! The vibes were amazing and I felt right at home. VIVA AFRIKA!

The food was very good and the portions are very generous, but it was more than 1 hour wait. Everybody should be warned - I did not have that much time and I see how preparing the food fresh might take a while but I just expected a mainly to-go food place wouldn't be anything more than a reasonable wait time.
Also, you shouldn't plan on dining there. There are only a few tables and it doesn't seem like they're usually empty. We thought we'd eat there but seeing as there were only 2 tables, had to take the food to go in the end. I was generally disappointed by this and the extremely long wait time.

Amazing food matched with amazing service! Its hard to get good tasting authentic African food especially with exceptional service but Voilà Afrique
never fails! I highly recommend this restaurant.
I had everything on the menu and eat there almost everyday

Entering Voilà Afrique felt like entering a home. The owner is a patient, kind, and caring woman, who is as concerned with your experience as she is with delivering a delicious meal.

We ordered the vegan tacos, fried plantains, jollof rice with oxtail, and egusi, and each dish was delicious.

We went out of our way to pay this restaurant a visit and would gladly make the trek again!
Very yummy food, I tried fufu here for the first time with my family and it was delicious. 10/10 would come here again

I've been coming to this place for awhile now and I have enjoyed their food every time. I ordered my food thanksgiving day at the restaurant and sat down to wait for it to be ready. I witnessed a woman blow and wipe her nose with the tissue and then wiped her nose with her hand then attempted to continue to prepare my food all while I'm sitting there watching. I asked her to wash her hands and she did so kindly and thanked me for being so outspoken. I did respond in a nice way by letting her know that I am a nurse and to see her doing what she did meant I had to say something. This whole ordeal has made me weary ‍ of eating out because you never know what people do in the kitchen. I was just fortunate enough to witness the unsanitary practice. With covid, the flu and God knows what else lurks around....people should have compassion for others. It took me awhile to think about if I should post this review and It's sad that I now have to give a bad review after all the 5 star reviews I have written. It truly bothers me just knowing how inconsiderate and nasty people can be. Yes...I had to say it. I will never return and this definitely teaches me a lesson to cook my own damn food and trust no one!!

Decent pastrami sandwich and that roasted turkey they put on the BLT was AWESOME.

It is kinda rundown inside, but it's really cheap pricewise.  The guy working the tables was good and unintentionally hilarious.

Not sure where the "Viennese" comes from though...

A turkey sandwich with fries and a drink that goes for $7 in midtown.  Not bad.  That being said, they do have some consistency issues (sometimes it's on wheat, sometimes on a roll, sometimes carved turkey, sometimes cold cut) but for the price, it's kind of like being on a gameshow!  You never know when you might hit the jackpot, they sometimes add bacon for free!  

The use Boar's Head meats, so the quality of the ingredients seems to be pretty decent.  The service is a little lacking as nobody seems to speak much English, but pointing and grunting appear to work.  Actually, maybe that's the problem with my consistency issue...hmmm.  

Other than that, it's a nice place to get a sandwich if you are in the midtown area and on a budget.  I personally go there at least once a week since my office is right across the street and haven't gotten sick yet!  I'm a fan!

In hurry? Hungry? Want to eat cheap? This deli is great. They have decent sandwiches and hot foods as well for great price! I recommend the turkey sandwich (cold cut or fresh) with a cup of soup. They even give you free chips as a combo and pickles on the counter individually wrapped for you to take!!!

The roasted chicken is great for hot food platter along with pasta and rice. They even have seating in the back with waiter service if you want to stay and relax!

Our offices recently moved to this location. I have been walking around the neighborhood trying to get familiar with what's around, and found this place yesterday morning. I ordered the American breakfast special (2 eggs, ham, home fries, toast with butter & tea) that only cost me $6. It was a good, hearty breakfast at an amazing price. Service is friendly. I plan on coming back.

I guess I should have walked out when I saw the staff coughing over the cooked chicken that was going to go into my sandwich, but maybe it is because I'm already sick, i stayed, paid and ate it anyway. I ordered a plain chicken, lettuce, and tomato wrap. It was really just plain, but for 6 something including a drink, I don't find the need to complain too much. The restaurant has seating in the back, but it is really dark, which isn't exactly inviting. it is more of a grabbing a quick bite to eat because you have a 1 o clock meeting type of place.

Very possibly the best fresh, roasted turkey sandwich around.  This place is an old-school sandwich shop and it definitely looks it.   I would never have walked in there if I had not heard from a co-worker about "the turkey".  Now several of us get their turkey sandwiches at least a couple of times a week-its flavorful and tender and not expensive.  You can watch them slice it right off the bird.  Plus they give a free bottle of water with the sandwich. I have never tried any other kind of sandwich from this shop and I have no desire to.  Just Turkey!

He charges 8 now, as he gets to know you and what you order it goes down in price which is a plus.  Good food, don't get the salads on the side fridge they aren't fresh, if you want a salad order one!
funny chap mans the tables. food's decent in this grocery-looking joint.
i cannot say enough about this caterer.  i have used them twice going on third time. food is delicious, customer service amazing. cant wait to use them a forth time!

We ordered catering for two events from Village Crown - a Shabbat dinner for 50 and a kiddush for 250. The food was fantastic. Everyone raved about how delicious it was. Ellen was an absolute pleasure to work with - very responsive and helpful. They were very generous with the portions and there were even leftovers (which I'm still enjoying)

Used VillageCrown for my daughter's Bat Mitzvah. Ellie was amazing to deal with during all the planning.  Food was amazing, plentiful and displayed beautifully! Would be the only ones I turn to for future events!

Was looking for a last minuet caterer for an important luncheon for my company and came across Village Crown Catering. They had the best prices & selection for kosher options and the food was amazingly delicious! Everyone loved the Chicken Marsala & Cesar Salad! Would highly recommend them. Great prices, amazing food & very friendly. Cant go wrong!

I attended a conference last week at Cardozo law school and had a great (and creative) wrap that I would not have expected from a traditional board meeting spread.

The wrap had eggplant, roasted red pepper, spinach, a sun-dried tomato spread and a hint of pesto. As a vegetarian, I find it rather difficult to get a meal that suits my dietary needs as well as being interesting to my palate. Usually the only option is a side salad or peanut butter and jelly.

My friend had a turkey wrap with sweet potato and miso. Really inventive and unlikely combination.

There was also a great tofu salad with quinoa. Pretty impressive for a kosher caterer. Usually I am disappointed with the vegetarian options at any social events because they skimp in presentation and thought.

I'm only bummed that I can't order delivery for a small delivery order. They will do a small order for pick-up though.
We had our annual meeting and Village Crown catered our breakfast. Everyone was so impressed by the fresh and delicious choices. Thank you Village Crown for your excellent menu and service!

Don't look any further! Village Crown have been amazing in making our event a success! Maxime was wonderful to work with and helped us create a custom menu that fit our taste and needs (and pockets!). The day of the event everybody loved the food, that was super fresh and delicious, and the great service. We could not be any happier.

A cozy and intimate wine bar, with amazing knowledgable staff.

Food menu is short and sweet, simple but delicious selection of fish, chicken, and beef dishes that the sommelier will happily pair with glasses of wine of your liking.

Finally! A cozy, romantic and authentic french wine bar in the neighborhood! The vibe is sexy and the service is attentive. I always order the french onion soup and the staff makes great recommendations based on what I am looking for. This is one of those places on a quiet street that you happen upon and is a neighborhood secret. A great place to meet up with your besties or a date night with the hubby.

I work in the area, so when I saw that Vin Sur Vingt was opening next to my office, I could not wait for their opening!

This place is promising to be my favorite after work activity. I stopped by yesterday and they for sure exceeded my expectations. Staff of this bistro is so friendly and nice. We were seated right away, the indoor is very spacious and the ambiance is cool. Our server had amazing recommendations that we went with and it exceeded our expectations. The selection of french wine is amazing, the menu is also very good. I just loved everything on the menu. We had the cheeseboard, moules frites and the chocolate lava cake. We also received complimentary drinks and mini cakes from the management. It was really lovely! I truly enjoyed my time there and I will be back a lot.

We like the fact the they didn't change the decor from the previous bistro which is where I and my partner met a long time ago . The food was classic bistro wine bar and the service was friendly and efficient . We'll be back .
Crème Brûlée was disgustingly sour, 1star! However the customer service alone deserves 5 stars!

Just went to this neighborhood spot for the first time and it oozed with charm. Carmine, our waiter, was wonderful. He walked us through the menu and made great recommendations. Highly recommend and make sure you sit in Carmine's section!

Service not attentive. Waiter didn't  ask if we are allergic to anything (gluten). Also, the entrée came late (pork chop) - it was so lean and couldn't be dry : the sauce was too much with the lentil on the side which is saucy too! It's too much to taste that My husband didn't even finish half of it. The dessert - creme brulee was awkwardly tasted bad. It's not french and just very tangy! As a French devour cuisine customer like us- this is a place that we are glad that we at least tried this place. If we will come back here, I guess it will be only for the Flambé and wine. I'd like to say that they have interesting stuff but it's like a sport that they know their goal at but they lack of practice.

After a series of Vin Sur Vingt wine bars around the city, a true French bistro came to the horizon, serving classic French dishes, like escargot (a given), oeuf en meurette (poached egg, mushrooms), and côte de boeuf pour deux (rib eye steak, brussel sprouts, potato gratin). Don't forget to round out a meal with a tarte tartin. An affordable list of wine is available at the bar or table. Not a surprise considered it blossomed from a wine bar family. It's next to Pod 51, so will be popular amongst travellers and hotel guests.

Very nice people running this place. I once needed help with something (wasn't even dining there/wasn't a customer) and they helped me out very generously and graciously. Have since been back and enjoyed it very much. Highly recommend.

I work in the neighborhood and was looking for a place to have a few glasses of wine with dinner at the bar.   I walked past Vin sur Vingt, noting the available seats at the bar, and when I got to 2nd Ave I turned around and went back.  Oh wow, am I glad I did.    

Great bistro menu.  It was hard to pick.  The pate en croute was really good - but what made it even better was the *spectacular* variety of French wines by the glass.  I enjoyed that pate with a Jaboulet Condrieu - and the last time I saw Condrieu by the glass, I was in Lyon.

The entrees all looked good but one - Hachis Parmentier au Canard - stood out.  Duck, Foie, Truffles, and mashed potatoes?  Sign me up.   And OMG was that the right choice.  Again that choice was made even better because they serve Jean-Luc Columbo Cornas *by the glass*.  I was in heaven.

The service was friendly and professional, and the staff was knowledgeable and attentive.   I would - I *will*! - go back here anytime I find an excuse.

Please go there and enjoy it.  I want them to be there for a long time :)
Insanely expensive. Just had a glass of wine there. 22 USD!  It was good but really??

Great place, nice addition to the neighborhood.  We recently had dinner.  Started with half a dozen oysters - wonderful, fresh, nicely shucked and presented.  My wife had the pan fried skate - I had the boeuf bourguignon - nicely presented, generous portions, great flavor - the side of mashed potatoes was spot on and told me we had real professionals in the kitchen.  The service was pleasant, attentive.  Also nice atmosphere.  We will be back for sure!

We live in the neighborhood and had been a regular for years at the predecessor restaurant located at same address, Bateau Ivre. So, we were very excited when the new French bistro finally opened post Covid. We were not disappointed. All the ingredients for a satisfying experience were present. The staff was charming and efficient. The meals we had for dinner were excellent and the atmosphere, similar to prior restaurant, permitted us to believe we were in Paris, but with much less travel issue!!

We decided to try a newer restaurant in our neighborhood, Vin Sur Vingt Wine Bar on 51st Street. We had a fabulous evening and thank the Chef, server and all the staff for the authentic French food and the five star service that we received. We started with a charcuterie board and wine, Beaujolais (white) and Saint Emilion (red) to complement our upcoming meals. The wine was perfectly served, excellent tasting with an unusual higher pouring amount than most NYC restaurants. Our entree were boeuf bourguignon and soupe a l'oignon.  The atmosphere, service, portions and taste were stupendous. At the end of our meal, we were served with complimentary Champagne and dessert. A five star experience and romantic evening with my wife. Our server was Sabri and once again thank you for a wonderful evening. We will be repeat customers

Work breakfast here went really well. Service was top notch, food was good, venue was very classy.

Our server and bus boy were very responsive to requests and when pouring water he spilled ice in a coffee and without prompting immediately grabbed the coffee and replaced it. Very nice.

I got shakshouka. It was quite good with a great tomato base, good sausage throughout to add a little meat to it. Would've been amazing to have added a little hot sauce too now that I think about it.

Would definitely return, very enjoyable experience. Pricey yes, so not a regular spot, but great breakfast.

If you like excess and old world beauty I would come here just for this. Marvel at the gold ceiling and the gawk at the prices. I've never paid so much for shakshuka. And then they only gave me three pieces of toast to eat said shakshuka so I ate half of it. Most of your reviews for this place mention this so this can't be a surprise.

I would come here during the holidays because it is extra magical up in here. I also got to take a free photo with some rockettes because, tis the season. There is a beautifully architected gingerbread house on display in the lobby and richly decorated Christmas trees for your festive fun.

Romantic dating spot. Cocktails are yummy. Highly recommend Through the Mountains.

They were very busy. Reservations are a must or else you can try your luck at the bar.

The good is really good here but organization and service leaves a lot to be desired. Long wait to be sat for breakfast even with reservations. Server was MIA so we asked another server to take care of us and he did a great job. We sat near kitchen and it seemed pure chaos.  Had to argue with server (and chef) what was on the menu (pecan pie w/gelato) and we had to ask for the gelato again. Definitely not the level of service I would expect.

We made a last minute reservation. We were seated very quickly. They brought juice & coffee right away. We got our orders placed. I ordered an omelet (without cheese-allergy) that came out partially cooked, I requested it be cooked further. When it came back, it had cheese in it. Very disappointing. The server never even came back to check on the meals. Overall, food was basic, nothing special at all. We requested our check & it took so long to come get our payment that I went and waited in the hotel lobby while my husband waited for the server. Our check for 4 people was $241. This might be the worst experience for the price. It is a neat space, but there are a lot of neat/nice spaces. I would give it less than a 3 star, but the rest of family's meals were correct. Still very slow service and it was not busy. I just can't understand. Hope others have better luck!

Very pricey, but as expected when you're staying at the Lotte. The basket of pastries was something like $24 for 4 pastries. I ordered the shakshuka and a latte with oat milk. I think for the 2 coffees, 2 entrees, and pastry box, plus tip it came out to over $120. Woah that's pretty steep for a light breakfast! Oh well this wasn't the first time I've eaten here, and it certainly won't be my last.
Have no idea if food is good or if service is good because ignored by front desk person. If your having a bad day, I'm sorry but figure it out. Had a great meal next door at Monterey!!

Go for the room, not for the food or the service. We arrived around 8:30, and were seated in about 10 minutes without a reservation. We were immediately served coffee and juice but things went downhill from there.  It took 10 minutes to get refills on our coffee, in spite of 3 servers moving around the room. A party of 2 that arrived after we did were served before us, and our order did not include any complicated prep (eggs for 2 of us, yog and rolls for the others). My omelet arrived cold and without any evidence of the gruyere listed on the menu. Breakfast was $200. Again, the room is magnificent, but the gilded age setting and prices are sadly undercut by the actual experience. I've always thoughts breakfast is a hard meal to actually do well and sadly, Villard proves my point.

The villard is located inside the palace hotel in Manhattan

Our party was about 10 people for Sunday morning brunch and we thoroughly enjoyed it

The morning starts with fresh pastries brought to the table that we ordered as a way of starting off the brunch along with a few specialty drinks and coffee's

We ordered virtually every item on the brunch menu and everyone raved over the quality and taste of the food

From a price point standpoint this is one of the more expensive brunch spots but we enjoyed both the atmosphere the company and the food and we would go back again

I don't think I've ever eaten in a more stunning hotel restaurant. There is so much detail and elegance in both rooms I was constantly staring around me in awe during breakfast.

The food here is fantastic and will have you full for a busy day. My husband and I tried the American Breakfast, Avocado toast, Lemon pancakes, popovers, and bananas foster beignets. Everything not only looked beautiful in presentation but it tasted top notch. The wait staff were so attentive, classy, and kind. This was also where I got to glimpse Serena Williams during our stay which was a great way to start off our first trip to NYC. If you are staying at this hotel you have to eat here once.

Wow, Villard Restaurant was certainly cool. Villard Restaurant has an overall outstanding vibe and a cool crowd that hangs there. Everything was fresh, flavorsome, and really delicious. The team is super helpful as well. Thanks everyone!

Beautiful decor.  Nice staff.  Limited menu for breakfast but it was still good.  Avocado toast was great!  The thick cut bacon was very different but definitely worth the try.  Felt like I was in the scene of gossip girl.

An upscale place for breakfast and brunch, ideal to start the day with a treat or for an early business meeting. The main room is a neoclassic nineteenth century nicely decorated. The menu, the presentation of the dishes and service are really high end.

Had breakfast at Villard and for $240 for 4 people, I expected much better service. First off, when we arrived at the front door, there were at least 3 doormen out front and none of them bothered to step up and assist us with our luggage or open the door. They stood there hands folded and continued to converse amongst themselves. We sat down in the restaurant and asked for an assortment of coffee and various juices. The juices came at varying times, and when the coffee arrived, one of them was set in front of the wrong guest. We made a comment, to which the server said "give me a second I only have 2 hands". Wow, how rude! The server could have used a tray or made 2 trips if he couldn't hold all the drinks. The food was ok but nothing to brag about. My avocado toast was the least amount of avocado I've ever seen. It's basically a thin avocado spread.
Not sure we would be back for the price point, service, and old school ambiance combination. There are plenty of newer hip breakfast spots with much better and more personalized service!

This cozy, elegant restaurant is on the mezzanine level of the Lotte New York Palace Hotel. Its high ceilings, dark, wood-paneled walls, and tall windows lend themselves to a classic, old NYC dining experience. Actually, had they had a fire burning in that large fireplace, the setting would have been absolutely perfect.

Service was polished, professional, and attentive.

The brunch menu offered several classics, and all three of us opted for the omelet. I felt mine was a bit overdone with far too much "browning" on the outside. It was also quite dry and bland. The gruyere was lovely and beautifully melted. I had a side of sausage links, and they were delicious.

My friends were staying at this hotel, which is why I met them there for brunch; however, given the plethora of brunch options available in the city, I'm not sure I would return.

One of the most delightful breakfast-brunch in NYC - Villard at the Lotte New York Palace. I started to sample a few dishes, and I must say everything I ordered was a decadent delight. The staff is extremely professional ensuring the quality of service meets all your expectations. I must say! Every single dish was unique and vibrant. I ordered the delicious Farro Porridge, it was so delicious and the mixed berries on top really transformed this delicious hearty dish!!! The Lemon Ricotta pancakes are a must!!! And the delicious eggs benefit pizza with a bed of smoked salmon has been one of the best breakfast items I've ever had in my entire life, nevertheless, the avocado toast. This Brunch spot has class and I cannot wait to return!
Hidden Gem!!!

Listen, this is a world-class hotel. Prices are  in line with that of others in NYC. Everything served was of the highest ingredients and meticulously prepared. Service is consistent with similar establishments. But the lovely Art Deco setting makes this a sublime experience.

VILLARD is the place in Midtown for breakfast. End of story!!!

The setting is absolutely incredible. The restaurant is housed in old Brownstone mansion from the 1800s. It is something you expect to see in Europe, not Midtown Manhattan.

Everything on the menu is delicious and changes each season. The pancakes, farro porridge, and popovers are my favorites. They just introduced a fresh pressed juice flight that I cannot wait to try!

If you're in New York and want to have an unforgettable meal, VILLARD is the place to be!

Inside the Lotte Palace. I would make reservations if you plan on eating here. Had brunch on Sunday and it was quite packed. Million dollar bacon tasted like Asian pork belly. The Benedict was good going in but then made me sick to my stomach before the check even came. Asked for medium rare steak and it was eat too rare. Berries and fruit was not sweet. For the price we paid, the food was not that great.

We went for lunch on Sunday. The place was pretty empty. Definitely on the pricier side but the decor and service was pretty good. The service was fast and there's always someone around. a good place for a more upscale meal! The food was average - the most fun part was the decor and ambiance. There's a 15% mandatory service fee at the end, which is not bad for this type of place.

Yelpers: This should be 4 $$$$, not 3 $$$.  Eat here only if money is truly no object. Went for breakfast; food was very good.  But,$9 for a plain cup of coffee; ala cart breakfast options start at $25; steak and eggs $45. Villard is in a very fancy hotel. You're paying for their gold leaf ceilings. If prices like this this don't bother you, then you'll enjoy your meal.

Villard is a very upscale and beautiful place. It's located in  the Palace hotel. It's a large restaurant and feels very grand. I would recommend making a reservation. I had the shrimp and grits and thought they were exceptional. The billionaire's bacon was also awesome and totally worth trying. I would have given them 5 stars but I thought the service was underwhelming and unprofessional. Our server was very hard to track down and a bit awkward to interact with.

Worst possible service ever. Would not recommend to anyone. Cappuccinos took 45 minutes then got to the table cold. Had to ask for napkins. Messed up dish specifications. Eggs were cold too. It was the worst service I have ever had anywhere in the world, and even more so in NYC.
Good food but not the best service. It's a nice place but probably wouldn't go back. Inside the palace hotel with a nice classic ambiance

If you want to pay $50 for $2 worth of food and terrible service, this is your place!

Also, they will add automatic gratuity bc they know the service is so substandard, you wouldn't give them a tip otherwise.

In all honesty, you can get a better breakfast from Starbucks.

Villard breakfast is my new favorite breakfast & brunch spot in NYC! The bacon to share is unbelievable. The Marscapone pancakes are the best I've eaten.  The bourbon barrel syrup was equally as tasty.  The service was excellent too!

Beautiful location and menu - although be aware it's quite expensive so you are paying approx 22-27 for eggs and 10 for a cappuccino. We enjoyed the atmosphere and choices but didn't appreciate the service as much. Our check was dropped on our table unexpectedly halfway through eating our meal instead of asking if we wanted anything else. Didn't appreciate how abrupt that was handled.

Also be aware automatic 15 percent gratuity which was not pointed out and ended up tipping 20 percent on top of this erroneously. Have never seen automatic 15 percent like this anywhere!

Had breakfast for the first time here. I have always admired the building from afar so when I was invited for brunch, I jumped at the chance. The room itself is a work of art. So much history.  Loved the mahogany walls and leather ceilings.  Staff was really attentive. Professional yet friendly. Ordered the lemon mascarpone pancakes. They were delicious!  The brandy syrup really took it over the top. My friends chicken sausage biscuit was a big hit too. Yes, it's more expensive than most but you get what you pay for.  Will be back.

Beautiful space but....My partner and I were having a business meeting here and the acoustics were completely off. The music was SO LOUD we could not hear each other and the people we were meeting with. That's not the worst part. I ask the waiter to if he could turn down the music as it was as loud as a night club and he says that he doesn't control but he will ask his manager. He goes over to the other side and just stands there like a dumb*** and doesn't follow up. He's there talking to another waiter and they're just chatting with each other. Then he realizes that I'm staring at him and he decides to go stand behind the door, but the other waiter is in plain site, still talking to him and looking at him so I know he hasn't gone anywhere. He just ignored me completely. no follow up, no trying. Nothing. Thought we would get better service as this was the New York Palace. But I guess not. Better training for the staff is necessary as we did not feel that the New York Palace had the level of service that it should have.

Horrific service. Amazing food, but not with it to deal with the service. Went for brunch to celebrate a big occasion and the first thing the waiter did was spill drinks over two people in the party. No apology from the manager, not even a visit. Would not go again.

Food good. Beautiful room. Breakfast service is horrendous. Took ten minutes for anyone to greet me and another 5 after composing to get coffee. Not atypical for NYC hotel restaurant, but extremely frustrating, especially when craving caffeine.

Just recently had Sunday morning breakfast at the Villard, located in the Lotte New York Palace hotel.  One word sums up the experience - exquisite! With a nice view over Madison Avenue, it is a truly sumptuous venue, high ceilings, wood paneling, all you would expect from the lavish mansion of a 19th century industrialist. I kept my order simple with the complete American breakfast, getting two soft poached eggs, wheat toast, etc. I was amazed when the plate arrived, as I've never seen poached eggs so delicately and perfectly prepared. My wife ordered the Lemon Marscapone pancakes with bourbon-spiked maple syrup, and told me, literally, that they were "the best pancakes she has ever had". (Trust me, my wife knows her pancakes!) Our waiter was attentive and polite, and the room, while fairly full, was large enough to be relatively quiet - unusual for a New York City restaurant, where often diners sit practically in each other's laps. I highly recommend the Villard for breakfast - I can't see how anyone would be disappointed.

The food is good but not extraordinary. I went with two friends for a special brunch. We arrived on time for our 11:30 reservation but were told the kitchen closes at 11:30 so we must order immediately. Our friend was late and we had known she was going to be.... but we had to order for her... there was no leeway. So I spoke with someone there about our not having been forewarned when we made the reservation. We were offered 3 free mimosas which we turned down, were then given a fruit plate and our coffee was kindly comped. However, beware! There is a 15% service fee included on the tab, which we, sadly, overlooked. So we tipped our waiter 20% over the 15%- giving him a total 35% tip. While this was clearly our oversight, no one made an effort to point this out... and in the end we felt somewhat taken advantage of in a situation where the Server was supposedly trying to make things "right".

We arrived on Easter Sunday without a reservation , the place was great. The staff were very attentive, the food was lovely. The food was freshly cooked to perfection and at a great price. We couldn't recommend this highly enough. Keep up the good work

I only wish I had checked the Yelp reviews before deciding to try this neighborhood spot that lives at the bottom of the Hotel Z (supposedly owned by Jay-Z) While the decor is lovely, the service is just ok, the food lacks sorely in presentation, quality and flavor. I had the Snapper Livornese. The presentation was a non starter. See my photos. Fortunately, I missed lunch today and was ravenous. With my 1st bite I was turned off. The dish was a filleted fish and it had scales!!! I pushed through and ate it. The fish was over cooked and seasoned as if the cook had poured a mixture of capers, olives and tomatoes mixed in Italian salad dressing over it. A messy salad  was thrown beside it on the plate. UGH! Oh! I forgot, we had an appetizer of Fried Calamari that we sent back after two bites. The taste was that of deep fried paper, no exaggeration. The waitress was gracious about it. My hubby had the $30 steak dish. He immediately said upon tasting it that it was sooo not a $30 steak, and that he could have paid half that price anywhere on Vernon Bvld and gotten a very decent steak. It was waaaay over cooked. He had to ASK the waitress to bring him a steak knife, steak sauce and ketchup and the salad which came with the dish. The waitress took her time bringing them. Side note: there was only one other party in the restaurant at the time. SMH! After a while,
the waitress comes over and asks my husband how it was was. He said "I am trying hard to enjoy it." She volunteered that she would give us desserts on the house. This clearly was not her first time at the rodeo. We packed up the remaining steak so we could take home every thing we paid for -- even if we just wanted to give it to the neighbor's dog.  Then we asked for the check. Even though the check was ridiculously high for poor food, the waitress had included a $16.00 tip!  Of course we felt it was quite undeserved. We paid cash and tipped way less, which is very unusual for us but this was a bad experience. As we exited the restaurant, the waitress  has the gall to come over to us to tell us that the bill was missing the total amount requested. I told her that the food did not warrant the tip that she added onto our bill. Mind you, this adding of the tip was not mentioned on the menu at all. She proceeded to say that this is the way they ring things up at this restaurant, and if we did not add the tip that she included to our bill that she would have to cover it. "That's why I gave you the free desserts" she said. Awwww too bad, was my thought. But my Hubby is a softie, even on a stomach of meh service and bad steak. He generously   added the necessary amount to complete a 15% tip for bad food and so- so service in a lovely environment. Next time, I will just eat the napkins. Oh wait, there will not be a next time there for me!

Came here to celebrate my cousins birthday.  It was not a busy night at all and the service was horrible! Food was not delivered to our table on a timely manner.  1 person in our party never received their dish, 1 person order chicken rolattini and is was horrible looked like boiled chicken sent it back!  Everyone who ordered steak had a side of asparagus and they never got it (5 ppl)!  We asked for the manager and never came out. Offered us champagne on the house- NO THANK YOU! Then to say they taking 30% off the bill!!! I would not recommend anyone to come here!!
Weak excuse for Italian food. I'm not impressed at all. Service was ok but could be better. You're in the basement of a hotel.
Way to expensive for to basic food, bad customer care, waiting for hours to be served..

spent my 3rd time on the vista - unbeleivable expereince - 5 stars all the way - frank the manager will greet you and be there with you every step of the way - he carries the place with his personality and service - great views / great service - would not be the same without frank - keep up the good work and we will keep coming back

frank - thank you for all you do

So... I came here for my bday dinner because it looked so cute on google.
First off... they acted like they didn't want to seat us because we didnt have a reservation...mind you we looked on open table app and they had plentyyyy of open space, we can SEE it.
they ended up sitting us at an outdoor table that is not comfortable to eat at but only have drinks as the table was very low. We asked if we can change to an empty table and the waitress WENDY immediately hit us with a short and cold NO. so we had to physically book a reservation although we were already there justttt to get a damn table.
This was such a lackluster meal. The food was typically cold. They brought a salad with lil to no dressing, when I asked for it, she made it seem like it was a hassle to go and get it. The Henny coladas we ordered tasted like the milk from warm cereal. A heavy NO.
Furthermore the customer service was terrible. Very cold. Very short with answers. The waitress WENDY clearly hates her job and she expressed how many ppl don't tip her (I wonder why *sarcastic*) and proceeded to tell us how much she should be tipped and without my consent charged my card for her tip of which she did not deserve.   I won't everrrrrr be back.

Called in haphazardly on Saturday night for a table for 15 and was quickly seated! The staff was extremely accommodating. Although the food may have been a little pricier and not as tasty as we all would have liked, an amazing view and nice rooftop spot in the area.

By far one of the worst bathrooms I've used in a long time. It's a glorified porta potty and smelled of urine. The floor was soaked, the whole thing shakes when the toilet flushes, and there weren't napkins to dry your hands. The lobster roll was good and the main reason there's 3 stars. It's a nice view but be fair warned, the spotted lantern bugs can fly that high and they are menaces. The waitress was very nice and the bartender killed the lantern flies

So me and my girlfriend decided to check this place out since it's in Queens, not really a far drive and most importantly it's a rooftop bar.

We came here around 3PM on a beautiful sunny Saturday afternoon.
As soon as we got out of the rooftop elevator a man who appeared to be the manager pointed us to the entrance then asked if we had reservations which we did not. We asked if we can sit outside to which he kind of hesitated since there was a large party coming in later but said ok.
Mind you the entire place was absolutely empty only 4 other people there besides us.

We ended up sitting inside anyways.

We ordered 2 drinks which took such a long time to come we almost walked out.
Also mind you it was absolutely hot since it's an open rooftop bar and the waiter never even bothered to ask us if we wanted any water.

The drinks finally came and were good so we decided let's get another round then leave. Again the place maybe had 6 people now including us and again it took the waiter soo long to get us those drinks. It seemed like the waiter was more concerned with setting stuff up in the place then actually helping us. We spent maybe an hour there and the waiter on their own without us calling her came just 1 time to check on us.

So 4 drinks came out to be $92!!! These are Manhattan prices!!! Apparently they added a 20% gratuity to the bill which makes me avoid places that do that.

Just based on the overall experience and prices we are definitely not coming back here it's more of a tourist trap then anything else.
The view is not bad but there's other places which are much much better!

Sunset will be a good time to go to this lounge. It is very busy. Service is good, servers are nice. View is amazing. You need to make reservations but there are few people come without one still got in.

$25 will be charged per person if you did not show up. 20% automatically charged as tip.

One issue of this place is that they play birthday songs 100dB loud. We literally measured it with an app because it happens 7 time in 2 hrs. Some people come here for birthday or some say that to get a free cake.

We rented a space here for an event for 20 people, specifically the outdoor portion of the venue. It was spacious with a beautiful view of the Manhattan skyline. The management and staff were very accommodating and hospitable. Unfortunately, I couldn't say the same thing about the food. The quality was extremely poor, and while the price was inexpensive, the value for money was severely a loss.

Ok so I took department here for our holiday dinner party. I'd always wanted to go here so this was the perfect opportunity. Upon entry what you'll find is it's inside a hotel. There is horrible signage that gives you directions to where the place actually is. Getting off the elevator there are 2 entrances; make sure you go to the left.
They give you a drink menu where all of the drinks are $18. But they do have cheaper drinks. I ordered a cosmo which is only $16. So the prices even on Yelp are wrong. I asked for a regular drink menu, and the server Ploy told us they don't have one. How is there no basic drink menu. So they want you buying the more expensive drinks.
Now the drinks were good. Everyone definitely enjoyed them. The food was good as well. I had the lamb chops and rice pilaf. The serving sizes are really good. I also tried the chicken wings, calamari and shrimp. The food was definitely good.
Parking is horrible. I drove around and around, it was a rainy Friday night. So I just parked in the Icon parking garage on 31st St and walked 3 short blocks.

The one thing we didn't like was 2 of my team members wanted something separate and when they got their checks, they were charged the 20% gratuity even though they were apart of the table. But overall my team and I really enjoyed ourselves.

Took my mom here for their annual Mother's Day brunch and it was absolutely beautiful. I loved the table set up in the ballroom, looked stunning. The food was good but the view was even better! The service was okay. At the end, we got to go to the 7th floor to look at the view as a thank you from management. That was extremely cool of them. I would definitely love to come here again and stay at their hotel. I was also told there was a rooftop/restaurant, that I really want to check out.

Nice view. Definitely can see how this place would get packed in better weather. Came on a Saturday night on a whim without reservation for 2 ppl and was able to be seated. I was dressed casually which wasn't an issue. Other people were also dressed casually. Some people were dressed up.

Drinks: drinks are yummy. I tried the  henna colada, skyline and the Sangria. The colada and sky view was delicious and strong. The Sangria was regular nothing special.

Food: calamari came in a little cute basket. They were cooked well. Tasted fine. Not the best I had but it was good. I had the shrimp taco which was delicious. The spicy sweet aioli is good!

Overall view is beautiful, service is good and timely, food is good.

I went to many venues to have my wedding. When I found Vista Sky Lounge I was immediately interested in finding out more information. Mike and Bill were so helpful, they were not pushy at all and they knew what they were doing. They were such a well oiled machine I was beyond impressed. We wanted to bring in an outside caterer for our wedding, it was very important for us to have a plant based menu, and they let us do what we wanted to do and worked with us on pricing and also referred us to a fantastic Florist.  The overall cost was so reasonable and the guests said the venue was gorgeous and one of the best weddings they have ever been to.  The ceremony was on the rooftop and then the cocktail hour was in the same space, they just moved all the furniture around in 5 minutes which was incredible, setup the DJ and caterer space, all while we could take photos with family and friends.  Then the reception was in the ballroom with surrounding stunning Manhattan Skyline views.  I could not have asked for a better team to plan my wedding.  If you are looking for a Stunning space at a reasonable price, call Mike and Bill and Vista Sky Lounge.

The food and customer service here could really use some fixing up. The calamari was decent but everything else we ordered (lamb, mushroom risottos) was lackluster to say the least. I asked for medium well lamb, it was over cooked. None of the food had that glistened fresh food look. I considered ordering the salmon but as we left I saw a waitress bringing it out to one customer and it looked just as dry as my lamb. The staff has no uniform, they all seem to wear what the want. Our waitress had on a white tank top with basketball shorts, another girl had on a white t-shirt with sweat pants. There was no hostess to greet us. We stood and waited for about 5 minutes until the girl in the t-shirt decided to seat us. Also, it's outdoor and NYC is known to get chilly, where are their heated lamps? The customers were freezing. We asked to be moved to one of the interior tables and that at least helped. The location is 10/10, everything else is below standard. Great for taking photos and capturing content of nyc skyline

This was a highlight of our trip, oddly enough we stumbled in here around 11pm with reservations and were immediately sat! We had drinks come out quick, food quick (under 30), and the view was to die for! They close kitchen early on Sunday, and some other days also. So be sure to call ahead to make sure soups on, and if going for drinks walk up in! We WILL FOR SURE be back here. The BEST flash fried wings I have had in a while....

I came here to have a few drinks with my boyfriend. The drinks were actually really good but low in alcohol. I def enjoyed these drinks a lot. We had a strawberry mojito and a mule. Both were delicious. The place is a little small and stuffy. It was really hot in there so I expects it gets hot in the summer. The view was okay, not really a beautiful view compared to other rooftops. Mainly a queens view of Lic.

That's my to go place if I'm looking for a rooftop spot. There's a beautiful view of the Manhattan skyline at night, Food is great. My only complain is the bathroom which is more of a makeshift porta patty

Dinner:
-Vista Signature Burger   $21
Made with caramelized onions (I didn't get onions in mine), Muenster cheese, and paprika aioli. With a side of French fries! I was chowing down on these fries, they were perfectly salted and crunchy but soft. Couldn't get enough of those fries. Onto the burger, the meat was lacking in flavor it definitely could have used some more salt and seasoning on the patty. It was enjoyable but with a little more seasoning it could be a winner.

Drinks:
-Purple Rian   $18
Butterfly vodka, peach schnapps, pineapple juice, and lime. Beautiful presentation, this one is more on the dry and bitter side but I enjoyed it!

-Ocean Blue    $18
Coconut rum, blie curaçao, cream of coconut, and pineapple juice. Super sweet and it basically tasted like juice we loved it!

-Lychee Figtini  $18
Figenza fig vodka, dry vermouth, and lychee. This is THE best drink on the menu. I am such a lychee girl so this hit the spot. Perfectly refreshing and smooth.

-Mykonos  $18
Figenza fig vodka, passion fruit purée, lime, and ginger beer. Presentation was beautiful, but I'm more into sweet drinks so this wasn't my favorite. I did like the notes of passion fruit and the orange slice that was paired with it!

I enjoyed the excellent hospitality, views, and how kind the owner and staff is! Lovely place go for a first date or dinner with friends, check it out

Decent view. The food is bad. Out of 6 people, no one really enjoyed their food. In addition, $18 watered down drinks that are mostly juices and syrups. The bathrooms are horrible. It's a glorified porter potty on the roof. Dirty and not well maintained. To top it off, the service was honestly
Horrible. Our waitress often went missing for 20-30 minutes while we waited for someone to come by the table. Everything took forever to come, would not recommend nor return.

the only good thing about this place is the views , food is too expensive , the music playlist ls all over the place and the service was ok just took a while to get their attention, and how is their a lave cake wit no vanilla ice cream? lol

Nice restaurant and friendly staff. M The food was OK pretty over priced for what it was and they auto add 20% gratuity even just for one person which was a little ridiculous. I do tip well but I had to split my checks because I was there on business. I ended up having to pay $46 for two drinks.

What you pay for is the view. Food is mediocre. We had the salmon, chicken kebab, and lobster mac and cheese.

Skip the Mac and cheese. It's creamy but no flavor and the lobster still had bones in it

The salmon dish was average but best at the table.

Chicken kebab had good flavor but the sides were bland and their tsaziki sauce is sour cream.

If you are going for the views,  I recommend. Otherwise. Not worth the money.
Service was good, food were awesome and the view was amazing. We just hope we went during the night to see the city instead of days but overall A++.
The view was great and so were the cocktails. It is warm when it's hot out as there is no AC and the food was good.

Our server Jane was so amazing she was so attentive and very lovely. Cocktails appetizer and food was delicious price are good as well very reasonable for the place. And the view is worth it every single second you must come and joy this gem of Long Island Island

Since moving back local, we've been hitting rooftop bars in NYC, LIC and Brooklyn.

They are all great (Panorama for the views!!) but this is the only one we would come back to just for the food.

Went on a Sunday afternoon so parking was easy.  And sat at one of the outside tables.

My gal loved the specialty drinks, while I kept with my go to.

Above all this place is about the good.
We started out with the Saganaki and the octopus apps. Saganaki was the best I've tasted. Octopus was fresh and tasteful

For dinner we did splitties as she chose the lamb chops and I went with the mushroom truffle orzotto

Both well prepared.

Next time we'll come back in the evening to really enjoy the views.

A friend and I have a standing annual summer dinner date. Due to Covid restrictions, a rooftop setting made perfect sense. Which brings us to Vista Sky Lounge!

We made reservations via Opentable (strongly suggest as they get a lot of business) for a Friday night. As soon as we arrived we were immediately greeted by several people at the hostess stand (including managers very well dressed in suits *WELL DONE*) then escorted to our table.

Once seated our waitress came over, introduced herself and gave drink suggestions. I prefer cute drinks so I went with the Mai Tai (too sweet for me) followed by a glass of Prosecco (can't go wrong). My friend and I shared calamari as our appetizer (soooo good, crispy and very well seasoned) followed by chicken kebabs as my entree. The kebabs were also very well seasoned & portioned perfectly with a side salad.

Throughout the evening several people stopped by our table ensuring we weren't in need of anything. I have zero complaints and look forward to returning!
I went for a birthday celebration, the only thing is that you could tell the food was not fresh hot and we waited for an hour but everything else is good. The steak & truffle fries is 10/10 for me

It was my first time here and I have to say the night view is spectacular ! The seating was great as well. However, let's talk food which I'm big on. The food was blah I initially ordered a lobster roll with fries and the amount of dressing on that lobster roll was not good overpowered by the taste of cilantro smh... my boyfriend ordered wings and fries his was ok. I changed my plate to steak tacos and although that was a bit better they just don't make the cut for food, I also had a Henny colada the best drink. So overall food I would rate a 1 star, drinks views and vibes a 4. Also the food took a long time to come so be prepared to wait if you hungry. I won't return but it was a beautiful view. A birthday celebration for me so I'm thankful.

Beautiful terrace overlooking the city. Great music, great atmosphere, and the food was surprisingly good as well. Ordered the lobster roll and fries, and they did not disappoint! Service was great as well, very attentive.

I don't mind paying for good food but a smile and personality is appreciated, especially when a 20% gratuity is added!!!
Food: 3/5 | Service: 1/5 | Atmosphere: 4/5

I definitely had high hopes for this place but it definitely was a fail. I wanted to try this restaurant because the photos online looks for beautiful. We were greeted at the door and sat down immediately. We wanted to sit outside because it was such a beautiful night. We was told to wait 20 mins and we we're definitely okay with that. We ordered drinks that took about 25 minutes to come and then was moved by the friendly manager. Our server wasn't so friendly. She bypassed our table over and over our food took over a hour to come out. We were done with our appetizers at least 30 minutes before the food came out. I was not pleased with the salmon it had a very fishy and old taste also, the vegetables were very soggy. When I wasn't eating my food instead of her, asked me what was wrong she took away my plate and threw it away never ask me if I needed another drink the whole night. I felt so out of place like I wasn't welcomed at all. She even brought the wrong check over to our table. And didn't even apologize for bringing us the wrong bill. I'm only giving this place 3 stars because of how nice the manager was and the ambience. Don't come here if you are hungry you will be greatly disappointed

Due to the current pandemic, wifey wanted to try a rooftop restaurant for her birthday. So I did my research and read some good reviews about Vista Sky Lounge. Street parking was a bit of an issue. We read somewhere that the valet parking is only for private events. Well, we made sure we got there on time for our evening reservation. They do have a 20 minute grace period by the way. So if you are running late...you should give them a call to let them know. I had spoken to Regina (when I thought we would be late) and she was so helpful!

Once we got to the penthouse, the view of the city was AMAZING. Our reservation was for 7:30 pm and there was still light outside. We were waiting for it to get darker to truly take in the spectacular view.
Our table was ready and waiting for us. So there was no standing around waiting for an available seat. The host was polite and greeted us with a nice smile. The music was upbeat and a little loud (but not overwhelming) since there were three birthday parties going on at the same time. These parties had their own sections.

Now for the food and drinks. As for the appetizers...we had the lobster mac and cheese was was DELICIOUS. The calamari with marinara sauce was just ok. We should have asked for tartar sauce.
As for the entree...I had the Prime Tagliata NY Strip Steak with truffle fries. I had ordered the steak medium well and it was perfect. I have to get used to the truffle fries. It was just ok for me. Wifey got the Wild Scottish Salmon with the rice pilaf. She had LOVED the salmon, but did not like the rice pilaf. She felt that it didn't taste that fresh. She would not order the rice pilaf again. Next time she will ask them to switch it for something else.

Now the drinks..my wife made fun of me since her drink was stronger than my tropical fruity drink. The more and more I had tasted her drink..the more upset I got with myself lol. Hey..I love the color blue. So I chose the Ocean Blue drink that had coconut rum, blue curacao, cream of coconut & pineapple juice   (and can't forget the pineapple). Don't get me wrong..it was very tasty....but it's more suitable to drink this when you're laid out at the beach. Now wifey's drink was the strong Skyline that had whiskey, amaretto di Saronno, pineapple and oj (and can't forget the cherry).

A festive place like this...we would come back and basically order a bunch of appetizers, some drinks and take in the beautiful view. We WILL be back with some friends!!

Threw a surprise 30th birthday here at Vista sky lounge for my sister and we were all amazed to how perfect the venue was! She loved it! Stunning city skyline view day/night, great quality food, attentive staff. George (food and beverage manager) assisted with the planning of this event and was very responsive and helpful throughout, even with the small details. Aside from accommodating  customized pre-fix menus and birthday cake sparklers for the birthday girl, he even accommodated a 360 video booth, right outside next to our room (was so much fun). We were happy with the turnout and highly recommend George and Vista Sky Lounge for your next event, or even a date night! Thank you again!
Kinda expensive. Steak's too salty. Margarita's too sweet. Paying the view. Meh meh meh.
Great place to chill with family or friends. Drinks were very good and well as the appetizers. I ordered the chicken wrap. Loved it!  Will definitely be back

Honestly way too overhyped in my opinion. I got the burger and the lobster roll, burger was so plain and felt like it had no taste. Lobster roll was ok. The drink I got (ocean blue) was really good. My lava cake took over 45 mins to come out lol. The background to take photos was nice but the seating was terrible because in all of my photos there are old men in my pictures. I feel like they should have a corner with the view where no one sits so people can take photos. Plus they add the gratuity to your bill. Anyway not that great wouldn't recommend.

I don't even know where to start. Let's start with maybe the most important food. There was none....
*We were there on September 11,2021 at 8:20 pm

We ordered at around 8:45 it was nearly ten our food had never arrived. So I guess we will never know if their food was worth the wait.

Now the service:

We had a reservation for 8:15 pm. They did not sit us until 8:20 pm. When we sat down the table was dirty, they sat us next to an air conditioner a breezy night, the music was SUPER LOUD, and they sat us by a speaker...We asked the waitress if there was something else we could wait for she said "This is all I got!" And put her hands up in the air.

We also asked the manager if he  can turn the music down since this is a restaurant not a club. The manager said he would try and never did..


While we were sitting no one greeted us. The manager tossed the menu on the table and kept it it moving.
The waitress came to take our order about 25 minutes in and she asked "What do you want?" No greeting , no apology for the wait just "What do you want?" When we told her what we wanted we waited 30 minutes for our drinks...and our food just never came.

When we asked about our food we were told that the cooks got into a "fight" in the kitchen and that's why the food is taking so long. Apparently one of the cooks left after the dispute.

The bathroom was FIFLTY...there are no words that can describe the bathroom. Paper towels piled up in the garbage. The toilet looked pure brown, as if it had not been cleaned for a month.

Finally, after not being able to bare the nonsense music longer (and wondering if there was a hidden camera somewhere). We finally asked to leave, we asked not to pay for the drinks, so at least the one drink we each had was free. However, it was a very unpleasant experience.

This hotel came up as a high rating. I was impressed upon entry. Cozy room, decent size. I had the Manhattan view and was highly satisfied. The rooftop restaurant & bar is amazing. Outdoor dining is perfect for the spring and summer time. The view of the city is GORGEOUS! I love their drinks, the cocktails are to perfection. I would definitely come back to stay!

All the times I've been here have been with groups, for drinks and snacks, and excellent evenings. The staff gives exceptional service. The drinks and food are on the expensive side, but not shocking for the area & setting.

Diners with food allergies have limited options as far as the snack & bar-food menu--someone who avoids both gluten and dairy can only get a salad or a plate of fries. I've heard the mozzarella sticks are great. The drinks are always good; it's mostly a cocktail-type place with limited beer & wine.

The height makes for a nice view, especially if you're out on the deck in the summer. If you go in cold weather, make a reservation to ensue indoor seating. The plastic "igloos" are a fun gimmick and lend some privacy to the deck, but they're not heated unless the staff drags in a little space heater on an extension cord (which may or may not work).
Went to celebrate for 2 birthdays, The Waiter was Advised oky recieved 1 Birthday Dessert. We tried to talk to Manager who Gave Us An Attitude! NEVER AGAIN Its Not Worth It
Sadly when I was here, I forgot my phone at home so I didn't get any pictures. It's okay all the more reason to come back and visit

The views are great and everyone is very kind, however the service was lacking very much. It seemed like there weren't many people working for the amount of guests present.

We ordered a drink and it would take 30 minutes of arrive. For a full rooftop, with only 2 servers to cover all the patrons, that makes you as a business look bad and people more reluctant to return.

A little later on we decided to order some French fries to just munch on while we're there, this is about 2 rounds of drinks in already. Our waiter said it would be about 40 minutes or so for the fries. My mouth dropped  to the floor, let's just say we didn't get any fries haha.

I appreciate them being open and allowing us to be there, but if you can't handle full capacity then please don't allow so many people to be up there all at once.
What can you say the views are fabulous. You take all that in while you feast on great food and drink. It's my spot to unwind relax and enjoy.

I went here for dinner on Friday and ordered the Prime Tagliata NY Strip Steak and it was misleading because there was no Peppercorn Brandy cream sauce on the steak (which was listed on the menu).

We asked the waitress if the dish should come with sauce, but she pretended not to understand what we were asking and offered me salt and pepper instead. I'm very disappointed.

Also, we spent over $400 and our waitress would only accept two credit cards for payment, but we had a party of four and wanted to split the payment four ways.  I would've thought that this wouldn't be so complicated, but I guess not.

The best thing about this place is the view.

Came here for a bridal shower on a Saturday afternoon  good food, wonderful atmosphere the 11th floor had nice views of the city . The bartender was very attentive. The place and bathrooms were clean which usually is a mess with 80 plus women . Will come again for dinner. Would love to check the rooftop out on a warm night.

Such a cute date spot. Definitely try making a reservation before coming (aim for sunset/golden hour for the best experience). I ordered the lobster mac and cheese and was not disappointed! Will come here again for the food and vibe :)

The place is beautiful, with one of the best views of the skyline. The drinks are well done, I loved the variety of craft cocktails, my favorite was the Rosa Margarita with watermelon flavors and infusion. Food was ok, it could be hotter, the octopus was delicious, and the seafood pasta was a really good portion. This place is amazing for birthdays, meetings, and dates.
The food was good. Nice portion sizes. The service was average. Views of Manhattan stole the show!!

Great drinks and great view but horrible service. Service is everything for a great experience right?! I made a reservation to sit outside at 9:00 and you have to put down a card and everything($20 charge if you are 15 mins late to your reservation) so I figured they would strict about their reservation. NOT THE CASE. I am actually still currently waiting for my table an hour as and 15 mins later!!!! Sheesh guess I'm not eating hear tonight

The wait time for a food was very long and the food was not good
The drinks were just ok

A friend found a staple in his food

I stay at the hotel that the bar is on top of a lot, so I come to this rooftop frequently. By far the most reasonably priced rooftop bar I've been to near the city, and the views are absolutely spectacular! The food, drinks, and service impress me every time too. Very prompt staff and a good choice of food and drinks. I always recommend this bar and restaurant to everyone I know who lives in the city or is even there for a visit!
