Food came quickly, but I wish I had read the reviews first. The $17 "carnitas" burrito had a few pieces of bland pork in it and the bulk of the burrito was rice and beans. It tasted like someone who is just learning how to cook made it. The nachos and guac was just a tiny container of chips with a dollop of mediocre guac sitting on top. The salsa they gave me tasted like it came right out of a jar. In a city full of Mexicans, this place is pretty embarrassing. The prices should be half of what they're charging.

Between my group this is the 4th time we've received utter crap from this place. Amazingly enough, the order arrived within 20 mins of being placed and was ice cold. We're the idiots. You don't have to be.

If I could give 0 stars I would. The food tastes like they went to a grocery store, bought the cheapest, lowest quality ingredients and decided to try to make Mexican food. The nachos are literally stale chips with canned movie theater style nacho "cheese" spread around. For 1$ I could understand but they charge 9. The quesadilla is flavorless and disgusting. Do your self a favor and go literally anywhere else.

This place is SO SO bad from a quality perspective so it's extremely annoying that they have like 6 differently named restaurants on each of Seamless and GrubHub, but they're all the same 25-02 address - this place is so bad they need to TRICK you into ordering from them!! STAY AWAY

Pros:
- ambiance is so pretty and so many beautiful little touches that add to the visual experience
- nicely created menu with wide variety
-very professional and welcoming staff. Waitress and host both
-asked for less sugar martini and they made it perfectly
-beautiful tasty cocktails. Such thought in the old fashioned. Flavored ice cube and mini clothespin to hold the lemon garnish. So creative !
-beautifully plated food
.
Cons:
-long wait but that only means they're popular so it's barely a con
- a bit disappointed in the soufflé pancakes but I'll admit I'm ignorant and maybe they are just supposed to be that light and fluffy.
.
Would I return? YES for cocktails and karage!

Nestled in the heart of LIC near Court Sq, close to subway both stations, Court Sq. And Queensboro bridge, this French Asian theme restaurant is a gem.

Their barista was excellent, creating varieties of speciality espresso based drinks as well as others. They serve soufflé pancake all day, and ramen, salmon ikura bowl, as well as various other delightful dishes.

I tried the Salmon+ ikura bowl with Sea Urchin add. It was delicious. Also tried matcha latte. Matcha was very good quality, great flavor and no adding sweetener non-sense. Simply matcha with oat milk. They serve with "oatly" if that matters to you.

I'll be coming again, I'd like to try, their other menu items. And ambiance is relaxing an chic, with slow French music playing in the background.

One of the real highlights of LIC. With all the new restaurants opening including the Japanese pancake place across the street, you never know where the best places are. Well look no further than Vert Frais, like Izakaya Mu (gone now), it is a true Japanese highlight. I went for dinner and I can't wait to come back for brunch of breakfast for those pancakes.

For starters, they are a cafe and restaurant and they are known for these floral drinks and lattes. Note that if you are here for dinner they stop doing lattes after lunch. The only drinks you can get after hours are alcoholic drinks, tea, or the hot chocolate.

For dinner, I had the hot chocolate, my gf got the salt ramen, and I got the Omu Rice. Everything was excellent.

1. Hot chocolate - rich and flavorful. This hot chocolate was excellent for an american style hot chocolate. If you are looking for the thicker european hot chocolate, this isnt it.

2. Salt Ramen - flavorful and delicious, the broth was rich and full of depth. The noodles were bouncy and not too soft or too undercooked. One of the best choices of ramen in the LIC area.

3. Omu Rice - This was really the highlight for me and it was rich and flavorful. The fried rice was flavorful and had large pieces of meat that balanced against the soft and fluffy eggs that were cooked perfectly. The sauce on top was perfect, it was thick but not congealed and had enough brightness to cut through the eggs and fried rice. This was one of the BEST Omu Rice dishes I have had in NYC. Note that this dish is extremely heavy and while it seems not that big, it fills you up.

The ambiance in this restaurant is beautiful and the service was excellent as well.

Delicately made fluffy yummy shuffle.  Very tasty.

This,restaurant was open in June 2023 - a few months ago but looking like 10 years old.   Floor is a bit older and doesn't like brand new but it is cozy and not bad.

We were there at 6:30pm or so but hot beverages were not available except tea.  We wanted green tea latte or latte or something warm along with this dessert but we were told there is no person to prepare to warm up milk after the person in charge is gone at 4pm.

We paid $45 for this 2 plates including tip.  
It is tasty but expensive and you finish to eat in a few min as it is very very fluffy.

Heard of this place from eater.com, so we had to go check it out. The place was nicely decorated and well set up. The service was great except for at the end when it was hard finding someone to get the check and a refill on the water.

For the food, we got appetizers such as the chicken karage (it has bones inside but still pretty good) and the fries. The fries weren't anything special, but the chicken was very tasty. For my entree, I ordered the ramen with pork broth and pork. It wasn't anything out of the ordinary. It was overpriced for a simple ramen dish. If anything, another order of wings would've been better than the entree dish.

Decent Japanese + French cuisine - the interior design is absolutely gorgeous

It was still relatively packed even though we went on a rainy sat. Suggest making resy if you can

We loved the drinks and souffle pancakes! Those are must try here

Hamburg steak 4/5: very juicy hamburg meat

Omurice 3.5/5: egg was very fluffy and we enjoyed the Demi glaze sauce cuz the rice inside had a Spanish twist to it which didn't seem

KARAGE 4/5: was disappointed that it wasn't truly a karage because KARAGE is typically fried chicken without the bone but still tasted good

Matcha rose latte 4.5/5: loved the latt

Lavender latte 4.5/5

Something blue latte 3/5 - sweeter end of the spectrum like marshmallows

Like most brunch spots on a Sunday in NYC, Vert Frais was extremely busy when we arrived. A member of my party made a phone reservation days before, but despite our efforts they lost our information and had us wait about 45 minutes. Not the end of the world, but the staff was not very apologetic for their error. They called us to come back, but had us wait another 15 minutes at the front of the restaurant like sardines. When we finally sat down, they set up the speaker right next to our table. Not ideal!

All of that aside, I got what I came for - the matcha soufflé pancakes. I worry about matcha overpowering the dishes it's added in, but this was a really lovely addition. I tried the crème brûlée soufflé pancakes and was not quite as impressed. It
tasted like a sweet heavy cream sauce, which isn't terrible, but I was still glad I went with the matcha. My iced cappuccino was really yummy, though it was a bit small for the price.

Others at my table took the savory route with an omurice and ramen. Both were tasty, but I prefer a sweet breakfast. Some questionable ramen reviews had me worried, but I still think you should go for it
if you have a craving! The menu is a bit limited, but for me that's a plus.

The spot itself is very pretty. The bathroom was lovely, albeit a bit dark. It looks like a huge space because the ceilings are so high, but the actual floor space is a bit small - explaining the wait times. I'd definitely come back!

Our meal started out a bit rough, but by the end of it, we were very happy. We had called a day before to make a reservation, and the staff took our phone number, our name, and confirmed all the details. When we got there the next day, our reservation did not exist and the lady was giving us some attitude about it, making it sound like it was our fault that we didn't have a reservation. We ended up just writing our name down and walked around before getting called to our table. Once they called us, we returned to the restaurant but didn't get seated for another 20 min. They definitely need to work out the kinks in their operations because none of this ran smoothly.

The food was really excellent though, so we ended up having a good time. The table got matcha soufflé pancakes, shio ramen, and the rice omelette. All the food came out super fast, including the pancakes!

Matcha soufflé pancakes: Cream sauce was delirious, pancakes were super light and fluffy!

Shio ramen: Broth was so good, very light, the pork was perfection. My favorite dish of the table.

Rice omelette: Egg was super fluffy, great texture, thought the sauce was a little sweet for my taste, but overall yummy

Drinks: The lattes and coffees were superb. The rose matcha was sooo good, the rose was so floral yet not overpowering

Overall, the actual dining experience could've been better, but the food knocked it out of the park. Will definitely be back for the ramen!

Vert Frais in Long Island City (LIC), Queens, NYC is honestly the best restaurant I've eaten at in a long time!

We ordered the rice omelet off the main course menu and the chicken karaage off the appetizer menu. Both dishes were incredibly delicious and generous portion sizes as well. The sauce on the rice omelet only added to the already delicious omelet with rice in it and was beautifully presented. The chicken karaage was lovely because it wasn't too salty like other places I've eaten it at, but had the right kick of pepper. It wasn't overly fried either, which created the perfect balance of the fried skin and a lot of juicy meat on the inside, and not just skin and bones.

The interior of the restaurant had white walls, wooden accents, succulent plants and plant artwork designs, and an overall beautiful aesthetic and design. The staff was super friendly as well.

Overall, both the food and overall dining experience was a 10/10. I'll definitely be back here soon!

We got the matcha latte, rose matcha latte and the matcha pancakes to share.

Vibes are very nice even classy inside. The drinks were honestly just alright. I got the matcha latte and it wasn't very strong matcha, mostly milk flavor. My friends rose matcha was at first very strong rose taste then not much of either taste.

The best thing was the matcha fluffy pancakes. The matcha sauce was great the pancakes fluffy though almost eggy like a sponge cake. After a bit of finishing our food, the waiter gave us the check. Maybe it was cause 4 people ordered one pancake and a drink each...but regardless.

Alright not coming back unless I'm in the area.

Came here expecting a lot more, but left pretty disappointed. It's at a very convenient location, close to a lot of the apartments in Court Sq area. It's very well decorated so the ambiance is very cute, but it was a bit smaller than expected.

The menu is pretty limited and I felt that all the dishes we got could have been better and were all overpriced. The Sho-yu ramen was so salty and I left half of it unfinished. There weren't that many toppings either so it was hard to eat just broth and noodles most of the time. The drinks I would say are better, so I would suggest coming here for their "cafe" instead of for an actual meal.

Very well done ambiance and atmosphere. Interior decor brings lots of bright natural light into the restaurant. Spacious with high ceilings and chic modern furniture.
Food is also great. Their ramen soup base is simply divine! Lavender lattes and drinks were also pretty amazing. Service was good, I did feel a bit rushed post meal and while I understand they are quite busy, it always irks me when servers start taking away plates before we've even finished the food.
(I would dock half a star just for that, wait staff did do it politely by saying they have a lot of people waiting but as someone who likes to enjoy their brunch with friends, I wish they didn't rush us).

One of my favorite restaurants in LIC! Authentic japanese food and great ambiance. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and the service is excellent.

I've been here several times to try the different items on their menu and my must orders are the hamburg steak, soufflé pancakes, karaage, and shio ramen. The ramen comes from a michelin starred chef / recipe!

Underwhelming, but will give a second chance. I came here to try their vegan ramen, however they weren't serving it . Minus the ramen, the vegan option are extremely limited and overpriced... I ended up getting the beet salad, which was exactly what it sounds like. A bunch of lettuce with cubed beets and some salt for $13. My friend order the rice omelette which looked 10x better than what I had. Will definitely need to go back here to try the ramen and give the restaurant a fair review.

Although the salad was underwhelming, I was pleased with their matcha latte. The presentation was beautiful and the matcha was strong yet sweet. And the variety of drinks was plenty. The restaurant itself is also very comfortable and beautifully decorated. Would love to go back to try their drinks and other lattes.

Along with great drinks, the staff are very attentive and polite. We arrived right at the open and we're seated immediately, however we did try to get a table a few weeks ago and had a horrible experience. The lady who manages the seating is definitely spreading her responsibility too thin. When I arrived and put my name down she said the wait would be 30 mins (and it took me 10 mins to even get my name on the waitlist cause the lady was so busy calling guest and guiding guest to their tables). 30 mins into waiting she said it would be 30-45mins more. We waited about an hour before giving up and just eating at another place nearby. They definitely have an issue with turning tables over.

Hopefully 3 times will be the charm?

The damage: $62 (plus tip and tax) for 2 lattes, one beet salad, and one rice omelette. A bit over priced imo.

The food was beautiful and tasty!
I got the Matcha Soufflé Pancake and it was so soft and just the perfect amount of sweet. I also got the Rose Matcha Latte (hot) and the rose flavor was the strongest out of all the rose matcha lattes I've had! Please take a moment to appreciate the latte art.
My partner got the Rice Omelet and the egg was very fluffy and is definitely the best omurice I have had in NYC. He also ordered the Twilight Fizz (espresso, orange juice, tonic water) to drink and we weren't really a fan of it. We could taste the three ingredients very distinctly. He said it was interesting and not bad, but would not order it again.
They have a variety of drinks so I would definitely come back just to try the other drinks on the bar and cafe menu!

I've come back several times since I enjoy the atmosphere and the distinct menu compared to the other options in the neighborhood. We espeically enjoy the Omurice (Egg Omelette) and Hamburg Steak, though the Ramen is a good option as well.

I don't give 5 stars because I've noticed that the staffing is sometimes inconsistent, and there was one time I went with a friend of mine that was vegetarian and the only vegetarian dish (the vegan ramen) was unavailable, so it was very limiting for my guest. The reservation system on their website seemed to be out of order as well, so we had to call to make the reservation.

We still enjoy the spot though, and the drinks are very visually beautiful, and there are more that I would like to try.

WHAT A TREAT! My boyfriend chose Vert Frais for our Sunday breakfast date as we had never tried soufflé pancakes before. We arrived shortly after it opened and I am happy we did as the restaurant got busy very quickly after. The decor was beautiful and all the seating had a lovely view - including the bar. The service was very quick and the pancakes didn't take too long to come out - perfect amount of time to finish up my Earl Grey Tea.

Onto the pancakes. Seeing as I've never had soufflé pancakes, I don't have any others to compare them to but they were everything I expected and more. The creme brûlée pancakes were to die for!!! I caught myself craving them all week. The matcha ones were an 8/10 - coming from someone who dislikes matcha.

Overall, this is a cute spot to check out if you're looking for something sweet! I didn't get a chance to try out the drinks but everything coming out of the bar looked spectacularly presented!

I went to Vert Frais the other day with one person. We went on a weekday in the late afternoon for lunch, so there was no line -- when I've walked by on the weekends, there is almost always a wait.

The restaurant is cute, bright and light. Service was prompt.

I tried the following dishes:

Chicken Karaage (4/5): The chicken was really good, but it was on the oily side. It was a nice dish to share, as the portion was pretty large.

Creme Brulee Souffle Pancake (4/5): Very good, but heavy for sure. The pancakes were rich and creamy.

Vert Frais Vegan Ramen (4.5/5): I really enjoyed this ramen. It is in a soy milk and potato broth, which made it taste really creamy despite being vegan. There was a good amount of noodles and fixings, including cabbage and carrot. I would eat this again.

French Fries (3.5/5): Covered in Parmesan cheese. The fries were skinny and well-cooked, and the portion was huge. Decent, standard type fries.

Overall, I had a good experience at Vert Frais and would go back!

Lively atmosphere and good vibes. LIC needed a place like this.

The awesome:

Karage are actually chicken wings, which made it great.

Green salad is refreshing.

Omarice was very good. Bacon bits inside the rice were key. Gravy was a tad on the bbq side but no issues with it.

Soufflé pancakes were damn good. One of the best I had.

The not so great:

The Bloody Mary didn't taste very good. That's about it.

Otherwise, this place is great.

The omurice is delicious! I'm glad there is finally a decent option in queens even though it's a little expensive. The crème brûlée soufflé was also good: very eggy, but wasn't so keen on the orange zest in the crème sauce tbh. The lavender latte is deeply lavender scented but next time I would prefer to try their fruity drinks. I heard the hamburg steak was very good but it was 28! The omelette is just so so. Ambience was very lovely and it's a popular spot for catching up over tea and desserts.

This spot has some of the best soufflé pancakes in the area!! I got the matcha soufflé pancake. It was very soft, pillowy, and warm - absolutely perfect! and the matcha cream was delicious. I also got the matcha latte over ice, which was refreshing and not too sweet - just how I like it.

Inside was very clean, well decorated, and elegant. This would be a great date spot!! Bathroom was clean as well. I did have to wait around 30 minutes to be seated, so be prepared for a wait depending on the time and day. I would definitely come back again to try their other pancakes!

One word: stunning. If you want to brunch in a beautiful spot while in LIC, look no further. Vert Frais feels like you've been transported to a cafe in France. Dig a bit deeper and you will find an amazing menu filled with things such as crème brûlée pancakes and an Omurice dish.

On a hunt to find a good Japanese soufflé pancake and this spot came up. A reservation is recommended because even in a very rainy day this spot with jumping. We were called on our mobile when a table opened. Service was a bit wonky...not bad just inconsistent. We were also in a slight rush which might have confused the staff.

The crème brûlée pancakes were delish. The sauce that was drizzled on top was delightful with a bit of orange. The pancake itself was good, only slightly scrambled eggy. The omelette that covered such delicious fried rice had the most decadent Demi glacé. It was delicious and hearty.

I would totally come back to try more items on this menu. Looking forward to seeing Vert Frais stick around.

I couldn't get a reservation, so I came right at opening. The decor is beautiful. You can really tell the attention to detail was really thought out. The space had high ceilings and lots of natural light. The restaurant filled up very quickly after I arrived. There didn't seem to be a large number of staff in front of the house, but the server was still quick and efficient enough to get everyone's orders and refill water.

Although the menu is small, there is still a great selection. I saw that there is a vegan ramen on the menu. I wasn't in the mood for ramen, so I asked if the omelette rice could be made vegetarian. The server confirmed it could be made without the bacon. The dish was very fulfilling. The demi-glace sauce was not too ketchupy like some I've had before.

Definitely come here if you can make a reservation! If not, come right at opening like I did.

TLDR: Vert Frais is a new Japanese cafe in the LIC area. Very nice decor but def on the pricier side and felt the flavors did not have quite the punch I was expecting. The signature drink was decent enough that I'd come back for maybe cocktails and to try something else

Popped in randomly for brunch. The interior is very nice but definitely on the pricier side.

The Twilight Fizz was interesting. A non-alcoholic concoction of espresso, orange juice, tonic. It was refreshing, coffee-ish and fruity all at the same time. As weird as it looked, I actually enjoyed this quite a bit.

Omelette rice. The creamy soft-scrambled egg you'd expect that is in fashion now but not cut table side which was a bit of a shame. The demi-glace sauce was flavorful but a bit too sweet. The fried rice under had some bacon and mushrooms but again - the sauce was overpowering for me that I couldn't taste the individual flavor of the rice. Just the texture of the grains. Neither the bacon or mushrooms had much char on it so it just kind of got lost in the egg mush covered in sauce.

Ramen. This place does say "Ramen Bar" so I did need to try it. I understand that a shio ramen is mostly salt for seasoning and so it is not going to be quite as rich as a tonkotsu broth. It was clean tasting, the bamboo shoots were cooked well as was the chasiu. At right under $20, I felt like there are much better options for ramen out there at this price point. If you don't like rich broths though, you may enjoy this. It is definitely on the lighter side.

Creme Brulee Souffle Pancake. Not quite as fluffy as I was hoping for. A bit more eggy and dense, something reminiscent of a sponge cake maybe. The sauce was fine but not particularly interesting.

Chicken Karaage. This was probably the tastiest thing here but then again - it is skin-on fried wings. So unlike the boneless chicken chunks you'd be expecting, think elevated Chinese takeout wings. I don't mean that as a diss, that' s just the flavor that comes to mind. Imagine the your favorite takeout spot's wings but they just put a bit more TLC in it and tossed it in spice and fried garlic.

All in all - I had very high expectations for this place. The things I expected the most from fell short and were very expensive. My random signature drink and the chicken were my favorites and ironically the cheapest things we ordered.

The drink alone was good enough that I'd visit again but order all different things.

The atmosphere and service are amazing. The place feels like an upscale fancy luxury restaurant. The chicken karage was the most amazing karage ever. The flavor was just amazing. The parm fries were good, but it felt like it wasn't anything spectacular. We ordered 2 ramen, the classic shio, and sho yu. The food here feels super healthy and clean. Broth was very smooth and on thinner side. Im more of a thick broth type of person but it was good. It doesn't look like much food, but you will leave decently fuller than you expect.

Food (4/5):
- I got the rice omelette. My friend got the omelette with some addons
- I thought it was creamy and tasty. The demi glacé was more sweet than savory, which I personally enjoyed. Overall, I thought it was a solid rice omelette, but quite pricey
- Friend also thought her omelette was solid. I do think it was a bit pricey though

Service (4/5):
- It took them over 20 min to get our order and over 20 min to get our check
- However, to be fair, I do think they were a bit understaffed and it was quite crowded. Whenever I interacted with them, they were friendly
- So overall, slow service but friendly servers

Ambiance (5/5):
- Very cute and aesthetic
- Great for chilling with friends
- Make sure to get a reservation. My friend and I did walk in and we had to wait 45 min

My friends and I came here for brunch on a Saturday and were so impressed! The wait was about 30 minutes for a 4 person walk in/we ended up sitting at the bar which was very cute too. The aesthetic of the place was absolutely beautiful. I got an Iced Lavendar Latte with Oat Milk and the Rice Omelet. Both were delicious and the bacon in the omelet gave great flavor. It was also very filling. We also shared the Creme Brulee Souffle Pancake. The texture was so soft and fluffy!

Newly opened in LIC, Vert Frais has a very clean aesthetic that very much suits the IG vibes food bloggers often gravitate towards.

We walked in on a Thursday night and were quickly seated. The menu itself is quite small for dinner, just 2 entrees and the rest more focused on breakfast. Between 2, the rice omelette and Classic ramen was just about enough. Both items are what you would expect, very hearty.

Would like to come back and try their brunch menu though!

I ordered 2 pancakes as an appetizer to share. One pancake came out on time and the other one came out after entrees. Wtf? I reminded the waiter twice, prior to the entrees. I asked again regarding a missing pancake order during entree and asked if the waiter forgot our order, and the waiter simply said no.

In addition, all the dishes came out at a weird time. The rice dish came out first, then after 10 minutes, the ramen dishes came out. I ended up eating my rice dish cold.

I will give them two stars because their drinks are beautiful and delicious. Food was ok- it wasn't anything special. The ramen is smokier than a lot of places, but is a solid Japanese ramen. If this was a cafe, not a restaurant with waiters, i would have gladly given them a 4-5 stars. But, this is a sit down restaurants with waiters!!! Service matters to me, and timing of the dishes matters to me. I will never come back for a meal.

The space of Vert Frais was much smaller than I expected, but looked great. We came on a late Saturday  afternoon and got seated right away.. the place was smaller than I thought but a very nice space. We got the crème brûlée pancakes, karaage, classic ship ramen, and the vegan ramen. I was actually so surprised by how much I enjoyed my meal. Ramen is usually just okay, hard to find places that wow me, but the vegan was such a pleasant surprise. The broth was creamy and rich. Such a good option for vegans and vegetarians! The karaage was actually fried chicken pieces and a pretty decent portion. The soufflé pancakes were soft and better than some others I've had in the city. It also had a citrus flavor to it which I wasn't expecting but didn't mind. Food came out in a decent time, and we both genuinely enjoyed our meal here. Definitely worth trying!

The ambiance of the restaurant was super cute, from the name of the restaurant I honestly wasn't sure what cuisine it was gonna be hahaha. But it was a nice surprise. We got the rice omelette and the hamburger steak. This was the first time I had an rice omelette and I really liked it! It had a hint of bbq taste and the rice was  super fluffy and singular. The hamburger steak was very surprisingly for me because I did not like meatloaf growing up. I throughly enjoyed it, enjoyed it more than the rice!!! It was very moist but the flavors were strong.

The drinks were also SUPER GOOD!! I prefer my drinks to have no alcohol taste hehe and strawberry fields legit felt like I was drinking lemonade with a heat kick as an after taste.

Exceptional service, decor, and ambiance. Eight friends and I came and ordered the entire menu and everything was delicious. My favorite dishes were the ramen and the egg sandwich (not on the menu, by request and availability only).

I have known Sobi for years and where he really shines is ramen: there was a shio and a vegan option, but I would love to see him introduce a shoyu - his masterpiece.

He has another few dishes in his arsenal that are extraordinary: his pork don comes to mind.

The drinks were a bit of a positive surprise for a restaurant like this but it definitely hit the spot.

We will be back. It was so good. Highly recommend.

Service was great. The restaurant is clean with a warm and inviting vibe.

I popped in for an afternoon snack on a rainy day, I ordered the Matcha Soufflé Pancakes which was quite yummy. The matcha taste wasn't too strong and the pancakes were puffy and fluffy. What a nice little treat .

My friend and I ordered the same thing on the menu, shio ramen. I honestly think the soup was very oily, I myself have worked at a ramen shop and honestly I drank more of the oil then being able to give a good taste on the soup. Tasted like chicken soup. It's a cute spot looks super cute inside, but maybe i'll give this spot another try. For breakfast, was really looking more forward to try the matcha soufflé pancake, staff was very friendly though. The beet salad season was delicious.

Just stopped by for a drink and thought it was fantastic!

This spot gives a chic, tea parlor vibe. Can't help but admire the amount of work and thought out into all the decorations, even more so expressed by their drinks. Lucky enough that it wasn't crowded when I went as the place is small with limited seating

The Sun kissed was delicious!!! I was so excited by the presentation. It's orange juice and seltzer topped with this bubble that feels like a kiss as you drink it. So exciting!

Also this location is very new- I recommend stopping by before it gets harder to!

Came here on a weeknight with a couple friends. The interior aesthetic is super nice and ig worthy. We got the shoyu ramen and omurice. The food itself isn't bad, there's not too much flavor in both dishes which can be good or bad depending on your taste. The portions are also relatively small for the price so something to keep in mind. The service was great and our waiter was super nice.

Convenient and cute spot in LIC! I came for dinner and got the Rice Omelet, which is a demi-glace omurice. Great texture on the egg (SO FLUFFY!) and the sauce was tasty (although a bit BBQish??) but the rice and egg could have used some more flavor. It would have been pretty bland without the sauce in my opinion. My friend got the Classic Shio ramen and really like it- the broth was really savory and light! The affogato was pretty standard but great if you love a strong espresso. This spot is so convenient if you live in LIC but I don't think its worth coming to if you live in other boroughs. I'll definitely be coming back to try the souffle pancakes!

Vert Frais is chic and elegant. The food is light but flavorful, and the lattes are beautiful and sweet but not too sweet (depending on what you get). I've  tried the omurice, matcha souffle pancakes, ramen, and I'd like to try the hamburg steak. I've been here twice now, once for brunch and another time for dinner, and I can confidently say the food is solid. The only thing keeping me from giving Vert Frais a 5 is the fact that service, while generally polite and accommodating, is sort of slow no matter what time of day you come. I'd recommend having at least one more server to help alleviate any waiting. My husband's drink took forever to arrive and by the time it did, I had already finished my food. I'll be visiting again and look forward to seeing how Vert Frais continues to evolve and (hopefully!) succeed.

The Japanese soufflé pancakes alone earn this place five stars. They are a unique and delicate experience worth seeking out. It is like having a small fluffy cloud on your plate. Each bite sits lightly on your tongue and almost dissolves. If you are turned off by textures, perhaps this may not be for you. It is definitely more feel first and taste second, if that makes sense.

They do not take reservations for brunch and it is a small space, so you will most likely have to wait. There were two of us and we waited 35 minutes. Conveniently, Softbite is right across the street so we could grab some pre-brunch appetizers and mimosas to tide us over. We arrived around 12 on a Sunday.

We got a little bit of everything including the ramen, but this place was my destination after I saw a reel on their pancakes. To be fair, I had never had a soufflé pancake before. So perhaps someone knows of even better ones! By all means, point me in that direction too if this is the case. Everything was so good and made for the perfect start to our NYC weekend. A strong recommendation if you are looking for something different!

Such a cute brunch spot! Came on a Saturday afternoon and didn't have to wait as a walk-in, but I did hear some people calling in to reserve a spot. The rose matcha latte was so beautiful, tastes ok. Prices are decent also. The matcha souffle pancake was sooo yummy and definitely one of the best in the city, although it is a rather small portion. The omelette rice was sooo good and also the best omurice I've had so far. Ramen was just ok - would skip that.

Hands down one of the best omurice in town! At least this was one of the best that I ever had. The omelette was so soft and creamy and instantly melted in my mouth. The fried rice was flavorful and fluffy, with the aroma from bacon and mushroom. The demi glace sauce was a little bit too sweet, too BBQ-y for my taste. And yes the omurice was not cut open. But I was not bothered at all because the creamy melting omelette has won my heart.

We also got the chicken karaage, which was bone-in chicken wings -- different from other restaurants but it was fried perfectly and the crispy garlic and chili pepper added a lot of flavor to it.

Shio ramen was good but not impressive.

Cocktails were meh. Would rather go to dutch kills after the meal.

Overall, I am very happy that LIC now has such a great place for Japanese comfort food. Highly recommend!

5 stars for service!
Our waiter gave us so much information about the menu and different dishes, which made picking smooth. Food was OK !
Beautiful interior and super nice service! Drinks are very pretty and taste nice. Omelette rice was good, but would have loved for the dish to be a little warmer when served.

We came on a Sunday at 2:25pm. We waited about 30 minutes for a table of 2. We ordered 3 things and of all we enjoyed the fried rice egg omelette the most.

The karage, which I expected to be boneless as it is traditionally, was surprisingly moist and flavorful. The soufflé pancakes had a melt in your mouth texture without being too sweet. The rice egg omelette was wonderful balance of salty, sweet, and tart with a mild tomato flavor in the rice.

Service was ok, I noticed the table of 4 next to us were served their dishes at drastically different times.
It's a fairly new spot. I recommend checking it out if you're looking to try a new restaurant in the LIC area. Seating is fairly limited so show up before you're starving like we did.

Overall, 4/5 stars, not sure I'd go out of my way to visit this restaurant again.

3.5 for food
Beautiful space and food is tasty but they are not kid friendly - no high chairs! We started with the Karaage which almost every table got. It was okay. The bones were brittle but the crunch on the skin was nice. It's missing the traditional accompaniment of potato salad or pickles. The beet salad was beautiful and tasty. Love the orange segments. I got the Hamburg steak which came with fries and rice or bread. The gravy was rich and savory and the beef patty was moist. Perfect with the rice. The fries needed a dash of salt but had a nice crunch. I was confused by the large untrimmed watercress. Wish they had cut in to smaller pieces so that it was a salad and add some dressing? It looked to be a big garnish. My husband enjoyed the ramen. The dessert took 1/2 an hour to come out and the portion is very small but the rich lava cake was quite good. Overall I would come back for drinks and maybe the soufflé pancake but wasn't too Impressed with the rest of the items.

This place has adorable cocktails! I got the earl grey one and it came in a teacup. I would recommend the omelette and hamburg steak. We originally saw this place on Instagram and came for the suffle pancackes, but they only serve that for brunch. Overall, the interior was beautiful and the food was great.

Ramen for brunch? It's more likely than you think, particularly if you're at Vert Frais in Long Island City. This Japanese restaurant and cocktail purveyor sports a menu containing breakfasty dishes (rice omelette, matcha souffle pancakes) and savory fare (shio ramen, shoyu ramen, hamburg steak). The drinks include light refreshing tonics (the Vert Frais) and powerhouse liquormobiles (the Tiki Negroni).

The reservation page on their website wasn't loading, so I set out to arrive close to the 11 AM opening. I arrived at 11:30 and waited a full hour for my party of two to get a table. This place is having a moment, so be prepared to wait, unless you're a celebrity influencer or you somehow figured out how to place a reservation.

Service was slow to start but once we ordered our food and drinks they arrived quickly. The rice omelette was hearty and delicious, a classic yōshoku staple, elevated by the careful touch of the talented kitchen team. The shoyu ramen was also delicious: that broth! Wow! I picture a happy smiling piggy up in heaven giving me a thumbs up as I eat this dish. Ganbare, Piggu-chan!

Full of food, we settled up and headed out into the heat and humidity of New York in the summer of 2023. The atmosphere was pleasant and the bathroom was super clean (smelled good too).

Came with a party of 5, we had placed ourselves on the waitlist and our table was ready 2 separate times before our whole party arrived. The host was nice enough to accommodate us even though we technically lose our spot if we don't reply in time. I highly recommend the karaage and the soufflé pancakes. The karaage came as wings and drum sticks covered in a very tasty dry seasoning. We got the creme brûlée soufflé, which was moist and I liked the hint of lemon zest in the sauce. The ramen was decent, very light and clean taste. If you were looking for a more heavy savory broth I would pass on it. The chasu was too fat for my liking. My friends all loved the Hamburg steak. Seems like there is a less of a wait around 3/4pm.
So good! Loved both pancake options. They served coffee in a tiny little tea cup and it was so cute. Would definitely return

Highlights - Ka-arage (fried chicken), Hamburg steak, Shio Ramen. All were good and delicious.

Silk old fashion and rose martini was superb. Super aromatic, floral, and spirit forward.

Okay - Omu-rice - sauce was on the blander side. But the runny egg texture was top notch.

Cute vibes and set-up. Beautiful restaurant. Love how warm and comfortable the space felt

Very cute little spot near the ferry in Dumbo! I don't normally hang out in Brooklyn, so I'm trying to find new cute spots around the areas I explore. We walked into this ice cream shop because we were both craving a good scoop. We were pleasantly surprised to see all the different variety. There were some vegan scoops and gluten-free scoops labeled and they gave free samples as well. Ice cream scoops we got were pretty good my only true complaint is that it's so expensive! Seven dollars for one scoop is pretty pricy, but gottta remember it's Dumbo, so it's gonna be.

Overall, it was good, and if I feel like a big bowling on ice cream again, I would come back.

Van Leeuwen has always been my favorite ice cream chain! The flavors are unique and the ice cream itself is super creamy -- this location was no exception. Right on the Dumbo waterfront, this Van Leeuwen has such a cute pink interior and the staff were super helpful.

We ended up here because the line at the Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory was ridiculously long, but I think this place is actually the better choice between the two. Definitely recommend eating your ice cream on the benches right along the water for amazing views of the city!

Creamy, delicious ice cream. There is a reason why they have long lines.

Unlike some ice cream stands that either discontinued sampling or only allow a select few, this one allows unlimited samples and you are handsomely rewarded with a great result.

They also offer vegan ice cream. But it all tastes so good so you will have a hard time picking a bad one.

Enjoy cautiously.

The first time I had Van Leeuwen Ice Cream was from their Ice Cream truck in NYC. I noticed there was an affogato, espresso poured over ice cream. Talk about heaven? Van Leeuwen Ice Cream, I think heaven is you!  We've been to this location and I thought I wrote a review but here's my latest review for 2023.

Walking in the store late Saturday afternoon, we're faced with a line. To me, not big deal. The smell of fresh waffles while waiting is intoxicating. Looking at the menu choices, chocolate fudge honeycomb was calling me, is it vegan? As we move through the line, a gentleman behind the counter says: if you don't want a taste, please move to the front of the line.

Now we slide by and I say, Xcuse me suckas as we head to the front of the line.   My wife placed her order but told me to order something she likes so she can have a taste, yes dear.

I ordered a waffle cone with my base of chocolate fudge and my favorite, Cookies & Cream on top.

We walk outside, man that is some righteous ice cream!

I love the unique flavors and the fresh tasting ice cream. I'm a total fan of Van Leeuwen Ice Cream.
Yummy ice cream. My husband had a chocolate milkshake and I had the cookies and cream small cup, one scoop. Both were equally good. I would go back and try other flavors.

It's hard to mess up ice cream, so there's not much negative to say! The flavors are amazing and it's always good to have dairy free options. It's all the pleasure without the pain! It's a cute tiny shop with quick service at least for the day and time that I went.

I do not recommend going to this Van Leeuwen's location. It used to be an Ample Hill ice cream store with interesting flavors and now the Van Leeuwen's chain has taken over. There were 5 staff members the day we went and most of them were standing around not scooping ice cream and when they did were very slow and took their time. The line took 1.5 hours to get through. There were no signs outside with a menu of flavors or pricing. From the time we entered the doorway to the time we received our ice cream it took 45 minutes. One of the employees was just standing next to a cash register not helping anyone.

Ice cream costs $6.50 for a single scoop. The Marion Berry Cheesecake does not taste like anything. The peanut butter honeycomb brownie is delicious.

There are plenty of places to get ice cream, avoid this tourist trap. If i could give less than one star I would.

Service is suuuuuuuuper slow. We did a 45 minutes hours line, once it was our turn, service was really gentle and patient with us. Ice cream taste was reallyyy good. I had the cookies and cream with chocolate fudge in a cup.

Worth the price!!

The scallion pancake isn't your traditional pancake. It is a thicker crust, almost pizza dough like. However, it is amazing! It was crispy and the sesame enhanced the flavor. The pan fried dumplings were fried to crunchiness. The filling had a overwhelming chive flavor, but still great with the chili oil. The dan dan noodles were thick and chewy. These are my favorite type of noodles, almost udon like (maybe it was udon noodles). This was such an unexpectedly great meal!

The service was fast. You order at the cashier and then there's open seating. They call your number out when your food is ready. It is a great fast, casual, and affordable place, would definitely recommend!

Contrary to the name, I would recommend their steamed buns and soup noodles. Very affordable for the area, generous portion sizes, good flavor, and low-key enough of a joint to stop-by whenever you don't feel like cooking. The outdoor seating is limited but it feels great whenever you can snag a seat.

I'm not a personal fan of dumplings. My friends thought they were just okay! Make sure to ask for sauce at the front counter if you do order.

Will go back whenever I'm in the area!

The fried dumplings were just okay. So maybe they were a 3...but if you have the word "dumpling" in your name, you need to get it right. Decor is simple, no service bc it's pickup...so basically it is just about the food.

I love Vanessa's Dumplings. I usually go to the Chinatown one but when I'm in the area, I come up to the UWS branch. Of the times I've come here, I have ordered on the phone or on food apps but it seems to take longer than quoted to receive the food. Despite the longer wait, this is still one of my favorite places to come for food. Their boiled spicy wontons w/ chicken + shrimp is the best out there. I love bringing their sesame pancake sandwiches, especially the beef one, for lunch. They reheat easily and are filling. Vanessa's is reliable and definitely my favorite comfort food!

I love Vanessa's Dumpling. I gave some to my sis the last time I visited the Village location and she recently asked me when I was going back. I just so happened to be heading to the city today for an event and decided to be nice and pick up some dumps for her and her boo.

As always, I made my order through the Yelp app and everything was pretty much ready by the time I got there. The guys working the counter were nice. They followed my order instructions and marked all the containers. This was important because my sister's bf is vegetarian but she eats meat and I did not want any confusion with their order.

I also ordered some stuff for myself but on a separate transaction and they also marked my containers which was very nice. Chicken & Basil pan fried dumps, Shrimp & Chicken pan fried spicy wonton, and spicy Beef pan fried dumps, are always a goto for us. I also picked up some of their sour and spicy cukes and kimchi.

For some reason, despite how ridiculously pack they get, I prefer the Village loc but it's nice to be able to grab these little meat purses when I'm uptown. This shop was empty when I arrived.

My sis got the same dumps as I, along with the Spinach & Mushroom wontons, Dan Dan Mein with spicy beef and a couple of wonton soups. She took a couple to chow on, for the ride.

Definitely splurge on the chili oil. It's only 75 cents. You also get more bang for your buck if you order the frozen dumps and cook them yourself.

Vanessa's dumpling house is a decent but not great option if you're in the area. Their dumplings are hefty and almost like soup dumplings with how juicy they were. The dough was a little thicker than I like my dumplings and it was pricey compared to places in Chinatown. I also got the dan dan mien with spicy beef sauce- it sucked. There was barely any beef sauce and what little there was was so hard and flavorless- it was just spicy. The noodles were overall SO DRY. I know this place has dumpling in the name, but if an item is on your menu, it should taste good. I would only stop by and just for the dumplings if I were desperate and in the area.

This place can be hit or miss. The dumplings are usually on point (regardless of filling choice). Other dishes though are usually a little off.

Only things I would really recommend worth a try if it's your first time, the chicken/shrimp dumplings and the scallion pancake sandwich.

A hidden gem in the UWS. With an abundance of affordable, tasty, delicious options - you'll not be disappointed! For a basic 8 pc order of vegetable dumplings, you'll spend less than $8... for homemade Dan Dan Mien Noodle, you'll spend less than $9... and the list goes on...

The inside is not great for eating with just several tables and compact quarters, but the food is delicious! Perfect for take-out. They offer bags of frozen dumplings for sale, too, for $25 each (with about 26 pieces). The staff work hard and do their best to make you happy. The place closes from 3-4pm daily for break hours so just be aware.

If I lived closer, I would be grabbing food here at least once-twice weekly. There are plenty of vegetarian options and enough food to easily make you feel content once you've completed the meal.

Only subtracting a star because I prefer the Chinatown location more and I believe this location may charge a little more but based on the location, it makes sense! They also accept cards which is a plus! The Beef Dan Dan were so so fresh. The Sesame Pancake with Pork was also great!
Awesome addition to the Upper West Side. 3.5 round up to 4 cause the dumplings came in the clutch and the service was awesome. Food was executed well and there was plenty of seating. Recommend.

I don't really like dumplings much, but this was the best dumplings i've ever had in my life. So f- bomb!! It's a really small shop and it was a little hard to find with google maps. I ordered the vegetables pan fried dumplings, but made it spicy! I kid you not that was so filling and tasy! And with some soy sauce!!! Chef's Kiss  ‍‍! quick service as well! And it's affordable!! Like come on now

You know I had a lot of expectations for this place, because the location downtown is delicious, and it really was disappointing. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't that great. We got the veggie dumplings, veggie bun, and the peanut noodles. Honestly just nothing was that flavorful, the bread portion of the bun wasn't very good. The dumplings just tasted like pan fried stuff, and the dipping sauce wasn't like anything special either. But it's so confusing cause the other location is so good!! Just not really sure why this one isn't as fabulous.
Even the interior just felt more fast foody, gave off more of those vibes that like bomb quick bites. There's a subtle difference and idk this just wasn't it.
But everyone that worked there was very nice!

Cozy small joint with plenty variety of dumplings . Options to dine in, not very much space for hanging around, it's more like in and out. Take out or even buy them frozen to take it home, which I believe is very convenient.

They're big portions, flavorful and delicious. It's more like an appetizer for those with a big appetite.

Loved the dumplings! I had to order the assortment to get a taste for the different types. The website says the assortment comes with vegetable, shrimp, pork and shrimp. Not sure if that's what I got though. The shrimp was my favorite. I ordered the duck sesame pancake. Easily a meal on its own. I enjoyed just as much as the dumplings. The only thing that unfortunately wasn't a fav was the red bean steamed bun. It was a sizable bun but too much bun compared to filling.
I noticed that a lot of the negative reviews pertain to their staff. Luckily I had a very limited interaction with the women taking orders because they did not seem like good role models for customer service.
One last thing - the prices on their website are not 100%
accurate. Some prices in store were 50-60 cents more.

3.5 / 5.0 - We were excited to have another dumpling spot open up in the area, but were unfortunately quite disappointed.

We ordered:
- Chive and Pork Fried Dumplings x2 ($5.88+ each)
- Sesame & Peanut Noodle ($7.88+)
- Dan Dan Mien ($8.88+)

Apparently, they were backed up and we waited 20 min for our food--no updates, no apologies. Once we got home, we saw that the dumplings were hot, but the noodles were not.
The dumplings were good, but the dumpling wrapper was too thick for my taste.
The noodles lacked flavor and were all lumped together, so I'm guessing they were just sitting there waiting for the dumplings to be made.

I'd heard good things about the one downtown, so hoping the quality improves at this location, too.

I ordered the boiled Assorted Dumplings which included two dumplings of each the Pork and Chive, Chicken and Basil, Vegetable, and Shrimp. The pork and chicken were my favorite. They were very savory and flavorful. Although the vegetable dumplings weren't bad, I don't think I'd order a full order of just vegetable dumplings as they tasted pretty plain.

Not food related, but I do wish they'd use more earth-friendly packaging. We got our orders to go, and our food was packed in a plastic bag with a soy sauce packet, Sriracha packet, and plastic fork wrapped in a plastic film. We were in a hurry, so I didn't realize they packed a bunch of extras until I left, but I would've requested no extras had I known that they by default packed them for all their to-go orders.

Stumbled upon this place while looking for some grub in between bar crawling and this hit the spot! I just wanted something quick so I went with the pan fried veggie dumplings but looking forward to stopping by again to try to the sesame pancake sandwiches. Their dipping sauce was SO GOOD! They should sell them or give up the recipe! Would highly recommend.

Pretty solid and pretty affordable food. Got there a few minutes after they opened and quickly ordered. Decided to try a few things since it was my first time and I was sharing my with my partner. One order of spicy dumplings, one order of fried dumplings and a sesame veggie sandwich. We ended up with leftovers. I liked all three dishes, wish there was more veggies in the sandwich tho. Sadly the food took a long while to come out, about 20 minutes. Seems slow for the otherwise fast-food vibe of this place.

Food is all right, wait is ridiculous.

I grabbed food here a couple do times - dumplings, noodles and the bun. The food is all right, nothing to write home about, but the wait is ridiculous. I went when there was no one there and the wait was over 20 minutes!

Was super excited to see a Vanessa's Dumpling House on the Upper Westside! Used to go to the original Chinatown location when I was in school and it is one of my favorite go-to comfort foods (so a little more than super excited lol).

Of course got #1 Pork & Chives pan fried dumplings and they were exactly as they should be and as I remembered it. As stated in other reviews, price has gone up so much (previously $1 for 4-5 dumplings) now that it's gotten so popular outside of the asian  community.

Also, got the Peking duck sesame pancake and it was savory and delicious as well. Very filling (currently taking a break so decided to write this review before I continue eating).

And last but not least I got a regular hot Milk Tea and wow. Milk Tea perfection. I know this is not what they are known for but this is the taste of milk tea I'm always look for, so perfect. There's a lot of milk tea/bubble tea places out there but the taste does not always hit the spot like this.

I had vegetarian dan dan noodles, vegetable pan fried dumplings, vegetable steamed bun, and plain sesame pancake sandwich. Everything was delicious - I especially enjoyed the dumplings for their crispy texture and the dan dan noodles for the slightly spicy flavor. The portion sizes were quite generous. This was a great choice for a quick meal on a budget!

To be clear, I like the Vanessa's downtown. It's cheap, it's utilitarian, it's good.

This one: the food quality isn't there and they charge 3x. It would never be able to survive without the name recognition of the original.

Service was extremely slow - it took around 20 minutes to get one order of dumplings being the only customer in the shop.

It's such a shame because I love Vanessa's on the LES but this one is just such a hard pass.

The dumplings were great!! Everything is fresh and homemade. Loved the chicken and basil dumplings as well as the shrimp wontons. Service was good and the ambiance was fun (loud music and casual sit down). Also met one of the owners and he really cared about making sure everything was great! Awesome and kind.

I've had experience with the original location in Chinatown and that was when dumplings were 4 for $1.50 back in the day. Understandably, the prices have risen but it is cheap compared to other lunch options. 8 dumplings for around $5.50 isn't so bad. I had the spicy fried wontons and the scallion pancake with duck. Both were fairly sized and warm when I picked up my order. I wasn't full after eating the two but I was satisfied. I'll have to try the regular fried dumplings next time.

Please note the prices on grubhub/seamless are probably 50 cents more expensive than in store so if you need to save money, you know what to do
Fried chive and pork dumplings were great, but I think the cabbage and pork steamed bun was my favorite -- I'd probably multiple of these next time around. I'd skip the duck sandwich next time.

I do not usually write reviews but, I had to this time. Others really need to know  what they are purchasing from this establishment.

Re: Vanessa's Upper West Side (Amsterdam Avenue 81st-82nd Street)  I ordered chicken dumplings, pork buns and a duck sandwich. The buns and the dumplings were not editable. The dough was tough and thick and dry. Like chewing on a rubber ball, and I know, not good for the digestive system.  Do not know if they were old, but they were not like any dumpling or bun that I have every eaten. The duck and cucumber sandwich was very greasy, and although it was sort of tasty, I could not eat it b/c of the grease.  I gave one star for the sandwich. What a shame restaurants are still getting away with selling food that they would not eat themselves.  I will never visit here again.

Very yummy and filiing!

Was coming home after a late night and finally wanted to try out Vanessa's dumplings!

Got the dan dan noodles with beef sauce, and man does this place give a good bang for your buck. The noodles were chonkier than usual, but still held the sauce well and were very delicious. A bit more nuttier than other places, and has a great kick to it.

Will come back to try dumplings next!

I'm so excited by the new dumpling spots here! I ordered Beef Dan dan mian, which was delicious and definitely spicy. The sweet and sour cucumbers were a good pairing, though the vinegar was very strong--it had a much stronger bite than day the cucumbers you would get at Din Tai Fung.
Their noodles are homemade and perfectly chewy, and I look forward to trying the dumplings and steamed buns!

They also have frozen dumplings by the bag

Welcome to the UWS, to a long block full of stellar little places.. Senna Thai, Van Leeuwen, Jin Ramen and a branch of the NY Public library.

3 stars would be unfair, everything is new and squeaky clean. Long narrow space with a sleek uncluttered white/orange and blond wood.

The spicy wontons, shrimp and chicken were very good. But both the Dan Dan spicy noodles and sesame peanut were pretty to look at and well portioned but lackluster in flavor.. especially the peanut. It's on the same block that I work on, so I would return but stick to wontons or dumplings.
I was very disappointed at this place. The food was not that great. I ordered a bunch of stuff and literally the only satisfaction I received from this place was a beef pancake sandwich.

Vanessa's has become one of my favourite lunch spots  . The dumplings are amazing but, recently I've been enjoying the spicy beef noodle soup. The soup has just the perfect amount of kick to it. Vanessa's is a great option for takeout.

I've been hooked on their spicy pan fried wonton stuffed with chicken shrimp. Delicious. Hubby and I decided to try the wonton soup. It come out steaming hot with absolutely no flavor. We asked for salt apparently they didn't have any. Such a disappointment. I'll still to just 4A.

Really delicious, healthy tasting, fresh veggie dumplings. 8 per order - get with spicy chili oil and cilantro for a small extra charge. Also got a side of kimchi for just under $5 and it was HUGE - enough for four people. The kimchi had green apple and big chunks of ginger which gave it a unique and refreshing taste. Certainly got my veg on, will be back to try some of the meat options (there's a dumpling sampler option) and definitely work my way through the noodle section of the menu :)
Dumplings were absolutely fantastic, the buns were great but a little bland because of the thickness of the dough.  The cucumber salad was also wonderful.

Delicious dumplings and noodles! I love that they have vegan options. Their veggie dumplings have a nice tasty filling and they are quite large, so definitely filling. They have a smoked tofu option for their dan dan noodles which is vegan (per their Instagram page). SO good. The noodles are perfectly chewy and the sauce has a slight spice to it, and overall great flavor. Prices are reasonable- while I am sure it is more than from its original downtown location years ago, it still is below market average for dumplings and noodles.

I have ordered from here twice already and will continue to do so when that next dumpling/ noodle craving hits !

Tip top good eats.  I was in the mood for an eclectic lunch so I figured Vanessa's would do.  Thankfully I had plenty of hungry mouths to share in this spread.  So my most recent order consisted of the boiled assorted dumplings, pan fried pork dumplings, mushrooms and spinach pan fried wontons, pancake sandwiches with duck, kimchi, seaweed salad,  and red bean steamed buns.  It was all delicious and tasty.  Sauces were included and were soy and chili based.

I would definitely return and want to try their variety of frozen, at home products.  Service is quick and efficient; place seems clean.  Definitely pop in for a fun lunch or snack.  The prices are very affordable and the food is filling.  It's nice to have an uptown version of this gem.

This has nothing to do with the food and store. The food are amazing.

However, been there more than 3 times, always have problems with the cashiers. They have a such bad attitude towards costumers, when they speak to me. They placed my orders incorrectly, the poor service are unacceptable.  We called to pick up, after 30 minutes we went to pick up and it's still "not ready" because the cashiers didn't actually checked my order. It was ready and actually right there. The lack of efficiency and training are really disappointing for this such great food in Upper West Side.

不务正业，态度不行，没把工作当回事，不尊重客人，在那嬉戏打闹。点单的时候还带着耳机，没能准确知道顾客的需求。

I started out with the pan fried chicken dumplings - I thought they'd be like the pan fried buns that dumpling places sometimes served, but they were more the potsticker dumpling style. I really enjoyed them though! They're browned and pan fried nicely, and tasted really fresh. I then tried the peking duck scallion pancake, and that was amazing! The sesame pancake was baked perfectly and just the right thickness to complement the filling without overpowering it. The duck, sauce, and scallions were a really good combination, even though I generally don't like scallions, it worked together really well for this sandwich! The duck was delicious, though it was more roast duck than authentic peking duck.

We ordered a bunch of things to try and I would say we definitely liked some more than others. We tried the combo steamed dumplings and honestly would not order them again. The spicy beef dumplings however, were good.

The steamed buns were also pretty enjoyable and the duck sesame pancake sandwich was the best thing we ate. The dan dan noodles were tasty, but not the best we have had. I don't know if we would order them again, but we enjoyed them enough at the time.

The people working there were very friendly, the portions are generous and the prices are beyond affordable. I would recommend checking it out especially for the peking duck sesame pancake.

Shakiea and Edgar , was exception with there accommodation when they found out that I was given shrimp and spinach not once but twice !!! Not only am I allergic but when told to the kitchen crew they exchanged with the exact same thing thank god I had a epi pen with me I'm not sure the cook understand the difference and how many other meals did they send out with out awareness of one's dietary and allergic restrictions .. unexceptional

A friend recommended Vanessa's while I was visiting. She told me about the Chinatown location but after a visit to the  Met. I found out about the Upper West side location that was closer. It's been a while since I've had really good dumplings. The pan fried were generously filled with chicken and shrimp. The wrappers were perfectly tender and the sauce tasty with the right amount of spice. I also had chicken and chive wontons  and I'm in love. The staff was very friendly and I received my food quickly. Next trip to NYC it's on my list of must eats.

My absolute favorite take out spot in NYC. They make it pretty quick and have great portion sizes for the price. Got 3 items for less than $30 including tip. Great flavors and ingredients taste very fresh.
These dumplings always hit the spot. I highly suggest the chicken and basil. Don't suggest the pork and cabbage(tastes sourkraut-y). I like to buy the bags of 25 to keep in the freezer.
It was awesome! I had the beef noodle soup & the chive pork dumplings. Very tasty & reasonably priced. It will be our go to place for noodle soup & dumpling cravings.
This is a good place to grab some causal food/ snack. Tried the assorted boiled dumplings and the beef noodle soup here. Both dishes were delicious. Would come back to try out other food.

This place is ok, we came and got the chicken noodle soup, the veggie soup, the veggie buns and the pork dumplings, the chicken soup was amazing, it was flavorful and the noodles were thick and very good, the veggie one was sort of bland but it was ok once you added soy sauce, t he veggie buns were not very good though, the outside was delicious but the filling was not very good.
Tried Dan Dan noodles and a pork bun and thought  they were both mediocre. The Dan Dan noodles were pretty bland even with the beef sauce.   Just stick with the dumplings from here

I was so happy this place opened up! The UWS literally had few dumpling options, and China town is too far!

The food is good and comparable to other locations. The boiled spicy dumplings could probably use more cilantro. The duck pancake sandwich could of had more meat.

About 15-20 min wait time outside while they make food. It's clean inside and doesn't smell greasy. Good experience. Pretty busy on weekends.

service is good, but the dumplings are one of the worst. the skin is too thick. the meat inside was dry. the milk tea was water down milk... maybe some tea? the cucumber was good though. not a place i would recommend to anyone. sad when all they do is just dumplings? so many better places.

A delicious, casual place to grab dumplings. This place is great for a group of people since you don't have to worry about splitting the check and each person can check out separately at the register. I usually like getting the pan fried dumplings and the soups look pretty delicious as well.

Food amazing, service outstanding, NY ambiance
I will return with my daughter who recommended it !!! My daughter
Lives in the city .. I live in CA

Great selection of meat and cheese

Decent Happy Hour Wine

The reason i'm not giving it more stars is due to the $$$ nature of what was being offered. I think for what it is, there are better neighborhood options that are better bang for buck.

Otherwise, great vibe and experience but maybe not worth the price tag.

Dark wine bistro.  Yes it does get loud and yes the small plates are very small, but the wine is tres bon. The cassoulet ($18) was about a one cup portion and was really just a really good gravy with just a few small pieces of meat and potato.  Escargots ($15) were 6.  The butter was good.  Wine bottles start at $55, and ours was excellent.

The place is so cute - it's what you have to pay nowadays - a bottle of wine and two small apps $120 with tax and tip.
Will definitely go back.

$22 glass of wine and that was on the lower end of the price scale. And good luck figuring out the prices as the menu's are worn out with price changes written in pen..

This could be the biggest rip off in NYC and that's saying a lot.

And lastly, use some of the money from your 1000% markup and bring in a professional cleaning crew as the inside stinks really bad. Even though it was 90 and humid outside, I opted to deal with the humidity because of how bad it smelled inside.

If you want to get ripped off while holding your nose, I suggest running, not walking, to this place..

Visited this wine bar last night around 5:45pm for drinks and food with my sister and we had such a lovely time. We were pleasantly surprised to find out they had happy hour until 6pm. There's a cozy vibe, very dimly lit, the service was good and we all enjoyed our time. Perfect midday, chill hang out spot in UWS.

My go to for a quick glass of wine (or two) and a delicious Croque Monsieur sandwich!  The food is always delicious, service prompt and great, and the wine fantastic! This is by far my favorite solo lunch or dinner restaurant in the UWS!

Like being on a side street in Paris. This is a beautiful French wine bar. Highly recommend the Crème de Bleu (10$) and their white Cote du Rhône (15). The prices are reasonable for the area and setting: it's a lovely place to sit and take in the evening. You can certainly eat dinner there or proceed to another place for dinner. Staff is friendly and very helpful in choosing food and wine.
The service is impeccable, and the ones selections are amazing. Great tapas style offerings for food. The ambience is out of this world. Looking forward to going back.
The best! Great wine selection and friendliness of staff. Oh yeah and the food is wonderful too.

Feels like you're truly at a French bistro. Small table setting (groups of 2-4 only), great menu of small plates, with a wonderful wine menu, tucked quietly away between Columbus and CPW. Food was delicious and somehow, was managed by one fantastic waiter who was able to eloquently handle service for all tables at the restaurant. Exactly what I was hoping for and will absolutely be back!

Vin Sur Vingt never disappoints. Everything is good, but the French onion soup, boeuf bourguignon, and gateau au chocolat are MUST HAVEs. Enjoy delicious food and wine in a warm, cozy atmosphere with friendly service.

I came here the other day for my lunch break away from the office. Working across the street makes the Plaza Food Hall convenient for both lunch and happy hour options. This particular food stall is a favorite. Food offered is well seasoned, fresh and pairs well with the selection of wines available.

On my last visit I ordered the quinoa bowl which is served cold with quinoa, sweet potato, goat cheese tomatoes and a warm broiled piece of salmon. Flavors complimented each other and paired well with the Chardonnay my server recommended.

He also very kindly gave me a complimentary glass of champagne at the completion of my meal. The staff her is always helpful and friendly. I consider this walk across the street, delicious meal and friendly environment an addition to my self care routine in a stuffy stressful office setting.

The husband and I went last night. After we sat down and our ordered glasses of wine arrived, the waiter confided that the only food on offer was a few main courses. Feeling slightly snookered, I ordered beef stew, and the husband ordered chicken pot pie. The food, I guess made elsewhere and reheated, was indifferent. Strangely, the stew came with a side of drained macaroni pasta. Given the price tag, I was unimpressed. As we wandered off, the husband remarked that it hadn't been much of a success. The two stars are for the graceful and efficient waiter who seemed to have the place to himself.

Amazed I didn't discover this place sooner! Fantastic food, fantastic wine, and the BEST service. The staff was helpful, friendly, and seem to genuinely love what they do. We will definitely be back. Highly recommend.

Not a bad spot to get a glass of wine or a bite to eat at a French inspired bar/restaurant. My wife and I decided to stop by on a weekday night. It wasn't too busy. The weather was nice enough that they had the accordion doors open. We chose to sit at a table outside. We both ordered a glass of red wine, and some olives to share. The wine tasted good, but I couldn't shake with the price I paid for a glass, I could have bought a bottle. That really is my only nitpick of the place -- the prices all seem a bit high. The service was fine. I imagine I will try other places in the area before stopping by here again.

I went here on a Thursday night for dinner and drinks. The place immediately gave off a very warm and welcoming vibe, especially on a cold & windy night! There were quite a few people at the cozy bar, but there were seats available for dining.

We were impressed by the vast selection of wines, our waitress (who by the way was adorably French and her mere presence transported me to Paris~~) was very helpful in assisting with our selection of a bottle. Once we had decided on a wine, we then turned our attention to the menu. The menu is also very classically french and felt like something straight out of Europe. We ordered the escargot, tuna tartare, croque monsieur, AND the croque madame (comes with an egg). We were also given a nice basket of warm, crisp bread which they kept refilled throughout the meal. We absolutely loved the escargot and were very satisfied with our choice of sandwiches.

This is a very cute spot for a glass of wine and a bit of French cuisine on the UWS. Would come back with a date or with friends!

Even the most mediocre company can be elevated by stopping by VSV for a slice of Paris-lite decor: candles, low lighting, wicker furniture, checkered tablecloths--this place is every French stereotype come to life, in the best way possible.

The wine selection is equally magnifique, with vineyards both known and unknown well-represented. Service is a bit slow and spotty, even when the place is nearly empty--but that's also very French. ;)

When a business tells you "we don't want your business" I'm willing to take them at their word. I'll never order from them again, and i'll do my best to help other people avoid the mistake of doing business with them. Ordered from them from seamless. They deleted items, did not contact us, and when I called them told me, in exact words "I don't want to talk to you, I don't care" They apparently are "place and pickup" and don't have any interest in whether they give good service. Take your business to someone who cares and doesn't say rude things to customers. They charge 18% service fee for this charming attitude.

Adding insult to injury, the food is at best mediocre. There are multiple better choices within 10 blocks.

loved this place! really wonderful staff with amazing service. we got there right when they opened thinking we would be the first ones there and there were multiple tables already seated. The rosé was some of the best i've ever had and they have amazing charcuterie boards. Great food and great staff will come back again and again.

Cute new wine bar upper west side with wonderful service and a large wine selection.  Trois mois, 3 months new per the friendly French bartender

We were upper west, saw this was a nearby "hot and new" place, and wanted to check it out.

Bartender was very friendly, let me taste a couple wines before I decided on a fantastic Bordeaux.  I was even able to use a few of the basic phrases I remember from college French with him and he shared a couple new ones.

Atmosphere is nothing over the top, basic simple and cute. Not wow-some, but a charming, cozy neighborhood wine bar feel and was surprised when I noticed there are several other locations throughout the city as it does not have a chain type feel.

Negative: closes early. We arrived around 1130 and the kitchen was closed, and they were closing up, turning off the lights to close the restaurant around 1150 ish as if to say time to go!  We were the only people there except a few people at a table that I assume work there.

Shout out to Victor. I will admit - my knowledge of wine is low. We came here to learn more and enjoy the cool French ambience at the East Village location. What made the experience truly special was our host Victor - who went above and beyond with individual recommendations. The story behind the wine are most interesting, and we appreciated the host taking the time to explain the regional wine differences in France. Great service, great venue, great location! We will be back.

Great service.  Adorable neighborhood cozy wine bar.  
Tuna Tartare a bit fishy and too many filler veggies.  Needed more olive oil, citrus and salt & better quality tuna ~***
Croque Monsieur was crazy good cheesy madness.  Lovely salads with both.  Bread in bread basket basic & boring not crusty crunch to crust and lacking and flavor.  Bread  toasts were lack luster.  No olive oil, no salt or seasonings were evident in food and definitely not on table.

As far as wine bars go, pretty solid. Only two criticisms: The music ('90s ballads) and the stemware (for flights at least) could be much better.

Otherwise very good. For the wine flights, you can build your own from like 50 really varied selections. For the food, we tried the brie tartine and the pork belly salad, and both were excellent. They've got a deli slicer on the counter so I assume the charcuterie is fresh and delish. Also the staff greets you in French, which adds a certain je ne sais quoi, and they even comp'd us a couple of 3/4 glasses of sparkling rose.

So yeah, definitely a spot everyone should give a try.

I don't take this topic lightly but this is the Salade niçoise I have had...including those in France. The service was impeccable and the wine was out of this world. Do not miss the house rose or the bubbly in any form. Gluten free friends, don't pass this one up.

My friends just came from Central Park on a lovely spring evening and wanted to grab a drink small bites. We found this wine bar nestled on 84th between Columbus and CPW. We had a lovely bottle of red Domaine Le Colombier (Vacqueyras) and decided to have some cassolettes and tartines. The casollettes are cheaper the more you get, 3 for $32 or 5 for $54 (individually they are $12-$14). We had the ratatouille, meatball, and boeuf bourguignon. It came with a lot of different types of bread and the casolletes were perfectly portioned and extremely tasty. My friend had the tartine au brie du miel which also looked amazing, the perfect mix of sweet and savory. Our servers were lovely and gave great recommendations. If you are in a hurry, this place is not for you. My only regret was not coming at Happy Hour when bottles of rosé are half-priced.
