This little spot packs a big punch in terms of service, quality, and atmosphere. It seems a lot of care went into creating the wine list, it is extensive with something for every palate and budget. We chose a Cotes du Rhone that was absolutely wonderful! The menu was interesting and it was difficult to decide on just one item. We ordered steak tartare & the 3 fromage & 3 charcuterie plate. This was probably enough for the four of us-but we also ordered salads and ratatouille. We were all very pleased with the service-very attentive-and the timing of meals was perfect.

This is a small place and we didn't have a regular sized table-so i'd suggest calling ahead if you have a bigger party. We went in not even expecting to be able to get a spot, so we were extremely pleased with our cozy corner of tables!

In a big city like NY, it's hard to find something that really stands out as being high quality, but also friendly on the wallet. I was so impressed and will be recommending this place to all people I know! Nice work Vin Sur Vingt!
Vin Sur Vingt is my absolute favorite wine bar. Small, cozy, has character. Feels like a cute little neighborhood spot.

Wow! Great wine. I was really happy with the Anjou which was perfectly balanced between sweet and crisp, and the Boudreaux was very satisfying too. The food was nicely done and most of what we ordered was tapas size so perfect for snacking and having some variety. Out of everything we tried I'd recommend the meatballs or one of the sandwiches. The service was also very friendly. I'll definitely be back!

One of my closest friends lives on the same block as this bar, he got me here saying let's go to my favorite bar. I have been to their soho location, but this was my first time at the UWS location. We came here on a busy Friday night, so the place was packed. I really enjoyed their excellent French wine selection and shared a tartine (Brie Au Miel - $12 for a slice of bread with melted Brie and drips of honey *eye roll* - but super delicious). After dinner at a nearby restaurant, we came back here for another glass of wine. It's a bit of a trek for me, but I'll be coming back here for sure, it's really charming.

Adorable little gem that's tucked away on the side streets of the uws. This place literally makes you feel like you're somewhere other than NYC. It's normally packed whenever I go, but maybe that's because I always end up going there during the weekends. Service can be a bit slow, as I have seen only one server work there on couple occasions (which doesn't make sense to me at all). Luckily, the server was fast and trying to be attentive as possible.

They have an extensive wine menu, but not nearly as much for single glass options. It would be great if they offered carafes so that customers could try more wines on their menu. They could use some updates in their operations, but in either case, it's a great place to stop by for a glass of wine and some cheese/charcuterie.

What a gem of a place! Transport yourself to a romantic wine bar in France for the evening.

It has the cutest, warmest ambience that you can find in the UWS. There is a simple counter in front of a huge wine rack, and then the rest of the floor is open with chairs along the middle and the walls.

They serve happy hour deals, and I was delighted to snag a glass of Beaujoulais right before it ended. It was delicious!

We ordered french onion soup, chicken confit, and a trio of cassolettes: salmon, duck, and boeuf bourgignon. My goodness, everything was fabulous. I paired the dinner with a wine sampler, which happened to be perfect because I paired the red wine with the beef, white wine with the salmon, and rosé with the duck.

To top it all off, the waitress was so incredibly pleasant! She had great recommendations and was very patient with our questions. When we asked for a bread basket, she said she was happy to bring us one, but she warned that it would make us full before the rest of the meal (which would come with lots of bread). I was so pleased that she cautioned us against the first basket of bread, because she was soooo right, we couldn't even finish all of our food even after skipping it.

Love this place and I will be back!

Our server at the bar in the 84th street location, Demetrius, was so helpful! He gave my friend (not a wine drinker) and I many tastes and was very knowledgeable and friendly. I have only been to the 84th street location, which a lot of neighborhood folks come to (a good place to meet new people?), though they do hold wine tastings in their TriBeCa location apparently. I can see it being a GREAT place to frequent if you are really interested in delving deeply into French wine.

Real wine bar in UWS
Menu with organic wine , biodynamic wine
Short food menu but amazing dish to pair with your wine. The chicken sandwich is awesome
Chicken cassolette a big win
Can t wait to go back
The cherry on the cake is the service. They are all so great and you will feel like you are in a great bistro in Paris

This food was spectacular! I felt like I got on a plane and flew to Paris. My husband and I got the 5 choice combo plate and everything was delicious. Our server Didier had wonderful wine parings for us as well. He was so attentive and easy going on a night that was probably hectic. Our total bill was around $100 and worth every penny. Can't wait to come back!

Tucked in a residential UWS neighborhood, Vin Sur Vingt gets a big win for me. Initial take on the place: wow, this is a cozy split between a european espresso cafe with pastries and a inviting place to enjoy wine, stare out the windows and feel the feels: a momentary reprieve.

we arrived later on a quiet Monday evening and had our pick of tables. We were a party of 4, sat in the middle of the wine bar. Since it was late, our food options were limited to Charctucerrie, Cheeses and breads. No complaint here!! Their wine menu is extensive, as it pertains to France. We ordered 2 bottles of white: the second bottle a 2012 Montrachet is phenomenal! (it was my own little desert) Ask for it. The Bartender/winetender was a wonderful french guy. Friendly and made sure we liked and chilled the wines we ordered.

Oh, wine bar. This is what I envision a wine bar being: character, wines on full display, floor to ceiling length window-doors that open up, fresh, airy, touch idyllic, bit of nyc hustle, and at night dimmed lights for a romantic date. If these folks were going for a low key wine bar vibe, they nailed it. I must say, I felt transported for the duration of our drinks.

No idea what time they close, but the Winetender didn't kick us out.
Great find in this area of the city . Lived the food . The place is a little tight but the taste of the dishes make up for that . The service can a bit slow at rush hours but it's nor unbearable.

Wine bar hopping for tonight. This place had a really good wine flight deal. Wines were also top notch, IMO. However, my bf wasnt quite fond of the selections (wine importer).

Atmosphere was nice and so was the crowd. We met some really cool folks here tonight.

Overall, great place for whine and cheese

This charming little wine bar has great choices for wine by the glass and a nice selection of french "tapas"-style entrees - some are served in little glass jars and some on plates (the tartine's that are open-faced sandwiches).  Easy to share.  The name is a clever play on a French expression "vingt sur vingt": 20 out of 20, i.e. a perfect score on a paper.
Great place to visit with a friend or a great date night. I loved the atmosphere and wine selection. Paul was very nice!!! Wonderful meat and cheese platter.

This is one of the best wine bars I have been to. Wide section of wines to choose from and from all over France. My absolute staples each time I go are the charcuterie board, 3 meats & 3 cheeses..any combination, I change it up every time. They also make an amazing Croque Monsieur, easy spilt for two or good for one if you're hungry. After a day at the museum, this is the perfect treat and place in the Upper Best Side.

Great wine selection! There are far fewer options by the glass, so don't go alone ;) The staff were kind and provided great recommendations- they allowed me to try a couple before I found one I liked for a glass.

Lovely wine and small bites place. Not exactly a dinner spot but you can certainly fill up on different offerings quickly. Service is slow to refill water and clean the plates but the wine tasted great and the food was good. The place has a certain European charm and we will return.

Great place to grab a glass of wine and snacks. Definitely can fill up on food. Happy hour prices are good with a few options of white and red along with a great rosé bottle special. Stop in early for a wine before dinner or stay all night!

Stumbled onto this place on a Friday night after work and absolutely loved it!  I did not realize that Vin Sur Vingt had multiple locations and definitely will visit each one to see what the ambience will be.  If it reflects what the UWS version is, I know I'll love it.  They have so many variations of French wines from different regions - Bordeaux, Alsace, Loire, Rhone, Languedoc/Roussillon, Bourgogne...I could go on, but I will one day travel to each region so I know what I'm drinking!  This place seems like it would be pretentious with bottles of Bordeaux ranging from $1,300 (Saint-Emilon 1er Grand Cru Classe Chateau Cheval Blanc 01') to $1,420 (Margaux Chateau Margaux 02'), but definitely not.  The service is on point, the waitress was very polite and patient while helping me decide on which glass to get.  I started off with a taste of the Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux Chateau Roc 14', but it had too many tannins.  The second taste that was recommended was the Saint-Estephe Les Hauts de Pez 12', which was smooth, classy, and just what I needed after a crazy, busy day at work.  Smelled fruity, maybe hints of raspberry and cherries.  Regardless, so delicious and will definitely buy a bottle to share with my friends.  

Definitely a nice date spot for a weekend one on one, or chilling with friends!  Will definitely come back to this fine establishment and explore the other locations, downtown.
Lovely place with great food and wine. Always a good choice when in the neighborhood.

Nice French wine bar in my neighborhood. I was there solo, making some headway into my latest read. I sampled the happy hour wine special which was only fair; however, the wine list is substantial and bartender seemed knowledgeable.The bar was a good place to dive into a book, and I remember the food being quite tasty (especially the mini casseroles) on a previous visit. I enjoyed the upbeat Motown music but it seemed out of place for the setting.
Very small place. Friendly staff and cozy atmosphere.....however this place has a small selection of wines, the food was average.
Great low-key vibe for catching up with friends paired with great service! Hercules was very attentive!

An absolute gem.

Super cute wine bar with real French atmosphere. Huge wine list with extensive, well-chosen selection of wines by the glass. Here you can get anything from a $10 glass of perfectly nice wine up through a $2000 bottle of Cheval Blanc or Chateau Margaux. Tasting flights and daily specials add to the variety.

The food is much more than an afterthought. It ranges from nibbles to have with your wine through full meals, and it includes great selections of cheese and charcuterie. Quality ingredients and care throughout. And the service is friendly and professional. The vibe is laid back and cozy.

The fact that this place is on a quiet side street instead of a noisy, busy avenue seals the deal. A wonderful addition to the neighborhood!

Let's be honest. The place has a ring of genuine wine bar about it and the food is quite good although not "incredible" or "amazing".  However, It is small and noisy and the prices are just not worth the experience.  There are better places around and you don't get the feeling that the customer is the important thing.  Maybe my problem is being European and used to a better atmosphere, service and prices.

It tries, but just doesn't make it.

Decent brunch/diner food! One of my go-to brunch spots in the area. I've been here a couple of times (weekday, weekend) and have had a comfortable and satisfying dining experience each time. It has never been super packed when I visited, so I've always been seated immediately and it was never too loud.

Food seems to be consistent and reliable. Portions are good. The Farmer's Benedict is good -- it was a lot more filling than I thought it'd be. The hash browns are soggy -- not crispy except for some burnt edges -- but I don't mind that. They are still seasoned well. The Chocolate Chip Pancakes were tasty as well -- they weren't too sweet or plain, and the texture/density was just right! My friend the Huevos Rancheros were good too, but a little difficult to eat.

Overall, I feel like I can count on having a good brunch meal when coming here because the food never "misses," service is quick, and the seating areas are comfortable and clean.

Came here for lunch on a Sunday and got seated right away. The food selection is your basic American brunch & lunch and the prices are around $20-30 per entree. I got the pesto chicken sandwich and while the portion size was huge, the sandwich was very bleh. The breading was super super greasy and the chicken was reallllly dry. I know it's one of their most popular dishes, but I'm not sure why? It didn't taste great to me and the seasoning wasn't good either. It was also really hard to eat and pick up bc the bread was soo greasy, it was falling apart when I tried eating it. It came with a side of fries tho which were decent/average.

My friends got the huevos rancheros which comes with no meat, eggs & hash, and tuna salad sandwich. Again, nothing we ate was anything to rave about and what you would expect it to be.

I think I would only recommend coming to this place if you happen to be in the area and had nothing else to eat but I would never recommend going out of your way or coming here if you have other options.

This spot is perfect for families who want as nice as possible of a night out. There's a decent kid menu, a nice alcohol menu, and lots of other food menus.

Our waitress knew that we'd want to order kid food right away, which was right on, and she also kept asking if we wanted another drink (but not in a pushy way).

The outdoor seating is a nice option, and there's some plant coverage if you don't want to feel like you're right on the street.

I wish the kid mac and cheese didn't come out so hot. Yes, it was tasty, but maybe there's another way to make it for the kids. French fries were perfect. I didn't think the hot chicken sandwich special was so great; good idea, but the pieces didn't really mesh well together, and it was very hard to eat.

I'll definitely be back! Thanks for one of the best nights out with my family (young kids) in a while.

Disappointing diner. Ordered gluten free pancakes - they were terrible. They were soggy inside and had a strange metallic flavor. Perhaps the baking powder wasn't mixed in? GF pancakes have to be thin to be fully cooked - these were the diner hubcap sized one, so never going to happen. The "carmelized bananas" dish was chopped banana swimming in a super sweet corn syrup sauce. Yuck. The bacon was okay. The corned beef hash was homemade and the fried egg on top was perfectly cooked. But my enthusiasim dropped when I contended with all the gristle, they used the end pieces of the corned beef. Finally, when we needed service we had to go inside to get a waitress. The service for the outdoor diners was spotty.

EXCELLENT BREAKFAST!
I enjoyed being back in NYC and having a delightful breakfast at Viand. I had the traditional eggs benedict  It came with hash browns. Was very good.  They also have a full bar, so, I had a bloody mary.  
We sat outdoors.

*Tourist Opinion*

Im here on vacation from San Francisco with my best friend. We both had overnight flights and were running on about 2 hours of sleep combined. She looks at me says lets find somewhere to eat after landing and we decide on pancakes.

Thanks to yelp we found this place. The vibe was nice, very laid back and it was cute to see the regulars come in and order their coffees. I loved the bit of colored tiles on the floor and the set up of the booths just made sense for the inside. We came at about 9:30 am so not sure how their outside seating works!

On to the food, I ordered a Plain Bagel with Cream Cheese, Lemonade and a Berry Bowl. My friend got the Dulce de Leche French Toast and orange juice.

My review: THE LEMONADE WAS THE BEST LEMONADE IVE HAD IN MY WHOLE LIFE (house made). I have waited 20 years to find the perfect lemonade and Viand has it. I love a sour drink it was just perfect. I appreciated that the bagel came with the cream cheese on the side, it allows u to control how much or little. The berry sauce was also the perfect amount of sweet to add on top. The berry bowl was good, typical berries not much to say here. But the bowl they served them in was a very nice blue cracked glaze design and I enjoyed that. SERIOUSLY GET THE LEMONADE PLEASE.

Besties Review: It was really good and amazing portion size. The Nutella tasted house made which was a great addition. Orange Juice was pretty good as well (fresh squeezed tasting).  

The service was great. They are attentive and check in with you in a way that feels purposeful, like they really want to. Sweet people. Seeing the way they interacted with their regulars was sign enough of an awesome establishment.  

Overall, we had a good experience here. I will be back for another lemonade.

This may have been the worst breakfast I have ever had. I think it's probably a good place for families, since they have a large menu with many options - but definitely not a good place for a couple trying to get some decent breakfast. We chose to eat outside in the covered area, so I am unable to comment on the interior of the restaurant. Our waitress was aloof and we continued to see her behind the outdoor enclosure past the restaurant on her phone. It took a while to order and to pay our check. We decided to choose the berry fruit cup and one the quesadillas. The berry fruit cup was mostly melon and pineapple which tasted like it had been sitting out for days and not the least bit fresh. The quesadilla was 98% cheese and just fell apart. It was a hard meal to eat and I don't plan to return again.
The gluten free pancakes are good, especially with the syrup. Our server kept forgetting sides and food items. I get it was busy, but it is a big brunch spot. They may have to hire more staff.

A great diner located in the UWS on Columbus and 85th. We went there for dinner around 6 pm on a Friday. It was pretty quiet at that hour. More people started to flow in as time went on. We were able to order a meal quickly for our son once we sat down. We then got our drinks order in and then finally the food. The portions here at Viand are very large. Prices are a bit on the higher side for a diner but it makes sense once you see how much food you get. The service was great and everything was delicious. I meant to take picture of the food but we were so hungry when it arrived that we just immediately dug in.  We ordered a cheese burger and fries, a pesto chicken panini, a Philly cheesesteak and some kids meals. We were surprised to see we received some drink specials on the tap beer we ordered because we didn't see anything advertised anywhere. Will be back here again!

The food is average, but the takeout service is an abomination!
First of all, although it is against the law to include plastic utensils in a take-out bag unless the customer requests them, Viand includes them in every bag even if you ask them not to.  Not great for the environment!
Next - last night after a harrowing day I ordered a take out meal from Viand.  I arrived home at 9:00 to find 2/3 of my meal was there.  But they had forgotten the other 1/3!  When I phoned I was told that even though what what was missing would have required no preparation,  it was too late for them to deliver it.
I then asked to speak to the manager.  And this is the unbelievable part!   I told him what happened and instead of addressing the issue and at least having the common courtesy to apologize and assure me it wouldn't happen again, he said "OK.  Thank you very much" and hung up  This goes beyond common rudeness.  It was completely unprofessional.
Fortunately the Upper West Side  has many take out places from which to choose, most of which I'm sure offer good service.
Casual diner, great for brunch or breakfast. The menu is extensive, so you'll be able to find something for everyone. Portions are also generous. Service is efficient.

Very disappointing experience from the moment we put our names in (walk-in's only, FYI) to the moment we were eating.

Put our names in to the hostess outside - it appeared that she calls your name just once and crosses it off the list.. even though we were standing right there just a few feet away near the outdoor dining tent.. good thing we asked if our names had been called and then luckily we got seated.

I got chocolate chip pancakes and they were clearly burnt / overcooked, within each of the 3 pancakes in the stack. As comparison, another guest at another table right next to us had her plate of pancakes not overly overdone.

I ask the waitress nicely - Can I please get a different order of the chocolate chip pancakes as these are very overdone/overcooked? Is that okay to get a new order? ... She rolls her eyes at me, goes IF THAT'S WHAT YOU WANT, and just takes away my plate. Unwelcoming and unfriendly...

I was very disappointed. I will not return here. I wish they were nicer and more accommodating as I had a valid reason for it and even saw they didn't serve the pancakes that way to every person..

This experience genuinely confused me. I came here with my dining partner because I reeeeeaaallllyyy wanted pancakes and I'd read the avians had good ones.

The staff was fairly nice and accommodating. We were seated right away and given time to pick what we wanted.

I originally asked for banana and chocolate chip pancakes. A couple minutes later I was told they had no bananas so I asked for chocolate chip and marshmallow pancakes. My dining partner asked for chocolate chip pancakes. We also ordered the chicken tender appetizer.

Instead of chocolate chip and marshmallow pancakes, I received chocolate chip and *graham cracker* pancakes. So strange. They were alright. A bit dry because of the lack of marshmallow

Instead of chocolate chip pancakes, my dining partner got chocolate chip and walnut pancakes. Even more strange.

The chicken tenders were groundbreaking, though. Truly the perfect amount of crunch and tenderness. The honey mustard was fantastic and overall the highlight of the meal.

Not sure if I'd return for the service, but I'd return for the tenders.

*2.5/5

I'm sad to say this but this was the lamest shakshuka I've ever had, it just tasted like eggs in a pool of canned tomato sauce. Also my friend's Bloody Mary was the worst Bloody Mary I've ever had, it was so bitter and just not it. If I said Bloody Mary in the mirror three times and the Bloody Mirror from Viand appeared, I would be rather sad
Huge portions, very flavorful. Recommend both menu items, I believe the owner came by so the staff was very attentive. Would go here again!
Not worth the hype at all. Dozens of better diners everywhere in the area. Plus they gave me raw chicken ... just avoid !

I got the roasted beet salad which seemed to have very fresh ingredients and good flavor but our service was terrible. The waitress took our order then we never saw her again. We had finished with our food for at least 10 minutes and I had to ask someone inside for the bill, they weren't busy either.

Viand Upper West Side is a diner I go to mainly when I visit my friends that live on the West Side. I sometimes stop in if I'm hanging out alone. It's a typical breakfast for me. Nothing to write home about.

When I lived on West 74th Street I'd stop in this diner for breakfast more frequently. Since I still have friends that live nearby I sometimes find myself having a meal now and then. I wouldn't say it's in my top choice of diners in the neighborhood. It is just convenient at times. Service has always been no frills. The friendliness of the employees appears to be whatever mood they're in that day. Sometimes I don't get that warm home style welcome. If you're hungry and need to eat this is as good as any place else in this neighborhood for the price.

Classic diner on the UWS. Good food and generous portions, but overpriced for what it is. Was expecting a bit more of an elevated and/or unique breakfast... was tasty but not extraordinary or different from any of the other UWS diners for that matter. Probably paying for the location and ambiance but I really didn't get the hype with VIAND.

Solid spot to dine at during Covid times with some nice tented outside seating on the street, and overhead lamps helping keep us warm. Plexiglass partitions, and healthy ventilation. They do a nice job of it here.

As a diner goes this Viand is a step above most. Think hearty portions of better than most diner offerings you have experienced. My friend had the Short Rib Gnocchi which she really enjoyed, but was full after eating half and took the rest home for dinner the next day and said it was still delicious.

I was more than happy to see an Impossible Burger on the menu which I got with cheese, caramelized onions, and sweet potato fries. Good choice if you're not into eating meats and it tastes almost the same. Tasty meal.

Service was terrific, with more than enough water and coffee refills. They never rushed us to leave and kelp filling our cups over spirited conversation. I think we pretty much closed the place. They also let customers use the bathrooms which was a must as there was no way I was holding it in after all that cawfee tawk!
really good breakfast/brunch spot! can get quite busy. Real cute spot in UWS for outdoor or indoor dining. Smores pancakes were delicious. big portions.

A good spot for outdoor dining. Plenty of seating. There are overhead heaters (ours could have been hotter), plexiglass partitions between tables, and the sidewalk side completely open for good cross ventilation.

I had the Short Rib Gnocchi. I love short rib in anything. Gnocchi is heavy so this is seriously filling. I only made it thru half. It was great the next day. Having the Impossible burger and chili on the menu makes this a good hearty choice for anyone staying away from animal protein.

The service was quick and friendly. We were able to get multiple coffee refills and chat to our heart's content. And there're restrooms for customers. This is a solid spot for COVID dining.

First impression: outdoor seating reminds me my trips to Europe and dining al fresco. Love the shade from the awnings and the plant filled barriers that separate the eating area/dining booths from the rest of the sidewalk. Plenty of people cleaning and lots of sanitizer available. Owner and waiters are all super attentive and remember me despite the mask (it could be my pinkish metallic rose colored hair

Food: one of my favorite brunch spots starting around the pandemic reopening in NYC. Their spiked lemonades (my favorite is the strawberry lemonade with gin or vodka). I've tried about half of everything on the menu: Classic Benedict + Lox Benedict (delicious, get Hollandaise on the side), Eggs in Purgatory-Shashuka (perfectly seasoned and I always ask for extra pita), The Modern Egg Sandwich (I always replace the ciabatta with brioche or a croissant). Also, not sure what preserves they use with the bread/biscuits but it's ammmmazzzing!

Perfect brunch spot.  Service was great and kept our coffee full, which is all I ask for when I'm eating brunch outside.  The corned beef hash is highly recommended. The sandwich was okay, I didn't really care for the bread.  We enjoyed our breakfast here and would recommend it.

Food was very okay. We both got the brunch special and it was over $60 after tip (for two specials). so for that price and mediocrity of food I probably will not be back. Service was very friendly though and the atmosphere is like a regular old American dinner.

I loved my Grilled Vegetable Panini! Comes with a small garden salad on the side. It's on focaccia bread and has goat cheese - two of my favorites. Huge sandwich, plenty for a second meal. It was $18.

Cheeseburger with cheddar cheese was good. Juicy, good flavor. Felt a little pricy, coming in at $20. Bun was average - we'll opt for a pretzel bun next time.

Great diner close to Central Park on 85th and Columbus Ave. They have plenty of outdoor seating with plexiglass separated tables. Solid spot to enjoy a meal during Covid.

Staff here is super friendly and the service is pretty fast. We were seated right away and our food arrived within a few minutes of ordering.

We got a Swiss my lox brunch special with a Reuben sandwich and Tuna salad Melt along with 2 bloody Marys. Tuna melt sandwich came a with pickle, cole slaw and a side of fries. Brunch special with a choice or drink (got a coffee). The sandwiches were quite tasty and filling.

All of that was around $90 (and so I would say it is on the pricier side as diners go) but they serve generous portions and we had leftovers to take home. Bloody Mary was pretty good; just enough spice and booze. Loved it :)

I will definitely go back and try other dishes on their menu :)

Size matters. Let us be candid.

I have had more gourmet sandwiches in this neighborhood. Viand's are nevertheless tasty versions of some popular menu items that can be found around NYC. At $19 per sandwich, they better be good. They are.

We ordered a substantial lunch after a long walk in Central Park. We ate the sandwiches at our friends' apartment on 86th. Not in photos was the chicken souvlaki sandwich--also large. Flavors and sizes were robust. Honestly, each sandwich was large enough for two meals! We had the sweet potato fries for four meals!

Loved their take on a Cuban sandwich and Buffalo Chicken sandwich. Perfectly cooked chicken, pork and ham.

Great pickles, slaw, and salads too. Viand, you made a great October Sunday even better.

Good amount of food for the price! We went when they first opened. It was a weekday and pretty empty inside. Service was very good and our food was ready quickly. I had the chorizo omelet. I expected the chorizo to be ground, but it was sliced of chorizo instead. Overall good experience for a quick and reliable breakfast.

Great vast menu for brunch and breakfast. Delicious selections and great service.
Was able to accommodate a party of 6 on short notice.

I went here for breakfast, lunch, and brunch so far. I love the food and they come in big servings. If your in the sandwich mood, I recommend The Modern, pancakes eggs and a large selection of food are available here too. If available, the cinncackes are really good, they are one of many specials.

Diner with nice outdoor seating. The food was just okay. Not amazing not bad. I wasn't crazy about thé hollandais sauce, it didn't taste like it was made on site so it was probably premade. Not the greatest diner and there are so many fantastic ones in the city.
Visiting NY for the first time, I do not recommend this place. My toast was burnt, and hash browns looked like they came from the bottoms scraps of the pan. Not satisfied, cute little place however.

Over priced and nothing special from the culinary pt of view..

Unfortunately

Charging such HIGH prices for mediocrity in Manhattan...

Not the way to go!

Tastes really good with huge quantity!
I will definitely recommend this place for brunch.

Solid Bruch/ lunch place with a variety of option to choose from. We tried Viand right before we visited the MET; I would recommend this combination as you can have something lite to eat without feeling heavy afterwards, allowing you to walk around the city and enjoy your day.
The outdoors space was very pretty and it felt as if you're in your own little world in the middle of the city.
The food was very tasty. I tried the Greek yogurt with berries, granola, and honey and it took me right back home to Greece.

100% will go back.

Best diner ever. Solid food. So happy
Reliable and busy for good reason. Keep it coming

Definitely skip this place. Service is horrible and food is below average. One server came over literally one minute after we got sat down by the hostess and I told her we weren't ready. She looked annoyed and walked away. Then we had another server come over to us and I said we aren't ready. She came back like 5 minutes later with a sassy tone and said, "Are we ready or not?" We ordered the chicken pesto panini and the kung pao chicken dumplings. Panini was alright while the dumplings had a flavorful filling, but the outside had rubbery edges. Not one person came to check up on us. So, when we asked for the check, we didn't tip them.
Cool atmosphere and good food with outdoor seating.  We had the Nutella pancakes, avocado toast, and lox and schmear omlette.  It was all very good.
This place was a great find. Quick walk from Central Park. Great food, great service. Would recommend.

Viand is my go-to in the neighborhood for classic American diner fare.

The patty melt and tuna melt are just what you'd hope for. The homemade chicken tenders are a grown up version of your childhood favorite.  The Manhattans are strong for when you need one most.  The service is friendly and attentive, but not overbearing.

All around great spot!

Had a very disappointing experience at Viand. Our waitress was rude to us from the moment we sat down and gave me a difficult time when I asked for a new glass for water because mine had leftover lipstick on it. My girlfriend's pancakes were burned and the waitress was reluctant to replace them. My french toast was decent but nothing special. The nail in the coffin for me was having my card run at the table and then the waitress hovered over us while we tipped which I thought was unprofessional and not good service. I won't be coming back to Viand.
This cute place had amazing service, great portions and food was delicious. We Would definitely recommend.

Thoroughly enjoyable. Greek salad, vegetarian sandwiches all fresh and vibrant. Service is fast, street side dining was wonderful on a June afternoon. Well worth the walk from Museum of Natural History.
The best diner food I've ever had. The turkey sandwiches are a can't miss - it's fall of the bone turkey breast actually cut from a turkey, none of that chemical stuff

We were riding bikes in the park and got hungry. We came down 85 st. My old stomping ground. I thought there would be somewhere to eat in this area. Much to my surprise, there are a few places to eat. We chose this one. And what a great choice it was. We had to wait 15-20 mins. The area was full of people. I asked the hostess if she could seat us outside where we could watch our bikes. She said sure. We finally got an excellent table near the bikes, on the corner. We spoke to a few passerby and people waiting for a table. We ordered a hamburger and gyro. We also ordered onion rings and French fries with our meals. The orders came out quick. They looked fantastic. Both were big plates of food. The onion rings and fries were some of the best we have ever had. Real crunchy and not greasy at all. The hamburger was as ordered. Full of flavor and nicely prepared. The gyro was a ton of meat, platter style. If was also nicely prepared and flavorful. People passing by were in awe of our meal. This place rocks. I'm so glad that we stumbled across this little gem on the upper west side. It did not disappoint. The staff was awesome and the food was great. Thank you.
I highly recommend them.

Pretty solid spot. I went there because its close by and it was reviewed well on Yelp. I ordered one of their $24 brunch specials that came with a glass of red wine sangria. (Sangria was surprisingly good!) Even though it was busy my food came out within 15 minute. Generous portions, I couldn't finish my dish. I recommend it!

When all the other brunch spots along this street were spilling over with people, this place was relatively quiet, until after 11am. The weather was perfect for sitting outside.

The food isn't the prettiest, but it tastes good. I ordered the shakshuka ($15), which came with pita bread to dip. I have to say that this place gets mad props for hitting the right bread to sauce ratio. I was able to soak up all the delicious tomato sauce with the bread I was given, and I liked that it was crisp on the outside and warm. The shakshuka had two eggs, which was enough for me, though I think a real shakshuka should have way more eggs.

The portion sizes are quite large. The sandwiches are super filling and can be shared with another person, and the French toast came as a mountain of toast and Nutella. You get a hearty meal, the food is decent, and you don't have to wait too long. The only thing is that as more people started coming in, I could tell the waitstaff was starting to get overwhelmed. The guy who had been so good at filling up our water jug stopped coming around, and they took forever to get us our check.
Yum!! I got the very healthy and filling quinoa and stuff, it could have been a bit more flavorful but I was thoroughly happy. I will be returning!

This is one of my favorite go to spots in the city! It's fairly challenging to find a diner that has it all, but they really do. They have an unmatched turkey salad and reliable curly fries. You may have to wait about 15 minutes during peak times on the weekend, but it work the wait. Otherwise they deliver on various apps and always get the order right.

I had the build your own crepe with the traditional batter with Nutella, strawberries and whipped cream. This hit the spot for me . I found this place by accident after wondering around Central Park and looking for food

I give two stars instead of one since I haven't tried their sweets crepes but I had one spinach and Gruyère. It was tasteless , no cheese, raw spinach and the creo itself THICK UNDERCOOKED AND FLAVORLESS . Made it to the trash after three bites $ 15
Not good with the hot chocolate or chai tea. However,The crepe looks great！many choices on the menu
Really good buckwheat (gluten free) crepes. I love getting the NY Breakfast crepes and substituting the Gruyère for goat cheese. Highly recommend you try that!

These are the thinest crêpes I've ever had in my life. It tasted like a corndog batter with a tiny bit of Nutella. The ham was even thinner than the Nutella.

If you like crepes go somewhere else

Crepe was ok and the lady making it was nice but the other lady at the cashier was not good.
I want a drink and picked the OJ, I've asked if was freshly squeezed and without even looking at me she said no.So I got the red ice tea, I've asked what it was and she said - Ice tea.
I could clearly see that it was ice tea  but wanted to know the flavor however, she was so entertained chatting and avoiding eye contact that I couldn't be bothered.

The Nutella hot chocolate is pretty good.
Good spot close by Central Park.
We didn't try the crepes but heard people around being happy with them.

Stopped by for a coffee on my way to Central Park. I actually ended up getting the Nutella hot chocolate and added a shot of espresso. It was delicious (not TOO sweet like hot chocolate can be sometimes) and I enjoyed the milk froth! It was pricey for the small size. There are about three small tables outside, but they were decently spaced apart, which I appreciated during this time.

A decent crepe place in the UWS, I ordered a savory basil tomato mozerella and prosciutto crepe. It was what I expected nothing special. The mozerella didn't melt all the way so some of the cheese was still cold.

I went today for a crepe and what I received was the worst service imaginable.  An angry man spewed obscenities at me after I asked for a bag with handles. He also called me a faggot, which may have explained why he didn't want to help me   Clearly the owners don't prioritize customer service

I came here on a Friday night as I was starving and wanted a quick bite.  I ordered the savory crepe with prosciutto, raclette cheese and sliced potatoes.  It was pretty good.

I will come back and try their sweet crepes.

One of the few eateries on the block and open late, so it's got that going for it. It's small and quaint with some seating available. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if it's on your way or you're looking for a cute and casual meeting spot, it's solid. My friend and I ordered the turkey and the smoked salmon crêpes because we wanted something savory. They literally took twenty-five minutes to make these two crêpes. It was torture for me. Nobody knew what the holdup was.

When they finally came, the server gave us an extra one, the chicken pesto, on the house, which was sweet. Luckily, the chicken pesto was my favorite one! I highly recommend that one if you're searching for one with more protein. The turkey was my second favorite. The smoked salmon was mediocre, but then again, I'm not the biggest fan of cream cheese.

I ordered a Dulce de leche and it was extremely disappointing and underwhelming. I probably got the least amount of food from one order serving, when compared to the handful of crepe stores that I've been to in the past. An order is around ten dollars, which is fair and the normal pricing for a crepe, but with the ten dollars I paid for in the other stores (which is also located in the NYC area), they would comes with alot more ingredient/topping such as ice cream, fruits, whip cream, nuts etc, which is the standard that I'm basing my experience off of. Obviously, every place is different when it comes to quantity and pricing. But when you ordered from this menu, you're getting just that. It was just crepe pan cake with caramel syrup and nothing else. And each additional topping would cost two dollars each. To put it bluntly, this place is a rip off.

Ordered a sugar and butter crepe ($7.25), wanted Nutella on the side and apparently thus was an extra $2 for a small container...geez they know how to overcharge for mediocre crepes that's for sure. Staff is not that friendly either. See sad little picture of the most pathetic crepe ever.

I got a gluten free  buckwheat crepe with egg whites, salmon, capers and goat cheese instead of cream cheese. I love that they accommodated my request for substitutions without giving me hell or charging extra.

The crepe was pretty good and very filling. I watched it made and didn't have to wait very long despite only one person making the crepes (they have like 5 stations).

I just wish they had the nutritional information (the reason this is a 5 instead of 4 stars).
Crepes are very good, both the savory and sweet, however their açaí bowls are awful! Bitter and very expensive. Steer clear of those.

Nice cozy environment visited by locals.
Delicious crepes and coffee. I had Nutella (because everything taste better with it) and bananas with coffee. The crepes are delicious but a bit too crispy for my taste.

Really cute place on the upper west side! They have a couple outdoor seating tables and we were lucky enough to grab one because it was really busy. We got a drip coffee, a latte, and cold brew- all great. A little on the pricier side ($5 for cold brew, and $5 for lattes). I would have given this place 5 stars if it wasn't for the extremely long wait. Only one person was working there and it was so busy! She was super sweet, but just very overwhelmed. It was hard to order and hard to pay because of this. We had to Amelie crepe, and it was amazing (picture attached). The dough was soft and the filling was delicious. Would definitely come back again for another round of crepes. I saw others ordering the sweeter options that smelled so good. Maybe I will try another location where they have more people working to make it a quicker experience. But nonetheless, it was a great place to stop on the UWS.

I took a couple of crepes to go and haven't regretted it! Well, I do regret not staying. The crepes are done as you would prefer and the staff are very friendly. They're not afraid to give you heir opinion.

I had two orders of the goat cheese and spinach. Try it out!

THIS PLACE HAS THE BEST CREPES IN THE WORLD!!!!!!

$

Service is casual

Atmosphere is ok

Decoration is great!

Food is like THE BEST!!!

So, yes, Vive la Crepe!

Go to this place! It will be worth it! And as always, Vive La Crepe!

To echo the sentiments of other Yelpers, Vive La Crepe is a quaint little spot in UWS that serves solid crepes perfect for a quick afternoon bite. Are the crepes filling enough to replace a meal? Probably not. Prices are a bit steep, but expected for this part of town. I appreciate how everything is freshly made right in front of you. My favorite so far is the smoked salmon option, but I would say all the savory crepes are pretty decent. Their dessert crepes don't come with ice cream, but they do offer scoops from Van Leeuwen for an additional price.

So you're having a get together around lunch time in Central Park and you need something to eat. What do you do? Well, you could go to the snack bar in the park and get ripped off. You could get a sandwich at one of the delis that is literally on every block of the city, but what's exciting about that? Heck, you could even get one of those pre made salads at the drug store but then again, who knows how long it's been sitting there. But why not go out of your comfort zone and try a crepe?  

Sure, must people think that creeps are only stuffed with bananas and hazelnut spread and served for dessert, but there are so many more options to choose from here that just might broaden your culinary horizon. Be adventurous!

I tried the savory crepe with turkey, Gruyere, spinach, and tomato sauce and it was delicious. Sure, it took a few minutes for them to make the crepe from scratch, but it was worth it. My friends that I was with (who opted for the aforementioned deli sandwich) came back with their plastic shopping bags, but immediately regretted their decision when they smelled the fresh crepes inside.

Only reason I went with four stars instead of five was they they don't seem to have a way to wrap up the crepes and I ended up having to carry it in a paper sleeve in one hand and my drink in the other back to the park. Some aluminum foil would have been very helpful.

TLDR: Skip this place! Slow/bad service, potentially broken credit card machine, limited seating, doughy/soggy bland crepes. Only up sides are: there's a bathroom and I believe a gluten free crepe option.

I went here with a Groupon. The person didn't know how to ring it up. Their credit card machine was down. Luckily, I had cash on me. Most of their other customers only had credit card and needed to run to the bank for cash. I ordered, paid the price difference, and sat down. When they started serving people who came after me I grew suspicious. I asked how much longer until my order would be done. Apparently, my order was never passed onto the person making the food! I was only the second customer in the place when I ordered. By the time I realized I had been forgotten, it was filling up with the after school rush. I didn't get an apology or anything. They just asked me what I ordered and eventually made it. I got my crepes to go because I was tired of waiting and done with the screaming children hopped up on sugar.

What I got:
-Savory crepe with Prosciutto, raclette cheese, and sliced potatoes: Very bland! Even the normally salty Prosciutto did not help to balance out the blandness of the cheese and potatoes. It desperately needed a flavorful sauce.
-Sweet crepe with Nutella: They packed in way too much Nutella. Toward the end I felt like I was drinking my crepe!

I was really disappointed overall with the actual crepes themselves. They were barely crispy on the edges. I think the batter was too thick and they were rushed. So the crepes as a result were extra thick and soggy. Not that delicious crisp with each bite. I wouldn't go back. There are better crepe places or if I'm feeling really adventurous, I'll make my own crepes with extra butter!

***UPDATE: A kind Managing Director from this company reached out to me to help correct my bad first experience here and assure me that they would provide additional training. I will update my review once I give this place one more try. Next time I will request my crepe as crispy and ask them to go easy on the Nutella as suggested.
Had a delicious crepe today and will certainly be back again!! Great selection, quick and yummy!!

Such yummy crepes!! I ordered a turkey royale and an iced coffee and thoroughly enjoyed my experience! It was a little on the pricier side, but that is expected for the location. The service was the best we had anywhere in NYC, the manager was the absolute sweetest!! I came with 3 other people and we got 4 different crepes and everyone was convinced it was the best crepe they'd ever had. Definitely would recommend!

Cute place, with lots of seating, high ceilings, and an airy, spacious cafe vibe. The crepes, however, are just okay. A bit dry, if you order incorrectly. $6.50 (for the sugar & butter crepe) to $9.50, which feels a bit steep, but in the realm of normal for the neighborhood. Staff is pleasant.

Christmas carols are playing. Relatively quietly, but still irritating.

The most delicious crepes! Staff is super nice, and they have a loyalty card program, where after you buy 5 crepes you get your next one free. Really great menu selections (although my personal favorite is Nutella with banana - YUM!) but taking away a star because of the price. I think $11 is a little too steep... but worth it for a special treat every here and there!

Vive La Crêpe! certainly has many menu selection of both sweet and savory, and I always thought of them as fresh and high quality. I especially love one of their cute seating decor they they have at each location; long wooden block with back of the chair sticking out of it. I think it is really creative and adorable. Lots of wood used in the interior, bringing the cozy, comfortable feeling throughout, with great natural light coming in from large windows.

It seems like just about every neighborhood these days has a Vive La Crepe, eh?

If you've been to one you've been to them all. They're totally decent crepes. Nowhere near the best I've ever had, but nothing you'd shove away from your face either. It's sort like Jack Johnson. Chances are you're not going to head out of your way to give him a listen, but when it's on the in background, it's totally unoffensive and mildly enjoyable.

I'm more of a savory crepe guy, but their sweet stuff will do the trick as well.
Loved my crepe with strawberry, banana, and Nutella! Such a cute shop and the woman working was so nice and attentive. Also enjoyed the coffee! I'll be back! So many good menu options.

My friend that I was with said her breakfast egg, ham, and cheese crepe was good. I got a very berry smoothie which tasted amazing. Sweet but not in a sickening and big way. Great place for a early afternoon snack or drink.

If you are in the mood for a little piece of heaven even on the go, definitely stop by here.  They have so many choices... but my favorite is Nutella and strawberries.  It was amazing.  The crepe is always light and very thin- just the way I like.
Disappointing service. Matcha latte looks good in their advisement but it was misleading. It's not a special drink with overpriced price tag.

Don't go to a crepe place for matcha: that's my takeaway.

After being told that matcha couldn't be made without milk (i.e., you can't dissolve the powder in water), which is news to the Japanese, I relented, and had a matcha made with some milk, which was fine, but nothing to write home about.

I thank them for the effort, but given the amount of advertising devoted to matcha, encourage them to figure out how to serve it!
So delicious and tastes just like ones in Paris! Pricey, but unfortunately that's NYC. Yum!

The crepes are sooooooo good and made sooooooo will it's hard to resist!
My favorite is the nutella with strawberries. They also have hot chocolate with nutella.

I love crepe!! This is the first visiting cafe. I ordered sweet crepe. It's chocolate crepe with banana. (chocolate paste & banana) It's yummy, but it's expensive. I think it's too expensive with two toppings.
There are a lot of savory crepe (vegetables crepe). It looks delicious and cost is ok. So I recommend savory crepe.

Terrible. Slow. Didn't have their hot drink machine working, only regular coffee. At a cafe?? Brewed a new batch of coffee also and waited for the whole tall canister to fill before serving anyone. Took 10 minutes to get a cup of black coffee. Not even apologetic.
I finally had to stop by because I can't believe how good their crepes smell as I'm walking by their location. They didn't disappoint, the Nutella Crepe was amazing!!!

I was so in the mood for a crepe. I received a sloppy, overly moist crepe that tasted a little like cooked sawdust. It was so supposed to have gruyere cheese, only they must have forgotten to put it in. I really hate leaving negative reviews but for a small place that makes crepes, and for the high price, you would think they would get it right. The gentlemen was also unfriendly. Maybe their dessert crepes are better.

I stopped by this place to try their hot chocolate. The selection menu for crepes left me craving for one and I gave in. I got mozzarella tomato basil crepe- absolutely delicious. Very well made and crisp. The only reason I gave this place only 3 stars os bec they do not have any complex carb crepe options( buckwheat)..overall- food great taste; variety decent; price affordable; service good; ambience good. Will try more stuff.

This location has the most wonderful staff and the best crepes! I went to Viva La Crepe on Columbus on a snowy cold night and Ashley helped me by working within my budget and making the most delish crepe! Thank you so much! I'll be back soon!

This is my favorite crepe place in The City. I look forward to visiting this little place every trip. The staff is very friendly, cleanliness and great food! You cannot go wrong with the spinach & egg or if you have a sweet tooth, I would recommend the strawberries and Nutella! Whatever your pallet craves it will be blown away!

It's the dirtiest restaurant I've seen at UWS. The floor was full of trash, and the staff just stand there, swiping phones and eating his snack. Food was ok but we waited for a long time to get our food. Won't come anymore..

Cute space, there's some seating inside and outside of the restaurant. There's buckwheat and traditional crepes available. This is one of my favorite crepe places in NYC because the crepes here are crispy which I love. They are kind of pricey at $9+ but they are huge and filling!
According to me five year old: the crepes are so yummy, they are super delicious, i would go back every weekend, and stay there for one hour eating crepes!

Been here dozens of times and almost always order the same thing, because why would you want anything different than a ham and gruyere crepe? The crepe batter is a little on the sweeter side than some others, which I like, it complements the ham nicely. They can take a while to make, so be patient. It should be every so slightly crispy on the outside. A couple times when busy my crepes have been rushed and underdone slightly, for that reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5.

My wife and I decided to stop by before hitting the movies to see "Concussion" of which if you haven't seen you should of your a fan of any sports besides Football. When we entered we were greeted almost immediately which was good but making a decision on what to order was the hard part. So after two minutes or so my wife ordered the #7 and and I the #9.

Watching make the your order is fun but what really caught my attention was the portion size of the ingredients he staff include into your crepe, almost similar to how frugal "Subway" is with pre-packaged portions. Though the crepes were awesome my only complaint is the bang for our buck of which I feel my wife and I didn't get though the snack was great, in all our total balance was $20.30 for two crepes. I feel it wasn't worth that much but hey it's NY and do I have to accept it yes, but will I try it again.. Not for awhile.
Super clean cozy and professional for a small place. Easy recommendation for snack/ bite to break up the ny walking.

I walked by here and was excited to see they had gluten free buckwheat crepes on the menu.  I asked the man at the counter if he could confirm that they cook the gluten free crepes on a separate griddle, and he said, "no, it's all the same. Why, does it spread so easy??"   Food safety 101? Yes indeed sir gluten does "spread" so easy -- wish I had an eye roll emoji on my Yelp app - warning to other Celiac out there - gluten free posting on a menu doesn't mean kitchen knows what they're doing!

This used to be a favorite pre-Yankees game spot years ago but other places became our place to go.  But on Labor Day, my buddy and I were just down the street and I suggested we visit before the Yankees vs Toronto game.

We were shocked at the change in the place.  It was totally renovated and so clean looking from our last time.  It wasn't crowded when we sat at the bar but it got crowded shortly afterwards.  

The beer selection wasn't terrific but they did have Presidente so we were good with those.  After having a couple of rounds it was about time to walk to the Stadium.  I asked our bartender for 1 more round.  Another bartender heard me ask and brought a round.  Then a minute later, our bartender put another round in front of us.  Obviously, they weren't in excellent sync.  I know we weren't given a round because our bartender didn't say anything when she put the beer down.  So, we did what any true Yankee fans would do, we scarfed the 2 beers down as quickly as we could.

Prices are still reasonable for the area before a game.  It might be worth another visit before the season ends.

Totally redone from what I remember from years back. Nice open space with a well stocked bar and courteous service. Not a fan of the food, seems a bit haphazardly prepared. A bit bland which is a disappointment for Spanish cuisine.
Thursday has a good kareoke night with one of the best kareoke DJs, DJ "Oppie".
It's definitely worth a visit wether you come back is entirely up to you.

Why 4 stars? The place has been renovated -- it's like they did a complete 180 place looks stunning and amazing!  The servers look great and are very hospitable as well. The drinks 100% great had LongIsland and Mojitos. Food we had the Tacos only reason why we didn't give it a 5 was because the food isn't where it should be yet, could be better BUT it wasn't bland or tasteless.  They should used real Mexican cheese, reduce the lettuce and cilantro and keep the green sauce the spice was perfect too! To their defense it's a Columbia sports bar could be their twist on the taco.  Def recommend Vega and will be back! Also we miss the mason jars!

We grabbed a couple of beers before the Yankee game that ended up being rained out.  

Decent atmosphere, nicely air conditioned and a friendly enough place to meet. No draught beer and the usual pedestrian beers. Ordered a couple of Heinekens. They were ice cold. Perfect. But curiously every beer was stuffed with a napkin down the bottle head. Not enough to contact the beer but odd nonetheless.
The Mailman loves the broads here, doesn't matter Asian, Latina or Black, he loves em. You'll leave here needing some sleep after getting tired out

The food service was terrible. I waited almost an hour for onion rings and mozz sticks... It shouldn't take that long to make. Also, this guy came in before me and ordered buffalo wings and his order came before mine. Complete bullshit. I wouldn't go back here

Drinks are way too sweet! Ten dollars for juice!!! That's what you get ‍ I tried to support them but they just want to make money.... they don't care about consistency and keeping their customers happy!!! I will no longer throw my money away here..... if you go, a beer and a shot is better than a cocktail  the food menu is simple ‍ stuff you can make at home and will taste better!

This is my favorite spot.. Wish they had Happy Hour because it's near home and when i get off I'd be more likely to drop in often... Waitress are friendly. They renovated and looks nice from the outside, due to Covid they have been limited but it's ok... Outdoor seating was fun.

Dropped into this place before a Yankee Game.  It was buzzing a little bit.  Nice bartenders.  But they made some weird drinks.  Gin and Tonics were served in stemmed lowball glasses (very strange), with no lime, and some gin that tasted like it had fake lime flavor mixed into it.  My buddy couldn't even drink it, and he has never met a G&T he doesn't like.

Also took a while to pay my bill.  The place was a little discombobulated.  And one bartender didn't even know the other's name.  Which I found very amusing.

Altogether, this is a fun little place that I would definitely return to before a Yanks game

I've been coming here for drinks before a Yankees game since 1993.

It's a local, Latin, neighborhood bar, one block from Yankee Stadium. It doesn't get as crowded as The Yankee Tavern or Stan's on a regular game day, but for Opening Day and during the post season it gets really packed. It has the requisite Yankee memorabilia on its walls.

Beers run $5.00 to $6.00 with mixed drinks and top shelf liquor a little more.

Always has very voluptuous Latina barmaids.

caliente staff indeed with friendly attitudes, friendly enough to even tip themselves but at least with influential eye contact flirtatiously calling you papi to ensure its ok

the music selection was strange (mariachi to death metal musica) and the seating elks lodge like.  however, who cares.  filling up and being served up $5 beers by babes that look straight outta a telemundo soap opera is fine by me.  

the next cheapest option before entering yankee stadium would be a brown bag of st ides from the nearby liquor store

Celeste is 100% on point with her review.  If you don't want to have to stand in a 2 by 2 foot space at a bar like Stan's before a game because of the crowd, hit up Vega Alta instead.  The beer is relatively cheap ($5 for a beer) when compared to the other places, and the people and bartenders are friendly.  It's never too crowded but there are always a good amount of people before a game.   I once went after a game and there was a DJ there and dancing.  Pretty good times.

Just an FYI, they recently have raised their prices and Heineken's are $6 now.  I assume Bud's and all that are either $5 or $5.50.

Wow, I'm surprised that this place has not been reviewed.  It's a great little neighborhood bar by the Yankee Stadium.  A good alternative to the crowded Yankee Tavern across the way.  It was a perfect night, bright and sunny, but not too hot.  Brian and I took the subway from Manhattan to the Bronx in less than 15 minutes to meet with Joe before the Yankees game.  

Welcoming atmosphere -- even for a Giants fan who was all decked out in Giants gear! Yes, I was representing the SF Giants in NY!  

Good people, attentive and friendly bartender, big screen t.v., and two handsome guys by my side -- there was noting else I could ask for!... Well, maybe beers on tap would have been nice.  

Alcohol Count:
Celeste/Brian/Joe: 2 beers + 1 shot of tequila

Alicia,Lucy,Crystal and the rest of the staff are not only beautiful women they treat u like family.Excellent service
Dennis Reavis
Fun neighborhood bar in the shadow of Yankee stadium.  Friendly, scantily clad bartendresses serve excellent chilled shots of tequila.  The beer isn't bad either.  Fun place to hang out.
I've never had a bad time here. Love the vibe (and it's all about vibe, right kids?)
GREAT BAR to have a drink before a Yankee game. Local neighborhood bar  but you won't feel out of place.  Lucy and her staff are very nice and you never have to wait for a drink!
Nice, gorgeous staff serving a reasonably priced beer by the Stadium in a down to earth setting.
